metadata.novel_title: I Transmigrate as a Single Mother of the Three Antagonists

novel_info.title: I Transmigrate as a Single Mother of the Three Antagonists
novel_info.author: Wen Xiao
novel_info.summary: Qiu Tong transmigrated into a storyline about the poor family background of three major villains..Her father was a financial fraud, and the three children she raised by herself would become super villains in the future. Their family would end up miserable.Qiu Tong wanted to leave, but the three children were so pitiful. Without her, they would die.In the end, she decided to change their fate!After that, Qiu Tong worked hard to earn a lot of money and became the richest person in City A. The three children also went from gloomy little devils to bright little angels. They even referred to her during their interview.The jaws of the executives dropped when they saw the interview.“These children look exactly like the President!”“President, bad news. Your children are looking for a stepfather for their mother!”Before long, Qiu Tong was brought to the magnificent palace where a handsome man was waiting.“You want to run away now after stealing my seeds?”“What do you want then?”“I want your heart in exchange.”Qiu Tong: Charming looks and exceptional character. Off-the-charts martial arts skills and a minor expert at money-making.Eldest Child: Male, genius in chemistry.Second Child: Male, extreme martial arts skills.Third Child: Female, their mascot in her little cotton-padded jacket. A highly-intelligent and skilled hacker.Jin Yang: S Country’s President. Handsome and cold-hearted. He was set up to have a one-night stand with Qiu Tong. He only found out later that she kept the children.

chapters.title: Chapter 1
chapters.content:
Chapter 1: Selling Children
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“Pfft! What are you talking about? We agreed that a child would cost $15,000, and now you’re raising the price at the last minute? And you want to fight me too?!”
“Hey, wake up! Qiu Tong, don’t play dead. You were the one who pulled at me first. I only blocked you and you hit the corner of the table yourself… I won’t compensate you if you die!”
Still in a daze, Qiu Tong heard someone cursing.
Someone tried to kick her.
She opened her eyes and saw the tattered roof.
Shifting her gaze, she saw a middle-aged woman with a mean face. She was dressed gaudily and had thick makeup on. It was obvious that she was not a good person.
Qiu Tong was stunned. She wasn’t dead?
She lived in the post-apocalyptic era and struggled to survive. She leveled up and finally became a young general. However, in the final major battle of the century, her heart was dug out by zombies while she was trying to protect her teammates.
Could she have become a zombie too?
No, that’s not right.
The woman before her clearly did not look like someone from the post-apocalyptic era.
How could a woman who grew up in the post-apocalyptic era be so fat and dressed so flamboyantly?
“Yo, you’re not playing dead anymore?”
The woman said, “If you’re awake, quickly get up and sign it. $45,000, I’ll transfer it to you later! I’m making a loss here. Take a look for yourself. All three of your children are so skinny. Only Qiu Xingyu is better. She can be sold for a good price.”
“Besides, they are already six years old. It’s not easy to find a buyer! If you weren’t recommended by Lin Shan… Hmph! Who would want to buy your children!”
Qiu Tong looked in the direction of her finger.
In the corner, three children cowered.
Two boys and a girl.
They were said to be six years old, but due to malnutrition, the three children looked only about four years old. They were short and thin, making their eyes look especially big.
At this moment, they were huddled together and looked at Qiu Tong fearfully, as if they knew their fate of being sold off. Their eyes were filled with endless fear and uneasiness…
And a deeply-hidden hatred.
Six-year-old children could harbor such deep hatred… Qiu Tong’s back suddenly turned cold.
Wait a minute.
Qiu Tong, Qiu Xingyu, selling children?!
When these keywords were combined, Qiu Tong suddenly remembered that before the post-apocalyptic war, she had read an antique 21st century novel on her computer.
One of the villains in the book was called Qiu Xingyu. She had two villains as her brothers, and the mother of these three villains was also called Qiu Tong and had the same name as her.
This Qiu Tong was greedy and vicious. She had given birth to triplets but did not remember who the father was.
As a single mother, she had no thoughts of improving her situation. Relying on charity grants, she brought her children to live in the slums for six years. She would hit and scold her children all day long.
And this year, Qiu Tong had hooked up with a scumbag. In order to please the scumbag, she had sold her children and ran off with the money to marry him!
Of course, the ending was tragic.
Qiu Tong was cheated of all her money by the scumbag who eventually dumped her. Without any skills, Qiu Tong could only return to the slums. However, the days she spent with the scumbag made her a drug addict. To get drugs, she had no choice but to become a sex worker.
The three children who had been sold off had turned into three villains. When they had the ability, they went to look for Qiu Tong and took revenge on her.
In the end, Qiu Tong died tragically in the wilderness without even anyone to give her a proper burial…
“…”
Qiu Tong fell silent.
Had she been reborn in the body of this vicious mother with the same name?
She had rather enjoyed the storyline when she first read it, but now that it was happening to her, she was not finding it very enjoyable.
Fortunately, she had transmigrated before she sold her children. Coupled with the fact that she knew the ending to this story, she might be able to change it!
Qiu Tong immediately got up from the ground, dusted herself off and said coldly.
“Sorry, I’m not selling my children anymore.”

chapters.title: Chapter 2
chapters.content:
Chapter 2: Increase The Price
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The flamboyant woman was not the only one who was shocked at her words. Even the three children in the corner widened their eyes in astonishment.
Qiu Xingyu, born third, tugged on her elder brother’s sleeve and whispered.
“Brother, Mommy doesn’t seem to want to sell us anymore.”
“…”
The firstborn Qiu Xingyuan pursed his lips coldly. “Who knows what evil idea she has up her sleeve. All these years, have we not trusted her enough? She disappointed us every single time.”
Qiu Xingqiao, who was born second, clenched his fists. “How many times have I told you not to call her mommy? That bad woman is not our mommy at all!”
Qiu Xingyu shrank back and stopped talking.
Qiu Tong:”…”
Did these brats think she was deaf?
After living in post-apocalyptic times for so many years, her senses were very sharp. Even though they were whispering, she could hear them clearly.
However, now was not the time to argue with them.
Qiu Tong waved at the three children. “Let’s go home.”
The three children stiffened.
Home?
Did they still have a home?
The flamboyant woman finally returned to her senses. “Qiu Tong, are you kidding me? Do you think you can refuse to sell them just like that?! Let me tell you, you have to sell them to me today even if you’re unwilling!”
Qiu Tong looked at the other party’s ferocious expression, her fat quivering, and she was very calm.
If it had been the original Qiu Tong, she might have been afraid, but this Qiu Tong was not afraid at all.
“Sure.”
Qiu Tong nodded. “Increase the price. Each child will cost 100 million.”
Upon hearing this, Qiu Xingyu’s bright eyes immediately dimmed.
She thought that Mommy had changed.
But she just wanted to raise the price…
However, Mommy was destined to be disappointed. They had not had a full meal since the day they were born, so how could they fetch a high price of 100 million?
Fat Auntie would never agree.
As expected, the flamboyant woman jumped when she heard that. “Are you crazy? Do you think you gave birth to golden geese? You’re asking for a sky-high price! You’re indeed the daughter of a financial fraud. You deserve to give birth to three illegitimate children who don’t even know their fathers… Ah!”
Smack!
The woman’s scolding was interrupted by the clear sound of a slap.
Qiu Tong retracted her hand and rotated her wrist. “Didn’t anyone teach you not to make personal attacks when scolding others?”
“Ah!”
The flamboyant woman shrieked in rage. “How dare you hit me! Slut, how dare you hit me!”
She charged towards Qiu Tong.
Her body was huge and she shot over like a missile. One would definitely die or be crippled by the impact.
Qiu Xingyu covered her eyes in fear.
Bang!
There was a loud bang.
The little girl peaked through a gap between her fingers and was stunned!
Her mother, who was lazy and claimed that she did not have the strength to work, fluidly flipped the fat woman over her shoulder and threw her onto the ground!
She then picked up a wooden table and was about to throw it at the other party!
“Ah! Help!”
The woman’s pupils constricted. Her earlier arrogance had disappeared and was replaced with deep fear. “Fine, don’t sell if you don’t want to! I was wrong, I’m sorry! Please just go… just go…”
She watched as the table came nearer and nearer, a wind blowing against her face. She nearly peed her pants from fright.
The table came to a stop about 10 centimeters away from her.
Qiu Tong loosened her grip and flung the table to the ground. She licked her lips and revealed a charming and bloodthirsty smile.
“Ah, I almost forgot. Humans are very fragile. We can’t treat you like zombies.”
The woman was so frightened that her face turned pale. She collapsed to the ground, unable to say a word.
Qiu Tong turned around and waved at the three children. “Aren’t you coming?”
With that, she walked out of the door.
It was already dusk outside. The rays of the setting sun gently enveloped the entire city, casting a shadow over the dilapidated buildings of the slums.
Qiu Tong took a deep breath. This world was really good.
So what if it was a slum?
At least, there was no endless fighting, famine or war.
It was just that she was short of money for the time being. She had the ability. As long as she worked hard, she would be able to earn money.
Qiu Tong decided to return to her accomodations.
But… where was her home?

chapters.title: Chapter 3
chapters.content:
Chapter 3: Falling Into The Water
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong did not inherit any memories from the former owner of her body, so she was a little lost.
She turned around to ask the three children.
The moment she turned her head, the three children who had been following her from afar startled and took a few steps back. It was as if she was a human-eating demon.
Under the faint light outside, Qiu Tong could see that the three children were all very beautiful. They had big eyes, long eyelashes and exquisite facial features.
If not for their dull, dry hair and sunken cheeks, they would have been even more beautiful.
Sigh.
Qiu Tong sighed. It was all her body’s former owner’s fault.
She didn’t want to bring them further fear, so she just continued walking forward. This place wasn’t very big anyway. It wouldn’t be too hard to find.
Qiu Tong walked a few blocks and stopped by a river, looking around.
The three children behind her were whispering.
Qiu Xingyu said, “Look, Mommy really didn’t sell us!”
Qiu Xingqiao snorted. “That’s only because she wanted to raise the price! Eldest Brother, what should we do? She didn’t manage to sell us for 100 million. Will she beat us up again tonight and not give us any food?”
The former Qiu Tong was indeed like this. As long as they did not satisfy her, she would treat them very badly.
Qiu Xingyuan’s gaze was cold and he did not speak.
He saw with his own eyes that this woman had suddenly become very powerful.
She could already beat them half to death before today. Wouldn’t she be able to beat them to death now?
No, he could not let her beat his younger siblings to death!
Today, she must die or they would!
Qiu Xingyuan cleared his throat. A dangerous plan formed in his mind. He sent his sister to the side to play. He asked Qiu Xingqiao to stay and told him his plan.
“This…”
Qiu Xingqiao was shocked. “This is wrong…”
Qiu Xingyuan said in a low voice, “If not, do you want us to be beaten to death by her?!”
In the end, Qiu Xingqiao gritted his teeth and agreed.
Qiu Tong was speechless as she listened to their conversation.
This was indeed a future big villain. He dared to talk about killing her now. What would happen in the future?
Footsteps from behind could be heard.
Qiu Tong did not move and pretended not to notice.
She could not be bothered to fuss with children. She did not intend to stay in this place. If she let them succeed in their scheme this time, she would be able to help them dispel some of their psychological trauma. She considered this her good deed of the day.
After all, the original Qiu Tong was inhuman. Since she had inherited the body of the original owner, she would take this as a chance to help her atone for her sins.
The next second—
A pair of small hands pushed her hard on her back!
Qiu Tong fell forward and lost her balance. She fell into the water and was soon engulfed by the waves.
“…”
“…”
The fierce Qiu Xingyuan stood by the river and looked at the river. His lips were tightly pursed and his entire body was still trembling.
He had been prepared to die if he failed.
But it was so easy.
The woman who had abused them for so many years actually fell without a word. He felt like he was dreaming.
Qiu Xingqiao pounced on him. “Eldest Brother…”
Qiu Xingyuan pretended to be calm. Only his trembling voice revealed that he was not calm at all.
“Go get Little Yu. Let’s go home.”
At night.
The three children spent their first night without Qiu Tong. Although they did not have anything to eat, it was the first time that there was no one to scold and beat them.
They laid side by side on the small bed, staring at the dim ceiling.
Qiu Xingyu clutched her concave stomach. She was sensible and did not ask for food. Instead, she blinked innocently.
“Eldest Brother, Second Brother, where did Mommy go?”
She was well protected by her two older brothers and was still a little naive. Her impression of Qiu Tong improved a little since she brought them back today.
Qiu Xingyuan patted his sister and coaxed her to sleep. “She has already gone on to a better life and doesn’t want us anymore. In the future, no one will hit or scold you anymore. Aren’t you happy about that?”
“Happy, but…”
Unable to fight off sleep any longer, Qiu Xingyu fell asleep.
Qiu Xingqiao finally dared to stammer, “Eldest Brother, do you think… that woman… is she dead?”
Qiu Xingyuan grunted in affirmation.
Dead.
He had seen with his own eyes that the woman had sunk to the bottom of the water without a single bubble emerging.
Qiu Xingqiao trembled again. “Then… will she become a ghost… and come find us?”
There was not much entertainment in the slums. All kinds of ghost stories became the best bedtime stories for adults to coax children to sleep. They also often heard scary myths and legends.
Qiu Xingyuan’s body stiffened.
He was a child after all, so he was naturally afraid of ghosts. He shook his head forcefully and was about to comfort himself with the words “there are no ghosts in this world”.
The next second, a wet head appeared at the bedside. It was Qiu Tong’s face!
“Ah!!!”
The two brats cried out in fright!

chapters.title: Chapter 4
chapters.content:
Chapter 4: Three-Person Escape
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong tutted.
So they were afraid of ghosts?
“Hehe, Mommy turned into a ghost and came back to find you guys…”
“Let me see, who should I eat first?”
Qiu Tong made a ghastly expression, stretching out her tongue. Coupled with her pale face and wet hair, it was terrifying!
Qiu Xingqiao was so frightened that he hugged Qiu Xingyuan tightly. In his fear, he did not notice that his elder brother’s body had also stiffened slightly.
“Eldest Brother! She… she really turned into a ghost and came back to take revenge on us!”
Qiu Xingqiao covered his mouth as he whimpered softly.
A faint smile appeared on Qiu Tong’s face. This young future villain wasn’t that brave after all!
“Oh? So noisy. Did something happen?”
Qiu Xingyu rubbed her eyes and got up from the bed. When she saw Qiu Tong, she muttered in a daze, “Mommy? Haven’t you already gone on to a better life? Why… are you back?”
Qiu Tong looked at the two boys.
Damn! They really knew how to spin sweet stories! Better life?!
She was just about to clarify things with the little girl when she saw Qiu Xingyuan grab two bricks and threw them at her!
Was he serious?!
Murdering his own mother a second time?
Qiu Tong bent over and dodged a few rocks and coal flying towards her. Grabbing one child in each hand, she threw them back onto the bed!
“Go to sleep!”
Qiu Xingyuan narrowed his eyes and used his frail body to shield his brother and sister behind him, glaring at her warily!
The woman’s hands were warm. She probably wasn’t a ghost.
But why did she seem like a different person?
She didn’t beat them even though they had pushed her into the river?
With her current fighting abilities, it was enough to beat them half to death!
“Mommy seems to have become nicer?” Qiu Xingyu tugged at the corner of her brother’s shirt.
But Qiu Xingyuan just furrowed his brows in deep thought and said, “Who knows if she’s planning something else!”
Qiu Ton was exasperated.
Did she really need to hear their secret whisperings?
She changed out of her wet clothes and dried her hair. She looked around, studying the surroundings.
Their living environment was truly dilapidated. The straw shed was riddled with holes, looking as though it could be blown away by the wind anytime! The so-called kitchen area did not even have half a grain of rice!
These little fellows were indeed quite pitiful!
“Shh!”
Taking advantage of Qiu Tong still checking out the kitchen, Qiu Xingyuan had Qiu Xingyu on his back and his younger brother’s hand. He planned to climb over the wall and sneak out with them!
He didn’t believe that the Qiu Tong would truly change!
He had to take his younger siblings away!
Otherwise, they might be separated tomorrow. Sold to different places!
Qiu Tong noticed all his movements and was in no rush to grab them. It was only when Qiu Xingyuan was clinging clumsily onto the wall and was about to fall down and bash his head that she ran over!
“Be careful!”
Qiu Tong caught Qiu Xingyu firmly in her arms. She kicked away a few falling rocks and pulled the two brats back!
Boom!
With a loud bang, half the wall collapsed… leaving behind only debris and dust!
Qiu Xingqiao was so frightened that he hiccuped and whispered, “Elder Brother, Mommy… Mommy saved us.”
This was highly abnormal!
Qiu Xingyuan looked at Qiu Tong with a complicated expression. She actually didn’t leave them to their fate?
Once, Little Yu had been hit by a falling tile and Qiu Tong viciously scolded Little Yu that she deserved it and wished that they would all die sooner.
Had she really changed for the better?
The next second, Qiu Tong threw them onto the bed again and threatened them with a smile.
“If you try to run away again, I will throw you all into the river to feed the fishes.”
Qiu Xingyuan: “…”
He knew that she was still as evil as ever!
Qiu Tong found two tattered blankets and covered them, before she also laid down beside them.
After fighting for so long in the post-apocalyptic era, she was exhausted. She planned to rest for a night before leaving.
Qiu Xingyu blinked and tugged at the corner of her shirt nervously.
Qiu Tong felt sorry for her and tried her best to be gentle. “Can’t sleep? Do you need Mommy to sing you a lullaby?”
Qiu Xingyu looked at her lovingly and nodded.
Qiu Tong shifted through her memory before starting to sing, “Long tongue, bloodstained hands, fresh zombies surrounding us, watch me shoot its head off…”
The children: “!!!”
Qiu Tong felt that something was wrong. “Don’t you think it’s a nice song?”
This was the most popular nursery rhyme in the post-apocalyptic world.
“Nice…”
Qiu Xingyu was trembling as she held onto her two brothers. She was so stiff that she did not move at all. “Mommy, we’re sleepy. Please stop singing…”
Qiu Tong nodded in satisfaction and closed her eyes.
She knew that lullabies were useful!

chapters.title: Chapter 5
chapters.content:
Chapter 5: Farewell
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Late at night, Qiu Xingyuan suddenly opened his eyes. He quietly woke Qiu Xingqiao up and carried Little Yu away.
Under the locust tree.
Qiu Xingyuan said in a low but steady voice, “She must have been possessed by a ghost and wants to kill us.”
The auntie from next door once said that there were grievous ghosts in the water. Qiu Tong must have been possessed by one such ghost when she fell into the water.
Otherwise, why would she behave so abnormally?
Not only was she highly-skilled, she even sang those weird songs…
Qiu Xingqiao’s face turned pale.
Qiu Xingyuan was rather calm. Human or ghost, no one could harm his younger siblings!
“Go and find some paper money! Burn some to exorcise the ghost!”
“I’ll tie her up. Don’t be afraid, I will protect you!”
Qiu Xingyuan directed Qiu Xingqiao while he ran back into the house. He looked at the sleeping Qiu Tong and tied her hands up with a hemp rope.
He mimicked the way they did it on television, drawing the sign of a cross and muttering some lines.
Qiu Tong had eavesdropped on the little rascal’s exorcism ritual. She secretly opened one eye and saw the paper money scattered all over the yard.
She tried not to laugh.
The post-apocalyptic life had made Qiu Ying extremely vigilant. The slightest sound was enough to wake her up.
The only reason Qiu Tong had kept silent and allowed the two brats to fool around was because she wanted to see what they could do!
“Eldest Brother, should we read some Buddhist scriptures?” Qiu Xingqiao asked when he entered bearing a candle.
Qiu Xingyuan shook his head and took the candle, approaching Qiu Tong’s bed.
Qiu Xingqiao exclaimed softly, “Are you going to burn her to death?! She’s… she’s…”
He still could not bring himself to say the word “mommy” no matter what.
“She’s already possessed by a ghost. She’s a demon, no longer that woman.”
Qiu Xingyuan said this, but his hands were trembling. She did not hit them today and even told them a story, even though the story was very bloody…
At that moment, Qiu Tong turned around—
Qiu Xingyuan’s hands trembled and the candle fell onto the bed. In an instant, a fire spread out uncontrollably!
The two brats were stunned.
Qiu Tong: “…”
She did not want to be burned to death!
She could no longer pretend. She escaped from her rope bindings and grabbed the two boys, throwing them onto a safe spot outside. Thereafter, she rushed into the house and used a blanket to extinguish the flames.
After a while, Qiu Tong came out with a cold face.
These two brats were really troublesome!
Qiu Xingyuan thought that she wanted to settle the score with them and he stood in front of Qiu Xingqiao protectively. “What do you want! I was the one who planned this. If you want to beat someone, beat me. Don’t hurt them…”
Qiu Tong stared at him coldly for a while before returning to her room to pack.
She could not stay here any longer.
She wanted to stay behind to have a good night’s sleep, but those two little devils were too troublesome. She would leave tonight.
Qiu Tong searched every corner of the house and found very few things she could use.
Apart from two stale buns, there were only a few crumpled notes hidden behind a beam.
It looked like the former Qiu Tong was afraid that the children would steal it.
Qiu Tong only took her ID card and stuffed the remaining notes and stale buns into Qiu Xingyuan’s hands.
“I’m leaving. I’ll leave these for you. Take good care of your younger siblings. Don’t be as stupid as you were just now. You almost lost your own life trying to kill someone. You need to be law-abiding citizens.”
She had said everything that needed to be said!
Whether these children would still grow up to be villains—that was not something she could control!
At least with her gone, they would be able to live a little more comfortably, right?
Qiu Xingyuan gripped the notes tightly. He was momentarily taken aback. “Where are you going?”
Was this really woman going to abandon them?
Qiu Tong looked at his young but determined face and smiled. “Just take it that I’m dead.”
The children: “…”
She strode off. Qiu Xingyu looked at her departing back profile. “Eldest Brother… Mommy doesn’t want us anymore?”
Qiu Xingyuan remained silent. He was feeling rather conflicted.
There were several times when he wished for Qiu Tong to leave them. He even really wished that she would die.
But now that she had really left, his heart felt heavy.
After all, he was still just a six-year-old child.
Qiu Xingyuan hugged his younger brother and sister and comforted them, “Don’t be afraid, so what if she has left? We don’t need her! I will take care of you!”

chapters.title: Chapter 6
chapters.content:
Chapter 6: Supporting The Family
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The next morning, the rising sun illuminated most of the streets.
As Qiu Tong walked along, she was amazed by everything around her.
The streets were bustling with people and the stalls along the road were filled with smoke and activity.
Qiu Tong’s eyes lit up. This was a completely different living environment from the post-apocalyptic world.
A large group of people surrounded the entrance of a flour shop at the corner of the street. Qiu Tong curiously looked over and was surprised to see a familiar young face in the middle of the crowd.
Qiu Xingyuan seemed to have fallen into a pile of flour. His hair, face and clothes were all white.
His tiny body was stiff and upright. He clenched his fists and his eyes were distressed. “I’ve already carried 10 bags of flour inside. You have to give me my salary!”
The boss of the flour shop was a tall and thin man with a shrewd look. He was holding a weight in his hand and his face was filled with impatience. “Get lost. Where did this wild child come from? You said you carried 10 bags of flour? But I didn’t see it.”
“And you’re not an employee of my store. Why should I pay you?”
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his lips even tighter, his little face gloomy.
In order to support his siblings, he had to work to earn money.
However, he was too young and no one dared to hire him. He had finally gotten the boss of the flour shop to agree, but now, the other party was going back on his word!
Qiu Xingyuan jumped forward angrily and tugged hard on the other party’s sleeve. “Give me my money! Give me my money!”
The boss of the flour shop swung around hard and the small body flew away. He slammed heavily against the counter, his forehead quickly turning red.
Qiu Tong was shocked and quickly approached Qiu Xingyuan. When she saw the fingernail-sized wound on his forehead, her eyes turned cold.
“You dare to bully even a child. Are you still human?!”
Her bright eyes were lit with anger. The boss of the flour shop denied guiltily. “I didn’t do it on purpose. He suddenly pounced over…”
As more and more people gathered around, the boss of the flour shop felt a little remorse. He disdainfully tossed out a penny. “It’s just my bad luck. Take the money and get lost!”
Looking at the coin rolling toward her, Qiu Tong’s eyes glinted harshly. She raised her hand and smacked the countertop, leaving a deep dent.
“Apologize!”
Her tone was cold and her eyes were filled with murderous intent.
The boss of the flour shop was so scared that his face was pale. He hurriedly picked up the coin and shoved it into Qiu Xingyuan’s hands. “Sorry, I was greedy. This is your salary!”
Only then did Qiu Tong reluctantly give a soft snort. She walked up to Qiu Xingyuan and squatted down. “Are you alright? Does it still hurt?”
Qiu Xingyuan did not expect to meet Qiu Tong again. And she had actually stood up for him. For a moment there, his face bore a conflicted expression.
Seeing that blood was still flowing down his forehead, a dark light flashed across Qiu Tong’s eyes. Using her own body as cover, she slowly pressed her palm against Qiu Xingyuan’s forehead to stop the bleeding.
That was her superpower in the post-apocalyptic era—healing.
A strange warmth spread from her body. Qiu Xingyuan suddenly had the desire to lean closer to Qiu Tong, but he restrained himself.
No, this woman must be regretting yesterday and now wanted to come back to sell them off!
Qiu Xingyuan warned himself fiercely that he absolutely could not trust this woman anymore. He gripped the coin tightly and pushed Qiu Tong away, before running away without looking back.
Qiu Tong didn’t even have time to call after him. She could only watch his departing back profile.
She wondered how the other two kids were doing. How did they end up in this situation, where they had to come out to work at such a young age?
Fortunately, Qiu Tong was skilled in detection and easily located Qiu Xingyuan’s position. She quietly followed him.
Qiu Xingyuan found Qiu Xingqiao, who had not been as lucky. He had worked the entire morning only to return empty-handed.
The two brothers used the penny to buy two meat buns and brought them to Qiu Xingyu. They lied and said that they had already eaten while out, before desperately gulping down cold water to fill their stomachs.
Unable to bear their hunger, the two boys snuck out of the house again.
Qiu Tong followed them and was surprised to find that they were planning to catch mice in the field. Her heart ached.
At the end of the day, they were just six-year-old children who did not even have the basic ability to survive.
Qiu Tong touched her dismally empty pockets as she gazed meaningfully at the two boys. She then left without saying a word.
The most pressing matter now was to earn money quickly!
She found a clinic on the street and pushed the door open, but there was no one there. She heard movement in the backyard.
The boss was preparing lunch and didn’t even look up when he saw someone.
“It’s lunch break now. Come back at two in the afternoon.”
“Boss, I’m here to look for a job.”
Qiu Tong was full of confidence. “I know how to treat superficial injuries. I want a part-time job here.”
“You?”
The boss saw that she was young and had patches on her clothes. He could tell from a single glance that she was from a poor family. His eyes flashed with disdain.
“Don’t come here and cause trouble. I don’t need more workers here!”
“Boss, I really can do it!”
In order to prove her ability, Qiu Tong directly grabbed a fish, which was floating belly-up, from the pond. She pretended to press on a few acupuncture points with her fingers, secretly transferring her power into it.
The boss looked at her coldly and was about to chase her away when his eyes widened in shock.
The fish, which had been on the verge of death, regained its vitality and started wagging its tail vigorously!

chapters.title: Chapter 7
chapters.content:
Chapter 7: Miracle Doctor
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“You really know how to treat illnesses?”
The boss’s eyes were filled with surprise and suspicion. His tone was hesitant. “Healing a person is different from healing a fish. You can’t afford the slightest bit of carelessness.”
Qiu Tong was rather calm. She suggested casually, “If you don’t believe me, you can find a few patients with superficial injuries and let me try.”
“If I can heal them, I don’t want a basic salary. I want 70% of the treatment fee. And you must pay me at the end of every day.”
“But I have one condition. No one can see my face.”
Without the need to give her a basic salary, it meant that there was no cost to him. And if she succeeded, it would also make his clinic famous.
The boss naturally wouldn’t miss such a good opportunity and he immediately signed an agreement with her.
In the clinic, he used a curtain to separate out an area, allowing Qiu Tong to treat her patients behind the curtain, while he observed and learned.
Qiu Tong mainly dealt with patients with superficial injuries and bone fractures. Such injuries were quite common and she treated about seven to eight patients in that one afternoon.
She borrowed a long needle from the boss in advance and pretended to perform acupuncture or injections on the patients. During the treatments, she slowly infused her superpower into the patient’s body. Bleeding wounds would stop immediately and the pain significantly lessened.
After just half an hour, a group of workers rushed anxiously into the clinic, carrying a stretcher.
“Doctor, quickly take a look at my brother!”
The face of the young man on the stretcher was full of pain. His lips were pale, and there was a metal rod stuck straight into his thigh. Blood gushed out like a fountain from the wound.
The boss was so scared that his face turned pale. He immediately wanted to rush over to say that the clinic couldn’t treat him.
Qiu Tong stopped him. “I can treat him.”
The boss’s lips were trembling. “This is a human life, it’s not something to play with!”
With a faint smile, Qiu Tong asked the workers to turn the stretcher around and move his legs past the curtain.
Looking at the vicious iron rod and the blood still gushing continuously, it was very likely that the iron rod had pierced a major artery. If the bleeding was not stopped, he would be in danger of falling into shock.
Qiu Tong immediately stuck the long needle into the wound and flicked it with her index finger. She frowned and slowly infused her power.
The gushing blood gradually stopped, and the youth’s pale and bruised face slowly regained its color. The pain on his face also eased a lot.
With slightly furrowed brows, she gestured for the boss to come over and help her remove the iron rod.
The boss’s hands trembled as he braced himself to remove the rod. However, he realized that the patient seemed to be unconscious. In fact, he appeared to be sleeping.
With a practiced hand, Qiu Tong skillfully bandaged the wound and had the boss go out to communicate with the other workers. Everything was fine now.
The group of workers nearly knelt down before the boss in gratitude. They thought that their brother was going to lose his leg!
Everyone at present tutted in wonder, praising the progress of this clinic’s medical skills.
The boss had never seen such amazing medical skills before. With the casual insertion of a few needles, the gushing blood was immediately stopped. Even the patient’s pain seemed to have eased by quite a bit.
Miracle doctor, she was simply a miracle doctor!
In just two hours, the boss’ initial disdain and suspicion towards Qiu Tong had turned into unrestrained admiration. He even requested her to be his teacher.
Qiu Tong was amused by it but she had to reject him. After all, this was not solely just pure medical skills, but due to her special ability.
The boss felt that it was a pity, but he could understand. After all, every physician family had their own rules. In order to win Qiu Tong’s favor and make her stay in his clinic for the long-term, he took the initiative to reduce his share of the treatment fees from 30% to 20%.
Qiu Tong needed the money so she did not refuse.
With money came stability and assurance. Furthermore, she still had three little kids to raise.
In the middle of the empty yard, a basket was propped up with a wooden stick. There was a rope tied to the wooden stick. The other end of the rope was held by a small hand.
Qiu Xingqiao stared at the basket nervously. When he saw the bird walk to the bottom of the basket, he quickly pulled the rope and the wooden stick with it. With a “clatter”, he managed to trap the bird under the basket.
“Eldest Brother, I caught a bird!”
Qiu Xingqiao excitedly rushed over and grabbed the bird in his hand, before rushing to look for Eldest Brother.
They could have an extra ingredient for dinner tonight! Little Yu had meat to eat now!
But when he turned around, he saw a figure stepping in through the door. Qiu Xingqiao was so frightened that his whole body stiffened and his hands lost their grip strength. The bird struggled and flew away.
“My bird!”
Qiu Xingqiao cried out in defeat. This was a bird that he had spent an entire afternoon before finally catching one.
He glared at Qiu Tong angrily, his eyes full of guardedness. “What are you doing here? Haven’t you already left?”
Could she have changed her mind and decided to come back to torture them?
Hearing the commotion, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingyu walked out. Qiu Xingyu’s eyes lit up. “Mommy!”
Panting, Qiu Tong walked into the courtyard carrying a huge bag of items. She then placed it heavily on the ground.
Dewy cabbage, carrots, pork streaked with fat and rice as white as jade pieces…
The three brats were stupefied.. It was as if a mountain of treasures descended from the heavens, crashing down upon them until they had lost all sense of direction.

chapters.title: Chapter 8
chapters.content:
Chapter 8: Mutually Beneficial Exchange
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“What are you standing there for?”
With her hands on her hips and still panting, Qiu Tong commanded. “Qiu Xingyuan, wash the meat. Qiu Xingqiao, prepare the vegetables. Little Yu, rinse the rice.”
Little Yu sweetly assented and was about to go over when she was stopped by Qiu Xingyuan.
“We won’t eat your food!”
Qiu Xingyuan picked up Little Yu and walked away. Qiu Xingqiao hurriedly followed him and whispered, “Brother, did she bring those things for us to eat?”
He suddenly looked horrified. “Could she be trying to poison us?”
“Will she still be able to sell us if she poisoned us to death?”
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his lips tightly. He also felt that Qiu Tong was harboring evil intentions. There must be some trap.
Qiu Tong was both amused and exasperated when she overheard their whispers. She decided to do everything herself and quickly prepared the ingredients in front of her.
Food was scarce in the post-apocalyptic era, not to mention fresh vegetables and fruits. Qiu Tong was so moved by the sight of those ingredients that she nearly cried when she was buying them.
The aroma of food soon drifted out, making the three brats sitting in the corner feel utterly famished.
“Brother, I’m so hungry…”
Qiu Xingqiao took a deep breath. Even if he couldn’t eat it, he could still smell it, right?
After cooking for more than an hour, Qiu Tong finally sat down in satisfaction.
There were about a dozen dishes on the table, including both meat and vegetables. She also steamed a large pot of fragrant white rice.
With a satisfied smile, Qiu Tong glanced at the three little heads. “Come and eat.”
Qiu Xingyuan looked at her coldly. Without his permission, his two younger siblings dared not move.
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and ignored them. She strode over and sat down, before helping herself generously to the food.
Qiu Xingqiao widened his eyes and swallowed even harder as he watched Qiu Tong eat.
“How can she eat so much? Is she a pig?”
Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes flickered. Seeing that Qiu Tong was fine after eating the food, he brought Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu over slowly.
Such a tiny kid, but full of caution and schemes.
Qiu Tong was secretly amused, but her face remained expressionless.
“Help yourself to the rice. Take as much as you can eat. You must cherish the food and not leave a single grain of rice!”
She piled the dishes in front of the triplets and said calmly, “Eat more. Don’t be picky.”
Looking at the table full of sumptuous dishes, the three children almost thought they were dreaming.
They had never eaten so much good food since they were born. Even during the New Year, they only had some salty side dishes and plain, watery porridge.
In the past, Qiu Tong would not let them eat at the table. She would just toss them a bowl and let them squat at the corner of the table like animals.
“Why did you come back?”
The guardedness in Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes intensified, as if Qiu Tong was really plotting something. “What exactly are you planning?”
Qiu Tong tapped her index finger on the table, her bright eyes slightly curved. “Because I am regretting it.”
Qiu Xingyuan’s body stiffened, and his eyes darkened gradually.
Indeed, she was regretting it!
She still planned to sell the three of them…
Qiu Xingyuan quietly gritted his teeth and swore that even if he had to go all out, he would never let Qiu Tong sell off his brother and sister.
Just as he was about to lash out, he heard Qiu Tong say unhurriedly, “I was pregnant for 10 months and walked through the gates of hell three times before giving birth to you three brats.”
“It wasn’t easy for me to raise you three and if I were to abandon all of you now, it would be my loss.”
She clapped her hands together and grinned. “So I’ve decided I’ll keep you all alive until you can survive on your own.”
Qiu Tong raised one finger, laying out her condition so as to lower their suspicions against her.
“The condition is that you have to repay me by being filial to me when I’m old. If you have no problem with that, come over and eat.”
It turned out that she was afraid that no one would support her when she was old!
Having finally understood her motive, Qiu Xingyuan’s tense nerves relaxed slightly.
It was just a mutually beneficial exchange. Besides, he did not have the ability to support his younger siblings yet. Since Qiu Tong was willing to raise them, that would be for the best.
Qiu Xingyuan glanced at Qiu Tong and said coldly, “Deal.”
It was as if to him, it was really just a mutually beneficial exchange.
With Qiu Xingyuan’s permission, Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu immediately rushed to the table and helped themselves to the food, hurriedly stuffing it into their mouths.
In the next second, those two kids widened their eyes in shock when the amazing taste tantalized their taste buds.
They had never eaten such delicious food before. It was a hundred times more delicious than meat buns!

chapters.title: Chapter 9
chapters.content:
Chapter 9: Fake Sister
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Even Qiu Xingyuan could not resist a look of surprise. He never knew that this woman could actually cook.
Amusement flashed across Qiu Tong’s eyes when she saw them eating so happily.
“As long as you listen to me obediently, you will see better days in the future.”
Qiu Xingyu held her bowl, which was bigger than her own face. “Mommy, will you still sell us when our life gets better?”
Her gaze was innocent. She had obviously been well protected by Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao.
Qiu Tong pinched her cheeks. “Of course not. You’re already so old. Even if I sell you, you won’t fetch a good price.”
Qiu Tong spoke very seriously. In any case, even if she promised that she would not sell them, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao might not believe her. She might as well find a reason so that they could remain in peace.
However, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at each other, their small faces full of worry.
“Brother, what if someone offers an attractive price? Will she still choose to sell us?”
Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes were filled with doubt as he quietly whispered into Qiu Xingyuan’s ear.
Qiu Xingyuan looked at Qiu Tong coldly and said hatefully, “I will never let her succeed!”
Qiu Tong, “…”
She was helpless. These two brats were unmoved by both hard and soft tactics. They were impervious to everything, yet they had so many tricks up their sleeves!
The three of them quickly finished all the food. It was mainly because Qiu Tong’s appetite was so big. The three brats were so shocked that they gaped at the sight. Qiu Xingyuan even suspected Qiu Tong of eating the Qiu family into bankruptcy.
Seeing that it was almost time for her to meet the boss of the clinic, Qiu Tong cleared the dishes and instructed.
“I’m going out this afternoon. The three of you have to take good care of the house. Do not open the door to strangers, understand?”
Other than Qiu Xingyu responding to her obediently, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao stared at her and pursed their lips without saying a word.
Qiu Tong did not expect them to reconcile with her within such a short period of time. Just as she was about to leave, she heard someone calling her.
“Qiu Tong, what’s wrong with you?”
A beautiful woman with short braids, a flowery shirt and black pants rushed over and grabbed her. “Why did you suddenly change your mind?”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes slowly and looked at the woman who was a complete stranger to her. She put up her guard and did not respond.
“Eldest Brother, that bad woman is here again!”
Qiu Xingqiao’s sharp eyes spotted Lin Shan immediately.
It was this woman who kept saying that she was Qiu Tong’s best friend, but encouraged Qiu Tong to sell them off!
Qiu Xingqiao gritted his teeth in anger and rushed out with his head lowered. “I’ll chase her out now!”
Lin Shan’s back was facing Qiu Xingqiao. When she saw Qiu Tong remain silent, her frown deepened. “Why aren’t you saying anything? Are you regretting it now? Qiu Tong, you can’t be soft-hearted at a time like this. As long as you sell them, you’ll be free… Ah!”
A sudden force from the side made her stumble!
“Little bastard, are you blind?!”
Lin Shan yelled at the top of her lungs and raised her hand to slap Qiu Xingqiao across the face. It was obvious that she usually hit them.
This time, a slender hand grabbed her wrist.
There was no emotion in Qiu Tong’s eyes. “He’s just a child. There’s no need to be so serious.”
Lin Shan stared at Qiu Tong as if this was the first time she was seeing her.
How could that be?
She had hit these little brats often in the past, and Qiu Tong had never stopped her. She would even comment that they deserved it.
“Qiu Tong, have you really gone soft-hearted?”
Lin Shan grabbed Qiu Tong’s arm and sighed. “But you have to think about yourself. You’re only in your early twenties. How are you going to survive with these three burdens?”
“I’m your best friend. Why would I harm you?”
The woman whispered into Qiu Tong’s ear, “The buyer I introduced to you is offering the highest price. You won’t be making a loss.”
Only then did Qiu Tong recall that this was the former Qiu Tong’s “best friend”—Lin Shan!
According to the storyline in the book, Lin Shan was not a good person. Not only did she cheat the former Qiu Tong of all her money, she also instigated her to sell her children. She was a typical “fake sister”.
She lowered her eyes, not daring to show too obvious a difference from the former Qiu Tong. She stated indifferently.
“I have other arrangements.”
Seeing that she had made up her mind not to sell the children, Lin Shan panicked. She had already accepted the commission fee, and if Qiu Tong went back on her word now, wouldn’t she have to cough the money back out?!

chapters.title: Chapter 10
chapters.content:
Chapter 10: Threatening To Break Up
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Just as Lin Shan was about to persuade her, something large and dirty flew over and landed on her newly-tailored clothes with a smack!
A foul smell quickly spread.
It was cow dung!
“Ah! Little brats, I’ll kill you all!”
Lin Shan’s lips were trembling, and she was so angry that her eyebrows were vertical. She rolled up her sleeves and rushed over, wanting to teach Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao a lesson, but she was stopped by Qiu Tong.
“Qiu Tong, look at these ingrates. What are you keeping them for?”
Lin Shan glared hatefully at the brats. “We might as well sell them and exchange them for some money!”
“If you like to sell children so much, why don’t you sell your own children?”
With a cold face, Qiu Tong smirked. “Speaking of money… when are you going to return the money you swindled from me?”
“What… what are you talking about?”
Lin Shan took a step back and looked away guiltily, refusing to admit it. “When did I cheat you of your money?”
The smile on Qiu Tong’s face grew colder when she realized that she was denying it.
“Since you didn’t cheat me, then it’s a loan? When are you going to return the $15,000 you borrowed from me?”
In the original novel, it was stated that after the former Qiu Tong’s family assets were seized, she still had some money on her. However, Lin Shan would keep borrowing money from her, until she was all emptied out.
Seeing that she was really angry, Lin Shan’s expression changed and her tone softened. “Qiu Tong, don’t be angry. Actually, I borrowed money from you for your own good.”
“Think about it, the Qiu family assets were seized and everything has been confiscated by the police. If they find out that you still have that stash of money, the police will definitely take it away.”
Lin Shan sounded extremely sincere, as if she was genuinely concerned for Qiu Tong. “I am just helping you keep it safe for the time being.”
As for whether she would ever return the money to Qiu Tong, Lin Shan did not even consider it. In any case, based on her understanding of Qiu Tong, she would definitely not dare to call the police, so the money would remain in her hands.
However, to Lin Shan’s surprise, Qiu Tong insisted on getting her money back.
“No need. Give me back my money. I’ll hand it over to the police myself.”
“Have you gone mad?”
Lin Shan raised her voice and said angrily, “Qiu Tong, don’t you trust me? Well now, we’re best friends but you don’t even trust me…”
Despite Lin Shan’s reprimand, Qiu Tong insisted, “It’s every citizen’s duty to abide by the law.”
She raised her eyebrows, her clear and sharp gaze almost seeing through Lin Shan’s thoughts. She smiled insincerely and said, “You’re not planning to keep it for yourself and not return it to me, are you?”
After having her true motives exposed, Lin Shan now looked miserable. “How is that possible? It’s just that I came out in a hurry today and didn’t bring any money with me.”
“Wait for me. I’ll go back and bring it to you now.”
Lin Shan ran off without looking back. Qiu Tong watched her leave, the smirk on her face growing wider.
Lin Shan probably wouldn’t dare to come again for the time being.
But, no one had ever managed to take anything from her. Even if they did, she would make them pay it back ten times or even a hundred times over!
She already had a plan in mind.
Turning around, Qiu Tong raised her eyebrows in surprise. “Why are you looking at me like that?”
Qiu Xingyuan drew back his conflicted gaze. He did not expect this woman to protect them.
Previously, when Lin Shan came, she would either hit or scold them. Meanwhile, this woman would instigate her to beat them even more ruthlessly.
This was the first time she had protected them.
The three children started to have some tender feelings for Qiu Tong. Even the way they looked at her changed.
Qiu Tong noticed the change in the children’s attitude. Before she could rejoice, a man suddenly appeared at the door.
“Qiu Tong!”
He rushed over aggressively and pointed angrily at Qiu Xingyuan and the rest. “Didn’t you promise me to sell them? Why are they still here?”
Who was this?
Qiu Tong looked at the handsome but malicious man in front of her and asked coldly, “Why should I sell?”
The man thought that Qiu Tong could not bear to part with the children, so he immediately held her hand and said with deep affection, “Qiu Tong, we’ll have our own children in the future. With these three burdens, we won’t be able to have a good life, and my family won’t accept you.”
His tone carried a hint of threat. “Don’t you want to marry me?”
Qiu Tong’s heart skipped a beat. So this man was her lover, the scumbag Yu Ge?
Yu Ge was also an expert at swindling money. Later on, he even cheated Qiu Tong of the money from selling her children before dumping her. This was the main cause of Qiu Tong’s change in temperament and poverty.
Qiu Tong retracted her hand and said coldly, “You can’t even accept my children. This means you don’t love me at all. Why should I care if your family can accept me?”
“Yu Ge, you can’t blame these children for their lack of ability to survive. You’re the useless one!”

chapters.title: Chapter 11
chapters.content:
Chapter 11: Well Done
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Yu Ge’s face flushed red from humiliation. He glared at Qiu Tong and questioned her, “Are you really not planning to sell these three bastards?”
He said vehemently, “Fine! If you don’t agree to sell them today, we’ll break up!”
“Sure!”
Qiu Tong readily agreed.
Yu Ge was stunned. Qiu Tong smirked, but her smile did not reach her eyes. “Please leave now. We will have nothing to do with each other from now on!”
Yu Ge panicked when he saw that Qiu Tong really wanted to have a clean break from him.
He had not extracted every drop of value from Qiu Tong yet, so how could he be willing to let her go?
“Qiu Tong, don’t be angry. I’m just worried about our future.”
Yu Ge looked troubled. He let out a long sigh. “I didn’t mean to force you to sell your children, but we will have our own children. With them, how can we give our own children the best life?”
“If you sell them for a sum of money, we can open a grocery store and even build a home. When our own children are born, we can provide them with a good living situation. I will also do my best to take care of you and our children.”
Yu Ge deliberately painted a beautiful future for Qiu Tong. The love in his eyes looked like it was about to overflow. “Qiu Tong, I love you and I can accept everything about you. But we have to consider reality. Sell the children, okay?”
Qiu Tong’s eyes flickered, but she remained silent.
The three kids who were eavesdropping at the side were instantly enraged.
When Qiu Tong turned away, Qiu Xingyu took the opportunity. She clasped her hands behind her back. Her large eyes were brimming with tears, making her look extremely pitiful and aggrieved.
“Uncle, can you not let Mommy sell me?”
Yu Ge’s gaze landed on Qiu Xingyu’s beautiful and adorable face. A strange glint flashed across his eyes. “Little Yu, come here to Uncle.”
Among the children, this daughter seemed to be the most valuable.
If he could trick her to go outside…
Yu Ge smiled as he waved her over. “Do you want to eat ice cream? Uncle will bring you to buy it, okay?”
Qiu Xingyu ran over affectionately and tugged at his clothes. “I want to eat, but Uncle, my doll fell into the pool. Can you help me get it first?”
The direction of the pool was at the back of the courtyard, in a very hidden corner.
Yu Ge seemed to have seen the banknotes waving at him. He looked warily at Qiu Tong’s corner and realized that she was not paying attention to the commotion. He immediately went to hold Xiao Yu’s soft hand.
“Let’s go then.”
Moving very nimbly, Qiu Xingyu ran towards the pool. “Uncle, come quickly!”
She pointed at the doll in the middle of the pool, her eyes sparkling. “Uncle, it’s over there!”
Yu Ge stuck his head out and looked over. However, he was suddenly kicked hard on the back. With a splash, he fell into the pool!
Qiu Xingyu immediately jumped up and clapped her hands excitedly. “Second Brother, you’re super awesome!”
Qiu Xingqiao lifted his nose proudly and waved his fist at Yu Ge.
This person actually dared to instigate Mommy to sell them and even had ulterior motives with Little Yu. Qiu Xingqiao was furious and wished he could teach Yu Ge a lesson.
At the same time, a small arm reached over and poured a packet of powder into the pool.
Yu Ge, who was soaking in the pool, immediately had large patches of rashes on his face and body. It was strange and terrifying. He was desperately scratching and shouting, “What did you pour inside?!”
“It’s just powder that makes the skin extra sensitive.”
Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes darkened, his lips set in a cold line. “Just take it as our gratitude for your ‘care and concern’!”
“Tsk, well done.”
An amused voice came from above.
The three children gasped and realized that Qiu Tong was already standing behind them.
Qiu Xingyuan reacted extremely quickly and immediately shielded Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu behind him. “It was all done by me. It has nothing to do with the two of them!”
Qiu Tong glanced at him and suddenly raised her hand.
Was she going to hit him?
Although he had long expected it, Qiu Xingyuan’s heart still turned cold. He gritted his teeth and closed his eyes.
However, it was a gentle touch that reached his head. “This powder is quite effective. You should prepare a few more.”
Qiu Tong praised him with a smile. Qiu Xingyuan was indeed the future drug lord. He already knew how to mix chemicals at such a young age.
She used a broom to pull Yu Ge up.
Being tricked by the three children in such a wretched manner, Yu Ge was both embarrassed and angry. He gritted his teeth and clenched his fists, wanting to smash it towards Qiu Xingyuan.
“You three little brats! Bastards! Demons! How dare you trick me!”
Qiu Tong picked up the broom beside her and took the opportunity to give him a good beating.
“You dare to force me to sell my children? Why don’t you take a good look at yourself in the mirror!”
“Even if all the men in the world are dead, I won’t fall for you!”
“Get lost, get lost!”
Covering his head, Yu Ge was given a thorough thrashing by Qiu Tong.. He ran out of the house in a sorry state. With a face full of rashes, he angrily said, “Qiu Tong, just you wait! You will regret this!”

chapters.title: Chapter 12
chapters.content:
Chapter 12: Mysterious Man
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong did not take his threat to heart. After successfully chasing him out, the family of four was tired and hungry.
Looking at the time, it was probably too late to cook.
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and smiled. “Let’s go. I’m in a good mood today. I’ll bring you guys to eat something good!”
The place they lived in was too remote. It would take them a long time to reach the downtown area.
Fortunately, Qiu Tong was not in a hurry. The four of them leisurely walked along the road.
The three children had always been focused on survival. They never stopped to take a good look at the scenery around them. Nevertheless, they were also at an age where they were full of curiosity. Along the way, they were extremely curious about all kinds of things.
As they passed a remote street, they suddenly heard the chaotic sounds of gunshot.
Two groups of people were fighting on the streets. One side was clearly on the losing end. Unable to hold on any longer, they fired two shots at the pursuing enemy, before hurriedly fleeing away.
The other side immediately gave chase. Qiu Tong shielded the three children and hid to the side in case they were accidentally injured. The three children hid behind her obediently, revealing only six pairs of eyes as they stared nervously and fearfully at the chaotic street.
Seeing that they were very anxious, Qiu Tong comforted them. “It’s alright. I’ll protect you.”
Qiu Xingyuan shot her a quick glance, as if he did not believe her.
Although Qiu Tong had changed recently, Qiu Xingyuan still did not dare to let down his guard. He did not forget that Qiu Tong was still the greatest danger.
When all the chaos finally dispelled, Qiu Tong slowly walked out with her children.
The originally orderly street had become very messy. There was no one on the road, but only a car knocked to the side. There seemed to be a figure in the back seat.
Qiu Tong frowned and decided to circle around the car and leave.
She had three children with her and could not risk meddling in other people’s business. However, when she caught a glimpse of the man’s face in the backseat, Qiu Tong immediately changed her mind.
The man’s facial features were unusually deep-set. He had straight eyebrows and well-defined features. His thick eyelashes cast a shadow on his face. Even though he was unconscious, he still looked cold and aloof.
Qiu Tong stared blankly at his face, a sense of familiarity lingering in her heart.
But she had never seen this man in her memories.
With a glint in her eyes, Qiu Tong asked the three children to hide in a nearby alley. She then moved a nearby bamboo basket and some clothes over to cover them, before saying hurriedly, “Hide here. Don’t move.”
She turned back to the place where the gunfight had taken place, only to find that the group of people who had left earlier had returned. They seemed to be planning to take the man away.
Qiu Tong’s eyes turned cold as she charged over and kicked one of the men away.
With swift and fierce movements cultivated during her post-apocalyptic days, her body was agile and her attacks clean and direct. Every strike was aimed directly at the vital points. In just a short period of time, none of the group, which comprised over a dozen men, were left standing.
“Hey, wake up!”
Qiu Tong patted the man’s face and he opened his eyes, staring at her coldly.
Qiu Tong’s body stiffened, and that sense of familiarity welled up in her heart again.
However, the man lost consciousness again.
Only then did Qiu Tong notice the gunshot wound on his chest. Her eyes flickered as she leaned forward and a faint white light gradually appeared on her palm.
The hideous wound started to heal and Qiu Tong did not notice the flutter of the man’s eyelashes. Still in a blur, his eyes opened just a slit.
Jin Yang didn’t expect the other group to be so bold as to set up a trap and start a gunfight in broad daylight.
He tried his best, but there were too many opponents. In the chaos, he was shot in the chest.
As much endurance as Jin Yang had, he had lost consciousness from the intense pain.
Amidst the haze, someone seemed to be calling out to him.
Jin Yang forced his eyes open, only to meet a pair of limpid eyes.
He wanted to see more clearly, but his consciousness was once again dragged back into the thick black fog.
Vaguely, he could smell a crisp, clear fragrance, which was not too thick. The pain in his chest seemed to have eased a lot.
He kept drifting in and out of consciousness. Jin Yang wanted to open his eyes, but he could only vaguely see a blurry figure, as well as hear her soft and gentle voice.
There also seemed to be three chattering children.
His chest was getting warmer and Jin Yang could subtly feel that his injuries were getting better.
By the time he regained full consciousness, he had been transported to the hospital by his team. The fatal wound on his chest had also recovered.
He could not help touching his chest with his long fingers, as if he still remembered the pain of being shot.
Jin Yang’s eyes darkened. Was he dreaming when he saw that woman?

chapters.title: Chapter 13
chapters.content:
Chapter 13: Your Prize
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Jin Yang called for his comrade who had sent him to the hospital. The other party immediately understood. “You are talking about that young lady with her three children?”
So there were really three children.
Jin Yang frowned slightly and gave a small nod. He had his comrade immediately investigate the background of Qiu Tong and those three children.
He had vaguely felt that Qiu Tong’s aura was very familiar, as if he had seen her somewhere a long time ago.
But no matter what, he could not remember.
Jin Yang’s eyes darkened when he thought of the warm aura that was like the morning sun.
Taking advantage of the chaos during the gunfight, Qiu Tong took a lot of money from the bad guys and brought the three kids to a restaurant in the city. She slapped the table and said, “Serve us all your signature dishes!”
The table, which was large enough to cater to 20 people, was instantly filled. The three children looked shocked.
Wasn’t this too much?
Qiu Tong felt extremely satisfied and gestured to them. “Eat. What are you waiting for?”
She quickly lowered her head and started to eat. She ate in a frenzied, but not uncivilized manner. Watching her, Qiu Xingyuan and the rest was once again dumbfounded.
Qiu Xingyu carefully looked at Qiu Tong’s bag, her eyes filled with sorrow.
Mommy was such a glutton and they didn’t have much money on them. Would she eat them into poverty?
“We are not eating.”
Qiu Xingyuan shook his head guardedly. With so many dishes and the expensive look of the restaurant, the prices should be very high.
If they spent all their money, Qiu Tong would definitely use that as an excuse to throw a tantrum.
Qiu Tong looked in confusion at the three children huddled in a corner. “Why aren’t you eating?”
Qiu Xingyu bit her finger and looked longingly at the exquisite dishes on the table. She whispered, “We won’t have any money left if we eat.”
What reason was that?
Qiu Tong was amused and said casually, “I have money to pay for this.”
“Besides, you can always earn more money when you run out of it, but you cannot go hungry.”
She made the three children come to the table and instructed them carefully, “But don’t ever waste food.”
The three children were thrifty by nature and nodded obediently. They felt that Qiu Tong had really changed a lot.
In the past, when she had no money, Qiu Tong would scold the heavens for being blind. She would go on a tirade about men, before beating them and scolding them for being money-sucking burdens.
They had never seen Qiu Tong so optimistic. In the past, Qiu Tong was always full of complaints, and would even hit them when she was angry.
After eating and drinking, Qiu Tong was in no hurry to bring them back.
The three children usually stayed at home and did not go anywhere. Qiu Tong planned to bring them around. As expected, the three children were full of energy and looked at everything in town with fresh eyes.
“Wow!”
Qiu Xingyu’s sharp eyes caught sight of a doll arranged behind a display window by the street. Her eyes immediately lit up and she pressed her hands against the glass without blinking.
Qiu Tong came up behind her and raised an eyebrow. “You like it?”
Qiu Xingyu nodded vigorously and looked at Qiu Tong expectantly.
When she saw the price in the window, Qiu Tong’s expression changed.
This little toy that could not be eaten was actually several times more expensive than the food she had just eaten?!
Qiu Tong didn’t think it was worth it, so she grabbed Qiu Xingyu’s hand and turned to leave.
Although Qiu Xingyu was reluctant, she understood the situation at home and followed obediently. She turned back to look at the doll several times, her eyes filled with longing.
Qiu Xingyuan’s heart ached as he watched. He was also a little angry.
Qiu Tong was willing to spend so much money on a full table of food just to fill her stomach, but she was unwilling to buy Little Yu a doll which she liked so much!
Quietly clenching his fists, Qiu Xingyuan took a good look at the doll in the display window, carefully noting down the price.
When he had money in the future, he would definitely buy this doll for Little Yu!
And he had to buy two. He would put the other one in Qiu Tong’s room for her to see!
They thought that Qiu Tong was going to bring them home, but she led them to a stall which gave prizes for shooting at the balloons.
What was she doing?
Qiu Xingyuan frowned. He realized that he could not understand Qiu Tong anymore.
Pretending not to notice the three kids’ confusion, Qiu Tong walked straight to the boss. “How much?”
“$20 for 30 shots.”
Qiu Tong pointed at the doll placed on the highest shelf. “That’s the prize for hitting all the balloons?”
That doll was more than twice the size of the one in the earlier display window.
The boss looked at her and instantly took her for a fool. He chuckled.
“Yes, you can have it as long as you hit all the balloons.”
Did she really think that she would be able to hit all the balloons?
Qiu Tong understood and waved at Qiu Xingyu with a smile. “Come here, I’ll help you get a doll!”
This time, the boss was not the only one who believed that Qiu Tong must be dreaming. Even Qiu Xingyuan thought so.
Qiu Xingyu walked over doubtfully, but was immediately pulled into Qiu Tong’s arms. Qiu Tong placed Qiu Xingyu’s index finger on the trigger.. “Aim properly.”

chapters.title: Chapter 14
chapters.content:
Chapter 14: Soldiers On The Battlefield
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“Pop!”
Qiu Xingyu’s eyes lit up at the sound of a balloon bursting. “I hit it!”
Qiu Tong smiled but didn’t say anything. Thereafter, she continued to pull the trigger with Qiu Xingyu, taking aim at the balloons which were 10 meters away. In less than 10 minutes, they popped all 30 balloons.
Gasp after gasp rang out.
No one expected Qiu Tong to actually hit the targets and win the biggest prize.
The boss’ face turned pallid. If he had known earlier, he wouldn’t have allowed them to play!
Qiu Tong handed the huge doll to the excited Qiu Xingyu. “Your prize.”
Qiu Xingyu hugged her doll excitedly and looked at Qiu Tong with admiration. “Mommy, you’re amazing!”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were filled with disdain when they saw Qiu Xingqiao so easily won over by a doll.
“It’s just a game. What’s the big deal?”
“That’s right. If you want, I can help you win it too!”
Even as they spoke those words, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were also very shocked. They had no idea that Qiu Tong knew how to use a gun, and that her marksmanship was so accurate.
As if she could see through the two boys’ tough exteriors, Qiu Tong smiled at them. “Do you want to learn?”
Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes flickered. He stole a glance at his elder brother’s expression before lying. “That’s such a basic thing. I don’t want to learn it!”
Qiu Xingyuan did not speak. His silence expressed his refusal, but his eyes would occasionally shift toward the gun.
Qiu Tong did not miss the desire in their eyes. She smiled to herself and said enticingly, “Do you really not want to learn?”
“After learning it, you can protect your little sister and even continue to win her dolls.”
“Just nod your heads if you want that.”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at each other. Qiu Xingqiao pretended to show great reluctance. “Since you want to teach us so badly, we have no choice but to agree.”
Qiu Tong nearly laughed out loud at his impertinent act.
Nevertheless, things were progressing as Qiu Tong hoped. This was the first step to her successfully subduing these devilish brats!
The next day, Qiu Tong summoned the three brats early in the morning and told them to run 10 rounds around the house. This was in accordance with the training method in the post-apocalyptic world.
The three brats did not know what she was up to and had no choice but to follow her instructions. Although they often did manual labor, they did not usually expend so much energy all at once.
When the three children came back panting, they discovered that it was just a warm-up?!
“Next is sit-ups.”
Seeing that the three children did not understand, Qiu Tong quickly gave them a demonstration and said in a mild tone, “Since you guys have just started this training, you don’t have to do too many, just fifty will do.”
However, they only managed to do a dozen or so before they were completely unable to take it anymore. Qiu Xingyu was so tired that she collapsed onto the ground.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao quietly gritted their teeth when they saw Qiu Tong drinking her fruit juice with a relaxed expression, as if she was enjoying the sight of their torment.
This woman must be going crazy again. She was deliberately messing with them!
Qiu Xingqiao jumped up angrily and glared at Qiu Tong. “Why aren’t you training?”
Besides, they had never seen Qiu Tong train before. She claimed that this was useful for learning to shoot. It was most likely a lie!
“Because I’m stronger than you!”
Qiu Tong replied leisurely. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked unconvinced. “How do you know? Perhaps we are more powerful than you!”
Qiu Tong’s interest was piqued. She raised her eyebrows. “Are you challenging me?”
The two little men gritted their teeth and nodded vigorously.
“Yes!”
Qiu Tong accepted the challenge readily. She did not look down on them just because they were children. “You two can come at me together.”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at each other. With tacit cooperation cultivated over their many years together, they charged at Qiu Tong together, one attacking her neck while the other attacked her legs.
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes as she inwardly admired their strategy.
As expected of the biggest villains in the future, they were so talented in fighting. They were able to quickly detect the vulnerable parts of humans.
Unfortunately, their opponent today was Qiu Tong.
Shifting one foot behind, Qiu Tong dodged and leaped at the two little ones and pinned them to the ground.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were conquered, their clothes and faces covered in dust.
“Are you convinced now?”
Qiu Tong let them go. Seeing that it was almost noon, she said, “You guys continue, I’ll go and make lunch.”
Qiu Xingyuan helped Qiu Xingqiao up from the ground. When they thought of the mission Qiu Tong had assigned them, they all felt a headache coming.
“Brother, is she just purposely tormenting us?”
Qiu Xingqiao grimaced and sat on the ground. He felt like it would be a long time before he could stand up again.
Qiu Xingyuan also frowned. He felt that Qiu Tong must be feeling too bored and restless now. “She has her full attention on us now. Who else can she torture but us?”
“Brother, why don’t we find her a man? She’s so restless now, she must be lacking a man!”
Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes lit up, and he suggested, “I heard from Brother Hu Zi and the rest that the moment this woman gets caught up in a romance, she won’t be able to think about anything else.”
This way, Qiu Tong wouldn’t keep tormenting them anymore!
Qiu Xingyuan considered this and felt that it seemed to be a good solution.

chapters.title: Chapter 15
chapters.content:
Chapter 15: Matchmaking Corner
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“Where are you taking me?”
Qiu Tong was baffled. She had just finished cooking when the three brats pulled her out with mysterious expressions on their faces. They refused to tell her what they were going to do.
“You’ll know when we get there.”
After walking for more than 10 minutes. Qiu Xingyuan surveyed the surroundings and said in a casual tone, “We are here.”
What was so special about this place?
Qiu Tong frowned. Suddenly, a man leaned over. “Beauty, where are you from?”
Another short, fat man squeezed over. “You look familiar. Have I seen you from somewhere before?”
“Can you respect the queue? First come, first served?”
“This kind of matter depends on fate. What has it got to do with first come, first served…”
Speechless, Qiu Tong watched the two men argue with each other. She felt increasingly puzzled.
They were at a corner of the city park. It was a rather secluded area and there were about 20 to three men and women gathered here.
There were more men, but they were generally average-looking. Most of them were probably office workers.
There were fewer women, and there were also two or three couples talking together.
Qiu Tong edged over and realized that they were describing their family background and personal details. This was obviously a matchmaking corner!
She cursed under her breath and was about to turn around to find those brats and settle the score with them, when someone blocked her way.
“Hello, pretty lady. I already noticed you just now.”
The newcomer had average looks but his smile was especially confident. “Are those three children yours?”
Qiu Tong nodded perfunctorily, but the man appeared a little disappointed. “So it’s a second marriage…”
But looking at Qiu Tong’s beautiful face with appreciation, he said, “Although you have three children, I have a good feeling about you. Why don’t we get to know each other first?”
“My family background is not bad. I am definitely a worthy match to you, but I have to say this first. After we get married, we have to have our own children…”
Qiu Tong laughed at his confident and conceited tone. “I’m sorry, I’m not looking for a partner.”
“Why did you come to a matchmaking corner then? Are you trying to cheat people?”
A trace of anger flashed across the man’s face. He raised his hand to grab Qiu Tong. “You’re not allowed to leave. You have to explain yourself!”
He even wanted to take advantage of this situation to grope Qiu Tong’s chest.
Qiu Tong’s eyes turned cold. She lifted her leg and kicked the man’s crotch, teaching him a vicious lesson.
She turned around and found that the three kids had already run away.
Very good, they dared to scheme against her!
She made a note on her mental scorecard against those three brats, but Qiu Tong found that the house was empty when she returned.
Where were they?
Qiu Tong looked around but did not find anyone. She happened to see her neighbor. “Have you seen my three children?”
The neighbor looked at her strangely, as if she was very surprised. “You are actually looking for your children?”
Qiu Tong pursed her lips and remained silent. The neighbor pursed her lips in disdain and gloated.
“It’s too late for you to care about them now. Your second son went to find someone to fight with. And your eldest son is probably bringing your daughter to the internet cafe.”
The Qiu family was full of weirdos. The neighbor left hurriedly for fear of being tainted by anything to do with the Qiu family.
Qiu Tong did not pay attention to the neighbor’s attitude. She followed the direction pointed out to her and found the nearest internet cafe. But she still could not find Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingyu.
Could something have happened?
Qiu Tong panicked and was about to look elsewhere when she passed by a bookstore at the back of the internet cafe. Swas shocked to find Qiu Xingyuan squatting on the ground.
He was engrossed in a book with his back facing her.
Qiu Tong walked in and realized that he was looking at high school chemistry. He was only six years old!
Qiu Tong turned around and saw Qiu Xingyu staring at the computer screen nervously.
Qiu Tong, “…”
Was this the greatness of destiny? They were so young but the foundations for being the biggest drug lord and top hacker in the future were already being laid?
She was still deep in thought when she heard a harsh shout. “How long are you planning to loiter around here?”
The shop owner walked over impatiently and chased them out in disdain. “Go, go, go! You come here for free every time. We’re closing the shop. Hurry up and leave!”
“Just a little longer. I’ll be done soon.”
Qiu Xingyu pleaded pitifully. She was only a few steps away from completing her code. She just needed a little more time.
“It’s the two of you again! Don’t come here if you don’t have money. I wonder which family you are from. You are truly shameless, hogging the computer all day long. Do you have any manners at all…”
The shopkeeper’s words became increasingly insulting. Qiu Xingyu was just a child and her eyes slowly turned red.
Qiu Tong’s heart ached at the sight and she immediately stepped out with a cold face. “Shut up!”

chapters.title: Chapter 16
chapters.content:
Chapter 16: Settling A Debt
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Her eyes were cold, and because of her anger, she was filled with a murderous aura. She looked like someone not to be trifled with.
The boss was startled by her. He looked suspiciously at her. “Who are you?”
“I’m their mother.”
Qiu Tong shielded Little Yu behind her. Little Yu glanced timidly at her face and hung her head gloomily, as if she had committed a grave crime.
“Do you know how to discipline your child? She’s so young but already knows how to take advantage of others. What are you teaching her…”
The boss was furious and scolded Qiu Tong as well after knowing who she was. “What kind of child is that? What kind of parent are you?! Your child is the one who did wrong. How dare you behave so aggressively?”
“What wrong did she commit?”
