Qiu Tong asked coldly. The boss pointed at the computer and said angrily, “She comes here every day to take advantage of the internet and hog public resources. Shame on her!”
“Sorry, Mommy.”
Qiu Xingyu clutched the corner of Qiu Tong’s clothes tightly, her eyes filled with fear. She felt that she had embarrassed Qiu Tong.
Tears welled in her eyes. “I’ll never come here again,” she added nervously.
Qiu Tong stroked her head and glared at the boss again. She smirked and said, “Since it’s a public resource, what’s wrong with her using it? The computer is out there. Isn’t it for people to use?”
“Since you can’t bear to let anyone use it, why don’t you just lock it up in a safe?”
“Why are you so unreasonable?”
The boss did not know how to refute Qiu Tong. Seeing that the mother and daughter were about to leave, he immediately stopped them. “Don’t go! Your child was hogging public resources and made me lose many customers! Pay up!”
Qiu Tong paused and looked at him expressionlessly. “How much?”
The boss looked at the shabby clothes on them in disdain and said in scornfully, “$80! Look at your pathetic state. Can you afford to pay?!”
Smack!
A stack of cash was thrown down in front of the boss.
Qiu Tong said calmly, “Here’s $200.”
The boss looked at her doubtfully and counted the bills. It was indeed $200!
A smile blossomed on his face, and even his attitude towards Qiu Tong and Qiu Xingyu turned exceptionally warm. “We are just a small business, I hope you understand. Come over whenever you have time, I’ll reserve the computer for you!”
Qiu Tong ignored his solicitousness and just scooped up Qiu Xingyu. She turned around and saw Qiu Xingyuan looking at her with a complicated expression.
“Let’s go.”
She went forward and pulled Qiu Xingyuan to her side. This time, he followed beside her obediently and did not try to struggle away.
Walking out of the bookstore, Qiu Tong looked at Qiu Xingyu seriously and promised, “Little Yu, I’ll buy you a computer as soon as possible. In the future, you won’t have to come all the way here just to use the internet.”
She lowered her head and looked at Qiu Xingyuan, who had kept silent the entire time. “Also, tell me what you want for your chemistry studies. I’ll arrange everything for you.”
Since the two children were destined to have the same talents as during her previous life, she would fully support them and guide them on a completely different path.
Qiu Xingyu’s eyes lit up. “Really? Mommy, you’re the best!”
Qiu Tong was amused by the look of admiration in her eyes. She put her daughter down to let them both walk alongside her. Together, they went to find Qiu Xingqiao.
Qiu Xingyu excitedly shared with her brother the type of computer she wanted to buy. Qiu Xingyuan pursed his thin lips, his eyes flickering with doubt and disbelief.
“Little Yu, she was just making a casual remark. Don’t get your hopes up.”
The excitement on Qiu Xingyu’s face slowly faded as she mumbled, “No, Mommy said she would buy it.”
Qiu Xingyuan’s gaze was cold as he smirked sarcastically. “Is she rich?”
Qiu Xingyu hesitated for a moment. Pain flashed across her eyes. Her mommy had just spent $200!
Qiu Tong, who was walking in front, heard the whispers of the two little kids. A sense of helpless frustration flashed across her eyes.
Finding an opportunity to earn money was indeed their top priority now. Once she had money, she would buy them what they needed.
In the end, Qiu Tong found Qiu Xingqiao in an inconspicuous alley. He was in a fight with someone else.
She narrowed her eyes and observed for a while, before raising her eyebrows in surprise.
Although Qiu Xingqiao’s combat ability was not as good as hers, he could already completely subdue a gangster in his teens.
After successfully beating him up and seeing his opponent run away, Qiu Xingqiao walked back with a smug look on his face. When he passed Qiu Tong, he even shot her a menacing look.
Qiu Tong, “…”
Qiu Tong felt a throbbing pain in her forehead. The weight on her shoulders felt as heavy as Mount Tai.
There was still a long way to go before she could properly train these three brats and lead them to the righteous path!
After bringing the three children home safely, Qiu Tong squatted down and instructed them seriously, “I have something to do, don’t fool around outside.”
She looked at Qiu Xingyuan and said in a soft voice, “You’re the eldest brother, you have to take good care of your younger siblings.”
Qiu Xingyuan looked at her impassively, as if there was no need for her to give him such instructions.
Qiu Tong was amused. She patted his head and headed for the nearby internet cafe.
She needed money to support her children. She had to make Lin Shan cough up the money as soon as possible!

chapters.title: Chapter 17
chapters.content:
Chapter 17: $15,000
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
She chose a computer at random and found Lin Shan’s social contacts from her hand phone. She messaged Lin Shan on a social messaging platform.
“When are you returning my money?”
Her fingers flew nimbly across the keyboard. Through this platform, she could see that Lin Shan had read her message.
Qiu Tong smirked and quickly sent another message. “If you don’t return my money, I’ll call the police!”
This time, Lin Shan replied very quickly.
“Qiu Tong, we’ve been like sisters for so many years. Is our friendship worth less than a mere $15,000? You’re making me sad.”
Qiu Tong slowly narrowed her eyes. Lin Shan saw that she was keeping silent and thought that playing the emotional card was effective. She started to recall the past memories.
As Qiu Tong pretended to chat with her, she took the opportunity to hack into Lin Shan’s social media account. She managed to dig out quite a lot of shocking content.
There were quite a few photos of her being intimate with all kinds of men. Qiu Tong quickly copied the photos and saved them. After determining Lin Shan’s current location, she stood up and left the internet cafe.
She went straight to Lin Shan’s apartment and called her.
Lin Shan picked it up quickly and asked, “Qiu Tong, I’ve sent you so many messages, why didn’t you reply? Did you really call the police?!”
“I’m downstairs at your house.”
Qiu Tong ignored her questions and just replied with a cold statement. Lin Shan immediately fell silent and hung up.
In less than five minutes, Lin Shan rushed out of the corridor.
“Qiu Tong, must you be so ruthless?”
Lin Shan really didn’t expect Qiu Tong to find this place. She lowered her voice and behaved in a secretive manner, as if she was afraid of something.
Qiu Tong knew what she was worried about, so she decided to block her at the door. She casually glanced at a window on the fifth floor and said, “Aren’t you going to invite me up for a cup of tea?”
Lin Shan froze, her face turning pale. After a while, she said awkwardly, “It’s not convenient.”
It hadn’t been easy for her to get close to a rich old man, and he was very generous. Plied by her feminine wiles, the man soon succumbed to her. Not only were they living together now, they were also planning to get married.
At this critical juncture, if Qiu Tong were to expose her true colors and went up to quarrel with her, all her efforts would be for naught.
She lowered her voice and pleaded, “Qiu Tong, you go back first. We’ve been like sisters for so many years. Don’t you trust me? I’m planning to get married soon. There are too many things going on and I can’t transfer the funds.”
“When I have money, I will return it to you immediately.”
Qiu Tong did not believe Lin Shan at all.
“Since you don’t have money, you can ask your boyfriend to pay it back for you.”
Qiu Tong smirked and threatened, “And if you’re too embarrassed to ask, I’ll ask on your behalf.”
Seeing that she really meant to go upstairs, Lin Shan hurriedly stopped her. Her expression turned extremely ugly. “It’s just $15,000 right? I’ll transfer it to you right now!”
Lin Shan took out her phone and said sarcastically, “Just a mere $15,000 and you are behaving like I am trying to take your life. Qiu Tong, you deserve to be poor and be stuck in the slums forever!”
After transferring the $15,000 to Qiu Tong, Lin Shan’s eyes flashed with a hint of heartache. She then glared at Qiu Tong hatefully. “Qiu Tong, we are no longer sisters from now on! I’ve finally seen your true colors!”
“Get lost now!”
Qiu Tong was unperturbed. She turned around and sent Lin Shan’s scandalous photos to the old man’s phone before leaving.
With $15,000 on her, the first thing Qiu Tong did was to bring the three children to buy the promised items.
When they stood in the mall, the three kids thought they were dreaming.
“Mommy, can I really buy it?”
Qiu Xingyu looked at the computer on the display booth, her eyes flashing with desire and disbelief.
Qiu Tong smiled. “Which one do you want?”
Qiu Xingyu let out an excited shriek and immediately picked a computer that was the most value for money.
Qiu Tong did not discriminate against Qiu Xingyuan either. She purchased a large number of chemistry tools for Qiu Xingyuan, as well as direct access to the university’s chemistry learning materials. She also bought wooden stakes and punching bags for Qiu Xingqiao.
The three brats felt rather light-headed when they received the gifts. They hoped that this beautiful dream would never end.
Qiu Xingyu looked at Qiu Tong, who was following behind them. She covered her mouth as she quietly approached her eldest brother and second brother.
“Mommy seems to have really become nicer.”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at each other. They pursed their lips and did not speak.. No one knew what they were thinking.

chapters.title: Chapter 18
chapters.content:
Chapter 18: Boxing Competition
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
On the way home, Qiu Tong found a large group of people surrounding the noticeboard, discussing something.
She also went to look and saw that it was an announcement for a heavyweight boxing match. The champion’s prize money would be as high as $30,000!
Wasn’t this the perfect opportunity? She needed to earn money and here was the perfect opportunity served to her on a silver platter!
Fighting was her specialty!
Qiu Tong’s interest was piqued. She immediately went to the registration address and filled out the registration form.
The staff looked at her thin arms and the three children following behind her. He reminded her tactfully, “Madam, the boxing match is not that simple. You need to win against other competitors who might be of a higher level than you in the preliminary round first. You have three children and should consider your personal safety…”
Qiu Tong nodded her head nonchalantly and quietly warmed up her limbs. She stared at the stage with fervent eyes, already somewhat impatient.
Qiu Xingyuan’s face darkened.
This woman was willing to sacrifice her life for the sake of earning money?!
The three children looked at the gifts in their hands and their hearts instantly felt heavy. Their eyes were filled with guilt.
Qiu Xingyuan gripped the books and materials in his hands tightly. He suddenly gave Qiu Tong a forceful tug. “Don’t go!”
Surprised, Qiu Tong looked at Qiu Xingyuan’s awkward expression. He said softly, “I’m still young and don’t really need these chemistry tools and books. Why don’t we return them…”
Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu also said that they did not like boxing and surfing the internet. They did not need these things.
However, Qiu Tong firmly rejected them. “Since you have talents in these areas, study hard! Don’t worry about money.”
Qiu Tong took off her jacket, revealing her slender body. Her eyes lit up and a confident smile appeared on her face. “Remember to cheer me on from below the stage!”
Just as she stood on stage, the audience started booing.
“Such a young lady. What are you doing here?”
“That’s right. Going on stage just to embarrass yourself. Get lost!”
Ignoring the boos below the stage, Qiu Tong circled her wrists. Her opponent was a 1.9-meter tall muscular man. His muscles gleamed as he advised her in a low and muffled voice.
“I’ll hit hard. You better go down yourself!”
Qiu Tong just smiled at him. The moment the bell rang, she moved!
She was extremely fast, and in the blink of an eye, she was already behind the man. She grabbed the man’s shoulders and slammed her heels against the ground, twisting around with great force!
Bang!
The sound of his body crashing onto the stage floor stunned the audience.
It was a clean shoulder throw which had everyone instantly dumbstruck.
The boxer crawled up from the ground in a sorry state, no longer daring to look down on Qiu Tong. However, Qiu Tong’s next attack made the audience gasp in disbelief.
This woman was too strong!
In just half an hour, Qiu Tong passed the preliminary round, having won every single fight.
Holding her notice for the next round, Qiu Tong jumped off the stage and raised her eyebrows at the three stunned children.
“Let’s go!”
The three children, “…”
…
At Lin Shan’s residence.
The phone was slammed onto the coffee table. The old man, Mr. Cui, pointed at a series of unsightly photos on the screen, trembling in anger.
“Explain yourself! Didn’t you say that I was the only one?!”
It turned out that she was lying!
Lin Shan lowered her head and kept crying, not daring to speak.
Mr. Cui was so angry that he picked up his jacket and walked out. Lin Shan’s heart skipped a beat, and she rushed over to hug his waist tightly. “Don’t go! That was all because I was young and ignorant. I’m sorry! After we got together, I really only had you!”
“We’re about to get married. If this gets out, won’t I become the laughingstock of everyone?”
Mr. Cui’s face was dark as he kept silent after that.
Lin Shan was nervous. In order to please him, she carefully suggested, “Didn’t you want to buy Qiu Tong’s children? I’ll help you!”
Seeing Mr. Cui’s disbelief, Lin Shan quickly said, “Although I failed the previous time, I’m still her best friend. She’ll definitely trust me! Don’t worry, I’ll definitely succeed.”
Seeing that she seemed to be very confident, Mr. Cui finally calmed down and sat down on the sofa. But he refused to even glance at Lin Shan.
Lin Shan solicitously brought him a glass of water and asked, “Who wants Qiu Tong’s children so badly? They’re just three burdens.”
Mr. Cui glared at her warningly. “Don’t be so nosy!”
“Anyway, you just need to know that the status of that person is not something which you should even dare to think about!”

chapters.title: Chapter 19
chapters.content:
Chapter 19: Coming For The Kids
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong squatted in front of her house and looked at the dirty water on the ground, deep in thought.
Prize money from winning boxing competitions could only stem her money problems for the short term. It would be impossible to become rich via this route.
Staying long-term in the slums with three children was not an option either.
Security in the slums was poor, and the environment was rather harsh and cruel. The educational resources were also not as abundant as those in the city. She had to find a way to move the three children to the city.
If she did not remember wrongly, after this period of time, the property prices would skyrocket. She might as well get a small house now. Firstly, it would solve the problem of accommodation, and secondly, it would be a small investment.
Having made her decision, she called the three children over and announced in all seriousness, “I’m going to buy a house.”
Qiu Xingyu looked at her with admiration, while Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at her like she must be “daydreaming”.
Qiu Tong had not told them that Lin Shan had returned $15,000, which could be used to make a down payment. She could then take a bank loan for the rest of the amount, and then slowly repay the loan.
After assuring them that she was not daydreaming, she went online to pick an apartment building with comprehensive facilities and a decent education environment. She then brought the three children to choose an apartment.
Just as they reached a traffic intersection, several people rushed over and immediately surrounded Qiu Tong and her children.
“Are you Qiu Tong?”
The leader was a fat man who had a dragon tattooed on his left arm and wearing a black short-sleeved shirt. He glared at her fiercely before turning his cold eyes to the three children behind her. “Your father cheated us of our money! You have to return the money to us!”
He was extorting money from her without even offering any evidence?
Qiu Tong gave him a cold look. “He was the one who cheated you. Go look for him. Why should I pay you?”
“Children must repay their father’s debt!”
The fatty said angrily, “Your father has been arrested and you’re his daughter. You have to pay for him!”
He signaled with his eyes, and the others approached slowly with malevolence. “I heard that you have $15,000 in your hands. Since you have money, you need to repay his debts. Otherwise, don’t even think about leaving here today!”
Qiu Tong looked at them impassively and pushed the three uneasy children aside to avoid hurting them.
“What’s going on?”
Lin Shan suddenly appeared at the entrance of the street. A scheming look flashed across her eyes as she grabbed Qiu Tong. “Qiu Tong, you owe them money?”
“What her father owes is what she owes!”
The fat man and Lin Shan exchanged a look before snorting impatiently. His sinister eyes stared coldly at Qiu Tong. “If you don’t return the money, don’t blame us for being merciless!”
“Sir, don’t be angry.”
Lin Shan stood protectively in front of Qiu Tong, her eyes filled with righteous loyalty. “How much does she owe you? I’ll help her pay it back!”
“$15,000!”
Without hesitation, Lin Shan transferred $15,000 to the fat man right before Qiu Tong’s eyes. The men finally left after that.
She glared at Qiu Tong and said indignantly, “I treat you as a true friend but look at how you treat me in return. For the sake of a little bit of money, you don’t even care about our friendship.”
She let out a long sigh and said emphatically, “Take that $15,000 as a loan from me to you.”
Lin Shan glanced at Qiu Tong and said understandingly, “I know you don’t have the ability to pay me back now…”
She pretended to glance nonchalantly at the three children behind Qiu Tong. Lin Shan suggested, “The three of them are all grown up now, so they can do some manual labor. Why don’t you leave them to me and let them work to repay their debts first?”
So she was here for the children!
A cold smile flashed across Qiu Tong’s eyes. She knew very well what kind of person Lin Shan was. She was probably the one who hired those men to put up this entire act.
But Lin Shan didn’t have the guts to orchestrate something like that alone. There was probably someone else behind her!
“Sure!”
Qiu Tong agreed readily and looked at Lin Shan from the corner of her eyes. “However, you probably don’t have any jobs to offer them, right? Who are you going to hand them over to?”
“Have him personally come talk to me.”
“I will agree if the price is suitable.”
The three children’s hearts sank with Qiu Tong’s every word.
They thought that Qiu Tong had changed, but in the end, she had not changed at all. She still wanted to sell them out!
Qiu Xingyuan clenched his fists and pursed his thin lips tightly, hatred flashing in his eyes. Qiu Xingqiao’s little face flushed red, and he wished he could immediately rush over and fight Qiu Tong to the death.. Meanwhile, Qiu Xingyu’s eyes were red, and tears kept welling up in them.

chapters.title: Chapter 20
chapters.content:
Chapter 20: Going Home
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Lin Shan stammered, unable to speak.
A knowing sneer appeared on Qiu Tong’s face, and she said deliberately, “Although I don’t like these three children, they are my biological children after all. I can’t bear to let them do manual labor either. Why don’t we just forget it.”
“Don’t!”
Seeing that Qiu Tong was about to change her mind, Lin Shan hurriedly said, “Actually, I lied to you just now.”
She pretended to hold Qiu Tong’s hand with a look of helplessness and sympathy. “They’re your children, how could I bear to let them do hard labor? Let me tell you the truth, it’s Mr. Cui who wants the children. He’s old and doesn’t have children, so he wants to adopt them.”
Lin Shan’s tone was alluring as she slowly nudged Qiu Tong into agreeing. “Think about it, you would be allowing these three children to live a good life by sending them over. Once Mr. Cui dies, won’t all his assets belong to them?”
“By then, they would bring you over to live with them. Wouldn’t that be the best of both worlds?”
Qiu Tong listened quietly with lowered eyes, waiting for her to finish her little speech. A moment later, she smiled. “So it’s Mr. Cui.”
After successfully obtaining the information she wanted, Qiu Tong was about to leave with the three children when Lin Shan hurriedly pulled her back.
“Qiu Tong, what do you mean by that?”
“Tell Mr. Cui that hankering after the children of others because he can’t have children himself—he deserves to die without anyone to send him off to the netherworld.”
Qiu Tong stared at Lin Shan coldly. Her lips curved up in a mocking smile. “Since you care so much, why don’t you just go over and be his daughter?”
“You!”
Lin Shan’s face flushed red. She finally realized that Qiu Tong was purposely playing her for a fool. Her face fell.
“If you don’t agree, you must give me back my $15,000 now!”
She pulled Qiu Tong back to try and force her to return the money. Qiu Tong raised an eyebrow and said, “I can pay you back, but I have to call the police first!”
“That bunch of people just now claimed that they were owed money without providing any evidence. You gave them the money before I managed to get to the bottom of things.”
“I want the police to investigate and see if there’s really any debt.”
Seeing that Qiu Tong was really going to call the police, Lin Shan panicked.
How did that idiot Qiu Tong suddenly become so shrewd?!
She did not dare to let Qiu Tong call the police. She was worried it would be discovered that she had been the one who arranged for those men. She forced an awkward smile.
“Never mind. Those men shouldn’t have gone far. I’ll go find them and get my money back.”
Looking at Lin Shan’s pathetic back profile, Qiu Tong sneered and narrowed her eyes. She then looked away and continued to lead the three children to choose their house.
After looking at and comparing several places, she finally found a two-bedroom suite and paid the deposit.
“In the future, this room will belong to the two boys. Little Yu and I will stay in the other room.”
Qiu Tong looked very satisfied after assigning the rooms. Although the house was not too big, it was much bigger than the small, dilapidated hut in the slums.
However, the three children looked troubled and did not look happy at all.
“What’s the matter?”
Sensing that there was something wrong, Qiu Tong touched Qiu Xingyuan’s head, but he avoided her.
Qiu Xingyuan looked at her coldly and pursed his thin lips. “Why are you still selling us? Is it because you need money to buy a house?”
He gave a small, cold smile and clenched his fists tightly.
“Will you still sell us off in future, as and when you need money to buy things?”
Qiu Tong looked at him in astonishment. She then looked at Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu, who also had cold and guarded expressions on their faces. She suddenly felt very exasperated.
“I’m not planning to sell you guys. I was tricking her to try and get information out of her.”
Qiu Tong denied it, but the three children remained unconvinced.
“If I really wanted to sell you guys, I would have done so long ago,” she said in frustration.
“Don’t worry, I’m still waiting for you to support me in my old age. I definitely won’t sell you off so easily!”
This woman still needed them so that they could support her in her old age…
Qiu Xingyuan suddenly remembered that they were still “valuable” to her in that way, and his small fists slowly relaxed.
Qiu Tong was amused. She assigned the children the task of settling into the new home, before returning to the internet cafe herself.
Lin Shan’s account had already been hacked by her. She quickly browsed through all her friends and soon found an individual folder containing a “Mr. Cui”.
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes. Making use of Lin Shan’s account, she sent Mr. Cui a file and successfully hacked into his phone.
All his phone records and transaction history were displayed clearly in front of her. After going through almost a thousand phone numbers, Qiu Tong finally locked her eyes on a single line.
Controlling Mr. Cui’s phone by remote access, she quickly sent a message to the other party. “The children are in my possession now.”
The other party replied quickly, “When will they arrive?”
It was indeed him!
Qiu Tong still wanted to chat with the other party, but the other party sensed that something was wrong. He immediately went offline and deleted his account, not giving Qiu Tong any time to track him.
Qiu Tong cursed under her breath. Time was of the essence, and she only managed to determine that he was situated in the capital!

chapters.title: Chapter 21
chapters.content:
Chapter 21: Kindergarten
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The capital again?!
Qiu Tong frowned, deep in thought.
In the original timeline, the three children were sold to the capital, but it was not specified to whom they were sold to.
Once and again, things were being linked to the capital. Qiu Tong didn’t think it was a coincidence.
When she had first transmigrated over and was in the process of selling her children, could that have been arranged by the same person too?
The more Qiu Tong thought about it, the more likely it was. However, the former Qiu Tong was just a mother of three from slums. How could she know someone from the capital?
Could it be the children’s father?
All sorts of conjectures flashed across her mind, but no matter how hard she tried, she could not remember who the children’s father was.
One mystery after another shrouded her. Qiu Tong walked back with a dark face and heavy footsteps.
She could not just continue to sit and wait for the other party to plot and steal her children!
Qiu Tong slowly narrowed her eyes. The experience of surviving in the post-apocalyptic world had given her a heightened sense of awareness when it came to danger. She could not allow the three children to end up like how they did in the original timeline.
She had to go out and look for opportunities to earn money. With enough money and power, they could stop struggling on the poverty line and be secure enough to face the unknown.
However, it would be too risky for the three children to stay at home alone if Qiu Tong went out to earn money.
After all, someone was hiding in the dark and eyeing the three children like a tiger watching its prey. They were waiting for an opportunity to snatch them away from her.
Qiu Tong’s brows were tightly furrowed. She was very dissatisfied with all these areas of vulnerability.
After careful consideration, Qiu Tong’s eyes lit up.
If it was not safe to leave them at home, she would send them to school. Wasn’t this the best way to settle this once and for all?!
Coincidentally, the three brats had reached the age of schooling.
“Kindergarten?!”
Three different voices raised their voices at the same time. Not only Qiu Xingyuan, but even Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu were full of disdain and reluctance.
Qiu Tong beamed as she squatted down to coax them. “The kindergarten is very fun. There are playground slides and delicious food. You’ll get to know a lot of good friends there.”
Qiu Xingyu tilted her head. “I don’t want good friends. I only want Eldest Brother and Second Brother.”
Qiu Tong’s face stiffened for a moment. She persuaded gently, “Both your brothers will be going too.”
Qiu Xingqiao quickly said, “I’m not going!”
Who would want to play with a bunch of weak snotty brats who would fall from just a light push?
Qiu Xingyuan just put on a very cold expression. His objection was very obvious.
Qiu Tong was not put off. She continued to encourage them. “Mommy will reward those who are willing to go to kindergarten with a kiss!”
Qiu Xingyu’s eyes lit up. Her mother had never kissed her before.
Qiu Xingyu ignored her brothers’ cold gazes and immediately switched sides. “Mommy, I will go to kindergarten!”
Qiu Tong pouted her lips and rewarded Qiu Xingyu with a big kiss.
Since Little Yu was going to kindergarten, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao would naturally feel uncomfortable at the thought of letting her go alone. They would definitely agree to go together.
Qiu Tong looked at Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao with a smile. The two brats instantly put on their guard. “What are you doing?”
She dragged the boys into her arms. Lowering her head, she kissed them both with two loud smacking sounds.
“Wah—”
Qiu Xingqiao was like a cat whose tail had been stepped on. He immediately jumped up and wiped his face with all his might. “That’s disgusting!”
Qiu Xingyuan’s small face was stiff, his eyes displaying a similar look of disdain.
Qiu Tong threw back her head and laughed. The matter of the three Qiu family brats going to school was settled.
The next day, Qiu Tong brought the three children to a nearby kindergarten to report. After paying, they came out and saw a fat figure charging towards Qiu Xingyu and the other two like a cannonball.
Fortunately, Qiu Xingyuan was quick to react and pushed Little Yu away to prevent her from being bumped.
Instead of being sorry, that little fatty arrogantly pointed at Qiu Xingyuan and the other two, his eyes filled with provocation.
“You three bastards are not allowed to attend school here!”
“Get out!”
The shrill voice was filled with malice, causing Qiu Tong to frown.

chapters.title: Chapter 22
chapters.content:
Chapter 22: The Rascal’s Parent
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“What did you say?!”
Qiu Xingqiao’s brows were a straight line as he clenched his fists and charged over.
“Qiu Xingqiao!”
Qiu Tong hurriedly called out to him. Qiu Xingqiao stopped in his tracks, his face flushed red as he glared at the little fatty angrily.
The little fatty made a face at them. He was not afraid of Qiu Tong at all and continued to scold, “Even your own mother doesn’t like you guys. Without parents to take care of you, you guys are just illegitimate bastards!”
Qiu Xingyu held Qiu Xingyuan’s hand, her eyes already red.
“Who said I don’t like them?”
Qiu Tong walked over and raised an eyebrow at the little fatty. She waved at him. “Come here and apologize to my children. You can be good friends.”
“Pui!”
The little fatty stuck his hands on his hips, his gaze exceptionally arrogant. “Who wants to be good friends with three illegitimate children? And I didn’t say anything wrong, why should I apologize?”
Compared to this little fatty, her three brats were like angels.
Qiu Tong put on a dark expression and deliberately deepened her voice. “Are you going to apologize or not?!”
The little fatty took a few steps back but remained stubborn. “I won’t apologize. What can you do to me?”
“If you don’t apologize—”
Qiu Tong picked up a metal rod from the side and grinned. Even though she was smiling, she looked terrifying.
She grinned at the little fatty. Before his horrified gaze, she slowly bent the metal rod.
The metal rod that was as thick as a child’s arm twisted into a strange arc in the blink of an eye.
She narrowed her eyes slowly and curled her lips. “Be good and apologize or you’ll be next!”
The little fatty was petrified.
“Wah—”
Shrill cries of terror pierced through the air. The little fatty was crying so hard that snot and tears were flowing. He looked at Qiu Tong as though she was a monster.
Qiu Tong’s face darkened again. “Apologize!”
The little fatty trembled and cried as he said, “Sorry.” Then, he quickly turned around and ran away!
He was just a rascal. Dealing with rascals was nothing to her!
Qiu Tong clapped her hands gleefully and turned around to find the three children looking at her with conflicted expressions.
“What?”
She blinked in confusion. Qiu Xingqiao stammered as he pointed at the metal rod on the ground. “You… you bent it?”
“If you train according to my method, you can also bend it with your bare hands in future.”
These words immediately made Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes light up. Even the way he looked at Qiu Tong changed.
Qiu Tong was about to leave with the three children when an angry figure suddenly charged over, accompanied by the little fatty who was crying.
“Are you the one who bullied my child?!”
Before clarifying the matter, that person pointed at Qiu Tong’s nose. “Little witch! Do you have any shame? You dare to bully a child. Are you even human?”
Qiu Tong frowned and said coldly, “He was the one who scolded my children first.”
“So what? Despicable people like you deserve to be scolded!”
The person spat viciously and looked at Qiu Tong with eyes full of disdain. “Besides, what’s wrong with just a couple of insults? It’s not like you are physically harmed by it. Why must you split hairs with the child?”
Qiu Tong finally understood. So this was that rascal’s parent.
“Since you’re unwilling to teach your child, I don’t mind helping you to teach him.”
Her gaze turned cold, and her tone was sharp. “If your child still dares to speak rudely to my children, I won’t be so nice next time!”
“How dare you!”
The other party raised her voice and glared at Qiu Tong, looking like she wanted to eat her up. “Where did you come from? Do you know who I am? Believe it or not, I can get you and your three miscreants kicked out immediately!”
A teacher who noticed the commotion quickly came over to smooth things over. “Parents, it’s normal for children to have conflicts. We don’t want…”
“She has violent tendencies. I demand the kindergarten to kick out such incompetent parents immediately!”
The parent pointed at Qiu Tong arrogantly and narrowed her eyes viciously. “Take these three bastards and get lost. You’re not welcome here!”
The teacher’s face was filled with embarrassed awkwardness. There was nothing she could do but try and persuade both sides to calm down. However, the rascal’s parent refused to let things go.
Qiu Tong suddenly smiled coldly. “What did you just say?”
The parent raised her chin and repeated in a challenging tone, “I said, take these three bastards… Ah!”
A loud slap landed on her face.
Qiu Tong retracted her hand, her smile still faint. “If you don’t know how to speak nicely, I can teach you.”
“You dare to hit me?!”
The parent’s face instantly turned malevolent. She threw her fat body at Qiu Tong. “You little slut, I’m going to take your life!”
“Stop!”
A sudden shout rang out. Before Qiu Tong noticed what was happening, someone’s back profile appeared in front of her.
A man stood firmly in front of her.

chapters.title: Chapter 23
chapters.content:
Chapter 23: Military Commander
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong frowned. She had never seen him before.
“It’s just a conflict between children. Why should it escalate to a fight between adults?”
The person’s tone was polite and distant, but it was filled with an indisputable tone. “And it was indeed you who insulted them first. You should apologize.”
The fat parent was about to curse when she got a glimpse of the military rank on the man’s shoulder from the corner of her eye. She shuddered in fear.
This was a second lieutenant!
Her mind immediately cleared up and she forced a smile. “Sir, you are right. We’ll leave immediately.”
“Apologize.”
The second lieutenant commanded in a low voice. No matter how unwilling the fat parent was, she had no choice but to humble herself. Swallowing her anger, she said, “I’m sorry.” She then slunk away with her fat son.
Qiu Tong raised an eyebrow, confused by this sudden change in attitude.
She was about to thank the man when he turned around. His features were delicate, but his eyes were exceptionally clear. “Hello, I’m Shao An.”
He saluted Qiu Tong and said respectfully, “Thank you very much for saving our commander.”
Commander?
Qiu Tong frowned, suddenly recalling the gunfight that day. So the man she had saved that day was a military officer?
She turned and replied calmly, “It was nothing.”
However, Shao An was exceptionally insistent. He handed her a card as a thank-you gift. “This is just a small token. Please accept it.”
Qiu Tong accepted the card and turned to leave. “We’re even then.”
Gunfights and the military. Qiu Tong vaguely felt that the other party’s status was very troublesome. She had three little kids with her and did not want to be entangled with the other party’s affairs.
One card in exchange for his life. Just take it that he had the better end of the deal.
“Wait.”
Shao An stopped her. A hint of sincerity appeared on his delicate face. “Our boss wants to thank you personally. Please come with me.”
Qiu Tong stopped in her tracks and raised her eyebrows. “No need. If he really wanted to thank me, why didn’t he come over himself?”
Shao An stepped forward, his tone somewhat urgent.
“Please don’t misunderstand. Our boss’ identity is rather special. He can’t appear in public so easily…”
“Then there’s even less reason for me to see him.”
Qiu Tong’s tone was cold and it was obvious that she wanted to draw a clear line between them. “I’m just an ordinary person. I don’t deserve to meet such a big shot.”
Shao An did not expect her to be so guarded. Seeing that Qiu Tong insisted on leaving, his expression changed slightly. His right hand subconsciously touched the gun at his waist. He planned to stop her using force.
“Let her go.”
A low and deep command came from the earpiece. Shao An’s expression changed, and he immediately stood where he was, replying softly, “Yes.”
Qiu Tong’s guard relaxed when she left the kindergarten and saw that the strange man did not follow her.
She could not be blamed for being paranoid. It was just that the person who was secretly targeting her children had not surfaced yet. She did not dare to let her guard down against anyone.
After confirming that there was no danger, she squatted down and looked at the three children seriously. “You three stay at home obediently. I need to go out for a while.”
The three brats nodded and watched Qiu Tong leave. Qiu Xingqiao moved closer to Qiu Xingyuan. “Why has this woman changed so much?”
And became so mysterious.
Qiu Xingyuan did not say anything. Qiu Xingyu hugged the doll that Qiu Tong had won for her and pouted as she said softly, “I prefer my current mommy.”
After settling the kids at home, Qiu Tong found a nearby underground market.
She was alone and unarmed. It would be difficult for her to fight with more than one person at once. If she were to encounter any danger in the future, it would be difficult to ensure the safety of the three children.
Therefore, she needed a weapon to be fully prepared.
“Do you have guns?”
She glanced at the equipment on the counter and asked the boss who was settling the accounts in a low voice. The boss glanced at her and turned to walk in. “Follow me.”
Qiu Tong followed him and realized that there was another world inside.
Rarely-seen guns and prohibited items on the market were like street goods here, lined up in a row.
Qiu Tong’s eyes lit up. She touched the guns lovingly and carefully, before finally selecting a silver pistol.
“This one.”
She handed over the card Shao An had given her earlier. She failed to notice a change in the expression of the originally lukewarm boss.
He sized up the woman in front of him with a bewildered gaze. The boss took the card with both hands and said respectfully, “Please wait a moment.”
Qiu Tong raised an eyebrow in surprise. People in this trade, did they usually provide such good service?

chapters.title: Chapter 24
chapters.content:
Chapter 24: Champion
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
In order to increase the three children’s ability to protect themselves as soon as possible, Qiu Tong gradually increased the intensity of their training over the next few days. The three brats complained incessantly, but they were so tired that they did not even have the strength to cause trouble.
While she was supervising the three naughty brats’ sit-ups, Qiu Tong suddenly received a text message asking her to participate in the second stage of the boxing competition, to be held tomorrow afternoon at the address stated below.
Qiu Tong frowned when she found the place according to the address.
It was a boxing arena hidden in a secluded corner of a street. It was very inconspicuous and there were random advertisements plastered on the signboard. It looked extremely unofficial.
She stepped inside. A passage led underground. Before she had even moved close to the curtain flaps, she could already hear waves of loud cheers and screams.
Hot blood, sweat, and shouts were enough to make anyone’s blood surge.
The boxing arena was a few hundred square meters and filled with spectators. In the middle was a boxing ring that was over a dozen square meters and stained with blood.
“Number 141, match 31.”
An official at the door callously announced her match and number. Qiu Tong located her boxing ring. A short, muscular man in shorts was already standing on it.
She stood hesitantly below the stage. “This boxing ring isn’t a proper one, is it?”
“Proper?”
The opponent sneered. He rested his arms on the rope and narrowed his eyes coldly. “Life and death is up to fate. Scram if you’re afraid!”
Qiu Tong slowly wrapped her hands with the boxing handwraps and went on stage with a worried look on her face. “Will they go back on their word about the $30,000 prize money?”
So she was only worried about the prize money?!
The opponent was speechless. He was offended at being taken lightly by this little woman. He gritted his teeth and said angrily, “We’ll talk about that when you have actually survived this match!”
“Ding!”
The bell rang, and a series of wolf-like cries nearly brought down the roof. It had been a long time since Qiu Tong felt her blood surge like that. Her blood vessels contracted crazily, and her eyes burned with a crazy fighting spirit.
“Little girl, you don’t belong in a place like this!”
The opponent licked his lips and revealed a cold smile. He raised his hand and made a slashing motion at his neck. “Go home!”
Qiu Tong smirked, her eyes calm and expressionless.
She bent her elbows slightly and leaned back, her entire body arching like a cheetah.
“You are just good for show.”
The opponent sneered and threw a punch.
“Swoosh—”
Qiu Tong’s movements were too fast. In the blink of an eye, she appeared behind her opponent. No one could see how she moved. She bent her knees and drew a sharp arc, her knee arcing like an arrow towards her opponent’s waist.
A fatal move!
The man’s pupils constricted violently, and a suffocating feeling of death welled up in his heart. His survival instincts took over and he ducked pathetically to the side, just barely managing to avoid that fatal blow.
The audience was in an uproar. Everyone looked at the stage in shock. A man and a woman, one strong and one weak. The stark contrast was completely reversed by Qiu Tong’s astonishing strength.
“Qiu Tong! Qiu Tong!”
After a few seconds of silence in the stands, an even louder cry erupted from the stands, gradually forming waves of cheers that engulfed the boxing ring.
The man on the stage had an ugly look on his face. He no longer dared to underestimate Qiu Tong and was on full alert.
He had to end this quickly!
Qiu Tong’s gaze sharpened. She punched quickly, accurately and ruthlessly. Her punches landed heavily on the man’s face, causing him to spit out blood and retreat hastily.
She bent her knees and jumped. In the boxing ring, she was like a fighting machine, blocking the man’s escape route. Her long arms reached out and grabbed the man’s arm. Her petite figure bent over as twisted her feet around.
“Crash!”
The sound of his body landing heavily on the cement ground rang out loud. One could also hear the sound of bone breaking.
The arrogant and despotic man was lying on the ground like a pile of dirt. The coldness in Qiu Tong’s eyes faded and she smiled faintly.
“I’m sorry, it has been too long since I last fought, so I haven’t figured out how to adjust my strength.”
The cheers and screams in the stands were deafening. Qiu Tong frowned and sat calmly on the stage, waiting for the next round.
No one dared to look down on her, the only woman. Qiu Tong’s speed was too fast, and her movements tricky. Her figure was slender and agile, and she ended every match as fast as she could.
“The champion is—Qiu Tong!”
As the referee blew the whistle, Qiu Tong breathed heavily and her eyes lit up. $30,000!
In a hidden private room in the corner of the second floor, a sharp eagle-like gaze locked onto Qiu Tong’s slender figure. Jin Yang’s thin lips curled up slightly.
No wonder she dared to save him that time. It turned out that this woman was extremely skilled.
Qiu Tong was about to leave after receiving the prize money when the organizer stopped her.
“Qiu Tong, there’s an additional segment. Do you want to participate?”
Qiu Tong paused. The organizer tactfully added, “If you participate, you can win another $30,000!”
Another $30,000?!
Bring it on!
Qiu Tong nodded without hesitation. When she stood on the boxing ring, she realized that the organizer was holding a cheetah!

chapters.title: Chapter 25
chapters.content:
Chapter 25: Fighting For Your Life
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
This was the so-called additional segment?!
They locked living humans and cheetahs in cages and watched humans fight for their lives against the cheetahs’ crazed attacks. Just for the sake of entertainment?
Indeed, only the rich could come up with such a perverse thing.
Qiu Tong clenched her fists, her eyes turning cold.
Seeing that the person participating in the additional segment was a woman, an abnormally intense jeering and whistling immediately sounded from the crowd.
“You still have a chance to back out now.”
The organizer noticed that Qiu Tong’s expression was not quite right. Although she was very powerful, she was still a woman and she was facing a ferocious beast without any conscience or rationality. As a result, the organizer could not help but feel a bit of compassion for her. “I will still transfer you the initial $30,000.”
Qiu Tong’s eyes flickered and she slowly tightened her handwraps. “No need.”
She had specially analyzed the rules of the additional segment. Apart from the final reward of $30,000, she could also receive tips from the rich people in the audience.
And those tips usually started from $2,000. One could get as much as $10,000 in tips in a match.
“I can…”
Just as she was about to agree, a staff member rushed over and whispered something into the organizer’s ear.
The organizer’s expression changed. He gave Qiu Tong a meaningful look before putting on a business-like smile.
“Miss Qiu, the guest in Private Room Eight is willing to pay $150,000 for your participation in the additional segment.”
Private Room Eight?
Qiu Tong looked up at the second floor, but the glass in the room was too opaque for her to see anything.
Who would spend $150,000 on her?
Qiu Tong found it a little strange and felt rather wary of the situation. She pursed her lips and refused coldly. “I don’t know the guest in Private Room Eight. I don’t need his money.”
Regardless of what the other party’s motive was, Qiu Tong did not want to owe him a favor. She took off her jacket and revealed her lean, strong body, before stepping into the boxing ring without hesitation.
“Rumble—”
Waves of heat surged towards her. Before Qiu Tong could get used to it, a hoarse and irritable growl came from behind her.
A pair of dark golden eyes locked onto her.
The two-meter long and half-human-height cheetah was released from the cage, and its deep roar instantly silenced the entire crowd. Everyone held their breaths, not daring to look away, afraid that Qiu Tong would be splattered with blood in the next instant.
“Roar!”
The beastly roar that was filled with killing intent and threat faded away. A dark golden streak shot straight at Qiu Tong, as a foul-smelling hot air blew over.
Qiu Tong reacted quickly. She leaned back her upper body as the cheetah jumped over her. Its paws landed on the ground, and in the blink of an eye, it turned to try and bite Qiu Tong again.
It was too fast!
Qiu Tong rolled to the ground in a sorry state and threw a punch. Suddenly, there was a sharp flash and a tearing sound. Her arm was slashed by a sharp claw and blood gushed out.
Stimulated by the smell of blood, the cheetah’s attack became even more frenzy.
Qiu Tong gritted her teeth and leaped upwards. She somersaulted and landed on the back of the cheetah.
“Roar!”
Sensing that there was someone on its back, the cheetah went mad. It sped around the boxing ring, slamming into the sides with all its might. Qiu Tong gritted her teeth and grabbed onto the short hairs on the cheetah’s neck as she quickly thought of a solution.
No one expected Qiu Tong to last so long with the cheetah!
The audience was about to explode. Everyone stood up, their eyes shining with excitement as they screamed like crazy.
Qiu Tong no longer had the energy to pay attention to what was happening below the ring. She clung onto the cheetah’s neck with all her strength. Suddenly, she was flung against a pillar beside the boxing ring.
“Ah!”
Screams of fear and excitement rang out. Everyone could not help but widen their eyes as they saw the bright yellow beast charging straight at Qiu Tong, who had fallen to the ground.
Qiu Tong pursed her lips and her pupils constricted. The cheetah’s gaping jaws gradually magnified before her eyes.
“Click—”
In Private Room Eight on the second floor, Jin Yang’s eyes were cold.. He expressionlessly unlocked the safety catch and aimed the black gun at the cheetah.

chapters.title: Chapter 26
chapters.content:
Chapter 26: Human Modification Plan
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
She only had one chance to fight for her life now!
Qiu Tong’s gaze sharpened. Just as the cheetah was about to pounce on her, she lifted her leg and kicked the cheetah’s chin. Pushing off the ground with one hand, she twisted her nimble and slender waist, before straightening her body and leaping onto the cheetah’s neck!
She had escaped from the jaws of death!
Everyone’s hearts nearly stopped at her move. The screams from the stands were loud enough to shatter glass. Money bills were tossed at her like snowflakes.
Qiu Tong was not in the mood to look. All her attention was on the raging cheetah, and her injured wrist was gradually losing strength.
She could not delay any longer.
Her slender legs flew forward and clamped down on the cheetah’s neck like a pair of scissors. With a violent and arrogant howl, she exerted force on her legs, and the sound of bones breaking was especially clear.
The cheetah slowly crumbled to the ground. Its dark golden body lay motionless on the floor.
Qiu Tong stood up, panting. Her face and body were soaked with blood. She had a wild and exciting beauty that pierced the eyes of the crowd.
“Qiu Tong! Qiu Tong!”
Waves of cheers erupted from the stands, and everyone’s faces turned red as they shouted crazily. They had personally witnessed the birth of a miracle. Qiu Tong had really defeated the cheetah and won the additional segment!
In Private Room Eight on the second floor, Jin Yang’s eyes shone brightly.
“Invite her here.”
His low and deep voice was filled with admiration. He turned his head and ordered Shao An to invite Qiu Tong over, but Shao An had his own concerns.
“Mr. President, I’m not sure about Qiu Tong’s background. She’s just a single mother, yet she’s so skilled. I’m afraid her background might be complicated.”
“Furthermore, her appearance during the attack was too coincidental. I suspect that someone was behind it.”
“With your special status, it’s best not to meet civilians in private.”
“Are you done?”
Jin Yang narrowed his eyes slowly, his expression unchanged as he said indifferently, “Bring her up.”
“Mr. President!”
Shao An’s tone was a little anxious. Their expedition this time had been a trap all along. It was an opportunity deliberately created for the terrorists to try and assassinate the president, so that they could catch the mastermind behind everything.
But if Jin Yang summoned Qiu Tong on impulse, it might alert the enemy.
Jin Yang glanced at him coldly and Shao An instantly fell silent. He lowered his head with a dark expression and resigned himself to his fate as he went out to get Qiu Tong.
Apart from the $30,000 prize money as the grand champion of the boxing matches, there was also the $30,000 for the additional segment, as well as tips from the audience. All in all, she had received a total of about $100,000 in cash.
Satisfied, Qiu Tong signed her name and prepared to leave with the money.
“Miss Qiu.”
Shao An, whom she had met at the kindergarten, suddenly appeared beside her and looked at her expressionlessly. “Our Boss wants to thank you in person.”
Qiu Tong raised an eyebrow. “No need. I’ve already received my money. We’re even.”
Shao An stood in front of her with abnormal persistence. His gaze was especially stubborn. “Our Boss only wants to meet you. Please come with me.”
Seeing that the other party was so persistent in wanting to see her, Qiu Tong frowned. She could vaguely feel that she had piqued the interest of a very troublesome character.
In order to quickly draw a clear line with the other party, Qiu Tong gestured for Shao An to lead the way. When they reached the second floor, she realized that they were the guests in Private Room Eight!
“Hello, Miss Qiu. My name is Song Yan.”
In the private room, Jin Yang was wearing a black windbreaker. His facial features were deep and reserved. He had sharp eyebrows and bright eyes. His light-colored eyes appeared amiable, but they were actually filled with keen sharpness. From time to time, they would flash with a harsh glint.
He had purposely used his younger brother’s name.
“Hi.”
While Qiu Tong was sizing up Jin Yang, he was also sizing her up. He saw that Qiu Tong was unexpectedly thin and weak.
There was actually such a huge amount of energy hidden in such a slender and frail body. Jin Yang quietly raised his eyebrows and became more interested in Qiu Tong.
Jin Yang glanced at the wound on Qiu Tong’s forehead and a dark glint flashed across his eyes.
Previously, the fatal wound on his chest had unexpectedly healed without any treatment. After eliminating several other suspects, Jin Yang cast his suspicious gaze towards Qiu Tong now.
Could this woman have healing powers?
He had always known that the parliament was secretly implementing a human modification plan, but this plan was a highly-classified secret of the government and could not be divulged to the outside world. Only high-ranking personnel knew of it. Moreover, as far as he knew, none of the human modification experiments had been successful, and none of the subjects had been released.
Was Qiu Tong a modified human?
“Miss Qiu, it’s all thanks to you that my injuries from the previous incident recovered so quickly.”
Jin Yang nonchalantly tried to probe her. “Your injuries are so serious this time, I’m afraid you need to rest well.”
Qiu Tong touched her forehead. She was very guarded and did not use her supernatural power to heal herself. She just nodded casually. “Yes, just doing what’s necessary to survive.”
She narrowed her eyes and looked at Jin Yang with a thoughtful look. “Mr. Song, where are you from? Have we met before?”
Qiu Tong rubbed her chin thoughtfully. “Why do I find you so familiar?”

chapters.title: Chapter 27
chapters.content:
Chapter 27: Enemy Attack
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Shao An was shocked and instinctively stood in front of Jin Yang, his left hand on the gun handle at his waist.
Jin Yang held him back calmly and said with a faint smile, “Maybe my looks are rather common.”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and scanned his features before shaking her head silently.
“I think you look a little like my three kids.”
She asked in a serious tone, “Mr. Song, is it possible that you had three children while you were out sowing your wild oats?”
Shao An coughed violently, looking at Qiu Tong with fear and unease, as if she had said something outrageous.
Jin Yang didn’t expect her to be like all those other women, trying to link themselves to him. His eyes narrowed and his expression gradually turned cold.
“No. You got the wrong guy.”
The change in his attitude was too obvious. Qiu Tong was slightly stunned. She immediately understood the key point and could not help but laugh.
“Mr. Song, please don’t misunderstand. I don’t have ulterior motives.”
She really felt that the children looked a little like him.
When Qiu Tong smiled, the corners of her eyes would scrunch up, inadvertently revealing the innocence of a young girl.
Jin Yang frowned. There seemed to be someone in his memory who smiled like that…
It should be someone he was very familiar with, but no matter how Jin Yang tried to recall, he could not recall that person’s appearance or name.
“Ah!”
A piercing pain like an electric shock struck his brain and blocked his memories. Jin Yang trembled in pain and Shao An immediately rushed over anxiously.
“Sir, are you all right?”
He shielded Jin Yang behind him, before pulling out his gun and aiming it at Qiu Tong. He interrogated her harshly, “What did you do to him?!”
Qiu Tong raised her hands innocently to show that she was not aggressive. “I didn’t do anything.”
“Shao An, stop!”
Jin Yang gritted his teeth as he endured the pain with great difficulty. Panting slightly, his face had turned pale.
“I’m sorry, Miss Qiu. Shao An was too impulsive. Please don’t mind him.”
Qiu Tong didn’t take it to heart and was about to find an excuse to leave when she heard Jin Yang continue, “I also think Miss Qiu looks a little familiar. I think I’ve seen her somewhere before.”
Qiu Tong gave a self-deprecating smile. “How could someone like Mr. Song know me?”
“I’m just the daughter of a financial fraud and I am burdened with three kids. Maybe I really got the wrong person.”
Jin Yang’s heart stirred. “Your father is?”
“Qiu Rong.”
Qiu Tong replied in a mild tone. Jin Yang quickly ran through his mind and realized that he indeed did not know anyone called Qiu Rong.
It seemed that Qiu Tong was really not an experimental subject in the human modification plan.
Jin Yang frowned slightly and was about to ask Shao An to send her back when suddenly, there was a gunshot and the glass surrounding the private room shattered.
“Enemy attack!”
Shao An immediately stood by Jin Yang’s side, protecting him. His eyes turned cold and he shouted angrily, “Sir, you leave first. I’ll cover your retreat!”
“Ah!”
The boxing ring outside had been completely taken over by the terrorists. Everyone was covering their heads and scurrying away like rats. It was chaos.
Qiu Tong noticed that the people outside seemed to be divided into two groups. One group was obviously here for Mr. Song, while the other group was surrounding the terrorists with weapons.
Could they be Mr. Song’s men?
Before Qiu Tong could figure out what was going on, a gust of wind blew toward her and she threw herself to the side. The bullet whizzed past her ear and shattered the vase behind her.
She might die for no reason if she were to continue staying here!
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and took out the pistol that she had spent a lot of money on. With a sharp look in her eyes, she rushed out of the bar counter and shot at several people.
Her movements quickly attracted the attention of the terrorists. Four or five people surrounded her with ugly expressions. Qiu Tong gritted her teeth as she reloaded.
“Bang! Bang!”
Bullets had no eyes. Qiu Tong pushed the table beside her to protect herself as she moved towards the exit.
“Miss Qiu!”
Shao An appeared out of nowhere, followed by the stern-looking Jin Yang.
The other party directly pushed Jin Yang to Qiu Tong’s side. Shao An’s expression was solemn and murderous. “I’ll hold them back. You take Boss and leave through the side door first!”
Qiu Tong did not want to be implicated in this, but Shao An had already run away.
Gritting her teeth, Qiu Tong pulled Jin Yang and rushed out of the side door!
Qiu Tong’s luck was heaven-defying. The moment they rushed out, they saw a heavy-duty motorcycle parked right in front of them.
Without any hesitation, she leaped up and swiftly got on. “Come on!”
Tossing a helmet at Jin Yang, Qiu Tong was propping herself up on the motorcycle with one leg. Her leg was long and shapely, and she looked very dashing.
Jin Yang couldn’t resist admiring the sight for a few seconds.
Noticing that he was not moving, Qiu Tong pushed her hair back and looked at him. “You know how to ride a motorcycle, right?”

chapters.title: Chapter 28
chapters.content:
Chapter 28: Safe Escape
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Jin Yang was silent for a moment. “…yes.”
He quickly sat behind Qiu Tong and hugged her slender waist awkwardly.
With such a slim waist, she really did not look like a woman who had three children.
Some strange thoughts barged into Jin Yang’s mind, and he forced those ridiculous thoughts out. A loud roaring noise rang out followed by the screeching sound of brakes. They shot forward like arrows.
The terrorists who were following closely behind also caught up. Qiu Tong bent over slightly, her entire body like a falcon, but also like a cheetah prowling the city. The roar of the heavy motorcycle echoed through the streets, finally shaking off the terrorists.
“Done.”
She parked the car on an empty street and took off her helmet. Her messy hair fell across her forehead. The wildness radiating off her body was captivating. “There shouldn’t be anyone chasing after us.”
“Thank you. You saved me again.”
Curling his lips, Jin Yang did not try to hide the admiration in his eyes. “How can I repay you?”
Qiu Tong fiddled with the helmet and glanced at him casually. “No need. Your subordinate already gave me a lot of money. The amount is enough for me to save you twice. No need to repay me further.”
The other party’s status was obviously very mysterious. They had only met twice, and he was still being pursued.
Qiu Tong was unwilling to have anything to do with such a troublesome character.
Jin Yang did not expect such an answer. The warmth and affection in his heart was instantly extinguished as if doused by a basin of cold water.
Qiu Tong’s heartbeat quickened when she saw the time on her watch.
Oh no, the three brats were almost done with school!
Hurriedly leaving the motorcycle and helmet behind, she ran off, turning her head to shout at Jin Yang, “Stay here and don’t move. Shao An will come looking for you soon!”
“I have something urgent to attend to, I’ll make a move first.”
With that, she flagged down a taxi by the roadside and hurried towards the kindergarten.
Watching her hasty departure, Jin Yang felt both exasperated and amused.
Shao An only gave her a little money, but it was enough for her to save him twice?
Was his life so worthless?
“Sir!”
Shao An, who had successfully quelled the chaos, rushed over with his men. After discovering that Jin Yang was safe and sound, he finally heaved a huge sigh of relief.
Jin Yang nodded at him and his tone returned to normal. “How’s the situation?”
“The terrorists have been successfully subdued and the leader behind them has been captured.”
Jin Yang was quite satisfied with Shao An’s report. He indicated for Shao An to send those people back to the capital directly.
“Send them to the capital and punish them according to the law.”
Shao An lowered his head, indicating his acknowledgment of the order. He looked at Jin Yang hesitantly. “Sir, Qiu Tong didn’t do anything to hurt you, right?”
Jin Yang gave him a strange look and said coldly, “No, why would she want to hurt me?”
Shao An cleared his throat, a hint of doubt appeared in his eyes.
“But she didn’t recognize you?!”
Although his Boss had disguised himself as Song Yan, who in the country would fail to recognize the face of the president?
“Is she pretending?”
Jin Yang frowned and thought about it. He felt that it was impossible. Qiu Tong’s attitude towards him was very natural, and the way she treated him was like any ordinary person.
“Sir, should we send someone to follow her?”
Shao An asked in a low voice.
Jin Yang pondered for a moment before decisively rejecting. “Without my orders, no one is allowed to disturb her!”
…
By the time Qiu Tong rushed to the kindergarten, most of the children had already been fetched away.
Only the three brats were left standing at the door carrying their school bags and their heads lowered. They looked rather pitiful.
Qiu Tong’s heart softened and she explained in a gentle voice, “Mommy has something else to attend to. That’s why I’m late.”
“Mother Qiu.”
The kindergarten teacher’s expression was rather grim. She glanced at the three brats and pulled Qiu Tong aside. She whispered, “These three children did not perform well today. They were very unsociable and even tried to skip class midway.”
Fortunately, the kindergarten teacher discovered it in time. Otherwise, the three little brats would have successfully escaped from their “prison”!
“It might be because it’s their first day in kindergarten and they’re still not used to it. Go back and counsel them.”
Seeing Qiu Tong’s dark face, the teacher tried to placate her and told her to find a chance to have a good talk with the children.
Qiu Tong gritted her teeth. These brats!
What kind of danger would they have faced if they had left the kindergarten?
Suppressing the anger in her heart, Qiu Tong apologized to the teacher and led the three troublesome children back in a huff.
The boys walked behind nonchalantly, but Little Yu’s eyes were filled with worry.
She whispered to her brothers, “Mommy is angry.”

chapters.title: Chapter 29
chapters.content:
Chapter 29: Relying On Yourself
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“So what if she’s angry.”
Qiu Xingqiao put on a brave front but was also worried inside. A trace of apprehension flashed across his eyes, but he still said stubbornly, “At most, she’ll sell us again. It’s not like she hasn’t done it before!”
Qiu Xingyuan only silently patted Qiu Xingyu’s head and comforted her. “This has nothing to do with you. Your Second Brother and I will bear the responsibility.”
These three children were quite loyal to each other.
Qiu Tong was so angry that she actually felt like laughing. As soon as she got home, she demanded, “Tell me, why did you skip class?!”
“Those other children are childish and annoying. Who wants to be with them?”
Qiu Xingqiao had a look of disdain, while Qiu Xingyuan put on a wooden expression and said indifferently, “I don’t want to attend kindergarten.”
“Do you think you can refuse to go just because you don’t want to?!”
Qiu Tong raised her voice, feeling even angrier. “Explain yourself, or none of you will escape my wrath!”
“No reason!”
Qiu Xingqiao glared back at her angrily. “Beat us if you want. We’re not going to kindergarten!”
He raised his head and closed his eyes tightly, looking like he was ready to grin and bear it, to let Qiu Tong scold and beat him.
However, his eyelashes were trembling violently. He was not as firm as he sounded.
Qiu TTong’s heart softened again. She dragged the two kids to the balcony and made them stand there in the horse stance as punishment. They were not allowed to come in for dinner unless they admitted they were in the wrong.
Qiu Xingyu leaned on the glass door and looked at her two brothers whose legs were trembling from the effort of maintaining the horse stance. With a sad face, she walked over to Qiu Tong.
“Mommy, can you not be angry? My brothers didn’t do it on purpose. It’s all because those children were too overbearing. They said that we don’t have a father and refused to play with us. They even bullied me. That’s why my brothers brought me away.”
Qiu Tong was stunned. She did not expect the real reason to be this.
At the thought of the three children being ostracized in the kindergarten and then being immediately reprimanded by her when they returned, Qiu Tong felt rather dismayed and asked Qiu Xingyu to call Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao in.
Qiu Xingyuan was still expressionless, but Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes were red as he glared at Qiu Tong angrily.
Qiu Tong was amused, but she kept a straight face. “Let’s eat.”
In order to make up for the grievances suffered by the children, she specially cooked two more dishes that Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao liked to eat, filling the entire table.
Ignoring the children, Qiu Tong sat down and began digging in.
Compared to her, the three children’s table manners could be considered elegant.
“You look like you’ve been starving for years. Even beggars have better table manners than you.”
Qiu Xingqiao looked disgusted.
Qiu Tong looked up at him and said nonchalantly.
“What’s the point of having good table manners? There’s no food on the table at all in a post-apocalyptic world. Who would care about table manners then?”
She lifted her chin and gestured at the three children’s full bowls. Her tone was full of threat. “Finish your food. Don’t leave a single grain behind.”
“You’re not allowed to be picky. Eat more!”
She ordered the three children to eat quickly, and the three children were rather disdainful of her post-apocalyptic theory, thinking that it was just her crazy talk.
The sky had just turned dark. Qiu Tong cleared her throat and stopped the boys, who were about to return to their bedroom. She said seriously, “Before we sleep, I’ll tell you a bedtime story.”
“A little snail asked his mother why he had to carry a hard and heavy shell from birth? Why don’t his friends, the caterpillar and earthworm have shells?”
“His mother told him that the caterpillar would become a butterfly and be protected by the sky; while the earthworm would be protected by the earth. Meanwhile, the snail would be protected by no one. The little snail was very sad to hear this, and felt sorry for himself, for no one could protect him.”
“But Mother Snail explained that this is why we carry the heavy shell—we can rely on ourselves!”
The story was short, and Qiu Tong did not know if the three children understood her. Qiu Xingyu was the first to pounce on her and plant a big kiss on her face.
“Mommy, I understand now. Although we don’t have a father and can only carry the heavy shell of our lives, this heavy shell will also make us stronger. We can rely on ourselves!”
Qiu Tong was very pleased by their intelligence.
The boys also looked more happy now. The gloominess between their brows dissipated.
When Qiu Tong said goodnight to them, Qiu Xingqiao replied awkwardly. Qiu Xingyuan, on the other hand, took a long, meaningful look at Qiu Tong. It was rare that there was no coldness or suspicion in his eyes.
…
With money, Qiu Tong finally began to decorate her new home.
However, she did not expect that an uninvited guest would come knocking first.
“Qiu Tong.”
Yu Ge, who had been standing downstairs, saw the four of them from afar and immediately came up to them. He enthusiastically wanted to help Qiu Tong carry her bags.. “Why didn’t you tell me you moved? I’ve been looking for you for so long.”

chapters.title: Chapter 30
chapters.content:
Chapter 30: Change
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“What are you doing here?”
Qiu Tong pulled the children to the side and glared at Yu Ge warily. Yu Ge’s eyes flashed with anger, but he quickly suppressed it.
“I’m your boyfriend. Isn’t it normal for me to look for you?”
He looked at Qiu Tong affectionately and reached out to hug her. “Are you still angry with me? I was just too anxious. I just want the two of us to be together sooner.”
“If you can’t bear to part with these three children, we can also not send them away. I can treat them as my own children and raise them together.”
Qiu Tong found Yu Ge’s wishful thinking laughable.
“Who wants to raise them with you?”
She narrowed her eyes coldly and glared at Yu Ge warningly. “We have already broken up, so please get lost!”
“Do you think you can break up with me just like that? Did you ask for my permission?”
Yu Ge quietly gritted his teeth as he sized up Qiu Tong and the three children impassively. He noticed that their clothes were neat and their skin was fair and tender. It was obvious that they were living well.
Damn it, Qiu Tong didn’t tell him that she had money!
Yu Ge felt deep regret. If he had known earlier, he would not have fallen out with Qiu Tong so early. He would have made the woman spit up all her money before dumping her!
He shamelessly moved forward to hold Qiu Tong’s hand. “Qiu Tong, my feelings for you are sincere. Let’s start again, okay?”
He even took out his identity card and tried to prove his sincerity. “Haven’t you always wanted to marry me? Look, I even brought my identity card!”
“We will go to the Civil Affairs Bureau to register our marriage now!”
Yu Ge stole a glance at Qiu Tong’s face and saw that she was expressionless. He couldn’t resist adding boldly, “However, I don’t have a place to stay yet. Since we will get married sooner or later, can my name be added to the property deed?”
So he was after the house.
Qiu Tong raised an eyebrow and reached out to take his identity card.
Yu Ge thought that she had changed her mind and his eyes lit up with joy. The three children also widened their eyes nervously.
Looking at the picture on the identity card, Qiu Tong sneered and suddenly kept it.
“Qiu Tong, what do you mean by that?”
Yu Ge did not understand, but he saw Qiu Tong staring at him coldly.
“Yu Ge, even if you think of yourself as trash, I am not a trash recycling station.”
“I’ll keep your identity card for the time being. I was young and ignorant in the past when I lent you $15,000. I’ll return your card when you give me back my money!”
When did she lend him $15,000? She was clearly the one who willingly gave the money to him!
Yu Ge’s face alternated between green and white. With a twisted face, he lunged at Qiu Tong. “Give me back my identity card!”
Three small figures suddenly appeared from the side. Qiu Xingqiao lifted his leg and kicked Yu Ge’s knee hard. Qiu Xingyu picked up a rock and threw it at him. Qiu Xingyuan took out the medicinal powder that he had not used up the last time and sprinkled it on Yu Ge’s face again.
The familiar itchy rashes spread crazily once again. Yu Ge finally knew that the culprit who had caused him to be so miserable last time was actually the children. His eyes immediately turned fierce.
“Just you wait! I won’t let you off!”
After he said that, the itch on his face became worse. He did not dare to stay any longer and ran away without looking back.
“Coward.”
Qiu Tong snorted in disdain. How dare this kind of person try to snatch her children?
She turned around and found that the three children were staring at her strangely.
She raised her eyebrows in confusion. “Why are you looking at me like that?”
“Mommy, don’t you like him anymore?”
Qiu Xingyu asked carefully. They remembered that their mother had beaten and scolded them many times for that man.
“He hurt you all. How can I still like him?”
These simple words made the three children’s hearts tremble.
Qiu Tong had been obsessed with Yu Ge because of her own sad life. They knew how crazy and determined Qiu Tong was, but they did not expect her to abandon Yu Ge for them.
Had Qiu Tong really changed?
The three children returned home in silence. Qiu Tong was in high spirits as she instructed them to decorate the house. The atmosphere was rather harmonious.
Soon, the home appliances Qiu Tong ordered online arrived.
Looking at the electrical appliances piled up in the living room, the three children studied the instruction manuals helplessly.
Their standard of living in the past was too dismal. They had never come into contact with such high-tech appliances. Even Qiu Xingyuan, who had the highest IQ, was helpless.
“Brother, would she regret things now and go back to that man for help?”
Qiu Xingqiao looked at Qiu Tong, who was squatting on the ground and fiddling with the electrical appliances. A deep suspicion flashed across his eyes. Apart from asking Yu Ge for help, he really did not know who else Qiu Tong could get to assemble the appliances.
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his lips and lowered his eyes. “She can look for whoever she wants.”
However, the three brats were soon shocked to see Qiu Tong successfully assembling all the appliances and connecting them to the electrical system.
“Come here!”
Qiu Tong clapped her hands gleefully and looked at the big color television that she had carefully selected. She planned to let the three children watch TV together to relax.
Just as she switched on the television, a familiar face suddenly appeared.

chapters.title: Chapter 31
chapters.content:
Chapter 31: Locust Plague
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Wasn’t that Song Yan?!
Qiu Tong widened her eyes in shock, but what the news reported shocked her even more.
The man she had saved was the president of this country?!
When she transmigrated here, she did not have any memories of the former owner of the body at all. She only had a vague understanding of this world.
Qiu Tong logged on to the internet and entered the word “President.” Immediately, a large amount of information and favorable commentaries on the president popped up on the front page. The person in the photo was Song Yan.
However, the strange thing was that the name of the president on the internet was clearly Jin Yang.
Then who was Song Yan?
Qiu Tong entered Song Yan’s name and found that they were actually half-brothers.
She narrowed her eyes and compared the two photos. She realized that Song Yan and Jinyang were very similar. She continued to look through the information, but the description of the president’s civil conflict was extremely complicated and obscure. It took a lot of effort before she managed to sort out the connections.
Although Song Yan and Jin Yang were brothers, the two of them were at odds with each other in every aspect, be it political standing, world view, personality, methods and so on.
Could the previous two assassinations be arranged by Jin Yang to deal with Song Yan?
Otherwise, who would dare to assassinate the president’s brother?!
Qiu Tong vaguely felt that she had witnessed some unspeakable secret. She immediately closed all the webpages and forced herself to forget all her surmisations.
Her only thought at the moment was to raise the three brats safely and make sure they didn’t go astray. These political struggles had nothing to do with her, and it wasn’t as if she, a commoner, could interfere at will.
After purchasing and decorating the house, Qiu Tong still had more than $10,000 in cash.
However, the theory of the time value of money meant that cash in hand would only depreciate over time. Anyway, there would come the day when everything would be spent.
She had to think of a way to maximize the funds at hand. Only then would she be able to continuously create new wealth!
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes as a thought flashed through her mind.
She remembered that in the original timeline, there would be a major locust plague happening this year, causing the production of food to decrease sharply and the demand to increase substantially, creating a food shortage.
If she took this opportunity to stock up on some food and sell it later, wouldn’t she earn a lot?!
Qiu Tong’s eyes lit up. After finding the right business opportunity, she immediately brought the three children to the food market.
