The three children were already immune to her sudden actions now. Although they did not understand why Qiu Tong suddenly wanted to stock up on food in such large quantities, she was the one earning the money, so they had no reason to question her.
Qiu Xingqiao yawned lazily as he watched Qiu Tong haggle with others.
“Is she possessed by a ghost again? Can she finish so much food?”
Qiu Xingqiao suddenly halted. He thought of Qiu Tong’s usual eating habits and hesitated.
Actually, she might really be able to finish everything…
Qiu Xingyuan held onto Qiu Xingyu and did not speak. He was also clutching a chemistry book.
Qiu Xingqiao shifted his gaze away uninterestedly. Suddenly, he noticed a large group of people gathered not far away. He immediately rushed over to watch the commotion in excitement.
He had just taken a step when he collided with a little girl.
“Ah!”
Her terrified cries were filled with pain and dismay. Ignoring the wound on her knee, the little girl desperately tried to pick up the grains scattered on the ground with her skinny hands. “My grains, my grains!”
Large drops of tears fell onto the ground. Qiu Xingqiao was a little embarrassed. He squatted down and apologized softly, “I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to.”
The other party did not seem to have heard her. She just continued to pick up her grains from the ground in a frenzy. Seeing that some grains had landed in the middle of the road, she rushed over without thinking.
“Be careful!”
Qiu Xingqiao’s pupils constricted violently as he instantly charged forward to push her out of harm’s way. They tumbled off the road together.
A large truck whizzed past them. The draft created by the passing vehicle made them break out in cold sweat.
“Qiu Xingqiao!”
Qiu Tong, who had noticed the commotion, was scared out of her wits. She put everything down and immediately rushed over. “Are you alright?”
Qiu Xingqiao shook his head silently. He immediately looked at the little girl who was in a frightened daze and said angrily, “How could you charge around like that? It’s so dangerous!”
But the little girl turned a deaf ear to Qiu Xingqiao’s reprimand. She stared straight at the grains that had been crushed by the truck. Her eyes turned red as she squatted on the ground and wailed incessantly.
Qiu Xingqiao was shocked by her crying and instinctively looked to Qiu Tong for help. “I didn’t bully her!”
Qiu Tong patted Qiu Xingqiao’s head comfortingly. She squatted down and asked the little girl in a gentle tone, “What’s wrong? If you have any problems, you can tell us.. We can help you.”

chapters.title: Chapter 32
chapters.content:
Chapter 32: Locust Pesticide
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Xingyuan also brought Qiu Xingyu over.The little girl’s mood became much better on seeing more people of the same age as her, but her face was still filled with sadness.
“That was my family’s last bit of food.”
The little girl sobbed as she spoke. Her family’s harvest today wasn’t good. They didn’t manage to harvest much grain over the whole year either. Nevertheless, they relied on selling their small harvest for a bit of money. But now that the grains were dirty, even their last hope was gone.
She was very petite, and her arms were so thin that one could almost feel her bones. Judging from her appearance, she was about the same age as Little Yu, but she was much burdened by hardship.
Qiu Tong’s heart softened. Looking at the crushed grains, she asked, “How much did you plan to sell it for?”
“$1.”
The little girl bit her lips and said timidly. Seeing that Qiu Tong seemed to want to buy it, her big eyes were filled with anticipation.
However, Qiu Tong shook her head.
The light in the little girl’s eyes extinguished. But then Qiu Tong said, “I went to check the market price just now. The market price for grains is about $2. I’ll give you $3.”
She took the remaining grains from the little girl’s hand and smiled. “I’ll buy the rest.”
“Really?”
The little girl was overjoyed and immediately bowed to Qiu Tong. “Thank you! Thank you!”
After handing the money to the little girl, Qiu Tong looked at the bustling food market and fell into silence.
The people who came to sell food in the market were more or less all hardworking people who had labored hard for a year. They had worked so hard for a year in return for just a tiny bit of hope. Meanwhile, the merchants and customers who came to buy food kept trying to depress their prices.
Some people could not even afford to eat the rice they planted themselves, so they carried their entire harvest over to sell them in exchange for a meager income.
If she only cared about storing food for herself and did not care about the lives of these people, when the famine came, the first people to collapse would be these hardworking people struggling on the poverty line.
By then, who knew how many people would starve to death in that famine.
If Qiu Tong were to make money from their sweat and blood, she would never be able to live with her conscience.
But how to avoid this tragedy?
Qiu Tong frowned. As she walked, she suddenly bumped into a little fellow.
Looking down, she saw Qiu Xingyuan looking at her expressionlessly with a chemistry book in his hand.
In that instant, Qiu Tong’s eyes lit up.
Yes, she still had Qiu Xingyuan!
Qiu Tong shared her thoughts.
“…You want me to develop a pesticide to kill locusts?”
After hearing her words, Qiu Xingyuan frowned slightly, not understanding what Qiu Tong was up to. “There aren’t many locusts now.”
Qiu Tong blabbered nonsense and tried her best to persuade him. “The temperature and humidity is suitable now for locusts to reproduce in large numbers. If a locust plague breaks out, this kind of locust pesticide will come in handy very soon. Not only will we be able to avoid a locust plague, we can also make a huge profit!”
“No way!”
Qiu Xingyuan flat-out rejected. He felt that Qiu Tong’s worries were groundless. “There hasn’t been a locust plague for more than 10 years. How could it suddenly happen?”
“Just because it hasn’t happened in over 10 years doesn’t mean it won’t happen.”
Seeing that Qiu Xingyuan still did not believe her, Qiu Tong had no other choice but to claim. “Actually, I can communicate with spirits. I already foresee a locust plague will happen not long from now.”
Qiu Xingyuan looked at her coldly as if he was looking at a fool.
Qiu Tong suppressed her frustration. An idea popped up in her head. “I can prove it!”
She mumbled to herself as she rubbed her fingers. After a while, she opened her eyes and looked at Qiu Xingyuan mysteriously.
“I’ve calculated it. You’ve been developing a drug that can alleviate the symptoms of people with cardiovascular disease. But you haven’t done any clinical verification yet. You also haven’t found a test subject, right?”
Qiu Xingyuan’s expression suddenly changed.
Qiu Tong was right!
He had just started thinking about this idea and had not told anyone. He did not expect Qiu Tong to know.
This woman really knew how to tell the future?!
Qiu Tong noted the surprise in his eyes. She looked at him with a smile. “So? Are you willing to save the world with me?”
Qiu Xingyuan scoffed lightly, his gaze still doubtful. “Would you be so kind-hearted?”
“People can change.”
In the end, Qiu Xingyuan could not endure Qiu Tong’s nagging and pestering, so he could only agree to give it a try. Qiu Tong transferred a large sum of money to him. “If you lack anything, just buy it. If it’s not enough, I will continue to sponsor you.”
Qiu Xingyuan paused and looked at her deeply. “Do you really believe that I can do it?”
“Apart from you, no one else in this world can develop it.”
Qiu Tong patted his shoulder.
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his lips, not understanding why Qiu Tong was so confident that he could succeed.
However, this feeling of being trusted was not bad.
Qiu Xingyuan originally intended to make a half-hearted attempt just to keep Qiu Tong off his back. But she repeatedly asked about his progress. Annoyed, he had no choice but to go out with a gloomy face to purchase the required materials.
He must be mad to go along with that woman’s crazy scheme.
As he passed by an alley not far from his residence, a figure suddenly blocked his path.

chapters.title: Chapter 33
chapters.content:
Chapter 33: Robbery
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
After Yu Ge was chased away, he was unwilling to give up just like that. He wandered around for a few days, but didn’t see Qiu Tong at all.
He narrowed his eyes and sized up the child who only came up to his lower belly. A dangerous glint flashed across his eyes.
He recognized him. It was this little brat who caused his face and body to itch for several days!
“Where’s Qiu Tong?”
Qiu Xingyuan glared at him warily. His small body retreated a few steps back, trying to find a way to escape.
“She won’t see you!”
“Bullsh*t! If it weren’t for you three brats, Qiu Tong and I wouldn’t have fallen out!”
The more Yu Ge thought about it, the more indignant he became. If these three little brats had disappeared sooner, he would have already gotten Qiu Tong and all her money would have been his!
His gaze fell upon the school bag on Qiu Xingyuan’s back. Yu Ge smirked. “What’s in your bag?”
Qiu Xingyuan suddenly felt uneasy and turned to run.
He had only taken a few steps when someone grabbed his collar roughly and flung him to the side. His bag was also snatched away.
“So much money?”
Yu Ge’s eyes lit up!
Qiu Xingyuan gritted his teeth and pounced over, his little face filled with anger. “Give it back to me!”
Yu Ge kicked him away impatiently. There was a thick wad of cash. There must be at least a few thousand dollars here.
Qiu Tong was indeed rich now if she could give her child so much money!
Yu Ge’s eyes were filled with greed. He stuffed the money into his pocket and warned Qiu Xingyuan fiercely, “If you dare to tell anyone about what happened today, not only will I kill you, I will also kill the other two brats!”
Qiu Xingyuan lowered his eyes coldly and clenched his fists tightly.
It was only when Yu Ge left that he slowly got up from the ground. But all the money had been snatched away.
Qiu Tong’s eager expression appeared in his mind. Qiu Xingyuan pursed his lips even tighter.
Somehow, he didn’t want to disappoint that woman.
He must find a way to come up with that money!
In the evening, at the underground market.
An inconspicuous little figure sneaked into the shooting range and quickly squatted down to stuff the scattered bullet shells into his bag.
Previously when they had lived in slums, there were all sorts of people there. It was there that Qiu Xingyuan knew that bullets were very expensive.
He had already grasped the theoretical knowledge of making gunpowder. As long as he had bullet shells, he would be able to quickly produce a large number of bullets to sell. He would be able to earn back that money then!
After some time, Qiu Xingyuan returned to the laboratory specially prepared for him by Qiu Tong and very carefully inserted a pile of gunpowder into the metal bullet shell.
Success!
Joy and confidence flashed across Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes as he sped up. After about 40 minutes, he was exhausted. His fingers trembled slightly as he brought the lamp to the side. The lamp contained alcohol.
Oh no!
Qiu Xingyuan widened his eyes in horror. Before he could react, he felt a pain in his hands and heard a familiar voice. Then, he was pulled into a soft and warm embrace.
“Be careful!”
“Boom——”
The violent explosion instantly shattered the utensils in the room into pieces, while Qiu Tong covered Qiu Xingyuan with her body, pressing him tightly onto the floor. Qiu Xingyuan did not suffer the slightest impact.
“Are you hurt anywhere?”
Qiu Tong checked Qiu Xingyuan up and down nervously. When she found that there were no injuries, she became furious. “Are you crazy? Who told you to research explosives?”
From the corner of her eye, she saw a pile of dark gold bullet heads in the corner. Qiu Tong’s eyes turned cold and her anger surged. “Qiu Xingyuan! Why did you make so many bullets?”
Qiu Xingyuan lowered his head and did not explain. As usual, he bore everything in silence.
“Do you know how dangerous it was just now? What if you hurt yourself?!”
Seeing that he was still unwilling to explain, Qiu Tong was truly angered now. She really felt like prying Qiu Xingyuan’s head open to see what he was thinking.
“I won’t hurt myself.”
Qiu Xingyuan twisted his fingers awkwardly, his little face tense. “It was just an accident.”
Seeing that Qiu Tong was still glaring at him coldly, Qiu Xingyuan lowered his eyes and casually found an excuse. “Anyway, I still have so much explosives and no use for them. Might as well just make bullets.”
She noticed his tightly pursed lips. Qiu Tong knew that he had a secret and did not press him further. She changed the topic.
“How can there be no use for them? Let me teach you.”
She rolled up her sleeves and gestured for Qiu Xingyuan to pay attention to her process and the exact ratio of gunpowder to use. Unknowingly, the two of them had been in the laboratory for the entire afternoon.
Qiu Xingyuan did not understand what she wanted to do.
At night, Qiu Tong sneaked out with her three children.
“Mommy, Eldest Brother, what are you two doing?”
Qiu Xingyu looked at them in confusion and Qiu Tong said mysteriously, “Mommy and Eldest Brother have prepared a gift for you!”
After about three minutes had passed, Qiu Tong asked them to look up at the night sky. “Look!”
Colorful fireworks instantly lit up the night sky like a grand and festive bouquet of flowers. Every moment was astonishing.
Even Qiu Xingyuan, who had helped to create them, was shocked by the scene before him.
So… she was making fireworks this afternoon?

chapters.title: Chapter 34
chapters.content:
Chapter 34: Casino
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“Mommy, it’s so beautiful! I love this gift!”
Qiu Xingyu shrieked in amazement.
Qiu Tong gave a smug smile and glanced at Qiu Xingyuan, who was also looking at the sky. She said meaningfully, “You should be seeing such beautiful things at your age. Leave the rest to Mommy. You don’t have to worry.”
She smiled and touched Qiu Xingyuan’s head. The boy, who had always been gloomy and cold, looked at her blankly as if he didn’t recognize her.
Qiu Tong felt that Qiu Xingyuan seemed to have relaxed a little.
As expected, in the next second, Qiu Xingyuan said in a low voice, “Someone snatched away the money for the locust pesticide. It was Yu Ge.”
That wretched man again?!
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and gritted her teeth in anger.
He did not even let a child off. He was indeed a scumbag with no conscience!
Well then, don’t blame her for enforcing justice on behalf of the heavens!
The three children were in a good mood the next day after witnessing the stunning “fireworks show”.
“You have a mother but no father!”
“It must be because you kids are too naughty. That’s why your father doesn’t want you all.”
Those words that had formerly angered the three children had no effect on them now.
Qiu Xingqiao even took out an item proudly and shouted, “What’s so great about having a father? I have this!”
The item in his hand immediately attracted the attention of all the children. Qiu Xingqiao became even more pleased when he realized that he had become the center of attention.
He proudly showed off his fireworks. The red, orange, yellow, green, blue and purple colors instantly made everyone gasp in surprise.
This was an improved version made overnight by Qiu Tong and Qiu Xingyuan. It was convenient to carry around, and it was even more beautiful.
“Qiu Xingqiao, do you have more?”
Some children were extremely envious and approached Qiu Xingqiao in an adoring manner. Not to be outdone, some other children clamored to barter with Qiu Xingqiao. Some even wanted to buy fireworks from him.
The children crowded around Qiu Xingqiao so tightly that not even a drop of water could pass through. Finally, he could not take it anymore and shouted, “My brother and sister also have it!”
Compared to the pathetic Qiu Xingqiao, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingyu were already well-prepared. They exchanged their fireworks for money in an orderly manner.
Soon, the three children became the top dogs of the kindergarten and were much-adored by the other children.
While the three children were in kindergarten, Qiu Tong dragged Yu Ge out of her handphone blacklist with a cold face.
“Where are you?”
Qiu Tong asked coldly, ignoring the clamor in front of her.
Yu Ge seemed to have expected Qiu Tong to look for him. His tone was filled with confidence and pride. “I’m at the Imperial Casino.”
After getting his location, Qiu Tong rushed over within ten minutes. From afar, she saw that Yu Ge’s eyes were already bloodshot from gambling. As soon as he saw her, he immediately rushed over. “Qiu Tong, give me another $15,000! I only need $15,000 and I’ll definitely be able to make a comeback!”
“When will you return the $20,000 that you already owe me?”
Qiu Tong glared at him coldly and Yu Ge avoided her gaze. “Since when did I borrow money from you? Don’t slander me!”
Qiu Tong sneered. “You even dare to snatch money from a child? Robbing a child? Yu Ge, are you that shameless?!”
Having been exposed by Qiu Tong in front of so many people, Yu Ge’s face flushed red. He glared at her with bulging eyes. “Don’t spout nonsense, you’re slandering me! Qiu Tong, never mind that you are always clinging onto me, now you are slandering me! You love me so much that it has turned to hate!”
He charged at her, wanting to chase Qiu Tong out.
Qiu Tong’s eyes turned cold as she lifted her leg and kicked Yu Ge in the stomach. The 1.8-meter tall man was sent flying across the air before falling to the ground with a thud, unable to get up.
“Are you going to return my money?”
Qiu Tong looked down at Yu Ge, who was groaning in pain. Yu Ge gritted his teeth and refused to admit it. “I don’t owe you any money!”
He would not repent until he saw his own grave!
She took up a fruit knife from the fruit platter and smiled at Yu Ge. “It’s fine if you don’t want to pay me back. I will charge you $1,000 per finger. But it looks like your pair of hands won’t be enough. Never mind, we can include your feet!”
The cold glint of the blade made Yu Ge nervous, but he was betting that Qiu Tong would not dare to make a move.
“How dare you?! I will call the police!”
Ha!
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and raised her hand, before stabbing downwards.
“Ah!”
Yu Ge shut his eyes and screamed. He had not expected Qiu Tong to actually dare to attack him. He was feeling deep remorse now.
“I’ll return you money, I’ll return it right now!”
“You should have just done so earlier.”
Qiu Tong let go of him. Yu Ge then realized that the knife had landed between his fingers. He collapsed weakly to the ground.
“This is all the money I have.”
Yu Ge’s hands trembled as he handed about $1,000 in cash over to Qiu Tong. Seeing that Qiu Tong looked unsatisfied, his legs trembled. “I really don’t have any money left… I lost all my money…”
Seeing that he was not pretending, Qiu Tong gave a light snort. Her gaze landed on the gambling table.
“Move aside!”
She motioned for Yu Ge to get lost while she took his place.. She looked at the betting table before her with interest.

chapters.title: Chapter 35
chapters.content:
Chapter 35: Cheating
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
It was a simple betting game based on the number of the dice rolled: “Big” or “Small”. However, Yu Ge never won a single round and lost all his money.
Yu Ge’s luck was just too lousy. But there were actually some intricacies to this betting game.
With a twitch of her ears, Qiu Tong pushed all her money to “Small”. When the dice were revealed, there were indeed just four dots!
Qiu Tong smirked. She had already grasped the trick to this game.
After that, it was as if she was cheating. With her sharp senses, Qiu Tong won nearly every bet. The rest of the gamblers immediately followed her bets. Soon, the casino lost close to $15,000.
In just three hours, she had increased the original $1,000 by more than 50 times.
Satisfied, Qiu Tong was ready to leave the table. But the casino dealer had lost so terribly that he pointed at Qiu Tong with bloodshot eyes. “She cheated!”
The grim-faced boss was also standing at the side. He looked at Qiu Tong coldly. “Hand over the money!”
“Winning equals cheating?”
Qiu Tong was certain that there was something wrong with this casino. Cold amusement flashed across her eyes. Ignoring her comment, the boss gave a wave of his hand. More than 10 men charged toward Qiu Tong!
Qiu Tong did not wish to get entangled in a prolonged fight. Stepping off the gambling table beside her, she leaped into the air and threw consequent kicks at several of the bodyguards. Before anyone could react, she fled.
“Chase after her!”
The boss was so angry that his face turned ashen. He glared at Yu Ge coldly and ordered his men to drag him over. “Is she your woman?”
“No… no…”
Yu Ge was so frightened that his face turned pale. However, the casino owner, who had suffered heavy losses, refused to listen to his explanation.
“You are to return all my money within three days. Otherwise—”
“Crash!”
An axe split a chair in half with a heavy blow.
Yu Ge collapsed to the ground. With a pale face, he raised his hands and swore. “Of course! I’ll return it! I’ll definitely make Qiu Tong cough up the money!”
After winning so much money, Qiu Tong went to the kindergarten to pick up the three kids.
“Mommy!”
As soon as Qiu Xingyu saw her, she rushed over with her small school bag, her eyes sparkling. “I made many new friends today.”
Although Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao did not say anything, their faces also looked lighter and more relaxed.
The three children were more mature than their peers, but they were still kids after all. Due to their family background, it had been a long time since other children were willing to play with them.
“You are so cute, other children will definitely like you.”
It was rare to see the three brats in a good mood, and Qiu Tong’s smile grew wider.
She had worked hard for so long, all for the sake of letting these three children start a new life and grow up healthy and happy, just like ordinary children.
Just as she was about to bring the three children home, Yu Ge, who had been secretly following behind her, suddenly rushed out and grabbed Qiu Tong’s arm.
“Everyone, come and be my judges. I’m the father of these three children! But this woman refused to let me see the children just to get back at me!”
“Children, I’m your father!”
Yu Ge rushed towards the three children, but Qiu Tong pushed him away forcefully, her eyes wary. “What do you want?!”
Yu Ge pretended to stagger backwards and collapsed to the ground in an exaggerated manner. His face was full of tears and snot.
“This woman is so selfish and ruthless! I’m the father of these children. But not only did she take all my money, she refused to let them acknowledge me!”
Yu Ge’s ruckus at the entrance of the kindergarten soon attracted the attention of the other parents. Everyone looked at Qiu Tong strangely and whispered among themselves.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s faces were cold. Qiu Xingyu pursed her lips tightly and hid behind her two brothers in fear.
They did not believe that this man was their father.
“Yu Ge, you are truly unrepentant!”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes dangerously and glared at him. “You’re not the children’s father!”
“Then tell me, who is the father of the children?!”
Yu Ge asked in a harsh tone. Qiu Tong was speechless.
She had no memories of the children’s father, so how would she know who their father was?
Seeing that she couldn’t say anything, Yu Ge’s lips curled into a quick smile. He quickly pulled the people around him to complain. “I worked so hard for the four of them, but this woman found another man and even brought the three children away with her!”
“Those three ingrates refused to acknowledge me when they saw that I had no money…”
The more Yu Ge spoke, the more exaggerated he became. Qiu Tong was furious and was about to teach him a lesson when a teacher hurried over to disperse the surrounding parents.
“Mother Qiu, is he really the children’s father?”
The teacher approached Qiu Tong with small, cautious steps. Qiu Tong immediately denied, “Of course not.”
“If you don’t admit it, we’ll do a paternity test now!”
Yu Ge got up from the ground and said confidently, “How can I possibly not recognize my own children?”
The other parents agreed.. “That’s right, Mother Qiu. Why don’t you do a paternity test? Wouldn’t everything be clear then?”

chapters.title: Chapter 36
chapters.content:
Chapter 36: Paternity Test
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Seeing that Yu Ge had taken the initiative to request for a paternity test, Qiu Tong vaguely sensed that there was a trap. She looked away coldly. “There’s no need. I know very well who the children’s father is.”
“If you know, why are you refusing to say?!”
Yu Ge refused to let it go but kept interrogating her. “You are just feeling guilty, so you don’t dare to do a paternity test!”
The teacher continued to persuade her, “It’s better to do one. Otherwise, if this father keeps making a fuss at the entrance of the kindergarten, it won’t be good for the children.”
Hearing the teacher’s subtle hint, Qiu Tong lowered her eyes and finally chose to compromise.
Qiu Tong brought the three children to the hospital and drew their blood. They sat on the hospital bench and waited for the results.
Little Yu was a little nervous. She whispered to her two brothers, “Will he turn out to be our Daddy?”
“No way!”
Qiu Xingqiao blurted out angrily, while Qiu Xingyuan remained silent with a cold face, but his eyes were filled with denial.
Half an hour later, the report was finally out.
Qiu Tong took it and her attention was drawn to the last line—
It had been determined that Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu were 99.99% related to Yu Ge.
Yu Ge was really the father of three children?!
Qiu Tong’s eyes widened, and Yu Ge, who had seen the result, smiled smugly.
“Qiu Tong, what else do you have to say?!”
He pointed at the last line of the report and said in a malicious tone, “It’s written clearly in black and white that I’m the children’s biological father!”
Qiu Tong looked at him coldly and said nothing.
The three children’s faces darkened as they clenched their fists.
“What do you want?”
Wasn’t Yu Ge here just for money?
Qiu Tong pursed her lips and asked coldly, “How much do you want?”
“$300,000!”
Yu Ge immediately demanded an exorbitant sum. His eyes sparkled. “In addition, you have to transfer the ownership of the apartment to me!”
Qiu Tong almost burst out laughing at Yu Ge’s shamelessness. She had worked so hard just to scrape together $150,000, and Yu Ge was now asking for $300,000?
“Yu Ge, you should know your limits. Otherwise, you won’t get anything in the end!”
Now that Yu Ge had something to fall back on, he was not afraid of Qiu Tong’s threat. His tone was exceptionally harsh. “Stop scaring me, Qiu Tong. If you don’t agree, I will immediately sue the court and fight for custody as their biological father!”
“Go ahead.”
Qiu Tong stood up coldly. She no longer wished to entertain his silly mind games. There must be something wrong with that report. She had to find out the truth immediately!
Seeing that she was about to leave, Yu Ge hurriedly stopped her. “You can’t leave!”
“I’m the children’s father. What right do you have to take the children away?! Give me the money or give me the children!”
He clung onto Qiu Tong, refusing to let them leave. His noisy actions attracted the attention of countless people in the hospital.
Qiu Tong couldn’t bear it anymore. She grabbed Yu Ge by the collar and dragged him out of the hospital. Her tone was vicious. “Yu Ge, you better not have been up to any tricks, or I will never let you off!”
Leaving Yu Ge at the door, Qiu Tong immediately took the children home in a taxi.
“Little Yu, lend me your computer.”
As soon as she got home, Qiu Tong rushed into her room and started working on the computer with a serious look on her face.
The three children did not dare to disturb her and waited quietly in the living room. Qiu Xingyu tugged her skirt nervously. “Did the paternity test state that he is our father?”
“No way!”
Qiu Xingqiao clenched his fists, his little face flushed red. “I don’t have a father like that!”
“What if he really wants to snatch us away from mommy?”
Qiu Xingyu could not hide her worry. Qiu Xingqiao’s face was pale, and for a moment, he did not know how to answer. He looked to Qiu Xingyuan for help.
Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes were cold, and his tone was chilly. “If he really dares to come for us, I will deliberately injure myself! As long as I can prove that Yu Ge was negligent and caused me to be injured, the court will strip him of his custody!”
Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes lit up. “Alright, my skin is thick and I’m not afraid of pain. Let me do it!”
The three brats muttered in the living room while Qiu Tong quickly hacked into the hospital’s medical system and immediately found today’s DNA test report.
Qiu Tong sneered when she saw the figure “0.99%” under the possibility section.
She knew that Yu Ge must have done something.
To prevent Yu Ge from colluding with the hospital to destroy the report, Qiu Tong quickly downloaded the original and even printed it out.
Seeing the three kids staring at her nervously, Qiu Tong smiled.
“Don’t worry, he’s not your father. I’m foolish but not that foolish.”
The three children, who were all tensed up, instantly heaved a sigh of relief. Qiu Xingqiao regained his lively and active appearance. He stuck his hands at his waist and laughed arrogantly. “How can that kind of coward be worthy of being my father?!”
Qiu Xingyuan’s expression was still cold and stern as he frowned slightly.. “He won’t give up so easily.”

chapters.title: Chapter 37
chapters.content:
Chapter 37: Counterattack
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“Don’t worry.”
Qiu Tong seemed to know exactly how fragile the hearts of those three children were. She hugged them comfortingly, her tone exceptionally firm.
“No matter what he does, I will never let him take you away from me!”
Qiu Xingyu leaned against Qiu Tong and nodded vigorously. “I don’t want to leave Mommy either.”
The next day, a court summons was sent to Qiu Tong.
Yu Ge had really gone to court to sue Qiu Tong for custody!
Qiu Tong smirked as she gazed coldly at the date and venue of the trial.
Yu Ge was certain that she would not be able to get the original report and wanted to use the fake report to fool the court. Well then, she would play his game!
After sending the three children to kindergarten, Qiu Tong brought the original report to the court on time.
Yu Ge had already arrived with his lawyer.
“Qiu Tong, it’s not too late to regret now.”
Yu Ge narrowed his eyes as he urged Qiu Tong. “It’s just $300,000. Money can be earned anytime.”
Qiu Tong completely ignored him and walked straight to the defendant’s seat and sat quietly.
Yu Ge thought that she had already given up. He secretly cursed in his heart.
What was the use of having the children? He wanted money!
However, he immediately thought of something. As long as the three children were in his hands, he need not fear that Qiu Tong wouldn’t fork out any money.
“Thump!”
The chief judge lightly knocked on his wooden hammer. The detailed report of the case was laid out in front of him. He said in a deep voice, “Plaintiff, make your statement.”
Yu Ge’s lawyer stood up and looked at Qiu Tong coldly. “Ms. Qiu, do you admit to refusing to let my client have contact with his children?”
“As the children’s biological father, my client has the right to visit the children. Just because of a conflict between adults, you purposely let the children live in an unhealthy family environment. Your way of thinking and emotional state are very dangerous. You are completely unsuitable to continue being the guardian of the three children!”
Qiu Tong smirked. “And Yu Ge isn’t dangerous? He tried to sell the three children and even robbed the eldest child of his money. He likes to gamble. How is he fit to be a father?”
“Since he’s the biological father, may I ask if he has ever spared a single cent on child support?”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and said in a mocking tone, “This ‘good father’ would rather receive $300,000 and wash his hands off his children. He’s only using this custody battle to blackmail me into giving him money! From a legal perspective, this is a scam!”
“You’re slandering me!”
Yu Ge was instantly enraged. He had nothing. At most, he would just lose the lawsuit. So he lied for all he was worth. “You cheated me of all my money. How would I have money to pay for child support?”
“No money?”
Qiu Tong sneered. “If you don’t have money, why did you go to the Imperial Casino?”
Yu Ge was at a loss for words as panic flashed across his eyes.
“You forced me to do that. Qiu Tong, you snatched my children away and made me homeless. I had no choice but to stay in those places!”
Qiu Tong raised an eyebrow and turned to the judge again. “How can such a person ensure the children’s daily living conditions and studies when he doesn’t even have a place to stay or a stable job?”
“Therefore, I request to reject the other party’s request.”
Yu Ge did not expect Qiu Tong to react so quickly and catch on to his shortcomings. He immediately tried to salvage the situation. “I already have a place to live and a job. Since I’m the children’s father, shouldn’t you at least give me one of the three children?”
“Yu Ge, I’ll give you one more chance.”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes slowly and said in a strange tone, “If you stop now, there’s still room for reconciliation.”
Yu Ge thought that Qiu Tong was afraid, so he became even more arrogant. “Judge, I can choose not to fight for all three children. Just one will do!”
Seeing his stubbornness, Qiu Tong no longer held back but took out the report she had prepared.
“It’s just that I retrieved the original report from the hospital. Yu Ge is not my children’s father at all! In order to extort money from me, he deliberately forged the report and pretended to be my children’s father. He then tried to swindle me of $300,000 and the children’s custody!”
Qiu Tong handed over another petition and said coldly, “I’m suing Yu Ge for extortion and blackmail!”
Yu Ge’s lawyer was stunned by the sudden turn of events.
Yu Ge lost his composure and rushed over, wanting to snatch the report from Qiu Tong’s hands. “It’s fake! Hers is the fake one!”
Qiu Tong easily dodged and handed all the documents over to the judge. The judge called the appraiser over and carefully compared them before shooting a cold glare at Yu Ge.
“Extortion, blackmail, falsifying a report, how dare you!”
Oh no!
Yu Ge’s legs gave way, and he sat paralyzed on the plaintiff’s seat. His lawyer, on the other hand, did not dare to say a word. Now, he wanted nothing more than to draw a clear line between them.
In the end, Yu Ge suffered the consequences of his own actions and was sentenced to three months in prison.
Qiu Tong watched with satisfaction as Yu Ge was arrested.. Then, she slowly walked home.

chapters.title: Chapter 38
chapters.content:
Chapter 38: Kidnapped
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
After Qiu Tong left, the judge changed out of his clothes and headed straight to the guest room upstairs. With a smile on his cold and stern face, he said, “I’m sorry to have kept you waiting, Commander Shao.”
“No problem.”
Shao An narrowed his eyes and retracted his gaze from the court. He sent the video he had just taken to his boss and smirked.
His boss would definitely be pleased to see this.
After Jin Yang received the video, he looked at Qiu Tong, who was valiant and cool, neither timid nor overbearing. Every word she said made sense. A smile flashed across his eyes.
Having finally gotten rid of Yu Ge, that disgusting man, Qiu Tong was in a good mood and prepared to tell the three children the good news.
However, when she rushed to the kindergarten, she realized that most of the children had left. There was no sign of her three brats.
She stopped the teacher curiously. “Teacher, where’s my children?”
“The children left a long time ago.”
The teacher looked at her strangely and said hesitantly, “Little Yu said that you had something important to do today and couldn’t come. She requested for them to go home by themselves. The three children have been gone for nearly 40 minutes.”
But she did not see the three children on her way here.
Qiu Tong left the teacher in a hurry. She searched through all the parks and amusement centers nearby but could not find them.
The three children were young and mischievous, but they wouldn’t do such a thing. Did something happen?
With her heart thumping in anxiety, Qiu Tong immediately went into the nearest internet cafe and hacked into the surveillance cameras. She could vaguely see the three children leaving the kindergarten before disappearing without a trace.
Qiu Tong was unwilling to give up. She studied the surveillance footage for several hours, but to no avail.
Could it be that the three children had purposely travelled along the surveillance blind spots?
Unable to find any trace of the children, Qiu Tong rushed home with a sullen expression, wanting to see if the children had gone home on their own.
The moment she entered, she realized that the house was quiet.
Qiu Tong’s eyes darkened and she instinctively lightened her footsteps. Suddenly, she felt a gust of wind behind her. She turned around and dodged nimbly, grabbing the wooden stick that was swinging at her.
“Qiu Xingqiao?”
Qiu Xingqiao saw who it was and his eyes turned red. “Why are you back so late?”
“What’s going on?”
Qiu Tong squatted down and hugged him tightly. “Where are your siblings?”
“They…”
Qiu Xingqiao sniffed and said in a choked voice, “They were taken away by human traffickers!”
After Qiu Xingyuan and the rest left the kindergarten, they had just walked to the alley near the district when a large group of people suddenly rushed out from a van parked by the roadside. They gagged their mouths and dragged them towards the van.
Fortunately, Qiu Xingqiao had good stamina and could fight. He bit hard on those people’s hands and took advantage of their pain to break free and hurriedly escape.
The little fellow was in low spirits and felt very guilty. “I didn’t protect my siblings.”
“No, you did very well.”
Qiu Tong’s tone was gentle as she comforted Qiu Xingqiao. “You’re very smart and brave. If you hadn’t come back to tell me, Mommy would never have found you.”
“It is only because of you that your siblings have hope of finding their way home.”
Qiu Xingqiao, who was still upset about being a deserter, looked up and asked with a hint of uncertainty, “Really?”
Seeing Qiu Tong nod her head affirmatively, Qiu Xingqiao’s expression became better. He stared at Qiu Tong. “You must save them and beat up the bad guys!”
Qiu Tong did not say anything. She hooked his little finger with her own and said in a low voice, “If you have any problems, you have to seek out the police to help you.”
Qiu Xingqiao was already violent enough. She could not let him get used to solving problems with brute force.
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes dangerously. Nevertheless, she could still beat those people up before she called the police.
Who would want to kidnap the three children?
They had no money and they had not offended anyone. Qiu Tong suspected that it might be Yu Ge, but then she soon dispelled that notion.
Not only was Yu Ge currently locked up in jail, his only goal was money. He would not attack the children.
Qiu Tong was deep in thought when she suddenly remembered someone else.
Lin Shan!
Previously, the former Qiu Tong was bewitched by her into selling the children. Lin Shan had even tried to set a trap to continue deceiving her into selling her children.
Other than her and that Mr. Cui, no one would target her three children!
Qiu Tong’s eyes turned cold. She immediately took a taxi to Lin Shan’s place and knocked on the door.
“Who is it?!”
An impatient voice came from inside. When she saw that it was Qiu Tong, Lin Shan’s expression changed and she instinctively wanted to close the door.
Qiu Tong kicked the door open and stormed in. She scanned the room but did not see the children.
Her cold gaze slowly shifted to Lin Shan.. Qiu Tong’s tone was cold, and her eyes swirled with mad anger, as if filled with the aura of death and hell. “Where are my children?”

chapters.title: Chapter 39
chapters.content:
Chapter 39: Investigation
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“What children?”
Lin Shan’s eyes flickered, and she said in a tough tone, “Aren’t your children at your house? Why are you here?”
Qiu Tong could not be bothered with her. Ignoring her attempts to obstruct her, she forced her way in and opened all the doors. But they were empty.
Not only was there no sign of the children, even Mr. Cui was gone.
Qiu Tong frowned and glared at Lin Shan. “Where did Mr. Cui go?”
“Qiu Tong, what do you mean?”
Lin Shan put on a brave front and pointed at Qiu Tong with her hands on her hips. “You treated me so badly before, but you have the cheek to turn up at my door now? You already know my relationship with Mr. Cui. Why do you care where Mr. Cui went? What are your intentions?”
Qiu Tong’s patience ran out and she glared at her coldly. “I’m asking you one last time, where did Mr. Cui go?”
Lin Shan shivered under her merciless gaze, but she still braced herself and said, “Are you shameless? You want to seduce Mr. Cui… Ah!”
A strong force gripped her throat tightly. Qiu Tong looked at her with an especially cold gaze, her valiant face suffused with a thick murderous aura.
“Where is he?”
Lin Shan was so scared that her lips were trembling. She was hesitating whether she should say it or not, but in that moment of hesitation, the hand at her throat suddenly contracted, and she was unable to breathe.
“Cough cough…”
Her face turned purple as she tried her best to grab Qiu Tong’s fingers. However, Qiu Tong’s hands were like iron pincers, and she could not pry them apart. Just as she thought she was about to suffocate, Qiu Tong suddenly released her hands.
Lin Shan coughed so hard that her face turned red. She looked at Qiu Tong with fear.
“Next time, I won’t let go.”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and asked coldly, “Where is Mr. Cui?”
“I really don’t know!”
Lin Shan’s voice was thick with tears. She covered her neck and shrank back desperately. “He only said he was going out to do something. I don’t know where he went!”
“Call him.”
Qiu Tong took a fruit knife from the kitchen and forced Lin Shan to call Mr. Cui. “Speak normally. If you try anything funny…”
She pressed the knife hard against Lin Shan’s neck. Lin Shan nodded repeatedly with a pale face.
Qiu Tong took Lin Shan’s phone and easily cracked her password. She gestured for her to make the call.
It rang for a long time before Mr. Cui finally answered the call. His tone was extremely impatient. “What is it this time?”
“Are you coming over tonight?”
Lin Shan looked at the knife by her neck and tried her best not to tremble. “My mom called me and asked when we’re getting married…”
Mr. Cui interrupted her impatiently. “Didn’t I tell you that we will talk about this next time? I have something important to do now. Don’t bother me!”
“Wait, where are you? If it’s not convenient for you to come over, I can come to you!”
Lin Shan quickly stopped him. Mr. Cui made some vague replies but did not give her an exact location. He then hurriedly hung up.
She looked at Qiu Tong in fear and was about to cry. “I tried my best but he didn’t want to tell me…”
Qiu Tong had successfully hacked into Mr. Cui’s phone during the call and located his location.
Her eyes were fixed on the flashing red dot on the screen. She stared coldly at Lin Shan. “I’ll settle our scores next time!”
Ignoring Lin Shan’s horrified expression, Qiu Tong immediately zoomed in on the flashing red dot on the screen and was shocked to discover that it was in a high-end villa compound.
There was a high chance that the children were also brought there!
Qiu Tong returned home and gathered some items. Just as she was about to leave, Qiu Xingqiao stubbornly wanted to follow her. “I want to go too!”
His small face was full of determination. Qiu Tong knew that if she did not bring him along, Qiu Xingqiao would just charge on alone. She might as well keep him by her side.
As the two of them approached the entrance of the villa compound, they were stopped by the security guards.
“Who are you?”
He looked at Qiu Tong and Qiu Xingqiao warily. “Do you have an invitation? If not, you can’t enter!”
Qiu Tong was about to explain when she saw a figure walking towards her from the corner of her eye. She hurriedly pulled Qiu Xingqiao and hid in the bushes.
After a while, Mr. Cui appeared with a card in his hand, humming. He seemed to be in a good mood.
Qiu Tong’s eyes darkened. It seemed like the children had been brought here and sold to someone inside!

chapters.title: Chapter 40
chapters.content:
Chapter 40: Mysterious Visitor
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
However, Qiu Tong did not have an invitation and could not enter.
Qiu Tong told Qiu Xingqiao to hide while she figured out a way to crack the villa compound’s wireless network. She successfully hacked into the security system and closed all the intruder warning devices.
Carefully avoiding the security guards, she then successfully sneaked into the villa compound with Qiu Xingqiao.
Qiu Xingqiao followed Qiu Tong closely, as if she was his pillar.
“Where are we going now?”
“No rush.”
Using her handphone, Qiu Tong hacked into the surveillance system. She scrolled through all the surveillance records of the perimeter of the compound and the parking lot, before finally finding Mr. Cui.
He had parked his car on the basement floor, and then jogged towards one of the innermost villas.
Qiu Tong nodded slightly at Qiu Xingqiao, indicating for him to follow.
She had Qiu Xingqiao hide in the bushes while she climbed up a banyan tree at the perimeter of the villa. Her body was as light as a cat’s as she quietly sneaked into the second-floor balcony.
Through the glass doors of the balcony, she suddenly saw Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingyu locked up in this room.
Qiu Tong was just about to make a move when she saw someone enter and quickly hid at the side.
The glass was soundproof, and Qiu Tong could not hear the conversation inside. However, it was clear that the other party had not mistreated the two children. Not only had they been provided with food, they were also given fruits and children’s books.
Seeing that the two children were well taken care of and not abused, Qiu Tong heaved a sigh of relief.
There were so many security guards outside and it was broad daylight. It would be very difficult for her to bring the two children along with her now.
But if they waited until it was nighttime, they could escape more easily under the cover of darkness.
Qiu Tong decided to wait until nightfall before taking action. She returned to Qiu Xingqiao’s side.
“Did you find them?”
Qiu Xingqiao was burning with anxiety. Seeing Qiu Tong nod her head, his eyes went red with determination. “Then let’s rescue them quickly!”
Qiu Tong didn’t know whether to laugh or cry. She grabbed his collar and said, “It’s not convenient to make our move now. Wait for the sky to turn dark.”
“I’m going to find out who the owner of this villa is. Wait for me here and don’t run around.”
Qiu Xingqiao nodded obediently. After settling him down, Qiu Tong went back into the security system and secretly hacked all the surveillance cameras around the villa in the southeast corner.
She leaped onto the balcony again and rolled onto the ground. She noticed that the window of the study was open.
Qiu Tong surveyed her surroundings warily. When she realized that no one was around, she supported herself with one hand on the balcony and leaped forward into the study. She landed lightly without making a sound.
Her sharp gaze swept across the decorations in the study room inch by inch, instantly taking in the wall full of medals and trophies. There was even a military uniform hanging on the clothes rack beside it.
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and examined each medal carefully. It was then that she realized that the owner of the villa was actually a first lieutenant of the country!
Why would a person of such status spend so much effort to capture two children?
Qiu Tong was confused. When she approached the desk, there was a document on it!
The document contained the order to capture Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu with all means necessary. Furthermore, it was covered with a red seal. This meant that it was an official document of the highest grade level.
In other words, the person who issued this order was someone of an even higher status than a first lieutenant!
Qiu Tong was secretly shocked. She did not expect this matter to be so complicated.
Just as she was about to investigate further, she heard hasty footsteps coming from the corridor outside. She also heard a low voice.
“Our esteemed guest has arrived.”
A deep and heavy voice rang out. It should be the first lieutenant’s voice. “Send the children upstairs first.”
More footsteps.
When it was quiet outside, Qiu Tong slowly approached the door and opened it slightly.
A broad middle-aged man’s back flashed past the stairs. He seemed to have gone downstairs to welcome the mysterious guest.
Qiu Tong could not help but hold her breath. With a single leap of her long legs, she successfully sneaked into another room and could see everything that was happening downstairs.
Qiu Tong quietly opened the blinds and stared at the door.
Not long after, an extremely familiar face strode in from outside.
Qiu Tong gasped.
This man… how could it be him?!

chapters.title: Chapter 41 - Escape Plan
chapters.content:
Chapter 41: Escape Plan
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“…Song Yan?”
Qiu Tong stared at him, trying to guess his intentions.
How could his appearance just be a coincidence?
Could it be because she previously mentioned that the three children looked like him, so he had secretly ordered the lieutenant to kidnap the children?
“Sir, what brings you here?”
The lieutenant bowed extremely respectfully.
Jin Yang sat on the sofa with a cold expression, lightly tapping on the edge of the porcelain teacup. He looked up and asked with a cold gaze, “Do I need to ask for your permission before coming here?”
As he narrowed his eyes, the tea lid made a clear, clinking sound, startling the lieutenant so much that his face paled as he shook his head.
Qiu Tong pushed at the gap in the glass window, trying to hear their conversation more clearly.
Bang!
Smack!
Sounds of something breaking in the room above rang out followed by hurried footsteps. The villa then suddenly returned to silence.
Jin Yang looked up at the lieutenant. “You have guests?”
The burly officer was a little flustered, but he did his best to conceal the presence of the children. He forced a stiff smile and said, “I just got a couple of new pets. Perhaps they are not used to the strange environment here. Sorry to have disturbed you, Sir.”
Jin Yang smiled. “Oh? What kind of pets? Can I see them?”
The lieutenant immediately stopped him and said, “They have not been tamed yet. I’m afraid they might harm you! It will be better to see them after I finish taming them.”
Qiu Tong listened to their conversation, her eyes filled with confusion.
From the looks of it, Song Yan didn’t seem to know the children’s situation. Could it really be just a coincidence?
While they were talking downstairs, she sneaked away and waited for an opportunity to rescue Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingyu.
In the room, the two children were not idle either.
Qiu Xingyuan used his body to block the bodyguard’s line of sight. He took out two pills and passed them to Qiu Xingyu. With a vigilant and anxious look, he said, “Little Yu, eat this antidote. Brother will bring you out!”
His expression was cold and calm as he tried his best to suppress the nervousness in his heart. He had already planned his escape route. He had to escape with his sister!
Did Qiu Xingqiao tell that woman that they were kidnapped?
For some reason, Qiu Xingyuan even hoped to see Qiu Tong here. But he immediately chased that terrifying idea out of his mind!
“Elder Brother, I am a little scared. Will Mommy come and save us?”
Qiu Xingyu tugged at his fingers as she looked at the sumptuous spread of fruits and delicacies on the table. She secretly hid a few of them, wanting to bring them back to Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Tong.
Qiu Xingyuan shook his head and said firmly, “Don’t think about her anymore. We have to rely on ourselves!”
Choosing the right moment, he sprayed his specially-concocted gas in the air, smashing things and causing a commotion.
The bodyguards outside the door heard the noise and ran in. They immediately inhaled the gas and fell to the ground weakly. They watched as the two children ran across their bodies while holding hands.
Propped up by Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingyu entered a few complicated codes into the touchscreen control panel at the door. She successfully hacked the surveillance system of the villa and paralyzed the entire building’s audio recording system.
“Elder Brother, it’s done!”
“Little Yu is awesome!”
Holding Qiu Xingyu’s hand, Qiu Xingyuan slipped away from the corridor with her, avoiding the guards who had rushed over upon hearing the alarm.
Just as they were catching their breath and thinking that they would be able to escape successfully, they bumped into a burly secret service agent. He looked down at the two children and blocked the stairway.
“Where are you guys going?”
“Elder Brother!”
Qiu Xingyu tugged at her brother’s sleeve in fear.
Qiu Xingyuan raised his arms to protect her, lifting his little chin stubbornly in an attempt to find a chance of survival in this desperate situation.
He secretly withdrew his fingers into his sleeve, wanting to take out a small amount of powder to create a smokescreen, so that Little Yu might be able to escape. However, he suddenly saw a black shadow appear in front of him!
The figure kicked the special agent’s abdomen and swiftly twisted his neck, making him go unconscious.
Qiu Xingyuan was stunned. Qiu Tong had really come!
“Mommy!”
Qiu Xingyu cried out softly and threw herself into her arms. Her eyes were filled with tears. It was clear that she was extremely afraid.
Meanwhile, Qiu Xingyuan’s thin lips were pursed tightly, but his tensed body had relaxed somewhat.
Qiu Tong put her index finger to her lips to indicate silence, but it was too late.. The noises emitted by the beaten secret service agent had already caught the attention of the lieutenant downstairs.

chapters.title: Chapter 42 - Cover And Distraction
chapters.content:
Chapter 42: Cover And Distraction
Crap!
With Qiu Xingyu in one arm and holding Qiu Xingyuan’s hand in the other, Qiu Tong hid in the corner of the villa, hiding from the guards who were quietly searching.
After observing the terrain, she realized that the only way to leave was through the living room where the lieutenant was!
Qiu Tong rolled to the other side, trying to investigate if there were any other routes, but unexpectedly met Jin Yang’s gaze.
He frowned slightly, his eyes flickering with surprise as if he was wondering why she was here.
“Shh!”
Qiu Tong pressed her index finger against her lips and shook her head, indicating for him to keep quiet.
The lieutenant sensed his gaze and turned his body—
Qiu Tong quickly crouched down!
“Your pets seem to be very restless. Why don’t we go take a look?”
Jin Yang only hesitated a moment before he spoke. Taking the lead, he strode up to the second floor, diverting the lieutenant’s attention.
The first lieutenant naturally didn’t dare to let him know that there were a couple of kidnapped children in the villa. He quickly followed him and said that he had a few bottles of fine red wine, inviting him to taste them.
Qiu Tong pushed the door open and pushed Qiu Xingyuan out of the door. She turned around to look at Jin Yang and gave him a grateful wink.
It seemed like she had wronged a good person!
If she were to meet him again, she would definitely think of a way to repay him for his help!
Jin Yang inadvertently turned around and was dazed by the sight.
The image of Qiu Tong’s eyes repeatedly replayed in his mind. That sense of familiarity assaulted him once more. He tried to recall where he had seen her before, but the sharp pain in his mind quickened his breathing and he winced.
Startled, the lieutenant held him. “Are you all right, Sir?” he asked.
Jin Yang adjusted his breathing and shook off his arm. In a weak voice, he said, “I have something on today. I’ll try your red wine another day!”
His footsteps were hurried. He wanted to run out to find out if they had met before!
But where was she?
There were only a few patrolling guards, who seemed to be looking for something.
“…Who is she?”
Jin Yang rubbed his temples. Every time he saw her, he seemed to be reminded of something, causing a headache!
Why?
Qiu Tong took advantage of the disruption to bring the two children to meet up with Qiu Xingqiao, who was hiding in the bushes. She hacked the door access system again and sneaked out through the opening.
She and the three children ran quickly without looking back.
It was not until they ran out of the villa’s vicinity that they dared to stop. They bent over and panted heavily.
Qiu Xingqiao furrowed his brows and said to Qiu Xingyuan, “Elder Brother, I’m sorry. Back then, I…”
Qiu Tong patted him on the head, forcing him to retract his apology. “It’s not your fault, why are you apologizing? Besides, you came out to pass the news to me, they won’t blame you, right?”
Qiu Xingyuan’s face was impassive. “You are just stating the obvious, aren’t you?”
Qiu Tong, “…”
In the villa, the first lieutenant received news from his subordinates that the two children had gone missing. He was so angry that he smacked the table and growled at them, saying that they were a bunch of useless good-for-nothings who couldn’t keep the two children locked up!
The secret service agent woke up from his unconscious state and ran to him to beg for forgiveness.
“It was a woman who came to save them! I fought with her and her skills are pretty good!”
After the secret service agent finished his report, the first lieutenant ordered all his guards to search the entire city for them. They must capture the children again!
When they reached home, Qiu Tong locked the door firmly and put in place a few simple mechanisms that would alert them to intruders. She turned her head and saw Qiu Xingyu, whose eyes were filled with admiration, opening her arms to hug her.
“Mommy, you’re amazing!”
This time, even Qiu Xingqiao nodded. “It looks… pretty awesome!”
However, Qiu Xingyuan bit his lip and raised his head to stare at her with his stubborn little face. He deliberated over his words and asked, “Did you really not know that we were kidnapped? Did you betray us like last time?”
Qiu Tong was exasperated.
At this point, he was still worried that she would betray the children?
She really did not know if she should praise Qiu Xingyuan for his vigilance or feel ashamed that she had yet to gain his trust!
However, what the former owner of her body did to them had created deep scars in their hearts, and that would require time to heal…
Qiu Tong could sense Qiu Xingyuan’s anxiety and stiffness. She smiled and said, “What are you talking about? I don’t lack money now. Besides, investing in you is much more worth it than selling you!”
“I’m still waiting for you guys to study and become successful in future, so that you can take care of me in my old age! I’m so smart, I won’t invest in a lost-making venture!”
Although her head was full of schemes, she had denied that she was in cahoots with the lieutenant in the villa. Qiu Xingyuan heaved a sigh of relief. His shoulders drooped as though he had just taken a pill to calm himself down. He tried to coax Qiu Xingyu to sleep.

chapters.title: Chapter 43 - Mercenaries
chapters.content:
Chapter 43: Mercenaries
At night, Qiu Tong turned and sat up. Qiu Xingyu was holding her and she gently pried open her arms, before moving away and walking to the living room.
She frowned when she thought of the official document with the red seal.
They mobilized a lieutenant from the military just to capture a few children?
All that had happened in the past few days had confirmed that there was a major power trying to snatch her children. Their motive was unknown!
But the children needed to study in kindergarten, and she couldn’t watch after them 24/7.
Danger was inching closer like a grim reaper, forcing her to think of a way to get rid of the “flies” that surrounded them!
Qiu Tong turned on the computer and typed on the keyboard. She quickly entered a series of web addresses and entered the dark web anonymously.
“Protecting children for one month. A team of three and above to rotate over a 24-hour shift. $500,000 upfront payment.”
When this news was released, a group of mercenaries immediately accepted the contract and agreed to the specific details and location with her.
Qiu Tong looked back at the children who were sleeping soundly under the moonlight. She could sense their gradual transformations and her lips curled into a smile.
…
The next day, five mercenaries with bearded faces and sharp eyes, as well as wearing camouflage uniforms with their muscular biceps exposed, came to the door.
Qiu Xingqiao saw them and instinctively raised his baseball bat to protect Little Yu.
“Who are you?!”
The mercenaries looked at each other and glanced down at his smartwatch to check the address. “Is Qiu Tong your mother?”
Qiu Xingyuan stood up warily, frowning.
Qiu Xingyu nodded. “She’s our mommy! Why are you looking for her?”
“Don’t reveal your identity! They might be bad people!”
Qiu Xingqiao was very street-smart, but Qiu Tong couldn’t help chuckling at his words. She wiped her wet hands on her apron and spoke up.
“Come in. From today onwards, they are uncles who will protect you! Don’t be afraid!”
Protect?
Qiu Xingyuan could see the disdain and contempt in the mercenaries’ eyes. He continued to shield Qiu Xingyu and maintained a distance from them.
Wasn’t this woman afraid that these men would have bad motives?
Since when did she trust strangers so easily? Her personality had changed so much!
Mercenaries only respected strength and they would work for whoever paid them. Their attitude towards the children was perfunctory and although they would protect them, they did not respect them.
Seeing that Qiu Xingyu wanted to go out and play, the mercenary leader Ke Le immediately reprimanded her.
“Play?! Stay in the house and don’t go out! If you die, who will pay the rest of my fee?!”
Qiu Xingyu was so frightened that she shrank back. Her large eyes were filled with tears as she looked at Qiu Tong for help.
“Mommy…”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes, anger flashing across her eyes. “You guys are willing to work for money, but you don’t treat your employer very well!”
The leading mercenary was too lazy to even lift his eyes. “Cut the crap. If you guys weren’t as weak as trash, would you have spent money to hire us? In our world, whoever is strongest has the final say!”
“Since you don’t have the capability, stop nagging. If you want to stay alive, listen to us…”
Bang!
Before he could finish speaking, Qiu Tong kicked in his direction!
Ke Le dodged nimbly and grabbed her ankle, wanting to throw her to the ground!
Qiu Tong swung twice through the air, hanging onto his throat, causing his body, which was twice her size, to fall to the ground. Ke Le’s face turned purple as he begged for mercy.
A few mercenaries initially wanted to step forward to avenge him, but they were shocked by Qiu Tong’s well-trained actions and murderous intent.
Qiu Tong released Ke Le and dusted off her hands. She looked at him as he desperately gulped down fresh air while still sprawled on the ground.
“Since whoever’s strongest has the final say, then do as I say and protect my children to the best of your abilities!”
“But pay heed to your attitude!”
The mercenaries did not expect her to be so skilled and were impressed.
Ke Le no longer dared to casually sit on the chair. Instead, he leaned against the wall and nodded with a compliant attitude. “Yes, Boss.”
The other mercenaries also wiped away their shocked expressions and saluted Qiu Tong. They shouted in unison, “Yes, Boss!”
Qiu Xingyuan, “!!”
Qiu Xingyu exclaimed, “Wow! Mommy is so awesome! She’s like the violent hot chick in the movies!”
Was that… a compliment?
Qiu Tong was dubious, but she accepted it. She sent the brats to kindergarten and headed to Mr. Cui’s villa.
She needed to settle some scores with him!
The villa’s security system was like useless decorations to Qiu Tong. She easily barged into the house and rummaged through Mr. Cui’s bedroom for the bank card she had gotten from selling her children.
After that, she deliberately left behind Lin Shan’s hair tie and a few strands of her hair, placing them in a conspicuous place. She then transferred $150,000 from that card.
Qiu Tong then tossed aside the bank card in disdain, calculating how much money she could use to pay off the mercenaries.
Before she left, she smashed a few of Mr. Cui’s favorite antique collectibles.
Even so, she believed she was going too easy on him!

chapters.title: Chapter 44 - Teaching A Lesson
chapters.content:
Chapter 44: Teaching A Lesson
Mr. Cui came back and saw the broken pieces of antiques on the floor. His heart ached terribly. When he looked at his bank balance, he almost fainted.
He was so mad that he threw the hair tie at Lin Shan’s face. He pointed at her and cursed, “B*tch, how dare you steal from me!”
“The evidence is right here! Spit out the money!”
In the past, she had been gentle and soft, but now, all her promises were like burst bubbles.
Lin Shan was shocked. She bit her lip and retorted, “It’s not me! How many women have you brought back? They are also suspects. Don’t blame me!”
“You never intended to fulfill your promise to marry me! What do you take me for?”
Lin Shan was foolish enough to argue with him. Meanwhile, Mr. Cui only wanted to get the money back as soon as possible. He ignored her nonsense and pulled at her clothes, searching for the bank card in her pockets!
As the two of them argued, the door to the villa was suddenly kicked open.
A few imposing men dressed in casual clothes, but who still held a military bearing, stepped through the door and stared at Mr. Cui.
“The children are gone. Were there any other witnesses when you took the children away that day?”
“Think carefully. Did anyone else know that they were at the villa?”
Mr. Cui stuttered in fear but shook his head profusely. He clasped his hands together nervously and respectfully, not daring to appear impertinent. “Sir, I was definitely not discovered!”
“I always carry out my tasks discreetly! How could the children go missing?”
The man signaled to his subordinates, who immediately grabbed Mr. Cui by the collar and threw him out!
Mr. Cui’s spine hit the hard corner of a desk, and the pain of his broken bones made him wail. “Ah… let me go… I really didn’t…”
However, the other party had no intention of stopping. He kicked Mr. Cui’s chest and saw a few drops of blood dribbled out from the corner of his mouth.
“Stop!”
After beating him up for a while, the man gave an order and his subordinates retreated two steps with their hands behind their backs, with Mr. Cui still trapped in the middle.
The leader squatted down, his eyes narrowed threateningly.
“Do you remember now? Did anyone else see it?”
Lin Shan screamed in fright. Seeing that Mr. Cui was barely breathing, she rushed over to help him up. “Stop beating him, please stop it! I’ll tell you!”
“It was Qiu Tong! When Qiu Tong came to find me, I told her…”
“What? So it was you who betrayed me!”
Mr. Cui widened his eyes, clutching at his broken ribs. He ignored the pain and got up to give her a tight slap!
Smack!
A slap mark appeared on Lin Shan’s face but she didn’t dare to retort.
Mr. Cui turned around and smiled ingratiatingly. “Look, it’s all because of this b*tch. I really didn’t know, everyone…”
The man glanced at him contemptuously. After getting Qiu Tong’s address, he rushed straight to her residence without hesitation.
However, as soon as they entered, they were met with five imposing mercenaries.
“Damn it, there’s really someone who dares to snatch our wards from us!”
Ke Le took out a gun from his waist, and the muscles on his face tensed such that he looked extremely ferocious. “Brothers, show me how fearsome you can be! Go!”
These were professional mercenaries trained on the battlefield. Their murderous aura naturally surpassed that of others!
They did not care about their lives, but the other party could not afford to be careless. In just three to five minutes, the other party showed signs of fatigue and scattered.
Qiu Tong locked the three children in the room and came out to fight. She went straight for the leader and kicked him over with her leg. She grabbed his head and slammed it onto the ground.
She looked coldly at the blood dripping down the back of his head. She tugged at his hair and whispered into his ear.
“Go back and tell your lieutenant not to come near my children again!”
“If he dares to take my children, I will let him have a taste of his own medicine one day! Do not doubt my words!”
Qiu Tong’s tone was sinister, and the other party widened his eyes in shock.
She did not say anything else and directly instructed the mercenaries to throw those men out of the door before repairing and strengthening their intruder alert mechanisms.
Qiu Tong opened the door and saw that the three brats had their ears pressed against the door, eavesdropping on the battle outside. They seemed very nervous.
She smirked. “Looks like you’re worried about me?”
“…”
Qiu Xingyuan turned his face away awkwardly. “Stop dreaming.”
Qiu Tong, “…”
Was this really her biological son?
Qiu Xingyu asked, “Mommy won, right?”
Qiu Tong’s heart softened when she saw Qiu Xingyu’s sparkling eyes. She hugged her and gave her a peck on the cheek. She raised her eyebrows smugly. “Of course!”
Qiu Xingqiao stared at her with a burning gaze. He was obviously envious of her powerful abilities but was too embarrassed to speak because he had failed to take their earlier training seriously.
Qiu Tong understood and pointed to a few sandbags in the corner.
“Carry a heavy load and squat 300 times a day. After seven days, I’ll teach you a few moves.”
“Will do!”
The children were elated and nodded in unison!

chapters.title: Chapter 45 - Looking for Trouble
chapters.content:
Chapter 45: Looking for Trouble
Outside, the soldiers helped their injured leader to a safe spot before calling Lieutenant Xiao Zhen, who was waiting in the villa.
“Reporting, Sir. The children are protected by a group of powerful mercenaries. We can’t get close.”
“Trash! A bunch of good-for-nothings!”
Xiao Zhen reprimanded them before hanging up the phone in a huff.
He did not expect that this stupid woman, who was rumored to only care about money, had become so smart and powerful that she could actually finish off the people he sent.
Could the rumors have been wrong?
It looked like they had to rely on their wits now, and not just clash head-on with Qiu Tong!
…
In the kindergarten, the children trailed after Qiu Xingyu and the other two like a pack of dogs, stealing glances at Ke Le…
The mercenaries kept a straight face as they watched the naughty brats prod them with their fingers. The kids were so envious that they started salivating. They shouted, “Wow! They’re mercenaries! So powerful!”
Qiu Xingqiao lifted his small face proudly, his eyes full of pride.
Little Yu stood on her tiptoes and called out to Qiu Tong, “Goodbye, Mommy!”
Qiu Tong waved and sighed. She touched her empty wallet and turned to go and make money to support her family.
Outside the clinic, the boss squatted under the sign with his head in his hands. When he sensed that someone was there, he said without looking up.
“Leave. The miracle doctor isn’t here!”
“I’m here.”
Qiu Tong suppressed her laughter and pushed open the door. She saw two pots of green plants in front of the curtain separating the office area, as if waiting for her to return…
“Aiyo! You’re finally here! I thought you weren’t coming anymore!”
When the boss saw that it was her, his attitude instantly improved. He moved the ladder over and hung the banner that said “Miracle Doctor, Treats All Illnesses”!
Qiu Tong stood by the side of the road and saw an anxious young man carrying an elderly man on his back. They were hurrying toward another clinic at the end of the street.
The old man’s face was pale, and he seemed to be in dire straits. He could not afford to waste another minute.
She frowned and stopped him. “The patient’s condition is not good. Don’t move him about too much. Stop carrying him around.”
The young man was a little flustered. “Then what should we do? I have to bring Grandfather for treatment!”
Qiu Tong moved and revealed the clinic’s sign behind her. “This is a clinic. Bring your grandfather in. I can see him.”
“…Alright!”
The young man looked hesitantly at the end of the street. Gritting his teeth, he carried his grandfather into the clinic.
A gangster standing on the street with a toothpick in his mouth saw this and spat.
“Damn it, this clinic again! They’re stealing my sister’s business! Let’s go, we’ll teach them a lesson later!”
Inside the clinic, the young man clenched his fists nervously. He took out all the money from his pockets and spoke with a trembling voice.
“Please save my grandfather!”
Qiu Tong lifted the old man’s clothes and discovered that there was a wound on his abdomen. The wound had not been properly treated and was infected with pus which resulted in his current critical condition…
Using her silver needles as a conductor, she used her supernatural power to slowly scrape away the festering flesh. She made the wound stop bleeding and then bandaged it.
Qiu Tong watched as the old man’s breathing gradually stabilized and said, “It’s done.”
The young man widened his eyes. “You’re really a miracle doctor! I spent thousands of dollars in the other clinic, but Grandpa’s condition just kept getting worse.”
It turned out that they had ended up delaying proper treatment because of those quack doctors.
The young man thanked her repeatedly. She wiped the silver needles with a cotton cloth and waited for the next patient. However, she heard a commotion at the door…
A few tough-looking men carried in a stretcher with a man screaming in pain. They set him on the ground.
“Miracle doctor? Hurry up and take a look at my brother. If he can’t be cured, I’ll destroy your shop! What kind of bullshit signboard is that? It’s all a lie!”
His loud voice attracted a lot of onlookers.
Qiu Tong frowned, sensing his hostility. She examined the sick man’s body. His face was ruddy, and there was nothing wrong with his muscles or bones. What was wrong with him?
They were obviously here to cause trouble and were just using him as an excuse!
She smirked and said, “He’s not sick. Leave now. Don’t obstruct my consultations.”
One of the boorish men rolled up his sleeves. “Bah! A quack! My brother is already in so much pain! How can he not be sick? Don’t tell me he’s just pretending?”
Qiu Tong saw that they were unwilling to give up. She placed her fingers on the “patient’s” ankle and twisted it forcefully…
“Ah!”
His fake wailing was instantly raised by an entire octave. He was in so much pain that his entire body was twitching and he was sweating profusely.
The boorish man looked a little anxious. “What are you doing!”
Qiu Tong looked up, exuding an oppressive and cold aura. “Since you want to create trouble, you should put on a better act. Don’t expose any flaws. Carry him away. It’s just a dislocation, it can still be fixed…”
The boorish man pointed at Qiu Tong and the boss and hollered. “Do you know who you’ve offended?”
“My sister is Mayor Shen’s relative! This isn’t over! Just you wait, don’t try to run away. I’ll make you suffer!”

chapters.title: Chapter 46 - Unemployed
chapters.content:
Chapter 46: Unemployed
Qiu Tong rubbed her wrists indifferently, not taking them seriously.
The boorish man carried his injured friend back to the clinic at the end of the street. He shouted angrily. “Sister! That clinic doesn’t know its place! Tell Mayor Shen to destroy them! I don’t know where this bullshit miracle doctor came from and how much business she has already stolen from us!”
“They are showing you utter disrespect!”
Hearing this, a woman in a white coat swept a bunch of medicine all over the floor. “It’s that b*tch again! I’m going to get her kicked out of the clinic!”
At night, in a room on a round bed in the hotel, the air was filled with the scent of love.
Mayor Shen was so tired that he collapsed on the bed. He hugged his lover and patted her butt.
The woman snuggled in his arms and said, “My dear, someone is bullying me! Are you going to do something about it? I don’t know where this swindling woman came from. She stole my business and even hit my people!”
“She obviously doesn’t respect you! She clearly knows that I’m yours…”
She deliberately provoked as her hands continued teasing him.
Mayor Shen’s eyes were bloodshot. He flipped over and pinned the woman down while panting heavily. He promised. “Serve me well tonight. Tomorrow, I’ll send some people over to settle them!”
The next day, when Qiu Tong arrived at the clinic from the kindergarten, she saw a few police officers putting a seal on the door…
When the boss saw her, he quickly ran over quietly and said bitterly, “The clinic is closed for business.”
“They claim that the environment does not meet hygiene standards. I tried a bit of bribery and heard that… it was because I hired a non-licensed staff.”
He stole a glance at Qiu Tong’s face and said frankly, “I’m guessing you offended some higher-ups yesterday. You definitely can’t continue practicing medicine.”
Although the boss hoped that he could keep this miracle doctor, he had no choice but to let her go if he wished to continue his business!
After pondering for a long time, he was finally forced to tell Qiu Tong that she need not come to the clinic in the future…
Having lost her job, Qiu Tong frowned worriedly. Thinking of the three little kids at home and the five greedy mercenaries, she felt a headache coming on.
At noon, the whole family sat at the dining table. The table was filled with vegetables.
Qiu Tong ate the stir-fried vegetables without any restraint, not forgetting to select a few nutritious leafy vegetables and placing them in the children’s bowls. Ke Le was stunned by the sight of Qiu Tong and the three children digging into their food.
There were two rice grains at the corner of Little Yu’s mouth. She looked up at him and asked in a childish voice, “Uncle, why aren’t you eating?”
“If you don’t eat now, you’ll go hungry!”
Ke Le and his men looked at each other. Not wanting to disappoint the little angels, they could only take up their chopsticks and dig into their food…
Qiu Xingyuan and the other two had a hard life before. To be able to fill their stomachs with white rice alone would have been good enough for them.
But Ke Le was a carnivorous mercenary. If he couldn’t eat meat, how would he have the strength?
He picked up two vegetable leaves, chewing and swallowing with difficulty. His face was pale.
“Boss, can our food… be slightly better?”
