Ke Le went into the kitchen and took the initiative to wash the bowls for Qiu Tong. His thick arms holding onto the small porcelain bowls looked rather comical.
The baskets on the floor were filled with the cheapest vegetables. Ke Le felt dizzy just looking at them…
Qiu Tong was also helpless. Seeing that Qiu Xingqiao had led Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingyu Bao to exercise their bodies, she said, “I have spent all my money to hire you. Where would I get the spare cash to buy meat? I just lost my job today too. Life is tough!”
Especially now that the children’s bodies were still growing, they couldn’t go back to catching mice and birds to eat!
Qiu Tong was fretting as she plucked at the vegetables to vent her frustration. Where could she find a job to earn money?
Why not try the boxing ring again?
Ke Le was taken aback by her words. He had been impressed by Qiu Tong’s skills and had never expected her to lack money!
He suggested to Qiu Tong, “With your ability, you can try accepting missions from the Dark Web! The rewards are very high!”
“We saw recently that there is a high-paying local contract to protect important persons and eliminate terrorists…”
“But to be honest, that mission is definitely dangerous and not as easy as protecting some children! That’s why we didn’t take it on!”
Ke Le scratched his head foolishly. Qiu Tong’s eyes lit up as if she could see a large wad of cash waving at her.
With great interest, she peppered Ke Le with questions about the process of accepting missions from the Dark Web before running back to her room. She entered the Dark Web and went straight to the special mission!
According to the communication method provided by the Dark Web, Qiu Ying dialed the other party’s number. After a few seconds of the dialing tone, she tapped the screen lightly with her fingers and narrowed her eyes.
“Hello?”
The voice on the other end sounded extremely metallic, but Qiu Tong found it rather familiar. She stared at the Dark Web mission. “I’m here to apply to be a personal bodyguard…”

chapters.title: Chapter 47 - Personal Bodyguard
chapters.content:
Chapter 47: Personal Bodyguard
“Personal bodyguard? Sorry, we don’t want women.”
The other party was about to hang up, but Qiu Tong suddenly said, “The Dark Web rules state that only those who fail the test can be disqualified. You want to dismiss me with just a few words? I’m going to report you! You won’t be able to issue missions on the Dark Web anymore!”
“Your stubborn mindset needs to be changed. Why do you think women are inferior to men?”
Qiu Tong lowered her voice and said bluntly, “Give me a chance to prove my strength. If I don’t meet your standards… you can do whatever you want with me then!”
The other party remained silent for a long time before agreeing to meet her.
Qiu Tong followed the address she received and rushed to the villa hidden in the forest. The bodyguards covered her eyes with a black cloth and brought her through layers of guards and searches, before finally arriving at the guest room.
Qiu Tong removed the black cloth and was secretly amazed. It seemed like he was really a big shot!
Click!
The door was open from the outside, and a long shadow stepped in. When their eyes met, both parties were so shocked that their mouths gaped.
“It’s you?”
“Why is it you!”
Qiu Tong did not expect the interviewee to be Shao An!
She recalled that “Song Yan” had helped her at the lieutenant’s villa. She had to repay this favor!
Qiu Tong waved her hand and suggested, “We’re all friends, so we can discuss a 10% discount on the fee! That’s nice enough of me, right?”
“It can’t be any cheaper! I have three children to raise, and life is tough!”
Qiu Tong saw that Shao An was about to say something but stopped himself. She quickly started stretching and asked, “Do you want to spar with me to test me?”
Shao An had a strange expression as he shook his head and said, “No need. Come with me.”
Qiu Tong was indeed skilled, but her status…
Shao An knocked lightly on the door. Jin Yang stood in front of the French windows, his black shirt unbuttoned. He turned around and met Qiu Tong’s almond-shaped eyes. He was extremely surprised.
“She’s the one who accepted the Dark Web mission.”
Shao An explained. Jin Yang’s pupils constricted. He pressed his thumb lightly on his palm and frowned.
The terrorists had attacked him ruthlessly several times in the past. They hid in the dark like ghosts, and as his personal bodyguard, she had to protect him with her life when necessary…
He didn’t want anything to happen to Qiu Tong.
A strong desire to protect surged in Jin Yang’s heart, and he rejected her bluntly, “You won’t do.”
“Why?”
Qiu Tong was dissatisfied. She threw her coat to the ground and said with a determined look, “Why don’t we spar?”
“Standard rules. If I lose, I’ll scram.”
“If I win, the bodyguard position is mine!”
A strange emotion flashed across Jin Yang’s eyes. He twisted an antique porcelain bottle and a wall slowly rose, revealing the boxing ring hidden inside.
Qiu Tong leaped onto the stage. She used her teeth to fasten her boxing gloves. She tilted her head at Jin Yang, before crouching back like a cheetah and attacking his abdomen!
Jin Yang shifted his feet and successfully dodged two seconds before she made contact.
“Stop insisting! This job is not suitable for you.”
“If you need money, I can…”
Qiu Tong’s eyes glimmered. Taking advantage of the moment when Jin Yang let down his guard, she bent her elbow and used a feint to deceive him into counterattacking.
In the next second, she pressed Jin Yang down with all her weight and pinned him to the ground. She straddled his waist and forced him into immobility.
Shao An was below the stage. When he saw the two people entangled together, he quietly looked away.
Did… did Jin Yang deliberately give in to her?
“Have we… met before?”
Against the light, Jin Yang looked at her blurry silhouette and found it extremely familiar. The fragrance that drifted over seemed to engulf his sealed memories.
He tried his best to think about it. Intense pain filled his entire body in an instant, causing him to shut his eyes tightly and breathe heavily.
Qiu Tong felt his pain and relaxed her hold slightly. However, she did not expect Jin Yang to take the opportunity to gain the upper hand and pin her down.
Jin Yang held her hands above her head, a smile on his lips.
Qiu Tong struggled and cursed, “You cheated!”
Jin Yang smiled and said softly, “You’ve lost!”
Qiu Tong lowered her eyes and bit her red lips as if she had been wronged. Her proud chest heaved up and down as she breathed heavily, causing Jin Yang’s throat to tighten and his blood to gather below the waist. He was afraid of hurting her, so he loosened his grip…
Now!
A crafty look flashed across Qiu Tong’s eyes as she suddenly bent her knee and struck his vital point.
Jin Yang dodged to the side, wanting to control Qiu Tong again. He looked up and saw the sharp hair clip she was holding at his neck…
Qiu Tong crouched down in front of him. She heard Shao An running up the stage in a panic. Her red lips moved to his ear as she spoke softly.
“I won!”

chapters.title: Chapter 48 - Money
chapters.content:
Chapter 48: Money
Disregarding the outcome, Jin Yang’s thoughts were in a mess.
Qiu Tong leaned against the ropes of the ring, proudly curling the ends of her hair around her fingertips. She lifted her head proudly and heroically, the familiar expression causing Jin Yang so much pain that he couldn’t breathe.
He placed a hand over his heart and knelt on one knee. But he then suddenly grabbed Qiu Ying’s wrist!
“What’s the matter?”
Qiu Tong lowered her eyes in bewilderment. When she met his blank and helpless gaze, her heart trembled.
Jin Yang panted heavily and asked, “Have we… really never met before?”
It seemed that he would ask the same question every time they met.
Qiu Tong simply thought that he looked like the children, but he did not exist in her memory at all. She shook her head firmly. “No.”
Jin Yang lowered his eyes and looked away. He propped himself up on the ground, his expression gradually returning to its usual coldness.
He used a silk handkerchief to wipe the dust on his fingertips. He looked up and said in the tone of an employer, “We want to eliminate terrorists, who use cruel methods and have unpredictable whereabouts. Their numbers are unknown, but the operation is extremely dangerous.”
Qiu Tong’s reply was extremely serious. “I know, the Dark Web has the mission information.”
Jin Yang cleared his throat at her unexpected frankness. With a conflicted expression, he reminded her, “Are you not afraid of death?”
Qiu Tong suddenly realized what he was thinking and smiled faintly. “They can’t hurt me.”
What kind of confidence was this! What arrogance!
Jin Yang thought of all the strange things about her and asked, “Do you know a lot about terrorists? Perhaps, you’ve been to places like research labs?”
Qiu Tong shook her head. She had never come into contact with terrorists before, but post-apocalyptic zombies were much harder to deal with than terrorists!
Her eyes were clear as she asked, “Aren’t they just ordinary people with two hands and two legs?”
“Don’t tell me their stamina is a hundred times stronger than an ordinary person?”
“…”
Shao An listened to her nonsense in shock and stared at Jin Yang with an unfathomable expression…
Jin Yang was amused by her frank yet ignorant attitude. He walked over to the desk with deliberation, opened the drawer and took out a checkbook. He scribbled down a string of numbers and handed it to Qiu Tong.
“I admit that you have super strong combat abilities, but you know nothing about our operation against the enemy. As such, you have no chance of winning!”
“I’ll give you $300,000. Take it and do what you want with it.”
Qiu Tong kept the check without hesitation and patted his shoulder. “Of course I have to do something after receiving the money. Don’t worry, I won’t be a burden!”
“One more person means one more helping hand!”
Jin Yang couldn’t help but laugh at her words. He shook his head and wanted to persuade her to give up, but Qiu Tong insisted that she couldn’t accept money for nothing.
“If you refuse, I will just hide outside the villa and follow you to destroy the terrorist organization!”
“Since I am already involved now, why don’t we go through the battle tactics for the operation together?”
Qiu Tong’s stubborn attitude made Jin Yang frown. In the end, he reluctantly agreed to let her stay and join the operation.
But Jin Yang reminded her, “Safety above all. Don’t just charge forward…”
Qiu Tong agreed perfunctorily, but in her heart, she was planning to kill a few more terrorists. After the matter was settled, she would ask Jin Yang for more money!
Her eyes darted around and a wicked smile appeared on her lips. She had accurately hit Jin Yang’s weak spot, causing him to lose focus.
Qiu Tong returned home and packed her things, preparing to move to Jin Yang’s villa for a week.
She called the children over and rubbed their heads. She said, “Mommy has some things to do and needs to leave for a few days. You guys stay at home obediently. You’re not allowed to quarrel with your kindergarten friends. You’re not allowed to run away!”
She turned to look at Ke Le and said calmly, “Take good care of them!”
Ke Le slapped his hand to his chest to reassure her.
Little Yu raised her head and hugged Qiu Tong’s waist, asking her with a clingy voice, “Mommy, where are you going? Can you bring us along?”
The mission was dangerous. Qiu Tong didn’t want the children to worry about her. With Qiu Xingqiao’s personality, he might follow her secretly.
As she thought about it, she casually fabricated a lie and coaxed, “Mommy is going to borrow some money from a relative. When I return, I will buy a doll for Little Yu and lots of meat for you guys to eat!”
Qiu Xingyuan stood in a corner and looked at her with a dark expression. He bit his lips and said with difficulty, “Can you… not leave?”
“A while ago, you asked me to study the locust pesticide. There’s already some progress.”
“If there really is a locust plague, we can earn a lot of money…”
Qiu Xingyuan clenched his fists and lowered his head, so that no one could see the emotions in his eyes.
Sensing his reluctance, Qiu Xingqiao looked at his elder brother and said crisply, “Mommy will be back soon!”

chapters.title: Chapter 49 - Leaving Home
chapters.content:
Chapter 49: Leaving Home
“Be good! The more money we have, the better things will be. Mommy has already agreed to help…”
Qiu Tong nearly blurted out the truth. But disappointment flashed across Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes as he looked at her. He stubbornly pursed his lips and turned away, not saying anything else.
Holding Little Yu’s hand, Qiu Xingqiao saw Qiu Tong to the door. His eyes were filled with reluctance.
Qiu Tong’s eyes were gentle as she hugged the two kids and kissed their cheeks with a smile.
She looked up and saw Qiu Xingyuan standing at the door with a cold expression, as if he did not want to talk to her at all. She guessed that he might be angry, but she could not figure out what was going on in his little head.
Qiu Tong sighed helplessly and said, “Take care of your brother and sister for Mommy.”
Qiu Xingyuan’s little face was all scrunched up, and his shoulders were stiff as he spat out a few words, “Do I still need you to tell me that?”
Qiu Tong stood up. Carrying a backpack full of clothes, she hurried towards the main entrance.
“Goodbye, Mommy! Come back soon!”
A luxury car was parked at the entrance of the courtyard. Qiu Tong entered and Little Yu ran down the steps with tears in her eyes. She chased after the car and shouted twice.
“Mommy… Mommy!”
When Jin Yang heard the voice, he turned his head with a strange expression. He seemed to be scanning the area with his mind, but all he saw was an empty district.
He looked away and fixed his gaze on Qiu Tong fiddling with a few peculiar-looking wrist guards, knee guards, and self-made weapons. “You have very few things…”
In his impression, women always carried countless luggage when they traveled.
Qiu Tong misunderstood his question. She pressed down on the mechanism on her wrist guard, revealing a few sharp barbs. She raised her hand and said softly, “Weapons need to be simple but refined. The important thing is that it can save your life. Do you guys like to carry weights when carrying out missions?”
Jin Yang rubbed his temples and simply shook his head in silence.
Qiu Tong shrugged. After just half an hour, she started to miss the three children at home…
At home, the children hung their heads.
Holding a milk bottle, Qiu Xingyu ran to Qiu Xingyuan’s side. She tugged at the corner of his clothes. “Elder Brother, why are you unhappy? Do you miss Mommy?”
“Little Yu misses Mommy too. When will she be back?”
She was not coming back!
Qiu Xingyuan thought silently in his heart, but he could not bear to tell Qiu Xingyu that their mother had abandoned them again.
Ever since the fall of the Qiu family, their relatives had cut off all contact with them and were too lazy to bother with them. They would avoid them even if they met them on the streets.
But Qiu Tong said she was going to borrow money from them?
She must have been lying!
Perhaps Qiu Tong had found a new boyfriend and the other party was unwilling to accept her children, so she chose to abandon them!
Qiu Xingyuan secretly clenched his fists and swore that he would take good care of his younger siblings!
…
In the villa, Jin Yang accompanied Qiu Tong to walk around and familiarize herself with the environment.
Butler Gao De rushed over and dragged Shao An into a storage room. Seeing that no one was following them, he asked in a low voice.
“Sir actually brought a woman back?”
Shao An nodded.
Gao De muttered in disbelief, “Impossible!”
Shao An pursed his lips and reminded him, “I’m also very surprised, but tell all the servants in the villa that she is his personal bodyguard. Don’t go around spreading gossip!”
Gao De responded perfunctorily, his thoughts involuntarily drifting back to some years ago. He furrowed his brow.
Jin Yang once had a lover whom he loved deeply. It had been an extremely secretive matter, so secretive that only he knew about it…
But seven years ago, on a stormy night, Jin Yang dragged his heavily injured body back to the villa. He had a high fever and was unconscious for a few days. When he finally woke up, he never mentioned her again.
Gao De had tried several times to probe, but Jin Yang’s reaction was as if he had completely forgotten that there was a lover in his life. He was now only obsessed with government affairs…
All these years, there had been countless women who had tried to climb into Jin Yang’s bed, but he had never gotten close to any of them.
Gao De even suspected that he had a psychological problem, but now… he actually brought a woman back?
Would she be an exception?
Gao De was immersed in his memories when he was awakened by a deep voice…
“Butler Gao.”
“This is Qiu Tong.”
Jin Yang and Qiu Tong had returned and he offered a simple introduction.
Qiu Tong nodded as she surveyed the luxurious interior of the villa. She clicked her tongue in admiration. He was indeed rich!
Gao De sized up Qiu Tong and unexpectedly discovered that she was allowed to stand within Jin Yang’s personal space!
Gao De met Qiu Tong’s probing gaze and smiled apologetically. He put away his doubts and looked at Jin Yang, asking respectfully, “Sir, I’ll arrange for someone to tidy up the guest room and temporarily arrange for Miss Qiu to stay there. What do you think?”

chapters.title: Chapter 50 - In The Same Room
chapters.content:
Chapter 50: In The Same Room
“No, I want to stay with him.”
Qiu Tong pointed at Jin Yang, not the least bit shy or bashful.
Her experience in the post-apocalyptic era told her that as a personal bodyguard, she should be with her employer at all times. Otherwise, if zombies attacked at night, they would break into the bedroom through the window, and she would not be able to protect her employer!
Contrary to her calm attitude, countless thoughts flashed through Shao An’s mind as he looked at Qiu Tong with a complicated expression.
Gao De quietly sized up Jin Yang. Surprisingly, he did not reject Qiu Tong’s request. Instead, his thin lips curled into a smile.
Shao An narrowed his eyes and sized up Qiu Tong’s appearance and figure. The more he thought about it, the more he felt that something was amiss. He suspected that she had some ulterior motive and was deliberately trying to get close to Jin Yang!
Qiu Tong understood what Shao An and Gao De were worried about. She walked upstairs with her backpack, calling out in a mocking tone.
“I have no intention of finding a stepfather for my children for the time being… Hey, which room do you live in?”
Gao De, “!!!”
Shao An, “…”
Gao De could not hide his shock and secretly quietly calmed his anxious heart when he heard that Qiu Tong had children.
Jin Yang took out two bottles of fine red wine from the wine cellar and poured them into the decanter, gently swirling it as he admired the dense bubbles…
Gao De understood his tacit approval and took the initiative to lead Qiu Tong to Jin Yang’s spacious suite-style room.
Shao An looked at Qiu Tong’s increasingly outrageous behavior and wanted to stop her. “Sir, her identity is suspicious. You can’t let her behave so wantonly…”
Jin Yang’s voice was cold and carried a commanding tone that could not be refuted. “Just do your own part well.”
“You have no right to interfere with my decision!”
Shao An stood rooted to the ground. His expression changed slightly before he lowered his head and replied, “Yes, I understand.”
At night, Jin Yang had already fallen asleep. Qiu Tong changed into a set of casual sportswear and sat cross-legged on the sofa outside, flipping through the small sketchbook she carried with her.
This contained the drawings which Qiu Xingyu had done in the kindergarten’s drawing class. The lines were crooked and the colors were mixed haphazardly, such that it was impossible to tell what she was drawing. Nevertheless, Qiu Tong still admired it endlessly, as if she was holding Picasso’s own sketches…
The clock on the clock pointed to one in the morning. Muted knocking noises could be heard inside Jin Yang’s house.
Qiu Tong picked up a baseball bat and quietly pushed the door open. She checked that the doors and windows were all tightly shut and no strangers had sneaked in.
On his Morandi-colored bed, Jin Yang was frowning as if he was deep in the throes of a nightmare. There seemed to be an intense chase in his dream. He kept waving his hands, which knocked against the bedside table several times, creating the noise which Qiu Tong heard.
Qiu Tong watched him from the end of the bed. She had found the source of the sounds.
She was a little conflicted. Protecting her employer shouldn’t include helping him chase away nightmares, right?
“…Don’t go!”
Jin Yang muttered, his cold and handsome face revealing a hint of helplessness. From time to time, he would raise his hand, as if wanting to grab something.
Qiu Tong’s heart softened. She walked to the bed and used her fingertips to gently smooth his furrowed brows.
“He looks strong and stubborn. I didn’t expect him to be so fragile in his dreams… what is he dreaming about? Zombies?”
She mumbled to herself as she patted Jin Yang’s shoulder half-heartedly.
In the next second, Jin Yang seemed to have sensed something. He grabbed her wrist and pulled her onto the bed. He leaned over and wrapped his arms and legs around her in an embrace, before burying his head in her neck as if seeking warmth and comfort.
Qiu Tong’s body stiffened. She wanted to push him away, but realized that Jin Yang’s strength in this dream-like state was astonishing!
Jin Yang murmured in a daze, craving the warmth of her body. He kept asking, “Where did you go? Why… did you leave me behind!”
Qiu Tong couldn’t understand him. She frowned and waved her hand in front of his eyes, confirming that he was still asleep.
“Let go of me!”
Qiu Tong wanted to break free from his restraint, but every time she tried to pry his fingers away, Jin Yang would hug her even more tightly…
Qiu Tong had to face up to reality and resign herself to fate. She lightly patted Jin Yang back and hummed a lullaby which she used to coax Little Yu to sleep…
“I won’t leave you behind, I promise.”
Gradually, she could not keep her eyes open any longer and also fell into a deep sleep.
The next morning, Qiu Tong and Jin Yang woke up at the same time. They looked at each other in their embrace, before jumping apart as if they had been electrocuted!
Qiu Tong explained, “You were the one who held onto me last night and forbade me from leaving.”
Jin Yang couldn’t remember anything at all. Every once in a while, he would have the same nightmare, chasing after the back of a woman he would never be able to touch. He rubbed his aching temples and was about to say something when the door was pushed open…
Shao An held some documents in his hand and wanted to report to Jin Yang about important matters, but he saw them sitting on the bed together!
“Sir?!”

chapters.title: Chapter 51 - Action
chapters.content:
Chapter 51: Action
Jin Yang was stunned for a moment before he pulled the bedsheet to cover up Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong fiddled with her messy hair. From the corner of her eye, she saw Jin Yang buttoning up the top few buttons of his shirt. His actions were suave and charming.
Shao An sized them up with a complicated gaze. He was clearly conjuring up some intense and amorous images.
Qiu Tong coughed lightly and tried to explain, but was interrupted by the person beside her…
Jin Yang coldly glanced at Shao An. “Speak.”
Shao An was stunned. He looked away and respectfully lowered his eyes. He held the document with both hands. “All the military forces that can be deployed around the residential building and the two sides of the street are already stationed there. They can attack terrorists at any time…”
“As for the underground boxing arena, it’s been taken care of on the grounds that it has already been closed down. There’s no controversy or suspicion at the moment.”
Jin Yang nodded, flipping through the documents with his slender fingers.
Qiu Tong leaned over curiously and pressed her body against his arm.
A milky fragrance wafted into Jin Yang’s nose, causing his breathing to halt for a moment. He subconsciously pushed the map in front of her so that she could look at it.
Qiu Tong quickly memorized the information and connected the clues together. She finally understood why he had gone to the underground boxing arena to watch the matches that day.
Below the boxing arena was a human trafficking den, which was closely linked to terrorists!
Jin Yang’s throat tightened and he said in a hoarse voice, “Gather all the elite soldiers at the exit. We will take action at the predetermined time tonight…”
After he said that, he looked at Shao An who was still standing at the door and narrowed his eyes impatiently. “Is there anything else?”
Shao An hurriedly shook his head and turned around, before walking off with stiff steps, closing the bedroom door.
In the confined space, both of them felt somewhat awkward.
Qiu Tong picked up the pillow that had been thrown onto the floor and looked at his furrowed brows. The side profile of his thin lips looked somewhat bewildered and adorable. She asked curiously, “You had a nightmare last night, remember? I think you were looking for someone.”
Jin Yang’s profound eyes were slightly closed and his mind was blank. “I don’t remember.”
Qiu Tong shrugged and stopped asking.
…
Late at night, Jin Yang sat in a heavily armored SUV and parked in an alley two streets away from the underground boxing arena.
Qiu Tong examined the weapons and equipment. She deftly wrapped her hands with hand wraps.
Jin Yang passed a bulletproof vest to her and said with an unfathomable expression, “These terrorists are very vicious. If you encounter danger, hide at the back. Remember, safety first.”
Qiu Tong placed the bulletproof vest over his body and chuckled valiantly. “My mission is to protect you. Don’t worry! I am lucky and won’t die!”
She seemed to have an innate self-confidence that was dazzling and captivating.
Jin Yang recalled the vague female voice he heard when he was shot. He held her wrist and asked, “You…”
Was she a successful product of the human modification plan?
He did not say this out loud. Shao An stood in front of the vehicle and knocked lightly on the glass window. He informed Jin Yang via the communication system.
“It’s time, Chief.”
Jin Yang retracted his gaze and took a deep breath before pushing the car door open. “Move out.”
He issued an order and all the armed soldiers rushed into the first level of the basement in the corner of the street. Apart from some broken tables and chairs, there were only a few human traffickers who tried to resist. The soldiers easily surrounded and controlled them, before making their way into the floor below.
The few electric lights in the stairwell flickered. An old fan creaked.
Qiu Tong followed Jin Yang closely, protecting him.
Shao An held his gun and pushed open the door with his left hand. Instantly, countless people rushed out from inside…
They used their bodies as shields, both young and old. Their eyes were empty but filled with fear as they advanced. The soldiers were stunned for a moment. They took out their guns and prepared to fire indiscriminately.
Jin Yang’s eyes were locked on them. He could sense that this group of commoners were not equipped with weapons and were being used by others!
He immediately shouted, “Halt all fire! Protect the civilians!”
In the next second, an old man with tattered clothes and white hair staggered forward at Jin Yang.
He opened his hands and was about to touch the corner of Jin Yang’s clothes. He muttered in terror, “Save me! Sir, save me…”
Did he know Jin Yang?
Qiu Tong heard a strange beeping sound from the old man!
Something was amiss!
She lowered her eyes and saw the red numbers and wires on his waist. She quickly pushed the old man away and shouted, “Be careful! There’s a bomb! Stay away from them!”
Thanks to her warning, all the soldiers became vigilant and restrained the wandering civilians.
Qiu Tong immediately pounced towards Jin Yang, protecting him with her body and using her arms to shield his head…

chapters.title: Chapter 52 - Decryption
chapters.content:
Chapter 52: Decryption
Bang!
The bomb was detonated and the heatwave from the explosion pushed Jin Yang and Qiu Tong to a corner.
Jin Yang’s pupils constricted. Qiu Tong was in his arms and their lips were pressed against each other through their masks.
Multiple explosions rang out one after another in the second level basement. With this method, the lives of countless civilians were used to attack the soldiers. The military unit suffered heavy losses.
There was a burnt smell in the air and tattered clothes were scattered on the ground.
The remaining soldiers bypassed the iron gate and barged in. Where were the terrorists?
There were only a few iron cages left behind, that reeked of blood, as well as some abandoned firearms.
They gritted their teeth in frustration. The ambush plan that they had planned for days had failed.
Qiu Tong stood up awkwardly and helped Jinyang up. She followed Shao An to check the scene.
The old man who had attacked Jin Yang had his limbs torn apart due to the explosion of the bomb. The scene was tragic. Qiu Tong used her leg to kick the corpse on the ground and discovered that a woman in the corner was still breathing weakly…
Qiu Tong covered her most critical wound with her hand and used her special ability to heal her, so that her life would be out of danger for the time being.
She restrained the person and asked, “Who kidnapped you all? Why did you agree to become a human bomb? Cooperate with us and I will ensure that you can leave safely. You can change your name and welcome a new life.”
“They are terrorists! The organization is huge, the division of labor is clear, there are also the lookouts…”
“There are many secret exits in this building. If there is any disturbance, they can quickly retreat and escape.”
“They carry out a lot of human trafficking. They kidnap us to sell and keep us in cages. If there’s an emergency, they’ll kick us out and send us to our deaths. They are just betting on the fact that you won’t shoot…”
Qiu Tong frowned as Jin Yang listened to her narration with a dark expression.
Shao An took stock of the scene and handed the woman two slices of bread.
She ate ravenously and said in a daze, “Oh right! They also have special staff to brainwash some of the captured folks so that they are willing to be used.”
Qiu Tong looked down and realized that the terrorist group had an extremely tight management system that would be difficult to break through from the outside.
If they wanted to force an attack, they would have to face the problem of innocent civilians getting injured.
She recalled one of the methods to surround a group of zombies during the apocalypse and had the idea of pretending to be human traffickers and infiltrating a terrorist organization.
“Are the movements of the kidnapped people limited to this building? Is there no way to leave?”
Qiu Tong threw out an inexplicable question. The woman shook her head and calmed herself down. Pointing at an electronic ankle device around her ankle, she said, “Only high-level kidnapped people who have been brainwashed can move around outside. They are responsible for buying some daily necessities, vegetables and fruits, as well as looking for other trafficking targets…”
“To prevent the police or others from sneaking in. They put this special ankle device on us.”
“It’s developed using the latest technology and materials. Unless you destroy the device or cut off the feet, you’ll never be able to remove it. Only the senior leaders of terrorist groups have the password and method to remove the device…”
“I’m afraid that I won’t be able to remove it even to the day I die… even if I run to the ends of the world, I won’t be able to escape…”
The woman’s eyes were filled with helplessness and resentment. Qiu Tong squatted down and examined the ankle device with interest.
Shao An summoned the best decryption expert in the military. He fiddled with it and triggered the defense system of the device. It indicated that the password was wrong and would explode in five minutes!
Everyone panicked and retreated while protecting Jin Yang.
Qiu Tong comforted the terrified woman as she examined the device. She stared at the electronic screen and tapped at a few places with her fingertips.
The ear-piercing alarm disappeared. Jin Yang pushed the bodyguard away and walked to her side. He stared at Qiu Tong’s actions, his eyes shining with anticipation.
She always seemed to be able to surprise him!
Two minutes later, with a click, Qiu Tong unlocked the passcode and removed the electronic ankle device, swinging it around…
Qiu Tong glanced at Jin Yang before putting on the ankle device under everyone’s shocked gazes.
She smiled playfully and murmured, “Not bad. It’s quite exquisite.”
“But the password system is just child’s play, it’s very easy to crack.”
Jin Yang frowned at her actions. He seemed to have guessed something and asked anxiously, “What are you planning to do?”

chapters.title: Chapter 53 - Persuasion
chapters.content:
Chapter 53: Persuasion
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“I can infiltrate the group and become an undercover agent.”
Everyone was shocked. They felt that Qiu Tong’s logic was abnormal and her actions were extremely odd.
Qiu Tong explained. “The kidnapped civilians have ankle devices. They obey the terrorist organization because they fear death. I can blend in and help them remove the devices and bombs. I can slowly coax them to defect and work for us.”
“When the right time comes, the kidnapped civilians will be able to protect themselves and will not be restrained by the terrorist organization. No human bomb will be able to stop us.”
“If we can convince them to turn against the terrorists, they can even cooperate with you on your plan and wipe the organization out.”
Qiu Tong tilted her head, waiting for Jin Yang to agree.
The impression the surrounding soldiers had of Qiu Tong began to change from disdain and contempt, to respect and even a hint of admiration…
The atmosphere in the second floor basement became more fervent. They seemed to be able to foresee a great victory and could not help feeling the urge to carry out their mission.
Jin Yang’s breathing was unsteady. His sharp eyes locked onto her figure and his thin lips pursed into a straight line. “No.”
Qiu Tong questioned his ability to command. “Why? This is the best and only way to break through.”
Jin Yang’s gaze turned slightly cold. His low and hoarse voice contained an indescribable nervousness. “There will be other ways.”
Qiu Tong was vexed. She didn’t want to waste any more time. After some thought, she walked over to Jin Yang and grabbed his elbow, pulling him to a quiet corner…
Shao An and his bodyguards formed a human wall five meters away, blocking them from the rest. However, they could not help perking up their ears in curiosity, wanting to hear their conversation. Unfortunately, they were too far away and could not hear anything. They could only secretly guess what Qiu Tong wanted to do!
After interacting with him the past few days, Qiu Tong believed that Jin Yang was a trustworthy person.
She was not worried that revealing certain things to him would bring about danger and trouble.
Qiu Tong lowered her head, lifted her shirt and unbuttoned it, revealing her snow-white skin…
Jin Yang was surprised. He looked slightly embarrassed and wanted to shift his gaze away. His throat tightened as he asked, “What are you doing… we are in public!”
Qiu Tong didn’t say anything. She just peeled off her clothes, revealing the wound she’d just received from the explosion.
As if she couldn’t feel the pain, she lowered her head and used her palm to cover the wound, transmitting her special ability to heal the wound in front of Jin Yang.
The miraculous sight made Jin Yang forget about the erotic scene in front of him. His cold fingers poked the tender flesh on her back, causing Qiu Tong to tremble.
“Look, I have the ability to protect myself. Even if I infiltrate a terrorist organization, I won’t be in danger.”
Qiu Tong pushed away his hand and met Jin Yang’s eyes. She said seriously, “You know better than anyone else that my plan is the only feasible one, and I can coordinate with you from the inside.”
Jin Yang saw her supernatural power with his own eyes. He recalled that previous incident. If he hadn’t met Qiu Tong, his life would have been in danger.
“How did you do it?”
“You have supernatural powers. How did you get them?”
Jin Yang pressed on. Qiu Tong didn’t expect his focus to be on that. She replied half-heartedly, “I was born with it.”
“I’ve been different from normal children since I was born…”
Qiu Tong changed the topic and pointed at the corpses outside. She said firmly, “If you want to destroy the terrorist organization and let the civilians live free and happy lives, you should agree to my proposal.”
“Even if I don’t have the ability to protect myself, you should still choose to let me be a spy and exchange one person’s life for the happiness of tens of millions of people. It will be worth it!”
“I’m your personal bodyguard. You didn’t hire me to hide behind you! I don’t want to be useless!”
“Jin Yang, do you understand what I mean?”
Qiu Tong’s voice had risen a few octaves and Jin Yang was moved. He finally agreed to her plan.
“Put your clothes back on.”
Jin Yang reminded Qiu Tong as she stepped out from the dark corner.
She bent her head and re-buttoned her ruffled shirt, before tucking it in properly. Her face was still flushed from the heated argument.
When Shao An heard the sounds of movement, he turned his head and happened to see her actions. He was stunned.
“Sir, you two…”
Shao An’s gaze wandered between the two of them. He stared at the corner and then saw the two red marks on Jin Yang’s neck from the explosion…
He could not help but imagine all sorts of amorous images.. Realizing something, Shao An quickly shook his head, not daring to think too much.

chapters.title: Chapter 54 - Invitation
chapters.content:
Chapter 54: Invitation
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
After the ambush failed, Jin Yang instructed Shao An to keep an eye on the underground blackmarket 24/7.
A few days later, there was indeed some new movement.
Shao An personally led a team to scout the market a few times and obtained a lot of new information. He immediately reported to Jin Yang.
“Just as you predicted, sir. After things died down, they’re back to trading.”
As Shao An spoke, he handed over the intelligence file in his hand.
Jin Yang took over the document and flipped through it seriously. Qiu Tong also went up to him. She gave off a sweet fragrance that made the man’s eyes darken.
Shao An continued, “Many wealthy people can secretly enter and exit the second floor basement using special invitations.”
“When you meet a ‘slave’ that you like, the rich can buy him or her for any purpose. It doesn’t matter if you end up killing the ‘slave’. And if you get tired of him or her, you can sell the ‘slave’ back to the market at a lower price.”
As he spoke, Shao An took out an invitation from his pocket and handed it over. “Sir, this is it.”
A fair hand took the invitation before Jin Yang did.
“Sell the ‘slave’ back?”
Qiu Tong playfully brushed the golden words with her fingertips and lifted her eyes to look at Jin Yang. She smiled lightly. “Well then, this ‘slave’ here will be waiting to be sold back by you… Master.”
It was clearly just a teasing remark, but from her lips, it sounded seductive, especially when she said “Master.”
Jin Yang’s Adam’s apple bobbed. He lowered his eyes and finally said, “…Be careful.”
That night, Qiu Tong put on her ankle device, some makeup and her clothes. She looked at the mirror before pushing the door open.
Jin Yang, who was already prepared outside, heard the sound of the door opening. He looked up and was momentarily stunned. A look of surprise flashed across his eyes.
Qiu Tong, who had always been dressed simply, was now wearing a tight-fitting red dress. Her curvy sexy figure and long legs were very eye-catching.
With her exquisite makeup and fiery red lips, she looked extremely alluring and sexy, as if she had become a completely different person.
Qiu Tong whistled. “What’s the matter? Are you dazzled by my beauty?”
“…”
Jin Yang looked away expressionlessly and cleared his throat. “Let’s go!”
They parked the car in the alley and got out of the car. Qiu Tong passed the golden mask to Jin Yang and held his hand in a very natural manner.
Jin Yang’s body stiffened, but he did not shake her off.
When they reached the second level basement, they were surrounded by smoke. The doorman stopped them and Jin Yang took out his invitation letter and handed it over.
After checking the invitation, the doorman chuckled and led them into the long corridor.
There were bodyguards and thugs armed with guns along the way. Security was tight.
The music in the venue was deafening. The lights were dim, and smoke filled the air. The smell of cosmetics, alcohol and sweat mixed together.
It was crowded and the atmosphere was chaotic.
Qiu Tong looked around, trying to remember the layout.
Right at this moment, a wretched voice suddenly sounded beside them.
“Yo, mister, are you here to sell your slave?”
“I like your slave!”
Qiu Tong followed the voice and saw a fat, greasy middle-aged man wearing a pig mask. He reeked of alcohol.
He stared straight at Qiu Tong and walked over with a lecherous look, smacking his lips.
“What a stunner. I’ve been in this market for years, but I’ve never seen such a slave.”
“Sir, you are probably tired of it already. It’ll be troublesome to sell it back. That’s perfect. The two of us can just do an exchange. My slave may not have as good a figure as yours, but she’s very good in bed. Hehehe.”
The greasy man let out a wretched laugh and stretched out his hand towards Qiu Tong’s hips. “Let me try out the quality of this…”
Qiu Tong’s eyes flickered coldly. Just as the greasy pig’s hand was about to reach her, she broke it.
Just as she was about to attack, Jin Yang, who was beside her, took a big step forward, his tall and sturdy back blocking her.
Jin Yang’s eyes were cold as he stretched out his right hand to grab the pig’s hand.
The greasy man was stunned. Thinking that Jin Yang wanted to shake his hand, he smiled happily.
“Hehe, good deal, good deal.”
Unexpectedly, in the next second, a cold glint flashed across Jin Yang’s eyes and he instantly tightened his grip.
“Ahhhh!!”
The man’s scream was drowned out by the music.. In the next second, Jin Yang raised his leg and kicked his chest. The man’s fat body fell heavily to the ground and he spat out a mouthful of blood!

chapters.title: Chapter 55 - Infiltrating The Slave Den
chapters.content:
Chapter 55: Infiltrating The Slave Den
“You dare to hit me?!”
The greasy man spat out two loose teeth and stood up shakily. He pointed at Jin Yang. “Do you know who I am? The owner of this place and I…”
Before he finished speaking, Jin Yang shot Shao An a look. Shao An took out a check from his pocket and wrote a number before tossing it over.
“I don’t care who you are. Take the money and scram.”
“I don’t care about your money…”
The greasy man cursed but inadvertently glanced at the check. He was taken aback.
Under the dim light, he could clearly see that there were several zeros behind the numbers.
“Hundred, hundred thousand, million…”
The greasy man quietly swallowed his saliva and looked at Shao An again. The figure in front of him was abnormally tall and sturdy, and his aura was extraordinary. Since he could give away so much money, he was definitely not someone to be trifled with.
He immediately changed his attitude and said with a flattering smile, “So you’re a big shot. I was really stupid to actually dare to offend you…”
The greasy man took the check, still muttering, “But I can’t believe it. It’s just a toy. I can’t believe he cares so much…”
Jin Yang stared at the man from above with a straight face. The coldness in his eyes could kill.
“I’m warning you, she’s not a toy.”
“Yes, yes, yes. I have a foul mouth. I misspoke!”
Cold sweat trickled down the greasy man’s back. He lowered his head and apologized profusely.
“Then get lost!”
Shao An glared fiercely at the greasy man. The greasy man fled without daring to make another sound.
Jin Yang’s expression was dark and cold.
This surprised Shao An.
He had been under Jin Yang for many years. No matter what happened, he would never reveal his emotions.
For this Qiu Tong, he actually…
Qiu Tong did not notice Shao An’s strange expression. She surveyed the interior. “After I control the situation inside, I will make a red mark on the necks of the ‘slaves’ during the auction.”
No red mark would mean nothing had changed.
“Okay”
Jin Yang nodded. “Be careful.”
Qiu Tong smiled. “I won’t allow anything to happen to me.”
In the post-apocalyptic era, she was a major general after all. She had killed thousands of zombies. How could these few terrorists be her match?
Jin Yang pursed his lips and didn’t say anything else. He followed the plan and brought Qiu Tong to the staff.
With Qiu Tong’s pitiful status as ‘slave’, plus her good figure and beauty, she was quickly sold back. She was brought back to the slave den.
The slave den was in the basement. Qiu Tong was shocked by what she saw.
The basement was as big as two basketball courts, and there were no partitions. Apart from young women like her, the rest were mostly old, weak, sick and disabled. Everyone’s clothes were ragged, and their expressions were dazed.
There were strong men, too, although everyone appeared to be suffering from varying degrees of injury. The air smelled stale.
Qiu Tong frowned and decided to wait and see.
When it was time for dinner, the guards carried two large buckets of steamed buns to the door. “Eat, you animals.”
The slaves snatched at the buns like crazy!
Qiu Tong had successfully snatched two steamed buns and was walking back when a boy suddenly flew in front of her, having been kicked by someone.
A burly man walked over. “Hand over the steamed bun and I won’t hit you!”
“I won’t… Ah—”
The little boy did not give in. He firmly protected the steamed bun in his hand.
The burly man was enraged and started punching and kicking the little boy. The little boy’s nose and mouth were covered in blood…
The scene was very cruel, but the surrounding slaves were busy wolfing down the food that they had snatched. The other slaves who had not managed to snatch anything were watching anxiously. No one came forward to help.
This scene reminded Qiu Tong of her three children.
When the three children were with the former owner of her body, they didn’t have enough to eat, no warm clothes to wear, and were bullied. They were just like the little boy in front of her.
She wondered how they were doing now.
Qiu Tong stepped up with a frown. “It’s your own fault you didn’t manage to get any buns yourself. Why are you trying to snatch his?”
“Ignorant fool, get lost!”
The burly man flew into a rage and threw a punch at her. Qiu Tong dodged it perfectly.
Qiu Tong smirked and grabbed the man’s hand, throwing him over her shoulder. “You should be the one getting lost!”
“You…”
The burly man wanted to stand up again, but Qiu Tong stepped on him ruthlessly.
He gritted his teeth and said fiercely, “Just you wait!”
If not for his four broken ribs, how could this b*tch be his match?
Qiu Tong ignored his venomous gaze and kicked him away, dusting off her hands. “I’ll be waiting!”

chapters.title: Chapter 56 - Shocking Appearance Of The Male Protagonist
chapters.content:
Chapter 56: Shocking Appearance Of The Male Protagonist
After dealing with the burly man, Qiu Tong knelt down before the boy.
The boy’s brow bone was broken, and his eyes were bloodshot. His hands were dripping with blood, his flesh all swollen. It was a terrifying sight.
Qiu Tong was shocked and handed her steamed bun to him.
“I’ll give you mine.”
The little boy ignored her and stared at the ground with clenched fists.
Qiu Tong wanted to pat his head. “Go ahead and eat. I’m here. I won’t let them bully you.”
The little boy cautiously leaned against the corner of the wall. Qiu Tong was close enough to hear that the little boy was breathing heavily.
She reached out to touch the boy’s forehead. “You have a fever?”
The little boy had no strength to push her and scolded her in disdain, “Don’t touch me! It’s none of your business!”
He was really similar to Qiu Xingyuan.
Qiu Tong thought that since she had already gotten involved with him, how could she not care?
Qiu Tong touched the boy’s forehead and used her power to heal his wounds.
“By the way, what’s your name?”
The little boy’s face was gloomy. He did not reply to her words nor eat her food.
Qiu Tong noticed that the little boy was very vigilant towards her. After confirming that he was not in danger for the time being, she ignored him and continued to observe her surroundings.
However, she did not expect to see the birthmark of a crabapple on the back of the boy’s neck.
Qiu Tong was stunned.
The boy with the crabapple birthmark…
In the novel she had read before the post-apocalyptic war, the male protagonist, Ye Luan, had a birthmark of a crabapple on the back of his neck!
Ye Luan? This child?
She remembered that Ye Luan was an orphan. He had a reclusive personality and a tragic background. However, the novel did not mention that Ye Luan came from a slave den.
By the time he appeared in the novel, it would be ten years later. He had grown up to be a gloomy and fearsome young man.
In the span of ten years, Ye Luan would experience countless bloody crises. It was no wonder that his final blow would be so cruel. He did not hesitate at all when dealing with her children.
Qiu Tong made up her mind to protect Ye Luan.
Not only that, she also wanted to bring him back to get along with her three children. After they develop feelings for each other, he would definitely not kill them.
At the thought of this, Qiu Tong leaned closer to Ye Luan and said domineeringly, “Child, I’ll protect you from now on. I won’t let anyone bully you again, understand?”
Ye Luan was still indifferent to her words.
However, there were a few slaves who started mocking them mercilessly. “Everyone, listen to this. This woman is speaking nonsense!”
“You are a prey locked in a cage, yet you boast about protecting others!”
“If you ask me, she’s an idiot. She can’t even protect herself, yet she wants to drag along an even weaker piece of trash! Everyone, stay away from them. Let her die on her own. Don’t bring us along!”
Ye Luan tensed up at the crowd’s ridicule. He was used to being despised and bullied these days.
Qiu Tong was the only person who showed kindness to him, but she ended up being mocked by them.
He stared coldly at the person who had just spoken.
“Hey, you little brat!”
The other party was annoyed by his stare. He stood up and wanted to give him a slap. “How dare you glare at me?! I’ll beat you to death!”
Ye Luan didn’t dodge. He looked up at that person, as if wanting to memorize his face.
One day, he would return the favor to all those who had bullied him.
Ye Luan was already prepared to be slapped, but this time, the slap did not land on his face.
When that person approached, Qiu Tong suddenly made a move and kicked him in the stomach. She said coldly, “I’ve already said that he’s someone I’m protecting. Don’t you understand?”
That person was sent flying and rolled on the ground in pain while clutching his stomach.
The slaves had never seen such a fierce woman before. For a moment, they couldn’t quite figure her out. No one dared to step forward again. No one dared to make trouble for Ye Luan again.
Qiu Tong turned and gave Ye Luan a kind smile. “It’s alright now, go to sleep.”
Ye Luan, “…”
He watched with a conflicted expression as Qiu Tong took the initiative to shield him behind her. After a long while, he silently closed his eyes in the darkness.
The next day, Qiu Tong was woken up by wretched cries.
Qiu Tong opened her eyes and saw several guards trying to pull a little girl out. “Let’s go! It’s your turn to go to the auction today!”
The little girl was so frightened that she cried loudly and reached out to a woman. “Mommy, save me…”
The woman was in a panic. She grabbed the child’s hand with all her might. “Sirs! Please, she’s just a child… please, she can’t be sold!”
In the next second, the woman was pushed down and beaten up violently. “Do you think you can do whatever you want now that you are here? Be good and follow me onto the stage to wait for a master to bid on you. Otherwise, I’ll beat you to death right now!”

chapters.title: Chapter 57 - Repaying Kindness With Ingratitude
chapters.content:
Chapter 57: Repaying Kindness With Ingratitude
“Please, please…”
Even though the mother was already vomiting blood from the beating, she still shook her head stubbornly. She even used all her strength to crawl towards her daughter and reached out her bloody hand to grab her. “Baby, Mommy is here…”
“Ah!!!”
The woman screamed.
The guards stepped impatiently on the back of her hand and strung her up. They then flashed their whips and whipped the woman hard.
Smack! Smack!
The whip made a terrible sound, and even the slaves who were watching seemed to feel it and begged for mercy in fear.
“Sir, please spare them. They just don’t know the rules yet!”
“If you kill them now, you won’t have any money. They can only be sold for a good price if they’re alive!”
Slaves were killed in the slave den every day. Either they were killed by the other slaves or they were tortured to death by these perverted guards.
The tragic state of the mother and daughter touched the crowd.
However, their pleas were completely useless to the guards. They even turned on them. “Who are you to speak here? Scram! Or I’ll beat you all up!”
Soon, several guards brought their guns and surrounded the slaves to prevent them from moving forward.
Those people huddled together, not daring to move again.
Before long, the woman fainted from the whipping, and their daughter was forcibly taken away.
Silence soon returned to the basement. The slaves had witnessed the entire mother-daughter episode, and they were silently suppressing their emotions that were about to erupt.
All of them wanted to tear these guards apart, but what could they do?
Qiu Tong pursed her lips and said in silence, “Every day, you’re either sold or bullied by these guards. Have you never thought of escaping together?”
The slaves looked at her as if she were a lunatic. “Escape? Everyone is injured. How can we escape?”
“There’s also the device tied to our ankles. We’ll probably be blasted into meat paste before we reach the door!”
Qiu Tong muttered, “I know how to cure injuries…”
“Tsk, stop bullshitting.”
Qiu Tong was interrupted before she could finish.
The burly man, Kai En, whom she had stepped on yesterday, looked at her mockingly. “Stupid woman, is there something wrong with your brain?! You keep saying such crazy things. Do you really think you’re invincible?”
Qiu Tong knew that if she did not cure one of them in public today, these slaves would not believe her.
She smirked and said coldly, “You don’t believe me? Come and try then.”
Kai En still did not believe her. “Don’t bring up all our hopes just to drop us into despair. If we can’t escape as you said, everyone will tear you apart!”
What a joke. She was just a woman. How could she know these things?
Furthermore, there was no medicine in the slave den. Under such circumstances, how could she cure them?
Everyone’s emotions were stirred up by Kai En. “Yes! Shut up! Even if you can cure our injuries, can you also remove our ankle devices?!”
In the face of everyone’s anger, Qiu Tong remained calm.
“It’s just an explosive device, I can dismantle it. The more people there are, the more power we have. If we are no longer injured, there’s no need to fear those few guards anymore.”
With that, Qiu Tong locked her gaze on Kai En. “You claim that I cannot cure your injuries. Do you dare to try?”
“I…”
Before Kai En could say anything else, Qiu Tong walked toward him and raised her hand—
Rip!
She tore open Kai En’s shirt, exposing the wound in his abdomen. She pressed against his ribs. “Four broken ribs? I think they’re cracked.”
“Ow!!!”
Kai En howled in pain and swung his fist at Qiu Tong. “B*tch, I think you want to kill me!”
Qiu Tong easily caught his fist before tearing off a corner of his shirt. She rubbed the injured area with her hand before bandaging it.
“B*tch! Are you crazy? There’s no medicine. What’s the use of just bandaging my wound… eh?”
Kai En cried out. But a strange sensation at his injured area shut him up.
The original pain was replaced by a warm feeling. He was shocked and pressed his ribs in surprise. “Strange… it really doesn’t hurt anymore?”
Qiu Tong raised an eyebrow.
Kai En was overjoyed, while the other slaves were stunned.
Qiu Tong was very pleased with the slaves’ reaction. She waited for them to take the initiative and step forward, but to her surprise, a fierce light began to fill Kai En’s eyes.
“B*tch, I was injured last time and so didn’t beat you up. This time, I’ll let you know how powerful I am!”

chapters.title: Chapter 58 - Stirring Trouble
chapters.content:
Chapter 58: Stirring Trouble
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Kai En still remembered how Qiu Tong had humiliated him yesterday and was about to teach her a lesson!
Qiu Tong did not hide or panic. When he charged at her, she just tilted her head and dodged. She grabbed his hand and easily threw him over her shoulder!
In the next second, Qiu Tong was strangling his throat!
The smile on her lips was very cold. “I just cured you and you’re already repaying kindness with ingratitude, huh? Let me see how powerful you are.”
Kai En found it difficult to breathe as Qiu Tong used all her strength to choke him.
“Cough cough… I…was wrong… let go, let go…”
In that instant, Kai En felt his head swell and his eyes sting, as if he were going to die the next second.
He could only beg for mercy.
Unexpectedly, even after he recovered, he was still no match for Qiu Tong!
The slaves were stunned by this scene and backed off one by one, intimidated by the murderous aura that Qiu Tong exuded.
Kai En struggled to pry Qiu Tong’s hand away. “Let me go… I promise not to hurt you. I… cough cough… I respect you as my boss. My brothers will listen to you…”
From the looks of it, this person had some status in the slave den?
“Sure, you have to obey me then.”
Qiu Tong had a plan and kicked him away. “But remember, I can cure you, but I can also cripple you. If you play any tricks on me, I promise you’ll die a horrible death!”
Kai En’s heart lurched and cold sweat ran down his back.
He could feel Qiu Tong’s powerful aura. How would he dare to go against her now?
Kai En quickly adjusted his attitude. “Boss, you’re so strong. What tricks will I dare to play?”
“It better be that way.”
Qiu Tong had run out of patience and coldly commanded, “Now, you go and stand guard. The rest of you wait in line for treatment.”
“There’s one thing I want to make clear first. After I treat you guys, you still have to pretend to be injured in front of outsiders. Don’t let anyone see through this.”
Kai En quickly nodded. “Yes, Boss!”
The slaves soon lined up under Kai En’s management.
One treated slave after another left the long line. All of them were now determined to follow Qiu Tong’s lead.
“Thank you for saving us. From now on, you are our boss!”
Just like that, Qiu Tong became the new leader of the slave den!
This was all part of Qiu Tong’s plan.
But on the third day, she realized that things had become a little tricky.
As there was not enough food in the basement, her special ability could not be replenished, and her ability to use it was limited. She had only treated a few people today, and she already had a headache.
Qiu Tong waved her hand tiredly. “From today onwards, we have to limit the number of people. Only 20 patients per day.”
Upon hearing this, those who hadn’t received treatment immediately panicked and became furious.
“What?! Are you trying to fool us? Only 20 people per day but there are hundreds of us in total. How long will this take?”
The slaves had been held here too long. Someone was being tortured to death every single day. They all feared death.
They had placed all their hopes on Qiu Tong, hoping to get out as soon as possible, but now Qiu Tong wanted to restrict the treatment!
“People are being taken away every day. If you don’t treat us all quickly, what if the guards choose me?!”
“You told us that you could treat our injuries and bring us out, but it’s been two days, and we still haven’t been treated! I think you just want to use this gimmick to stabilize your position in the slave den, right?”
Those people stared angrily at Qiu Tong, as if she was not their benefactor but their enemy.
Qiu Tong smirked. “Tell me, what’s the benefit of being the boss of the slave den?”
The slaves choked from her rebuttal. After a while, they retorted stubbornly, “You will have people working for you and serving you!”
“Is that so? In the three days that I’ve been here, has anyone even poured me a cup of water? Or snatched a steamed bun for me?”
Qiu Tong’s gaze was cold. “Since you think that I have other motives, from today onwards, there will be no more treatment. Everything will go back to normal.”
When she said that she wasn’t going to treat them anymore, most people were shocked.
Even if Qiu Tong’s treatment pace was slow, they would still have a chance of recovering. If Qiu Tong refused to treat them, it would be all over for them.
“What are you guys talking about! What did Boss manage to gain from you guys? She wanted to bring everyone out, but you turned around and attacked her instead!”
“Are you shameless? You want her to cure you even as you are scolding her?!”
“If you don’t want to be cured, then get lost. There are those of us who still want treatment!”
The slaves who valued the benefits stood out to defend Qiu Tong, while those who were just stirring trouble immediately lost their blustering stance.
The other slaves also chose to keep quiet.
Qiu Tong took the opportunity to say, “The number of injured people is increasing every day, and new slaves are also being thrown in. I am just one person here. So I’ve decided to treat those who can fight and have stronger bodies first.”
This would also be better for them to counterattack while escaping.
The slaves had no objections to this suggestion.
In the following period of time, Qiu Tong acted according to plan.

chapters.title: Chapter 59 - I Wont Forgive This Bad Woman Too
chapters.content:
Chapter 59: I Won’t Forgive This Bad Woman Too
Meanwhile, at the three children’s side.
Today was the seventh day, which was the day Qiu Tong had promised that she would return.
Qiu Xingyu did not even go to kindergarten. She waited for Qiu Xingyu at the doorway, wanting to give her a big hug.
However, Qiu Tong was still in the slave den making plans for the next day with the slaves. Even though she was anxious to return, there was nothing she could do.
Qiu Xingyu waited from morning till night, her eyes filled with anticipation and disappointment.
Qiu Xingyuan even specially bought fish and meat. He was unwilling to admit that he was also expecting her.
Seeing Qiu Xingyu’s dejected look, Qiu Xingyuan’s expression became increasingly gloomy.
Finally, he carried Little Yu back. “Don’t wait anymore, she won’t come back!”
It was already past one in the morning. If she wanted to come back, she would have done so long ago.
That woman must have run off with some man and abandoned them!
“But Mommy said today…”
Qiu Xingyu sobbed. Her mommy had changed for the better. Before she left, she even planted a kiss on her forehead.
She said that she would buy her a beautiful dress and delicious cake.
Qiu Xingyuan recalled the changes Qiu Tong had undergone during this period of time and clenched his small fists tightly.
He knew Qiu Tong wouldn’t be so nice!
“Little Yu, Little Qiao, forget about this woman. She was good to us just to lower our guard so that we won’t pester her when she leaves!”
Qiu Xingyu and Qiu Xingqiao thought about it and looked at the clock. They were instantly deflated.
Qiu Xingyu’s tears fell one by one.
Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes were also red. He bit his lips stubbornly and said fiercely, “Elder Brother, even if she comes back, I won’t forgive this liar!”
They had thought that the family of four could live well together. In the end, Qiu Tong cruelly abandoned them and even lied to them.
“Yes, I will never forgive this bad woman.”
Qiu Xingyuan said in a low voice, “In the future, I will earn money to take care of you guys. From tomorrow onwards, we won’t be going to kindergarten anymore.”
Qiu Tong was the one who arranged for them to go to kindergarten. If not for Qiu Tong, they would not want to be with a bunch of silly kids.
“Okay.”
Qiu Xingyu and Qiu Xingqiao nodded in unison.
With Qiu Tong gone, the three of them had to be united. Things had been very hard for Elder Brother, they could not disappoint him!
…
Qiu Tong had already come up with a plan. She calculated that there were 300 people who had been cured.
The guards would not be a match for their attack tomorrow night.
At this moment, Qiu Tong gathered everyone together and removed their ankle devices one by one. Then, she easily modified the explosive devices with a knife.
“If you don’t press the button, the device will not explode. However, you still have to wear the devices on your ankles. I will give you instructions tomorrow. When the time comes, take off the device and toss it out.”
In order not to arouse the suspicions of the guards, they had to do this.
The slaves had witnessed the whole process of Qiu Tong removing the ankle devices with her bare hands. They were completely impressed by her.
They obeyed her orders without qualms now.
“Someone is coming!”
The slaves on the lookout shouted anxiously, and the crowd quickly dispersed.
Soon, three guards came in.
They glanced at Qiu Tong before grabbing Ye Luan, who was beside her.
Qiu Tong quickly stood up. “What are you doing?”
Ye Luan was the male protagonist of that novel. Even if something happened to her, nothing must happen to Ye Luan. Otherwise, her three children might suffer if the storyline changed?
One of the guards shouted at Qiu Tong, “What does it have to do with you?! Get lost! You guys, take him away!”
Qiu Tong clenched her fists and suppressed her anger.
If she were to hit someone now, her entire plan would be ruined.
However, she could not just watch as Ye Luan was taken away. She walked forward and lowered her voice. “Don’t be afraid, I will save you.”
She quickly cut her finger with a small knife. She then touched Ye Luan’s neck and quietly drew a cross on his skin.
This was a signal to the people outside.
Ye Luan looked at her expressionlessly. Although he didn’t believe her words, there was still a slight flutter in his heart.
He had also heard about her plan. It was indeed feasible.
However, most of the slaves that were brought out never returned.
And now, he was the one being taken away…
Qiu Tong was currently locked up in the slave den. He would be dead by tomorrow night’s auction.
Before Ye Luan was taken away, Qiu Tong suddenly said, “Do what you want.”
“…”
Qiu Tong’s heart skipped a beat. Her fingers dug into her palms as she watched with cold eyes, Ye Luan being taken away.
She told herself that no matter what, nothing must happen to Ye Luan.

chapters.title: Chapter 60 - Successful Counterattack
chapters.content:
Chapter 60: Successful Counterattack
After Ye Luan was taken away, Qiu Tong immediately sent a message to the slaves. “We’ll take action tonight. In just a while, we’ll lure the guards over. Remember, you must act quickly.”
However, two minutes after she spoke, more guards arrived.
They grabbed a bunch of slaves.
They then left behind ten guards, all with guns in their hands.
It seemed like the terrorists had brought the auction forward.
Let’s begin!
Qiu Tong made a gesture and shot the rest a look, the slaves quickly took off their ankle devices and threw them at the ten guards!
“Get down!”
Qiu Tong shouted at the top of her lungs.
With a loud bang, the guards were blown apart!
At the same time, the metal door exploded!
Qiu Tong raised her hand, and the slaves launched their attack, charging out.
When the other terrorists heard the commotion, they rushed over. When the cured slaves saw them, their eyes turned red and they all charged forward.
Those who were cured were strong and could fight. There were hundreds of them and the small number of terrorists were no match for them.
Most importantly, Jin Yang had rushed in with his men.
Ever since Qiu Tong entered the slave den, he would come here every day, and he saw the red mark on Ye Luan’s body tonight.
In less than three minutes, the slave den were already littered with the dead bodies of the terrorists.
Qiu Tong smiled when she saw Jin Yang walk in with a gun.
Indeed, he did not disappoint her.
A gratified smile appeared on Jin Yang’s face. She did not disappoint him either!
Just like that, the slave den was occupied by Jin Yang and Qiu Tong.
Jin Yang frowned when he saw the large number of slaves standing behind Qiu Tong, all of them covered in bloodstains. He gave Shao An an order.
“Take care of these people and send them back to their hometown. If they don’t have a home, send them to the welfare center.”
Ye Luan had no family, so he had to be sent to the welfare center.
Ye Luan’s face was cold, he was unwilling to go.
He had been saved by Jin Yang and rushed in with them. Now, it was time to settle the affairs of the slaves, but Ye Luan refused to accept his fate.
He instinctively ran behind Qiu Tong and grabbed her sleeve.
Although he did not say anything, his actions showed everything.
Qiu Tong shielded Ye Luan behind her. “I have no objections to your resettlement plan, but this child has to stay by my side. I plan to adopt him.”
If she adopted Ye Luan, he and her three children would be siblings.
If they were to cultivate their relationship now, wouldn’t they be able to grow rich together later on?
“No, this is against the rules.” Shao An immediately stood out and objected.
Everyone who came out of the slave den had to be accounted for to the government. In addition, Qiu Tong was a single mother with three children. The adoption process would probably not be approved.
Shao An still wanted to say something, but Jin Yang spoke up. “You will make this happen.”
“…”
Shao An could only watch as their President once again changed his principles for Qiu Tong. He had no choice but to nod his head in agreement.
The slaves reluctantly bid farewell to Qiu Tong.
Quests heaved a sigh of relief and brought Ye Luan back to the villa to pack her things. Her mission had been completed and it was time for her to reunite with her three children!
She was about to leave with her things, but she saw herself in the mirror.
Wouldn’t her current appearance scare the three children to tears?
No, no.
Qiu Tong left Ye Luan in the bedroom and went to the bathroom.
After she took off her clothes and turned on the shower, she realized that there was nothing in the bathroom.
“…”
He was a person of such high status. But his guest room was so poorly furnished that there wasn’t any shower gel or even a towel!
“Ye Luan, are you there?”
She had no choice but to shout Ye Luan’s name.
Ye Luan’s cold voice rang outside the door. “What is it?”
“Help me get my shower gel and towel from my luggage.”
If she hadn’t been so anxious, she wouldn’t have forgotten to bring them in!
“Okay.”
Ye Luan replied indifferently. He walked towards Qiu Tong’s packed luggage which was locked by a passcode. He squatted down to study it.
However, he had never seen this thing before, so he was unable to open it no matter how he tried.
Just as he was about to ask Qiu Tong to come out and get it herself, Ye Luan heard the sound of the door being pushed open. In the next second, he saw Jin Yang, who was dressed in a black suit, walking in from outside with a document in his hand.
The two of them exchanged chilly looks. Neither of them had the intention of speaking to each other.
“Ye Luan, have you found my shower gel and towel?”
Qiu Tong prompted Ye Luan. “Oh, I forgot to tell you. The password is 61xxxxxxx.”
Ye Luan pursed his lips, looking gloomy.
Why didn’t she say so earlier?
Jin Yang didn’t say anything. He squatted down and opened the luggage.
He found the shower gel and towel, but when he pulled it out, his fingers accidentally hooked onto a black fabric.
Jin Yang’s face darkened when he pulled it out.
It was a pair of lacy underwear…

chapters.title: Chapter 61 - Awkward
chapters.content:
Chapter 61: Awkward
“…”
Jin Yang’s usually cold face was flushed red. He felt all the blood in his body rush to his lower body. The surging blood made him dizzy for a moment.
He shook his head to calm himself down and was about to put the underwear back into the luggage.
At this moment, the bathroom door opened.
Qiu Tong waited for a long time but did not hear Ye Luan’s reply. She opened the door slightly and popped out her wet head.
“Ye Luan, you…”
Qiu Tong’s words trailed off at the sight of the lacy underwear in Jin Yang’s hands. Their eyes met and an awkward atmosphere spread throughout the room.
Jin Yang, “…”
Qiu Tong, “…”
Ye Luan, “…”
In the end, it was Jin Yang who broke the silence first. He pretended to be calm and put the underwear back into the luggage. He calmly took out the shower gel and towel and strode towards Qiu Tong.
Beneath that calm facade, he was the only one who knew how embarrassed he actually was.
Qiu Tong reached out her fair arm through the crack of the door and took the toiletries from his hands. She was about to say something when she slipped and fell forward!
She was holding the items in her hands and was unable to break her fall. Just as she was about to make contact with the floor, a huge force suddenly came from behind her.
Jin Yang quickly pulled her toward him and wrapped his long arms around her slender waist from behind. His big, hot hands happened to land on her chest, holding her tightly in his arms.
“You!”
Embarrassment and anger flashed across Qiu Tong’s eyes. She hurriedly used a towel to cover her chest and broke free from his embrace. She abruptly pushed him out of the bathroom and slammed the door shut!
She stood under the shower and quickly washed her body, as if she wanted to wash away the fluttering in her heart.
Jin Yang looked at the door that almost bashed into his nose and smelled the lingering fragrance in his arms. Still feeling the smoothness of her skin on his fingertips, he touched his nose guiltily.
He thought of the beautiful image he had just seen and his heart started beating uncontrollably.
Jin Yang felt that he couldn’t stay here any longer and turned to leave.
After taking a few steps, he seemed to have thought of something and retreated again. He scrutinized Ye Luan, this young man who was only half his age. Suddenly, he raised his hand and grabbed Ye Luan’s collar, dragging him out of the room.
Qiu Tong tidied herself up and walked out of the villa. Shao An had already been waiting at the door with Ye Luan for a long time.
“Miss Qiu, this is the rest of the payment. Also, this is a cheque for an extra $150,000 that Sir asked me to pay you.”
Shao An pushed Ye Luan to Qiu Tong’s side and took out the cheque. He handed it to Qiu Tong. Filled with burning curiosity and thirsty for gossip, he lowered his head and asked softly.
“By right, Sir should have seen you off personally. Did you two have a fight?”
Qiu Tong looked at the cheque and smirked. She kept it.
She had just been taken advantage of and had no qualms accepting this extra payment.
“That’s because he saw something he shouldn’t have seen. Your boss is feeling guilty.”
Seeing her response and recalling the expression on his boss’ face when he asked him to give her another $150,000, realization dawned upon him.
What else could happen between a man and a woman?
They must have…
However, Sir was really generous. Giving her a $150,000 tip just for sex.
Shao An mulled over this as he saw Qiu Tong out of the villa.
After Qiu Tong left the villa with Ye Luan, the first thing she did was head straight to the market.
Before she left, there was nearly nothing left in the cupboards of their house. Hence, the moment she entered the market, she went on a major buying spree.
Ye Luan received countless shopping bags with a blank expression and followed closely behind her.
Was this woman going to buy the entire market?
Qiu Tong hefted the haunches of a pig on her shoulders and finally stopped her crazy shopping spree. Carrying a huge amount of stuff, she led Ye Luan back home.
At the door, Qiu Tong tried three times, but she could not fit the key in.
Did the kids change the locks?
Did something happen during her absence?
She became anxious at the thought. She took out a dagger from her waist and drew a steel wire from the handle.
The lock suddenly turned and the door opened.
When the three children in the room saw Qiu Tong, they looked as if they were facing a formidable enemy. There was not a hint of joy on their faces at their reunion.
When Qiu Xingyuan saw Ye Luan, his face turned completely black. He gripped a remote control tightly in his hands.

chapters.title: Chapter 62 - Fighting For Affection, Jealousy
chapters.content:
Chapter 62: Fighting For Affection, Jealousy
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes were cold as he took a step back with his younger siblings. He pressed a button forcefully and an ear-piercing alarm pierced the sky.
A few figures instantly broke through the window, their huge fists swinging as they quickly attacked Qiu Tong!
They were the mercenaries!
Qiu Tong immediately raised her hand to block, and the few of them quickly engaged in a chaotic battle.
Ke Le and the others did not show any mercy. Their fists were vicious as they brought out their full strength against their opponent.
Qiu Tong’s eyes were profound as she leaped backwards and somersaulted out of the eye of the storm.
She spun to stand behind Ke Le, her arm coming in at an odd angle from under her ribs. Her fist went straight for Ke Le’s jaw.
Ke Le took two steps back and Qiu Tong immediately lunged forward, pinning his arms behind his back. She used her weight and momentum to throw the man to the ground, her slender fingers gripping his throat.
“Boss?”
Ke Le finally saw Qiu Tong’s face and cried out in alarm.
The others stopped what they were doing and turned on the lights. The room was brightened.
Qiu Tong let go of Ke Le and stood up, looking back at the kids.
“Qiu Xingyuan, why did you sound the alarm just now?”
Qiu Tong looked at Qiu Xingyuan with an unfathomable expression and scrutinized him.
Qiu Xingyuan’s heart was in turmoil. He turned his head to avoid Qiu Tong’s gaze and stiffly found an excuse.
“I was mistaken just now. I thought it was a bad person barging in.”
Qiu Tong raised her eyebrows. She did not expose his lie, but she found it strange.
Before she left, she felt that her relationship with the children had improved. Why did it seem like things had returned to their original state after a few days?
“Where have you been for so many days?”
Qiu Xingyuan stubbornly wanted to get the truth from Qiu Tong.
