“Didn’t I tell you? Mommy went to borrow some money from relatives.”
Qiu Xingyu placed the bags on the table and carried Qiu Xingyu, who was hugging her thigh in joy. “Look, I bought all this meat. Tonight, we’ll have a feast.”
Qiu Xingyu clapped her chubby hands and hugged Qiu Tong’s neck affectionately, shouting loudly.
“Mommy is the best!”
Qiu Xingyuan lowered his head, his thick eyelashes blocking the disappointment in his eyes.
There was no truth in this woman’s words.
Qiu Tong pushed Ye Luan towards the three children.
“Come, let me introduce everyone. This is Ye Luan. He’s two years older than Qiu Xingyuan. You guys have to call him Big Brother, do you understand?”
“From today onwards, he will live with us. You have to treat your brother well and have him familiarize himself with this family as soon as possible.”
Qiu Xingyuan abruptly raised his head, his sharp gaze landing on Ye Luan’s face.
This woman actually brought back a new pet after going out for a while!
Qiu Xingqiao felt slightly uncomfortable in his heart as well. It had been a long and difficult process for Qiu Tong to finally show concern for them and stop scolding them all the time. Now, a random kid had suddenly appeared to reap the benefits.
Ye Luan met Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes and saw the displeasure in them.
Qiu Xingyu pursed her lips and stepped away from Qiu Tong. She stood to the side, aggrieved and silent.
Qiu Tong glanced at their expressions and laughed in her heart. As expected, they were still just children.
She took out the small blanket that she had prepared for Ye Luan from her bag and spread it out in Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s room.
“Ye Luan, you will sleep in this room with Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao from now on.”
“I’ll go prepare dinner. Go and play.”
Qiu Tong patted Ye Luan’s head and started to organize the supplies she had brought back.
Five burly men and four children. Plus she herself was a glutton.
However, as soon as Qiu Xingqiao left the room, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s expressions changed. They looked at Ye Luan with gloomy eyes…
After a while, Qiu Tong, who had just thrown the meat into the pot, heard the sounds of fighting coming from inside the house.
She quickly walked to the door of the boys’ room. She saw Qiu Xingqiao throw out the blanket that she had just laid out, and fighting with Ye Luan!
Qiu Xingqiao had some abrasions on his body. The corners of Ye Luan’s eyes and mouth were also swollen and bruised.
Meanwhile, Qiu Xingyuan was just standing at the side with his arms crossed and watching. His eyes were fixed on Ye Luan. If Qiu Xingqiao lost, he would join the fight without any hesitation.
Qiu Tong stood at the door in a daze, looking at the chaotic scene in front of her. Her head ached.
This Ye Luan was the male protagonist. And this villain Qiu Xingqiao actually dared to fight with him. Wasn’t he afraid of being punished?!
Qiu Tong snapped.
“Qiu Xingqiao, stop!”
“I told you two to treat your brother well, but what are you doing!”
“Hurry up and apologize!”

chapters.title: Chapter 63 - Running Away From Home
chapters.content:
Chapter 63: Running Away From Home
Qiu Tong’s words made Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao even more certain that Ye Luan was her new favorite.
All her attention was on this person, and she no longer had any feelings for them.
Ever since Qiu Tong decided not to sell them off, Qiu Xingqiao had never heard her reprimand him with such a harsh tone. At this moment, all the grievances in his heart surged.
He glared at Qiu Tong before turning around and running out. Even his back profile appeared to be filled with resentment and anger.
“Xingqiao!”
Qiu Xingyuan looked at Qiu Tong with a pained expression and ran out after Qiu Xingqiao.
“Elder Brother, Second Brother, wait for me!”
Qiu Xingyu panicked and chased after her brothers.
Qiu Xingqiao did not expect Qiu Xingqiao to have such a huge reaction. She rubbed her temples weakly and turned to look at Ye Luan, who was standing by the side with his fists clenched. She sighed silently.
“Stay home and be a good boy. Let Uncle Ke Le treat your injuries. I’ll go find the others.”
Qiu Tong headed in the general direction where the children had run off, asking bystanders on the way if they had seen the kids.
Three children walking along the road like that would attract quite a lot of attention. Not to mention that the three children were very good-looking.
Finally, Qiu Tong intercepted the three children by the side of a major road two blocks away.
“Qiu Xingqiao, you fought with your brother for no reason. Do you still think you did the right thing?”
Qiu Tong crossed her arms and stood before the three of them, looking down at them.
It wasn’t easy for her to bring back the male protagonist Ye Luan, so that these three little villains could benefit from his good karma. But they ended up beating him up on the first day!
Qiu Xingqiao’s small face was filled with indignance. He did not like this brother who had appeared out of nowhere, but he did not want to tell Qiu Tong the truth. He could only stare at Qiu Tong with angry eyes.
Qiu Xingyu hid behind her brothers and blinked her eyes at Qiu Tong. Her big eyes were filled with grievance. She wanted to say something but hesitated.
When Qiu Xingyuan heard Qiu Tong’s words, the corners of his lips curled into a cold smile. He raised his head and looked at her coldly, just like when they first met.
The three children’s behavior reminded Qiu Tong of their suffering and her heart softened.
“Alright, come home with me and apologize to brother properly. We’ll have meat to eat tonight!”
Qiu Xingyuan squatted down and reached out to touch Qiu Xingyuan’s head, but he dodged her.
“You are already going bankrupt just by raising the three of us. Now, you have this Ye Luan. Are you planning to sell us?”
“Unless you send Ye Luan away, we will never return with you.”
Qiu Tong immediately rebutted Qiu Xingyuan.
“Don’t worry. I brought Ye Luan back but I won’t let any of you suffer. I won’t sell any of you either.”
“Ye Luan has nowhere to go. I will never send him away.”
When Qiu Xingyuan heard this, his attitude became even more resolute. The four of them started to argue at the side of the road, and the atmosphere became very tense.
“Leave. We’re not going back.”
Qiu Tong looked at the three six-year-old brats. They were still underage and had nowhere to go. She suddenly changed her stance and pretended to leave.
“Since all of you are so determined, I’ll go back first. After you have thought things through, you can go home by yourselves.”
Seeing that the three children were silent, Qiu Tong decided to just walk off. However, she did not go far and hid at a corner of the street to secretly observe them.
“Elder Brother, Mommy seems to have really left.” Qiu Xingyu looked in the direction Qiu Tong left and felt a little flustered.
“Don’t worry, Elder Brother will take good care of you.”
Qiu Xingyuan’s aura became even colder. He brought his younger brother and sister into a provision store. He approached an amiable-looking woman and blinked his big eyes, pretending to be innocent.
“Auntie, my mother passed away, and I’m homeless now. Can you help me book a room at the hotel? We are very tired. I can pay you too.”
The round-faced woman looked at the money Qiu Xingyuan stuffed into her hands and instantly beamed with joy. She brought them to the nearest hotel and booked a room.
Qiu Tong stared in bewilderment at Qiu Xingyuan’s god-like maneuvering.
She never expected Qiu Xingyuan to do this.
His mother passed away?
How dare he say that!
Qiu Tong sneaked over to the room the children were in and pressed against the door.
When she heard their discussion about Ye Luan, she realized that the children were jealous. She felt sad but also a little pleased.
Qiu Tong skillfully unlocked the door and sat on the edge of the bed, explaining to the three children seriously.
“Ye Luan is just a distant relative who was adopted by our family. Why are you guys jealous?”
However, Qiu Tong had already exhausted the children’s trust in her. Moreover, the boys both believed that she was lying when she said that she went to borrow money from relatives. How could they believe her words?
Qiu Xingqiao even made a call to the front desk.
“A strange auntie barged into our room. Please send someone over and chase her away.”

chapters.title: Chapter 64 - Lost Children
chapters.content:
Chapter 64: Lost Children
The security guard soon arrived at the room and looked at Qiu Tong warily, treating her like a bad person who was trying to kidnap children.
“I’m the children’s mother,” Qiu Tong said in exasperation.
“We don’t even know her,” Qiu Xingqiao pointed at Qiu Tong angrily.
Qiu Xingyuan stood at the side and did not refute, tacitly agreeing with his younger brother’s words. Little Yu also hid behind her brothers, not daring to look at Qiu Tong’s expression.
The security guard took a step forward. His intention to chase her away was very obvious.
Qiu Tong had no choice but to leave the hotel for now. She would think of a solution when she got home.
But the moment she entered the house, she bumped into Ye Luan, who was about to push open the door and leave.
“Ye Luan, where are you going?”
Qiu Tong asked.
“I don’t think your sons can accept my existence. I don’t want your family to be disrupted because of me, so I want to leave this place. I don’t want to trouble you anymore.”
Ye Luan lowered his head as his fingers subconsciously fiddled with the tattered corner of his shirt.
Qiu Tong looked at Ye Luan, who seemed to be engulfed by loneliness. Her heart filled with compassion. This child had experienced too much.
The two of them had gone through life and death together. How could she let him be homeless now?
Moreover, she would only feel at ease if she kept the male protagonist by her side.
Qiu Tong hurriedly stood in front of Ye Luan to stop him from leaving.
“Don’t worry and stay here. The three of them are just a little jealous and throwing tantrums. They’re staying at a hotel now and will be back in a few days.”
“When the time comes, as the eldest brother, you must protect your younger siblings well.”
Ye Luan still wanted to say something, but Qiu Tong pulled him back into the house.
“Ke Le, bring your men to the hotel to protect those three brats.”
Qiu Tong shouted loudly out the window. She then took out the stewed meat and prepared a simple stir-fry vegetable dish, before inviting Ye Luan to the table.
Ke Le stared through the window at the fragrant meat stew. He cast a resentful glance at Qiu Tong before resigning himself to his fate. He led the way to the hotel.
When Qiu Tong saw that Ye Luan was only eating the rice in his bowl, a conflicted look flashed across her eyes. She quickly piled some meat into his bowln.
“Eat more meat. You don’t have to be so polite with me.”
Ye Luan didn’t say anything, but the speed at which he ate slowed down. He ate the food, bite by bite.
After dinner, Qiu Tong laid a new mattress for him in the boys’ room so that he could have an early rest.
After Qiu Tong left, Ye Luan smelled the lingering fragrance and warmth in the air, before closing his eyes in peace.
All this made him even more reluctant to leave.
Qiu Tong returned to her room, and the moment she closed her eyes, she saw the image of those three children looking resentful.
The children’s attitude today made her realize that she had to change to a bigger house.
The boys would definitely not be willing to stay with Ye Luan. In addition, Ye Luan had strong self-esteem and would not bow down to others.
Therefore, the current situation could only be resolved by living in separate rooms.
The next morning, the first thing Qiu Tong did when she opened her eyes was to calculate the money she had and contact a housing agent to look around.
She went to view nearly every suitable house in the surrounding area, temporarily setting aside the task of picking up the three kids from the hotel.
“Eldest Brother, does Mommy really not want us anymore?”
Qiu Xingyu held her doll, slumped in front of the window, hoping to see Qiu Tong’s familiar figure. She was not even interested in her favorite candy.
The moment he said that, the aura around Qiu Xingyuan became even colder.
Qiu Xingqiao stubbornly pushed all the blame onto Ye Luan. He rolled his eyes and said, “It’s all Ye Luan’s fault. If he hadn’t suddenly appeared, would we have to stay in a hotel?”
“Ye Luan must have a family. He can’t have appeared out of nowhere, right? As long as we can get rid of Ye Luan, our lives will be the same as before.”
Qiu Xingyuan nodded in agreement. The three of them left the hotel and sneaked to the vicinity of the house.
The three of them waited outside for more than an hour before Qiu Tong finally left.
Qiu Xingyuan let his younger siblings stay at the door as lookouts while he ran to a nearby provision store and called the police.
“Uncle Policeman, a homeless child suddenly appeared at my house. Please help him find his family.”
After Qiu Xingyuan gave the address, he quickly hung up the phone and returned to his younger siblings’ side.
The police were surprised to receive such a call from a child. Nevertheless, they still gathered their men and drove the police car towards Qiu Tong’s house.

chapters.title: Chapter 65 - Conflict
chapters.content:
Chapter 65: Conflict
Qiu Tong had already arranged to meet the real estate agent to view houses, but halfway there, she received a call from the agent.
The agent told her apologetically that the owner of the house had something on and would only be back later.
Qiu Tong had no choice but to reschedule her appointment with the agent before heading home.
Her original intention was to make use of this rare free time to bring Ye Luan to buy some new clothes and supplies, before visiting the three children.
She did not expect to see a police car approaching her house.
“What are you doing outside my house?”
Qiu Tong said loudly when she saw the police confronting Ye Luan.
“We received a report saying that there was a homeless child here. The household registration office also said that the child’s registered residence is not here.”
“According to the rules, we have to bring the child back to the police station. We have to contact the child’s family or send the child to the local welfare center. Either way, we can’t let him stay at your house.”
The policeman sized Qiu Tong up from head to toe, as if he was looking at a criminal who did human trafficking.
Qiu Tong objected. She glanced at Ye Luan, who was on his guard, and stood in front of the police.
“I don’t know who called the police, but you can’t take this child away from me.”
The policeman looked at Qiu Tong suspiciously and pointed at Ye Luan.
“Since you put it that way, I’d like to ask you, where did this child come from?”
“Do I have any reason to suspect that you’re carrying out human trafficking? Now, you have to come with me too.”
Qiu Tong’s eyes darkened. She had to go with the police.
She stroked Ye Luan’s hair comfortingly and got into the police car with the police.
The children witnessed this scene clearly from the shadows.
Qiu Xingyu looked at her brothers anxiously.
“Elder Brother, aren’t they here to take Ye Luan away? Why did they bring Mommy along?”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at each other in dismay. It was clear that they had not expected things to turn out this way either.
“Elder Brother, quickly think of something. Mommy is already in the car. Do you really want Mommy to be arrested by the police?”
Qiu Xingyu looked at Qiu Tong’s slender back, her heart in complete turmoil as she looked at her brother with teary eyes.
“Since she chose to protect Ye Luan, let her go to the police station. If we don’t let that woman suffer a little, she won’t think of us.”
Qiu Xingyuan’s tone was cold and unyielding as he looked at the police car gradually disappearing into the distance. However, his eyes were filled with conflict and darkness.
“Elder Brother is right. We shouldn’t care about her.”
Qiu Xingqiao was stubborn and pushed his sister back. “Let’s go back to the hotel. That woman doesn’t want us anymore. I don’t care if she goes to the police station.”
Although Qiu Xingqiao said this, he still turned to look at the police car. He only turned back after the police car had completely disappeared.
Meanwhile, Qiu Tong and Ye Luan were separated after they were brought to the police station.
The police brought Ye Luan to the reception room but brought Qiu Tong to the interrogation room.
“I’ve already said this many times. Ye Luan didn’t appear out of thin air, nor is his origin unknown.”
“He was officially adopted by me. However, the procedures have not been completed yet, so his household register has not been amended.”
Qiu Tong didn’t know how many times she had explained herself, but the police didn’t believe her.
At this moment, the door of the interrogation room was pushed open by a middle-aged man.
The police officer stood up and whispered into the middle-aged man’s ear, “Chief, this woman is suspected of human trafficking, but she’s very tight-lipped and won’t say anything.”
Chief Officer Fang picked up the documents on the table and flipped through a couple pages before throwing them in front of Qiu Tong.
“You said you adopted him. What about the adoption certificate?”
Qiu Tong rolled her eyes, her temper rising.
“I’ve already said that the adoption paperwork has not been completed yet…”
“Nonsense. According to the rules, you’re not allowed to bring the child home before the paperwork is completed.”
Chief Officer Fang interrupted her.
“I think you abducted the child and brought him here to sell. You still dare to deny it when there’s concrete evidence.”
“Bring her to the detention center. Get ready to hand her over to the prosecutor immediately.”
Qiu Tong was obviously unwilling to comply. She looked coldly at the self-opinionated police chief and pushed away the police officers who were about to take her away forcefully. She stared at them with bloodshot eyes and said, “I’ll say it again, I didn’t kidnap the child!”
“How dare you attack the police!” Chief Officer Fang was furious. He slammed the table and stood up.
“Hurry up and capture her!”
“Come at me if you dare!”
At this critical moment, a deep and dignified male voice sounded from the door.
Chief Officer Fang turned around and was about to scold this person who dared to challenge his authority. However, when he saw the rank of a second lieutenant on the other party’s shoulder, he swallowed his words.
It was Shao An.

chapters.title: Chapter 66 - The Adoption Agreement
chapters.content:
Chapter 66: The Adoption Agreement
Chief Officer Fang didn’t expect someone from the military to be here. He quickly walked over and smiled.
“Second Lieutenant Sir, why have you come to our small police station?”
Shao An looked down at Chief Officer Fang. He tossed a brown leather folder at him. His voice was cold.
“I came to deliver Ye Luan’s adoption papers to Qiu Tong, but I didn’t expect her to be arrested and sent to the police station.”
“You can arrest someone based on your own assumptions without any concrete evidence. Is this how your police department works?”
Chief Officer Fang’s forehead was instantly covered in cold sweat. He hadn’t expected that Qiu Tong would really be able to adopt a child. Even more so, he never expected this ordinary woman to have connections with the military.
To be able to mobilize a second lieutenant to protect her, the power behind this woman was something he didn’t even dare to think about.
Chief Officer Fang hurriedly apologized to Qiu Tong and personally placed the adoption papers back into the leather folder before respectfully handing it over to her.
“Miss Qiu Tong, I’m really sorry. We were just too eager to solve the case. Please forgive us and don’t take it to heart.”
Qiu Tong snorted. She knew that although the chief officer was a little stubborn and conceited, there were indeed some issues with her adoption process. She could not entirely blame these people.
“Chief Officer Fang, I hope this misunderstanding will never happen again.”
Chief Officer Fang felt relieved after hearing that. He quickly got someone to bring Ye Luan over and sent the three of them out of the door together with the other police officers.
Just as Shao An entered the police station, the three children had also arrived.
The three children regretted their actions the moment they returned to the hotel. In the end, they decided to come to the police station to rescue Qiu Tong.
After all, they hated Ye Luan, not Qiu Tong.
Qiu Xingqiao squatted at the side and whispered.
“Elder Brother, I just surveyed the area. There are four cameras in front of the police station, and two cameras in the neighboring district where the entrance of the police station is captured.”
Qiu Xingyuan nodded and calmly made arrangements.
“Little Yu, hack into the system and cut off all the power from the six surveillance cameras and the police station. When that happens, the police station will definitely be in chaos. Xingqiao and I can then take the opportunity to go in and save them.”
“When the time comes…”
Qiu Xingyuan’s voice suddenly trailed off, and his sharp gaze stared fixedly at the police station’s entrance.
The other two children followed their elder brother’s gaze and saw Qiu Tong carrying Ye Luan and walking out with Shao An.
“Shao An, thanks.” Qiu Tong waved the adoption agreement in her hand with a smile.
“Boss asked me to do it.” Shao An waved and left.
“Ye Luan, are you happy? From now on, you will be able to live together with us.” Qiu Tong placed Ye Luan on the ground and squatted down with a smile.
“Don’t worry. What happened today will never happen again. I will protect you and your siblings from now on. I will not let any harm come to you.”
Ye Luan’s heart skipped a beat as he looked at Qiu Tong’s serious expression. After experiencing so much together, this was the first time he had developed trust in someone.
Qiu Xingyuan watched as Qiu Tong tidied Ye Luan’s clothes and behaved affectionately with him. The storm in his eyes was nearly visible as he turned to leave.
Qiu Xingqiao snorted, the jealousy and anger in his heart reaching its peak.
This woman was very powerful. There was no need for them to save her!
He kicked the can aside and left quickly.
Qiu Tong turned around but did not see anyone.
Ye Luan also looked back. He caught a passing glimpse of the corner of a pink skirt. His eyes flashed with understanding and he seemed to be deep in thought.
He crossed his arms over his chest, and his expression was that of a person many years older.
“Auntie Qiu, you’re such a terrible mother. None of the three children want to go home.”
Qiu Tong was smiling on the inside at his adult-like manner, but pretended to look troubled. She let out a long sigh and shrugged.
“I have already tried my best to persuade them. Those three children just won’t come home with me. What choice do I have?”
Ye Luan looked at her with disdain. She couldn’t even handle three little brats. He was a bit speechless.
“Don’t worry, I’ll definitely have those three kids return home.”
As he said this, an awkward expression flashed across his face. “Don’t think too much. I just want to return the favor.”
Qiu Tong burst into laughter and ruffled his hair.
“Alright, Aunt Qiu will depend on you then.”

chapters.title: Chapter 67 - Provocation
chapters.content:
Chapter 67: Provocation
The next morning, Qiu Tong had just finished breakfast with Ye Luan when she received a call from the kindergarten teacher.
“Xingyuan’s mother, you finally answered your phone.”
The kindergarten teacher heaved a sigh of relief after the call went through.
“I’ve been calling you the past few days, but I haven’t been able to reach you.”
“Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu have not come to class for the past few days.”
“I want to ask, did something happen at home?”
Qiu Tong thought that the three children refused to go home and were staying at the hotel out of spite. She did not expect that they would not even go to school.
She was silent for a moment, and decided to cover for the three kids.
“Teacher, I’m really sorry. Something cropped up at home, so I didn’t have time to apply for leave for the three of them. But don’t worry, after the family matters are settled, the three of them will continue to go to school.”
“Xingyuan’s mother, I’m relieved then. If there are such things in the future, you must inform us promptly. Otherwise, we would be very worried.”
The kindergarten teacher could not help but lecture her.
Qiu Tong apologized again and hung up the phone. She was all prepared to go to the hotel to grab the three children and send them to kindergarten.
“Are you going to look for the three of them?”
Ye Luan put down his bowl of rice, a hint of craftiness in his eyes. “I’ll go with you, I have a plan.”
Qiu Tong knew that Ye Luan was the ultimate cause of the triplets’ unwillingness to return home. If she brought him along, there might be a pleasant surprise.
She nodded and agreed.
“Elder Brother, look! Isn’t that Mommy?”
Qiu Xingyu was leaning on the window sill. When she saw the familiar figure, her eyes lit up and she pointed downstairs excitedly.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao hurriedly came to the window. When they saw Qiu Tong, a hint of joy flashed across their eyes. However, when they saw Ye Luan beside her, all the joy in their eyes disappeared, leaving only anger.
Qiu Tong brought Ye Luan to the door of the three children’s room. Just as she was about to knock, she realized that the door wasn’t tightly shut.
She reached out and pushed open the door. Years of battle experience had made her aware of impending danger.
Qiu Tong quickly pushed Ye Luan away and somersaulted in the air, dodging the bucket that fell from the sky.
Just as she heaved a sigh of relief, a huge black trash bag came towards her. She couldn’t help cursing.
With one hand on the ground, Qiu Tong rolled to the right. She was worried the trash bag was dirty and didn’t want to kick it.
However, the traps set by the three children were far from over.
Qiu Tong faced a barrage of pillows, towels and even slippery shower gel spread all over the floor. She had to use all her wits and abilities just to avoid them.
She felt that this was more tiring than a real fight.
If not for her quick reflexes, she might have been fooled by the three children.
Qiu Tong dodged the last “weapon” and stood in front of the three children, sighing.
Forget it, it would be worth it if this allowed them to vent their anger.
“I received a call from the kindergarten teacher. She said that you guys haven’t been to school the past few days. Are you guys going to boycott classes?”
Qiu Xingyuan was still in a fit of anger as he said in a dark tone, “Why? Isn’t Ye Luan enough for you to manage? You still have the mood to worry about us?”
“Elder Brother is right. Just take good care of him. Why do you care about us?” Qiu Xingqiao shouted loudly.
“We’re not going to kindergarten. You can use the money you saved to support Ye Luan.”
Qiu Tong’s head ached. She didn’t know why they were so hostile towards Ye Luan.
Was this the power of heaven’s will?
The villains and protagonists were destined to be unable to coexist peacefully?
“You’re right.”
A tender voice sounded from behind them.
The four of them turned around and saw Ye Luan stepping into the room, carefully avoiding the stuff on the ground.
“This is perfect. I am old enough to go to elementary school now. If you guys don’t go to school, Aunt Qiu can use this money to pay my school fees instead.”
Ye Luan’s expression was cold. But he secretly winked at Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong instantly understood Ye Luan’s intentions and nodded in agreement.
“You have a point. I’ll have you enrolled immediately.”
As Qiu Tong spoke, she held Ye Luan’s hand and walked out without looking back.
Qiu Xingqiao looked at the backs of the two of them and felt like he was about to explode on the spot.
“I told you that the kid was up to no good!”
“Elder Brother, are you going to just watch him spend that woman’s money?”
Qiu Xingyuan’s face was also filled with grievance. He pursed his lips and snorted coldly.
“I won’t let Ye Luan do as he pleases. I want him to know that we have the right to spend that woman’s money.”
“Let’s go to kindergarten now.”
Qiu Tong hid outside the door and listened to the children’s conversation. She gave Ye Luan a thumbs-up and brought him to the elementary school next door to the kindergarten to settle the admission procedures.
However, Qiu Tong did not expect that something would happen to the three children the moment they returned to class.

chapters.title: Chapter 68 - Softening
chapters.content:
Chapter 68: Softening
After receiving the call, Qiu Tong hurried to the kindergarten next door, where the teacher was already waiting.
“Teacher, what happened?”
Qiu Tong asked anxiously.
“It’s like this. During class, Qiu Xingyuan had prepared some bottles and test tubes, saying that he was doing research on some locust pesticide.”
“But while some of the other kids were playing, one of them knocked over his test tubes, and they got into a fight.”
“After I found out, I immediately brought the children to the office. I also asked the parent of that kid to come. They are already waiting in the office.”
The teacher told Qiu Tong everything that had happened as they walked to the office.
When Qiu Xingyuan followed the teacher into the office, the parent of the other child was loudly scolding Qiu Xingyuan.
“How did the kindergarten accept a child with violent tendencies like you? I really don’t know how your family taught you.”
“I am his mother. You can talk to me if you want.”
Qiu Tong frowned and stood in front of Qiu Xingyuan, blocking the other party’s fierce gaze.
The parent sized Qiu Tong up. Seeing that she wasn’t wearing any branded clothes, the parent became even more arrogant.
“Let me tell you, I have never hit my precious baby myself.”
“But now, my baby was injured by your kid at the kindergarten. Not only was he physically hurt, he was also emotionally affected.”
“Not only do you have to compensate us for his medical expenses, but you also have to compensate for his psychological damage.”
“Otherwise, I’ll bring my child to the hospital for an examination and tell everyone that your child has violent tendencies. Let’s see if any kindergarten will dare to accept him!”
Qiu Xingyuan stood behind Qiu Tong, tightly clenching his fists, his eyes cold.
He had stirred up so much trouble for Qiu Tong this time. She would definitely not let him off. She would scold him or even give him a good bashing.
He would not be let off the hook, no matter what.
Just as the expression in Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes dimmed, Qiu Tong’s next words made him suddenly raise his head.
Qiu Tong looked at the other party’s twisted face and snorted.
“Sure enough, children do take after their parents. Looking at you, I can imagine how unreasonable your child usually is.”
“My son has always been respectful and polite. He is very well-mannered. If not for your son knocking over all of his test tubes and wasting all his hard work, my son would not have done this.”
“Furthermore, these test tubes and the materials used to make the medicine were carefully selected by my son and bought with money. They did not come out of nowhere.”
“So, not only will I not pay any medical fees, you will also have to compensate us for damage to our property.”
The other kid’s parent widened her eyes in disbelief.
“You must be so poor that you have gone crazy. It’s just a child’s toy. How can it be worth so much money?”
“He’s just a six-year-old kid. You don’t really believe that he can develop drugs that can be put on the market, do you?”
“I think you’re just bluffing.”
Qiu Tong snorted, her eyes full of mockery. “That’s because you are too stupid to see.”
“Although my son is only six years old, he is already very talented in chemistry. Even a high school student might not have such deep chemistry knowledge.”
“If you don’t believe me, I can take the residual chemicals to the laboratory. The facts will speak for themselves.”
“Also, you said that my son pushed your child and injured him.”
“I’ll call the police now. If your child doesn’t have any injuries, I’ll sue you for defamation and fraud. Let’s see which kindergarten would dare to accept the son of a fraud!”
Qiu Tong crossed her arms over her chest and looked at the ashen-faced parent before her without any mercy.
“According to the law…”
Qiu Xingyuan stood behind Qiu Tong, his eyes filled with light as he looked at her back view with a burning gaze. Qiu Tong’s stern voice sounded like heavenly music to his ears.
It turned out that she understood how hard he worked. She valued his experiments and hard work.
Qiu Xingyuan’s vision blurred.
The other kid’s parent clearly did not expect the seemingly delicate and weak-looking Qiu Tong to be such a tough nut to crack.
“Just take it that we’re unlucky. We won’t argue with you anymore.”
Not knowing what else to say, the other party’s parent pulled her child along and wanted to leave.
“Wait, you haven’t apologized to my son yet.”
Qiu Tong pushed Qiu Xingyuan towards them and said firmly.
The other kid’s parent had no choice. With a dark expression, she pressed down her own son’s head in apology to Qiu Xingyuan. She then threw down some money and left angrily.
Qiu Tong placed the money in Qiu Xingyuan’s hands and said in a gentle voice, “Qiu Xingyuan, this is their compensation for you. You decide what to do with it.”
Qiu Xingyuan hurriedly averted his eyes to prevent her from seeing the emotional turmoil in his eyes. He said stubbornly.
“Don’t think that I’ll go home just because you helped me. Give up on that thought.”

chapters.title: Chapter 69 - Buying A House
chapters.content:
Chapter 69: Buying A House
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong looked at Qiu Xingyuan’s awkward manner. Her mood improved greatly.
That stubborn brat.
After Qiu Tong settled the children, it was time for her to view the house.
“Miss Qiu, not only is this house located in a good location, but it’s also spacious and private. It’s the safest place for a mother like you who has children.”
The agent introduced the surroundings to Qiu Tong as he knocked on the door.
The owner of the house was a middle-aged man. He politely invited them in.
The house was a small two-story villa. There were five rooms upstairs, two rooms downstairs, an open kitchen and living room, as well as a small storage room.
There was an attached garden outside the house, and below it was a basement that had been transformed by the original owner into a movie theater.
Moreover, judging from the layout and environment of the house, the owner of the house was also someone who cherished the house and enjoyed life.
This was the most satisfying house Qiu Tong had seen in recent times.
Not only could each child have their own room, they could also transform the extra room into their work room.
“To be honest, if it weren’t for the fact that our whole family is going abroad, I wouldn’t have been willing to sell this house.” The middle-aged man chuckled when he saw Qiu Tong’s moved expression.
“It’s indeed very good. I can confirm my interest now.”
Qiu Tong nodded with satisfaction.
The agent’s face lit up. Another generous commission in his pocket now.
However, just as he was about to bring Qiu Tong over to make payment, a harsh female voice came from behind.
“I’m very pleased with this house. I want it.”
A woman with heavy makeup and wearing slim heels appeared in front of everyone.
“Miss Lu, Miss Qiu has decided on this house. Why don’t I show you another house?”
The agent’s expression changed when he saw the woman. He spoke respectfully.
He had arranged with Miss Lu to view houses tomorrow. He did not expect her to come looking for him today.
“I want this house.”
Miss Lu raised her chin and looked at Qiu Tong with disdain. She said arrogantly, “Why? Do you think I can’t afford it?”
The agent’s eyes were filled with panic as he looked at Qiu Tong with a troubled expression.
“Miss Qiu, do you want to look at other houses?”
Qiu Tong did not want to give up the house that she had worked so hard to find.
“First come first serve. I want this house.”
Miss Lu snorted and stretched out her five fingers, her long nails nearly poking into Qiu Tong’s eyes.
“When buying something, the highest bidder wins.”
“Owner, if you sell the house to me, I’ll add $10,000 to the total amount.”
When the owner heard that, he was tempted. He turned to Qiu Tong and waited for her reply.
Qiu Tong sneered and stepped forward.
“I’ll add $20,000!”
Miss Lu’s expression changed. Qiu Tong didn’t look rich but she was so extravagant. She did not even blink when she called out $20,000. Miss Lu’s face darkened.
“$30,000.”
Qiu Tong did not give in at all, and her aura grew even stronger.
“$40,000!”
Miss Lu did not say anything else. Although she could still bid, there was no need for her to spend so much money on this house.
After all, $40,000 was not a small sum.
Besides, she did not know Qiu Tong’s limit.
“I’ll remember you.”
Miss Lu threw down these words coldly and turned to leave. Her high heels made a sharp tapping sound on the ground, showing her anger.
A radiant smile appeared on Qiu Tong’s face when she paid the deposit and got the signed contract.
However, the agent did not look that happy. He kept sighing and looked at Qiu Tong worriedly.
“Miss Qiu, Miss Lu’s full name is Lu Zhiling. She’s a doctor from a nearby clinic.”
“She has a close relationship with Mayor Shen. You have offended her, so you must be careful in the future.”
When Qiu Tong heard the word “doctor”, she quickly recalled the incident in the clinic. Her sharp senses told her that Lu Zhiling was involved.
“Thank you for the advice, but I am not someone who is afraid of trouble.”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes. If this woman dared to do anything, she would settle all scores with her.
It was getting dark when Qiu Tong came out of the house.. She looked down at the time and hurried towards the school.

chapters.title: Chapter 70 - In Perfect Harmony
chapters.content:
Chapter 70: In Perfect Harmony
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The school bell rang just as Qiu Tong arrived at the kindergarten.
Ye Luan immediately saw Qiu Tong, who was standing at the door. She walked over with steady steps, feeling a little out of place with the mischievous and lively children around her.
The three children also saw Qiu Tong at the door. They were just about to go over when they saw Ye Luan and stopped in their tracks.
“Auntie Qiu.” Ye Luan nodded at Qiu Tong and followed her towards the three children.
“Qiu Xingyuan, I’m going to prepare a feast tonight. Can you bring your younger siblings home for dinner?”
Qiu Tong squatted in front of Qiu Xingyuan with a smile.
Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu turned to look at their eldest brother, waiting for his answer.
They knew about Qiu Tong defending Qiu Xingyuan in the office today, so their resentment towards her was not as great as before.
Qiu Xingyuan’s cold gaze swept across Ye Luan and Qiu Tong. He did not answer Qiu Tong’s question. Instead, he pulled his younger siblings and circled around the two of them in an irritated manner.
“Qiu Xingyu, the meatballs at the hotel last night. You seemed to enjoy them. Do you want to eat them again tonight?”
Qiu Xingyuan glanced at Qiu Tong before speaking to his sister.
Qiu Xingyu instantly understood what her brother meant. Although she was a little hesitant, she still clapped her hands in feigned joy.
“Sure, sure. That meatball is so delicious. I want to eat sweet and sour beef too.”
Qiu Xingqiao also chimed in.
“I heard that our hotel had to pay a large sum of money to hire this chef. The food he makes is definitely much better than a certain someone.”
“We can eat different dishes every day and try all the dishes on the menu.”
Qiu Tong understood the meaning behind their words. After exchanging glances with Ye Luan, she raised her voice and said.
“Ye Luan, I saw a very good house this afternoon. I’ve already made a down payment and can move in anytime.”
“We can move in tonight. And I’ve prepared a feast to celebrate. There’s a movie theater in the basement and the two of us can watch movies and snack tonight.”
“What movie do you like? We’ll watch it.”
Ye Luan played along with Qiu Tong. “I want to eat popcorn and iced watermelon. It would be even better if there’s cake.”
The three children stopped in their tracks when they heard their conversation.
This woman actually bought a new house?
They looked at each other and saw the emotions in each other’s eyes.
They could not let Ye Luan take advantage of the new house!
Qiu Tong bought that house. If Ye Luan could stay there, they could as well.
The three children quietly changed their direction.
Qiu Tong saw that although their faces looked grim, they still obediently followed behind her and Ye Luan. She couldn’t help but chuckle on the inside.
Even though this method was a little cliche, it was useful.
Before long, the four children stood in front of the two-story villa and looked at the building in front of them in shock. They could not believe that this was their future home.
“This house is very spacious. Each of you can choose your own room and have your own space.”
“I’ll leave the choice to you.”
Qiu Tong clapped her hands and looked at the surprised children. She felt that her money spent had been worth it.
“I want to stay in this room.”
It was rare for Ye Luan to take the initiative and choose the room first.
How could Qiu Xingqiao let Ye Luan beat him to it? He purposely said, “I want this one too. I like the blue wallpaper inside.”
Ye Luan generously gave it to him. “Alright, then you can stay in this room. I think the one next to this room is not bad either.”
However, Qiu Xingqiao insisted on going against him and provoked, “I also think this one is not bad! I want this one then!”
“You can choose first. I’ll choose after you’re done.”
Ye Luan understood his intentions and gave a discreet smile. He put on a magnanimous face and looked at Qiu Tong obediently.
Qiu Tong patted his head gently and smiled brightly. “Ye Luan, you’re so obedient. Whatever you want to eat tonight, Auntie Qiu will make it for you.”
Ye Luan nodded. “Auntie Qiu is so nice. I will definitely be obedient and not make you angry.”
“After all, you’ve worked hard to support me.”
Qiu Tong and Ye Luan performed in perfect harmony. The three children looked very conflicted at their blissful expressions.
Meanwhile, Lu Zhiling had just returned home. The more she thought about the earlier incident, the angrier she became. She found her younger brother Lu Sheng and planned with him to teach Qiu Tong a lesson.
When Lu Sheng heard that his sister had been bullied, his fiery temper was instantly ignited. He immediately brought a few hooligans along to find Qiu Tong.. The gang surrounded Qiu Tong and the children.

chapters.title: Chapter 71 - Refusing To Give Up
chapters.content:
Chapter 71: Refusing To Give Up
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
When Lu Sheng saw Qiu Tong’s face, greed flashed across his eyes.
“I was wondering what kind of powerful woman you are, but it’s just you! A widow with a bunch of children dares to bully my sister? Fighting over a house with my sister, I think you’re tired of living!”
“I’m warning you, give up the house immediately. Otherwise, don’t blame me for being ruthless!”
Qiu Tong recognized that this was the gangster who had been causing trouble at the clinic. She narrowed her eyes and said coldly.
“I’m open and aboveboard. Why should I give up a house that I bought with real money?”
“You want to snatch my house? Come and get it yourself!”
Lu Sheng had always been domineering. Not only did he not show any fear, he became even more arrogant.
“Seems like you want to do things the hard way.”
“Guys, attack! Don’t show mercy just because she’s a woman!”
With a flash, Qiu Tong snatched the wooden club from the hands of the burly man closest to her. She flew up and kicked him hard in the stomach!
“Ah!”
The burly man felt his arm go numb as a huge force surged towards him. It was as though his internal organs had shifted positions as he was sent flying backwards, smashing heavily into the ground!
Qiu Tong brandished the club in her hand fiercely. One punch and one club strike for each of them. All of them would soon fall to the ground screaming and moaning.
She grabbed Lu Sheng’s hair and smashed his face against the ground.
“You’re in luck today because I can’t be too violent in front of the children. Otherwise, I won’t let you off so easily.”
“I’m just teaching you a lesson today. If you dare to try again, I’ll send you to meet your maker.”
Lu Sheng’s face was covered in tears, snot and blood. He was in a miserable state and could only concede defeat to save his life.
Qiu Tong let go of Lu Sheng’s hair and turned to smile at the children.
She waved at them and walked past them with victory in her step. Her dashing back profile was deeply imprinted in their hearts.
Not only did Lu Sheng fail to gain anything from Qiu Tong, he almost lost his life. How could he let this go?
He immediately went home to discuss a plan with Lu Zhiling.
When Lu Zhiling heard her brother’s words, she clenched her fists tightly, her long nails leaving deep marks on her palms.
“Why don’t you find more people? I don’t believe that a woman like her can be that good.”
“Sis, this woman is very evil. I think we should attack from another angle.”
As soon as Lu Sheng said this, Lu Zhiling knew that he already had a plan in mind and waited for him to continue.
“After I came back, I asked someone to investigate Qiu Tong and found that her family background is quite shady. We can make use of her bad reputation to prevent her from living there.”
Lu Zhiling immediately became excited and discussed with Lu Sheng in a low voice how to deal with Qiu Tong…
The next day, as soon as Qiu Tong walked out of the door, she realized that there were already many people gathered at the door, pointing at her house.
She looked at what everyone was pointing at and saw that her front door was covered in red paint.
“The daughter of a swindler is also a swindler!”
“Pay back what you owe.”
“Swindler, get out!”
Seeing these words, everyone immediately looked at Qiu Tong with hostility.
Although the residents here weren’t extremely wealthy, they still owned considerable assets to be able to afford a house in this district. They were especially sensitive to swindlers.
Qiu Tong was the daughter of the swindler, Qiu Rong. As soon as the news spread, there was much discussion about Qiu Tong and her children.
“How can we be at ease with such a person living here?”
“This kind of swindler can easily fall back into old ways. She might target us one day.”
A middle-aged man who had once suffered from fraud shouted at Qiu Tong, “People like you should go back to the slums. We don’t welcome you here!”
The moment the man said that, the crowd started to stir. They all agreed with the man and glared at Qiu Tong and the children.
As the saying goes, enemies always crossed paths.
After leaving Mr. Cui, Lin Shan did not settle down on her own. A person like her always had to depend on a man.
With her beauty and figure, she soon found herself a new man who lived in the same neighborhood as Qiu Tong. The moment they stepped out, they saw Qiu Tong getting scolded.
Lin Shan stood behind the crowd and looked at Qiu Tong, who was being pointed at by the crowd. The jealousy and resentment in her heart reached a peak.
Qiu Tong was clearly so rich that she could purchase property here, yet she had taken $15,000 from her. Why?!
When Lin Shan saw that Qiu Tong was being harangued by the crowd, she sneered and joined in.
“Qiu Tong, you have the money to buy a villa here and live a good life. Yet, you didn’t help your father compensate those poor people who were scammed.. What a filial daughter you are.”

chapters.title: Chapter 72 - Brewing Public Opinion
chapters.content:
Chapter 72: Brewing Public Opinion
Lin Shan righteously looked at the angry faces around her. She was happy and continued.
“Back then, Uncle Qiu treated you so well. Whenever you asked for something, he would buy it immediately and give it to you.”
“Uncle Qiu didn’t say a word even though you stubbornly bore three children with some unknown guy. He has always been quietly supporting you.”
“Now, you’re enjoying your life here with a huge sum of money that you got through some shady means, while Uncle Qiu is suffering in prison. Can you really feel at ease?”
Qiu Tong looked at Lin Shan coldly and sneered.
“In this world, you are the least worthy person to criticize me! My former best friend, who tried to fleece me even after my family went bankrupt.”
Qiu Tong turned to look at the man standing intimately beside Lin Shan and smiled brightly.
“Lin Shan, you put so much emphasis on relationships. But didn’t you break up with Mr. Cui to find a new boyfriend?”
When the man beside Lin Shan heard this, he immediately shook off her hand and turned to question her.
“Lin Shan, didn’t you say that I was your first man?”
“The first?”
Qiu Tong looked at Lin Shan with feigned surprise. “Didn’t you break up with Mr. Cui because he saw a picture of you with another man?”
“That’s not right. I remember that it wasn’t just one man.”
The man’s face darkened visibly, and his gaze towards Lin Shan was filled with coldness.
Lin Shan had been dating the man for a long time. She knew that the man was really angry, so she quickly held his arm and explained.
“Honey, listen to me. It’s not like that…”
To her surprise, the man shook off her hand and walked in the other direction without looking back.
“Qiu Tong, how could you be so vicious as to come up with such a lie to sow discord between me and my boyfriend!”
Lin Shan turned to glare at Qiu Tong, her eyes filled with jealousy and hatred. She couldn’t help but think of Qiu Tong in the most vicious way possible.
It was impossible for Qiu Tong to suddenly have so much money and live here just based on her own abilities. Otherwise, she would not have been in such dire straits when the Qiu family went bankrupt.
Therefore, she must have found a rich man who was willing to spend money on her. So that she was able to live in such a big house now.
She voiced out her conjecture.
Qiu Tong crossed her arms and stood on the steps, looking at her coldly. “You depend on men to survive, so you think others are like you.”
“I’m not you. I don’t have to rely on a rich man. I can become rich with my own abilities.”
Lin Shan didn’t expect Qiu Tong to be so powerful even after the Qiu family had fallen.
“Qiu Tong, I want to see how long that man can tolerate you and your three brats!”
“I’m waiting to see the day you get kicked out of the house!”
Qiu Tong held the house deed in her hand confidently. Her lips curled up slightly, but her smile did not reach her eyes. “Lin Shan, you still have time to argue with me here?”
“If you don’t chase after your boyfriend now, I’m afraid that he will chase you out of the house.”
Lin Shan suddenly remembered how temperamental the man could be and panicked. She glared at Qiu Tong and rushed out of the crowd, chasing after the man.
Meanwhile, Lu Zhiling had been hiding in the crowd to see Qiu Tong make a fool of herself. She wanted to see Qiu Tong being criticized by everyone and she overheard Lin Shan and Qiu Tong’s conversation.
She gritted her teeth, feeling indignant.
Why was Qiu Tong’s sugar daddy so generous that he was willing to give her so much money in such a short time?
As for her own sugar daddy, not only was he a little eccentric, he was also not so generous when it came to money. Thinking of this, she hated Qiu Tong even more.
Lu Zhiling didn’t want to look at Qiu Tong’s victorious face anymore. She turned around and left the district.
However, the residents’ condemnation of Qiu Tong did not stop.
“Actually… Qiu Rong might not be a fraud. I heard that he did a lot of charity work and sponsored many people.”
Amidst the scolding, a middle-aged woman suddenly called out in a small voice.
However, her voice was quickly drowned out by the intense emotions of the crowd.
Qiu Tong frowned when she heard the woman’s words.
From what she said, Qiu Rong was not a bad person?
Then why did he cheat…
Qiu Tong didn’t have much of an impression of Qiu Rong and didn’t know much about him. So even though she found it rather strange, she didn’t think too much about it.

chapters.title: Chapter 73 - Photos
chapters.content:
Chapter 73: Photos
Faced with everyone’s condemnation, Qiu Tong swept her cold gaze across the room.
“What a joke. The daughter of a swindler will definitely cheat, and the son of a murderer will definitely kill?”
“What kind of logic is that?”
“I bought this house with real money. Every dollar can be properly accounted for. I can stay here with good conscience.”
“If I find out that you’re harassing me and my children because of this reason, I’ll definitely take legal action. By then, you won’t be able to escape the crime of slandering me and causing trouble.”
“If you guys want to stay in a jail for a few days, I don’t mind helping you fulfil that wish.”
Qiu Tong’s attitude was firm, and when the crowd heard her mention the law, they lost their confidence and started to disperse.
A few remaining stubborn folks were then cleared away after Qiu Tong called for security.
Qiu Tong had thought that this matter would end here, but the next day, her photos and history were exposed on the internet.
Lin Shan stirred up a major furore in the online forums with comments about how a swindler’s daughter was living in a luxurious mansion.
The matter continued to brew and rumors started to spread online.
Jin Yang’s expression darkened when he saw Qiu Tong’s photo on the headlines. His slender fingers scrolled down the screen. The malicious comments made the storm in his eyes deepen.
“Shao An, when did the internet become so chaotic? Clean up the online environment immediately.”
“I want everyone to know that the Internet is not a lawless place.”
Shao An, “…”
Was this really something they should bother about?
When Sir came across anything that had to do with Qiu Tong, he would always lose his mind.
Meanwhile, rumors about Qiu Tong had spread everywhere on the Internet. She saw the distorted facts and malicious comments.
Qiu Tong stared at the computer with cold eyes.
These people hid behind their computers and did not know the truth. They only followed random rumors on the Internet.
They were baring their fangs and brandishing their claws behind the keyboard. These netizens were even more despicable than those people who had pointed at her in real life!
She would let these keyboard warriors know that cyber crime was also a crime!
Qiu Tong placed her slender fingers on the keyboard. Just as she was about to show off her skills, she suddenly realized that within minutes, all the trending searches about her had disappeared without a trace. The accounts of those netizens who had been criticizing her had also been blocked.
The entire online world was quiet. There was no sign of the chaos from before.
Qiu Tong could not help but exclaim with heartfelt emotion.
The efficiency of the cyber-police in this alternate world was really very high. Such a fast response and concise action was something that even her original world could not achieve.
She closed her laptop with a smile, shaking her head gently.
Just as Qiu Tong was about to pack up and leave the house, she received an unexpected call.
“Hello, is this Miss Qiu? I am calling from the prison. There has been a sudden outbreak of an infectious disease here which has infected many prisoners, and your father Qiu Rong was not spared.”
“The prisoner is weak. I don’t know if he can make it through. He keeps talking about you. Do you want to meet him?”
Qiu Tong was stunned.
The former owner of her body hadn’t visited Qiu Rong for many years. After she transmigrated, things happened so quickly one after another. The children took up most of her time and she never even thought of the father.
She kept silent. The book she read did not provide much information about Qiu Rong and Qiu Tong’s relationship. She was a little afraid of exposing herself in front of this man who was very familiar with Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong gave it some serious thought and finally found an excuse to reject the visit.
After hanging up the phone, she realized that the three children were peering through the door with gloomy expressions. It was obvious that they were unhappy.
When they saw Qiu Tong looking at them, they grew even more withdrawn. Qiu Xingyuan snorted coldly and ran away with his siblings. He slammed the bedroom door shut. No matter how Qiu Tong knocked on the door, the kids inside did not respond.
An ordinary bedroom door was no obstacle to Qiu Tong. She poked a wire into the keyhole, and with two clicks, the door opened.
The three children were gathered together. When they saw her, their expressions changed abruptly. Qiu Xingyuan immediately placed his hands behind his back as if he was hiding something.
“Qiu Xingyuan, what are you hiding?”

chapters.title: Chapter 74 - Visiting The Prison
chapters.content:
Chapter 74: Visiting The Prison
Qiu Tong asked softly, not understanding why the three children had suddenly become so strange.
Qiu Xingyu turned his head away, looking as if he did not want to talk to her. Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu stood on the same side as their elder brother and remained silent.
Qiu Tong gently pulled Qiu Xingyuan over and forcefully pulled his hands in front of her.
“Let me see.”
Qiu Xingyuan’s hidden item was actually a photo.
Jagged lines ran across the photo. It was obvious that someone had torn the photo apart and pieced it back together with tape.
Qiu Tong looked at the photo in her hand. Her heart filled with shock as memories flashed across her mind.
It was a photo of a woman and a middle-aged man.
The woman had a beautiful face, lively eyes and was in high spirits. It was Qiu Tong from a few years ago.
The middle-aged man beside her stood tall and straight. He had a scholarly aura which was very appealing.
And the reason for her shock was that this man actually looked exactly like her late father!
Qiu Tong looked at the picture with a complicated expression. She had not inherited Qiu Tong’s memory, so she did not know Qiu Rong’s appearance and temperament. The only information she knew was based on the book’s description of Qiu Rong.
She couldn’t help but feel a little strange. She felt that some things were really too coincidental.
“This is… your grandfather?”
“Give the photo back to me.”
Qiu Xingyuan looked at Qiu Tong’s profound gaze and panicked. He was afraid that she would tear the photo apart again, so he pounced on her, preparing to snatch the photo away.
Qiu Tong stood up and raised the photo high above her head. She looked down at the jumping child and asked seriously.
“Where did you get this photo? And why did you keep it?”
“As long as you tell the truth, I will return the photo to you.”
Qiu Xingyuan glared at her reluctantly. In the end, he gave in as Qiu Tong had the height advantage.
He said petulantly, “Ever since grandpa went to prison, you’ve been cursing and swearing at home every day. You keep blaming Grandpa for the loss of your good life and the status of the eldest daughter of the Qiu family. Falling from heaven to hell.”
“So you threw out all of Grandpa’s belongings, including his photos. You tore them into pieces.”
“While you were otherwise occupied, we found all these photo fragments in the trash. It took a lot to piece together such a complete picture.”
“Grandpa treated us very well before he went to prison. We’ve been on the constant move and our lives were unstable. Grandpa remained very concerned about us and our studies. He’s very kind, so we like Grandpa alot and miss him very much.”
“Grandpa has been in prison for so many years but you’ve only brought us to visit twice.”
“We can only secretly take a look at the photo when we miss Grandpa, in case we forget what he looks like.”
Qiu Tong’s emotions were in turmoil. She finally understood why the three children had such grim expressions. They must have heard her refusal to visit their Grandpa in the prison.
Her gaze once again fell upon the photo in her hand. Looking at Qiu Rong’s face, which was the same as her birth father’s, she decided to visit him. She hoped that after seeing Qiu Rong, she would be able to solve the doubts in her heart.
Qiu Tong placed the photo back into Qiu Xingyuan’s hands and gently rubbed his head. Her gaze was gentle.
“You’re all good children. Mommy’s previous way of thinking was wrong. After seeing how filial you guys are, I feel that you are right.”
“I’ll go and visit your grandfather now, but you heard what the prison guards said. There’s a widespread epidemic in the prison. There are many unknown dangers and variables.”
“So this time, I won’t bring you guys along. Once the situation there stabilizes, I promise I’ll bring you guys to visit Grandpa.”
Qiu Xingyuan saw that Qiu Tong’s words were sincere, and he had also heard the contents of the phone call, so he knew that she was not lying to them. He nodded stiffly, and the anxiety and wariness in his eyes eased a little.
Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu were extremely excited. They were filled with anticipation for the next time they would visit Grandpa.
Qiu Tong hurried over to the prison. After she was done with the procedures, she put on a mask and was brought to a transparent window by a prison guard.
“According to the epidemic prevention rules, you only have twenty minutes with him.”
“Thank you.”
Qiu Tong nodded before turning to look at Qiu Rong.

chapters.title: Chapter 75 - Danger
chapters.content:
Chapter 75: Danger
Qiu Rong’s face was pale and sickly, but his gentle demeanor hadn’t changed at all. He looked at his daughter with a smile.
He… really looked exactly like her father!
The moment Qiu Tong saw him, a sense of familiarity and nostalgia gushed out of her heart. She instinctively picked up the phone by the window and called him “Daddy”.
Qiu Rong was slightly taken aback. Ever since he was arrested, Qiu Tong had never called him “Daddy” again. His eyes instantly became moist.
“Tongtong, you’ve grown up.”
Qiu Tong did not know why, but it all felt very natural when she told Qiu Rong about the recent events, about all the changes and interesting things that had happened to the children. She looked at Qiu Rong, who was smiling very gently, and whose eyes were filled with tolerance. Her heart surged with emotions.
Qiu Rong looked at his daughter, who was behaving very differently from before. She was not hysterical nor was she cursing viciously. Instead, she was exuding confidence.
He nodded in relief and carefully reminded her about the things to take note of in her life.
After their conversation, Qiu Tong felt that Qiu Rong was not at all like those vicious swindlers. Furthermore, after hearing that Qiu Rong had been engaged in charity work, she was filled with questions.
“Daddy, did you really commit fraud? Is there… something I don’t know?”
“No. Who did you hear that nonsense from?”
Qiu Rong immediately denied it, looking somewhat guarded. “You’ve been here long enough today. It’s time to go back.”
Qiu Rong’s evasive attitude made Qiu Tong’s heart skip a beat. She made up her mind.
He was afraid of something.
If he didn’t commit fraud, then obviously someone had set him up. But he didn’t dare to tell others.
She took a deep look at Qiu Rong. A person who could make him so fearful was definitely someone of high status and power.
Qiu Tong was silent for a moment, then she smiled again, as if she had never asked the question before. She continued to talk to her father, but secretly used her power to help Qiu Rong heal his illness.
20 minutes passed quickly and Qiu Tong had to leave at the urging of the prison guards.
However, she didn’t leave immediately. Instead, she went to look for the warden to discuss offering compensation for a reduction in Qiu Rong’s sentence. She met someone completely unexpected.
Why was he here?
Jin Yang didn’t expect to see Qiu Tong here either. “You…”
He came here today to meet the S+Class criminal, Dina.
Dina was the former leader of a terrorist organization. He had collaborated with many foreign forces and created many terrorist operations. He was extremely cunning and they had paid a huge price to capture him.
The terrorists whom Jin Yang and Qiu Tong had worked together to eliminate were only a branch of this organization. From this, one could see how terrifying their power was.
Dina’s people were sinister, cunning and extremely vicious. Even though the military had tried their best and used all kinds of methods, this person stubbornly refused to talk.
Therefore, in order to find out more about the terrorist organization that Dina was in, and to find out where they were located, Jin Yang personally came to the prison for interrogation.
Qiu Tong pointed at the other room and said, “I’m here to see my father.”
Jin Yang’s ears turned slightly red when he saw Qiu Tong and recalled what had happened in the villa before they parted.
“I’m here for an interrogation. Wait for me, I’ll go out with you.”
Qiu Tong nodded. She was going to talk to the warden about compensation and reducing her father’s prison sentence.
Jin Yang pushed the door open and entered. When he faced Dina, his entire aura suddenly changed. “Dina, you are now our prisoner. You have no choice but to cooperate with us.”
“I came to see you personally. You should know how determined we are in this matter.”
“I advise you to explain to me about your organization while I am still being nice to you. Otherwise, I’ll let you know how vicious I can be.”
Dina was experienced with interrogation methods. His gaze was malicious as he looked at Jin Yang provocatively.
“It was my biggest mistake not being able to kill you with one shot.”
Jin Yang looked at Dina and suddenly smiled. He leaned back in his chair and crossed his arms.
“Too bad. I won. That’s why I’m king.”
“No matter how regretful you are, you have to suffer the rest of your days in prison.”
“Tell me everything about your organization. I might be able to spare your life.”
When Dina heard the word “life”, a flash of madness passed through his eyes. He feigned a nod, leaned forward and softened his tone.
“Alright, I’ll tell you everything you want to know…”
Qiu Tong stood outside the interrogation room, watching the two of them confront each other through the glass.
All of a sudden, she felt all the blood freeze and her limbs turned cold. Years of combat experience told her that there was danger!

chapters.title: Chapter 76 - Threat And Enticement
chapters.content:
Chapter 76: Threat And Enticement
Qiu Tong suddenly raised her head to look at Dina and saw the madness and bloodlust in his eyes.
In that split second, Qiu Tong did not have time to think. She immediately broke through the door and pulled Jin Yang away from Dina’s optimum attack range!
“Be careful!”
As expected, Dina had already unlocked his handcuffs. He raised the knife he had taken from the cafeteria and stabbed it at Jin Yang!
Obviously, he didn’t expect a woman to suddenly rush in and ruin his plans. His expression was ferocious as he immediately tried to stab Qiu Tong in the back.
Jin Yang also reacted at this time. He raised his hand and knocked away the knife in Dina’s hand, rapidly exchanging blows with Dina.
Qiu Tong also quickly joined the battle. The two of them were experts in combat, and now that it was two against one, they suppressed Dina without any problem.
Jin Yang cuffed Dina again and turned to look at Qiu Tong.
“Are you all right?”
“I’m fine. You’re the one who’s injured.”
Qiu Tong looked at the blood on his hand.
Only then did Jin Yang feel the pain. He had been cut when he was trying to protect Qiu Tong.
Without thinking, Qiu Tong held Jin Yang’s injured right hand and used her power to heal him.
Jin Yang felt the smoothness in his hands. The familiar feeling in his heart appeared again. However, he felt a splitting headache and his face turned even paler.
When Qiu Tong saw this, she thought that he had been injured in some other way. She quickly examined him, and only then did she detect the same virus as Qiu Rong in his body.
“Are you infected too?”
Qiu Tong suddenly turned to look at Dina. Apart from Dina, no one else could have transmitted the virus to Jin Yang.
Dina’s eyes were bloodshot. He licked his dry lips and looked at them with a crazed look.
“That’s right. I’ve been infected too. My immune system has been compromised. There’s no special medicine to treat this epidemic. I can only wait for death.”
“If I can drag you along as I die, it would be worth it.”
Qiu Tong treated all of Jin Yang’s injuries and viral infection, before putting down his hand and asking him, “What do you want from him?”
Jin Yang looked at his hands in dismay. It was only when he heard Qiu Tong’s second question that he came back to his senses and told her his purpose of coming here.
“I see. Then I should be able to help you accomplish your goal.”
Qiu Tong smiled and looked at Dina. “As long as you tell me everything, I can cure you.”
Dina raised his head and looked at Qiu Tong, his eyes filled with hope.
However, the light in his eyes quickly dimmed.
These government officials wanted to trick him into working for them. Did they really think he was a fool?
Qiu Tong sat opposite Dina and stared at him. “Dina, as long as you tell us the situation of all the terrorist organizations and help the government eliminate or enlist those people, you can live.”
“You should know that I am the only one here who can save you.”
Still handcuffed, Dina smashed the table in front of him!
“If there is really some special medicine, you would have already taken it out to treat the others. I will never believe your nonsense!”
Qiu Tong had long known that he would not be compliant. Dina was not only vicious and cruel, but also very suspicious. He would not be so gullible.
If she couldn’t produce convincing evidence, he would never agree.
Qiu Tong whispered in Jin Yang’s ear.
Jin Yang understood and nodded. He made a call and someone came in with a syringe.
Qiu Tong picked up the syringe and skillfully expelled the air from it. An arc of transparent liquid shot out in the air.
“Dina, you can choose not to believe me, but you have to believe in your own body.”
“This is the latest drug that we’ve developed. Once you inject it, the effects will be immediate and it will relieve your symptoms very quickly.”
“As long as you cooperate, I will do my best for the follow-up treatment.”
Qiu Tong slowly injected the medicine into Dina’s body. She looked at his flickering eyes and knew that he was wavering.
Dina immediately felt the changes in his body. He suddenly had hope for survival.
There was really a special medicine…
Qiu Tong held the empty syringe in front of Dina, her voice had an enticing pitch.
“Look, your chance at survival is right in front of you. What’s there to worry about? The right choice is to hold onto it tightly.”

chapters.title: Chapter 77 - Misunderstanding
chapters.content:
Chapter 77: Misunderstanding
Enticed by Qiu Tong’s offer, Dina finally gave in and lowered his head.
“As long as you can treat my illness, I’m willing to help you.”
Jin Yang got the answer he wanted. He waved his hand and had his men take Dina away.
“Well done.”
Jin Yang’s slender fingers played with the syringe as he looked at Qiu Tong with admiration.
Qiu Tong smiled. In fact, there was no special medicine. It was just normal vitamins. She had used her special ability.
She had merely joined hands with Jin Yang to put on a show for Dina.
“Jin Yang, Dina is an S+Class criminal. He will typically be in solitary confinement and escorted at all times. He will not come into contact with other criminals.”
“However, even he has contracted the infectious disease. It means that the disease is highly infectious, and the method of transmission is unknown.”
“There are people visiting here every day. If we let the disease spread, it might affect the entire country.”
“Therefore, I suggest that we eliminate the root cause of the epidemic in prison. At the same time, stop all visits and seal off the prison before the epidemic is completely resolved.”
The warden was just entering the room when heard Qiu Tong’s words. He immediately retorted, “That’s impossible.”
“How do you maintain the normal operations of the prison when it is completely sealed?”
“Don’t talk nonsense here.”
Jin Yang didn’t even look at the warden. His voice was filled with dominance as he said, “I’m here. Do you have the right to speak?”
It was only then that the warden remembered that Jin Yang was also there. He repeatedly assured that he wouldn’t dare and his attitude immediately became humble.
“Just do as Qiu Tong says. Seal off the prison. People are only allowed to enter and not leave. If I find anyone missing, you’ll be held responsible.”
It would take a few days to completely eliminate the epidemic.
Qiu Tong did not expect things to turn out this way. Thinking of her children, she called the estate management.
“Hello, I’m the owner of Villa 23. My name is Qiu Tong.”
“I can’t go home for a while because something happened at the last minute, so I was hoping you could go to my house and help me tell my children and assist with their food requirements. I’ll pay you when I get back.”
“They don’t have cell phones. I can’t reach them.”
The estate management staff immediately agreed. After hanging up the phone, he rushed to Qiu Tong’s house.
When he arrived at the door, he realized that someone had installed an electric net outside the villa. There was a sizzling electric current flowing on it, indicating that the electric net was live.
The staff had no choice but to shout at the door.
But the entire villa was as quiet as before. No one came out to respond.
He thought that there might be no one at home, so he had no choice but to go back first.
In the end, Qiu Tong’s message did not reach the children.
Prison was a place where prisoners were kept. The only visitors were family members of the prisoners or the police who wished to interrogate the inmates. No one would spend the night there.
There was only one guest room in the entire prison.
It was arranged for Qiu Tong and Jin Yang to stay in this guest room together. There was no other alternative.
Qiu Tong shrugged nonchalantly and agreed.
After all, they had shared a room previously when she was Jin Yang’s personal bodyguard.
Jin Yang nodded expressionlessly as well. Other than the tight line of his jaw, there was nothing unusual about his demeanor.
Qiu Tong knew that the most common transmission pathways for infectious diseases were water, air and saliva.
Hence, after entering the guest room, her first action was to check if there were any harmful substances in the air and water.
Qiu Tong turned on the shower head and looked at the water flowing down. Her small nose twitched and she frowned.
“Jin Yang, come in for a while.”
Qiu Tong raised her head and shouted.
“Okay”
Jin Yang knew that she must have discovered something, so he strode into the bathroom.
Meanwhile, after the warden arranged their accommodations, he immediately went to the kitchen to have them prepare a meal. He then personally pushed the dining cart to the door of the room.
He knocked twice but no one answered. Seeing that the door was unlocked, he pushed the door open and entered.
He would not have many chances to come face to face with the President. If he did not seize this opportunity to leave a good impression on the President, he would have wasted all his years of being a warden.
The warden walked into the room but realized that it was empty. He found it a little strange. Just as he was about to call out, he heard sounds coming from the bathroom.
“Jin Yang, be careful…”
“I know. I just want to take a look.”
“You can look but don’t touch.”
“Hold on firmly…”

chapters.title: Chapter 78 - Source
chapters.content:
Chapter 78: Source
“!!!”
The warden listened to the sounds of water splashing inside and the two of them whispering to each other. He could not help being dumbstruck and instantly imagined some amorous scene.
He could not believe that the President would actually be in the mood for such activities in the shower of such a place. He stood rooted to the ground for a long time, unable to recover from his shock.
The sounds of water flowing grew increasingly louder. Unable to stay on anymore, the warden fled.
He had just run out the door when he seemed to have remembered something. He turned around and gently pushed the food cart out.
In the bathroom, Qiu Tong was completely unaware of all that. She looked at Jin Yang seriously and raised the shower head high as she spoke.
“Jin Yang, I think the source of the infectious disease might be in this water.”
In fact, Qiu Tong had only asked Jin Yang to come in because she had smelled a faint odor while checking the water.
After hearing Qiu Tong’s explanation, Jin Yang wanted to take the shower head and have a closer look, but Qiu Tong stopped him.
That was what the warden heard.
“Since we’ve found something, let’s follow the clues and take a look.”
Jin Yang turned off the shower and got someone to bring over a blueprint of the water pipelines.
Jin Yang and Qiu Tong followed the blueprint and found the water source. They traced the water source and found a dried-up lake.
“Jin Yang, wait a moment.”
Qiu Tong walked towards the lake and saw that the riverbed was dry and bare. There were many dead fish in the pit that were already rotting.
She squatted down and pinched the dried mud on the riverbed. She placed it under her nose and sniffed it twice. Her expression immediately changed.
“What did you find?”
Jin Yang came to Qiu Tong’s side and asked softly.
“I was right. The problem is in the water. These dead fish must be the source of the disease.”
Qiu Tong pointed at the pit full of dead fish, her gaze solemn and heavy.
“The water flowed through here and brought the virus to the water source below, causing the outbreak.”
“Jin Yang, get someone to bring these dead fish back. I want to use them as a sample to research for a cure.”
Jin Yang waved his hand and summoned his subordinates, instructing them to obey Qiu Tong’s orders.
Qiu Tong stood by the shore and watched Jin Yang’s men collecting the dead fish. Her expression gradually turned serious.
It was normal for this lake to dry up during this dry season. When the rainy season came, the lake would be filled with rainwater again and return to normal.
But having read the storyline in the book, Qiu Tong realized that this was not a simple seasonal transition, but an omen of the drought.
From now on, there will be very little rain during the summer and not a drop of water for months to come.
It wouldn’t take long for many lakes to show signs of drying up. Even the water in the rivers would slowly decrease. Smaller streams would disappear without a trace.
When that time came, the farmers wouldn’t be able to water their fields, which would greatly reduce production.
However, the effects of the drought were not just limited to this. There would also be locusts and epidemics.
Once people could not afford to eat and could not recover from their diseases, there would be no law and order. Chaos would reign over the entire society. The structure of the society would completely change.
The world will enter a period of famine.
“Jin Yang, I feel that this is not just due to the effects of seasonal changes.”
