Qiu Tong thought about it for a moment. In the end, she couldn’t bear to just sit back and watch the disaster happen. To look on as so many people died in the famine, without doing anything. Her expression was solemn as she looked at Jin Yang sincerely.
“I think this is a sign of drought. After drought, there will usually be massive locust plagues. There might even be famines and epidemics.”
“I suggest that you take care of the locusts in advance so that you won’t be flustered when things come to a head.”
Jin Yang frowned slightly, a trace of doubt rising in his heart.
This was just an ordinary natural phenomenon. The fish died because the riverbed dried up, and the lake happened to be right above the water source, which caused the virus carried by the dead fish to infect the water source of the prison, resulting in the epidemic.
It was pure coincidence.
He did not know why Qiu Tong was so cautious and excessively anxious.
Jin Yang’s gaze was probing. “Qiu Tong, locust plagues have not happened for many years. How did you determine that a major locust plague is about to happen?”

chapters.title: Chapter 79 - Tyrant
chapters.content:
Chapter 79: Tyrant
Qiu Tong did not want to expose her identity, so she could not explain her source of information to Jin Yang. Her eyes flickered twice and she lowered her head so that no one could see the expression in her eyes.
“We have to be on guard against possible disasters so as to not fall into a situation where we are caught off-guard.”
“I just saw this phenomenon and made some connections, but I might be overthinking it.”
“I think they’ve already cleaned up most of the dead fish. I’ll quickly clean up the water source first before I go back and develop a new cure.”
Qiu Tong knew that it was impossible for Jin Yang to believe her perfunctory excuse, so she quickly changed the topic and walked towards the water source.
Jin Yang knew that she was going to use her supernatural power, so he had his subordinates leave first.
Qiu Tong gently placed her hand on the water source and activated her supernatural power.
The water source, which was pitch-black and turbid, soon began to emit a faint green fluorescence. In the blink of an eye, it returned to its transparent state.
After Qiu Tong cleaned up the water source, she returned to the prison with Jin Yang.
The warden had already seen those dead fishes, and his attitude towards Qiu Tong changed drastically. He hurriedly arranged a laboratory for Qiu Tong to use.
Qiu Tong didn’t really make the medicine. Instead, she got Jin Yang to send over a large amount of vitamin pills. She then infused her power into the pills so that they would be effective in the treatment of the disease.
This was the most effective and safe plan she could think of.
After a few days, Qiu Tong finally finished making all the “special medicine”.
She had already exhausted a lot of energy to clean the water source, and then spent several sleepless days and nights creating the medicine. So she collapsed on the table after she finally finished.
Jin Yang jumped in shock and hurriedly caught Qiu Tong’s falling body. He sternly called the doctor over to treat her.
After knowing that she had only fallen asleep due to over-exhaustion, he heaved a sigh of relief.
He looked at the side of Qiu Tong’s sleeping face and felt his heart beating even more violently. He covered her with a blanket quietly.
Meanwhile, the warden was extremely grateful for Qiu Tong’s selfless sacrifice.
After Qiu Tong woke up, he immediately invited her to the cafeteria to distribute the medicine to everyone and also asked her to explain some things about infectious disease.
Qiu Tong agreed.
When she arrived at the cafeteria, the warden had yet to arrive. He was still leading his men to bring the medicine over.
Qiu Tong looked at the food in the cafeteria in boredom as she waited for the warden to arrive. She did not sense that a pair of malicious eyes was staring at her from afar.
The moment Wei Shuo entered the canteen, he saw Qiu Tong. He was immediately captivated by this woman’s gorgeous appearance and graceful figure.
This Wei Shuo was sent to prison because of attempted rape. After he went to prison, he relied on his strong build and ruthless character to become a tyrant in prison.
He walked over to Qiu Tong’s side with a tray in hand, his eyes filled with lust.
“What crime did a young lady like you commit to be imprisoned here?”
“But don’t be afraid. From now on, as long as you listen to me obediently, I promise you that you will be free and unobstructed in this prison. You will never be bullied by others again.”
“Otherwise, I can’t guarantee what you will experience when facing these men!”
Qiu Tong cast a sideways glance at Wei Shuo, and her eyes turned cold. She was just about to speak when she was suddenly protected by a middle-aged man who suddenly rushed out.
It was Qiu Rong. He had received the notice from the prison guards to gather at the cafeteria.
When he arrived at the door, he saw Wei Shuo cornering the young lady and smiling sinisterly.
Qiu Rong realized that it was Qiu Tong!
He was startled and panicked. Could it be that his Qiu Tong had been arrested too?
It was one thing for those people to send him to prison. It was another for them to arrest Qiu Tong too!
Qiu Rong had no time to bother about anything else. He immediately dashed forward and stood in front of Qiu Tong, mustering his courage.
“Wei Shuo, this is my daughter. I beg you not to make trouble for her. If there’s anything, come at me.”
“I didn’t expect you to have such a beautiful daughter. Why didn’t you introduce her to me earlier?”
Wei Shuo had never thought highly of Qiu Rong, this swindler with nothing. He raised his brows in cold contempt.
“It’s your good fortune that I’ve taken a fancy to your daughter. Don’t ruin my plans here. I’ll take care of you too!”
A ruthless glint surfaced in Wei Shuo’s eyes. He raised his fist and swung it towards Qiu Rong’s face!

chapters.title: Chapter 80 - Taking Medicine
chapters.content:
Chapter 80: Taking Medicine
However, just as Wei Shuo’s fist was about to make contact with Qiu Rong, it was suddenly grabbed by a slender hand.
Qiu Tong walked out from behind Qiu Rong. Her gaze was like a sharp knife as she glared at Wei Shuo. She grabbed Wei Shuo’s wrist and slowly pulled it back.
“Now that you’re in prison, you have to change your ways for the better, understand?”
“Stupid little girl, are you looking to die!”
She was very strong. Wei Shuo was in so much pain that his eyes revealed an ominous glint. He lifted his leg and kicked Qiu Tong’s abdomen. His kick was merciless!
Qiu Tong gave a cold snort. She raised her leg and kicked Wei Shuo’s calf tendon. With a crash, Wei Shuo knelt on the ground, sweating profusely from the pain.
He looked like he was kneeling before the two of them, lowering his head to admit his mistake.
“B*tch!”
Wei Shuo looked like he was burning up with fury. He struggled to stand up and shouted loudly to the lackeys behind him, “Why aren’t you all attacking yet! Today, I’m going to let this woman know what a man is!”
Just as his men were about to rush over, a sharp whistle sounded.
Everyone turned around and saw the warden standing at the door with a serious expression. They could not help but stay rooted to the ground, not daring to move.
The prison guards whipped out their batons and went around to knock everyone back into place. Soon, the scene was controlled and the prisoners sat obediently on the chairs.
“Miss Qiu, are you alright?”
The warden hurried over and looked at her worriedly when he thought of Qiu Tong’s relationship with Jin Yang.
“I’m fine.” Qiu Tong shook her head.
The warden felt relieved and turned around. “Let me introduce you all to Miss Qiu.”
“After her relentless efforts, she finally developed a special medicine that can treat the infectious disease.”
“Now, she will personally distribute the medicine to you, as well as explain important things to take note of regarding prevention and subsequent care.”
Qiu Tong distributed the medicine brought by the warden. But when she placed the medicine in front of Wei Shuo, an unforeseen event occurred.
Wei Shuo stared at her unhappily, his eyes filled with grudging hatred. “The disease can be cured just because you said so?”
“It has been just a short period of time. You probably haven’t even done any trial tests!”
“What? Are you trying to kill us? Aren’t prisoners’ lives also human lives?”
Wei Shuo’s words instantly ignited the suspicions in everyone’s hearts. The crowd started questioning.
Seeing that his daughter was being questioned, Qiu Rong was extremely anxious. He stuffed the pills into his mouth and said, “Since none of you is willing to believe, I’ll take them first!”
He believed that his daughter would not harm anyone!
When these criminals saw Qiu Rong testing the medicine with his own body, some of the doubts in their hearts dissipated. They started to trust a little more in Qiu Tong.
What if the medicine was really effective?
But Wei Shuo was still filled with suspicion. He said with an unfriendly expression, “Who knows if this is just an act that this father-daughter pair is putting on for us.”
“If something really goes wrong from eating it, it will be too late to regret later.”
As soon as these words were spoken, everyone’s opinion started to shift again.
Qiu Tong had always been a decisive person.
After she heard Wei Shuo’s words, she simply took back the medicine in front of him, returning it to the box held by the warden.
“You can choose not to eat it if you don’t believe me. Anyway, not just anyone can take my medicine.”
She looked at Wei Shuo coldly and raised her head. Her sharp gaze swept across the crowd. “All of you too. If you feel that there’s something wrong with my medicine, you can choose not to eat it.”
“You are free to choose. Death or survival.
Right at this time, one of the prisoners sitting behind Qiu Rong suddenly began to cough violently. He squatted on the ground, wishing he could cough out all of his internal organs.
“Cough cough cough…”
The epidemic in the prison had been going on for some time. Most people had been infected with the virus, and some of them had their immune systems severely damaged.
The prisoner knelt on the ground. The intense pain corroding his internal organs made him feel that he might as well be dead.
“Cough cough… I can’t take it anymore. Let me take the medicine. It doesn’t matter if it’s effective or not. Let me take the medicine!”
With a fierce expression, he suddenly grabbed the medicine as if it was his final chance at life. He swallowed it!

chapters.title: Chapter 81 - Memories
chapters.content:
Chapter 81: Memories
His coughing soon stopped.
“This medicine is truly effective!”
The inmate, who had just escaped death, started dancing and shouting. His recovery made everyone instantly recognize the effects of the drug.
When everyone saw this, they picked up the pills in front of them and hurriedly swallowed them.
As expected, the sound of coughing in the cafeteria disappeared.
The crowd’s excited behavior was a sore sight for Wei Shuo.
“Go ahead and take it. Who knows what side effects this medicine will have. When the time comes, you’ll know how evil this woman is!”
Wei Shuo shouted indignantly.
But this time, no one believed him.
In the face of life, they all chose to cling tightly to Qiu Tong, this life-saving miracle.
Qiu Tong was engulfed by everyone’s adoring gazes. They all expressed their heartfelt gratitude to Qiu Tong. Even Qiu Rong’s prestige and status among the prisoners had increased.
The prisoners who bullied Qiu Rong before felt especially awkward and guilty. They all came over to apologize to him one after another. Apart from Wei Shuo, the entire canteen was filled with joy and harmony.
Qiu Rong stared blankly at his daughter, who appeared very different from before. He was a bit lost in thought.
He already felt that his daughter’s character had changed a lot, but he did not expect her to be able to handle such a situation with ease.
Qiu Tong did not see the conflicted look in Qiu Rong’s eyes. She managed to escape the adoring crowd and dragged her father aside to eat.
Wei Shuo looked at Qiu Tong, who was now the center of attention. He exuded an indignant aura.
When he thought about how he had been humiliated in front of everyone, how he had been completely subdued by a mere woman, the anger in his heart burned even more fiercely.
He would never let these two people off!
Wei Shuo called a few of his followers and walked towards Qiu Rong and Qiu Tong.
However, he had only taken two steps when he felt a sharp pain in his stomach and a wave of dizziness in his head. His body swayed twice before he suddenly knelt on the ground and started coughing violently.
Wei Shuo’s situation instantly attracted everyone’s attention.
“Oh no, Boss is coughing up blood!”
One of Wei Shuo’s lackeys cried out in alarm when he saw the bloodstains on the ground.
The rest of Wei Shuo’s gang scattered in all directions.
The way he coughed was exactly the same as when those infected people had their relapses.
“Wei Shuo is infected too. Everyone, stay away from him!”
“Yeah, I was just talking to him earlier. Would I get infected again by him?”
“That won’t happen. Didn’t you hear what Miss Qiu said just now? After we take the medicine, our bodies will develop antibodies and we won’t be infected again!”
“Yes, yes, yes. Luckily, Miss Qiu is here. Otherwise, we would be in danger.”
“Wei Shuo is the only one now whose health is in critical condition. It seems that he’s the only one who didn’t take the medicine.”
Everyone moved further away from Wei Shuo.
When Wei Shuo heard their discussion, his blood surged so violently that he nearly fainted.
Qiu Tong watched the whole process calmly from her chair.
This was human nature. At critical moments, humans could surpass all imagination, and yet also behave entirely within expectations.
“Dad, eat more fish.”
Qiu Tong looked away as if she didn’t want to see Wei Shuo’s miserable state. She placed a piece of fish meat in Qiu Rong’s bowl.
When Wei Shuo saw Qiu Tong’s cold manner, he felt the pain in his body reach its peak.
He knew that once he got infected, he would not be far from death. He looked at the other prisoners who had recovered and knew that this medicine would definitely be effective.
Although he was extremely unwilling, he had no choice but to stumble over and lower his head towards Qiu Tong.
“Miss Qiu, please give me the medicine.”
Qiu Tong glared at him coldly, her expression unchanged as she listened to him gritting his teeth.
“My medicine hasn’t been tested in any way. It might have side effects.”
“I think a high and mighty person like you would definitely not want to use such drugs.”
Wei Shuo understood the sarcasm in Qiu Tong’s words and felt extreme regret in his heart. For the sake of protecting his own life, he had no choice but to humble himself further.
“Miss Qiu, I’m sorry. It was my fault just now. I was talking nonsense. Please don’t take it to heart.”
“Please forgive me and give me a way out.”
“I promise that I will never cause trouble for your father again. I will be very respectful to him and will not offend him at all.”
Qiu Tong nodded. That was what she’d been waiting for.
After she left, her father would be all alone. Although she was prepared to offer compensation in return for a reduction in his jail sentence, she did not know how long it would take. Hence, she had to find a guarantee for her father’s safety.
“Remember what you said. Otherwise, I can take back your life anytime.”
Qiu Tong tossed the medicine into Wei Shuo’s hands, her eyes filled with a murderous aura.

chapters.title: Chapter 82 - Is That Jin Yang?
chapters.content:
Chapter 82: Is That Jin Yang?
Wei Shuo dared not say anything to that. He hurriedly swallowed the medicine in his hand.
When the inmates saw that even the prison tyrant Wei Shuo had suffered such a huge defeat at Qiu Tong’s hands, and had no choice but to lower his head so humbly, they could not help but feel some fear towards Qiu Tong.
In just a few minutes, the people crowding Qiu Tong dispersed and there was no one left.
Qiu Tong was very satisfied with this situation and began to eat.
She had not slept or eaten properly for the past few days. She was starving.
Qiu Rong looked at Qiu Tong tenderly. The sight of this girl in front of him merged with the memories of his daughter. Thinking back to what had happened today, he could not help tearing up.
The Qiu family used to be a wealthy family, and he had spent all his efforts on Qiu Tong. Qiu Tong had lived up to his expectations and become an outstanding, capable and confident lady.
However, when Qiu Tong was 20 years old, something happened in his life. He had no choice but to move and run away with Qiu Tong.
At that time, Qiu Tong became pregnant and didn’t know who the father was. And after giving birth, her personality changed drastically.
She became selfish, vicious, greedy and vulgar. She even hated her own children.
When the children were three, Qiu Rong was arrested as a fraud.
Not only was Qiu Tong filled with hatred for Qiu Rong, she also showed no warmth at all during her two visits to the prison. She kept cursing him maliciously and then never showed up again, as if she had completely forgotten about him.
Later, Qiu Rong heard that Qiu Tong had vented all her anger on the three children, making their lives miserable.
And now, as Qiu Rong looked at Qiu Tong’s familiar face, it was as if his dear daughter had returned to his side after six long years. He couldn’t help but feel deeply moved.
“Tongtong, my Tongtong… it’s been six years, you’re finally back!”
Qiu Tong looked up from her plate in confusion. She looked at Qiu Rong, who was suddenly agitated. She asked in confusion, “Dad, what are you talking about?”
Qiu Rong observed her expression carefully and seemed to have thought of something. A flash of realization flashed across his eyes. “Tongtong, do you remember nothing again?”
It was the same six years ago. After her personality changed drastically, she completely forgot about what happened before.
Qiu Tong was shocked by Qiu Rong’s words.
He could tell that she was not the original?
This was someone familiar with the former owner of her body after all, and she had exposed herself in front of him.
Qiu Tong’s heart was racing, but her expression remained unchanged. Nevertheless, her eyes were filled with confusion.
“Dad, what do you mean?”
“You really don’t remember anything…”
Seeing her like this, Qiu Rong could not help but sigh deeply. He looked at her with a complicated gaze. “So, you still don’t remember who the children’s father is, right?”
In the past, she had been unwilling to speak. But now, it was because she could not recall anything.
Qiu Tong did not have any memories of the previous owner. Before she came, she had been afraid that she would reveal herself in front of Qiu Rong. Now that she heard Qiu Rong’s conjecture, she was relieved and agreed with him.
“Yes, I’ve indeed lost a portion of my memories, and I’m a little confused about many things that happened in the past… I don’t know what exactly happened either.”
Qiu Rong nodded. Actually, it was not necessarily a bad thing for Qiu Tong to forget those painful years.
With this thought in mind, Qiu Rong decided not to continue this topic. He looked at her lovingly. “It’s okay if you don’t remember. It’s good that you’re back.”
Qiu Tong, “…”
She did not understand what Qiu Rong meant and wisely chose not to speak.
Over the past few days, Qiu Tong had solved the problem of the infectious disease in the prison, while Jin Yang had also gotten the answer he wanted from Dina. Neither of them had any reason to stay here.
Outside the door, Jin Yang, who was dressed in a suit, said to the warden, “Call Qiu Tong out. We’re going back.”
He planned to give her a ride.
The warden hurriedly opened the door and walked in. He came to Qiu Tong’s side and smiled apologetically at her before saying, “Miss Qiu, Sir is already waiting for you outside.”
Qiu Rong looked in the direction of the warden, his gaze passing through the door and landing on the man outside.
His eyes suddenly froze and the expression on his face turned into fear.
He pointed a trembling finger at Jin Yang, who was standing outside the door, fear and panic filling his eyes.
“Tongtong, that person… is he Jin Yang?!”

chapters.title: Chapter 83 - Jin Taos Son
chapters.content:
Chapter 83: Jin Tao’s Son
Qiu Tong followed her father’s finger and shook her head.
“Dad, that is Song Yan, not Jin Yang.”
Upon hearing Song Yan’s name, Qiu Rong suddenly grabbed onto Qiutong’s arms and squeezed.
“Tongtong, be it Jin Yang or Song Yan, he is Jin Tao’s son!”
“I want you to remember that anyone related to Jin Tao, you must stay far away from them. You absolutely must not have anything to do with them, understand?!”
“Jin Tao is not a good person. You must not get involved with him!”
Song Yan was Jin Tao’s son?
Qiu Tong didn’t know who Jin Tao was. But she could see her father’s fear from his expression and actions. There must have been some long history between Jin Tao and her father!
She looked at Qiu Rong’s unusual behavior and suddenly asked.
“Dad, is your arrest related to Jin Tao?”
Qiu Rong shook his head almost reflexively and said quickly, “No!”
“Tongtong, everything that happened to me has nothing to do with others. It’s all my fault.”
Qiu Tong took in his guilty look, which further confirmed her suspicions. Her heart sank.
She did not want there to be a lifelong grudge between her and Song Yan.
Qiu Tong did not know why she had such thoughts. Her heart was in a mess.
“Dad, don’t worry. I still have three children with me. I don’t have time to think about all these messy things.”
“I just want you to come out quickly so that our family can reunite.”
“Before I came, the children were all clamoring to see you. If not for the sudden epidemic in the prison this time, they would have definitely come with me.”
When Qiu Rong heard his daughter talking about his three grandchildren, the expression on his face gradually softened. His tense body also slowly relaxed, and he nodded.
“Tongtong, as long as you guys are fine, I don’t mind.
“Dad, don’t say that. Our good days will come later.”
Qiu Tong held his hand tightly and said softly, “Take care of yourself then. I’ll leave first. After some time has passed, I’ll bring the children over to see you.”
“Alright, let’s go.”
Qiu Rong watched as his daughter walked towards Song Yan. His eyes narrowed and he had a bad premonition.
Were these two really not involved?
The warden sent Jin Yang and Qiu Tong out of the door. Jin Yang went to prepare the car. Qiu Tong turned to the warden and finally asked what she had been wanting to ask.
“Warden, my father went to prison because of fraud. I remember that as long as you offer a certain amount of compensation, you can reduce a jail sentence.”
“My father isn’t young anymore, and he just contracted an infectious disease. Although he’s recovered, I’m still worried about his health.”
“So, if possible, I would like to offer compensation in exchange for a lighter sentence for my father.”
The warden nodded and said, “According to the rules, you can indeed reduce a jail sentence.”
“But the amount of money your father swindled is very large. Going by that, you will have to compensate $800,000 to reduce his sentence by a year.”
“Alright, I understand. Please take care of my father during this period of time.”
Qiu Tong had a plan. She would do this for herself, for this second chance at life in this body. It would also be for Qiu Rong, who looked exactly like her father in her previous life. She wanted Qiu Rong to be released as soon as possible.
It could be considered fulfilling a filial duty on behalf of the former owner of her body.
Qiu Tong made up her mind. She was going to take on more jobs and earn more money so that her family could be reunited.
“Miss Qiu, you’ve done us such a big favor this time. Of course, I’ll take good care of your father. Don’t worry about that.”
The warden said hurriedly. Whether it was because of Qiu Tong’s ability or her relationship with Jin Yang, he would definitely help her.
Jin Yang drove the car over then. Qiu Tong nodded at the warden and turned around to leave.
“This is my place. Thank you for sending me back.”
When Qiu Tong saw the familiar gate, she unbuckled her seatbelt and prepared to leave.
Along the way, Jin Yang tried to make small talk with Qiu Tong, but whatever words he came up with died before they reached his lips. Now that Qiu Tong was alighting from his car, he suddenly realized that they were going to separate again.
He pursed his lips. “You’ve helped me solve such a big problem this time. How about I treat you to a meal to thank you?”

chapters.title: Chapter 84 - Jacket
chapters.content:
Chapter 84: Jacket
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong was thinking about her four children and rejected Jin Yang’s invitation without hesitation. She waved at him and got out of the car.
However, as soon as Qiu Tong swung one leg out of the car, she froze and stopped.
She looked at Jin Yang awkwardly as she gripped the side of her pants tightly.
Jin Yang heard the sound of fabric being torn. He was stunned at first, but then his lips curled into a faint smile.
He looked at Qiu Tong’s slightly embarrassed expression and cleared his throat, trying his best to suppress the urge to laugh.
Qiu Tong glared at him.
This jerk was laughing at her expense!
“Let me help you.”
Jin Yang got out of the car and walked around the front of the car. He bent down and carried Qiu Tong out of the passenger seat. He then tied his suit jacket around Qiu Tong’s waist, perfectly blocking the view of her exposed thighs.
Qiu Tong thanked him in a low voice and kept her face expressionless, but she ran away quickly.
Jin Yang looked at her departing profile and finally burst out laughing.
This girl… was really cute.
Qiu Xingyuan witnessed everything from the second floor.
Luxury car, strange man, jacket, intimacy…
These four words completely occupied Qiu Xingyuan’s mind. He felt that Qiu Tong’s old habits were returning.
Once this woman had a man, she would lose her mind.
Just like this time, she left them in the house alone for a few days without leaving any word…
However, this time, he would not allow Qiu Tong to bully his siblings. It was time for him to plan for the future.
Qiu Xingyuan looked at the locust pesticide on the table with a heavy gaze and had a plan in mind.
Actually, he had already successfully developed the locust pesticide last night. Initially, he wanted to give Qiu Tong a surprise, but he did not expect to see such a thing.
Therefore, he decided not to tell Qiu Tong about this matter and to find a way to sell it himself.
As long as he had money, he could lead a rich life with his siblings.
Qiu Xingyuan brought the locust pesticide to the market. After looking around for a while, he found a corner and placed the pesticide neatly on the ground before squatting down.
The passersby saw that Qiu Xingyuan was only five or six years old, yet he already looked like a little adult, coming out to set up a stall to sell things. While they were curious, they also pitied him, so there were quite a few people who came over to inquire.
However, when they found out that it was locust pesticide, they couldn’t help having doubts.
“This child is all nonsense. The climate has been so good this year, how could there be a locust plague?”
“That’s right. How many years has it been since a locust plague occurred?”
“Kid, no one’s going to buy your locust pesticide.”
Although Qiu Xingyuan felt that Qiu Tong was unreliable, he did not doubt her analysis of the possibility of a locust plague in the future.
He said calmly, “Have you seen such a long period of time without rain before?”
“Have you ever encountered such a hot and dry summer?”
“Such weather means that there might be a drought this year.”
“Historical records tell us that there is a 50% chance that droughts will be accompanied by a locust plague.
“If we don’t take precautions in advance, then all the hard work of the farmers this year will be wasted. When that time comes, the entire crop yield will be reduced.”
“What’s more, even without the locust plague, spending a little money to buy this would make one feel more at ease.”
Qiu Xingyuan’s words made the surrounding people fall into deep thought.
They could not deny that this child’s words were indeed reasonable. If they bought some back, even if there was no locust plague in the end, they could still use it to kill some other pests. It would not be a huge loss.
Most of the people took out their money, and a faint smile crossed Qiu Xingyuan’s small face.
Lu Zhiling, who was standing nearby, captured his look.
Lu Zhiling had just finished shopping at a nearby mall with Mayor Shen and was about to drive off for lunch.
She was sitting in the car and had her attention attracted by the crowd. She did not expect to see Qiu Tong’s son setting up a stall by the street.
Lu Zhiling had been to the villa area before and had seen this child with Qiu Tong.
She stared fixedly at Qiu Xingyuan, a trace of viciousness flashing across her eyes.
“My dear, there seems to be a child selling things over there.”
Lu Zhiling hugged Mayor Shen’s arm intimately and said coquettishly, “I think that child definitely didn’t pay the stall fees. He’s taking advantage of his young age, but is disrupting the market and breaking the rules. Isn’t that terrible?”
“Look, there are so many people gathered there. What if there’s a riot later? What should we do?”
“This is a safety hazard. If something really happened, wouldn’t it be a stain on your reputation?”

chapters.title: Chapter 85 - Arrested
chapters.content:
Chapter 85: Arrested
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Mayor Shen followed Lu Zhiling’s finger and looked over. Watching the growing crowd, he could not help frowning.
He was no fool. Lu Zhiling would not target this child for no reason. There must be something going on behind the scenes. However, he had always doted on Lu Zhiling, so he was naturally happy to agree to such a small request.
“You’re right. If you don’t learn to do things the proper way from a young age, you’ll become a scourge when you grow up.”
“I’ll get someone to handle it.”
Mayor Shen nodded and made a call to the police.
When the police received Mayor Shen’s call, they immediately moved out. Three or four police officers headed aggressively towards Qiu Xingyuan’s stall.
The police officers ignored Qiu Xingyuan’s struggles and the advice of the people around them. They confiscated all the pesticide and took Qiu Xingyuan away to the nearby police station.
Lu Zhiling sat in the car and watched coldly as everything unfolded. The corners of her lips curled up into a vicious smile.
Qiu Tong, this is what you get for opposing me!
Meanwhile, Qiu Tong received a call from the police and rushed to the police station.
Only when Chief Officer Fang saw Qiu Tong did he realize that Qiu Xingyuan was her son. Thinking of the second lieutenant, who was closely linked to Qiu Tong, he had a bad premonition and cold sweat broke out on his forehead.
“Why did you bring this child in?”
Chief Officer Fang gritted his teeth and looked at the police officer beside him.
The police officer lowered his head and laughed. “Chief, this is an order from Mayor Fang. We have no choice but to follow it.”
Chief Officer Fang’s expression changed as he cursed in his heart.
He could not afford to offend either of them.
Chief Officer Fang thought for a while and decided to deal with Mayor Shen. He smiled and said to Qiu Tong.
“Miss Qiu, I think there might be some misunderstanding here.”
“Let me make a call first. I’ll definitely give you a satisfactory explanation.”
Although Qiu Tong did not look happy, she nodded.
When Chief Officer Fang returned to his office, he immediately called Mayor Shen. “Mayor Shen, hello. I’m Fang from the police station.”
“You ordered to arrest a child just now, his mother’s name is Qiu Tong.”
“I met her at the police station previously because of some misunderstanding. Later on, a second lieutenant bailed her out.”
“That second lieutenant seems to be on good terms with her. It’s very likely that Qiu Tong knows someone from the military.
“So for what happened today…”
When Mayor Shen received Chief Officer Fang’s call, he was having lunch with Lu Zhiling.
He put down his fork and knife, surprise flashing in his eyes.
Who would have thought that this child’s family had military connections?
He looked up at Lu Zhiling, who immediately gave him a big smile.
Mayor Shen didn’t want to lose face in front of the woman. Besides, Qiu Tong wasn’t the only one who knew people from the military. His brother also had a lot of connections in the military.
“So what if she knows people in the military? She wants to take advantage of her connections? Do what you have to do.”
Mayor Shen hung up after speaking.
Hearing Mayor Shen’s determined attitude, Chief Officer Fang knew that he wouldn’t heed his advice. He sighed heavily and had no choice but to follow Mayor Shen’s orders.
Chief Officer Fang walked out of the office and smiled awkwardly at Qiu Tong.
“Miss Qiu, let me bring you to see the child first. I’ll tell you the details as we walk.”
Qiu Tong immediately stood up. She desperately wanted to know Qiu Xingyuan’s current situation.
When Qiu Xingyuan saw Qiu Tong appear, he knew that he could not hide this matter anymore. Qiu Tong must have already known about his business.
Seeing Qiu Tong glare at him angrily, he could not help but lower his head.
“Qiu Xingyuan, do you know what you did wrong?”
Along the way, Qiu Tong had already understood what had happened. This time, she was really angry.
Qiu Xingyuan lowered his head even more, his voice barely audible. “I shouldn’t have gone to do business at the market without you knowing.”
He had been rather scared during his time at the police station. Knowing that he was in the wrong, he could only answer obediently.
Qiu Tong raised an eyebrow and asked.
“What else?”
Qiu Xingyuan’s voice became even softer, almost a whisper.
“I shouldn’t have kept it from you. That I’ve already made the locust pesticide.”
Qiu Tong thought to herself:?
Well, this kid has been hiding a lot of things from me
. Nevertheless, she remained expressionless.
“Anything else?”
Qiu Xingyuan was stunned for a moment. After thinking carefully, he shook his head.
Seeing that he really did not have anything else to reveal, Qiu Tong pointed at him and scolded in a low voice, “Qiu Xingyuan, your biggest mistake was not protecting yourself properly!”

chapters.title: Chapter 86 - Black Card
chapters.content:
Chapter 86: Black Card
“Tell me, have I not given you enough food and clothing? Why did you set up a stall yourself? Do you know that you’re only six years old?”
“You don’t value your own safety. Have you ever thought about what will I do if something happens to you? What about your siblings?”
“I always thought you were a mature and rational child. I didn’t expect you to be so reckless.”
Qiu Xingyuan suddenly raised his head and looked at Qiu Tong in disbelief. His large eyes seemed to be able to see through her and see her true heart and soul clearly.
Was this woman angry because she cared about his safety?
Qiu Tong looked at him and sighed helplessly. She reached out to pull his arm and looked him up and down carefully.
“Are you hurt? Does your body hurt anywhere?”
Qiu Xingyuan heard that her tone was stiff, but it was still filled with concern. Suddenly, he felt his throat tighten and his heart ache. He did not know what to say.
“Chief Officer Fang, can I take the child away now?”
When Qiu Tong saw that Qiu Xingyuan was safe and sound, the anger in her heart finally dissipated.
Thinking about Mayor Shen’s instructions, Chief Officer Fang had no choice but to look Qiu Tong in the eye.
“Miss Qiu, I’m really sorry, but… your child has indeed violated our city regulations, so we have to follow the rules.”
Qiu Tong nodded. She knew that Qiu Xingyuan was in the wrong today. “So, what’s your decision?”
Chief Officer Fang hurriedly said, “Miss Qiu, you don’t have to worry. Although your son has violated the rules by setting up his stall, there are no serious consequences.According to the rules, we will have to confiscate the goods he was selling and impose a fine.”
“Thereafter, you can take him away. After all, he’s only six years old. We won’t be too harsh on him.”
Qiu Tong thought for a moment and nodded. Things were not so bad if it was just confiscation and a fine.
“No problem. We were in the wrong in the first place, so it is only right that we are punished.”
Chief Officer Fang did not expect Qiu Tong to be so compliant. The huge burden in his heart was lifted and he hurriedly said.
“Thank you for understanding, Miss Qiu. Come with me to make payment for the fine.”
Qiu Tong didn’t bring any cash, so she took out Jin Yang’s card and put it in front of Chief Officer Fang.
Chief Officer Fang’s eyes flashed as he stared at the card, not daring to breathe.
It was the Black Card!
Chief Officer Fang had the honor of seeing this kind of Black Card once before. He knew that the owners of such Black Cards all held highly-respected positions in the military.
In other words, this card not only represented wealth, but also status and power.
The expression on Chief Officer Fang’s face underwent a myriad of changes, instantly elevating Qiu Tong’s status by several levels. He had endless speculations in his mind.
His attitude towards Qiu Tong became more and more respectful, and his resentment towards Mayor Shen intensified.
Mayor Shen had really made him suffer. Qiu Tong was able to easily whip out this Black Card. This meant that she must be very familiar with the owner of this Black Card.
Qiu Tong just had to say a few words to that powerful person, would he still be able to maintain his position as the Chief Officer?
However, he couldn’t go back on his word now. Wouldn’t that be revealing to Qiu Tong that there was something fishy going on?
Chief Officer Fang was caught between a rock and a hard place. He had a flattering smile on his face and was extremely respectful towards Qiu Tong. However, his heart was in turmoil. This made his expression turn a little strange.
Chief Officer Fang picked up the Black Card with both hands and handed it to the police officer behind the cashier’s window. His cautious manner made the young policeman nervous.
The young policeman trembled as he stuffed the Black Card into the slot. As he was too nervous, his fingertips trembled and he pressed a few more zeros on the back of the fine.
By the time Chief Officer Fang noticed that, the young policeman had pressed the confirmation button. There was no time to stop him.
He looked apologetically at Qiu Tong, his heart filled with fear and shock.
However, he immediately relaxed. It was such a major sum that that transaction would never go through.
However, in the next moment, the faces of Chief Officer Fang and the young policeman turned pale.
Four words appeared on the screen—
Transaction successful.
Chief Officer Fang, “!!!”
The young policeman, “!!!”

chapters.title: Chapter 87 - Vicious Stepfather (I)
chapters.content:
Chapter 87: Vicious Stepfather (I)
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The young policeman was scared out of his wits. He had never processed such a large amount of money before.
Qiu Tong was also very surprised. She stared at the Black Card with a complicated look in her eyes.
How much money did Song Yan give her in this card?
Qiu Xingyuan looked at the Black Card with an ugly expression as he thought of the man in the suit who drove Qiu Tong home.
Chief Officer Fang’s face turned even paler as he apologized profusely to Qiu Tong. “I’m sorry, Miss Qiu. Don’t worry, I’ll refund the excess money to you immediately!”
As he spoke, he turned around and grabbed the young police officer by the collar, dragging him aside. He then personally operated the computer.
Chief Officer Fang tried his best to control his trembling hands. After returning the excess money, he respectfully returned the Black Card to Qiu Tong.
And this time, he personally sent Qiu Tong and Qiu Xingyuan out of the police station.
As he watched the two of them leave, he swore to himself that he never wanted to see Qiu Tong in the police station again.
If she came again, his lifespan would shorten by a few years.
Qiu Tong brought Qiu Xingyuan home.
Along the way, Qiu Xingyuan did not say a word. From time to time, he would look at Qiu Tong as if he was thinking about something serious.
Qiu Tong noticed his actions. She thought that Qiu Xingyuan had realized his mistake and was too embarrassed to speak, so she did not take it to heart.
“Elder Brother, where have you been? Why are you back so late?”
The two of them had just entered the house when Qiu Xingyu skipped over and pulled Qiu Xingyuan along as she asked him.
Qiu Xingqiao also hurriedly ran over. When he saw Qiu Tong, his eyes lit up, but he quickly put away his joy and stood behind his elder brother with a straight face.
Ye Luan stood on the stairs and looked at them quietly.
“You…”
Qiu Xingyuan was silent for a long time before he finally spoke. He looked at Qiu Tong. “Are you with the man who gave you the card?”
He stared intently into Qiu Tong’s eyes, not letting go of the slightest change in her expression.
Along the way, his mind was filled with the huge Black Card and the man who sent Qiu Tong to the door. Hence, once he reached home, he could not help but question her.
Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu’s expressions changed drastically. They raised their heads and looked at Qiu Tong, anxiously waiting for her reply.
The word “man” reminded them of that previous jerk.
This woman… would she become like how she was before?
Qiu Xingyu did not care that the three of them were still in a cold war with Qiu Tong. She threw herself at Qiu Tong’s feet, hugged her thigh, and rocked her from side to side.
“Mommy, are you leaving with that man? Don’t leave. I don’t want you to leave.”
“I promise I’ll be good from now on. I won’t make you angry anymore.”
Qiu Xingqiao was not very willing to talk to Qiu Tong. He looked around and suddenly had an idea. He grabbed his younger sister’s hand and said softly.
“You know what, little sister? I heard a story a few days ago.”
“There was a divorcee woman who had three children with her. For money, she found another husband. Although her husband was gentle initially, his temper became very bad after they got married. He would get drunk and hit and scold the children.”
“Thereafter, the three children fled the so-called home and wandered around on the outside. They were found frozen to death by the side of the road. After losing those children as targets to vent his anger on, the stepfather transferred all his grievances and anger to the woman.
“In the end, that woman was beaten up every day and lived in regret forever…”
“Do you think this woman is very stupid?”
As Qiu Xingqiao spoke, he observed Qiu Tong’s expression, hoping to see fear and regret on her face.
Qiu Tong looked at the three kids. One was deep in thought, one was coquettish, and the other was threatening. They were really capable of anything to achieve their goals.
She could not help but laugh when she saw the children looking as if they were facing a formidable enemy.
“Don’t worry. I know that no man in this world is good. I won’t fall for them.”
The three little men in the room :”…”
There was no need to lump all men together. Those three little men were still worth a look…
Meanwhile, in the capital, a man who looked exactly like Jin Yang was sitting on a chair. His slender fingers were gently holding a wine glass. As he looked at the red wine, the corners of his mouth curled into a sinister smile.
He raised his head and downed the wine in his glass, revealing the red mole on his neck.
This was the only difference between him and Jin Yang.
This man was Jin Yang’s younger brother, the real Song Yan.

chapters.title: Chapter 88 - Vicious Stepfather (2)
chapters.content:
Chapter 88: Vicious Stepfather (2)
Song Yan slowly turned his chair around and looked at his subordinate who was standing by the side, reporting to him.
Song Yan asked in a light voice, “You’re saying that a large sum of money was withdrawn using Jin Yang’s supplementary card?”
“Yes, the card was used in S City and it was that Black Card.” The subordinate lowered his head respectfully.
He had served this man for many years and he knew that he was a complete lunatic when it came to Jin Yang.
“Come to think of it, I haven’t seen my dear brother in a long time.”
“Let’s go to S City and give my usually serious and cold brother a surprise!”
Song Yan stood up and stretched lazily before walking out.
Meanwhile, Jin Yang was in the government meeting with Mayor Shen.
“I’ve already personally interrogated Dina. He has agreed to cooperate with us to eliminate the remaining terrorists.”
“As the Mayor of S City, you have to treat this matter as the most important thing now. Do you understand?”
Jin Yang sat at his seat with no expression on his face. When he looked at Mayor Shen, there was not a single ripple in his eyes. His cold and powerful aura caused the temperature in the entire office to drop to zero.
Mayor Shen stood at the side, trembling with fear. His face was covered in a thin layer of cold sweat. He didn’t look the least bit formidable like how he behaved in front of Lu Zhiling.
“Sir, please rest assured that our district will cooperate with your operations…”
At this moment, the office door was pushed open from the outside.
Chief Officer Fang carefully walked in with the locust pesticide and went straight to Mayor Shen’s side.
“Mayor Shen, I’ve brought all these things over. Please see if there’s anything you want.”
After Qiu Tong left, Chief Officer Fang thought about it and felt that Mayor Shen must have a motive for capturing Qiu Xingyuan.
Mayor Shen had personally ordered the arrest of a six-year-old child. Later on, when he had mentioned that Qiu Tong was related to the military, he still refused to release the boy.
Finally, he came to a conclusion—
Mayor Shen wanted this batch of goods that Qiu Xingyuan was selling.
Otherwise, there was no reason to make things difficult for a child.
This was also the reason why he brought Qiu Xingyuan’s goods to Mayor Shen’s office.
“Shut up! What nonsense are you spouting in front of Sir?!”
Mayor Shen didn’t expect that Chief Officer Fang would come looking for him at this time. He shot Chief Officer Fang a meaningful glance and gestured at where Jin Yang was sitting, hinting at him to hold back.
“Mayor Shen, what’s wrong with your eyes?”
Chief Officer Fang looked at Mayor Shen’s behavior and was a little puzzled.
This idiot!
Mayor Shen ignored him and bowed deeply to Jin Yang.
“Sir, this is the head of our local police station. He came here to report on some small matters.”
“Compared to our current discussion, those small matters are not worth mentioning in front of you. I will have him leave now.”
Only then did Chief Officer Fang notice Jin Yang. Looking at this man who he had only seen on television, his knees went weak and he almost knelt down.
“Sir… Sir?”
Jin Yang turned his head and looked at the thing in Chief Officer Fang’s hands. A rare spark of curiosity arose in his heart.
“What is that?”
Chief Officer Fang was so nervous that his mind went blank. It wasn’t until Mayor Shen nudged him hard that he reacted.
“Sir, this is… locust pesticide.”
Chief Officer Fang calmed himself down. Oppressed by Jin Yang’s strong aura, he stuttered as he narrated what happened.
Jin Yang took out a bottle from the box and looked at the transparent liquid flowing inside. He recalled Qiu Tong’s words about the drought and locust plague and couldn’t help wondering.
Mayor Shen and Chief Officer Fang looked at the silent Jin Yang, not even daring to breathe too loudly as they quietly waited for his order.
“Go and find out who invented this. After you find the person, buy the patent and let the factories produce this as a safeguard.”
Jin Yang placed the bottle on the table. He still leaned towards Qiu Tong’s conjecture.
“Sir, the person who invented the medicine was a six-year-old boy called Qiu Xingyuan.”
Chief Officer Fang said hurriedly.
“A six-year-old child has such high chemistry skills?”
It was rare for Jin Yang to be surprised. It seemed that there were geniuses everywhere. It was just that they had not discovered them.
He nodded approvingly. “Get ready. I want to personally reward this child with an award.”

chapters.title: Chapter 89 - Similarity
chapters.content:
Chapter 89: Similarity
Mayor Shen looked up at Jin Yang.
He thought that Qiu Xingyuan, that little brat, was just messing around with this pesticide. He did not expect for him to come up with something that would actually capture the attention of this powerful man!
When Mayor Shen thought about how he had sent police officers to capture that child, his heart felt as though a huge rock was pressing down on it.
If that child were to form a relationship with Jin Yang, wouldn’t he be doomed?
Thinking of this, Mayor Shen couldn’t help blaming Lu Zhiling.
Chief Officer Fang was even more shocked and fearful than Mayor Shen.
This was because he suddenly realized that the child he had arrested today looked so similar to Jin Yang!
The two faces, one big and one small, gradually overlapped in his mind and finally formed a face…
Chief Officer Fang tried his best to suppress the shock in his heart. He maintained a calm expression and pretended to speak casually.
“Sir, if you can personally present the award to that child, it will definitely be a supreme honor for that child.”
“Speaking of which, that little boy looks somewhat similar to you… I wonder if you know that child’s mother?”
“His mother’s surname is Qiu and her name is Qiu Tong.”
Jin Yang’s expression darkened. Before he could say anything, Shao An stepped forward and stood in front of Chief Officer Fang.
“Who the hell are you to ask about his personal life?!”
Only then did Chief Officer Fang realize what he had just blurted out. His curiosity had overwhelmed him. He hurriedly took a step back and bowed to Jin Yang in apology.
Mayor Shen was also shocked by Shao An’s sudden change in attitude. He shrunk to the side and did not dare to speak.
Jin Yang didn’t expect such a coincidence. The child who was researching the locust pesticide was actually Qiu Tong’s son. They were really fated.
He recalled Chief Officer Fang’s words and couldn’t help but feel curious. After all, Qiu Tong had said something similar before.
Did he really look like that child?
Never mind. He would be able to see that kid at the awards ceremony. He’ll see what happened then.
“Alright now, it’s not a big deal.”
Jin Yang said to Shao An as he waved his hand gently, gesturing for him to step aside.
“Go and arrange the award ceremony.”
“Alright, Sir. What do you think of holding it in the kindergarten that Qiu Xingyuan is in?”
Chief Officer Fang thought for a bit before suggesting.
When Jin Yang heard Qiu Xingyuan’s name, his brows twitched. This name was not bad.
“Fine.”
After Jin Yang confirmed the venue for the awards ceremony, he left Mayor Shen’s office with Shao An. He still had many things to do to capture the terrorists.
After Jin Yang left, the atmosphere in the office suddenly relaxed.
Mayor Shen collapsed on the chair, but then tensed up again.
He did not know whether Qiu Xingyuan was Jin Yang’s illegitimate son. But Jin Yang was going to personally present the award to that child, so he could not afford to get on Qiu Tong’s wrong side.
“Chief Officer Fang, bring some gifts over to apologize to Qiu Tong and the child immediately.”
Mayor Shen thought for a while and decided that it was better for him not to show his face for now. “We must be more friendly and talk to her nicely. We must not let her speak nonsense in front of Sir.”
In the end, Chief Officer Fang had to go clean up the mess that Mayor Shen had created.
Chief Officer Fang cursed in his heart, but he put on a compliant face.
After all, the higher the position, the greater the suppression.
After Chief Officer Fang, he immediately bought gifts and headed to Qiu Tong’s place.
Qiu Tong opened the door and saw Chief Officer Fang standing outside.
“Chief Officer Fang, why are you here? Is there any other problem with Xingyuan’s matter?”
“Miss Qiu, I’m here to tell you the good news.”
Chief Officer Fang placed the gift aside and said excitedly, “An important figure personally acknowledged the pesticide your son developed. He will personally present an award to your son at the kindergarten.”
“I think that this important person and your family is fated. Not only did he take a liking to the pesticide, he also looks very similar to your son.”
“I’m here to report the good news and also to apologize. My men were rude to you previously. Please forgive us and don’t blame us.”
Qiu Tong frowned. She remembered that when she first met Song Yan, she also felt that he looked like Qiu Xingyuan, so she probed.
“Is that person’s surname Song?”
“No, his surname isn’t Song. You’ll see him at the award ceremony.” Chief Officer Fang didn’t dare to reveal Jin Yang’s identity and shook his head.
Qiu Tong felt even more puzzled. Her son didn’t have a common face, so why did so many people resemble him?

chapters.title: Chapter 90 - Surrounded
chapters.content:
Chapter 90: Surrounded
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Chief Officer Fang left after relaying the news to Qiu Tong.
Although Qiu Tong was puzzled, she didn’t let it bother her too much. After all, she would be able to see him at the award ceremony.
Ke Le and the others had been protecting the three children well, so Qiu Tong was confident of letting them continue to send the three children to and from school, while she would see to Ye Luan. This way, all the children would be able to receive sufficient protection.
However, Qiu Xingyuan’s opinion of Qiu Tong’s arrangement could be summed up by one word.
Biased!
“Elder Brother, that woman only has eyes for Ye Luan now. She’s really too much.”
Qiu Xingqiao looked at his brother angrily, his heart filled with resentment towards Qiu Tong.
“Does Mommy not like us anymore?”
Qiu Xingyu was also a little unhappy. It had been a long time since she last saw Qiu Tong standing at the door waiting for them to finish school.
“In that case, we have to let her notice our existence.”
Qiu Xingyuan blinked and put his chemistry book into his bag. He then casually pulled out a piece of white paper, picked up his little sister’s pen, and drew a cartoon of a grimacing face on the paper for Ke Le.
He then left the kindergarten with his siblings before school ended.
“Let’s go. I will bring you guys to the internet cafe to spend the night. We won’t go back until that woman comes looking for us.”
Meanwhile, Qiu Tong had arrived at the school early.
Today was Friday. The elementary school usually let off earlier than usual on Fridays.
However, Qiu Tong waited at the entrance for a long time but did not see Ye Luan. After the last student left the school, she called Ye Luan’s form teacher.
“Ye Luan said that he had a stomachache and left very early. I wanted to accompany him home, but he said that someone came to pick him up.”
“Isn’t he home yet?”
Qiu Tong’s heart sank when she heard her teacher’s surprised voice.
She hurriedly hung up the phone and looked around for Ye Luan.
“Ye Luan, Ye Luan!”
Qiu Tong shouted as she walked around, peering into every single alley. The surroundings became quieter and quieter.
Suddenly, Qiu Tong heard something and her pupils constricted!
She quickly hid behind the wall and held her breath as she slowly approached a small alley.
In the small alley, Ye Luan was surrounded by more than ten strong men. From their stance and physique, these people must be well-trained experts.
Why was Ye Luan surrounded by these people?
Qiu Tong had a conflicted look on her face. She quietly drew nearer to them while scanning the surroundings.
“Kid, I advise you to hand it over quickly. Otherwise, your tiny body won’t be able to endure our punches.”
The leader looked at Ye Luan coldly, his tone full of threat and coercion.
Ye Luan was silent, but his small face was filled with resolution. That stubborn look instantly angered the man.
“Ignorant brat!”
“Don’t think that I won’t hit you just because you’re a child!”
As the man spoke, he approached Ye Luan and raised his huge hand—
“Stop!”
With that impending danger, Qiu Tong could no longer back. In a flash, she leaped forward and grabbed the man’s hand!
Qiu Tong’s eyes were filled with rage. She could clearly feel the strength of this man. If his strike had landed, Ye Luan would be severely injured!
“B*tch, mind your own business.”
The veins on the man’s arm bulged as he quickly shook off Qiu Tong’s hand and threw a kick at Qiu Tong’s back!
Qiu Tong dodged to the side at a strange angle. At the same time, she grabbed the man’s shoulder and spun behind him. She hooked her other arm around the man’s neck and used her right leg to lock him tightly!
The others saw Qiu Tong’s skills and quickly attacked her, surrounding her in the center.
Qiu Tong was analyzing their moves as she fought.
These people had obviously undergone strict training. Their teamwork was very well-coordinated which amplified their combined combat strength. All signs indicated that they were not ordinary robbers, but more like soldiers.
The leader was also being increasingly amazed. He was well aware of how good his men were. Yet, this woman was able to fight them on equal terms.
Who the hell was she?!
At that moment, the three truant children happened to pass by the side of the alley. When they saw Qiu Tong protecting Ye Luan behind her while fighting a group of men, their faces instantly darkened.
This woman was really willing to do anything for Ye Luan!
Look, she provoked some unsavory characters again!
With a cold face, Qiu Xingyuan was the first to turn around and leave.. Qiu Xingqiao followed his elder brother and stomped away furiously.

chapters.title: Chapter 91 - Entrust
chapters.content:
Chapter 91: Entrust
Only Qiu Xingyu kept turning back. She asked in a small voice, “Elder Brother, Second Brother… will Mommy be in danger?”
The image of Qiu Tong and those people fighting kept replaying in the three children’s minds. Qiu Xingyuan’s footsteps gradually slowed down.
Qiu Xingqiao saw that Little Yu’s big eyes were filled with worry. He pursed his lips and became a little anxious.
He said awkwardly, “Elder Brother, look at how worried Little Yu is about this woman. If we leave like this, Little Yu won’t be able to rest easy the rest of the day.”
“Why don’t we go back and take a look so that Little Yu can be assured?”
Qiu Xingyuan was silent for a moment, but he nodded.
Since his younger siblings were worried about that woman, he would bring them there.
It was only because of his younger siblings… Qiu Xingyuan told himself.
Meanwhile, the battle between Qiu Tong and those men had reached its climax. Not only were these men highly skilled, they also had excellent teamwork. After a long time, Qiu Tong had only managed to kill three of them.
Qiu Tong knocked down another man. In the next second, she sensed a major impending force coming from behind, while a man’s fist was coming at her from the right.
Qiu Tong made a snap decision to endure the attack from behind, so that she could counter the fist coming from her right. A fierce light flashed across her eyes.
However, the pain she expected from the back attack did not come to realization. Qiu Tong heard the man behind her groan.
She seized this opportunity and hammered the enemy on her right onto the ground. Without any hesitation, she then threw a roundhouse kick at the face of the man behind her. The man’s body instantly flew out!
Two more…
Qiu Tong was just about to heave a sigh of relief when she saw the three children standing behind her. She could not help being shocked.
Why were they here?!
The three children had a pile of stones beside them. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao kept throwing stones at the men who were attacking Qiu Tong. Qiu Xingyu squatted on the ground and handed stones to her brothers.
The three of them were doing their best to help Qiu Tong fight the enemy!
Qiu Tong was touched, but she could not let these children fall into danger with her.
She nimbly circled around the man in the lead and suddenly jumped up. She grabbed the man’s head with both hands, bent her knees and used her body’s gravity to throw the man to the ground.
Qiu Tong’s body did not slow down at all. Using the momentum from the impact, she instantly leaped next to the man closest to her. With a powerful elbow strike, she struck his temple. The man swayed twice before falling forward.
Having finally dealt with those few men after much difficulty, Qiu Tong quickly retreated to Ye Luan’s side and whispered in his ear.
“I’ll distract them. Escape with your brothers and sisters.”
“I am entrusting them to you.”
Without waiting for Ye Luan to speak, Qiu Tong shouted, “I have what you want! If you want it, come and get it yourself!”
Qiu Tong ran towards the other end of the alley.
The leader’s expression changed and he quickly chased after her with the others.
“Don’t let that woman escape! Catch her!”
When Qiu Xingqiao saw this, he immediately wanted to chase after them. However, Ye Luan suddenly grabbed his arm. “Auntie Qiu said that she wanted me to bring you away from here. Don’t waste her efforts.”
Ye Luan stared fixedly at Qiu Tong’s departing figure, refusing to let go no matter how Qiu Xingqiao struggled.
“If not for you, we wouldn’t be in danger!”
Qiu Xingqiao couldn’t struggle free. He looked at Ye Luan with eyes full of hatred. He raised his other hand and punched Ye Luan’s face!
A bruise instantly appeared on Ye Luan’s face, but even so, he still didn’t let go. He tightly gripped Qiu Xingqiao’s arm, not letting him leave.
Qiu Xingqiao couldn’t defeat Ye Luan, so he turned around and bit Ye Luan’s arm. It was as if he was venting the anger in his heart. His mouth was filled with the stench of blood.
“Second Brother, let go of Ye Luan.”
When Qiu Xingyu saw the blood on Ye Luan’s arm, her face turned pale. She was afraid that something would happen and immediately dragged her elder brother over to pull Qiu Xingqiao away.
She looked at the bloodstains on Ye Luan’s arm and his pallid face. She couldn’t bear to see Ye Luan like this and reluctantly used a handkerchief to bandage Ye Luan’s wound.
Ye Luan glanced at Qiu Xingyu and pursed his lips, not saying a word.
Qiu Tong ran out of the alley alone. Looking at the men chasing after her, she felt anxious. But the next moment, her eyes lit up!
There was a car by the roadside!
She sped up, opened a car door and rushed inside!
There was someone in the driver’s seat and he was just about to start the car.
“Hurry up and drive!”
Qiu Tong threw a wad of cash at the driver and urged him.
The driver turned around and looked at her in confusion.
Qiu Tong looked at the familiar face and was stunned.
Why was he here?!

chapters.title: Chapter 92 - Misunderstanding
chapters.content:
Chapter 92: Misunderstanding
“Song Yan?!”
Qiu Tong gaped. “Why are you here?”
Song Yan: “…”
This was the real Song Yan. He was waiting for his subordinate here and did not recognize the woman who had suddenly appeared.
People usually mistook him for the president when they saw his face. How did this woman recognize him?
“There’s no time to explain. Drive!”
Seeing that the pursuing men had caught up, Qiu Tong buckled her seatbelt and looked at Song Yan anxiously.
In the rearview mirror, several burly men were rushing towards them!
Song Yan frowned but still stepped on the accelerator.
The car sped away. But just as they passed an intersection, a black car suddenly appeared and slammed into them.
The car was pushed off the main road and nearly flipped over.
Song Yan tried his best to control the steering wheel. From the corner of his eye, he saw two more cars crashing towards him at the same time—
“Sit tight!”
Song Yan quickly spun the steering wheel. The car made a 180-degree turn. With the screeching sound of brakes, their car charged out of the encirclement!
If not for the seatbelt, Qiu Tong might have been flung out…
Song Yan usually looked so cool and calm. She did not expect him to be so wild when driving.
The car behind was following very closely, so Song Yan had no choice but to keep accelerating. Fortunately, he was already familiar with this area. After constantly changing directions, he finally managed to shake off the pursuing vehicle.
Their car turned into a remote alley. After confirming that no one had followed them, Song Yan stopped the engine.
Qiu Tong heaved a sigh of relief and nodded at Song Yan.
“Thank you. I’m glad you reacted quickly.”
This woman seemed to be quite familiar with him judging from her attitude.
Song Yan rubbed his chin and was about to ask how she knew him when she took out a black card and handed it to him.
“I’ll return this card to you. There’s too much money in it. I can’t accept it.”
Song Yan stared at the black card in front of him. He saw the English words engraved on the card.
This card…
This was a limited edition Black Card issued by the Royal Bank. The people who owned these were either rich or of royalty. But he happened to know the exact owner of this card in front of him.
This was Jin Yang’s card!
Well, his brother not only flirted with women and gave them Black Cards, he even used his name?
The key was that he and Jin Yang looked identical. This woman probably really thought he was Jin Yang.
Song Yan sneered in his heart. It seemed that this was the woman who had just withdrawn that large sum of money using Jin Yang’s supplementary card.
“Since I’ve already given you the card, how can I take it back? Keep it. There’s not as much money as you think.”
Song Yan pushed the card back.
“But…”
“No buts. You saved my life. Is my life so worthless?”
Song Yan turned his head and sized her up. She had a petite face and a slender figure. But her eyes were clear and black, containing a firm strength.
This woman was very beautiful.
Hearing his words, Qiu Tong stopped harping on the matter and kept her card.
“Alright, I’ll keep the card for now. I’ll return it to you when you need it in the future.”
Song Yan smiled nonchalantly and even sent Qiu Tong home in a gentlemanly and considerate manner.
“Rest early. See you next time.”
After Qiu Tong got out of the car, Song Yan watched her leave from the window.
Qiu Tong did not know if she was overthinking things, but she felt that Song Yan was a little strange today.
As Song Yan drove away, he quietly noted Qiu Tong’s location and smiled coldly.
Since they were young, their family always sided with Jin Yang. Jin Yang always got whatever he wanted easily, while Song Yan could only live in Jin Yang’s shadow forever.
Therefore, he was always keen to snatch anything that Jin Yang had!
Including this woman…
Seeing that the children had not returned, Qiu Tong frowned and was about to turn around to look for them when she saw Qiu Xingyuan return with his younger siblings. Behind him was an injured Ye Luan.
Seeing that she had returned safely, Qiu Xingyu couldn’t help but run over excitedly and look at her with widened eyes.
“Mommy, are you alright?”
“I’m fine.”
Qiu Tong stroked her head and saw Qiu Xingyuan walk past her with a cold snort, as if blaming her for causing trouble again.
Qiu Xingqiao clenched his fists and warned Ye Luan, “Jinx! What are you doing here?! Get out of my house!”
Ye Luan’s expression was cold. He opened his mouth as if he wanted to say something, but didn’t say anything.
“Oh no, oh no! The children are gone!”
A loud shout came from outside.
Ke Le, who failed to fetch the children from school, was just rushing back. He was holding the drawing the children had left in the kindergarten. “They also left you a note—”
Qiu Tong looked and saw the cartoon demon face on the paper. Its blood-red eyes were terrifying and had eight demonic fangs. Its bloody jaws were opened wide as if to eat humans!
With the demon’s clothes and hair, it was obviously a caricature of Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong, “…”
So she looked like that in the hearts of these little kids?!

chapters.title: Chapter 93 - Genius Painter
chapters.content:
Chapter 93: Genius Painter
“Painting Mommy as a demon? Tell me honestly, whose idea was it? Who was the one who drew this?”
Qiu Tong stuck her hands at her waist and demanded an explanation from them. She lowered her eyes to carefully observe the exaggerated and bold caricature of her.
With this artistic talent, she secretly wondered if the Qiu family could also produce a genius painter?!
The three children avoided Qiu Tong’s gaze and responded to her question with silence.
Qiu Tong rolled her eyes and covered her heart with her hand. She pretended to have a heart attack and said, “I’m so pitiful. I must be the first mother to be angered to death by her child’s drawing, right? I didn’t know I looked like this in your hearts!”
“Do you know how dangerous the world is outside? Mommy hired Uncle Ke Le to protect you, but you sneaked out…”
“What if something happened? How sad will Mommy be?”
Qiu Tong gasped in an exaggerated manner, clutching the drawing and comparing it to her own face. She shook her head and sighed quietly.
“Mommy!”
Little Yu ran over to Qiu Tong’s side in a panic, supporting her by the arm and shaking her gently. Copying a doctor’s actions, she pressed against Qiu Tong’s chest. She looked back and stamped her feet anxiously.
“Eldest Brother, Second Brother, quickly think of a solution. I don’t want Mommy to be angered to death!”
Qiu Tong smirked.
Anxiety and awkwardness flashed across Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes. He explained stiffly, “That’s not you!”
“We were drawing someone else…”
“Really?”
Qiu Tong hesitated, wanting to believe it, but out of the corner of her eye, she caught a glimpse of the small line of words at the bottom of the canvas. It was neatly labeled—
“This is Miss Qiu!”
Miss Qiu?
Qiu Tong was speechless. She raised one fair finger and pointed at those words. She looked up at Qiu Xingqiao and asked, “How are you going to explain this?”
The three kids and Ke Le sank into an awkward silence…
The evidence was right in front of her eyes, but Little Yu suddenly thought of something. She snatched the drawing paper over and compared it with her little face.
“Mommy! My brothers drew this small portrait for me. The kindergarten teachers asked me to be a model in an art class!”
“Mommy is so beautiful and gentle… how could she possibly look like this?”
At this point, Little Yu paused and tugged at the corner of Qiu Tong’s clothes to comfort her. “Mommy, don’t be angry, okay?”
Qiu Tong’s heart nearly melted from all the coaxing.
She had not really wanted to fuss with them and she was now in a much better mood. She led them into the house.
After returning home, Qiu Tong saw Ye Luan covering his arm with his school bag. She blocked his way back to his room and squatted down, pulling him to her side.
She looked at the clear bite mark on Ye Luan’s forearm and asked with a frown, “What happened?”
Ye Luan pursed his lips and refused to speak.
Qiu Xingqiao stood at the side for a while. He stared at the floor and admitted, “I bit him!”
“Those people were chasing after you, but he stopped us from following you… so I bit him!”
Qiu Xingqiao told the truth with a straight face.
Going by how Qiu Tong was usually so concerned about Ye Luan, she would definitely reprimand him like the last time, right?
Qiu Xingqiao clenched his fists and leaned against the wall like a man, waiting for Qiu Tong to reprimand him…
Nevertheless, he still felt rather indignant…
Qiu Tong came to his side and raised her hand.
Qiu Xingqiao instinctively closed his eyes, thinking that he would be beaten. But in the next second, those gentle hands patted the top of his head.
“Mommy knows that you were just too anxious in wanting to save me…”
“Mommy told Brother Ye Luan to stop you guys. Next time, don’t hurt him on impulse. You have to apologize to him, okay?”
Qiu Xingqiao was surprised by Qiu Tong’s gentleness, while Little Yu looked at Qiu Tong with admiration. “I want to have my head patted too!”
“Okay!”
Qiu Tong hugged the three children and patted them one by one. She said in a low voice, “Thank you for helping Mommy today…”
With her gentle touch, all the grudges between Little Yu and Qiu Tong dissolved. Little Yu smiled sweetly and obediently leaned into Qiu Tong’s arms.
However, the two boys looked away stubbornly. From time to time, they would glance at Qiu Tong’s smiling lips and then look at Ye Luan with complicated feelings…
In the evening, Qiu Tong found the medical kit at home and brought Ye Luan to her side. She took off his clothes and looked at the few bruises on his body. Her heart ached as she narrowed her eyes.
She took some iodophor and dabbed it gently on his wounds to prevent infection.
Ye Luan endured the pain as his body trembled uncontrollably.
Qiu Tong knew that he could be very stubborn, so she asked softly, “Who was chasing you today? Why did they chase you?”
Ye Luan’s expression changed and his body stiffened. He replied calmly, “I don’t know.”

chapters.title: Chapter 94 - Successful Battle For Favor
chapters.content:
Chapter 94: Successful Battle For Favor
Qiu Tong could tell that Ye Luan was deliberately hiding something. She threw the cotton bud into the trash can and bandaged him.
“I heard them asking you to hand over something. Do you have something that others want?”
“Is that why those people are chasing after you? If that’s the case, you can give it to me. I’ll keep it safe for you for the time being.”
“There are many of them. You are a child and it will be difficult to guard it. You might even be killed for it.”
She tried to persuade him seriously, but Ye Luan became wary of her. His dark eyes were fixed on Qiu Tong, his lips pursed into a straight line.
“I don’t have anything.”
Sensing that Ye Luan was stiffening up again, Qiu Tong didn’t press further. Instead, she started to pack up the first aid box.
Qiu Xingqiao listened to their conversation and was very dissatisfied with Ye Luan’s attitude. He lifted his chin and walked up to him. “How could you do this?! It was because of you that nearly got us killed!”
“In order to protect you, Mommy got into dangerous situations several times, but you refused to say anything…”
“You’re not welcome here. Get out! Leave our home…”
Qiu Xingqiao pushed Ye Luan’s shoulders and looked at the delicate but taciturn boy in front of him. He snorted angrily. Ever since he came home, his mother no longer cared about them!
Ye Luan lowered his eyes in silence for a long time. He didn’t refute but bowed deeply to Qiu Tong and walked towards the door.
Qiu Tong saw that he was about to leave and hurriedly stopped him. She turned toward Qiu Xingqiao.
“Little Qiao, don’t be like that. Brother Ye Luan has his own problems. There are many secrets that can’t be divulged casually. It’s just like how you guys also have many things you can’t tell Mommy. It’s the same…”
“Mommy will protect you and this family. You have to promise Mommy to get along with Brother Ye Luan. Don’t say any more angry words.”
Qiu Tong tried to placate the children with furrowed brows. She looked at the mercenary Ke Le and said, “From tomorrow onwards, you will accompany me to send Ye Luan to school. This will be safer.”
The people who were pursuing Ye Luan today were quite skilled and liked to attack in a group. It was very difficult for Qiu Tong to deal with them alone.
Therefore, Qiu Tong planned to have one out of the five mercenaries and protect Ye Luan with her.
Qiu Xingyu, one of the triplets, analyzed the situation quietly and felt a little disappointed.
Mommy still wished to escort Ye Luan every day and not them…
Suddenly, her eyes lit up.
There was a solution!
Qiu Xingyu took the initiative to run to Ke Le’s side. She dragged two of the mercenaries over to Ye Luan’s side. She said in a soft voice, “Brother Ye Luan is in danger. More people should be assigned to protect him!”
“I have Eldest Brother and Second Brother to protect me. I’ll be fine!”
“Brother Ye Luan’s safety is more important. We’re nothing…”
Qiu Xingyuan was a little confused by Little Yu’s actions, but he quickly understood what she wanted to do. He added, “Yes, we don’t need mercenaries. I can protect them…”
“Even if we encounter danger, we can rely on ourselves to escape.”
Qiu Tong was very touched by Little Yu’s thoughtfulness, but she knew in her heart that she could not really ignore their safety like they had said.
She frowned and pondered for a while. Then, she nodded and said, “In that case, let’s change it. I’ll leave Ye Luan’s safety to the four of you.”
“From tomorrow onwards, Ke Le and I will escort them to and fro school.”
Qiu Xingyu quietly suppressed the smile on her face and placed her little hands behind her back. She made a “thumbs-up” gesture to Qiu Xingyuan.
She truly had a smart little head on her!
The battle for favor was a success!
Seeing this, the two boys rubbed their noses and looked out of the window in tacit understanding. They pretended nothing had happened.
…
The next day, the kindergarten held a parent-teacher meeting. Qiu Tong sat in the designated seat according to the teacher’s instructions. She did not expect Little Jin’s mother to be beside her.
Little Jin was the child who had damaged Qiu Xingyuan’s test tubes the previous time. They had an unpleasant experience together.
Little Jin’s mother remembered Qiu Ting’s arrogant and unreasonable attitude the previous time and was very unhappy with her. She deliberately moved away from the seat and kept a distance from Qiu Ting as she shouted.
“A child really takes after his parents. Your child has such a bad temper. He must have learned it from his parents at home!”
“Our children are in the same class as such children. I’m so worried every day!”
Little Jin’s mother snorted sarcastically at Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong was reading the kindergarten teacher’s comments on the children and couldn’t be bothered to argue with the noisy woman.
Little Jin’s mother saw that she was silent and said proudly, “My child won the computer award! He’ll be able to go on stage to receive the award later!”
“It’s said that with these awards and certificates, they will be given priority when choosing their elementary and middle schools!”

chapters.title: Chapter 95 - Kindergarten Parent-Teacher Conference
chapters.content:
Chapter 95: Kindergarten Parent-Teacher Conference
Little Jin’s mother glanced sideways at Qiu Tong and deliberately raised her voice as she said, “Children should study hard. Don’t be like some children who only know how to mix strange liquids. No idea what they’re doing.”
“How old are they now? They think they are still in the countryside playing with mud!”
The children sat beside Qiu Tong and quietly clenched their fists. They suppressed their unhappiness and gritted their teeth, not wanting to cause trouble for their mother.
Qiu Tong noticed the children’s anger and raised her hand to rub the top of Qiu Xingyuan’s head. She also pinched Qiu Xingqiao’s puffed up little face.
Little Jin’s mother saw her placating the children and mistook Qiu Tong for being ashamed. She arrogantly pulled at the other parent beside her and deliberately pointed at them.
“Those children have very strange tempers. They can’t play with other children!”
