“The second son is irritable, the eldest son is solitary and likes to play with dangerous things. Our Little Jin was almost beaten up by them several times…”
“Do you think the kindergarten should screen the children’s family backgrounds? Someone who impacts the environment like this should really be chased out…”
“Look, these children don’t look like they’re that smart. Maybe they won’t be able to pass the elementary school promotion test!”
Little Jin’s mother became more and more excited as she spoke. Qiu Xingqiao could not bear it anymore. His face flushed red with anger, and he jumped to his feet and said, “Nonsense!”
“My Elder Brother is especially outstanding. We just don’t want to waste time with those idiots!”
“Mayor Shen will be bringing an important figure to present an award to my brother! He’ll be presenting the prize himself! And he’ll be publicly praised…”
Qiu Xingqiao’s words made the surrounding parents whisper among themselves, discussing the credibility of Qiu Xingqiao’s words.
Little Jin’s mother looked extremely spiteful. She snorted twice and said, “What a joke. Do you think a big shot would be so free? To come here and give an award to a child?”
The other parents were convinced by Little Jin’s mother. Coupled with their own jealousy, they looked at Qiu Tong and the three children with disdain.
This was indeed a child who liked to lie!
The parents stole a glance at Qiu Tong, who did not try to stop anything or explain. They hid behind her and gossiped. “Look, this parent isn’t even going to stop her own child from lying. Children who are brought up like this will definitely become social delinquents in the future!”
Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes were suffused with hatred as he looked at them coldly.
Qiu Tong rested her hand on his little hand. Qiu Xingyuan looked up and was stunned to see her smile, which was gentle and comforting…
He pulled his hand back awkwardly, but the anger in his body gradually dissipated and returned to normal.
Outside the kindergarten, Shao An arrived early to check the safety of the environment. When he passed the classroom, he saw Qiu Tong and the three children sitting beside her. He was so shocked that he stood rooted to the ground!
He rubbed his eyes and looked at Qiu Xingyuan through the thick and blurry glass window…
Alike! Simply too alike!
It turned out that Qiu Tong had said that her children looked like Jin Yang not because she was lying or just trying to get close to him!
Those two boys really looked like Jin Yang!
Shao An could not help but quietly speculate about the relationship between the two of them…
Buzz—
Shao An’s phone rang. He hid in a corner and answered the call with his hand covering the receiver. He answered respectfully, “Sir.”
Jin Yang stood there, his aura cold and stern. “Come back now.”
Click. The call ended.
Shao An frowned and felt that something was wrong. He immediately started the engine and rushed back.
Qiu Tong sat in the classroom and vaguely sensed someone dashing by. She looked over but did not see anything. She lowered her eyes again.
Shao An rushed back to the villa and looked around warily. Before he could ask what was going on, he heard Jin Yang say in a cold voice, “Pack your things.”
“We’re setting off for the capital now.”
Shao An was stunned. He asked in surprise, “Sir, what’s the rush?”
“You have to go to the kindergarten today to give the award to Qiu Tong’s son. You have no idea how much that child resembles you!”
“I can help you adjust your schedule and flight. You can leave after you give out the prize…”
“Or, just give me half an hour. I’ll go back and take a picture for you to see!”
Shao An felt some regret. He should have secretly taken a few photos of Qiu Xingyuan for Jin Yang. Looking at how much Jin Yang valued Qiu Tong, he would definitely be very happy.
Besides, although he believed in the nobility of Jin Yang’s character, the child was so similar to him that he had to wonder if they were related by blood…
Jin Yang narrowed his eyes at Shao An’s nagging. He placed the glass cup on the coffee table and looked up with a murderous gaze.
“My order is to return to the capital immediately.”
“Are you trying to disobey my orders? Do you even know what delaying by half a minute would mean?”
Shao An was stunned by his aura and immediately nodded respectfully. “Yes Sir, your orders are to be obeyed! I’ll do it immediately!”
He turned and left the villa, hurriedly changing the day’s itinerary. On the way, he took out his phone and called Mayor Shen. “President Jin Yang has something to attend to in the capital. The awards segment for today is canceled.”

chapters.title: Chapter 96 - Awards Ceremony
chapters.content:
Chapter 96: Awards Ceremony
Mayor Shen had already arrived at the entrance of the kindergarten in a Mercedes-Benz car. When he heard Shao An’s notice, he paced around anxiously.
“Why the sudden cancellation?”
“All the guests invited by the kindergarten are already here. It won’t be good if we cancel now…”
He tried to find a way to mediate the situation, but there was no reply. He looked down at his phone screen.
Beep beep beep—
The call lasted for only two seconds. Shao An did not even wait for his reply before hanging up.
Mayor Shen scratched his head in frustration. Just as he was thinking about how he should explain things to the guests, he looked up and saw a familiar figure.
Mr. Jin Yang?!
Mayor Shen ran over happily and bowed respectfully. “Didn’t you say you were returning to the capital? Why are you here now?”
Song Yan happened to be looking for Jin Yang near the kindergarten. He had one hand in his pocket and was about to leave when he bumped into Mayor Shen!
Song Yan raised his eyebrows and paused for a moment. He could tell that this person was here for Jin Yang.
He gave a perfunctory reply and asked in return, “You received the notice?”
Mayor Shen did not suspect this man at all. He hurriedly raised his phone and said, “Mr. Shao An told me that you want to cancel the award ceremony…”
“But Miss Qiu’s children have already gotten the news that they will receive the medal. I was worried that they would be disappointed. It’s great that you could come.”
Song Yan stuck the tip of his tongue between his teeth and smiled. He took the initiative to stride into the kindergarten. “Let’s go then.”
“Don’t let the children wait too long. The award ceremony is an important matter.”
Since it was something Jin Yang planned to do, he was interested in taking a look.
When Mayor Shen and Song Yan walked out of the auditorium, the award ceremony was already coming to an end.
Many children had already received the awards from the kindergarten teacher. Some were holding red apples high while others were holding certificates as they handed them to their mothers. The scene was very lively.
Little Jin’s mother flaunted the prizes that her child had won and looked proudly at Qiu Tong and the three children, who looked a little dejected.
“Hey, I remember someone bragging about being able to receive an award from Mayor Shen and some big shot.”
“Mayor Shen probably doesn’t even know that the kindergarten is holding an award ceremony today, right? How dare you brag!”
Qiu Xingyu was so angry that she felt like crying. “Don’t spout nonsense!”
Qiu Tong squatted down and hugged her, wiping a few tears off her face with her fingertips. She coaxed her gently, “A girl’s tears are the most valuable. You can’t just cry because of some random person…”
“The same goes for you two boys. You have to remember that science is the same throughout the world. And it cannot be proven just by winning awards. Even if those people don’t come, don’t be disappointed.”
“Mommy can buy you all these prizes when we get back!”
“As long as you work hard and do the right thing, you will definitely achieve gains. Success at the starting line is not worth celebrating…”
“The most important thing is to be able to stand on the podium after the finish line.”
Qiu Xingyu was comforted by her and ran to Qiu Xingyuan’s side. She looked up and said clearly, “Mommy is right, Elder Brother. You’re the best!”
Qiu Tong stared at Little Jin’s mother. The mother understood that Qiu Tong was saying those words for her to hear. Feeling increasingly annoyed, she deliberately put on a mocking tone.
“It’s easy to give high-sounding sermons!”
“Children who are already lagging behind at the starting line still wish to catch up with to the rest of us in the future? This is ridiculous!”
“If Mayor Shen and the big shot doesn’t come to the award ceremony today, your children are liars and so they are bad children!”
The surrounding parents sized up Qiu Tong and the children.
There were only 10 minutes left until the end of the awards ceremony.
Would Mayor Shen and the big shot really come?
At that moment, Mayor Shen was respectfully escorting Song Yan into the auditorium. They walked straight to the stage.
Mayor Shen tapped on the microphone and said in a very humble tone, “Please settle, everyone. There’s still an award to be presented.”
Everyone looked up at the stage before gazing in shock at Qiu Tong. Even Little Jin’s mother looked in disbelief at Mayor Shen and the man beside him…
“This is… the president?”
“Why would he come to the kindergarten to present an award to a child? What kind of award is it?”
“Don’t tell me it’s really for Qiu Tong’s children?”
The parents’ disdain and contempt for Qiu Ying turned to envy at this moment. They wished they could become Qiu Xingyuan’s parents and receive such an honor from that esteemed person…

chapters.title: Chapter 97 - Failed In Her Duty
chapters.content:
Chapter 97: Failed In Her Duty
“Qiu Xingyuan, please come on stage to receive the award.”
The guests at the kindergarten’s ceremony stood up and applauded along with the music of the awards ceremony.
Qiu Tong straightened Qiu Xingyuan’s suit and bow tie. She patted his shoulder and sent him to the side of the stage with a smile.
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his lips and raised his head. With a calm gaze, he walked to Song Yan’s side.
Song Yan opened the red velvet gift box from Mayor Shen’s hand and took out the medal that was gleamed with a golden light. He bent over and personally placed it on Qiu Xingyuan’s chest.
Thunderous applause rang out from below the stage. Camera lights flashed repeatedly, capturing the current scene. The parents looked at Qiu Tong with endless envy.
“Mommy, Eldest Brother is amazing!”
Little Yu excitedly stamped her feet and clapped her hands as she spoke.
Song Yan followed the voice and saw Qiu Tong. He immediately straightened up and looked at Qiu Xingyuan’s face. His movements froze for a moment…
This child’s mother… was Qiu Tong?
Qiu Tong was the Miss Qiu that Mayor Shen had mentioned?
Song Yan’s pupils quivered, before he concealed his shock.
Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes were very similar to Jin Yang’s, and his silhouette and aura were also very similar to him!
Therefore…
Jin Yang didn’t seem to like women, but he actually had an illegitimate child?
Did Jin Yang know about the child’s existence?
Song Yan smirked. This was the best opportunity he had. He wanted to snatch this illegitimate son of Qiu Tong and Jin Yang, and use him to humiliate him.
He could not wait to see Jin Yang’s panicked and vexed expression. After thinking about it, he bent over and squatted beside Qiu Xingyuan. He pointed at the kindergarten teacher’s camera, indicating for them to take a picture together for remembrance.
He rested his hand on Qiu Xingyuan’s shoulder and casually pinched off a strand of Qiu Xingyuan’s hair.
Jin Yang and Song Yan were identical twins with identical DNA. With this hair, one could determine whether they were related by blood!
Song Yan gathered the hair into his palm and smiled calmly.
Qiu Xingyuan found it a little strange. He stole a glance at Song Yan and felt that this man seemed rather familiar, as if he had seen him somewhere before.
The kindergarten teacher gestured at him, “Student Qiu, look at me!”
Qiu Xingyuan put on a stiff face and smoothed his hair as he turned to look at the camera. His posture was a little stiff.
Seeing that his elder brother was so outstanding, Qiu Xingqiao glared at Little Jin and his mother with his hands on his hips. He called out in a loud voice. “Did you see that? My elder brother’s medal is the awesome one!”
“A stupid certificate can’t compare to it! What’s so great about an award for computers? If Little Yu were to participate in that competition, she would definitely be better than you!”
Qiu Xingqiao childishly smirked and stuck his tongue out at Little Jin. He wanted to pay back all the grievances he had suffered!
Little Jin had been treated by his mother as a precious treasure since he was young. He was bold to the point of being audacious. At this moment, he was pointing at Song Yan and Qiu Xingyuan, who were taking a picture together on stage. He was speaking loudly such that all the surrounding parents could hear.
“Hmph, what is this science award? It’s a sham!”
“The Qiu children look very similar to the award presenter! Especially Qiu Xingyuan and him…”
“Who knows what your relationship is! That award might have been won through connections!”
“Mommy said that as long as you donate money to the kindergarten, you can win awards in exchange. You must have spent more money than us!”
Little Jin bluntly revealed the “dark side” of the kindergarten. Little Jin’s mother was so frightened that her legs went limp and she rushed over. She covered his mouth and turned her head to look at Song Yan guiltily.
“Sir… don’t listen to his nonsense! Children are ignorant!”
Little Jin’s mother was very frightened. How dare this child speak nonsense in front of the president!
Song Yan personally accompanied Qiu Xingyuan to the middle of the crowd. He sized up Little Jin with a meaningful smile on his thin lips and said indifferently.
“It’s alright. Children can’t tell right from wrong. Everything they say is unintentional.”
“However, he’s so young, yet he’s already speculating and slandering others. It seems like he lacks parental supervision. As his mother, you should pay more attention.”
His tone was calm and even gentle, but Little Jin’s mother was trembling in fear.
He… he said that she had failed her duty as a parent!
She grabbed Little Jin and roared with a ferocious expression.
“Did you hear that?! Don’t spout nonsense! In the future, you must control your mouth and stop slandering others, understand? Otherwise, I won’t buy you any more toys!”
Little Jin had never been scolded in public before. Sensing the gazes of the children around him, he felt embarrassed and shielded his eyes with his arms. He immediately broke down and wailed.
Qiu Xingyu was somewhat frightened. She hid behind Qiu Tong’s back and covered her eyes with her small hands, peeping through them to see the situation.
She tugged at Qiu Tong’s sleeve and said softly, “Auntie is so angry, but she has never scolded Little Jin in the past.”
Qiu Tong stroked the top of her head comfortingly, her gaze landing on Song Yan.

chapters.title: Chapter 98 - Purchasing The Formula
chapters.content:
Chapter 98: Purchasing The Formula
“Boohoo… I was in the wrong…”
Little Jin had no choice but to apologize to Qiu Tong and the three children.
The gazes of the kindergarten parents changed as they looked at the Qiu family. They turned away and kept silent. How could they dare to spout any more nonsense?
Song Yan lazily raised his finger and rubbed his forehead. He said casually, “Children have to be controlled when they make mistakes, but scolding alone is useless. You have to educate them.”
“What would happen if he bears a grudge against other children in the kindergarten in the future?”
Little Jin’s mother understood his hint and pulled Little Jin to his feet. She promised him, “Definitely not! Don’t worry… I will definitely educate him well!”
Qiu Tong stared at Song Yan. She had a nagging feeling that he was different today.
Furthermore, Chief Officer Fang had clearly said that the guest presenter for the award ceremony did not have the surname Song, but it was still Song Yan who came to the kindergarten. What went wrong?
Qiu Tong could sense an unfamiliar aura from the man before her. Was she being too sensitive?
Song Yan sensed Qiu Tong’s probing gaze. He immediately withdrew the mischievous smile on his face and switched to his indifferent expression. He tugged at his tie and pursed his thin lips into a straight line as he looked ahead…
Qiu Tong heaved a sigh of relief when she saw that familiar expression and mannerisms, dispelling her suspicions.
This was obviously the person she was familiar with.
Perhaps the strange environment in the kindergarten had caused him to behave abnormally. Qiu Tong found an explanation for Song Yan’s abnormal behavior.
However, Qiu Tong did not know that imitating Jin Yang was very simple for Song Yan. He had often used this trick to cheat his parents and gain more care and concern for him.
Even his biological parents could not differentiate between him and Jin Yang, much less Qiu Tong?
At the thought of this, Song Yan gritted his teeth in self-deprecation. Annoyance pricked his heart. As soon as the award ceremony ended, he looked at Qiu Tong and walked out of the kindergarten.
Mayor Shen personally escorted him out before returning to the auditorium. He looked at Qiu Tong and rubbed his hands together, speaking in an extremely genial tone.
“Miss Qiu, your son’s locust pesticide is very successful and we are very interested in it. Can you sell us the formula?”
“We will mass-produce it. If you want, we can pay you a patent fee.”
Qiu Tong was a little surprised, but she quickly lowered her eyes to look at Qiu Xingyuan and said, “He was the one who developed the locust pesticide. You should be asking Xingyuan for his opinion, not mine…”
Qiu Xingyuan looked up at Qiu Tong in astonishment.
She was giving him the authority?!
Qiu Tong smiled and nodded encouragingly. “Mommy respects your opinions.”
Even though they were young children, they also had the right to decide upon things that belonged to them!
Qiu Tong’s respect and support for Qiu Xingyuan made his heart tremble. He clenched his small fists and nodded in agreement.
Mayor Shen nodded and squatted down to say to Qiu Xingyuan, “We have a budget of $15,000 to purchase the locust pesticide formula. What do you think?”
“If you’re not satisfied, I can discuss with my superior about increasing the fee…”
The high budget amount exceeded Qiu Tong’s expectations. It also shocked the other parents who had stopped to watch the commotion.
They really did not expect the Qiu family children to be so capable. They were able to earn money even though they were still in kindergarten. And it was such a huge sum of money!
They suddenly felt that the certificates in their hands were not good enough!
“Look, compared to this kind of patent fee, what’s so great about a computer award?”
“Earlier, Little Jin’s family looked down on the children of the Qiu family. If we had children as obedient and adorable as those from the Qiu family, we would be able to smile even in our dreams. Little Jin usually only knows to brag and bully female classmates in kindergarten. He deserves to be scolded!”
Little Jin’s mother was utterly embarrassed by the whispers of the other parents. She felt very ashamed and lost all her earlier bluster.
Qiu Xingyuan looked at Qiu Tong hesitantly and saw that she had no objections or opinions. They had reached a verbal deal with Mayor Shen for $15,000.
Mayor Shen found his secretary and signed the check on the spot, before handing it to Qiu Xingyuan.
At the same time, he looked up at Qiu Tong and said, “After the locust pesticide is mass-produced, the Qiu family can also sell it on the market. The profits will be yours…”
“This is part of the official mandate. I’ll send you the business contract soon.”
As soon as these words were uttered, the surrounding people started discussing like crazy. They all knew how profitable pharmaceuticals were on the market, and how rare it was to have an official mandate to sell.
At the thought of this, the parents looked at Qiu Tong with admiration and envy.

chapters.title: Chapter 99 - Send You Home
chapters.content:
Chapter 99: Send You Home
Under the envious gazes of the parents, Qiu Tong led the three children out of the kindergarten.
Qiu Xingyuan gripped the check tightly. After a moment of hesitation, he awkwardly raised his hand and shoved it into Qiu Tong’s hand.
Qiu Tong looked at him in surprise and was about to ask why when she saw him walk to the side of the road. He said with a cold face, “I’m still young and it’s very dangerous to hold on to this sum of money. What if I meet someone like Yu Ge who steals my money?”
“I’ll let you keep this check for me for the time being. I am not giving it to you!”
“You can use it for the time being, but when the need arises, I’ll get it back from you…”
Qiu Xingyuan turned his face away from her.
Qiu Tong suppressed her laughter and rubbed his head. She hugged him and said softly, “Mommy understands. Thank you!”
She understood that he was afraid that she did not have money. It was just that he was not good at expressing his feelings for her.
Qiu Tong could wait. She could wait for the three children to fully trust and depend on her…
She believed that that day would come soon!
Taking advantage of Qiu Xingyuan’s daze, she suddenly leaned over and kissed his cheek!
Qiu Xingyuan widened his eyes in shock and wanted to push Qiu Tong away, but he could not. He could only rub his face in disdain, frowning in humiliation.
Qiu Xingyu looked at her mother and brother and rushed over to hug Qiu Tong’s neck.
“Little Yu wants a kiss too! Mommy can’t be biased!”
Qiu Tong kissed her tenderly and brought Qiu Xingqiao over as well. Everyone was rewarded with a kiss!
The family of four was laughing and playing when Song Yan’s black Mercedes slowly stopped in front of them.
Qiu Tong held the three kids warily and assumed a defensive stance. When Song Yan rolled down the car window, she relaxed a little. “You haven’t left?”
Song Yan smiled, narrowed his eyes and tilted his head. “I was waiting for you guys. Let me send you home!”
Qiu Tong was very familiar with Song Yan, so she herded the children in.
Song Yan gripped the steering wheel. Qiu Tong was surprised to see no sign of Shao An in the car. She asked in confusion, “You are by yourself? Alone?”
“Yes, Shao An has something to do. It’s not convenient to talk about it.”
Song Yan replied perfunctorily.
Qiu Tong recalled how those two men usually interacted with each other and nodded. She did not probe further. She rolled down the window and let the warm wind blow against her face. She was very relaxed.
Compared to her, the three children looked at Song Yan as if they were looking at an enemy. Their small faces were scrunched up!
Their mother had not told him their home address, but Song Yan seemed to have no problem with the route. He knew where their home was!
He seemed to be very familiar with their mother?
Mommy would never be so relaxed in front of anyone!
They must have met many times before!
Were they going to have a stepfather soon?
Qiu Xingyu looked at Qiu Xingyuan nervously. Qiu Xingyuan pursed his lips and stole a glance at Qiu Tong’s face, feeling rather worried.
If she really found a man outside, would she abandon them?
At the instigation of the triplets, Qiu Xingqiao cleared his throat and said, “Who are you? Why were you waiting for Mommy?”
“What’s your relationship with Mommy? How long have you known each other? How did you meet?”
He was an impatient person and did not hold back his curiosity.
Qiu Tong raised an eyebrow and burst out laughing.
Were these children interrogating a criminal?
Song Yan tapped his fingers on the steering wheel as he waited for the traffic light to turn green. Through the rearview mirror, he stared at the three children with their different expressions. If he wanted to drive Jin Yang crazy, he could start by capturing these children!
And he was more skilled at strategizing against children than that brother of his!
He raised his eyebrows and replied gently, “I’ve known your Mommy for a period of time.”
“We met by chance.”
Song Yan casually omitted several key details, without arousing Qiu Tong’s suspicion.
During his time outside, he had already conducted a thorough investigation. Qiu Tong was a single mother and no one around knew who the children’s father was.
Even the children themselves did not know.
In other words… Jin Yang did not know of the existence of these children!
“Our relationship…”
At this point, Song Yan turned his head suggestively to look at Qiu Tong and asked, “Do you want to be like other children, having a father who can play football with you on holidays or accompany you to the amusement park?”
Qiu Tong was surprised by his question.
Qiu Xingyuan sneered at Song Yan. He knew that this man was not harboring any good intentions!
Before Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu could react, he said coldly, “Our father is already dead! We don’t need a father!”
Song Yan stepped on the accelerator and the car drove very steadily. He could tell that the children were very obedient to Qiu Xingyuan. He raised his eyebrows and asked, “What if he’s not dead?”

chapters.title: Chapter 100 - Looking For A Stepfather
chapters.content:
Chapter 100: Looking For A Stepfather
The three children remained silent.
Qiu Xingqiao recalled Little Jin’s nonsense in the kindergarten and complicated thoughts surged in his heart.
Little Jin said that they all looked very similar to this uncle.
Qiu Xingqiao stole a glance at Song Yan’s face and said in a mocking tone, “Uncle, are you trying to say that you’re our biological father?”
Before Song Yan could reply, Qiu Xingyu smartly said, “I know Mommy is very beautiful. We’re also very adorable!”
“But I advise Uncle not to go around acknowledging random children!”
“Previously, there was a scumbag called Yu Ge who wanted to be our father and even tried to extort money from us. He’s currently locked up in jail!”
“Uncle has such a high status. You don’t want to end up like him, right?”
Qiu Xingyu lifted her chin proudly and threatened him. She then secretly high-fived Qiu Xingyuan to celebrate.
“…”
Song Yan was speechless. He sent them home in silence.
At the villa, Qiu Tong went to the bathroom to take a bath.
The three children looked at each other and ran to Qiu Xingyuan’s room. They closed the door and their little heads crowded together as they sat cross-legged on the carpet. The thought of Song Yan put them on high alert!
“Mommy really seems to want a boyfriend… she appears to be very close to that uncle today. It’s very likely that their relationship will develop further.”
“We are already grown up. A beautiful lady like Mommy would definitely have a boyfriend.”
Qiu Xingyu said in frustration.
Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyuan pursed their thin lips and kept silent. They thought of Yu Ge and were afraid that Qiu Tong would fall into the so-called love again and abandon them. Wouldn’t they become pitiful children again?
Qiu Xingyuan seemed to have made an important decision. “She wants to find a man, but I don’t believe in her taste.”
“Why don’t we help her find a man instead? We can help her check those men out!”
Qiu Xingqiao nodded vigorously in agreement. The children once again conspired to marry off Qiu Tong. They even managed to come up with a concrete plan and countermeasures. All the way till it was late into night, they were still gathered together in high spirits…
Qiu Tong suddenly sneezed.
She rubbed her nose with her hands, feeling as if someone was plotting against her. Her back felt cold!
…
Over the weekend, Qiu Tong brought the three children and Ye Luan to the market to sell the locust pesticide.
They passed by a shop selling sugarcakes. Little Yu stared at the white and sticky sugarcakes, unable to move. She licked her lips and swallowed hard!
Qiu Tong immediately bought a few for them to share!
Qiu Xingyuan opened his mouth to take a big bite, but then saw that Qiu Tong didn’t have any cake. He thought that she didn’t buy any for herself because she wanted to save money. He cleared his throat and took a small bite, before awkwardly raising his hand.
“I don’t like sweet things. Here, have some!”
Qiu Tong, “?”
She smiled and pushed the sweetcake back. “Only children love sweet things. Mommy doesn’t.”
Qiu Xingyuan turned his head in a huff and took a big angry bite of the sweetcake, not saying another word.
Humph, so what if she was an adult?
They arranged the stall together and were soon surrounded by a huge crowd.
They were all reporters who had been waiting.
They had received news in advance that Qiu Xingyuan would be coming here to sell locust pesticide. When they saw the family of four, they rushed over with their cameras and microphones to interview Qiu Xingyuan, in order to get first-hand information about this prodigy.
“Little boy, can I interview you? How did you develop the locust pesticide at such a young age?”
“Have you made similar attempts before? Where did you learn this knowledge?”
“Ms. Qiu, do you think your children are considered geniuses?”
Qiu Xingyuan was bombarded by a barrage of questions. He answered them seriously.
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his lips when he thought of the marriage plan for their mother, which he and his siblings came up with yesterday.
Wasn’t this the best opportunity?
If a television station helped them to advertise and promote Qiu Tong…
At the thought of this, Qiu Xingyuan took the initiative to hold Qiu Tong’s hand so that the camera could focus on her face. He praised her as if his mouth was coated with honey. “The only reason I can have my current accomplishments is because Mommy has always encouraged me and helped me a lot…”
“Yes! Our mommy is very beautiful and can cook. Her character is also very… gentle! Her children are also very obedient!”
Qiu Xingyu chimed in to promote Qiu Tong. Her face was flushed red and adorable.
She highlighted the important points. “Mommy is single now. We welcome eligible bachelors to contact us! However, you have to go through us first!”
The three children announced Qiu Tong’s availability for marriage in public. Qiu Tong and the reporters were stunned!
This… this was a live interview!
The live broadcast footage spread to several television stations’ afternoon news. Even high-ranking officials in the capital saw it.
The president’s secretary saw the faces of Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao in the news interview. He spat out the hot tea he had just drunk and his face turned pale.
“Why do these children look exactly like the president?!”
“This won’t do… I have to tell the president immediately!”

chapters.title: Chapter 101 - The Presidents Illegitimate Children
chapters.content:
Chapter 101: The President’s Illegitimate Children
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The living room of the president’s official residence. The president’s secretary ran in anxiously and shouted, “President, something’s wrong!”
Shao An immediately took out his gun and stood in front of Jin Yang. Jin Yang stared at him with a frown and said coldly, “It better be something very important…”
The president’s secretary was so frightened that he swallowed hard. He bent over and picked up the television remote control on the coffee table. He turned on the television and a live broadcast footage appeared on the screen.
Jin Yang was a little surprised to see Qiu Tong. He immediately looked at the secretary in confusion, as if asking, “So?”
“Mr. President, your children are helping their mother find a stepfather…!”
“And they are doing it publicly!”
The camera panned to three adorable little faces. Jin Yang was stunned to see Qiu Xingyuan’s appearance. A numbing sensation spread throughout his limbs. His heart thudded violently and his legs felt like they could no longer hold the weight of his body. He placed his hands on the desk to support himself, his expression slightly solemn.
Shao An looked at the screen and added, “I told you that Miss Qiu’s children look a lot like you.”
“I suggest you attend the award ceremony before returning to S City. You don’t need to…”
Jin Yang felt his mind go blank. Their voices seemed to come from afar and he couldn’t hear them clearly.
His head ached as if it had been hit by a blunt instrument. That familiar image and voice grew further and further away, until Jin Yang could no longer see it clearly.
“Book me a plane ticket. I want to return to S City.”
Jin Yang gripped his glass and drank two large mouthfuls of ice water to calm himself down. He looked up and ordered Shao An coldly.
The secretary and Shao An looked at each other and felt that something was wrong!
If Jin Yang left the residence, all their current arrangements would be disrupted.
Although the secretary understood that the president desperately wanted to see the children, he still quickly took a step forward to persuade him. “Mr. President, the situation is tense and we need you to personally oversee it…”
“If you leave, I’m afraid it will cause chaos in the military. The enemy will find an opportunity to attack us. We might end up in a passive situation!”
“Can we push back the matter in S City a little?”
“I think Miss Qiu will definitely be able to take good care of the children.”
The secretary felt like his heart was about to leap out of his throat. He had taken the risk of being demoted to persuade Jin Yang to calm down.
As the president, he could not prioritize his personal affairs!
“Leave.”
Jin Yang furrowed his brows and waved Shao An and the secretary away. He sat on the sofa and replayed the interview with Qiu Tong and the three children. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s eyebrows were like mini versions of his…
It turned out that Qiu Tong had not said those words to curry favor with him on purpose.
They really looked like him!
But why couldn’t he remember anything about Qiu Tong?
Jin Yang tried his best to recall. The piercing pain in his temples surged again. He raised his hand to press against his rapidly beating heart and panted heavily.
“You’re all here? Did the president see you?”
“Are they really the president’s children?”
Jin Yang stood up. He wanted to pour two glasses of wine to calm himself down. When he reached the door, he heard sounds of discussion coming from outside.
Several high-ranking officials rushed over after seeing the interview. At this moment, they were discussing the relationship between Jin Yang and Qiu Tong!
Jin Yang strode over to the door and gently swirled his wine glass. He leaned against the door and listened to their deliberately lowered voices…
“They look too similar to the President!”
“But our President never had a woman before. He was always busy with government affairs. How could he have an illegitimate child?”
The secretary asked in confusion. The other officials paused and nodded in agreement.
The discussion outside stopped for a while. Someone asked quietly, “Could they be Song Yan’s children?”
“He’s the President’s twin and they look identical! But Song Yan is a Casanova and always has women around him.”
“Those children might be Song Yan’s!”
The high-ranking officials seemed to have found a reasonable explanation as they left the residence together. Their voices grew increasingly distant, but Jin Yang’s expression was extremely grim.
Although he had expected such a possibility…
However, when Jin Yang thought of the image of Song Yan and Qiu Tong together, he felt rather vexed.

chapters.title: Chapter 102 - Locust Plague
chapters.content:
Chapter 102: Locust Plague
In S City Hospital, Song Yan’s ears felt a little itchy. He lowered his head and sneezed. He muttered, “Who’s cursing me behind my back?”
He narrowed his eyes and stared at the laboratory. When he saw the nurse coming out with the test results, he quickly adjusted his stance and went up to her.
Song Yan flipped through the paternity test report anxiously. His gaze landed on the data on the last page. His thin lips curled into a smile.
As expected! The DNA was a 99% match. It was confirmed that the two samples were indeed related!
Song Yan returned to the car and played some upbeat music. He rested his hands on the steering wheel and looked at the test report that he had tossed onto the passenger seat.
He recalled that while he was sending Qiu Tong and the children home, the children’s attitude was very hostile at the mention of their biological father. They also appeared very unfamiliar with him.
Could it be that Qiu Tong had given birth to the children behind Jin Yang’s back?
They had never seen Jin Yang before?!
The smile on Song Yan’s lips grew wider and wider. His eyes shone with excitement. This was a good opportunity for him!
If he could win the favor of Qiu Tong and the children, he would be able to snatch what originally belonged to Jin Yang…
How exciting would Jin Yang’s disappointed, vexed and pained expression be?
Song Yan could not help looking forward to it. He kept the paternity test report and stepped on the accelerator as he left the hospital.
…
At the market, the reporters completed their filming and left with their cameras.
The originally bustling stall returned to silence. Qiu Tong continued to accompany the children in selling the locust pesticide. Although their sales volume had increased, most of the customers who stopped by were here because of Qiu Xingyuan’s reputation as a little genius. They only bought a couple of bottles and did not truly believe that there would be a locust plague.
“Little kid, what books do you usually read? Can you tell Auntie?”
“Auntie also has a little boy around your age. I want him to become as smart as you!”
“Look, I will buy three bottles of locust pesticide from you, alright?”
A woman squatted in front of Qiu Xingyuan and probed him, “Do you attend a tutoring class outside the school?”
Qiu Xingyuan swiftly packed the locust pesticide into a bag and handed it to her. He shook his head and replied, “No.”
The woman did not get the answer she wanted and muttered, “You’re so young but so shrewd. I bought these bottles for nothing!”
“I didn’t manage to get any good information!”
Qiu Tong heard her muttering and saw that she was about to throw the locust pesticide into the trash can. She rushed to her side and stopped her. “Didn’t you buy the pesticide for the locust plague?”
“Why do you care? I’ve already paid!”
“I have the right to do whatever I want with my locust pesticide!”
The woman threw the items in the trash can angrily. She stuck her hands on her hips and turned to look at Qiu Xingyuan. “Who would really believe that there would be a locust plague? Everyone just wants to know how prodigies study.”
Qiu Tong frowned and looked at the crowd who had gathered to watch their argument. She raised her voice and said, “The weather has been changing recently. The crops are growing slowly. There are signs of an impending locust plague. Everyone should buy locust pesticide and use it as soon as possible.”
“We have to prepare for a locust plague. Otherwise, when the locusts arrive and our grain supply is cut off, we will all face famine!”
Qiu Tong’s words elicited laughter from the crowd. The women waved their baskets and said sarcastically, “You really dare to say anything just to sell your locust pesticide! My family has been planting crops in the fields for generations. Why aren’t I seeing the signs that you have claimed?”
“Let’s go, let’s go…”
Qiu Tong’s heart sank when she saw their attitude. She recalled the disasters and zombies that she had experienced in the post-apocalyptic era. She planned to stock up on food first.
She had to ensure the safety of the three children and herself!
Qiu Tong arrived at the largest food stall in the market. From a few steps away, she saw an old man in tattered clothes pushing a cart full of grain to the entrance of the food stall. The shop assistant picked up a few grains of rice with his hands in disdain and placed them between his teeth to chew and taste. He shook his head and said, “The quality is too poor.”
“Even if I accept them, I can only give you this amount!”
“You should sell whatever you can. Get lost if you don’t like my offer. Don’t disturb our business!”
The shop assistant shook two of his fingers. The old man bent over and put his hands together in prayer. “These are all good grains. Take a closer look. The price is really too low. I won’t even earn back the cost of the wheat. Please have mercy…”

chapters.title: Chapter 103 - Locust Plague Rumors
chapters.content:
Chapter 103: Locust Plague Rumors
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The old farmer pleaded in a trembling voice.
Qiu Tong saw that he was wearing a cloth shirt with several patches on it. The straw sandals on his feet had also been patched many times. Feeling a twinge in her heart, she took the initiative to interrupt the shop assistant’s arrogant and hateful words. She placed a hand on the old man’s cart.
“Uncle, your grain looks good. Why don’t you sell it to me?”
“I’ll pay double their price. What do you think?”
The old man looked at Qiu Tong hesitantly, afraid that she was a liar.
The boss of the food stall, Shu Yuanwei, was hiding in the dark and watching. When he realized that Qiu Tong had come out to ruin his plans, he coughed and walked out of the shop. He threatened the old farmer fiercely. “Don’t believe her. There have been swindlers on the market recently…”
“Swindlers? I think you’re the ones who are cheating the farmers, right?”
“You used your monopoly power to maliciously lower the buying price from suppliers, but then turn around and raise the selling price to customers. Doesn’t your conscience prick you when you earn such ill-gotten money from others?”
Qiu Tong rebutted Shu Yuanwei angrily. The surrounding crowd pointed at him and discussed Qiu Tong’s words.
Shu Yuanwei was a little embarrassed, but he quickly put his hands on his hips and scolded Qiu Tong angrily, “What do you know?”
“The grains that the old man pushed over are all old. New grains will be released soon. When the time comes, everyone will definitely buy fresh grains!”
“Whoever buys these old grains will end up on the losing end!”
“We’re businessmen, not charity workers! Do we have to buy whoever looks pitiful at a high price?”
Shu Yuanwei found a lame excuse. Qiu Tong ignored his quibbling and ridicule, taking out some money and handing it to the old farmer.
The old man was so excited that tears welled up in his eyes. He raised his sleeve to wipe the tears from the corners of his eyes and thanked her profusely. “You have done a good deed. You will be rewarded!”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and smiled gently. “You too. Go buy some new clothes and shoes.”
With that, she took out some brand new notes and stuffed them into the farmer’s hands.
Shu Yuanwei looked at her actions and said in disdain, “Idiot, do you really think you’re a living Buddha who saves people from suffering?”
He wanted to turn around and return to the shop in disdain, but one of his shop assistants ran over anxiously from the other end of the street!
The shop assistant pushed through the crowd and stood in front of Shu Yuanwei, raising his hand high. “Boss, look!”
“I found this in a nearby wheat field. It’s a locust larva!”
“There are already many larvae covering the majority of the fields! I’m afraid there will really be a locust plague!”
He was speaking rather loudly. When the crowd who had wanted to leave heard these words, they all stopped in their tracks and surrounded him to look at the larva in his hand.
Everyone’s expression changed and they exchanged looks. “It is indeed a locust larva!”
The news that a locust plague was going to happen spread very quickly with the food stall as the starting point, causing the civilians to panic.
Shu Yuanwei suddenly rushed in front of the shop assistant. He snatched the locust larva and threw it to the ground. He crushed it and cursed, “Idiot!”
They could have suppressed the news of the locusts’ outbreak and secretly purchased grains to raise the price when the plague broke out, so that they could achieve high profits! But this idiot’s words had already spread, and the food stall might not be able to gain any advantage now!
Across the shop, the children’s business suddenly exploded.
“Give me two bottles!”
“Me too! I want 10 bottles!”
News of the locust plague spread very quickly. Many people rushed to Qiu Xingyuan’s stall to buy locust pesticide. The crowd fought over the pesticide and the bottles were rapidly sold out.
Apart from some of the more foolish civilians, most people in the city understood that it was too late to kill the larvae now that they had developed to such a stage.
There was no way to stop a locust plague from erupting. The only thing they could do was stock up on food!
The crowd quickly ran around, trying to buy grains from the farmers. The market price rapidly increased…
There were even some people who saw that Qiu Tong had yet to take the grain cart away, and directly offered three times the price to purchase it.
Qiu Tong raised an eyebrow at the livid Shu Yuanwei and shook her head in refusal.
“How is it? Boss Shu, I don’t think I lost any money. I can still make a small profit.”
“But for you, you’ve been suppressing the buying prices for the farmers and haven’t bought much grain. It would be a little difficult for you to deal with the locust plague now, right?”
Qiu Tong deliberately poured salt over Shu Yuanwei’s wounds.. The situation in the market was a slap in the face for him. He wished he could swallow his earlier words!

chapters.title: Chapter 104 - Counterattack
chapters.content:
Chapter 104: Counterattack
At the food stall, Shu Yuanwei looked at Qiu Tong, who was standing at the entrance. He gritted his teeth and glared at her fiercely, blaming her for all his losses!
Everyone wanted to stock up on food. When they saw Qiu Tong’s cart parked outside, they all asked her how much she was selling it for.
They raised the price to three times that of Qiu Tong’s earlier price.
Shu Yuanwei felt his heart bleed. Qiu Tong comforted the crowd. “These are my personal grains. Sorry, they are not for sale.”
“But if you want to buy grains, there’s still some at the old farmer’s house. I can introduce you to him…”
When Shu Yuanwei heard that his customers were about to leave, he hurriedly shouted and interrupted her. He started a rumor by saying, “Don’t listen to her!”
“She must have known in advance that there would be a locust plague. Otherwise, why would she let her children sell locust pesticide and wantonly buy up old grains?”
“Think about it carefully. Who would research locust pesticide for no reason?”
“In the past few years, the harvests have been very good. There’s no shortage in the food market at all! How did she manage to predict the locust plague in advance?”
When everyone heard Shu Yuanwei’s words, they took a few wavering steps back and maintained a distance from Qiu Tong, as if she was a jinx.
Shu Yuanwei immediately rejoiced and continued to slander Qiu Tong. He pointed at her and said, “She might be the one who created the locust larvae!”
“She is deliberately destroying the grain fields to cause a disaster. She then hoarded food at a low price to sell at a huge profit!”
“This woman is too vicious! Don’t be fooled by her!”
Shu Yuanwei’s words became increasingly outrageous. He even wanted to instigate the crowd to attack her.
Qiu Tong looked at his arrogant manner and rotated her wrist indifferently. She asked in a soft voice, “Did you buy insurance?”
Shu Yuanwei was stunned for a moment. He instinctively nodded and replied, “Of course.”
A smile flashed across Qiu Tong’s eyes as she approached Shu Yuanwei at an extremely fast speed. She grabbed his collar and threw him out. The surrounding crowd was so frightened that they took a few steps back, leaving an empty space.
Shu Yuanwei’s eyes were pitch-black. He was sprawled on the ground with his face facing down. He opened his mouth to curse Qiu Tong. But as he staggered to get up, he saw Qiu Tong’s fist coming at him.
“Thump!”
Shu Yuanwei’s head vibrated painfully. He squatted on the ground with his dark eyes and covered his head as he crouched.
Qiu Tong looked at his sorry state and took out a handkerchief in disdain to wipe the bloodstains on her fingertips. “Boss Shu bought insurance in advance.”
“He must have been asking for a beating today to cheat his insurance, right?”
She was using Shu Yuanwei’s own words against him. His face was ashen, but he could not think of anything to refute.
Qiu Tong did this to point out the error of Shu Yuanwei’s claims. Fortunately, the surrounding people also understood her intentions. They all looked at Shu Yuanwei’s tragic state and burst out laughing.
Shu Yuanwei was so embarrassed that his scalp went numb and his entire body ached.
He propped himself up on the ground, his eyes filled with hatred. He pointed at Qiu Tong and warned, “Don’t run if you have the guts!”
“I have connections with the police. I can let you spend the rest of your life in prison!”
“You have to pay the price for what you’ve done!”
Shu Yuanwei took out his phone and called the police. Qiu Tong stood calmly in place and settled the cart of food, waiting for the police officers to arrive.
The police officer roughly understood the situation at the scene and brought both parties to the police station to make a statement.
Qiu Tong did not resist. Instead, she sat on the bench at the police station and waited for the proceedings.
Shu Yuanwei sneered at her and threatened in a low voice, “Just you wait!”
As soon as he finished speaking, Shu Yuanwei saw Chief Officer Fang walking over from afar. He hurriedly took the initiative to go up to him and politely took out two cigarettes. “You’re so busy, yet I am still troubling you with this. I’m really sorry!”
“I heard that Chief Officer Fang’s daughter did well in her exams? I managed to find two bottles of good wine. I’ll definitely visit her personally to celebrate!”
Shu Yuanwei pretended to be familiar with Chief Officer Fang. Seeing him take the cigarette, he was relieved.
“Chief Officer Fang, look…”
“This woman committed a crime. She acted with the intent of harming another person. I’m covered in injuries. I can go to the hospital for an injury report!”
“Please punish her severely! Teach her a lesson!”

chapters.title: Chapter 105 - Chief Officer Change Sides
chapters.content:
Chapter 105: Chief Officer Change Sides
In the interrogation room of the police station, Qiu Tong sat on a bench in the corridor with her arms crossed. She looked around lazily.
Shu Yuanwei had a close relationship with Chief Officer Fang. Every few months, he would secretly send a few gifts to Chief Officer Fang’s family in exchange for his protection.
When Chief Officer Fang heard Shu Yuanwei’s accusation, he wanted to back him up. However, when his gaze landed on Qiu Tong, he stopped in shock and looked flustered.
Qiu Tong sensed his gaze and smiled with interest. She gave him a slight nod.
Shu Yuanwei noticed the slightly tense air between Qiu Tong and Chief Officer Fang. However, he foolishly thought that it was because Qiu Tong was afraid of Chief Officer Fang, which was why she was smiling.
“Do you see this? This is Chief Officer Fang from the police station. He is going to personally interrogate you. I won’t let go of this matter so easily!”
“You look pitiful and you have to support your children. Why don’t we discuss a private settlement?”
“As long as you agree to kneel down and apologize to me, as well as pay $15,000 to compensate for my hospitalization treatment and emotional trauma! I can consider letting you off. Otherwise, just wait to be jailed! Don’t even think about coming out for the rest of your life!”
Shu Yuanwei pointed in Qiu Tong’s direction and spoke arrogantly with Chief Officer Fang backing him. He did not notice that Chief Officer Fang’s face had turned pale.
Qiu Tong slowly stood up and ignored him. She stared at Chief Officer Fang coldly and asked, “Oh? Is that so?”
The dominant tone in her words made Chief Officer Fang’s legs go weak. He immediately shook his head and said, “No!”
“The police will definitely follow the rules and regulations. They won’t play favorites!”
“Shu Yuanwei, you were the one who provoked Ms. Qiu first. Her actions were in self-defense. There was no mistake.”
“Leave the police station quickly and stop looking for me!”
Chief Officer Fang quickly tried to put some distance between him and Shu Yuanwei. He looked at Qiu Tong politely and ingratiatingly. “I’ll have some police officers to send you and the children back!”
Shu Yuanwei was once again slapped in the face. He did not expect Chief Officer Fang to favor Qiu Tong!
Qiu Tong would never give Chief Officer Fang money or gifts. She must have received his protection because they were romantically involved!
Shu Yuanwei quietly came up with this conjecture. In his shock, he pointed at Qiu Tong and said, “I didn’t expect you to hook up with Chief Officer Fang!’ You’re already the mother of three children, yet you’re still so shameless!”
“I was still wondering how a woman without any background could sell locust pesticide on the market!”
“Looks like you are sleeping around! Why don’t you name a price? I’ll also…”
Shu Yuanwei’s arrogant words shocked Chief Officer Fang so much that he wished he could cover his mouth!
Why was this fellow always causing trouble for him?
Chief Officer Fang looked at Qiu Tong nervously. Her expression had turned extremely grim. She raised her hand to cover Qiu Xingyu’s ears, shielding her from the vulgar accusations.
Qiu Tong looked at Qiu Xingyuan’s watery eyes and said coldly to Qiu Xingyuan, “Take your siblings over there. Don’t turn around!”
Qiu Xingyuan clenched his small fists and gritted his teeth as he glared at Shu Yuanwei.
At the thought of Qiu Tong’s skills, he nodded vigorously and brought Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingqiao over to the wall at the side. He pointed at the list of rules tacked to the wall to distract them.
Qiu Tong rushed in front of Shu Yuanwei and kicked his head. His heavy body fell to the ground with a thud.
Chief Officer Fang could see Qiu Tong’s anger and took out his handcuffs in cooperation. He detained Shu Yuanwei and threw a few punches at his abdomen.
“Ms. Qiu, please come over and make a statement.”
“Shu Yuanwei is suspected of insulting the police and causing trouble. We will punish him with administrative detention. Are you satisfied?”
Chief Officer Fang subserviently accompanied Qiu Tong to the interrogation room. He even thoughtfully poured her a cup of warm tea and spoke to her in a soft voice.
Qiu Tong cooperated with his questions and signed her name on the statement. After leaving the interrogation room, she wanted to bring the children home, but she bumped into Shu Xian, who had come to bail Shu Yuanwei. He generously offered his bail and waited for the police to approve the bail process.
Lin Shan was wearing a revealing tight dress and a vulgar fur coat. She held onto Shu Xian’s arm and whispered sweetly in his ear.
Qiu Tong sized them up but she couldn’t be bothered with them. She just wanted to leave quietly. However, Lin Shan took the initiative to provoke her. “Aiyo, some women really have to go to the police station once every few days!”
“I wonder what kind of criminal activity she is involved in? So what if she’s beautiful?”
“She’s still available for sale!”

chapters.title: Chapter 106 - Robbery On The Way Home
chapters.content:
Chapter 106: Robbery On The Way Home
Qiu Xingqiao’s pitch-black eyes revealed his uncontrollable anger. He clenched his fists tightly, wanting to break free from Qiu Tong’s restraint like a fierce little beast.
“Let go of me! I’m going to tear her apart…”
Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes were bloodshot as he flailed around. No matter what Qiu Tong had done to them before, she was still their mother!
No one could scold or slander her!
Qiu Tong was touched. She hugged Qiu Xingqiao and comforted them gently. “If you encounter a stray dog on the street and it tries to bite you.”
“Do you bite back? Just let it bark as much as it wants!”
Qiu Tong was being deliberately sarcastic, causing Lin Shan’s face to turn ashen. She wanted to retort, but she sensed Shu Xian’s impatient gaze and could only swallow her words. Her hatred for Qiu Tong intensified.
Qiu Tong passed by Lin Shan with the three children. Taking advantage of her distraction, she quietly stretched out her leg and tripped Lin Shan, causing her to stumble and nearly fall.
Lin Shan forgot all about maintaining her image. She turned around and pointed at Qiu Tong. “You only dare to do things in secret. Challenge me face to face if you dare…”
Qiu Tong turned a deaf ear to her provocation. She rubbed the top of Qiu Xingqiao’s head and whispered to him, “Being impulsive is not the way to solve problems.”
“Neither is violence. We can make the smarter choice, right?”
Qiu Xingqiao nodded quickly and broke free from her arms. He ran to Qiu Xingyu’s side and held her hand. The family of four headed towards the market.
At the police station, Shu Xian bailed Shu Yuanwei out and helped him change into a new set of clothes. He asked, “Uncle, what happened?”
As he and Lin Shan looked on, Shu Yuanwei kept cursing Qiu Tong. He spat out especially nasty words and phrases. “That b*tch! I didn’t expect her to be linked to Chief Officer Fang. Not only did she steal my business, she even got me into this wretched state!”
“I must settle my scores with her!”
“Sooner or later, I’ll have that b*tch kowtow to me and admit her mistake. Otherwise, my surname won’t be Shu!”
Lin Shan listened to Shu Yuanwei’s words and turned to look at Chief Officer Fang, who was talking to the police officer. She silently guessed that he was the big shot that Qiu Tong had hooked up with! As long as she could gain Chief Officer Fang’s favor and snatch away Qiu Tong’s sugar daddy, everything she had would be hers!
When the time came, Qiu Tong would have no choice but to obey her every whim.
At the thought of this, Lin Shan was secretly elated as she imagined the future. She looked at Chief Officer Fang and her fiery red lips curled up.
Qiu Tong brought the children back to the market and looked at the old farmer’s cart full of grains. She wanted to move them back herself.
“I’ll help Mommy!”
“Me too!”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao pushed the cart while Qiu Xingyu sat on it, solemnly holding all the bags of grains together so that not even a grain of rice would fall off!
Qiu Tong watched as Qiu Xingyuan awkwardly shifted his gaze away, but refused to let her push the car. Her heart warmed.
The family of four pushed the cart into an alley not far from the grain shop. Suddenly, a few burly gangsters appeared from afar and looked at them with ferocious expressions.
The gangsters whistled and patted the wooden sticks in their hands. They looked at Qiu Tong and the three children and shouted in a hoarse voice, “Leave the grain behind and we’ll let you live!”
“Don’t blame us for being ruthless. We were paid to do this!”
“Blame yourselves for offending someone you shouldn’t have!”
The gangsters did not hide anything. They revealed that it was Shu Yuanwei who hired them.
When Shu Yuanwei came out of the police station, he felt that things were not going well for him. He knew that Qiu Tong would definitely find a way to move the grains back, so he thought of hiring thugs to teach her a lesson.
Qiu Tong looked at them and rotated her wrist calmly. She said in a clear voice, “How long are you going to just stand there and watch?”
“Do I have to deal with them myself?”
Ke Le and the others walked out from a corner. They scratched their heads and smiled foolishly. “Boss, we think they’re too weak.”
“They are not worth it at all!”
The smile in Ke Le’s eyes faded when he turned to look at the gangsters. What replaced it was a thick murderous aura. The mercenaries surrounded the gangsters, their movements agile as their punches landed heavily upon them!
The gangsters had no chance of fighting back at all. They hugged their heads and fled in all directions.

chapters.title: Chapter 107 - M78 Sniper Rifle
chapters.content:
Chapter 107: M78 Sniper Rifle
Qiu Tong watched as the hooligans fled. She turned back and stared at the cart of grains. After some thought, she asked Ke Le, “Is there any hiding place nearby?”
Ke Le pointed at the corner of the street and said, “There’s a straw shed in front. No one usually passes through it. It’s very safe!”
Qiu Tong nodded and gestured for the mercenaries to help move the cart of grains to the straw shed.
She sensed Ke Le’s confusion and explained softly, “All the food in the market has been snatched away…”
“Food is the most sought after thing. What we have will definitely attract the covetous eyes of others!”
“Not only Shu Yuanwei, there might also be others!”
The experience of surviving in the post-apocalyptic era made Qiu Tong realize that she could no longer openly transport the grains home. She hid the grains under some hay and patted Qiu Xingyuan’s head as she instructed, “You take care of your younger siblings, Ke Le will also protect you and the grains!”
“Mommy will come back to move the stuff home with you guys when it gets dark!”
With that, Qiu Tong sped towards the black market. She planned to use the money she had to purchase some guns and ammunition.
It was only a matter of time before the locust plague broke out. At that time, refugees would surge through the streets and they would be extremely hungry. It was very likely that they would do something extreme and cause riots. The image of the post-apocalyptic era surfaced in Qiu Tong’s mind. She frowned and quickened her pace…
Qiu Tong was the mother of three children now. She needed a gun for self-defense and be fully prepared to deal with the danger.
…
In the black market, Qiu Tong scanned every stall with her sharp eyes. She saw a few guns hidden under some fruits and asked for their price.
Be it guns, ammunition, poison powder, or information, as long as you had enough money in your pockets, you could buy whatever you wanted in the black market.
Qiu Tong wandered through a few stalls but did not find any firearms that she liked. She was disappointed and decided to head back first.
Before she left, she inadvertently glanced at an inconspicuous stall in the corner and realized that there was a gun barrel peeking out from under a coarse cloth.
It was… a M78 sniper rifle?
Qiu Tong couldn’t hardly conceal her joy as she walked to the stall. She reached out to pick up the sniper rifle to test its accuracy, but unexpectedly, a hand appeared and grabbed the head of the sniper rifle at the same time as her. That hand looked like it was fighting her for it.
Qiu Tong frowned and saw a tall, thin man beside her. He sized her up with a look of disdain.
“You’re a woman. If you want to protect yourself, buy some poison powder. Don’t buy firearms that you don’t know how to use.”
Yin Hai looked at her mockingly and wanted to snatch the sniper rifle away, but he realized that Qiu Tong’s grip was very strong. The two of them stood in front of the stall.
“Do you know how to use a sniper rifle?”
“If you buy this thing, it will be just for show. But if you’re willing to let me have it, I can give you some money…”
Qiu Tong was very disgusted by Yin Hai’s attitude of using money to suppress others. The corners of her lips curled up and her eyes turned cold as she rotated her wrist. Taking advantage of Yin Hai’s relaxed attitude, she snatched the sniper rifle. She removed the bullets and adjusted the aim.
“There is a longitudinal groove on the surface of this M78 sniper rifle. It increases the shooting range on the original foundation. At the same time, it also disperses heat better.”
“The trigger pull is 3.3 pounds which makes the shooting smooth and easy. Mercenaries from overseas often use this type of sniper rifle.”
“However, the greatest advantage of this sniper rifle is that its barrel has been modified. Not only can it load more bullets, it can also be modified into a submachine gun with a short range and high frequency when necessary. How about that? Are you still questioning if I know how to use it?”
Qiu Tong’s voice was soft as she described the gun. Yin Hai’s pupils dilated in shock. He could not believe that a woman knew so much about the M78 sniper rifle.
“Don’t look down on any people you don’t know. Otherwise… you might end up losing your life to them!”
Qiu Tong’s voice held a warning tone. As soon as she finished speaking, she raised the sniper rifle and aimed it at the space between Yin Hai’s brows. She gently placed her finger on the trigger, ready to take his life at any moment.
Qiu Tong’s cold eyes appeared behind the weapon’s eyepiece. Yin Hai was so scared he did not dare to move.
The atmosphere was so tense that no one dared to breathe. In the Mercedes-Benz car parked in front of the black market, Song Yan had been staring at Qiu Tong and Yin Hai. It was only now that he pushed open the door and walked out.
He met Qiu Tong’s gaze and shouted, “Yin Hai! Move away!”

chapters.title: Chapter 108 - Coincidental Encounter in the Black Market
chapters.content:
Chapter 108: Coincidental Encounter in the Black Market
Qiu Tong saw Song Yan appear in the black market. She raised her eyebrows in surprise and put down the sniper rifle.
Yin Hai respectfully retreated to Song Yan’s left side. He stood straight and reported to him with a vexed expression, “I’m sorry, I couldn’t help you get that M78 sniper rifle. Please punish me, I hold full responsibility.”
Song Yan waved his hand, indicating for Yin Hai to be quiet and not say anything else. He stared at Qiu Tong with interest.
This woman actually had some understanding of firearms and was skilled at using them. Could this be the reason why she could attract Jin Yang?
Song Yan’s interest in Qiu Tong deepened. He mimicked Jin Yang’s unique cold tone and said, “I didn’t expect you to like sniper rifles too?”
“I appreciate all fine things.”
Qiu Tong sized up Yin Hai with a smile and said bluntly, “Your new bodyguard is not as smart as Shao An.”
“If he underestimates his opponent like this, he might easily fall for schemes. I advise you to add a few more guards so that you can ensure your safety.”
Qiu Tong’s kind reminder stunned Yin Hai for a moment. He hated it when others compared him to Shao An, so he instinctively retorted, “You have got it wrong.”
“Shao An is the Presi…” Before he could finish his sentence, Song Yan stopped Yin Hai with a look. He immediately shut up and stood behind with his head lowered.
Song Yan shrugged and explained half-heartedly, “Shao An has other tasks to do.”
Qiu Tong nodded slightly, not interested in pursuing their current situation.
She just wanted to end the small talk as soon as possible and buy a batch of firearms before going back to find Qiu Xingyuan and the rest to carry the grains back!
Qiu Tong looked up at the darkening sky, a hint of impatience on her face.
Song Yan shifted his gaze and stood in front of Qiu Tong. He deliberately put on a troubled expression as he stared at the sniper rifle in her hand. “I will definitely let you have it now that I know that you like it. But…”
“As you can see, public security has been very chaotic recently. I came to the black market to buy a gun for self-defense.”
“If I let you have this sniper rifle, I will be in a dangerous situation. Shao An is away carrying out other missions… and you’ve seen Yin Hai’s skills!”
“I’m afraid that if someone tries to attack me, Yin Hai wouldn’t be able to detect it immediately…”
Song Yan said this right in front of Yin Hai. But the latter did not dare to speak up or even show any anger. He could only endure it and continue to listen to Song Yan coaxing Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong frowned and narrowed her eyes warily. “So, you still want to snatch this M78 from me?”
Song Yan stuck one hand in his pocket and waved his hand in denial. “I just wanted to ask you if you could take me in for a night?”
He saw surprise in Qiu Tong’s eyes. He added, “It’s very dangerous for me to be outside.”
“I’ll give you this gun in exchange for protecting me for a night. What do you think? It should be a fair and cost-effective deal, right?”
Yin Hai did not expect Song Yan to make such an outrageous request. He looked at Qiu Tong in shock, quietly speculating about their relationship.
Qiu Tong pondered deeply.
It was true that she and Yin Hai had their eyes on this sniper rifle at the same time. She was quite well-acquainted with Song Yan, and taking him in for a night was actually not too difficult nor outrageous.
Qiu Tong pointed at Yin Hai and asked, “Is he going to stay with us too?”
Song Yan turned to look at him. He smiled and said teasingly, “I will be living in your house and will be under your rules. Of course, I’ll follow your arrangements. If you find it inconvenient, you can also let him stay outside to guard the house. It’s fine.”
Qiu Tong counted the rooms in the villa. There were still a few empty rooms. She took out some money and bought a few sniper rifles and two boxes of bullets. “Let’s go.”
Song Yan drove Qiu Tong to the straw shed in the alley. As soon as she got out of the car, Qiu Xingyu ran over and hugged her waist. She said coquettishly, “Mommy, why are you back so late? It’s already dark!”
Qiu Tong rubbed the top of her head and called Ke Le to move all the grains into Song Yan’s trunk.
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his thin lips and looked at Song Yan with hostility. The children also stood in a row as if they were facing a formidable enemy. They frowned and said, “Why is this uncle with Mommy?”
Qiu Tong looked at Song Yan and explained calmly, “This uncle will be staying at our house for tonight.”
“What?!”
Qiu Xingqiao cried out in alarm, his eyes filled with disbelief.
Qiu Xingyuan looked at Qiu Tong with disappointment. Had this woman fallen into the river of love again and become a lovesick fool?

chapters.title: Chapter 109 - Prank
chapters.content:
Chapter 109: Prank
The night was dark. Qiu Tong instructed Ke Le and the mercenaries to carry the grains.
Song Yan saw her carrying a few bags of grains on her own. She was wiping the sweat off her face with her hand. His heart skipped a beat as he walked to her side to help.
Qiu Tong looked at him in surprise, then nodded slightly to express her gratitude.
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his thin lips, his small face filled with coldness as he stared at their backs, which looked exceptionally intimate together. He frowned as he observed.
Qiu Xingqiao pricked up his ears, wanting to eavesdrop on what Song Yan was saying to Qiu Tong. He quietly approached but accidentally stepped on a dead branch on the ground. The noise attracted Qiu Tong’s attention. She instinctively turned around and asked, “What’s wrong?”
“Stay there obediently and don’t move around!”
Qiu Tong instructed. When she saw Song Yan lifting a few bags of grains, she rushed over to help him.
Qiu Xingyu pouted and tugged at Qiu Xingyuan’s sleeve uneasily. “Eldest Brother, Mommy seems to really like that uncle!”
“What should we do? This uncle is getting so close to Mommy!”
The memory of Yu Ge remained like a shadow in the hearts of the children!
Qiu Xingyuan did not believe that Qiu Tong would choose her children over her boyfriend. His eyes flickered as he summoned Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu.
The three children gathered their heads together and secretly discussed their plan…
They had to chase Song Yan away!
…
At the villa, Qiu Tong placed the grains in the warehouse and brought Song Yan to the living room.
She turned around and saw Ke Le and the mercenaries sitting on the floor, exhausted from carrying the bags. She opened the refrigerator and rummaged through the simple ingredients. “Take a break. I’ll make something to eat!”
Song Yan hung his jacket on the clothes rack by the entrance and walked to the kitchen door. He asked, “Do you need my help?”
Qiu Tong shook her head and quickly heated up some oil. She pointed at the living room and said, “You can rest.”
“It’s safe here. Ke Le and Yin Hai are guarding outside. Don’t worry.”
Song Yan smiled faintly and returned to the living room to sit on the sofa. His gaze landed on the children whispering in the corner.
Qiu Xingyu stood on her tiptoes and picked up the box of biscuits. Trying to cover her actions with her small body, she clumsily pried open two halves of a biscuit.
Qiu Xingyuan rummaged through some cupboards and found some hot mustard. He squeezed out a long strip and smeared it on the biscuit before putting the two halves back together again.
Hmph! This would definitely make him cry!
Qiu Xingqiao stared at Song Yan with burning eyes. He clenched his small fists and muttered, “He better leave on his own!”
Qiu Xingyu walked over to Song Yan with small steps, her eyes fixed on the “mustard bomb”. She held out the box of biscuits to Song Yan. She said in a cute voice, “Uncle, I’ll treat you to some snacks…”
Song Yan saw through everything but did not expose her. He pointed at the television which was showing a cartoon and said, “Thank you.”
“Why don’t you sit here and we can eat together?”
Qiu Xingyu did not expect him to say that. Stunned, she turned around to look at her brother for help.
Song Yan took advantage of her distracted state to exchange the biscuits. He picked up one of the normal biscuits and opened his mouth to eat it.
Qiu Xingqiao did not see his actions but walked over to Song Yan expectantly.
He was already prepared to laugh at Song Yan’s pathetic state and embarrass him in front of Qiu Tong!
But after waiting for two minutes, there was nothing unusual with Song Yan.
Qiu Xingyu walked to Qiu Xingyu’s side in confusion. He tentatively picked up a biscuit and placed it in his mouth…
What happened? They clearly put the mustard inside!
Song Yan supported his chin with his fingers and watched with interest as Qiu Xingqiao picked up the biscuit. The smile on his lips widened.
“Ah!!”
Qiu Xingqiao’s expression changed. The mustard was so spicy that his tongue went numb. He covered his mouth and searched for milk or ice water in the living room.
Song Yan pretended to be concerned and asked, “Are you alright?”
He had stopped playing such lousy pranks since he was young!
These children wanted to play pranks on him? They were still too inexperienced!
Qiu Xingyuan shielded Qiu Xingqiao by his side and glared at Song Yan with furrowed brows. The two of them faced off.
Qiu Tong heard sounds in the kitchen and stuck her head out to ask, “What’s wrong?”
“Nothing!”
“We’re playing a game…”
Qiu Xingyuan and Song Yan answered at the same time. Qiu Tong was a little puzzled and called everyone to the dining room. “Let’s eat!”

chapters.title: Chapter 110 - Fighting For Affection
chapters.content:
Chapter 110: Fighting For Affection
At the dining table, Qiu Xingqiao was drinking from a milk bottle, his face covered in sweat.
Qiu Xingyuan stared at Song Yan unhappily. However, Song Yan acted as if nothing had happened and took the initiative to pick up two small ribs and place them in Qiu Tong’s bowl.
Song Yan looked at Qiu Tong tenderly and said affectionately, “You’ve worked hard today. Eat more.”
The three children stared at the two ribs in shock!’
He actually wanted to use this method to win over Mommy?!
Qiu Xingyuan immediately put down his chopsticks. Little Yu pondered for a moment before kicking Qiu Xingqiao under the dining table. She picked up two pork slices and piled them in Qiu Tong’s bowl. “Mommy!”
“You usually like this type of meat the most. Try it!”
Qiu Xingqiao understood her intention. He picked up the entire dish and poured everything into Qiu Tong’s bowl. “Mommy, eat more!”
Qiu Tong looked grimly at her rice bowl which was piled with food.
The children’s sudden love for her was a little intense. She could not handle it!
Song Yan looked at the children in amusement. They seemed to be very possessive of Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong buried her head in her rice, acutely sensing that the surrounding atmosphere was a little off.
On the television screen in the living room, the cartoon ended and the news segment was replaying a reel where Jin Yang was answering the reporters’ questions…
Qiu Tong heard a familiar voice and turned to look at the man standing in front of the camera in a suit, as he answered the reporter’s tricky questions calmly.
Jin Yang occasionally pushed up the frames of his gold-colored glasses as he stared into the camera. He lifted his hand to loosen his bow tie.
Qiu Tong’s hand paused as she stared at him, forgetting to chew the food in her mouth.
Jin Yang’s eyes were filled with indifference. “I hope that people from all walks of life won’t spread rumors.”
Qiu Tong stared at his actions and expression, momentarily stunned and dazed. She felt her heart skip a beat.
Why did his mannerisms feel so familiar?
She seemed to have seen him somewhere before!
Song Yan frowned and deliberately cleared his throat to snap her out of her trance.
Song Yan waved his hand playfully in front of Qiu Tong and asked with a mischievous look, “Why? Do you think he’s not bad?”
“Be it status or looks, he’s indeed not bad. It’s normal for you to like him…”
Song Yan probed, but a trace of gloominess flashed across Qiu Tong’s eyes. She lowered her head and ate two mouthfuls of rice. She said in a daze, “No.”
“The President and I belong to two different worlds. I was just paying attention to what he was saying.”
Qiu Tong thought of Song Yan and Jin Yang’s relationship and stopped talking. She didn’t want to talk about the president too much in front of him, afraid that he would be unhappy.
Friends should be wary of each other’s emotions.
Song Yan raised his eyebrows slightly, but he could not control the smile on his face. His eyes were filled with mockery and joy.
Jin Yang had shot himself in the foot!
Jin Yang had secretly used his name to fool women outside. Now, his trick had backfired and completely cut off all possibility between him and Qiu Tong!
Song Yan stared at the face on the television, wishing he could immediately let Jin Yang hear Qiu Tong’s reply…
Jin Yang’s expression would definitely be very interesting!
As the night wore on, Qiu Xingyu and Qiu Xingqiao took the initiative to clear the dishes. The three children then sat in the living room with Song Yan.
Qiu Tong looked at them awkwardly, secretly wondering how to allocate the rooms.
“Eldest Brother, if Uncle and Mommy live together, will we have other younger siblings?”
“Will Mommy not care about us anymore?!”
Qiu Xingyu leaned nervously beside Qiu Xingyuan and whispered into his ear.
The three children thought of what might happen in the future and their expressions changed.
No! They had to think of a way to snatch Mommy back. They couldn’t give Song Yan any chances!
Qiu Xingyu hugged Qiu Tong’s waist and said coquettishly, “Mommy, can I sleep with you tonight?”
“I’m afraid of the dark! I can’t sleep at night…”
Qiu Xingqiao’s expression was conflicted, but he quickly nodded stiffly in agreement. “I can hear dripping sounds in my room these few days!”
“There might be rats somewhere! You have to help me catch them!”
Qiu Tong looked at Qiu Xingyuan in surprise, as if waiting for him to speak up too.
Qiu Xingyuan looked away and played with a button on his shirt. “I can sleep in the same room with you too.”
What an unexpected turn of events!
Qiu Tong tilted her head and thought to herself, The children usually kept their distance from her, but now, they were asking to sleep in the same room with her?
This change was a little too sudden!

chapters.title: Chapter 111 - Factory Production
chapters.content:
Chapter 111: Factory Production
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“Alright, Little Yu can sleep with Mommy!”
