Qiu Tong carried Qiu Xingyu and turned to look at Song Yan. She pointed at a bedroom indicating that he should sleep there tonight. “If you need anything, you can look for me anytime.”
Song Yan nodded and bid her goodnight before gently pushing open the bedroom door.
In the room, two small night lamps emitted a faint yellow light. There were a few furry dolls on the bed.
Qiu Xingyuan’s medal and certificate from the kindergarten were framed and hung in the most conspicuous place.
Although the room was not very spacious, it was filled with a warm atmosphere.
Song Yan was suddenly vexed. He thought of the possibility that Jin Yang would have such a blissful family life, and a desire to destroy everything arose in his heart. He took out an item the size of a button from his pocket and casually stuck it in a corner, his eyes dark.
Click—
Song Yan pushed open the door to the villa. Yin Hai was already waiting outside. He turned his head and stared at the lights in the villa before leaving without looking back.
The next morning, Qiu Tong came out of her room rubbing her sleepy eyes and saw a stack of cash on the coffee table in the living room.
She walked closer in surprise and saw the note beside the stack of cash. She looked at Song Yan’s slightly illegible handwriting. “Thank you for taking me in.”
He was so polite!
Qiu Tong kept the cash. Hearing hurried footsteps, she turned around and saw Qiu Xingyuan running out of the room in his pajamas.
Worry and anxiety flashed across his eyes. When he saw Qiu Tong’s figure, Qiu Xingyuan heaved a sigh of relief.
This woman didn’t leave with Song Yan?
The two of them stood facing each other. Qiu Tong was about to ask if he was hungry when she heard the doorbell ring.
Qiu Tong pushed open the door and saw Mayor Shen standing outside with a gift box in both hands. He looked a little uneasy. “Miss Qiu, I’m sorry to disturb you!”
“It’s alright, come in and talk.”
Qiu Tong was slightly surprised and turned to let Mayor Shen into the house. She poured him a cup of warm tea and asked curiously, “What’s the matter?”
Mayor Shen stole a glance at Qiu Xingyuan, who was sitting on the sofa. He rubbed his teacup nervously with his fingers and stammered, “You should know that the locusts in the nearby wheat fields are already showing signs of increasing exponentially. The number of locusts in every wheat field is already reaching an uncontrollable level!”
“Our factory is rushing to produce locust pesticide.”
“But the staff we hired at the last minute are not very skilled in mixing the chemicals. I would like to invite Miss Qiu to bring Qiu Xingyuan to the factory to guide them.”
“This might help us and the farmers get rid of the locust plague as soon as possible.”
Qiu Tong looked at Qiu Xingyuan. Since he was the one being invited to the factory, she naturally had to seek his opinion.
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his thin lips like a little adult. This was the first time he had developed the locust pesticide, so he also wanted to see how the factory produced it. He nodded. “Sure. I’ll go with you…”
“Thank you!”
Mayor Shen was very courteous. He immediately instructed the driver to get ready and rushed Qiu Tong and Qiu Xingyuan to the factory.
After going through several rounds of disinfection, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Tong entered the factory accompanied by Mayor Shen. They saw dozens of staff dressed in protective clothing mixing the chemicals. Their movements were not that standardized, but they were very fast.
Qiu Xingyuan walked to their side and looked at the mixing process seriously. When his gaze landed on a certain spot, he frowned and stopped the employee. He said in a clear young voice, “You didn’t mix according to the proper ratio!”
“You can increase your speed by mixing the chemicals without measuring properly, but the effectiveness of the pesticide will be impacted!”
The employee lowered his head to look at Qiu Xingyuan. Although he did not think that a young child would understand these things, he still explained on behalf of Mayor Shen. “Currently, locust numbers are growing and reproducing exponentially. There’s no other way to increase our speed. We can afford to wait, but not the crops!”
“Are we going to just sit by and watch as the farmers suffer?”
The employee choked as he explained to Qiu Xingyuan. Qiu Xingyuan recalled the plot of land he had passed by and lowered his eyes in thought.
Although the chemicals were not being mixed to exact measurements, and this would weaken the effects of the pesticide, as long as the dosage reached a certain level, the pesticide produced would still suppress the growth of the locusts. It should not be a major problem.
Qiu Xingyuan lowered his small hands and walked back to Mayor Shen’s side. He said calmly, “This will do.”
“As long as the proportions of the chemical ingredients are not too far off from the recipe, you can continue to produce them according to the current process.”

chapters.title: Chapter 112 - Allergic Reaction
chapters.content:
Chapter 112: Allergic Reaction
A few days later, the first batch of locust pesticide was prepared by the factory. Mayor Shen specially sent someone to deliver a few boxes to Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong looked at the box seriously and recalled the difficulties that Qiu Xingyuan faced when he was developing the locust pesticide. This was his hard work.
As his mother, she should show her support!
At the thought of this, Qiu Tong asked Ke Le and the others to move a few boxes of the locust pesticide to the entrance of the kindergarten. They set up a simple stall and wrote the words “Free locust pesticide” on a board.
The news of the free locust pesticide spread very quickly. Many parents and others gathered at the entrance of the kindergarten.
When the pharmaceutical supervisor heard the news, he quickly drove over to help Qiu Tong. In just half a day, he had already given away most of the locust pesticide.
Ding Ding Ding—
The kindergarten’s school bell rang. Qiu Xingyuan walked out of the school with his school bag. He was a little surprised to see Qiu Tong, but he quickly concealed his emotions. He held Qiu Xingyu’s hand and walked to Qiu Tong’s side. He muttered, “How embarrassing!”
Qiu Tong rubbed the top of his head and said with gentle eyes, “Look, the pesticide that Qiu Xingyuan developed has helped many people!”
A hint of pride appeared in Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes. Little Yu took the initiative to help Qiu Tong give away the pesticide by shouting out to the crowd. But her soft, childish voice was quickly drowned out by the surrounding bustle…
Two burly men pushed their way through the crowd and looked at Qiu Tong with fierce eyes. They asked in a hoarse voice, “Did you make the locust pesticide?”
“There’s a problem with the pesticide distributed here! Everyone, don’t take it. When we went back to spray it, our bodies showed signs of an allergic reaction!”
“My elder brother’s arms are covered in red spots. He has been sent to the hospital!”
“They are swindlers! These pesticides are useless against locusts. Don’t be fooled by them!”
The burly men shouted and tried to overturn Qiu Tong’s stall, but Ke Le and the others quickly stood up to protect her.
The appearance of the burly men made the crowd hesitate. They looked down at the locust pesticide in their hands and were hesitant to bring it home.
Qiu Tong sized them up with a frown. She guessed that these people were looking for trouble. She asked in an annoyed tone, “What evidence do you have?”
One of the burly men immediately raised his arms and rolled up his sleeves, revealing patches of red spots on his skin. He even waved them around for the surrounding crowd to see.
“I am the evidence!”
“We have these red spots on our bodies. It must be the locust pesticide. Since you are the ones who made it, you have to take responsibility.”
“You have to compensate me for the hospitalization fees, my loss of working time and any follow-up treatment fees!”
The red marks on the burly man’s arm were obvious. The onlookers, who had been initially hesitant, quickly threw away the locust pesticide in their hands and criticized Qiu Tong and Qiu Xingyuan. “I was wondering why a perfectly fine pesticide would be given away for free. So it’s poison!”
“Take this pesticide back. Instead of eliminating the locusts, we fell sick!”
“How can a kindergarten child understand chemicals? They must have colluded with others to cheat money!”
When Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyu saw that their brother was being bullied, they hurriedly stood in front of the crowd with their hands on their hips and spoke up for him, “Our eldest brother is amazing. The locust pesticide he made will definitely be fine!”
“Yes, you are the ones who don’t know how to use it. Why are you blaming Eldest Brother?”
Qiu Xingyu pouted, her eyes brimming with tears.
The onlookers did not buy their explanation. They clamored for the adult-in-charge to step forward and explain.
“Calm down! We’re all here and we won’t just disappear. What are you guys fussing about?”
“You scared my children. I want an explanation from you too!”
Qiu Tong squatted down worriedly and wiped Qiu Xingyu’s tears. She hugged her and patted her back as she spoke coldly.
She could almost confirm that these burly men were just here to stir up trouble. Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes, wanting to settle this with force.
However, Qiu Xingyuan did not say a word. He walked to the pesticide on display and picked up two new bottles. He unscrewed the bottle cap and took some pesticide and smeared it on his own arm. Qiu Tong saw his actions and said nervously, “Qiu Xingyuan, what are you doing?”
The crowd was shocked by Qiu Xingyuan’s actions and stared at him.
One second, two seconds… two minutes passed. As expected, Qiu Xingyuan’s arm broke out in red spots, indicating an allergic reaction.

chapters.title: Chapter 113 - Blame and Rebuke
chapters.content:
Chapter 113: Blame and Rebuke
When the surrounding crowd saw that red spots had also appeared on Qiu Xingyuan’s body, they instantly erupted.
“Look! We are seeing it with our own eyes. There must be something wrong with the pesticide!”
“What other explanation do you have? Hurry up and recall your locust pesticide and compensate us!”
The burly men and the rest of the crowd pressured Qiu Tong and Qiu Xingyuan. Qiu Tong’s expression darkened. She had seen Qiu Xingyuan’s original formula with her own eyes. There was no ingredient that could cause allergic reactions! What went wrong?
Qiu Xingyuan saw a familiar face in the crowd. The pharmaceutical supervisor hid in the crowd in a panic and even took two steps back.
Qiu Xingyuan stared at his slightly flustered expression and asked with furrowed brows, “After I left the factory, did you further simplify the process again?”
“Did you do away with some necessary steps in the process of making the pesticides in order to speed things up?”
Qiu Xingyuan had come up with the crux of the problem. The crowd stared at the pharmaceutical supervisor in unison, waiting for his answer.
The pharmaceutical supervisor clenched his fists nervously, his lips pale. He instinctively denied, “No, we made it according to the process!”
“There’s clearly something wrong with your pesticide formula. Why are you pushing the blame on us?”
“It’s impossible to simplify the production process of the factory’s assembly line. Anyway, all the modifications have been approved by you!”
“Don’t try to change the topic! This has nothing to do with the factory!”
Qiu Tong could tell that something was wrong from the pharmaceutical supervisor’s expression. She shielded Qiu Xingyuan behind her and interrogated, “Since you said that there’s no problem with the factory’s production process, I am sure you are willing to get all the staff to come here now?”
“We can verify everything face-to-face.”
“Besides, there are surveillance cameras in the factories. We can take a look to see what went wrong!”
“As long as there is concrete evidence pointing to us, we will definitely take responsibility!”
The pharmaceutical supervisor did not expect Qiu Tong to be so domineering. His temples were throbbing and his palms were sweating. He immediately tried to rouse the crowd by pointing at Qiu Tong. “How can I show you the surveillance footage of the factory?”
“You guys have powerful connections backing you. Even if there’s a problem, you can settle it secretly. Even with the video footage, what can it prove?”
“In the end, the victims are still these innocent civilians…”
The pharmaceutical supervisor’s words once again stirred up a commotion. The parents of the students who were already jealous of Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Tong stepped forward and muttered, “Didn’t they say that the Mayor’s personal commendation was just for show! This pesticide might not have been developed by Qiu Xingyuan.”
“He has always been a quiet child. He is solitary and has strange manners.”
“I heard that Qiu Tong has been very close to Mayor Shen and a few of the higher-ups. I have friends who have seen her entering and leaving high-end villas!”
“This is not something a bunch of commoners like us can talk about. There must be something going on behind the scenes!”
Their discussion had changed from blaming Qiu Xingyuan and the locust pesticide to a personal attack on Qiu Tong’s family.
Those words became increasingly harsh.
Qiu Xingyuan bit his thin lips tightly, and the taste of blood spread in his mouth. He listened to the accusations and slander, which were all without any evidence. But he knew in his heart that it must be because someone had arbitrarily adjusted the ratio of the pesticide to speed things up, resulting in the current allergic reaction.
However, he had no evidence. Meanwhile, the crowd was clamoring for justice.
Qiu Xingyuan’s face was pale as if there was an iceberg engulfing him. He said, “I will take responsibility for the locust pesticide.”
His words indirectly admitted that he was the cause of the allergic reactions.
The crowd became very agitated. It was unknown who took the lead, but they actually pushed and pulled at Qiu Xingyuan. They scolded, “How are you going to take responsibility? There are locusts everywhere in the wheat field, and the locust pesticide is useless. We can’t buy any food!”
“We’re going to starve to death. How are you going to take responsibility? Are you going to give us food?”
“Yes, get the Qiu family to compensate!”
Qiu Xingyuan stood motionless in the middle of the crowd. His small face was stubborn, but his body was swaying, and his forehead was nearly bruised from all the jostling.
Qiu Tong grabbed Qiu Xingyu and Qiu Xingqiao and stuffed them into Ke Le’s arms to protect them. She quickly ran to Qiu Xingyuan’s side and protected his small body in her arms…

chapters.title: Chapter 114 - Protective Apparatus
chapters.content:
Chapter 114: Protective Apparatus
The commotion in the kindergarten was too great. When Chief Officer Fang received the news, he was so shocked that he immediately rushed over to maintain order.
The police officers drove the rioting crowd away with their shields and protected Qiu Tong and the children. Chief Officer Fang asked nervously, “Are you alright? Do you want me to escort you back? The situation here is a little complicated. Let us handle it…”
Chief Officer Fang tried his best to lower his voice, but the surrounding crowd still heard their conversation. They immediately shouted at the top of their lungs.
“Did you see that?! The Qiu family is linked to the higher-ups. The locust pesticide problem hasn’t been resolved yet, and they’re leaving?”
“We can’t let them go! The Qiu family must compensate us, or we’ll go to their house and block them!”
The noisy crowd tugged at Chief Officer Fang’s clothes agitatedly, asking for an explanation. As they argued, they ended up scratching his arm.
Chief Officer Fang gasped in pain and frantically pulled the police officers over to maintain order.
Such actions made the crowd resist even more. It developed into a riot.
Qiu Xingyu was so frightened that tears welled up in her eyes. Qiu Xingqiao held her hand tightly and comforted her, “Don’t be afraid. Close your eyes, things will be fine soon.”
Qiu Xingyu closed her eyes obediently. Qiu Xingqiao frowned and stared at Qiu Tong. He did not know why he was hoping that she could solve the tricky situation!
Outside the crowd, Lin Shan crossed her arms and hid in a corner to observe the situation…
She had come with Chief Officer Fang to see Qiu Tong make a fool of herself. She had no intention of interfering.
However, now that things had come to this, a scheming glint flashed across Lin Shan’s eyes. She took the initiative to walk out and attracted the attention of the crowd.
She deliberately stood on a higher ground and pretended to speak up for the farmers. She raised her voice and said, “Stop arguing!”
“Qiu Tong and her child’s pesticide is the problem. Why are you causing trouble for Chief Officer Fang?”
“Chief Officer Fang only approved the production of the locust pesticide. He didn’t know that there was a problem with the Qiu family’s formula, nor did he know that it would cause an allergic reaction…”
Lin Shan looked at Qiu Tong sarcastically, hinting to Chief Officer Fang that everything had happened because of Qiu Tong.
When Chief Officer Fang saw that the crowd’s emotions had stabilized a little, he awkwardly tidied his wrinkled clothes, frowned and cleared his throat.
Lin Shan looked at the crowd and continued in a loud voice, “I know a factory that makes protective apparatus.”
“We need to rush production of the pesticide to suppress the locust plague, right? Farmers need to use locust pesticide, but you’re also afraid that something will happen to your bodies!”
“I can help contact the factory and get them to speed up the production of a batch of protective clothing. This will prevent the farmers from suffering from allergic reactions.”
“At the same time, we can prevent the locust plague in the fields from worsening!”
After Lin Shan finished speaking, the crowd finally calmed down. They put down the rotten eggs and vegetables that they were holding in their hands, discussing if what Lin Shan said was true.
“Really? Are you lying to us?”
The crowd looked at Lin Shan doubtfully, wondering about her identity and the credibility of her words. However, the tense atmosphere finally eased a little.
Chief Officer Fang did not expect her to be so effective at such a critical juncture. He looked at Lin Shan with a complicated gaze, which changed from disdain to joy in just a few seconds. He turned to look at Qiu Tong. He was thinking that if he let things escalate, the higher-ups would definitely hold him accountable.
If Qiu Tong and the children’s reputations were harmed, the higher-ups would definitely be displeased.
Even if there was something wrong with the locust pesticide, there was no way he could pin the blame on the Qiu family.
Lin Shan had stepped forward at this moment to help Qiu Tong solve the problem. She was able to give the crowd a solution and let this matter pass.
Chief Officer Fang thought for a moment and immediately decided to sign a contract with Lin Shan in the name of the government. “This batch of protective apparatus will be distributed to farmers who need to spray locust pesticide in the shortest time possible. Please go home and wait. Don’t cause trouble again!”
After receiving this order, Lin Shan looked at Qiu Tong with increasingly disdainful eyes. She said sarcastically, “People shouldn’t try to stick their necks out if they don’t have the ability.”
“Now, you still need someone else to clean up your mess. I really don’t know where your thick skin comes from!”
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his thin lips. His eyes were cold as he clenched his small fists and looked at Lin Shan with frustration.
Lin Shan raised her eyebrows provocatively. “Little brat, why are you glaring at me?”

chapters.title: Chapter 115 - Government Order
chapters.content:
Chapter 115: Government Order
Qiu Tong scooped up a bottle of locust pesticide, unscrewed the cap and placed it at the tip of her nose to sniff. She poured out two drops onto her skin, and sure enough, there were red spots.
It seemed that there was indeed a component of the pesticide that would cause an allergic reaction!
Qiu Tong was thinking about how to help Qiu Xingyuan clean up the mess caused by the locust pesticide.
She looked up at Lin Shan. The coldness in her eyes made Lin Shan too afraid to speak again.
Chief Officer Fang dispersed the crowd and picked up the scattered bottles. He looked at Qiu Tong and asked politely, “Shall I escort you and the children back? Although the crowd has already left, there might still be some malicious people waiting in the dark for an opportunity.”
“It’s safer to let the police escort you home.”
Qiu Tong understood Chief Officer Fang’s good intentions. She squeezed into the backseat with the three children in her arms as the police car left with sirens blaring.
Lin Shan stared intently in the direction where the car had left. Grabbing the order form that Chief Officer Fang had given her, she rushed to Shu Xian’s factory.
The factory where Shu Xian produced protective gear was located in the suburbs. Lin Shan had been close to Shu Xian recently and was also familiar with the security guards. She pushed open the door and entered the office. She saw Shu Xian with his feet crossed and holding a game console, cursing incessantly.
Lin Shan frowned and waved her hand to disperse the cigarette smoke in the room. She strode gracefully to sit on his lap and hooked her arm around Shu Xian’s neck.
Shu Xian impatiently wanted to push Lin Shan away. “Move aside, don’t disturb me! Go over there and entertain yourself for a while…”
Lin Shan didn’t say anything else. She just waved the order form in front of him.
Shu Xian looked at the screen that displayed the words “Game Over”. He then looked at the order form. “Protective apparatus? Where did you get this?”
Lin Shan gave a simple recap of the locust pesticide incident. She thought that she would be able to hear Shu Xian’s praise, but unexpectedly, he threw the order aside in disdain. He took two deep puffs of his cigarette, narrowed his eyes, and puffed out a few smoke rings. “Although the government has ordered a lot of apparatus, there’s actually not much profit in this!”
“The deadline to produce these protective apparatus is very tight. They want us to make them before the locusts get out of control.”
“The government’s price is so low. And I have to pay the workers overtime. What profit is there for me? Let’s push this job to someone else!”
Shu Xian’s factory was quite big so he naturally looked down on this small sum of money.
Lin Shan’s heart surged with disdain at his short-sightedness. She adjusted her emotions and said gently, “Don’t be rash.”
“You know that it’s an order from the government. Let’s just do Chief Officer Fang a favor. If we do a good job this time, we will be able to form a steady connection with the government. We will definitely benefit from this connection in the future, right?”
“Some time ago, the government had a piece of land for sale. It’s said that it was handed over to a dealer who has a secret relationship with Chief Officer Fang.”
Shu Xian was convinced by her words. His heart was racing as he grabbed the phone on his desk and informed the factory to hurry up.
He raised his hand and hooked Lin Shan’s chin, his greasy palm touching her slender waist. “You helped me earn money. What do you want in return?”
Shu Xian patted Lin Shan’s butt. She laughed and threw herself into Shu Xian’s arms, pressing her heavy and round chest against his face.
“Little demoness!”
Shu Xian’s eyes were filled with lust. He picked up Lin Shan and pressed her against the desk. He lifted her skirt and took off her panties.
Lin Shan raised her neck and moaned in a sweet voice. She swayed her hips against Shu Xian.
Shu Xian grabbed the order form and stuck it on Lin Shan’s smooth and fair back. He lowered his head and kissed her passionately, causing Lin Shan to tremble…
The door of the office was open. When the secretaries passing by heard the constant moaning and the sounds of furniture knocking, they quickly left, afraid that they would see something disgusting.
…
In their villa, Qiu Xingyuan sat on the sofa with a cold face. Since returning home, he had ignored everyone and refused to speak.
Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu carried some cut fruits over and wanted to coax him to eat a few, but Qiu Xingyuan only shook his head. His expression was solemn, and his eyes were filled with frustration.
Qiu Tong sighed and walked up to him. She rubbed Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu’s heads. “Go and eat at the dining table.”
“Mommy and your elder brother have something to discuss. Be good!”
Qiu Xingqiao hesitated for a moment before leading Little Yu away.
When Qiu Xingyuan saw her sitting opposite him, a hint of evasion flashed across his eyes. He stubbornly raised his chin.
She must be wanting to ask why he had made such a mistake and created such a lousy pesticide. That he had embarrassed her and even caused the Qiu family to suffer!
Qiu Xingyuan quietly clenched his fists and leaned back against the sofa nervously. He sat upright and looked straight at Qiu Tong. “What do you want to discuss?”

chapters.title: Chapter 116 - Family Of Four
chapters.content:
Chapter 116: Family Of Four
Qiu Tong did not answer his question. She just poured a cup of water for Qiu Xingyuan and quietly looked into his eyes.
Qiu Xingyuan held the glass cup in his hand and bit his thin lips as he said, “I didn’t know about the allergic reaction to locust pesticide, but it’s too late to change the formula now.”
“This pesticide incident was my mistake…”
Qiu Tong listened to him speak a little longer before suddenly leaning over and reaching out to him.
Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes flickered. He raised his little face stubbornly and refused to dodge. He would face whatever comes!
The hand that he thought would land on his face paused in the air for a moment before landing on his head.
Qiu Tong rubbed the top of his head. When she saw Qiu Xingyuan’s furious expression, she burst out laughing. “The locust pesticide has a suppressive effect on locusts.”
“It’s your first time developing a pesticide, so it’s normal that you weren’t able to consider every aspect of the formula thoroughly. Don’t blame yourself too much.”
Qiu Xingyuan stood rooted to the ground in shock. He did not expect Qiu Tong to do this. He stared blankly at her, forgetting to dodge her hand.
“You don’t blame me?”
Qiu Xingyuan was frowning. Qiu Tong shook her head in surprise and asked, “Why should I blame you?”
“You must have been frightened by the chaotic crowd earlier. This matter is not something you can solve. Mommy will settle it!”
“Don’t worry. Mommy is here. Even if the sky falls, I will hold it up!”
Qiu Tong’s body emitted a warm glow, causing Qiu Xingyuan to be a little stunned.
Qiu Tong hugged him. She patted Qiu Xingyuan’s back and said softly, “You’ve already done very well.”
At this moment, Qiu Xingyuan felt a twinge in his nose. He endured the urge to nestle in Qiu Tong’s arms and bury his face in her neck.
Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu were secretly watching the scene at the dining table. When they saw what was happening, they ran over jealously and threw themselves into Qiu Tong’s arms.
Little Yu muttered in a childish voice, “Mommy is biased. Little Yu wants a hug too!”
Qiu Xingqiao squeezed his head into Qiu Tong’s arms. He was silent, but his body language showed that he was extremely reliant and trusting of her.
Qiu Tong looked down at the three children in her arms and couldn’t help smiling.
It looked like these children’s attitude towards her had improved a lot!
The family of four huddled together in the living room. Qiu Xingyuan said awkwardly, “But the allergic reaction incident has blown up. What can you do?”
Qiu Tong patted his head. “It’s not your place to worry about these adult matters!”
In the corner, Ye Luan pushed open the door of the bedroom and quietly looked at them. He knew what had happened at the kindergarten.
He lowered his head hesitantly and touched the area at his waist. His eyes flickered with dilemma, but he eventually dropped his hand and quietly closed the door.
Ye Luan sat by the bed and lifted his shirt to look at the chip at his waist.
This was what those people chasing after him wanted!
He had known from the beginning that there was a chip in his skin that contained information about the human modification plan.
If Auntie Qiu obtained this information and used it, the farmers would no longer be afraid of the locust pesticide. They would no longer show symptoms of allergy.
Auntie Qiu had been very good to him. He should have helped the Qiu family…
However, before he went to prison, his father had warned him not to hand the chip over to anyone else. Otherwise, he would be in big trouble!
Ye Luan clenched his fists and rubbed the bed frame gently. He quietly listened to the sounds outside the door and frowned.
In the living room, Qiu Tong coaxed the children to sleep. She returned to her room and took out her phone. She looked at the number in her contact list and dialed.
A few days ago, when Song Yan let her have the sniper rifle in the black market, they had also exchanged contact information.
Beep beep beep—
The phone rang for two seconds before it was answered. “Can we meet soon?”
The signal paused for a few seconds. Qiu Tong looked at the notification on the phone and frowned. “Hello?”
In front of the computer screen, Song Yan paused the audio recording and casually placed his headset aside.
He asked softly, “What’s the matter?”
“I heard that some farmers caused trouble outside the kindergarten. Do you need my help?”
“If you want, I can step out and prove Qiu Xingyuan’s innocence. To show the public that there is no problem with the formula of the locust pesticide.”
Song Yan’s tone was gentle and concerned. He had disrupted Qiu Tong’s prepared speech. She cleared her throat awkwardly. “You’re quite thoughtful, but Chief Officer Fang’s appearance has already aroused the hostility of the farmers.”
“I won’t trouble you with this matter.”

chapters.title: Chapter 117 - Suburban Military Base
chapters.content:
Chapter 117: Suburban Military Base
Song Yan swirled his wine glass and asked with interest, “Then… what do you want me to do?”
Qiu Tong zoomed in on the screenshot and asked bluntly, “Do you know of an abandoned military base in S City? It seems to be in the suburbs.”
“Can you find a way to bring me in?”
Qiu Tong probed, “I can pretend to be your guard. With your status, you should be able to help me get in?”
Song Yan suddenly became wary. Qiu Tong could tell from his pause that there was something wrong. She explained, “I want to find out if there are any abandoned helicopters in the military base. If they can be modified, we can hand them over to the farmers…”
“Using a helicopter to spray pesticide can prevent them from getting allergic reactions from being in direct contact with the pesticide.”
Qiu Tong doodled on a piece of white paper and said casually, “This can also increase efficiency.”
“We might be able to keep the locust plague under control right from the start. It would be good for the farmers and us.”
Song Yan raised an eyebrow. He was somewhat doubtful of Qiu Tong’s suggestion. He had some understanding of military equipment and weapons. Modifying a helicopter was extremely difficult!
He tapped his fingers on the desktop, making a tapping sound. “The helicopter design is classified.”
“Ordinary people have never seen it before, much less be able to modify it into a pesticide spraying machine.”
Qiu Tong understood that Song Yan would not believe her just by her words alone. She wanted to try and explain the modification plan in a simple and easy-to-understand way, but ended up saying, “Bring me to see the helicopters. If I can modify them, it will be good for everyone.”
“If I can’t, it won’t be any loss to you either.”
Song Yan raised his index finger to his forehead. He felt that Qiu Tong was very interesting. He replied, “Alright.”
“I can bring you there, but do you dare to make a bet with me?”
“I will lose the bet if you can modify the helicopter. You will lose the bet if you can’t…”
“Whoever loses must fulfill a wish by the other party. As long as the wish does not violate the law or the basic moral principles of the person, it must be satisfied.”
Song Yan narrowed his eyes and asked, “Do you dare?”
Qiu Tong frowned and nodded after a moment of hesitation. “Deal!”
…
The next day at the heavily-guarded abandoned military base in the suburbs, a few officers waited outside with ingratiating expressions.
Song Yan drove the car to the checkpoint with Qiu Tong. The officer guarding the door hurriedly ran over and bowed, “Mr. Song Yan, what brings you here? Is there something urgent?”
Qiu Tong looked at the military equipment behind the huge metal door. She was speechless.
Song Yan pushed open the car door in his military boots and raised his hand for Qiu Tong to help him out. His eyes were cold as he said, “Are there any abandoned helicopters?”
“Bring us over to take a look and prepare some tools for Miss Qiu.”
After Song Yan finished giving his instructions, he looked at Qiu Tong’s profile curiously. He raised his eyebrows and said softly, “Don’t forget our bet.”
Qiu Tong nodded and looked at the officer. “I am looking for a smaller, lighter model that can be modified to spray pesticide for agricultural purposes…”
The officer was stunned. His eyes widened several times, and his pupils were filled with shock and disdain as he smiled and said, “Don’t joke around!”
“These helicopters are used for combat. Do you think you can modify them just like that?”
Song Yan heard his tone and glared at him unhappily. Due to Song Yan’s status, the officers did not dare to say anything else and had no choice but to lead Qiu Tong to the aircrafts.
The officers followed behind, muttering amongst themselves. “Where did Mr. Song Yan meet such a woman?”
“She only knows how to talk big. Does she know what a helicopter is? She even said that she wants to modify it?”
Qiu Tong did not take their mutterings to heart.
The few of them walked to the area where the aircraft were stored. One of the officers introduced the various aircraft to her. “This is a helicopter that was still in active service last year.”
“These are airplane models from more than 10 years ago. The parts are old and can’t be used anymore.”
The officer spoke in a perfunctory manner. Qiu Tong did not listen to his narration at all. She stared at the aircraft carefully and tapped her hands absentmindedly. When she reached a particular aircraft, she stopped in her tracks, her eyes shining.

chapters.title: Chapter 118 - Repairing Aircrafts
chapters.content:
Chapter 118: Repairing Aircrafts
Qiu Tong stared at the few aircraft with a hint of lamentation in her eyes. She said in a mild tone, “These scrapped aircraft are all kept in this base.”
“It’s such a waste. They can be flown again with just a little repair and modification, but they’re left lying here gathering the dust.”
When the officer heard her words, contempt and disdain flashed across his face. However, because Song Yan was present, he could only pretend to be respectful and say, “You don’t know.”
“On the surface, these helicopters don’t look like they have any problems, but various parts inside are already damaged beyond salvage.”
“Several of them suddenly malfunctioned during flight and nearly crashed, so they were sent to this base.”
Song Yan had one hand in his pocket as he lazily raised his other hand to pat the metal sheet of the helicopter. He had no intention of speaking up for Qiu Tong.
When the official saw this, his tone became even more unpleasant. He said sarcastically, “You might have watched too many movies that make it look like modifying an aircraft is a simple matter… in actual fact, it requires a lot of professional knowledge. You can take a look, but don’t touch anything…”
“It’s a small matter if you damage something, but if you end up hurting yourself, we won’t be able to bear the responsibility!”
“Just take a look around. We have good tea in our office. Mr. Song Yan and this lady, please take a seat and rest.”
Qiu Tong noticed their sarcasm and stared at Song Yan. “Give me a set of tools.”
Song Yan nodded and gestured.
The guard had no choice but to hand over the toolbox reluctantly. Qiu Tong opened it and glanced at it before jumping into a helicopter with it in her hand.
In the cockpit, Qiu Tong used a wrench to remove the control panel of the mainframe. She looked at the few broken wires inside and twisted open the connection without a word.
Song Yan did not take her suggestion seriously at first, but when he saw Qiu Tong’s professional actions, he nodded and gestured for the officer to bring two ladders over. He stood outside the control panel and said, “Can it be fixed?”
Qiu Tong did not reply. She quietly dismantled a few of the helicopter’s panels, picked up the replacement control panel, and slammed it against the connections.
Knock knock—
The officer was stunned by her work. He stood there gaping.
Qiu Tong estimated that the damaged areas had already been repaired. She used a detection device to test the functions. Her eyes flickered with confidence as she pressed the buttons. The control lamp instantly lit up, and beeping sounds rang out in the cockpit.
The helicopter’s propeller began to rotate. The officers cried out in disbelief, “It’s really fixed?”
They looked at each other and the same thought popped up in their minds.
This woman was so formidable. If she could repair the other abandoned planes for them, wouldn’t it save them a lot of money?
When the time came, the higher-ups would definitely reward them! At the thought of this, one of the officers went up to her with an ingratiating expression. “Miss Qiu, can you take a look at the other planes? Can… can they still be fixed?”
Qiu Tong dusted off her hands and jumped out of the cockpit. She brushed off the dust on her body and waved two fingers in front of their eyes.
The officers were confused. One of them asked, “What do you mean by that?”
Qiu Tong immediately demanded, “$300,000 for each aircraft.”
Such a sky-high repair fee?!
For a moment there, the officers could not come to a decision, but Qiu Tong said nonchalantly, “For every aircraft that is scrapped and left here, it will cost tens of millions of dollars to develop a new model. My repair fee is reasonable… consider it carefully.”
“Song Yan, I want these aircraft.”
Qiu Tong recalled her agreement with Song Yan and pointed at a few of them. Song Yan nodded and instructed someone to help Qiu Tong with the paperwork.
Those helicopters from the military base should be able to be modified for agricultural purposes.
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and patted Song Yan’s shoulder. “Does your bet with me still stand?”
Song Yan raised his eyebrows slightly. He looked forward to Qiu Tong asking something from him. He replied readily, “Of course.”
“If you’ve already decided, tell me as soon as possible.”
Qiu Tong did not stand on ceremony with him. She pointed at the few aircraft and said, “I can successfully modify these aircraft into drones over the next few days. Can you give me full authority over them? In other words, I must be able to use and dispatch them as I please…”

chapters.title: Chapter 119 - Affection
chapters.content:
Chapter 119: Affection
Song Yan did not expect Qiu Tong to want the right to use the drones. He stared at Qiu Tong for a while, pondering before he nodded in agreement.
The officers calculated the military funds and felt their hearts bleed at the thought of all that money that would flow into Qiu Tong’s wallet.
Qiu Tong was a mere woman. But she was able to earn such an exorbitant fee just by removing a few screws?
The officers muttered in their hearts with dissatisfaction. They wished they voice out their displeasure. Qiu Tong could naturally see their distress but she ignored it. Instead, she clapped her hands and said, “Bring over all the aircraft that you want repaired. I can modify them now…”
“It’s been hard on you, Miss Qiu! What do think about these aircraft here?”
The officers looked surprised and happy. They felt like they were on a emotional rollercoaster ride as they happily brought Qiu Tong to the storage location of two heavy-duty aircraft.
Qiu Tong sized them up and nodded. She had someone move the ladder over and turned to enter the cockpit. But she needed an assistant.
“Mr. Song Yan, if you have time, why don’t you help me with some odd jobs?”
Qiu Tong’s tone was relaxed. Song Yan saw the smile on her lips and his heart skipped a beat. He nodded and walked to Qiu Tong’s side.
Repairing heavy-duty aircraft was already rather difficult, not to mention that the damage to these machines were a result of major attacks.
Qiu Tong carefully examined the damage. She stared at the control panel and raised her hand. “A wrench.”
Song Yan stared at the side of her face in a daze. Even after waiting a long time, Qiu Tong did not receive her requested tool. She frowned and looked up at him. She waved her hand and said, “With the current efficiency, I’m afraid these planes will take three days and three nights to repair!”
Qiu Tong’s words brought back Song Yan’s mind back to the present. He looked at the woman in front of him and his heart stirred.
In that instant, he really wanted Jin Yang to lose Qiu Tong and completely cut off any possibility between the two of them…
…
In the factories in the suburbs, Lin Shan recalled Shu Xian’s attitude. She was a little worried about the government’s order for the protective gear, so she rushed to the factories to personally supervise the production.
Relying on her relationship with Shu Xian, Lin Shan asked the manager to bring over two chairs. She sat near the air conditioning ventilation shaft. She ate fruit and pointed at the tired workers. “Be more careful in your work. This batch is an order from the government.”
“If anything goes wrong, you will definitely be held responsible!”
The workers had stayed up all night to work overtime for the past few days. They were completely exhausted and were irritated by Lin Shan’s sarcastic words.
An old man who was very experienced stood up and threw the protective suit he was working on into the production line. He turned to Lin Shan and said, “It’s such a tight deadline to produce a large number of protective suits. And no additional workers have been hired yet. Do you think we can just grow an extra pair of arms to work faster. We can’t do this!”
Lin Shan did not expect them to resist. She stood up in a panic and said, “I was just looking out for you!”
“If the government orders are done well, you guys will definitely benefit!”
“By then, I will talk to Shu Xian about givng you guys promotions and salary increases!”
Lin Shan had no right to do so, but she still made a promise to the workers in a loud voice. She raised her hand and said, “As long as you can produce these protective gear within the deadline, the company will definitely give you a big bonus! Hurry up and work…”
The workers knew of Lin Shan’s relationship with Shu Xian and did not believe her nonsense at all. They were dissatisfied.
Lin Shan was bored at the factory. When she heard that Shu Xian had arrived, she hurriedly ran out and took Shu Xian’s arm as they walked out of the factory.
Their factory was rather close to the abandoned military base. Lin Shan took two steps forward and saw Qiu Tong, who was covered in engine oil…
Qiu Tong swatted the dirt off her body with her gloves and wiped the dust off her face with the back of her hand.
Lin Shan sized her up and thought that she had lost favor with Chief Officer Fang. She happily tried to provoke her. “Who is this?”
“Why have you become so down and out? You’re so dirty. Did you go out to repair machines for the farmers?”
“Life is so hard. Why don’t you work in our factory?”
Lin Shan covered her red lips and said sarcastically, “It’ll definitely pay more than your current part-time job!”

chapters.title: Chapter 120 - Changing Her Sugar Daddy
chapters.content:
Chapter 120: Changing Her Sugar Daddy
Qiu Tong had been repairing the scrapped aircraft at the abandoned military base. Earlier on, Song Yan said that he had something to do and needed to leave. Hence, they went their separate ways then.
She did not expect to meet Lin Shan and Shu Xian!
Qiu Tong was feeling sore all over and couldn’t be bothered with Lin Shan. She always thought of Lin Shan as just a stray dog barking at the roadside, but her behavior had become increasingly outrageous.
Lin Shan thought that Qiu Tong had lost her backer and was in dire straits, that was why she was enduring her ridicule and not answering. She said sarcastically, “Now that there’s no source of income, how are you going to support your three children? I almost forgot that the locust pesticide your son developed will cause allergies…”
“Maybe in a few days, you’ll have to return all the patent fees and give some additional compensation.”
“You’re so beautiful. Why don’t you quickly find another sugar daddy? Maybe you can sell yourself to pay your debts!”
Qiu Tong narrowed her cold eyes and stared fixedly at Lin Shan. Lin Shan was instantly intimidated by Qiu Tong’s aura and did not dare to speak more nonsense.
Qiu Tong’s gaze landed on Shu Xian. With a wicked smile on her lips, she reminded him in a light tone, “I heard that Lin Shan helped you get an order from the government? Manager Shu is so smart, I advise you to think about what Lin Shan’s motive is…”
“Since she can persuade me to look for another sugar daddy, then perhaps that government order is just a way for Lin Shan to please and get close to Chief Officer Fang?”
Qiu Tong saw Lin Shan’s expression change and raised her eyebrows. “Manager Shu, don’t let that woman fool you.”
Hearing Qiu Tong’s accusation, Shu Xian immediately turned and shook off Lin Shan’s hand, questioning her in a hoarse and ruthless voice, “Are you trying to seduce Chief Officer Fang? B*tch! I’ll tell the factory to stop operations immediately…”
Lin Shan was a little flustered and helpless. She hurriedly chased after Shu Xian. She turned around and glared at Qiu Tong venomously. Biting her red lips, she blocked Shu Xian’s path and explained in a sweet voice, “Don’t let her use you anymore. Chief Officer Fang is already so old. How can he compare to you?”
“I’m sincere to you. Can’t you tell?”
Lin Shan flirted with Shu Xian. Qiu Tong watched as she shamelessly seduced the man right in the open. A hint of disgust flashed across her eyes as she left.
…
In the capital, Jin Yang was handling official business in the study.
The massive outbreak of locusts due to extreme droughts brought serious damage to farmers’ fields.
Jin Yang flipped through a few reports and frowned when he saw the photos. He didn’t expect the locust plague to spread so quickly.
Staring at the screen, he suddenly remembered that Qiu Tong had once mentioned to him about the locust plague. For a moment, his emotions were in turmoil.
How was she doing now?
Jin Yang’s mind wandered for a moment. He immediately contacted Mayor Shen.
When Mayor Shen saw the call from the capital, he jumped up from his chair in fright and answered the call respectfully. “Mr. President…”
“Increase the production of locust pesticide in the near future. Transfer the locust pesticide that has been produced to all parts of the country for farmers to use.”
“We must control the locust plague! I’ll leave this to you. Don’t disappoint me!”
Jin Yang’s order made Mayor Shen nervous but also a little proud and happy. Leaving the production of locust pesticide to him meant that there would be an additional chance of him being promoted in the future. At the very least, he would be able to gain some status!
Mayor Shen quickly agreed and asked, “Do you have any other instructions?”
Jin Yang paused for a moment before asking casually, “How have they been?”
Mayor Shen found it a little strange. He had clearly seen the president and Qiu Tong together not too long ago…
Could it be that they would miss each other even just after half a day?
Mayor Shen could not help quietly speculating, but he did not dare to voice out his thoughts. He immediately answered, “Miss Qiu and the children are all rather nice. Some time ago, after the kindergarten’s award ceremony ended, I heard that the children of the Qiu family have been very well-liked by their teachers.”
Mayor Shen glanced at the duration of the call and felt a little excited. He did not expect to be talking with the president for so long!
His eyes darted around as he tried to think of more talking points. Thinking of his relationship with Qiu Tong, he said obsequiously, “Sir, you’ve been making so many trips between the capital and S City recently. You still have to handle so many political matters. You must take care of your health!”

chapters.title: Chapter 121 - New Locust Pesticide
chapters.content:
Chapter 121: New Locust Pesticide
Jin Yang frowned in confusion when he heard Mayor Shen’s baffling concern.
He casually flipped through a few documents, his gaze landing on the word “Qiu” in the last line. He said softly, “I’ll leave the matters of S City to you. If anything happens to Qiu Tong…”
Mayor Shen had been an official for many years. When he heard Jin Yang’s words, he immediately understood what he meant and hurriedly said, “I will definitely take care of things!”
Jin Yang hung up the phone. His index finger rubbed against the word. He then called Shao An to come over. “Book me a plane ticket.”
“To S City in two weeks’ time.”
Shao An blinked. He thought of the children who had appeared in the news footage and understood that Jin Yang wanted to visit Qiu Tong and her family.
He immediately bought the plane ticket, but he kept stealing glances at Jin Yang from time to time. The curiosity in his heart intensified.
Shao An straightened his spine and shifted closer to Jin Yang’s side. He bent over and whispered into Jin Yang’s ear, “Sir, not only do the children of the Qiu family look 80% like you, they are also very smart!”
“Did you really not know of their existence before?”
“Do you need me to help you cover up this matter? Transfer Miss Qiu and the children to a safer place. After all, their relationship with you…”
Shao An tried using what he thought was an indirect method to probe.
However, Jin Yang’s expression darkened. He looked up and stared into Shao An’s eyes. He asked with his thin lips, “Are you very free now?”
Shao An instinctively felt a hint of danger. He hurriedly shook his head and shut his mouth, swallowing his curiosity. How would he dare to ask again?
…
In S City, the matter of the locust pesticide containing an allergen was blown out of proportion. The officials had yet to give an explanation.
The farmers no longer dared to use the pesticide. They could only watch as the locust larvae in their grain fields gradually multiply. The locust plague was growing more and more intense. Everyone was anxious and uneasy as they watched the farmlands about to be destroyed, but they could not think of a solution.
Lu Sheng he heard a few farmers muttering when he passed by the fields. “Don’t tell me that only the Qiu family can make locust pesticide?”
These words made Lu Sheng’s heart surge with greed. He stood in the fields and pondered for a while before rushing to Lu Zhiling’s clinic.
“The locust pesticide on the market now is worth a sky-high price! We can take this opportunity to earn a good profit!”
When Lu Zhiling heard his suggestion, a hint of worry appeared in her beautiful eyes. “But the pesticide needs to be mixed in a strict ratio…”
Lu Sheng looked a little impatient. “How can the farmers know whether the locust pesticide is effective or not now?”
“We just need to give them some psychological comfort. If there are any problems, we can blame it on Qiu Tong. Or that the locust plague has already spread beyond our control. What has it got to do with us? Don’t tell me the farmers can still demand compensation from us?”
Lu Zhiling was convinced by him and quickly developed and modified a new “locust pesticide”.
They deliberately chose the location where Qiu Tong had distributed the locust pesticide. They erected a signboard and set up a stall to sell it.
“This is a new kind of locust pesticide. It will definitely kill the larvae without causing any allergic reactions!”
“You will benefit from buying it now. Don’t miss this great opportunity…”
Lu Sheng kept shouting. When the farmers heard that there was a new type of pesticide, they rushed over from all over to buy it.
In just a few hours, sales of the new locust pesticide was shot up.
Lu Sheng and Lu Zhiling looked at the huge wad of cash and couldn’t help smiling.
Qiu Tong arrived at the kindergarten to bring the children home. She stopped in her tracks when she saw Lu Sheng and Lu Zhiling.
When she realized that the Lu siblings were selling locust pesticide, she found it even more strange.
Carrying his small school bag, Qiu Xingyuan quietly observed the stall in front of him.
A woman bought two bottles of locust pesticide and accidentally sprinkled two drops on the ground. She cursed her clumsiness and left.
Qiu Xingyuan squatted down and quietly looked at the two drops of liquid. He frowned and sensed that something was wrong.
He walked to Lu Sheng’s stall and said in a clear voice, “Has your locust pesticide been tested and certified by the government? There’s a problem with the ratio of ingredients you have used. It will cause the effects of the pesticide to be unstable, and it might even have a very negative effect.”
“It’ll be a big problem if you use it wantonly.”
Qiu Xingyuan stared at Lu Sheng with burning eyes as he blurted out the truth.

chapters.title: Chapter 122 - Destroying The Stall
chapters.content:
Chapter 122: Destroying The Stall
When the farmers heard Qiu Xingyuan’s doubts, they put down the locust pesticide warily. Some even started to cancel their payment, choosing to observe the situation first.
Lu Sheng glared at Qiu Xingyuan fiercely. His business had been affected and his anger was surging.
More and more people gathered around the stall. Lu Sheng rolled up his sleeves and pointed at Qiu Xingyuan, shouting, “Look clearly at who he is!”
“A while ago, the locust pesticide that went wrong was developed by a child from the Qiu family. His own pesticide was problematic, and now, he’s slandering us. He obviously failed to earn any money and wants to drag us down with him! He’s clearly jealous!”
Lu Sheng spat and gritted his teeth as he slammed the locust pesticide onto the table. He boasted, “We’ve done testing!”
“There’s definitely no problem. Please don’t believe a child’s nonsense…”
Lu Sheng looked at Qiu Tong and pointed at her rudely, publicly scolding and slandering her. “Who knows how Qiu Tong teaches her children? She actually lets her children cheat and harm others!”
“These children are illegitimate without a father. No wonder they lack discipline!”
“If there had been someone in the family to take charge of their upbringing, the children wouldn’t have become like this. How pitiful…”
Lu Sheng clicked his tongue. Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes turned red from anger and he quietly clenched his fists.
While the crowd discussed the background of Qiu Tong and the children, Qiu Xingqiao finally lost control and shook off Qiu Tong’s hand. He ran to Lu Sheng’s stall and lifted his leg to kick apart two wooden beams.
The table tilted as the wood broke, and all the locust pesticide fell to the ground.
Qiu Xingqiao ran over and stepped on the pesticide bottle. In an instant, the pesticide flowed all over the ground and the smell of locust pesticide filled the air.
Lu Sheng felt as if he was looking at the cash in his hand fly away. He was so angry that he wanted to grab Qiu Xingqiao by the collar and raise his hand to hit the boy.
“How can you bully children?”
“The children of the Qiu family are really delinquent. No matter what, the boy shouldn’t have destroyed the stall!”
The onlookers were watching the commotion and had no intention of intervening. Qiu Tong frowned and wanted to attack.
Ke Le and the others happened to pass by after picking up Ye Luan. The mercenaries immediately surrounded them. Ke Le hit Lu Sheng’s wrist. Lu Sheng released his grip on Qiu Xingqiao in pain, while the mercenary caught the falling Qiu Xingqiao.
Ke Le shielded Qiu Xingqiao behind him and instantly instructed his team, who were well-trained in controlling unruly situations.
Lu Sheng and the clinic staff were surrounded by mercenaries. The atmosphere between the two sides was tense and at a stalemate. No one dared to move.
When Mayor Shen received Jin Yang’s call, he kept thinking about showing concern for Qiu Tong’s situation. He had originally wanted to go to the kindergarten to make small talk with Qiu Tong and ask if she had encountered any problems recently and needed help. But now that he had witnessed such a chaotic situation, he was so frightened that cold sweat immediately ran down his back.
“Move aside! What are you doing?”
Mayor Shen stepped forward to stop both sides. When he saw Lu Zhiling and Lu Sheng, he scolded them sternly. “What’s going on?”
He turned to look at Qiu Tong and saw that she looked extremely unhappy. He hurriedly asked in a gentle tone, “Miss Qiu, are you alright? Are you hurt anywhere?”
When Lu Zhiling saw Mayor Shen appear, she came out from behind and walked up to him, pretending to be aggrieved as she said, “Mayor Shen, you came at the right time.”
“Our clinic knows that the situation in the grain fields is extremely serious. The farmers are all very anxious, so we worked overnight to develop this locust pesticide to sell it.”
“But the Qiu family children came to destroy our stall and even spilled our pesticide.”
Lu Zhiling fiddled with her curly hair. Sensing everyone’s eyes on her, she continued. “I know that Mayor Shen hasn’t been able to sleep the entire night due to the locust plague. The clinic wants to solve Mayor Shen’s problem…”
Mayor Shen looked back at Qiu Tong guiltily and coughed lightly to interrupt Lu Zhiling.
Qiu Xingqiao was so angry that he shrugged his shoulders in a huff. The knuckles of his fists were slightly swollen as he said, “Eldest Brother kindly pointed out to them that there was something wrong with their pesticide. But they started scolding Mommy and us…”
Qiu Tong could sense that Qiu Xingqiao’s anger had not subsided. She placed her hand gently on the top of his head and rubbed it.

chapters.title: Chapter 123 - Solution
chapters.content:
Chapter 123: Solution
Mayor Shen looked a little nervous. He put on an official tone and reprimanded the Lu siblings. “You need to be certified by the government to sell locust pesticide.”
“The pesticide can only be sold after the tests show that the content and effects are satisfactory. Now, quickly pack up the things on the ground and go back to wait for news!”
Mayor Shen looked at Lu Zhiling’s slightly dissatisfied expression. He was afraid that she would say something that would make Qiu Tong unhappy, so he frowned as he hinted at her.
“Gathering a crowd and inciting a riot. If the situation is serious, you will be arrested!”
“Besides, you’re all adults. How can you target and bully kindergarteners? This is ridiculous!”
Mayor Shen reprimanded Lu Sheng and Lu Zhiling before sending someone to disperse everyone…
Although Lu Zhiling was unwilling, she had no choice but to obey and leave.
Through the rearview mirror, Lu Sheng saw Mayor Shen asking about the condition of the Qiu family children with concern. He even wanted to send them to the hospital for a checkup. He could not help nudging Lu Zhiling’s arm. Pointing out the window, he said, “Look at Mayor Shen’s expression when he gazes at Qiu Tong!”
“He had the same look in his eyes when he first got together with you!”
Lu Zhiling frowned and turned to look at Mayor Shen. She widened her eyes when she saw him respectfully escorting Qiu Tong into his private car.
Lu Sheng nagged, “Mayor Shen hasn’t been coming to look for you as much lately. Maybe he’s tired of you and has lost interest in you!”
“In this situation, we have to quickly extort a sum from him. Otherwise, it will be too late!”
Lu Zhiling also thought that Mayor Shen had taken a liking to Qiu Tong and wanted to take her as his lover. Her beautiful face twisted.
Her eyes flickered with resentment and viciousness as she muttered, “Qiu Tong! Just you wait…”
…
Over the past few days, Qiu Tong had been repairing aircraft in the abandoned military base every day.
The more time those officers spent with her, the more they understood that Qiu Tong was truly capable. The initial contempt in their hearts was completely wiped away. They now often gathered around Qiu Tong to help her, trying to secretly learn some of her skills.
“Miss Qiu, are you really going to use these helicopters that you modified for agriculture?”
“This is such a waste. They’re all combat machines! The guns and cannons on them are all good to use.”
After getting to know Qiu Tong better, one of the officers voiced his regrets when he heard her motive.
Qiu Tong was busy modifying the storage box that would be filled with pesticide. She had also repaired the gun barrel. She said softly, “It’s not like there’s only one use for planes. It’s just that I need them for the locusts now.”
The officer did not understand. He pretended to be impressed and handed the wrench over…
At the protective gear factory in the suburbs, the first batch of protective apparatus was produced and sent to the farmers’ homes.
The farmers wore the thick protective gear to spray the locust pesticide as they walked in their grain fields. As expected, this temporarily resolved the allergy problem.
The citizens of S City once again threw themselves into destroying the locusts, and the discussion about the Qiu family gradually died down.
As the protective gear had played a key role in the battle against the locusts, Mayor Shen and Chief Officer Fang specially invited Lin Shan to dinner.
Lin Shan deliberately changed into her most alluring dress and put on her precious pearl earrings. She proudly raised her glass and clinked it with Chief Officer Fang’s. “It’s our duty to help the government solve its problems. You’re too kind!”
Chief Officer Fang was just about to praise Lin Shan in front of Mayor Shen, but one of the service staff gently pushed open the door and said, “Sorry, there’s a Miss Qiu who wants to come in. She said she has something to tell you…”
Mayor Shen and Chief Officer Fang looked at each other and hurriedly stood up from their chairs to adjust their clothes, before letting the service staff bring Qiu Tong in.
At this moment, the hearts of the two officials were thumping. They guessed Qiu Tong’s motive for this visit and were slightly nervous.
Lin Shan frowned. She found their reaction strange.
Qiu Tong pushed the door open and was not surprised to see Lin Shan. She just looked at Chief Officer Fang and Mayor Shen and said calmly, “I’ve already found a solution to the allergy problem and a way to curb the speed at which the locust plague is spreading.”

chapters.title: Chapter 124 - Something Bad Happened In The Grain Fields
chapters.content:
Chapter 124: Something Bad Happened In The Grain Fields
Mayor Shen’s right eyelid twitched violently when he heard Qiu Tong’s words.
He thought that Qiu Tong was worried that the locust pesticide would cause a huge commotion and implicate the Qiu family. He hurriedly explained Lin Shan’s situation to her. “Miss Qiu, Miss Lin Shan has already thought of a solution to the locust pesticide problem.”
“The protective gear developed by their factory can prevent the pesticide from making contact with human skin.”
“Don’t worry, I’ve already sent people to control the spread of the rumors. The discussion about the Qiu family’s locust pesticide won’t continue…”
Mayor Shen was trying his best to please Qiu Tong, wanting to put her at ease.
Lin Shan, on the other hand, became arrogant and smug. She sat at the round table and tilted her head to look at Qiu Tong. She said sarcastically, “Sigh, I beg you, Miss Qiu, please think twice before doing anything in the future. Otherwise, you keep troubling others to clean up after your mess. How annoying…”
“You must have heard the news that Chief Officer Fang and Mayor Shen invited me to dinner and specially came here to claim credit, right?”
Lin Shan fiddled with her nails, not noticing that Chief Officer Fang and Mayor Shen’s faces had turned pale. They stole glances at Qiu Tong’s face, their bodies trembling.
“Stop dreaming! You have no business being here. Go home and take care of your children!”
Lin Shan still wanted to say something, but Mayor Shen suddenly interrupted her fiercely, “Don’t spout nonsense!”
“The locust pesticide developed by Miss Qiu Tong is very helpful to us. The allergies are just a small problem. It’s not worth mentioning…”
Lin Shan looked up in surprise, her gaze wandering between Mayor Shen and Qiu Tong. She retorted indignantly, “What small problem? If not for our protective apparatus being so effective, the farmers would definitely not be able to control the situation with the locust plague now! The higher-ups will blame us!”
As the three of them argued, a subordinate pushed open the door and rushed in.
The subordinate looked at everyone present and tried to slow his breathing as he said to Mayor Shen, “Something bad has happened to the grain fields.”
“The use of protective gear by the farmers solved the problem of the locust pesticide. However, the materials used to make the clothes are very thick and there are very few ventilation holes. The farmers got heat stroke after spraying for a period of time… several men have already fainted and are still unconscious!”
The subordinate glanced at Lin Shan and added, “Also, the weight of the protective suit exceeds all previous standards.”
“The farmers already have to slow down their pace to carry the locust pesticide equipment. With the additional weight of the protective gear, their efficiency is greatly reduced.”
“After the relevant experts examined the scene, they say that if they still can’t find a solution, the locust plague might really spin out of control!”
The subordinate’s words were like an invisible slap to Lin Shan’s face.
Lin Shan was a little embarrassed. She averted her gaze and lifted her chin guiltily. She stubbornly said, “Making protective gear is the only solution!”
“If the protective gear doesn’t work, we can only blame the fact that there’s an issue with the development of the pesticide!”
“Didn’t Qiu Tong say that she has a solution? Why don’t we listen…”
“The Qiu family is always bragging. I wonder if what she says is true this time. Don’t tell me she will get her child to develop a new locust pesticide?”
Lin Shan gritted her teeth and glared at Qiu Tong mockingly, trying to provoke her. She wanted Qiu Tong to be blamed for everything!

chapters.title: Chapter 125 - Disrespect
chapters.content:
Chapter 125: Disrespect
Mayor Shen looked at Qiu Tong worriedly, afraid that she would turn on him on the spot and Mr. Jin Yang about this matter, thus implicating his position.
At the same time, he did not believe that Qiu Tong would be able to think of a way to completely solve the locust pesticide problem. Mayor Shen hurriedly tried to smooth things over. “This is an important matter. We have to slowly discuss countermeasures. Miss Qiu, don’t be too rash.”
“You can’t be blamed for this…”
Qiu Tong took out her phone with an indifferent expression and dialed the military base officer on her contact list.
The call was picked up after a few seconds. The officer asked happily, “Miss Qiu, are you still coming to modify aircraft today?”
Qiu Tong replied calmly, “No, I’ll give you a location later.”
“Send the modified helicopters from the base over. I need to use them now.”
The officer had received Song Yan’s order in advance to follow Qiu Tong’s instructions and immediately agreed.
Lin Shan listened with widened eyes. When Qiu Tong hung up, she said mockingly, “Yo, are you trying to scare me?”
“How can a civilian come into contact with helicopters from a military base? And they are sending it over for you to use?”
“Who do you think you are?”
Mayor Shen and Chief Officer Fang looked at each other and similarly felt that Qiu Tong’s words could not be trusted. They were well aware of the strict protocols of military bases. If a basic-level officer was to casually deploy military aircraft, even if they were abandoned aircraft, he would be severely punished.
However, when they thought of Qiu Tong’s background and status, they unanimously defended her and retorted to Lin Shan, “Miss Qiu has a high status.”
“As long as Miss Qiu Tong says so, she must be confident of it!”
Lin Shan was stunned. She sized up Chief Officer Fang and Mayor Shen suspiciously, sensing that their attitude towards Qiu Tong was a little different.
Lin Shan seemed to have thought of something. She stared at Qiu Tong and said, “I didn’t expect you to be so capable.”
“You managed to hook up with two high-ranking officials, the Chief Officer and the Mayor at the same time, and even have them get along so harmoniously with each other?”
“What method did you use? Skills in bed? Or just relying on your sweet mouth?”
Lin Shan sneered sarcastically, “I need to learn from you!”
When Chief Officer Fang and Mayor Shen heard Lin Shan’s nonsense, their expressions changed in fright. They stopped her with a harsh voice and reminded her, “Lin Shan! Don’t slander high-ranking government officials! Don’t slander people without thinking!” Their words were clearly hinting at something, but Lin Shan did not understand.
A dead silence fell. Lin Shan glared at Qiu Tong angrily.
Bang!
The door of the room was pushed open from the outside. Shu Xian, who had been invited, rushed over a little later. He personally brought a second batch of protective gear with him. He was so stupid that he didn’t notice the abnormal atmosphere. Shu Xian skillfully picked up an empty wine glass and filled it himself. He looked at Mayor Shen and said, “Our factory has finally produced it after working overtime!”
“The protective apparatus has solved the problems of Chief Officer Fang and Mayor Shen, but it’s a loss-making business for us.”
Shu Xian finished the red wine in his glass. He raised his hand to wipe the stain at the corner of his mouth. He pretended to mention casually. “I heard that there’s an empty space east of the city. The government has the right to use it. Its location is quite good. Our factory has been expanding recently. We just happen to need a piece of land to build a new factory.”
“Chief Officer Fang and Mayor Shen, why don’t you help me out on this?”

chapters.title: Chapter 126 - Dont Ask For Benefits
chapters.content:
Chapter 126: Don’t Ask For Benefits
Mayor Shen was in a very bad mood because of Lin Shan’s nonsense. Now with Shu Xian’s greedy and straightforward demand for benefits, his expression darkened.
Mayor Shen remembered that Shu Xian had received the government order through Lin Shan’s introduction. He said in a harsh and official tone, “The government has arranged for that piece of land to be used by outstanding enterprises. It can only be allocated after a bidding process and vetting the qualifications of the enterprises.”
“We have no right to privately promise it to anyone. Mr. Shu Xian, please apply for this piece of land through proper channels.”
Shu Xian frowned. Was producing the protective apparatus not enough to give him the right to the land? He stared at Mayor Shen unhappily.
Mayor Shen pondered for a long time before reminding, “The government will be increasingly strict with the corporate governance of companies. The management of the company must abide by the law. I advise Mr. Shu Xian not to think of using nefarious methods to gain profits. Otherwise, once an investigation is carried out, we will definitely do things according to the law!”
When Shu Xian heard this, he immediately nudged Lin Shan and asked in a low voice, “Didn’t you say that if we help the government we will definitely benefit in the future?”
“They are turning against me now? What’s going on?”
Shu Xian was overwhelmed with anger and did not care that everyone at present could hear his questions. “You were the one who persuaded me to accept the order.”
“These protective gear are not profitable at all. Hurry up and think of a way to persuade them to give me that piece of land!”
At the bottom of the round table, Lin Shan gently kicked Shu Xian’s feet, wanting him to shut up.
However, Shu Xian did not react. Already drunk, he kept nagging at Lin Shan. She was so embarrassed that her face was flushed red. Her eyes flickered as she frowned.
Mayor Shen and Chief Officer Fang were both smart people. They immediately saw through Lin Shan’s plan. She actually dared to use the government’s crisis to benefit herself. Glaring at Lin Shan, they cleared their throats, attracting Shu Xian’s attention.
Chief Officer Fang clenched his fists and put them to his lips. He frowned and said, “Don’t say anymore!”
“Not only is the protective gear made by the factory ineffective, it even harmed the farmers and delayed their work…”
“As for Lin Shan, she slandered and spread rumors about government officials. I’ll keep these offences in mind for the time being. If you dare to spout nonsense again, I’ll make you account for everything!”
Mayor Shen looked at Qiu Tong’s exceptionally calm expression and said on her behalf, “As for the locust pesticide, you don’t have to interfere anymore.”
“Miss Qiu Tong will settle it…”
When Shu Xian heard this, he raised his eyebrows in disdain. He put on a ruffian stance and picked up a piece of fatty meat with his chopsticks, stuffing it into his mouth. He glanced at Qiu Tong, not believing that she could think of a solution.
“With her status as a single mother with no backing and no business?”
“Do you think she can solve such a big problem like the locust plague? How? With that glib tongue of hers?”
Shu Xian patted his own face and smiled. He asked, “Or with her face?”
“Who will help her?”
At this moment, the sound of a helicopter came from outside the glass window of the hotel suite. Qiu Tong raised her wristwatch and calculated the time. She said calmly, “Quite punctual.” As soon as she finished speaking, Mayor Shen and Chief Officer Fang stood up in shock and disbelief. They wished they could immediately run out to take a look!
Could Qiu Tong have really gotten the helicopter to be sent over here?

chapters.title: Chapter 127 - Helicopter Slap In The Face
chapters.content:
Chapter 127: Helicopter Slap In The Face
In the private room in the restaurant, an officer pushed open the door and walked straight to Qiu Tong’s side, respectfully saluting her.
Chief Officer Fang and Mayor Shen recognized the military rank on the officer’s uniform and hurriedly got up to greet him.
However, the officer bypassed them and pulled open the curtains. A helicopter that was hovering in the air outside suddenly entered their line of sight!
Shu Xian and Lin Shan were gaping in shock. Chief Officer Fang and Mayor Shen were both thrown into a state of confusion by the commotion. The officer walked over to Qiu Tong and handed her the remote control. He said with a serious expression, “The helicopter has already been modified according to your specifications. It can be filled with locust pesticide and used to spray the fields at any time…”
Chief Officer Fang and Mayor Shen, “!!!”
Shu Xian and Lin Shan felt utterly humiliated, but they still forced themselves to say, “It looks very powerful. But who knows how it will be like when in actual use?”
“When the Qiu family first developed the locust pesticide, it also looked quite formidable.”
“What happened in the end? There were so many defects and only caused trouble for the farmers. It resolved nothing!”
When Qiu Tong heard their jealous and resentful words, a mocking smile appeared on her lips. She kindly suggested. “Instead of staying here to make sarcastic remarks, why don’t you return to your factory to see the situation there?”
“I heard that the families of the farmers who suffered from heatstroke have already surrounded the factory in protest.”
“If things get out of hand and they charge in to destroy some important equipment, I’m afraid your losses will be magnified.”
Shu Xian and Lin Shan immediately glared at Qiu Tong resentfully. They grabbed their things and left in a hurry.
…
At the villa, Qiu Tong rushed home to check on Qiu Xingyuan after settling the helicopter.
Due to the problem with the locust pesticide, Qiu Xingyuan had locked himself up at home for several days. Every day, apart from maintaining his stamina by eating two mouthfuls of rice, he would spend the rest of the time cooped up in his room, focused on researching allergic reactions to the pesticide.
Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu were worried about Qiu Xingyuan, so they stayed at home to accompany him.
Qiu Xingyuan was busy calculating the formula ratio in the room. Little Yu pouted and hid at the door, peeping at his back profile through the gap in the door. She quietly tugged at Qiu Xingqiao’s sleeve and said, “Second Brother, won’t Eldest Brother be very hungry?”
“Can we bring some fruit over for him?”
Qiu Xingqiao looked at the plate of apples on the desk that had already turned dark from oxidation. He shook his head and rubbed Little Yu’s head. He tried his best to coax her, “We’ll just quietly accompany Eldest Brother. Don’t disturb him.”
Little Yu nodded worriedly. Qiu Xingqiao looked at the clock on the wall and pursed his thin lips. He was waiting for Qiu Tong to return.
When Qiu Tong returned home, Little Yu hurriedly ran into her arms and hugged her waist.
“Mommy, why are you back so late? Eldest Brother hasn’t come out for a long time…”
Little Yu’s childish voice was choked as she spoke. Qiu Tong patted the top of her head and pushed open the door to call Qiu Xingyuan out. She said seriously, “The problem regarding the allergic reactions to the pesticide has been solved. You don’t have to worry too much.”
Qiu Xingyuan raised his tired eyes and looked at Qiu Tong. “You don’t have to comfort me.”
Although Qiu Xingqiao hoped that it would be as she said, his eyes were filled with suspicion and disbelief. “How did you solve it?”
Little Yu raised her innocent face, her eyes flickering as she asked, “Mommy, is that true?”

chapters.title: Chapter 128 - Working The Fields
chapters.content:
Chapter 128: Working The Fields
Qiu Tong’s phone buzzed twice and a message popped up on the screen. “The grain fields are ready. You can carry out the spraying mission anytime.”
seeing her remain silent, Qiu Xingyuan guessed that Qiu Tong must have fabricated a lie to comfort him. He turned around to return to his room.
Qiu Tong blocked his way and looked at the time on her watch. She snapped her fingers and said, “I’ll give you 10 minutes to change your clothes. Mommy will bring you to the grain fields so that you see the solution to the problem with your own eyes! I promise you’ll be satisfied.”
Qiu Tong’s gaze landed on Qiu Xingyuan’s face. She raised her eyebrows slightly, indicating for him to believe her.
Qiu Xingyuan and Little Yu turned to look at Qiu Xingyuan. He pursed his thin lips and nodded. Perhaps he could trust her this once…
The three children rushed back to their room to change before gathering beside Qiu Tong.
In the grain fields, a heavily modified helicopter was parked at the top of the field. It was extremely eye-catching.
