The officer, Mayor Shen and the rest were standing beside the helicopter, waiting for Qiu Tong’s arrival. The farmers were gathered not far away and discussed in low voices, “They are involving a helicopter now? They should just stop tormenting our fields.”
When the Qiu family arrived at the wheat field, the three children gasped and widened their eyes in disbelief!
Qiu Xingqiao had always liked military equipment. Now that he could see it with his own eyes, he turned around excitedly and asked, “Can I touch it?”
Qiu Tong nodded with a smile. The officer brought Qiu Xingqiao into the helicopter. He touched the metal sheet and the cockpit seat, his eyes shining with joy.
The officer handed the remote control to Qiu Tong and reported the situation. “The spraying box has been filled with locust pesticide. It can be launched at any time.”
Qiu Tong called the three children back to her side and skillfully keyed in the locust pesticide route and procedures. With the rapid rotation of the propeller, the helicopter steadily rose into the air and sailed off. Qiu Xingyuan looked at Qiu Tong’s operation in surprise. His gaze changed from suspicion to admiration.
Sensing their gazes, Qiu Tong squatted down and explained, “These are the control buttons.”
“Here are the buttons to control dosage and elevation. If you want the helicopter to return, press the red button.”
“The green button will command the helicopter to stop in midair and spray heavily on areas heavily affected by the locusts.”
Qiu Xingyuan listened attentively and nodded from time to time. Qiu Tong placed the remote control in his hand and encouraged him, “Go ahead and try.”
“Me?”
Qiu Xingyuan was a little surprised, but he realized that the officer did not stop Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong replied firmly and gently, “That’s right. You are the one who developed the locust pesticide. Don’t worry, Mommy will help you.”
The two of them controlled the helicopter and sprayed the locust pesticide steadily. When the farmers witnessed the efficient operations, their resentment and anger towards the Qiu family was swept away. Instead, they started to praise the Qiu family. “Did you see that? I didn’t expect the children of the Qiu family to be such prodigies. Not only can they develop pesticides, they can also control aircraft!”
“That’s right. Thankfully Qiu Tong was able to think of such a method to help us. It really saved us a lot of trouble!”
“This is the first time I’ve seen someone spray locust pesticide with a helicopter. This is really an eye-opener. Qiu Tong is so awesome!”
A peasant girl with a ponytail said enviously, “I want to work hard to become someone like her!”
When Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao, and Little Yu heard this, they raised their proud little faces, their eyes filled with pride and joy.
Meanwhile, the protective gear factory not far from the fields was in chaos…

chapters.title: Chapter 129 - Factory Storm
chapters.content:
Chapter 129: Factory Storm
The families of the farmers who had suffered heat stroke had gathered at the entrance of the weapons factory, sitting there cross-legged with banners raised, demanding an explanation.
The moment Shu Xian and Lin Shan’s car stopped, they rushed over and surrounded the two of them. They shouted loudly, “Evil enterprise!”
“Show us the quality report of the protective gear! It must be a lousy product. It was made to fool us…”
One of the farmer’s wives pushed Lin Shan. She put on a fierce stance and took out her phone to shoot Lin Shan and Shu Xian. She muttered, “Everyone, look. The boss of a business which collaborated with the government. They used inferior material to make the protective gear in order to earn more profits!”
“Expose this evil factory!”
Shu Xian and Lin Shan covered their faces with their hands and dodged wretchedly.
Seeing that the situation was gradually spiraling out of control, Shu Xian had no choice but to compromise and say, “Go and register your personal information. I will compensate you!”
“Will that be fine?”
When they heard about compensation, the farmers’ wives exchanged looks and released their hands. They threw the banners to the ground, dusted off their clothes, and left to collect their money.
Shu Xian was in a terrible mood when he saw his cash just flying away.
Meanwhile, the surrounding staff members complained with mocking expressions, “Boss Shu, Miss Lin Shan promised us!”
“As long as we can complete the production of the protective gear on time, the factory will give us a bonus, as well as an increase in salary and time-off!”
“Don’t go back on your word. Otherwise, we will also raise banners and stage a protest!”
Cheers rang out around them after the leader of the workers finished speaking. Blood surging, Shu Xian pointed at them and scolded, “Get lost, all of you get lost!”
“Who promised you a bonus? Whoever doesn’t want to continue working, pack your things and get lost!”
The workers had already expected such a reaction from Shu Xian. Carrying their work hats, they returned to the factory cursing.
Shu Xian glared at Lin Shan angrily and vented all his anger on her. He scolded loudly, “It’s all your fault!”
“Didn’t you say that working with the government will be beneficial? Where are the benefits? Not only did we not get the piece of land, I even had to pay out compensation!”
“How unlucky. Do you know how much money I lost in this deal?”
Shu Xian was about to go crazy as he glared at Lin Shan. Lin Shan tried to shift the blame. “Actually, Mayor Shen and Chief Officer Fang wanted us to modify our protective gear and continue our collaboration. It’s Qiu Tong! I don’t know where that slut got a helicopter to go against us!”
“She’s the one who ruined our plans!”
Lin Shan kept inciting Shu Xian. As expected, she saw an intense hatred surge in his eyes. She secretly gritted her teeth and decided to settle the score with Qiu Tong.
Meanwhile at the grain fields, the first round of locust pesticide spraying was completed in just a few hours.
Mayor Shen and the farmers thanked Qiu Tong. Seeing that it was getting late, Qiu Tong left with the three children.
In the fields, Little Yu waved her arms energetically and chattered about her excitement at seeing the helicopter. “It’s so big and noisy!”
“But Mommy is so awesome! She can control such a big aircraft!”
“Eldest Brother is amazing too… he learned very quickly!”
Qiu Tong smiled. She could feel the changes in the children’s feelings for her.
Extremely satisfied, she held Qiu Xingyuan’s hand. This time, Qiu Xingyuan did not break free. Instead, he gently gripped her fingers and gave a faint smile.
As the sun set, the four of them returned to the villa, only to see a handsome figure standing at the door.
When Song Yan heard their voices, he raised his head slightly and beckoned Qiu Tong with a wicked smile. “Why are you only back now?”
“I’m here to fulfill our promise…”

chapters.title: Chapter 130 - Fulfilling The Agreement
chapters.content:
Chapter 130: Fulfilling The Agreement
Song Yan raised his eyebrows lazily and winked suggestively.
These suggestive words instantly made the three children wary. Qiu Xingyuan immediately released Qiu Tong’s hand and pursed his thin lips to look at her in disappointment.
Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu hurriedly ran to Qiu Tong and spread their arms wide in front of her to protect her.
What agreement did they have?!
Was Qiu Tong going to leave with him? Was today’s helicopter performance their final gift?
This uneasy thought lingered in the children’s minds, causing them to glare at Song Yan nervously.
Song Yan found their reaction exceptionally interesting. He took out a brown leather token and threw it to Qiu Tong. The item flew in a perfect arc through the air and landed firmly in Qiu Tong’s arms. She opened the red seal and read the words, before looking up in surprise.
“It’s the military base’s official seal of approval. As long as you have it, you can use the drones freely without me or the officers.”
“This is our agreement. I’ve already done it.”
Song Yan explained in a serious tone. The three children’s tense nerves relaxed slightly and they heaved a sigh of relief.
Qiu Xingyuan stared at him coldly. He had a nagging feeling that Song Yan had some ulterior motive towards Qiu Tong. He could not put his finger on it…
Qiu Xingqiao glared at Song Yan and muttered angrily, “You should have just gotten someone to send this lousy thing over. Why did you have to come here?”
Song Yan shrugged. He leaned forward slightly and bent over so that his gaze was level with his. He deliberately said, “Of course I have to deliver this personally, because I need to find an opportunity to see your mommy. Who knows, we might meet more and more in the future.”
He smiled wickedly and winked. Qiu Xingqiao was speechless from anger at his shameless manner.
Little Yu stuck her hands on her hips and stomped her feet. She pouted and said, “No! We won’t allow you to see Mommy!”
Song Yan looked at the adorable Qiu Xingyu and pretended to ask, “Why? I’ll buy you lots of candy and bring you out to play!”
Little Yu covered her ears with her hands and kept shaking her head. She objected. “No!”
“We don’t like you…”
Song Yan put on an exaggerated show of disappointment. He covered his heart with his hand, looking as if his heart had been broken into pieces.
Qiu Tong chuckled helplessly at their interaction.
When Song Yan heard her laughter, his eyes flickered with interest as he said, “I didn’t even have the chance to ask last time. Where did you learn to modify the aircraft?”
Qiu Tong recalled that in her previous life, she had once used a drone to blow up the group of zombies chasing after her.
If she told them the truth, the three children would probably be traumatized, right?
Especially Little Yu. She was very timid. If she watched some scary cartoons, she would end up unable to sleep at night…
At the thought of this, Qiu Tong replied half-heartedly, “I usually pay attention to military matters. Perhaps I have some talent?”
“Consider me lucky.”
Song Yan did not believe her, but he didn’t probe further.
A fiery red sunset appeared in the sky. Song Yan sighed deeply and said, “I might have to be away for some time.”
“There are riots and terrorists in the neighboring province. The unrest needs to be suppressed.”
Song Yan’s gaze landed on Qiu Tong and the three children. He reminded them in a gentlemanly manner, “You have to be careful and protect yourselves.”
“If something happens…”
Before Song Yan could finish speaking, Qiu Xingyuan interrupted coldly, “It’s not your place to worry about our family matters!”

chapters.title: Chapter 131 - Turn Of The Tide
chapters.content:
Chapter 131: Turn Of The Tide
On television, a reporter carried a camera to the grain fields. When he learned that the plague had been controlled, he praised Qiu Tong for her efforts!
“Qiu Tong used a modified drone to spray locust pesticide. Not only did it increase efficiency, the equipment was also provided free of charge to help the farmers minimize their losses.”
“The locust pesticide distributed by the government was developed by Qiu Tong’s eldest son, Qiu Xingyuan. He is still in kindergarten and can be considered a young genius!”
The news reported about Qiu Tong and her family. More and more people on the Internet were paying attention to this matter and had given them the title of “Locust Destroyer Hero”. Praise for them could be seen everywhere.
Mayor Shen wanted to throw a banquet for Qiu Tong’s family in celebration.
Qiu Tong found it too troublesome so she refused politely, “I’m afraid my children won’t have time. Thank you for your kindness.”
Mayor Shen was a little surprised, but he quickly put the matter aside and confirmed with her about the locust pesticide spraying in the next few days.
Meanwhile, Lin Shan turned on her computer. Jealousy and resentment clouded her rationality. She gritted her teeth and opened the online forum page, registering an anonymous account to post a thread. Lin Shan uploaded a video of the kindergarten’s entrance onto the Internet. After adding some misleading words, she pressed the send button in satisfaction.
“Qiu Tong used a modified aircraft to spray pesticide to make up for the Qiu family’s mistake!”
“The locust pesticide developed by Qiu Xingyuan has a very serious allergen. Many farmers are still hospitalized because of the Qiu family’s pesticide.”
“Furthermore, no one knows if the allergen will cause long-term physical side effects!”
Lin Shan propped her chin on her bright red nails and looked at the comments below the post slowly increasing. She smiled proudly as the thread went viral.
She wanted to see how Qiu Tong would be able to explain herself this time!
In an instant, the opinion on the internet changed. The red spots on the arms of many farmers were proven to be caused by usage of Qiu family’s locust pesticide.
Qiu Tong’s earlier reputation had risen too high and she was suffering a major backlash now.
Netizens who were jealous of her started all sorts of rumors, attacking and slandering her. Even the three underage children were also implicated.
The rumors mixed truth and lies, confusing the rest of the public. It was easy to lead them to question the Qiu family’s original intention in helping the farmers eliminate the locusts…
In the villa, Qiu Xingyuan saw the comments on the internet and depressedly locked himself in his room again.
Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu sat in the living room with worried expressions. They did not even want to watch their favorite cartoon. They only sighed quietly.
Qiu Tong saw the rumors on the internet and knew the crucial thing now was to prove Qiu Xingyuan’s innocence. To prove that there was no problem with his locust pesticide.
Only by solving the root cause could they eliminate all those slanders and doubts.
Qiu Tong walked to the balcony and called Mayor Shen. In just two seconds, Mayor Shen answered the call and asked, “Miss Qiu?”
“Did you see those online rumors? I’ve already arranged…”
Qiu Tong interrupted Mayor Shen and asked in a mild voice, “A while ago, you mentioned that you would be holding a celebratory banquet? Is it going ahead as planned?”
“Will the pharmaceutical supervisor in charge of the production of the pesticide attend?”
Mayor Shen replied seriously, “Yes. He’s the person in charge of a major component of our battle against the locusts. Of course, he will attend and make a report.”
A comprehensive plan surfaced in Qiu Tong’s mind. She said calmly, “Please send me a few invitation cards then.”
“I’ll bring the children to attend.”

chapters.title: Chapter 132 - Going To The Banquet To Clarify
chapters.content:
Chapter 132: Going To The Banquet To Clarify
That night, Qiu Tong held a family meeting. When they found out that she was planning to find out the truth behind the locust pesticide allergy issue at the celebration banquet, the children were all excited.
Qiu Xingqiao said with burning eyes, “What do you need me to do? Just tell me!”
Little Yu nodded vigorously. She rubbed her eyes sleepily but forced herself to stay awake. “I also want to do my part for this operation!”
Qiu Tong looked at them in relief. She raised her hand to rub the top of Qiu Xingyuan’s head. She looked at Qiu Xingyuan and said, “I need you to develop a truth serum.”
“Truth serum?”
Qiu Xingyuan narrowed his eyes and repeated the name in confusion. He had never heard of it before…
Qiu Tong pulled out two blank pieces of paper and wrote down the principles of the truth serum. She explained. “To put it simply, this is a tranquilizer that can numb the nerves in the brain. The correct dose and ratio of these ingredients will make the person speak the truth for a short period of time. There’s no way for him to fabricate a lie.”
Qiu Xingyuan listened to her summary seriously and nodded. He took the two pieces of paper back into his room and started to research the correct dose and ratio of the ingredients.
A few days later, at the venue of the celebratory banquet, Mayor Shen, Chief Officer Fang and the rest were all there to receive interviews from the media. The scene was especially lively.
Qiu Tong was wearing a dark-colored evening gown that highlighted her graceful and charming figure. The veil on her head added to her mysterious aura.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were both wearing well-pressed tuxedos. Holding her hand, they stepped onto the red carpet and entered the banquet hall. Little Yu was holding the hem of a princess dress. Her pink face was no different from that of a princess in a cartoon.
The appearance of the family of four stunned everyone present. The news reporters and guests all raised their cameras to capture a rare and eye-catching scene.
Everyone raised their glasses to celebrate their victory in the first stage of the locust battle. Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu deliberately shifted the attention of the guests to the pharmaceutical supervisor.
“Actually, the supervisor works the hardest. He supervises the production of the pesticide in the factory every day!”
“Our elder brother has only provided a formula and guided the production process once. Actually, we should thank the supervisor for his efforts!”
Qiu Xingqiao kept praising the pharmaceutical supervisor to distract him. Qiu Xingqiao then nodded at Qiu Xingyuan. He secretly poured the truth serum into his wine and swirled it quietly.
The pharmaceutical supervisor did not expect to be the main hero. He was so happy that his mouth was agape as he said repeatedly, “You’re too kind, too kind!”
Qiu Tong raised her glass and looked at him indifferently. “Let me toast you…”
After she finished speaking, she downed her red wine. Mayor Shen, Chief Officer Fang and the rest followed suit. The pharmaceutical supervisor finished the wine with the truth serum. Although he found the taste a little strange, he didn’t think too much about it and continued to chat with the surrounding people.
After calculating the time for the truth serum to be effective, Qiu Xingqiao set the trap. “Uncle Supervisor is really amazing.”
“If you hadn’t made the decision to shorten the process of making the locust pesticide, things wouldn’t have been resolved so quickly.”
“According to Elder Brother’s method, the locust plague will probably continue to spread for some time… how did you manage to come up with a way to shorten the process?”
Qiu Xingqiao deliberately blinked innocently. The pharmaceutical supervisor was too pleased with himself. Coupled with the effects of the truth serum, he quickly confessed, “Actually, it’s nothing special. It’s just that the process of making the serum is too cumbersome. I got the workers to mix the ingredients by instinct, without needing to measure.”
“It also took too long to filter the impurities from the pesticide. It would take an hour or two. So I got the workers to do away with the filtering process…”
The pharmaceutical supervisor did not sense that something was amiss and continued to speak. However, Qiu Xingyuan immediately looked at him with a cold face and frowned as he refuted, “I did not permit doing away with the filtering process. In fact, I specifically reminded you that it is very important to filter!”

chapters.title: Chapter 133 - Problematic Supervisor
chapters.content:
Chapter 133: Problematic Supervisor
When the pharmaceutical supervisor heard Qiu Xingyuan’s words, he was slightly shocked. His rationality told him that he had to shut up now and steer away from this matter.
However, his body seemed to be out of control. He muttered to himself, “The impurities removed after each filtering was only a few grams. It’s completely negligible. What’s the point? I’m the supervisor of pharmaceutical production. Can’t I make the decision to delete it?”
“Although you’re the inventor of the pesticide, you’re just a child. Do I have to listen to everything you say?”
“I’ve been a pharmaceutical supervisor for more than 10 years, and I’ve never made any mistake.”
“I can also make a profit from it by removing the filtering process. Why not?”
The pharmaceutical supervisor revealed all his motives for doing things. Qiu Tong was recording with her phone. Seeing his pale face, she raised the corners of her lips and said fiercely, “So you are the one who caused the locust pesticide to produce an allergic reaction.”
“You have to bear the consequences yourself. Don’t even think about throwing the blame on me and Qiu Xingyuan!”
“I’ll make you pay the price. You better go back and think about how you’re going to apologize and make it up to us!”
Qiu Tong glared at him before turning to leave. After the effects of the serum wore off, the pharmaceutical supervisor wished that he could give himself a few slaps. He collapsed to the ground, his legs weak.
Although there were reporters at the celebration party, Qiu Tong was worried that they would be bribed by the pharmaceutical supervisor, so she decided to release the recording online.
“Although the filtering process is complicated, it’s necessary.”
“During the mixing process of the pesticide, there will be granular crystals that can easily cause allergies. They can be filtered out.”
“However, due to the arbitrary actions of the pharmaceutical supervisor, the locust pesticide gave rise to extremely strong side effects and allergies…”
“This matter has nothing to do with Qiu Xingyuan, the inventor of the pesticide. Please investigate.”
When the evidence and explanation was released on the internet, Mayor Shen knew that Qiu Tong had been wronged. He also arranged for people to help promote the post.
Soon, the farmers learned the truth. They all cursed the evil pharmaceutical supervisor while expressing their apologies to Qiu Xingyuan.
“Although he’s just a child, he is truly capable.”
“We looked down on a child just because he is younger than us and even made him suffer so much grievance and injustice. We owe him an apology!”
The topic “Apologize to Qiu Xingyuan” gradually climbed to the top of online search engines. More and more farmers started to protest, forcing the pharmaceutical supervisor to step out and apologize sincerely, acknowledging all his mistakes.
In the villa, Qiu Tong looked at the children who had been looking at their phones and shook her head helplessly.
Qiu Xingyuan looked at the clarification post and felt touched. He stole a glance at Qiu Tong and accidentally met her eyes. He immediately cleared his throat awkwardly and looked away. Rubbing the tip of his nose, he stood up and returned to his room.
Little Yu looked at his departing profile and ran over to Qiu Tong’s side. She looked up and said, “Elder Brother is very happy.”
Qiu Tong nodded. “I know.”
Meanwhile, Lin Shan saw that the tables had turned. She couldn’t figure out why Qiu Tong was always so lucky!
She indignantly found the video that she had secretly recorded a few years ago. In the video, Qiu Tong was scolding the children angrily with a fierce expression… Lin Shan snorted coldly and uploaded the video onto the internet before pressing the release button.

chapters.title: Chapter 134 - Mother And Children Reconcile
chapters.content:
Chapter 134: Mother And Children Reconcile
The video of Qiu Tong scolding the children firmly occupied the top trending search of all major online search engines. Many passersby reposted the video and criticized Qiu Tong’s ruthlessness.
“Is this their biological mother? How could she bear to hit such cute children?”
“She’s simply not fit to be a mother! I strongly request the relevant departments to investigate and strip her of her custody. Give those children a chance at a happy childhood!”
Public opinion suddenly changed again. Qiu Tong saw the former owner of her body in the video scolding and beating Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao with a ferocious expression, rebuking them with especially harsh words. Her heart ached. She frowned and glanced at the three small figures sitting in the living room. She wanted to go over to them but was afraid of scaring them.
When Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao saw the video, their nearly-healed psychological trauma was awakened again.
They quietly clenched their fists and shielded Little Yu, not wanting her to see the video. Their bodies were tense and their thin lips were trembling.
“You’re all illegitimate children. You should all die!”
“Get lost. Don’t let me see you, eyesores…”
Qiu Tong’s cursing and swearing echoed in his ears. Qiu Xingyuan’s pupils constricted. Sensing Qiu Tong’s gaze on them from afar, he held Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu’s hands as they returned to their room. The originally harmonious relationship between the children was attacked by an anonymous video. Their relationship became awkward and distant.
“Elder Brother, we…”
Qiu Xingqiao sat on the edge of the bed. He wanted to say that Qiu Tong seemed to have changed, but recalling the video footage, he could only hang his head low and grip the corner of the bedsheet in loneliness.
Knock knock—
Qiu Tong made three cups of hot milk in the kitchen and placed them on a tray before knocking lightly on the door.
Little Yu innocently ran to Qiu Tong’s side and took the initiative to distribute the milk to Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao. She pulled Qiu Tong to sit at the desk. “Mommy, do you have something to say to us?”
Little Yu was very considerate. She sensed that the atmosphere was a little off.
Qiu Tong nodded and said sincerely, “Although it sounds like an excuse, Mommy regrets what she did to you…”
“After watching the video, Mommy knows how much you’ve suffered in the past.”
“You are all the most precious gifts from the heavens to Mommy. You are the most adorable and obedient children. Mommy owes you this apology.”
Qiu Tong’s gaze landed on Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao. She sighed and continued, “I’ll try my best to make it up to you in the future. I won’t let you suffer anymore. I also hope that you can supervise Mommy. If Mommy does anything wrong or makes you feel uncomfortable, you can tell me directly.”
“Mommy will work hard to change.”
Little Yu was stunned. Her eyes were already red and moist. Qiu Tong rubbed the top of her head and asked, “Can you forgive Mommy?”
Qiu Xingyuan gritted his teeth and tried his best to maintain a stubborn and cold expression, but his eyes were also red.
Qiu Xingqiao was able to maintain his stance at first, but when he heard Qiu Tong say “I’m sorry”, his tears flowed uncontrollably. He could only keep wiping his tears with his hands.
Little Yu nodded vigorously and threw herself into Qiu Tong’s arms. She cried, “Yes! Little Yu doesn’t blame Mommy anymore!”
Qiu Xingqiao also grunted twice to show his assent.
Qiu Tong took a deep breath and pulled the three children into her arms, hugging them tightly.
No matter how strong Qiu Xingyuan was, he could not help crying weakly at this moment. The barrier between mother and son completely dissolved at this moment.
Qiu Tong could feel the children’s dependence and warmth. Her eyes turned red as she secretly swore to protect their happy lives from harm and bullying.

chapters.title: Chapter 135 - Solution
chapters.content:
Chapter 135: Solution
The bedroom of the villa was a sea of tears.
Qiu Tong coaxed Little Yu to stop crying and promised softly, “Mommy will think of a solution for the video. You don’t have to worry about it.”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao exchanged glances. They waited for Qiu Tong to turn in for the night before bringing Little Yu to the living room for an emergency meeting.
The three children were dressed in their pajamas and huddled quietly on the sofa. They frowned when they saw Qiu Tong’s video spreading online.
Little Yu finally understood why her siblings were behaving so strangely. She pouted and suggested, “Why don’t I hack the video and delete it?”
“I just need to modify and block the source code of the video. No one will be able to view the video on the website!”
“I can also remove all the trending searches online. It will be a very simple task… I can do everything quickly!”
Little Yu said confidently. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao also felt that the method was feasible.
Just as the two of them were about to nod at her to confirm the details, they heard light footsteps coming from the darkness.
Qiu Xingyuan immediately stopped talking. Qiu Xingqiao glared fiercely at Ye Luan, who had just come out of the room. He put his index finger to his lips and said, “Shh!”
“Don’t let some annoying fellow overhear our plan!”
Ye Luan had been feeling a little thirsty and was about to go to the kitchen to fetch water. This was when he chanced upon the children discussing. When he heard Qiu Xingqiao’s hostile words, he stood in front of the water dispenser with an indifferent expression. He did not speak up to defend himself.
In the dim light of the living room, all four children had different expressions. The atmosphere was a little comical.
Qiu Xingqiao clenched his fists and muttered angrily, “Perhaps he came out on purpose just to make fun of us.”
“He must have seen the video online…”
When Ye Luan heard Qiu Xingqiao’s conjecture, he turned around and interrupted him coldly. With an indifferent expression, he reminded him, “Although I have no intention of participating in your plan, I am nice enough to advise you not to delete the original video.”
“Although deleting the video can temporarily reduce discussion about this, it might cause more serious misunderstandings. People might think that Auntie Qiu is deliberately hiding the truth.”
“The netizens’ attitude towards her will become even worse. What you need to do is to solve the problem from the root. For example… you need to personally respond and clarify things.”
Ye Luan was grateful for Qiu Tong’s care. After he finished his suggestion, he turned around and returned to his room, closing the door with a bang.
The three children had conflicted expressions after being scolded by him.
Qiu Xingqiao frowned and retorted in a hoarse voice, “We know that too. There’s no need for him to tell us!”
“He’s just a few years older than us, but already knows how to put on airs! Hmph…”
Qiu Xingyuan sat silently at the side. Instead, it was Little Yu who quietly tugged at Qiu Xingqiao’s sleeve. She said in a small voice, “Second Brother, Brother Ye Luan seems to be making sense. Even if we delete the existing videos, someone might release more.”
“Why don’t we record a video to clarify things?”
Little Yu stared at Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao with sparkling eyes. They looked a little awkward and did not answer, but in their hearts, they had already tacitly approved of this plan of action.
Qiu Xingyuan took the initiative to find a suitable location to record the video. Little Yu ran quietly around the living room to fetch the necessary things. Qiu Xingyuan adjusted the height of the camera.
The three children were ready and Qiu Xingyuan pressed the start button.

chapters.title: Chapter 136 - Video Clarification
chapters.content:
Chapter 136: Video Clarification
In the study room of the official residence in the morning, Jin Yang browsed the news as usual to understand the major news in the country.
The news in S City reported on Qiu Tong making a helicopter to spray locust pesticide. When Jin Yang saw that the locust plague had been controlled and the farmers were praising Qiu Tong, his eyes were filled with admiration.
Qiu Tong seemed to always be able to surprise him.
Jin Yang smiled and stared at the photo of Qiu Tong standing in the grain fields. He zoomed in with his fingertips and looked at it carefully. He then scrolled down the screen.
A news item related to Qiu Tong suddenly popped up—”Shocking! The Locust Destroyer Hero is actually a vicious mother who abuses her children!”
Jin Yang frowned as he searched for related topics and videos. He realized that this news had already climbed to the top of the search rankings.
His eyes were chilly, and his handsome face was covered in a terrifying coldness.
“Come in.”
Jin Yang called Shao An over on the intercom. He wanted him to settle this.
However, before Shao An made his move, another news item popped up. It was another video. The thumbnail was the adorable faces of Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu. As if controlled by someone, this video quickly squeezed out the previous video of Qiu Tong abusing the children to occupy the headlines.
In the video, Qiu Xingyuan faced the camera like a little adult. Qiu Xingqiao coughed nervously twice, while Little Yu smiled sweetly.
Although the three children’s attitudes were different on camera, their expressions were confident and bright. There was no sign of them being threatened.
Little Yu faced the camera and spoke first, “Recently, there have been many crooked and ugly videos of Mommy on the internet. We really can’t bear to watch anymore!”
“Mommy is very good to us, even though it’s her first time being a mother and she is still learning how to take care of us…”
“We would quarrel and throw tantrums sometimes, but Mommy is not a demon!”
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his thin lips and said seriously, “If there are any more malicious rumors slandering us, we will take legal action to pursue the perpetrators. I hope that everyone can view the truth objectively and not be fooled.”
Qiu Xingqiao nodded vigorously in agreement. “Elder Brother and Little Yu are right.”
Little Yu took out the things beside her and displayed them in front of the camera. She said, “This is the computer Mommy gave me, the wooden stakes for Second Brother, and test tubes for Eldest Brother. Eldest Brother developed the locust pesticide with these things.”
“Mommy is very supportive of our hobbies. She would rather starve herself to take care of us!”
Little Yu pursed her lips and pretended to look pitiful as she added, “Mommy took care of us alone and spent all her savings buying gifts for us. We don’t have any money now! Everyone, don’t misunderstand her anymore. Stop making wild guesses and slandering her!”
“Mommy is the best mommy in the world!”
Qiu Xingyu spoke confidently. When the netizens saw the video, they all left comments. “These three children are really too adorable!”
“Recently, there’s been a new technology used to synthesize fake videos. Perhaps the video of Qiu Tong abusing the children is a fake!”
“That’s right. If Qiu Tong really doesn’t treat the children well, they won’t have come forward to clarify. Besides, have you guys noticed the light in these children’s eyes? They’re obviously very confident and happy!”
Qiu Xingyu looked at the comments and happily held up the phone screen in front of Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao. “Success!”

chapters.title: Chapter 137 - Difference In Treatment
chapters.content:
Chapter 137: Difference In Treatment
Even through the screen, Jin Yang still felt a strong sense of intimacy with the children.
A warm smile surfaced in Jin Yang’s eyes as he repeatedly played the children’s video. He even paused to carefully observe their expressions.
Shao An cleared his throat and asked, “Mr. President, do I still need to go and settle this?”
Jin Yang looked at the online discussion about the children’s video and felt that it had been effective. He said, “No need.”
The study room was a little quiet. Shao An stole a glance at Jin Yang’s expression and guessed that he must be in a very good mood now.
After all, Jin Yang had never behaved so abnormally in the past. It seemed that Jin Yang would behave a little out-of-character when it came to Qiu Tong or the Qiu family.
Shao An sighed quietly. He had no power to complain about the president’s personal affairs. As a lowly official, he had no choice but to obey his orders. “Yes, Mr. President.”
Jin Yang narrowed his eyes and raised his head to meet his gaze. Shao An nearly choked and cleared his throat, hurriedly shifting his gaze elsewhere.
“Take a trip to S City. Find Qiu Tong and rent those modified helicopters from her.”
“The method of spraying locust pesticide using remote-controlled aircraft is very good. Although the locust plague in S City is under control, the locust plague in other cities in the country is still spreading.”
“Go and settle it…”
Jin Yang instructed in a mild tone. He personally wrote out a cheque for a considerable rental fee and handed it to Shao An.
Shao An looked at the numbers in shock and swallowed hard. He stole a glance at Jin Yang’s stern profile and asked softly, “Mr. President, is this because you heard that the children are in need of money recently? Is that why you want to use this method to give them some money?”
“Even so, isn’t this sum of money a little too much?”
“If this gets out, will other officials speculate about your relationship with Ms. Qiu Tong? Wouldn’t that be bad?”
Shao An spoke without thinking. The more he spoke, the more excited he became. He did not notice that Jin Yang’s expression was turning colder.
“Mr. President, what do you think…?”
A chill ran down Shao An’s spine. He finally stopped talking and looked at Jin Yang with an awkward smile.
Jin Yang tapped his slender fingers on the table and stared at Shao An. “How long have you been working for me?”
Shao An was so frightened that he stuttered and did not reply. Jin Yang raised his eyes and said in a light tone, “I think you have forgotten your place and status. Control your mouth. I hate noisy and nosy people the most, understand?”
“Yes, Sir!”
Shao An hurriedly grabbed the cheque and rushed out the door. After he left Jin Yang’s line of sight, he patted his chest and muttered, “I was nearly scared to death!”
The next morning, Qiu Tong woke up and checked her phone for messages. She was shocked to find hundreds of notifications.
“Support for single mother, Qiu Tong, you can do it!”
“Don’t be affected by the comments on the internet. You must live well with the children!”
“If you don’t mind, I have some children’s clothes for Little Yu to wear…”
Qiu Tong looked at the countless heartwarming comments and followed their description to find the three children’s clarification video. Her heart warmed.
At the dining table, Qiu Tong looked at the three children, who were waiting for her reaction. She raised the fruit juice in her hand and said gently, “Mommy was very touched to see the video you made for me. Thank you!”
Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu grinned.
Ding dong—
A knock on the door disrupted this warm moment. They turned their heads at the same time, confusion flashing across their eyes.

chapters.title: Chapter 138 - Communication
chapters.content:
Chapter 138: Communication
Qiu Tong opened the door and saw Shao An standing outside in his uniform. She asked in surprise, “Didn’t you go on a mission?”
Song Yan had once said that Shao An was going on a rather important mission. Could it be that it had already ended?
Qiu Tong was silently speculating in her heart. Hearing her words, Shao An was stunned for a moment. “How did you know?”
Shao An recalled that he had once told Mayor Shen about his whereabouts at the kindergarten award ceremony. He mistakenly thought the Mayor must have mentioned this to Qiu Tong. He nodded and replied, “I came here this time to borrow a modified remote-controlled aircraft from you. We want to use it on a large scale in the neighboring city.”
“Of course, we will pay you to rent it. We won’t let you work for nothing.”
“This is a cheque. If you don’t think the amount is suitable, I can go back and discuss it with my boss…”
Shao An handed over the cheque and quietly observed the change in Qiu Tong’s expression. He originally thought that she would be surprised or excited to see such a large sum of money, but on the contrary, Qiu Tong looked up at Shao An with a strange expression. She did not agree.
Did she think that it was too little money?
Shao An was surprised. Meanwhile, Qiu Tong was just thinking that it was all thanks to Song Yan that she was able to access the aircraft at the abandoned military base in the first place.
Without Song Yan’s help, she would not have been able to do all this, much less resolve the public controversy surrounding the locust plague and locust pesticide.
“I won’t accept your money. I haven’t even thanked you for this.”
“If you need the aircraft, feel free to use it…”
Shao An looked at the cheque in a daze and asked in confusion, “Thank us?”
Qiu Tong nodded, reminding Shao An of the things to take note of when using the aircraft. “He should know this. The weight of the pesticide cannot exceed the limit. Otherwise, he must strengthen the container first. I had no suitable parts so I didn’t do it.”
“Alright.”
Shao An agreed but he was thinking to himself. The president knew how to repair planes?
And how did Qiu Tong know this?!
“If there’s nothing else, I’ll go back first.”
Shao An saw that the matter was settled. Before leaving, he stopped and turned to look at Qiu Tong. He asked, “Do you have anything to say to my boss?”
Qiu Tong frowned and asked in confusion, “We meet often. What’s there to talk about?”
Shao An was rather surprised. Mr. Jin Yang had been staying in the capital to handle government affairs over the recent period…
Immediately, Shao An heard the sound of television coming from the villa. He suddenly thought that Qiu Tong had said that she often saw Jin Yang on the news. He did not ponder further and just said, “My boss will come to S City in 10 days’ time.”
Qiu Tong nodded, her face completely impassive.
Seeing that she did not look forward to his return at all, Shao An strode out of the villa in resignation.
He sat in the car and drove towards the military base, quietly feeling sorry for Jin Yang. Although the president didn’t say it, Shao An realized that Jin Yang would repeatedly watch Qiu Tong and the children’s videos to relieve his longing. But what about Qiu Tong?
She did not miss Jin Yang at all. She was living very happily with the three children.
“Sigh, I’m afraid boss will be disappointed!”
Shao An muttered to himself and shook his head as he looked at the scenery outside the window. The corners of his lips could not help but curl into a smile.

chapters.title: Chapter 139 - Storing Food
chapters.content:
Chapter 139: Storing Food
In S City, Qiu Tong summoned a few mercenaries to accompany her to the market to purchase a large amount of food and daily necessities.
The locust plague affected the prices of grain and other necessities. All the signboards outside the shops in the market indicated a 20% increase in price. Qiu Tong entered and asked the boss to bring out his grain. After carefully checking that there were no problems with the grain, she paid without any hesitation.
When the surrounding customers saw Qiu Tong hoarding food, they couldn’t help asking, “Why are you buying so much food?”
“The locust plague is already under control. There’s enough food supply now.”
Qiu Tong smiled politely and gestured at the mercenaries to move the food back. She did not explain further.
As she had once lived in the post-apocalyptic era, Qiu Tong was extremely sensitive to danger. No matter what the situation, she always wanted to stock up on food and daily necessities, to guard against special situations which could happen any time. Furthermore, the locust plague in S City had just passed and the city was still in a fragile state.
Qiu Tong had four children to take care of and she needed to be fully prepared.
The mercenaries carried the bags of food to the car. Qiu Tong’s purchase attracted a crowd.
When Shu Yuanwei heard about it, he also rushed over to check on the situation.
He realized that Qiu Tong was actually willing to pay a high price to buy some old grain. Shu Yuanwei couldn’t help putting his hands on his hips and sneering. “You’re really crazy.”
“The government will definitely give you a monetary reward for helping to exterminate the locusts, right? Why do you have to buy so much food?”
Shu Yuanwei looked at Qiu Tong contemptuously, mocking her stupidity. He reminded her in a sharp tone, “In another week, the fields will be ready for harvest. By then, the price of grain will decrease and there will be a lot of fresh grain sent to the market. Why don’t you keep the money…”
“Don’t tell me you prefer stale grain? I did hear of some people who don’t enjoy fresh food.”
Shu Yuanwei watched as Qiu Tong ignored him and left with her food. He spat on the ground. “Pui!”
“Despicable fellow, she deserves to have her money wasted!”
Shu Yuanwei was so angry that his face turned pallid. He cursed a few times in the street before returning to his own shop.
On the way back to the villa, Qiu Tong and the mercenaries discovered that there were many refugees fleeing from other cities and countryside.
They occupied public places like parks and beside the ATM machines.
Qiu Tong frowned and asked softly, “When did this situation start to happen?”
The mercenary thought carefully and looked around warily before replying, “I think sometime in the past two weeks.”
“In the beginning, only a small number of refugees moved to the center of S City. But now, nearly every part of the city has refugees gathered.”
The mercenaries had never seen such a situation before. Their tone was somewhat solemn.
The more Qiu Tong heard, the more uneasy she felt. She knew that other cities would not be as lucky as S City to be able to use a helicopter to spray locust pesticide to control the situation.
If they missed the optimal locust extermination time, the locusts in the fields would easily go out of control and consume the grains before harvest.
Faced with such a situation, those farmers who relied on selling food for a living had no choice but to flee their homes and beg on the streets…
Qiu Tong had experienced riots caused by a lack of food in the post-apocalyptic era. She immediately sped up and urged the mercenaries, “Hurry.”
“Let’s hurry back.”

chapters.title: Chapter 140 - Refugees Blocking The Road
chapters.content:
Chapter 140: Refugees Blocking The Road
A week later, the harvesting of the grain fields was completed.
The Shu food store made a killing by buying at a low price and reselling at a higher price.
Shu Yuanwei was exceptionally pleased as he counted the bills. He recalled that Shu Xian’s factory seemed to have encountered some trouble recently. His eyes darted around as he dialed Shu Xian’s number. After learning that he was drinking alone at home, he immediately said, “Wait for me! I’ll go over and have a drink with you now!”
Eager to show off, Shu Yuanwei carried two bottles of good wine and headed to the villa district in his fur coat.
Outside the gate of the villa area, refugees and beggars from other places were gathered in front of the greenery by the road. When they saw Shu Yuanwei, their eyes lit up and they ran over. They blocked Shu Yuanwei’s path and clasped their hands together, begging, “Please show mercy!”
“We haven’t eaten in days!”
“Please show some charity and let us fill our stomachs…”
The beggars and refugees’ clothes were tattered and their bodies exuded an unpleasant smell. This made Shu Yuanwei take two steps back in disgust. He pinched his nose and waved his hand. “Get lost, a good dog knows not to block the way! Get lost, don’t ruin my good mood!”
Shu Yuanwei wanted to walk forward, but a female refugee mustered up the courage to hug his calf. Her dirty face was filled with despair.
“Please give us something to eat. Our child is still young and hasn’t eaten for a few days.”
“He’ll die if he keeps starving like this.”
In front of a trash can by the side of the road, a skinny child was wrapped in tattered clothes. He looked to be about two or three years old. His skin was sallow and his breathing was slow. He looked like he was sick. Shu Yuanwei did not show any sympathy. He lifted his leg and kicked the woman, cursing as he dusted off his leg. “How unlucky.”
“You dirtied my clothes. My pants are very expensive, can you afford to compensate me?”
Another refugee, who looked like the woman’s husband, saw Shu Yuanwei’s vicious actions. He hurriedly rushed to her side and stared at Shu Yuanwei venomously, wanting to snatch the good wine and roasted chicken from his hands.
But they were refugees and their bodies were weak. How could they be a match for Shu Yuanwei?
Shu Yuanwei suddenly lifted his leg and kicked the man’s arm. He cursed as he continued to hit him. “You bunch of trash should just die!”
“You even dare to come to this villa district? Do you know where this is?”
“You all smell so bad. You are just a bunch of foreign dogs. You should have been kept outside. Even if you die, don’t come to our doorsteps to die. You’re an eyesore!”
Shu Yuanwei continued to beat up the refugee. The woman cried and begged him to have mercy, but he had no intention of stopping.
Qiu Tong had just returned from the kindergarten to fetch the children when she happened to pass by and saw the scene. She frowned and shouted. “Stop!”
“Who do you think you are? I can hit whoever I want. Why are you stop me?”
Beads of sweat formed on Shu Yuanwei’s forehead. He rolled up his sleeves, wanting to make a move on Qiu Tong. However, just as his arm was about to reach her, Qiu Tong grabbed his wrist and twisted it downwards forcefully. The clear sound of bones breaking could be heard.
“Ouch, it hurts!”
Shu Yuanwei wailed and squatted down. He kept trying to smack away Qiu Tong’s hand, but still stubbornly said, “Stop being a busybody!”
“Let go of me. I didn’t provoke you…”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes. She didn’t want to be entangled with Shu Yuanwei any longer, so she let go of him and dusted off her hands in disgust. “Leave now!”

chapters.title: Chapter 141 - Future Chaos
chapters.content:
Chapter 141: Future Chaos
Shu Yuanwei staggered to his feet and ran towards the villa district without looking back.
Hugging her child, the female refugee thanked Qiu Tong repeatedly. Qiu Tong noticed that the group of refugees and beggars behind her were looking at Shu Yuanwei with resentment and viciousness. Secretly alarmed by this, she quickly took out some food and distributed it to them. “You better leave this place as soon as possible.”
“Bring the children to a warmer place.”
Qiu Tong looked at a burly refugee staring at the food and frowned at him, “You’re not allowed to call anyone else to come over here.”
“Our food is limited. We don’t have any more excess food to give you, understand?”
The refugees and beggars did not answer. They just hurriedly grabbed some food and stuffed it into their mouths. Their actions and expressions reminded Qiu Tong of the post-apocalyptic chaos. She hurried home in a panic and closed all the doors and windows of the villa. She drew the curtains and extinguished all the bright lights in the room.
Qiu Tong then hid behind the curtain and saw the refugees and beggars rushing towards the row of villas.
“That woman from just now lives in that direction!”
“She must still have some food. If we find her, we can survive a few more days!”
They wanted to beg for more food from Qiu Tong. Occasionally, they would stop and re-orientate themselves, searching for Qiu Tong’s residence, gradually approaching…
The leader of the beggars narrowed his eyes and examined the villas one by one. He said in a hoarse voice, “Continue to search!”
Qiu Tong immediately understood that this group of beggars must have run out of other areas in S City to beg for food!
Although the situation in S City was better than in other cities, the locust plague still affected the farmers and food production here to a certain extent!
There had still been a sudden decrease in the production of grains. The households in S City only managed to maintain their own food reserves, and none had any surplus food to give to the refugees and beggars.
The refugees outside the city were famished and cold. They were already on the verge of death, so it was inevitable that their emotions and actions would go to the extreme.
When they saw that the citizens of S City had food and accommodation, and could even live in warm houses, they would definitely feel unbalanced.
Unresolvable conflicts would gradually accumulate and eventually erupt, creating chaos.
Qiu Tong drew the curtains tightly and murmured, “The city is going to be in chaos.”
Qiu Tong received a call from the kindergarten teacher in the evening. “Hello? Is this Mother Qiu?”
“It hasn’t been very peaceful in S City recently. There have been many cases of refugees causing trouble. As the children don’t have the ability to protect themselves, we have decided to temporarily close the kindergarten for the next few days.”
“You don’t have to send the children to kindergarten for the next few days. As for homework and classes, our teacher will contact you again.”
Qiu Tong frowned and replied softly, “Thank you, Teacher.”
“I’ll take care of the children. You be careful too.”
She hung up the phone and looked back at Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu, who were sitting quietly in the living room watching cartoons. Her eyes darkened.
Qiu Xingyuan walked out from his bedroom. He overheard Qiu Tong’s conversation with the kindergarten teacher. He pursed his thin lips and asked with a serious expression, “Did something happen outside?”
“Is it because of those refugees outside?”
Qiu Xingyuan did not deliberately lower his voice. Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu heard his words over their cartoon and ran over in a panic. They asked Qiu Tong, “Mommy, are there bad people outside?”

chapters.title: Chapter 142 - Elimination
chapters.content:
Chapter 142: Elimination
The atmosphere in the villa was tense and heavy. Little Yu followed Qiu Tong nervously and fearfully, refusing to let go of her fingers.
Qiu Tong sensed their emotions and comforted the children gently. “It’s alright, Mommy will accompany you here.”
“Even if bad people dare to come here, Mommy will beat them back!”
Qiu Tong picked up two fairy tale books from the bookshelf and pointed to the bedroom. “Now, all good children should be in bed now. Mommy will read you a story, okay? Who wants to hear a fairy tale?”
Little Yu immediately raised her hand. Qiu Xingqiao said in a low voice, “We don’t want to hear stories about princesses and princes anymore. We want to hear stories about heroes…”
Qiu Tong burst out laughing. She was moved by the children’s innocence and carried them back to the bedroom. She coaxed them, “Alright, as you please.”
Half an hour later, Qiu Tong came out of the bedroom quietly and closed the door.
She wanted to go to the kitchen to have a drink of water, but realized that Ye Luan was sitting on the sofa in the darkness. In the dim light, his small figure looked a little lonely.
Qiu Tong noticed his envy and took the initiative to sit beside him. She asked, “Do you want Auntie Qiu to read you a story too?”
“Are you afraid too?”
Ye Luan frowned awkwardly and rejected coldly, “I’m not a child.”
Qiu Tong raised her eyebrows and deliberately slowed her movements as she stood up. “In that case, I’ll go back to my room first. Goodnight…”
The moment her figure brushed past Ye Luan, Ye Luan suddenly raised his hand and grabbed the corner of her clothes. He bit his thin lips and didn’t say anything.
Ye Luan lowered his eyes, his long eyelashes blocking his eyes. No one could tell what he was feeling.
Qiu Tong gave a small smile and sighed as she sat beside him. She hugged Ye Luan and whispered, “Auntie Qiu won’t read you any stories then. I’ll just sit with you for a while. You don’t have to be afraid. In Auntie Qiu’s heart, you’re also my child just like Qiu Xingyuan and the rest. You’re a very good child.”
Ye Luan’s emotions surged when he heard this.
The estrangement between the two of them dissolved that night, and their hearts became even closer.
…
Early next morning, the sounds of glass being smashed outside could be heard. The ear-piercing noise woke Qiu Tong from her sleep.
She quickly got up to take a look and realized that there were refugees gathered outside. They were attacking the guards of the villa in an organized manner, picking up stones and smashing them against glass. They even tried to break through the fences and barge into the guards’ area with ferocious momentum.
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes. She noticed that there seemed to be many gangsters from the city mixed among these refugees…
“The unrest has begun!”
Qiu Tong drew the curtains and asked Ke Le and the others to gather in the room. “From now on, your priority is to protect the children!”
Qiu Tong looked at Qiu Xingyuan and Ye Luan and instructed, “You two are the big brothers, you have to protect your younger siblings.”
“All of you have to stay obediently in the villa. Don’t run around and don’t go out, understand?”
Qiu Tong stared at the situation outside and said with a calm and solemn expression, “According to the intensity of their attacks now, the electric fence around the villa should be able to hold on for a while. They won’t be able to break in for the time being, but we still have to make preparations and take early precautions!”

chapters.title: Chapter 143 - Activation Of Electric Fence
chapters.content:
Chapter 143: Activation Of Electric Fence
The rioting in S City was fierce. The police station immediately activated an emergency plan and mobilized the police.
However, there were too many refugees surging into the city and they were joined by unemployed city-dwellers who were out to create trouble. The police officers could not suppress or control them at all.
Reporters from the television station risked their lives to report live from the streets. News about the cruel and chaotic streets quickly spread.
At the official residence in the capital, Jin Yang looked at the television screen with unprecedented nervousness. His entire body was tense as he stared at every figure that flashed across the screen, as if he was looking for someone. It was only when the signal on the screen stopped that Jin Yang heaved a sigh of relief and relaxed his clenched fists.
“Shao An, come here.”
Jin Yang called Shao An on the intercom, who rushed over in his uniform. “Mr. President, what can I do for you?”
“Postpone everything on my to-do list…”
“Prepare the helicopter immediately. I want to go to S City. Now, now!”
Jin Yang pursed his thin lips into a straight line. “What are you waiting for?”
Just as Shao An was feeling puzzled, he saw the image of a riot flashing on the television. He nervously stopped him and said, “Sir, security in S City is very bad now. Your personal safety be at risk. It’s very likely that someone will take advantage of the chaos to attack you. Why don’t you wait for news in the capital?”
“I can bring my men to handle it. Once the situation is under control, you can go over to see them.”
Shao An suggested a solution that he thought was feasible. Jin Yang frowned and walked up to him. He asked coldly, “Is it your place to teach me how to do things?”
“Why don’t I let you be the president too? Go and make the arrangements now!”
Shao An’s persuasion was fruitless. He could only obey orders and arrange for a helicopter. Jin Yang disguised himself and rushed to S City. He looked at Shao An, who was following him, and said, “You stay.”
“If they know that I’m going to S City, problems will definitely crop up.”
“Stay in the official residence and distract them. Take care of the government affairs for me and suppress the news. No more problems can be allowed to happen!”
Shao An nodded silently. He was already used to Jin Yang’s behavior when facing Qiu Tong’s problems.
“Be safe, Sir.”
Shao An watched as the helicopter flew towards S City. He quickly returned to the official residence and ordered everyone to keep Jin Yang’s departure a strict secret.
In the villa district, the refugees and beggars became increasingly anxious. They even wanted to break through the electric fence with brute force. A few agile escapees had already climbed onto the fence and were using tools to destroy it.
“Mommy, will they be able to break in?”
Little Yu hugged Qiu Tong’s waist tightly in fear as she asked in a trembling voice. Her little face was ashen from fright, and her eyes were filled with panic and fear.
Qiu Tong frowned and watched the intruders with a serious expression. She had no choice but to carry Little Yu to the electrical switch box at the door and turn on the switch.
Sizzle! Pop—
The electric fence was instantly shot through with electricity and all the escapees who were climbing onto it were electrocuted. Their limbs went numb, and they lost consciousness as they fell to the ground. Their limbs twitched incessantly, and some of them even foamed at the mouth as their breathing quickened.
This scene frightened the other refugees so much that they retreated one by one, staring at the electric fence in front of the villa in horror.
The leader of the refugees did not expect Qiu Tong to set up such a vicious defensive device.
“There’s… there’s electricity on it?”
The timid and cowardly refugees helped the severely injured escape to the back and raised their trembling hands. “We can’t go in, what should we do?”

chapters.title: Chapter 144 - Begging For Mercy
chapters.content:
Chapter 144: Begging For Mercy
“There are no electric fences in the neighboring villas. We can go and rob them!”
The refugees realized that the other villas were more vulnerable. Their eyes lit up as they pointed at the Shu family’s villas and shouted, “Let’s go to those over there!”
Qiu Tong saw that there were only a few injured refugees resting on the ground outside. Most of the other refugees were already attacking and seizing the food stores from the other villas.
She could not help frowning and sighing. “The worst has indeed happened.”
Qiu Tong muttered, “I’m afraid our electric fence won’t be able to hold for long. After they rob all the food from the other villas, they will definitely return…”
She watched as the refugees used metal rods and stones to smash the Shu family’s door. She could not help commenting. “They deserve it.”
Meanwhile, the Shu family’s villa was breached by the refugees in just a few minutes. They barged in like bandits and plundered the food stores.
Shu Xian and Shu Yuanwei were originally drunk, but they were so frightened that they instantly sobered up. They squatted on the ground, clutching their heads and trembling.
Lin Shan screamed and hid on the sofa. She covered her body with a pillow and flailed around shouting, “Don’t come over! I’m calling the police!”
When the leader of the refugees heard this, his expression turned gloomy and he looked very unhappy.
Shu Xian and Shu Yuanwei secretly cursed Lin Shan for being too stupid. They hurriedly raised their hands and said, “As you can see, we don’t have much food at home. There’s not enough for you to eat. Even if you turn the villa upside down, this is all there is!”
“We don’t dare to lie to you. But I know who has more food!”
Shu Yuanwei recalled the grains that Qiu Tong had hoarded. He tried to sell her out to the refugee leader in exchange for his trust.
“She just bought several carts of food a few days ago. She must have stored them at home. They’re not far away. I can bring you there!”
Shu Xian saw the expressions of the refugees relax a little. He hurriedly nodded and said, “Yes, yes! Even if you keep wasting time here, you won’t get anything.”
The leader of the refugees frowned. After some thought, he arranged for a few of his subordinates to escort Shu Yuanwei and let him lead the way.
The group of refugees returned to the entrance of the Qiu family villa in a swaggering manner. Shu Yuanwei pointed at the electric fence and said excitedly and ingratiatingly, “It’s this one! Just go in and rob them. You’ll definitely be able to get a lot of things…”
Bang! Smack!
As soon as Shu Yuanwei finished speaking, the leader of the refugees grabbed his head and swung his fist at his abdomen, causing him to spit out blood.
Several beat Shu Yuanwei with sticks until he could not get up. He wretchedly begged for mercy. “Stop beating me, stop beating me!”
“Pui! Are you trying to trick us?”
“This villa is clearly fortified. Didn’t you see our fallen brothers? They were all electrocuted just now!”
The leader of the refugees spoke in a hoarse voice. Shu Yuanwei did not expect things to turn out this way. He felt an unbearable pain in his abdomen and quickly tugged at the refugee’s pants. In a weak voice, he said, “I have a solution! I can help you break in and bring out the food.”
“Stop. Listen to what he has to say…”
The leader of the refugees raised his hand. Shu Yuanwei staggered and got up. He pointed at a small house outside the villa area and coughed. “That’s the villa district’s main power supply room. As long as we cut off the power from the villa area, the electric fence won’t work.”
“Without the electric fence, it will be very easy for you to break in.”
“There’s only one woman and a few children in that villa. They are no match for you.”
Shu Yuanwei pleaded. The leader of the refugees pondered for a while and nodded. “Okay.”

chapters.title: Chapter 145 - Cutting Off The Power
chapters.content:
Chapter 145: Cutting Off The Power
Led by Shu Yuanwei, the refugees and beggars headed straight to the main power supply room of the villa district. They used brute force to subdue the security guards on duty.
Shu Yuanwei wanted to interrogate them on which switch to cut off the power supply to Qiu Tong’s villa. But the leader of the refugees directly cut off the power supply to the entire area.
In an instant, the affluent villa district fell into a state of panic. The residents hid in the basement, trying to avoid the disaster in front of them.
Qiu Tong noticed something amiss and ran to the window with a frown. She saw the leader of the refugees surrounding her villa with a large group of people.
Ke Le stood beside her and said in a hoarse and rough voice, “Boss, don’t worry.”
“With us here, we will protect you and the children with our lives!”
Qiu Tong looked at him gratefully and patted his shoulder. She picked up the metal rod and other items she had prepared in advance. “You guys be careful too!”
“I don’t want anyone to get hurt, understand?”
The mercenaries nodded solemnly and guarded the door with serious expressions. They pricked up their ears to listen to the approaching footsteps.
With danger approaching, Ye Luan took the initiative to run to Qiu Tong with clenched fists. He raised his thin little hand and shielded her behind him.
Qiu Tong looked down at him in confusion. Ye Luan pursed his lips and said softly, “I’m a man. I have to protect Auntie Qiu when there is danger!”
Qiu Xingqiao put on a stoic face when he heard his words. He gripped his boxing gloves tightly and stood in front of Ye Luan and Qiu Tong. “She’s my mommy. It’s not your place to protect her! Go and find a place to hide. Just don’t cause trouble for us…”
This was the first time Little Yu was experiencing a riot like this. She was very frightened and feeling somewhat panicky, but she still chose to run in front of Qiu Tong.
Qiu Xingyuan filled up the last empty spot in front of Qiu Tong. He frowned nervously and looked at Qiu Tong worriedly. “Don’t move!”
Qiu Tong looked at the children who were protecting her and felt a warmth in her heart.
“Thank you.”
She muttered under her breath before grabbing the children by their waists and handing them to the mercenaries behind her. “Protect them!”
The mercenaries obeyed the order and surrounded the four children in the middle. They listened warily to the sounds of the refugees crashing through the door and smashing the windows…
Bang! Crack——
The refugees barged into the villa and saw Qiu Tong and Ke Le standing side by side. The leader of the refugees narrowed his eyes and said, “Hand over your food!”
“I promise they won’t hurt you.”
Qiu Tong glanced at the crowd and quickly calculated that their food store would not be enough for so many people.
If the distribution was unequal, it would make the refugees even more emotional and cause internal strife amongst them. The situation would worsen.
Qiu Tong said indifferently, “We don’t have excess food.”
Shu Yuanwei had been hiding behind the refugees the entire time. When he heard Qiu Tong’s reply, he jumped out and said, “She’s lying!”
“I saw with my own eyes that she bought several carts of food at the market. She must have hidden them somewhere!”
Ke Le spat on the ground and rushed to Shu Yuanwei. He grabbed Shu Yuanwei by the collar and punched him twice in the stomach. “Shut up if you don’t want to die!”
The refugees could tell that Ke Le and the others were very skilled. They picked up their wooden sticks and prepared to attack.
“Qiu Tong? Are you alright?”
It was Song Yan, who had now barged into the villa with his men.

chapters.title: Chapter 146 - Timely Rescue
chapters.content:
Chapter 146: Timely Rescue
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong looked at Song Yan in surprise and asked, “Why are you here?”
Ke Le and Song Yan’s eyes met. They both knew that they needed to seize this opportunity. Taking advantage of the refugees’ moment of confusion, they gestured for their men to surround the refugees and separate them, before attacking them one by one.
The situation in the villa immediately turned chaotic. Tables, chairs and sofas were destroyed in the fight. Goose feathers and cotton-like items floated in the air, blocking the view.
A knife-wielding refugee wanted to attack Qiu Tong from behind. Song Yan saw the dangerous situation from the corner of his eye. He propped himself onto the coffee table and leaped over. He kicked away the knife and grabbed Qiu Tong’s wrist, pulling her to a safe corner. He asked in a low voice, “Are you alright?”
Qiu Tong shook her head and tore off a long strip from the bottom of her T-shirt to wrap around her injured arm.
“Shao An said that you won’t be here until two weeks later. Why are you here early?”
Song Yan avoided her gaze and replied in a perfunctory tone, “I knew that there might be a riot in the city. I was worried about you and the children, so I came back to take a look. I didn’t really expect this…”
Qiu Tong raised her eyebrows in surprise. She looked at the side of Song Yan’s face and was about to say something to thank him when she saw a few refugees charging at them.
“These refugees came from the neighboring city and have been forced into a corner. They are not afraid of death at all.”
“You have to be careful! They have no qualms, so they are not afraid of being injured when they attack. They might even fight us to their death…”
Qiu Tong had lived in the post-apocalyptic era before. She knew better than anyone else the mentality of refugees, so she did not dare to be careless.
The mercenaries and Song Yan’s men were all elites, but the refugees outnumbered them. They were exhausted and seemed unable to hold on for much longer.
The leader of the refugees could see that they were lacking in stamina. He immediately shouted, “Defeat them and we won’t have to starve anymore!”
These words were like a stimulant. The refugees counterattacked with intense desire. Qiu Tong and Song Yan retreated to the bedroom door and gritted their teeth as they fought.
…
At the airport in S City, Jin Yang’s helicopter landed. Mayor Shen came to welcome it personally.
When his assistant received the news, he rushed to Mayor Shen’s side with a panicked expression, wanting to whisper to him and explain the situation.
Jin Yang tidied his clothes and looked up at him coldly. “Let me hear what you have to say.”
“Mr. President, Mayor Shen, there’s a riot in the affluent villa district. The situation is unknown now, but it’s said that the entire district had a power outage and lost contact with the outside half an hour ago. It looks like the situation is not good…”
Jin Yang thought of Qiu Tong and immediately glared at Mayor Shen. “Didn’t you promise me over the phone that everything is under control?”
“What’s going on?”
Jin Yang reprimanded in a raised voice. Mayor Shen was so frightened that he broke out in cold sweat. “Mr. President, the emotions of the refugees are uncontrollable!”
“Dispatch a team of police officers over right now. I’ll personally lead them to the district as reinforcements.”
Jin Yang gave his commands. Mayor Shen opened his mouth to refute, but he noticed the ruthlessness in Jin Yang’s eyes and realized his order was indisputable. He hurriedly nodded and made the arrangements.
10 minutes later, Jin Yang arrived at the villa compound with a large group of police officers. He rushed to the outside of Qiu Tong’s villa, but through the broken glass, he saw Qiu Tong and Song Yan together. He was just about to gesture at the police officers to charge in, but he suddenly froze and his hand hung in mid-air for a long time.
Why were they here together?!

chapters.title: Chapter 147 - Splitting Up
chapters.content:
Chapter 147: Splitting Up
There was an extremely strong telepathy between Jin Yang and Song Yan. Song Yan sensed his presence almost immediately and looked out the window.
“Things have become interesting!”
A teasing smile appeared on Song Yan’s face. From the corner of his eye, he saw Qiu Tong and the leader of the refugees locked in a stalemate. “Be careful!”
Qiu Tong had an extremely powerful healing ability, but she had no chance to use it now.
The refugees did not stop attacking. From time to time, Qiu Tong would glance over at the mercenaries protecting the children. With that distraction, she ended up getting some injuries.
Song Yan looked at the leader of the refugees who was raising his machete high. He could have pushed Qiu Tong away, but when he thought of Jin Yang, he ran straight to Qiu Tong’s side and hugged her tightly, using his body to endure the attack on her behalf…
“Are you all right?”
Qiu Tong supported Song Yan anxiously and looped his arm over her shoulder.
Ke Le heard her shout and rushed over to support her. “Boss, bring him to the window! I’ll help you stall for time!”
“Hurry up and think of a way to escape. We can’t be trapped in this villa anymore. We are being forced into a corner here!”
Ke Le noticed this problem and growled hoarsely.
Qiu Tong nodded. “Hang in there! I’ll settle his injuries first and then give you guys the signal to break out.”
“Let’s split up and meet up in the forest outside!”
With that, Qiu Tong helped Song Yan into a sitting position on the floor by the window. She looked at the knife wound on Song Yan’s back and narrowed her eyes, wanting to use her power to treat him. She leaned closer and carefully examined the extent of the wound. From Jin Yang’s perspective, it was an especially suggestive scene.
Song Yan stared at Jin Yang provocatively. He raised his eyebrows and held Qiu Tong’s hand. He deliberately coughed weakly. “It’s alright.”
“Don’t waste time on me. We have to leave this place as soon as possible.”
“The situation in the villa district must have attracted the attention of the police. They will find a way to control the rioters.”
Song Yan’s face was as pale as paper. He leaned his head gently on Qiu Tong’s shoulder, his hot breath landing on Qiu Tong’s neck. For some reason, Qiu Tong instinctively dodged. She supported Song Yan’s shoulders with both hands, but realized that his eyes were fixed on something outside the window.
“What are you looking at?”
Qiu Tong followed his gaze and looked over. Jin Yang was nowhere to be seen on the other side of the hill. She frowned in confusion.
Song Yan recalled Jin Yang’s conflicted expression and suppressed the smug smile on his face. He shook his head and propped himself up on the ground. He said, “We have to seize the moment and break out! They are a little tired now. This is the best opportunity!”
Qiu Tong found this a little strange, but she agreed with him. She sent Ke Le a signal and everyone forced their way out in different directions.
The mercenaries split up and carried the children away. They were pursued by the refugees in the bushes outside the villa. They hid Little Yu in the bushes and reminded her in a low voice, “Don’t make a sound. We will come back to get you after we chase away the bad guys!”
Little Yu covered her mouth with her hand, afraid of giving them even more trouble. She squatted in the bushes, tears welling up in her eyes.
Time passed minute by minute. After a fierce battle with the refugees, the mercenaries were in a hurry to meet up with Ke Le and forgot about Little Yu, who was still in the bushes…
“Uncles? Where are you?”
Little Yu stood up in fear and ran crying towards the forest.
A lone refugee discovered her and wanted to attack and kidnap her as a hostage, but was knocked unconscious by Jin Yang.
“Don’t be afraid!”
Jin Yang bent over and hugged Little Yu, coaxing her softly.

chapters.title: Chapter 148 - Both Lost Their Memories
chapters.content:
Chapter 148: Both Lost Their Memories
The police and mercenaries worked together to scatter the refugees. When Jin Yang returned to the villa with Little Yu in his arms, he found that it was already empty.
“I’ll get you something to eat, okay?”
Jin Yang recalled some parenting books that he had previously read, and wanted to use food to placate Little Yu.
He was just about to place Little Yu on the sofa when the frightened little girl refused to let go. She felt an inexplicable closeness towards Jin Yang and hugged his neck tightly with her arms. Little Yu’s grape-like eyes revealed an uneasy look as she shook her head and said, “No!”
“Little Yu is afraid of the bad guys! They might be hiding somewhere!”
Jin Yang looked at the adorable little girl and felt his heart melt from her childish voice. He could only hold her and sit down to coax her. “The bad guys have been chased away.”
His gaze landed awkwardly on the corner of the window where Qiu Tong and Song Yan had been. He frowned and fell into deep thought.
Little Yu bit her red lips and sized up Jin Yang seriously. “Uncle Song Yan, are you really our Daddy?”
“Every time we encounter danger, you will appear to help us! Just like a hero in a fairy tale, a prince!”
After interacting with him a few times, Little Yu’s impression of Jin Yang had changed. She even felt that it might be a good thing to have him protect her mother.
Jin Yang paused and shook his head after a moment of silence. “No.”
“I just met your mommy not long ago. We didn’t know each other before. Don’t call me Daddy.”
Jin Yang raised his hand and tapped the tip of Little Yu’s nose. Seeing the loneliness in her eyes, his heart ached as if someone was tugging at it.
In the forest, Song Yan heard this conversation through the surveillance devices he had left in the villa. He leaned against a tree trunk with interest and frowned as he recalled the paternity test report that had been released from the hospital. “Strange, could it be that he doesn’t know?”
Song Yan recalled Jin Yang’s abnormal actions. If he knew the identity of Qiu Xingyuan and the other children, he would definitely bring them back to the official residence to take care of them.
It really did not look like he was trying to avoid responsibility. Jin Yang really did not know!
“This is getting more and more interesting!”
In the distance, Qiu Tong was comforting Qiu Xingyuan and the rest. Song Yan’s gaze landed on her and he muttered, “It looks like Jin Yang did have a past relationship with her, but somehow, both of them lost their memories of that period?”
“Is this an opportunity bestowed upon me by the heavens?”
Song Yan took a deep breath, his eyes sparkling with excitement.
The mercenaries returned to the forest in twos and threes to meet up with Ke Le. Qiu Tong checked everyone’s injuries but did not see Little Yu.
“Did anyone see Little Yu?”
Qiu Xingqiao tugged at the corner of the mercenary’s shirt nervously as he asked with a trembling voice.
The mercenaries suddenly thought of Little Yu, who was hiding in the bushes. When they went back to look, she was nowhere to be seen!
“Boss, we are sorry!”
They wanted to kneel down and apologize, but Qiu Tong held them up. “Don’t do that.”
