She suppressed her anxiety and said, “You didn’t do anything wrong in the situation just now. Little Yu is very obedient. She definitely won’t run far. We have to find her as soon as possible before it gets dark…”
“Yes!”
The mercenaries searched the surroundings. Song Yan looked in the direction of the villa and frowned as he called out to Qiu Tong.

chapters.title: Chapter 149 - Declaring Ownership
chapters.content:
Chapter 149: Declaring Ownership
“Qiu Tong, we should split up to find her. Only then will we be able to find traces of Little Yu in the shortest time possible.”
“The mercenaries and my men have chased away the refugees. They probably won’t choose to bring a child along in their escape. Little Yu would just be a burden for them. Don’t worry! She should be fine…”
Song Yan already knew that Little Yu was at the villa and he patted Qiu Tong’s shoulder comfortingly.
Qiu Tong nodded and instructed Ke Le to follow Song Yan’s instructions. Song Yan quietly walked to a dark corner and looked at Qiu Tong’s back profile as he dialed Jin Yang’s number. “Hello? The President is actually not in the official residence in the capital but in S City. If the news of this spreads, it will probably cause quite a stir, right?”
“I didn’t expect the president to enjoy picking up girls using a fake name.”
Song Yan’s voice was laced with provocation as he said softly, “What to do now? I’m already with Qiu Tong!”
“I have to thank the president for creating an opportunity for us. Otherwise, I wouldn’t have met such a perfect and outstanding woman!”
Song Yan could clearly sense that Jin Yang’s mood had worsened. The smile on his face widened.
No one knew Jin Yang’s character better than him. Jin Yang hated entanglements and having to fight others for something. He had been like this since he was young!
As long as Song Yan asked for it, Jin Yang would choose to give up any toy or opportunity to attend an important event. He disdained fighting and snatching.
Song Yan took advantage of this character trait of his. He tilted his head and said deliberately, “Qiu Tong is a very clear-cut and frank person.”
“She told me before that she hates it when people lie to her.”
“If Qiu Tong finds out that the President is using someone else’s identity when interacting with her, what will she think? Will she think that the President suspects her and looks down on her background? That he treats her like a toy just to pass time?”
Jin Yang remained silent and did not answer. Song Yan’s voice suddenly turned cold as he suggested. “You better leave as soon as possible.”
“Otherwise, it won’t do anyone any good if Qiu Tong finds out about this!”
In the villa, Jin Yang hung up the phone with a dark expression. He clenched his fists tightly, feeling deeply vexed.
Little Yu took out two bottles of milk from the fridge and tugged at Jin Yang’s sleeve. She wanted to share it with him, so she handed one over and said, “Uncle Song Yan, this is very delicious!”
“Second Brother likes it the most. He doesn’t allow Brother Ye Luan to touch it!”
Jin Yang held the milk in his hand and rubbed the top of Little Yu’s head. He took a deep breath to calm himself before saying, “Can Little Yu stay at home obediently?”
“Your mommy will be back soon. Uncle has something to do and has to leave.”
Little Yu blinked obediently and nodded vigorously. “I will take good care of myself!”
In the forest, Song Yan found an anxious Qiu Tong and said, “My men have already found Little Yu. She’s at the villa. Let’s go back.”
When Qiu Tong heard this, she ran towards the villa. She suddenly pushed the door open and saw Little Yu drinking milk on the sofa. She hugged her tightly in joy. At this moment, the fear in her heart surged, causing Qiu Tong to collapse onto the sofa.
“Thank you.”
Qiu Tong looked at Song Yan gratefully. When Little Yu saw him, she asked curiously, “Uncle, why are you here?”
Song Yan guessed that Little Yu had mistaken him for Jin Yang. He walked over to Qiu Tong and gently pinched her face as he coaxed, “Uncle was worried about you, so he came back with Mommy to take a look.”

chapters.title: Chapter 150 - Send To The Police Station
chapters.content:
Chapter 150: Send To The Police Station
The rioting outside the villas had been quelled. The residents couldn’t help feeling relief as they came out of their basements.
Song Yan’s subordinates tied Shu Yuanwei and the leader of the refugees up with hemp ropes and threw them onto the floor of the living room. They said, “Sir, we have already arrested all the refugees who participated in the riot and are waiting for your instructions. Also, how should we deal with this particular person?”
Shu Yuanwei thought that the riot would definitely succeed. He did not expect it to end up like this.
Shu Yuanwei knelt on the ground, thinking that he was really unlucky. Shu Xian and Lin Shan had both slipped away. He was the only one caught!
“I didn’t do anything wrong. At most, I just gave them directions. What can you do to me?”
Shu Yuanwei raised his head stubbornly. His gaze landed on Song Yan, who was beside Qiu Tong. He immediately gaped in shock and panic.
“Mr. President?”
When Shu Yuanwei saw Song Yan’s face, he was so frightened that he knelt on the ground with a pale face and kowtowed repeatedly to beg for mercy. “I really didn’t know you and Qiu Tong had such a… such a relationship! I offended you, Sir. Please have mercy on a commoner like me. Let me off!”
Shu Yuanwei was so flustered that he kept stammering. He never expected that Qiu Tong’s backer would be the president himself.
“I didn’t mean to go against Qiu Tong at the market. Why don’t we do this? In the future, the Qiu family can come to our food store to get grains and other foods whenever they want!”
“I will give the order that no one will charge the Qiu family a single cent!”
Shu Yuanwei pleaded for mercy in an agitated manner, but Qiu Tong just stared coldly at his ingratiating and fearful face. She remained silent and sneered.
Song Yan did not explain his identity. He just raised his hand and instructed his subordinate, “Send him to prison and charge him with the crime of burglary.”
“As for your words of repentance, you can save them for your fellow prisoners in jail.”
Song Yan waved his hand and his men dragged Shu Yuanwei out. Before he disappeared, he was still shouting, “Have mercy! I won’t dare to do it again!”
Qiu Tong asked Ke Le and the others to bring the children to the bedroom. She and Song Yan sat on the sofa and looked at the refugees kneeling on the ground.
“Where are you from? Why are you robbing people in S City?”
Qiu Tong frowned and said, “Do you know that there’s a world of difference between begging and causing some ruckus on the streets compared to breaking into private homes and committing robbery? You might be sentenced to death…”
“Who truly wishes to commit robbery? Who doesn’t want to live a proper life?”
One of the refugees looked up at Qiu Tong, still remembering the bags of grains she had given him. He replied with a wry smile, “We moved here from the neighboring city. Everyone originally had grain fields at home. Even if they couldn’t earn money, they could still keep their families warm and full. They wouldn’t go hungry.”
“However, due to the locust plague, none of the grain fields produced any harvest!”
“We heard that S City managed to control the locust plague. Although the harvest was halved, there is still food. Hence, our entire family moved here to beg for some food.” The refugees recalled the hardships they had faced along the way and covered their faces with their hands, unable to speak.
Qiu Tong asked doubtfully, “But if you want to beg for food, can’t you do it in your home city?”
“There are also other wealthy districts in your city. Why did you come such a long way?”
Upon hearing her question, another refugee explained, “There are already rioting hooligans running rampant on the streets of our city. They’ve already snatched away all the food. They attack and plunder food and money without any qualms. Some even target the women.”
“We came here to take refuge!”

chapters.title: Chapter 151 - Planning To Follow
chapters.content:
Chapter 151: Planning To Follow
Qiu Tong’s expression was slightly grave. She understood that the most important thing now was to eliminate the hooligans in that neighboring city.
The hooligans had forcefully occupied an important department of that city. They stockpiled weapons and gathered more hooligans to strengthen their forces.
As long as they existed, there would be an endless stream of refugees spreading to the surrounding cities. This riot would never stop!
Qiu Tong surveyed the villa with furrowed brows. She saw the damaged wardrobe, furniture, and frightened children. “We have to get rid of the hooligans.”
Song Yan nodded in agreement. “I’ll bring some people to the neighboring city to check on the situation.”
“I’ll go with you!”
Song Yan wanted to reject Qiu Tong’s suggestion, but she said with a serious expression, “I don’t want the children to live in constant danger. If hooligans occupy a city by force, it will cause refugees and riots. I need everything to return to how it was before.”
“This concerns my own interests. Even if you don’t bring me along, I will go there myself.”
Qiu Tong expressed her determination. Song Yan could tell that she was stubborn and persistent, so he could only nod in agreement. “We’ll work together then.”
“Good.”
Qiu Tong looked at the children and frowned worriedly.
Ke Le and the mercenaries moved the overturned sofa and wardrobe back to their original positions. Qiu Tong called them over and instructed in a low voice, “We are going to the neighboring city to deal with the hooligans. I’ll leave the children to you. You must protect them!”
“Understood, Boss. Don’t worry.”
Ke Le replied in a hoarse voice. Their conversation attracted Qiu Xingyuan’s attention. He quietly walked to Ke Le’s side and asked about Qiu Tong’s arrangements.
“Boss asked me to take good care of you guys. She will be leaving with that man for a period of time…”
Ke Le answered honestly. Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu’s expressions stiffened.
They all turned to look at Song Yan and Qiu Tong. They fixed their eyes on Qiu Tong, who would nod from time to time. The children could sense the admiration in her eyes. “Mommy won’t abandon us, will she?”
Little Yu asked in a low and innocent voice. The three children were still filled with worry and fear.
They were afraid that Qiu Tong would abandon them and run away with Song Yan!
In the middle of the night, Qiu Tong was sleeping in her bedroom. Qiu Xingyuan gently pushed open his own bedroom door and knocked on Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu’s rooms to call them out.
In the darkness of the night, the three children rubbed their sleepy eyes as they analyzed the situation.
“Whether Mommy wants to subdue the hooligans or create an opportunity to be alone with that man, we can’t let her go alone!”
Qiu Xingyuan frowned seriously. Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu nodded eagerly. They echoed, “Yes, yes! We want to follow Mommy.”
“We all have the ability to protect Mommy!”
“If Mommy refuses to bring us along, we’ll sneak out…”
Qiu Xingyuan carried his piggy bank and listened to the sounds inside. He seemed to have some savings. With a serious expression, he said, “I’ll smash open this piggy bank. It should be enough for us to buy a ticket to the neighboring city.”
“Okay!”
The three children confirmed their plan and clenched their fists together, quietly cheering each other on!

chapters.title: Chapter 152 - Failed Plan
chapters.content:
Chapter 152: Failed Plan
The next morning, Qiu Tong packed her things and prepared to leave, but she could feel several pairs of eyes burning into her.
She casually turned to look and saw Little Yu huddled on the sofa, holding a children’s book to shield her eyes. She looked a little guilty.
Qiu Tong found it strange, but she continued packing and turned to Song Yan to confirm the necessary weapons and communication devices.
Qiu Xingyu and Qiu Xingqiao exchanged glances. She bit her lips and jumped off the sofa, pretending that her legs had gone limp and she had fallen.
“Aiya…”
Qiu Tong hurried over to Little Yu’s side and lifted her trouser leg to check if her ankle was seriously injured. She cautioned her. “Be more careful in the future. Otherwise, you might get injured and get a scar! That won’t be pretty anymore!”
Little Yu blinked and pretended to reach for a glass cup on the coffee table, but her hand slipped and she shattered the cup.
Glass fragments scattered all over the ground. Qiu Tong frowned and picked up Little Yu, moving her to a safe place.
“Mommy, aren’t I stupid? I can’t do anything without you!”
Little Yu hugged Qiu Tong’s neck tightly and pleaded coquettishly, “Mommy, don’t leave me, okay?”
Qiu Tong didn’t understand her hint and thought that she couldn’t bear to part with her. She helplessly carried her to the bathroom. “Little Yu, be good.”
“Mommy will be back after settling the riot in the neighboring city. Be good and stay at home. Don’t run around.”
Qiu Tong wiped the corners of Little Yu’s eyes with a wet towel. She then helped her to brush her teeth and wash her face.
The two of them came out of the washroom. Little Yu gave Qiu Xingyuan a meaningful look and pouted. She mouthed, “Plan A failed!”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at each other in dismay. They did not expect Qiu Tong to not even mention bringing them along.
Qiu Xingqiao gently nudged Qiu Xingyuan with his shoulder to let him carry out the second plan.
Qiu Xingyuan did not know how to act coquettishly or show weakness. He frowned and walked awkwardly towards Qiu Tong. He raised his small, cold face and asked, “That bad woman Lin Shan already knows where we live. And they know that if the power source is cut, the electric fence around the villa will be completely ineffective.”
“If you leave, she might come looking to make trouble for us!”
“If she and the other bad guys work together to take revenge, we will be in danger.”
Qiu Tong looked at his evasive gaze and mistook Qiu Xingyuan for being worried about the villa’s security measures. She pointed at Ke Le and the mercenaries who were repairing the doors and windows and said, “Uncle Ke Le will protect you. Everything will be fine.”
Qiu Xingyuan widened his eyes in surprise. He opened his mouth several times but did not say anything. He just pursed his thin lips and stood stubbornly in front of Qiu Tong.
Ye Luan came out of the bedroom with a glass of water in his hand and quietly watched the children’s actions.
He leaned against the shoe cabinet near the entrance and suddenly chuckled. “Auntie Qiu, don’t you realize that they are just pretending to be helpless, so that you will worry and can bring them along to the neighboring city?”
“Or should I say… it’s a sign of insecurity when children can’t bear to be separated from their mother.”
Ye Luan had exposed the children’s plan. Qiu Xingqiao clenched his fists and glared at him. He said angrily, “You don’t have to be such a busybody. You’re always so nosy!”
“Is that true?”
Qiu Tong looked at Qiu Xingyuan’s slightly flushed face with bewilderment.

chapters.title: Chapter 153 - Family Moving Together
chapters.content:
Chapter 153: Family Moving Together
Qiu Xingyuan took two steps back and looked away. He pursed his lips tightly and refused to answer.
Qiu Tong asked in amusement, “So when Qiu Xingqiao woke up and couldn’t find his clothes, and Little Yu accidentally shattered a glass cup… was this part of your plan?”
The three children kept silent, feeling uneasy. They glared at Ye Luan bitterly, blaming him for spoiling their plans.
“I didn’t expect you to have such a cute side!”
“This coquettish side to you is really… a little special! Why don’t Mommy give you another chance to carry out your act again?”
Qiu Tong teased. Qiu Xingyuan put on a straight face and wanted to return to the bedroom.
Qiu Tong pulled him back into her arms. Qiu Xingyuan was in her warm embrace and tried to pry her arms away, feeling a little uncomfortable.
“Actually, you don’t have to come up with such a complicated plan. You can just tell Mommy what you want.”
“We’re a family. There’s no need to be so paranoid about many things. This will easily cause misunderstandings between us and might even affect our communication, understand?”
Qiu Tong rubbed the top of Qiu Xingyuan’s head, messing up his neat hair.
She looked at the children with a gentle but serious gaze. “Mommy is going to do very dangerous things in the neighboring city. Do you really want to follow me?”
Qiu Xingyuan patted down his messy hair and gave an inaudible grunt.
“Then, you have to promise Mommy that you can’t run around and must be obedient! Do you understand?”
Qiu Xingqiao nodded vigorously and took the lead in expressing his stance. “We can help. We will definitely not bring you trouble!”
As a result, Qiu Tong had no choice but to ask Ke Le to help the children pack some simple luggage.
Sensing Qiu Tong’s compromise, Little Yu jumped up excitedly and waved her arms. She ran to Qiu Tong’s side and said, “Mommy agrees?”
Qiu Tong nodded. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were also very happy but they looked like they were suppressing their emotions. She found it rather funny.
“Mommy is the best!”
Little Yu expressed her emotions openly. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at her affectionate manner and felt a little envious.
Half an hour later, Song Yan waited outside with his team. He saw Qiu Tong bringing the children along. Song Yan took the initiative to take their luggage and placed them in the trunk. “It won’t be too long a car journey. Will the children be carsick?”
Qiu Tong shook her head. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao stared at Song Yan with eyes filled with hostility. They shut their mouths and did not answer.
“Uncle Song Yan, I want a hug!”
Little Yu had gone missing yesterday and Jin Yang had saved her. Naturally, she had some feelings for “Song Yan”.
Song Yan was stunned. He looked at the girl rushing over from Qiu Tong’s arms and instinctively opened his arms to hug her. His body was a little stiff.
He actually didn’t like children, but because of Qiu Tong’s gaze, he could only force an awkward smile and look down at Little Yu.
“Thank you Uncle, for yesterday!”
Little Yu took the initiative to show how close she was to Song Yan. She kissed Song Yan’s face several times.
Song Yan felt the little girl’s saliva all over his face. His scalp went numb and he hurriedly tried to push Little Yu further away. He took two deep breaths and persuaded patiently, “You’re a girl. You must be more careful and not behave too intimately with boys.”
“You can’t let strange boys hug you or kiss you, much less take advantage…”
Little Yu looked at him in confusion. After a moment of hesitation, she tilted her head and said, “But Uncle Song Yan is not a stranger.”
Song Yan was completely defeated by the naive child. He gave up and hugged Little Yu. “That’s right. As long as Little Yu is happy!”

chapters.title: Chapter 154 - Prison Riot
chapters.content:
Chapter 154: Prison Riot
Translator: Atlas Studios Editor: Atlas Studios
In S City, the government officers arrested the rioting refugees in the villa district and detained them in a detention center.
Jin Yang sat in the interrogation room and flipped through their statements. He also learned that there was a gang of hooligans in the neighboring city.
He deployed his skilled personal guards to the neighboring city to suppress and clean up the hooligans.
Jin Yang threw the statements on the table and was about to leave the detention center when he suddenly heard a commotion outside. The police officers in the detention center hurriedly ran out with their batons and guns.
The police captain kept urging, "Hurry up, don't let them escape!"
Jin Yang frowned and gestured for the guards beside him to stop a few police officers for questioning.
"What happened?"
When the police officer saw Jin Yang, he was so frightened that he immediately stood firmly in his military stance. He raised his hand and saluted as he replied, "Mr. President, there were too many refugees arrested just now and not enough guards in the prison. I don't know how the prisoners knew of this but they actually instigated a riot in an attempt to escape!"
"A few prisoners have already started climbing over the barbed wire fence. We were ordered by the warden to go as reinforcements!"
Jin Yang did not expect that the refugee problem would result in so much additional trouble. They exposed the negligence of the prison management!
He wanted to arrange for his guards to help deal with it, but he suddenly recalled the report about Qiu Tong. Her father Qiu Rong seemed to be imprisoned in S City!
Jin Yang frowned worriedly. "Let's go take a look."
His guards were worried about his safety and wanted to stop him, but he realized that Jin Yang's expression was serious. "Yes, Mr. President."
Outside the prison, many prisoners had already climbed out of the outer wall. The police officers were engaged in a melee with them.
Jin Yang waved his hand, indicating for the guards to step in and help. He pushed open the prison door and asked for Qiu Rong's prison number. He then strode over to check on the situation.
"Cough coughâ€¦cough cough!"
A weak cry for help came from the end of the gloomy and dark corridor. Qiu Rong was being strangled by one of his cellmates. His face had turned purple and his pupils were dilated. "Help, help!"
When Jin Yang saw the two entangled figures, he suddenly lifted his leg and kicked open the metal door, knocking over the criminal who had tried to kill Qiu Rong.
Qiu Rong lay on the ground panting heavily. The police officers who had rushed over immediately arrested the perpetrator and brought him out of the prison cell.
Jin Yang saw that Qiu Rong's expression had eased a little. He reached out to help him up and asked in a low voice, "Are you alright?"
Qiu Rong held his hand and stood up with difficulty. He originally wanted to thank his benefactor for saving his life, but when he saw that it was Jin Yang, his expression became slightly conflicted. He swallowed the words of gratitude he was about to say.
"Howâ€¦how's my daughter?"
Read latest Chapters at W u xiaWorld.Site Only
Qiu Rong asked in a hoarse voice. Jin Yang didn't notice the change in his attitude and arranged for the warden to transfer him to a relatively safe cell.
The warden acutely sensed Jin Yang's care for Qiu Rong and naturally did not dare to object.
Jin Yang looked at Qiu Rong's aged face and replied indifferently, "Qiu Tong is very safe. So are the children."
"I won't tell them what happened to you in prison. Don't worry."
Qiu Rong looked at Jin Yang gratefully and heaved a sigh of relief. He smiled weakly and nodded. "That's good.. It's good that they're alright!"
•••

chapters.title: Chapter 155 - Desolate City
chapters.content:
Chapter 155: Desolate City
After the unrest in the prison was suppressed, Jin Yang rushed to the neighboring city and handed all matters regarding the prison in S City to Mayor Shen.
Having received this important task, Mayor Shen naturally wanted to make a good impression. He hurriedly accepted the order and said, “Sir, don’t worry. I will definitely reorganize the various departments in the prison. Today’s incident will never happen again…”
Jin Yang nodded and left with a cold and indifferent gaze. Mayor Shen watched as his figure disappeared from the prison and hurriedly urged his subordinates to tabulate the prison name list.
It would take some time to sort out the information on the hundreds of prisoners. Mayor Shen sat in the warden’s office and waited for the news. Soon, a police officer ran in with a list of names. “Mayor, these are the names of the prisoners who escaped.”
“There were about a dozen, but their offences were relatively minor. They won’t be too dangerous to society.”
Mayor Shen flipped through the list. When he heard the police officer’s report, he immediately regarded him with a serious expression, “So what if they are not murderers? We don’t need to re-capture them then? These people escaped from prison! Wake up your idea!”
“Even if they only had one more day to serve before their release, you have to arrest them and make them serve out their last day!”
Mayor Shen issued his orders and the police officers quickly complied and went to search for them.
Mayor Shen casually spread out the stack of information on the escaped prisoners on the office table. Yu Ge’s picture and information were in that stack.
…
In the neighboring city, Qiu Tong and Song Yan rushed to their destination and found their surroundings desolate.
In the middle of the street were overturned baskets of rice and flour, as well as torn clothes and fabric. There were a few bloodstains in front of the trash can at the corner of the street. It was obvious that this place had been attacked and plundered by hooligans. The glass windows of the surrounding residential buildings and shops were already shattered, and none of the households were lit. Their doors and windows were tightly shut.
Qiu Tong and the others’ footsteps were extremely light, but they sounded especially crisp and clear in this deathly silent environment.
The children felt rather stifled. They held each other’s hands and followed closely behind Qiu Tong, not daring to make a sound.
“Hello, is anyone here?”
“We came from S City to help you…”
Song Yan’s subordinates knocked on the doors of several residents, but there was no response.
Suddenly, a figure popped out of the window of a dilapidated building. The thin, sallow-faced man stared warily at Qiu Tong and the others. He waved his hand and urged them, “Leave quickly. They’ve already plundered our place. As long as you hide, you won’t be beaten and robbed again!”
“Don’t anger them. When they come back…”
“I don’t want to die! I don’t want to die by their guns! Please stop meddling in other people’s business!”
The man seemed to have thought of something terrifying. He slammed the door shut in fear and used a wooden block to block his door.
Qiu Tong frowned and wanted to go forward to ask where the hooligans were gathered, but she could not get an answer no matter how hard she tried.
She shook her head at Song Yan and sighed. “Looks like they are too scared of the hooligans. They only want to hide and don’t dare to resist. We have to rely on ourselves to find their gathering place…”
Bang! Bang! Bang!
Just as Song Yan was about to reply, several gunshots rang out. Qiu Tong and Song Yan looked at each other before rushing in the direction of the noise.

chapters.title: Chapter 156 - Scouting
chapters.content:
Chapter 156: Scouting Translator: Atlas Studios Editor: Atlas Studios
The gunshots came from a tube-shaped building at the foot of the mountain. Qiu Tong and Song Yan hid behind the broken walls of the building to investigate the situation.
In the dark night, Qiu Tong and Song Yan laid low for nearly ten minutes without hearing any more gunshots. They exchanged glances and silently retreated to a quieter corner. Song Yan lowered his voice and said, "From the looks of it, the gunshots might have been misfirings while they were adjusting their guns."
"According to what the resident said earlier, they have already searched the residential buildings and shops in this area. It's relatively safer."
"Arrange for a large team to camp here. Stay alert and wait for orders."
Song Yan put on his pistol and protective gear and continued, "I'll go and check on the situation when it gets later into the night."
"I will go and get a general idea of their situation. We will discuss the specific battle plan when I return."
Song Yan wanted to stand up and leave, but Qiu Tong held onto his arm and insisted with a determined look, "I'll go with you."
"If you go alone and encounter danger, it will be very hard for you to escape. The two of us can take care of each other. If we encounter danger, we can discuss countermeasures. Now is not the time to be stubborn. Safety first!"
Song Yan looked at her in surprise and felt relieved. He could sense that Qiu Tong was concerned about him. However, Song Yan was not sure if her concern was for him oratain Yang? "The situation is unstable now. There is danger everywhere. The children need your presence and for you to take care of them. I can get a few subordinates to accompany me." Song Yan objected to Qiu Tong's suggestion, but she frowned impatiently. "Stop nagging." "Ke Le and the rest can protect the children. Qiu Xingyuan and Ye Luan will also take care of their younger siblings." "Your subordinates are good at close combat, but their investigative abilities are inferior to mine!" "You should know that I'm the best choice!" Time was ticking away. Song Yan finally relented and agreed to Qiu Tong's plan. The two of them hurried over to the vicinity of the tube-shaped apartment to investigate.
Qiu Tong gestured to Song Yan and ran around the corner to the back of the tube-shaped building. She realized that the seemingly dilapidated building was filled with noisy music and the sounds of drinking and chatting. Song Yan followed and pointed at a few tents set up in the empty space in front of the building. "There are about a dozen guns, some grenades and gunpowder."
"But the gunpowder is homemade, so it can't cause much damage."
Qiu Tong pointed upstairs and exchanged information with Song Yan in a low voice. "There are about a hundred people. They are disorderly and lax in management."
It seemed that this gang of hooligans had expanded in a hurry, and there were all sorts of riff-raff mixed in. Only 6o% to 70% of them actually had combat skills.
"Let's go back first." Song Yan and Qiu Tong looked at each other, wanting to quietly retreat the way they came. "Who's there! Don't move!"
Outside the apartment building, a gangster holding a gun was hiccuping as he staggered closer. He swung the submachine gun on his shoulder when he saw the two shadows in the darkness. He asked, "Who are you? Why are you here?"
Song Yan and Qiu Tong frowned, knowing that it was not good to make too much noise now.
If they were to attract the other hooligans around the building, they would be in an extremely unfavorable situation!
Qiu Tong's eyes darted around. She suddenly thought of a way. She grabbed Song Yan's arm and hurriedly said, "Let me borrow you for a moment!"
Before Song Yan could react, he saw Qiu Tong grabbing his hand and placing it on her waist...

chapters.title: Chapter 157 - Gangster
chapters.content:
Chapter 157: Gangster
The gangster stared at the two entangled figures and swallowed quietly. He took two steps forward and shouted, “Don’t move!”
Qiu Tong pretended to be an amorous couple with Song Yan. When she saw the gangster approaching, she pretended to be afraid and hid in Song Yan’s arms.
“It’s all your fault. It’s been so dangerous outside recently, and you still asked me to come here!”
“It’s the wilderness. What should we do now?”
Qiu Tong signaled Song Yan with her eyes to cooperate with her.
At this moment, Song Yan finally understood what Qiu Tong meant by borrowing him. He had no choice but to put on an act and hug her slender waist, pretending to be a man whose mind had been bewitched by lust. Song Yan said awkwardly, “I… I’m going to do you right here!”
The gangster was a little tipsy. Under the moonlight, he saw Qiu Tong’s charming figure and had some wicked thoughts.
Qiu Tong took the opportunity to beg, “Big Brother, please don’t tell anyone about us. Otherwise, I won’t be able to face anyone!”
“We’ll leave now. We won’t disturb you.”
Qiu Tong grabbed Song Yan’s hand and the two of them were about to leave when they heard the gangster shout, “Who told you to leave?”
“Move again and I’ll shoot!”
The gangster held his belt and wiped his nose with the back of his hand. He stared at Qiu Tong and said, “I won’t call anyone else over, but you have to come and give me a good time!”
“I haven’t had sweet flesh for many days. The women in the city are thick-waisted shrews. They don’t taste as good as you.”
“I saw you guys coming here in the middle of the night to hook up. You must be very open-minded then.”
Wielding his gun, the gangster said with a wicked smile, “As long as you make me happy, I’ll let you go!”
Song Yan looked a little unhappy. He reached for the gun at his waist, wanting to fight with the gangster.
Qiu Tong could tell what he wanted to do. She pressed his hand and shook her head, indicating for him to calm down.
They were very close to the building. If they opened fire, the entire gang would be mobilized. Qiu Tong and Song Yan would definitely not be a match for the whole party.
Now, she could only pretend to agree and lower her guard.
Song Yan understood Qiu Tong’s intentions. He gritted his teeth and said loudly, “Come over then, but be gentle. Don’t hurt my girlfriend.”
The gangster saw that Qiu Tong was not resisting at all. He lustfully approached the two of them and gestured for Song Yan to stand further away.
“Big Brother, it’s so inconvenient for you to carry that gun around.”
“What if you misfire and get injured? Don’t you already have a nice big gun in your pants?”
Standing in a sultry manner under the moonlight, Qiu Tong deliberately used a cheap seducing trick. The gangster lost control and threw his gun onto the ground, before unbuttoning his pants.
“Die!”
Qiu Tong seized the opportunity and swiftly approached him, using her hands to twist his neck. With a cracking sound, the guard fell to the ground, unconscious.
Song Yan watched her movements and couldn’t help clapping in surprise.
“I didn’t expect you to be such a violent woman.”
“When he wakes up, he’ll probably be afraid of women for the rest of his life, right?”
Song Yan dragged the gangster over to a nearby drain and threw him in. He picked up the gun and prepared to bring it back to the camp.
Qiu Tong glanced at him and said sarcastically, “Your acting skills are really lousy.”

chapters.title: Chapter 158 - Surrounded
chapters.content:
Chapter 158: Surrounded
In the wee hours of the morning, Qiu Tong and Song Yan deployed their forces to surround the tube-shaped building according to the terrain map drawn up.
The violent sounds of gunfire continued for nearly half an hour. Qiu Tong and Song Yan estimated that the firepower of the hooligan gang would definitely be insufficient to resist. Just as they were about to bring the rest of the troops down to assist in the attack, one of the soldiers from the front hurried back and reported, “Sir, they ran into the mountains through the tunnels!”
Qiu Tong and Song Yan frowned. They did not expect there to be a secret underground passage!
Now that the hooligans were frightened and had fled in a panic, they definitely would not have enough weapons with them. This was the best opportunity to pursue and attack.
“We will lead a team and surround them from both sides of the mountain!”
“If we give them time to rest and adjust to the new situation, things will definitely be disadvantageous for us…”
Song Yan agreed with Qiu Tong’s suggestion and immediately assigned the men and weaponry.
Qiu Xingyu was a little afraid as she recalled the fierce battle at the villa with the refugees. She hugged Song Yan nervously. “Uncle, I’m afraid.”
“Can I come with you? You will definitely be able to protect Little Yu. Just like that day… I only trust you!”
Song Yan looked down at her with a serious expression. There was impatience in his heart, but he could not show it.
Qiu Tong would be leading a small group of elite soldiers to quickly search the mountain. It would not be suitable to bring the children along. As a result, Song Yan could only reluctantly nod in agreement.
“I want to protect my little sister. I am coming along too.”
Qiu Xingyuan said with great determination. Qiu Xingqiao nodded vigorously and added, “Wherever Little Yu is, we will be there.”
Song Yan looked at the increasing number of burdens. His gaze landed on Ye Luan.
Ye Luan took out a dagger and stood firmly beside Qiu Tong. He raised his stubborn little face and said, “I’ll follow Auntie Qiu.”
Qiu Tong saw that Song Yan had many men by his side. Even so, she felt worried. She instructed the three children, “You must follow Uncle Song Yan closely and not run around. The battlefield is very dangerous. If you encounter bad people, you have to shout loudly, understand?”
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his thin lips. He could sense Qiu Tong’s anxiety and worry. He nodded. “I will protect them.”
Qiu Tong forced a smile and stared at Song Yan. “Protect them!”
Song Yan nodded in agreement. After affirming the headcounts of the two teams, they headed into the mountains from different directions.
The path into the mountain was a little rugged. Qiu Tong held Ye Luan’s little hand and reminded him to pay attention to rocky terrain. Ye Luan followed them with difficulty, unwilling to fall behind. He said, “Auntie Qiu, you don’t have to worry about me. I won’t be a burden.”
Qiu Tong looked up worriedly at the spot where Song Yan’s team had disappeared. Suddenly, she heard a few gunshots.
Everyone instantly went on high alert and hid behind a bunker. Qiu Tong aimed her gun at the enemy in front and pulled the trigger.
Gunshots rang out repeatedly in the forest, seemingly coming from different places.
Jin Yang rushed over from S City with his subordinates. Seeing that the building was empty, he knew that someone must have launched a surprise attack.
“Bring your men to the mountains to provide support.”
“Remember to differentiate between our side and the enemy! Don’t harm our own people…”
For some reason, the image of Qiu Tong suddenly appeared in Jin Yang’s mind. He frowned worriedly and rushed into the mountains.

chapters.title: Chapter 159 - No Reinforcements
chapters.content:
Chapter 159: No Reinforcements
The hooligans did not expect to meet such a tough opponent. They could tell that Song Yan and his men were armed and that they were no match for them.
They had originally planned to retreat into the mountains and take advantage of the terrain to take a breather. They would wait for their injured men to recover before going down the mountain to counterattack.
But the hooligans did not expect Qiu Tong, Song Yan and their team to pursue them.
They had no choice but to try and hold back the enemy with artillery fire. Song Yan and his men were targeting the main escape route of the hooligans. Their firepower was concentrated and fierce. Song Yan arranged for one of his men to keep an eye on the three children. He then immediately issued an order to find cover, stall and attract the enemy’s firepower.
Song Yan’s man hid the children under a safe rock bunker. He watched the intense battle, not wishing to be a babysitter.
“Hide here and don’t run around!”
With that, he stood up and rushed to the front line. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao shielded Little Yu at the innermost part of the rock and stared warily at the surrounding movements.
Qiu Xingqiao noticed the few grenades on the ground. Hunching, he slipped over to pick them up.
“Elder Brother, we have to help too.”
Qiu Xingyuan nodded with a tense expression.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao had a comprehensive understanding of military equipment so they knew how to use grenades. They used their short stature to evade the enemy’s notice and approached the hooligans’ hiding place. They threw the grenades…
Boom—
The grenades detonated one after another. The hooligans suffered heavy losses and the gunshots gradually died down.
Just as the children were rejoicing, they suddenly heard one of Song Yan’s subordinates running over. “Sir, the enemy in front of us has already retreated.”
“Some of the enemies are fleeing in the direction of Qiu Tong. Her team doesn’t have that many men and we don’t know if they have enough guns and ammunition. Should we send a portion of our men over to support them?”
“It seems that the enemy wants to retreat to the vicinity of the mountaintop and use the height as an advantage before counterattacking.”
Another one of the subordinates objected. “We can’t stay here for too long. We have to chase after them and scatter them…”
Song Yan frowned as he thought about it. He knew Qiu Tong’s ability to analyze the situation. He determined that the hooligans were already in a panic and were unable to think straight now. If he sent his men over to reinforce Qiu Tong’s team now, it would very likely cause trouble for her instead.
Qiu Tong’s team had a few local soldiers who were familiar with the terrain of the mountains. They should be able to handle them.
“No need. Continue to search according to the original plan. Don’t leave a single enemy alive!”
Song Yan paused for a few seconds before giving the order.
Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao, and Little Yu were hiding behind a rock. When they heard Song Yan’s conversation with his subordinates, they immediately became nervous and worried.
“Will Mommy be in danger?”
Little Yu asked with teary eyes. Qiu Xingyuan also felt like his heart was being squeezed by two hands.
Qiu Xingqiao looked at the surrounding guards in silence. He suddenly said, “We have to help her.”
Little Yu also hurriedly nodded and said, “That’s right, Elder Brother. Let’s go help Mommy! Little Yu can throw bombs. I am very accurate!”
Qiu Xingyuan and Little Yu stared at Qiu Xingyuan nervously, waiting for him to make a decision.
Qiu Xingyuan nodded. “Alright.”
The three children quietly crouched down to avoid Song Yan’s subordinate’s line of sight. They ran in the direction of Qiu Tong along the small path behind the mountain.

chapters.title: Chapter 160 - Coincidental Encounter
chapters.content:
Chapter 160: Coincidental Encounter
On the other side of the mountain, Qiu Tong was engaged in a tug-of-war with the remaining hooligans. The three children followed the gunshots and hid in a pile of rocks and grass to watch.
Song Yan’s subordinates were highly experienced and worked well together. Compared to the reckless hooligans, Qiu Tong had the advantage.
“Should we go around the mountain from the back?”
Song Yan’s men suggested according to the terrain. Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and realized that the hooligans seemed to be deliberately luring them deeper into the forest.
She imagined that there would definitely be a gathering place in the mountains. Qiu Tong instructed her team. “Find a place to surround the area 100 meters ahead. We also have to reduce the frequency of our attacks. Order a few scouts to throw away their guns and empty magazines…”
“Are you trying to confuse them?”
Song Yan’s subordinates could tell that Qiu Tong knew how to deploy troops. Their expressions changed from suspicion to trust as they obeyed her orders.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao realized that there were a few hooligans who wanted to ambush Qiu Tong. They immediately tried to warn her nervously.
Qiu Xingqiao picked up the slingshot that he carried with him and picked up a few stones from the ground. He aimed at the hooligan’s eyeballs.
The hooligan’s eyes were attacked and he instinctively wailed, “Ouch…”
Their hiding spots were exposed. Qiu Tong and her subordinates captured them alive for interrogation after.
Seeing that the situation had stabilized, Little Yu wanted to run out to look for Qiu Tong, but Qiu Xingyuan hurriedly grabbed her wrist and shook his head. “No.”
“She asked us to follow Song Yan. If she knows that we came here on our own, she will definitely scold us!”
Little Yu pouted reluctantly and pointed at Qiu Xingqiao’s slingshot. “But we helped Mommy beat up the bad guys. Second Brother and Eldest Brother are very powerful. We helped Mommy beat back several bad guys! Why wouldn’t she praise us?”
Qiu Xingyuan coaxed Little Yu in exasperation. He and Qiu Xingqiao looked at each other. The three children planned to sneak back the way they came from.
Halfway up the mountain, Jin Yang heard the sounds of gunshot and rushed over to help. He appeared at the fork in the road with a group of people.
The gunshots had suddenly stopped and they could not determine the exact location of the enemy. They could only wait…
Little Yu saw Jin Yang from afar. She shook off Qiu Xingqiao’s hand and skipped over to throw herself into Jin Yang’s arms.
Jin Yang was shocked by the sudden appearance of the three children, but he instinctively bent down to carry Little Yu.
The president’s guard instinctively wanted to stop the children from approaching. Jin Yang furrowed his brows and signaled them to move aside.
Little Yu didn’t notice anything amiss and hugged Jin Yang’s neck affectionately. She smiled sweetly and said, “Uncle Song Yan is looking for us? We’re very safe. We definitely won’t cause trouble for you and Mommy!”
Jin Yang’s expression and body stiffened when he heard Song Yan’s name.
When Little Yu saw his stiff expression, her eyes darted around. She held Jin Yang and kissed him twice.
Jin Yang’s face was covered in the little girl’s saliva. The president’s guards had never seen him like this before. They all lowered their heads, not daring to look straight at him.
Little Yu obediently continued, “Uncle Song Yan, don’t be angry!”
When Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao saw Little Yu behaving so intimately with him, their faces fell in annoyance. At the same time, an idea popped up in their minds—
Their little sister had changed sides!!

chapters.title: Chapter 161 - Escorting The Children
chapters.content:
Chapter 161: Escorting The Children
Jin Yang was a solitary character. Even Shao An, who had followed him for many years, was unable to get too close to him. He still had to maintain a safe distance from him.
But now, Jin Yang was letting Little Yu behave wantonly in his arms. He even wiped her saliva on his collar.
The president’s guards were shocked and stole glances at his face, which was very similar to those of the three children. They lowered their heads and speculated about their relationship.
Jin Yang brought the children to a safe hiding spot and asked tentatively, “Why are you guys here?”
Little Yu was innocent and naive. She was not guarded at all. She explained all their plans. “We overheard that you didn’t want to help Mommy. We were afraid that she would be in danger, so we secretly came to help Mommy beat up the bad guys!”
“Second Brother is very powerful. His slingshot is very accurate.”
“Eldest Brother is very smart. He was the one who led Second Brother and Little Yu to find Mommy’s location! We’re very powerful, right?”
Hearing Little Yu’s explanation, Jin Yang’s expression was somewhat complex and unfathomable.
Although the children were brave and resourceful, the situation in the mountains was constantly changing and filled with danger. It was definitely not safe for them to rush out now.
Song Yan did not even realize they were missing!
Jin Yang hugged Little Yu tightly in fear. He looked at the two boys who were extremely hostile towards him. “I’ll bring you guys to help Mommy, okay?”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao stared at him doubtfully and asked, “Really?”
“Of course, the situation on the battlefield has changed because of your help. I have to help her lure the enemy into an ambush.”
Jin Yang gently calmed the children’s emotions by acknowledging their help. At the same time, he called the guards beside him and said in a low voice, “Qiu Tong should have a plan. You guys will coordinate from the front and force the scattered hooligans to the ambush she has set up.”
Jin Yang reminded softly. “Remember, don’t let her team discover you…”
The guards respectfully obeyed the order but could not help muttering in their hearts. When had the president ever cared so much about the feelings of others?
It seemed that this Ms. Qiu Tong held an extraordinary place in the president’s heart!
The mountains were cold at night as a chilly wind blew. Little Yu could not help sneezing. Jin Yang looked down at her, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao, who were all wearing thin clothes. He frowned and looked for a place to hide nearby. “Let’s go and rest for a while. We’ll wait for Mommy to return.”
Jin Yang found a nearby house and brought the three children in to take shelter from the wind.
Seeing Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao sitting beside Little Yu and protecting her, Jin Yang smiled. He walked to the door to give the children some privacy. He recalled Song Yan’s warning to him. “Qiu Tong hates it when others lie to her…”
Jin Yang’s smile gradually disappeared. He clenched his fists and hammered on the door frame, his breathing heavy and vexed.
“Sir, all the hooligans have already entered Qiu Tong’s ambush. They have cleared the obstacles outside and can retreat at any time.”
“Should we send the children to her?”
The president’s guard ran over and reported. Jin Yang listened to the sounds of gunshots coming from the mountains and knew that the situation outside was not stable. He shook his head and said, “Go find some food and let the children fill their stomachs. We will take action when I give the order.”
Jin Yang turned back to look at the three children who were chatting amongst themselves. He sighed imperceptibly.
“If you didn’t want to forgive me, I won’t appear before you.”
Jin Yang looked in the direction of Qiu Tong’s ambush as he muttered to himself. His disappointed expression quickly returned to its usual coldness and calm.

chapters.title: Chapter 162 - The Children Are Missing
chapters.content:
Chapter 162: The Children Are Missing
Qiu Tong observed the enemy through a pair of binoculars and realized that the hooligans were running towards their ambush.
They had been in a deadlock and Qiu Tong was going to improvise to break the stalemate. But at this moment, it was as if someone was secretly helping her. Everything was progressing smoothly. The firepower of the hooligans gradually weakened. Qiu Tong raised her hand with a murderous look. “Surround them!”
“Yes!”
Song Yan’s subordinates immediately surrounded the hooligans with guns and restrained them.
Unable to escape, the hooligans panicked and fell into tumult. In the end, Song Yan’s subordinates easily captured them alive.
As the night fell, Qiu Tong looked at the hooligans, who numbered fifty in total. She assigned a portion of her men to guard them, while the rest followed her to support Song Yan and meet him at the mountaintop!
The road through the mountains was rather difficult to traverse. Qiu Tong hurried with some difficulty to the location where Song Yan had issued the signal flare. She saw the other hooligans tied up by the bonfire.
Song Yan saw her and immediately went up to ask, “How’s the situation over there?”
“We managed to ambush them. We need to send people to search the entire mountain to see if there are any survivors who managed to escape.”
Qiu Tong wiped the dirt and sweat from her face as she offered her combat advice.
Song Yan expressed his agreement and summoned his subordinates to carry out the task.
Qiu Tong looked at the troops who had already temporarily set up camp and were resting. She suddenly looked around uneasily and asked nervously, “Where are the children? Why don’t I see them?”
Song Yan had already been feeling that something was amiss. It was only after she reminded him that he realized he had not seen the children for a long time.
He hurriedly sent someone to look for the children.
Almost at the same time, one of his men rushed over with a flustered expression and reported, “Sir, the children are gone!”
He lowered his head guiltily when he saw Qiu Tong, his eyes avoiding hers.
Qiu Tong’s expression changed drastically when she heard that. She rushed to the subordinate and grabbed his collar, asking in a hoarse voice, “How did they disappear?”
His subordinate stole a glance at Song Yan and had no choice but to answer honestly, “I saw that the fight was at a critical stage and wanted to help. So I left the children behind a rock bunker and instructed them not to run around!”
“But when I went back to fetch them, I realized that there was no one there anymore.”
“There are only three messy sets of footprints on the ground. They seem to be heading towards the mountains…”
Qiu Tong’s lips turned pale. She turned around and glared at Song Yan. “This is what you meant by protecting them?!”
Seeing Qiu Tong’s attitude towards Song Yan, the subordinate immediately defended him. “It’s my fault. It has nothing to do with Sir.”
Qiu Tong gritted her teeth and shook him off. She picked up a few submachine guns from the ground and strapped them onto her body. She then led Ke Le and the others to find the children.
Song Yan looked at his subordinate coldly and said indifferently, “You failed in your mission. Go and receive your own punishment.”
His subordinate nodded in agreement, not daring to disobey or explain further.
Song Yan assigned all his subordinates to search the mountain immediately. He shouted, “We have to find the children before it gets dark. Otherwise, you will all be punished!”
“Yes.”
His subordinates didn’t dare to delay and scattered in all directions, diving into the forest and shouting the three children’s names.

chapters.title: Chapter 163 - Parent-Child Time
chapters.content:
Chapter 163: Parent-Child Time
Song Yan ran to Qiu Tong’s side and tugged at her elbow as he hurriedly explained, “I’m sorry, I failed to discipline my subordinates well.”
Qiu Tong shook him off unhappily. She stared at Song Yan coldly and said, “As the commander, I can understand why you didn’t have the time to look after them during a critical situation! But you did promise me at the start.”
“You said that you would protect them! And now? You think you can dismiss me with just a few words of apology?”
“Song Yan! If you can’t take responsibility for what you say, don’t make any promises…”
Qiu Tong stared at him with a dark expression and warned coldly, “If the children suffer any injuries, I won’t let you off!”
Song Yan knew how serious this matter was to Qiu Tong. He could not argue with her, so he let go of her hand and said, “I’ve already arranged for people to search the entire mountain. We won’t miss out any hidden caves or corners.”
Qiu Tong looked at the camp and frowned as she thought of Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao. Even if they were in danger, they would think of a way to escape.
“I’ll go back and see if they managed to find their own way back to camp…”
Qiu Tong gritted her teeth and quickened her pace towards the camp. Song Yan watched as her figure disappeared from view. He said fiercely to his subordinates, “What are you still standing here for? Go find the children!”
…
In the house on the mountain, Jin Yang sat with the children in front of a warm charcoal brazier. The children’s faces were all red from the heat.
The fierce battle with the hooligans lasted for a long time. Little Yu covered her stomach with her hands, feeling a little hungry. She stole a glance at the snack bag hanging from the president’s guard’s waist. It smelled like beef. She swallowed her saliva greedily and quietly bit her lips to suppress her hunger.
Jin Yang noticed her strange behavior and smiled. He gestured for the guard to bring the food over and handed it to Little Yu. “Do you want to have something to eat?”
Little Yu shook her head reservedly and stole a glance at Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s faces. “Uncle Song Yan, will you feed me?”
“I’ve touched a lot of dirty things outside. My hands are dirty!”
Little Yu deliberately stretched out her mud-stained hand and waved it in front of Jin Yang’s eyes. Jin Yang was helpless against the girl’s coquettishness and could only choose the most tender beef jerky and bring it to her mouth. Just as Little Yu was about to open her mouth to take a bite, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao ran up to them and blocked it.
“Sister, how could you betray us?”
Qiu Xingqiao stared at Little Yu in dismay. He stuffed his hand into the snack bag and drew out two strips of beef jerky to feed Little Yu.
“Here, Second Brother will feed you!”
Little Yu pursed her lips tightly and dodged around Qiu Xingqiao. She covered her mouth with her hand and said, “Second Brother’s hands are dirty too!”
“I want Uncle Song Yan to feed me…”
When Jin Yang saw the children running crazily beside him, he could only resign himself to fate and let them treat him as a plaything. His face was filled with a blissful but troubled smile. When the president’s guards saw this scene, they all gaped in shock.
“Second Brother is so naughty! Little Yu’s hair is all messy now. Uncle Song Yan, can you help me braid it?”
Little Yu was especially clingy as she sat in Jin Yang’s arms. Jin Yang had received a mission and was afraid of hurting the girl’s hair. His movements were stiff as he carefully arranged her hair into a comical but adorable style.
The president’s guards could not help bursting into laughter when they saw what the president had done with hair of the adorable little girl.

chapters.title: Chapter 164 - Slap
chapters.content:
Chapter 164: Slap
Following Jin Yang’s instructions, the president’s guard took out the food he carried with him. He distributed it to the three hungry children.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao sat on the bench and ate their food. There was no hint of harshness or disdain on their stubborn and determined faces.
Jin Yang could tell that Qiu Tong had taught them well. If Little Yu couldn’t finish her food, she would share it with her two brothers. Qiu Xingyuan would even pick up some food that had fallen to the ground and put them in his mouth. Sensing Jin Yang’s gaze, he explained awkwardly, “The locust plague hasn’t ended.”
“Food is a precious thing. Those baddies only do bad things because they lack food…”
When Jin Yang heard his words, his eyes flickered with admiration and relief as he rubbed Qiu Xingyuan’s head. “You did very well.”
Qiu Xingyuan’s small body was a little stiff, but he managed to quickly move away from Jin Yang’s touch. He smoothed his ruffled hair with a slightly disdainful expression.
“It’s getting dark outside. I came from the other side of the mountain road and forgot the direction and location of the camp.”
“Do you remember?”
Jin Yang asked. Qiu Xingqiao pointed to the east and said, “You can’t even find the camp?”
“We entered the mountain from the east. The camp is behind the building. There are three rows of poplar trees surrounding that empty space. Their leaves are a little yellow!”
Qiu Xingqiao carefully described the many details surrounding the camp. Jin Yang turned to look at his guards. They immediately understood and went out to scout the way.
A few minutes later, Jin Yang set off with the three children, wanting to send them back to the camp. He waited for Qiu Tong to appear before leaving.
Outside the camp, Jin Yang did not see Qiu Tong. He knew that she had probably discovered that the children were gone and was searching the mountains.
He placed Little Yu firmly on the ground and made an excuse that he needed to check the situation on the battlefield. “You must stay here obediently and wait for Mommy to return. You can’t run around anymore, understand?”
Jin Yang instructed them, still feeling a little reluctant to leave the children. But Little Yu suddenly stuck her head out and looked behind him. She waved excitedly and shouted, “Mommy!”
Qiu Tong arrived at the camp just in time to see that the three children were standing there perfectly fine. She was so excited that she nearly fell over herself.
“Where did you guys go? Are you alright? Are you hurt anywhere?”
Qiu Tong hugged Qiu Xingyu tightly and kissed her dirty face. She then turned to look at Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao and pulled them into her arms. The three children were a little breathless from being hugged by her. They could only raise their hands and pat her back weakly. “Mommy, cough cough!”
“Where did you guys go?”
Qiu Tong repeated the question in a hoarse voice. Little Yu pointed at Jin Yang and said, “We’ve always been together with Uncle Song Yan.”
Jin Yang, “!”
Qiu Tong looked back and saw the figure that she had neglected to notice earlier.
They were with Song Yan all along?!
What was all that about earlier then? Was Song Yan trying to trick her?
Qiu Tong stood up angrily and rushed in front of Jin Yang. She gritted her teeth and slapped him.
Smack—
The clear sound frightened the children so much that they did not dare to speak. The president’s guards wanted to step forward, but saw Jin Yang’s secret gesture. They could only stand rooted to the ground.
“Song Yan, what do you mean by this?”
“Is it fun to trick me?”
Qiu Tong interrogated him sternly. She panted in agitation and stared fixedly at the change in Jin Yang’s expression.

chapters.title: Chapter 165 - Protecting "Song Yan"
chapters.content:
Chapter 165: Protecting “Song Yan”
Qiu Tong used a lot of strength and left a clear mark on the side of Jin Yang’s face, which was quickly swelling up.
Jin Yang could feel the fear in Qiu Tong’s heart at the thought of losing her children. He didn’t want to reveal his identity by explaining himself.
Song Yan’s warning lingered in Jin Yang’s ears, making him realize that his cover had been blown. Qiu Tong would never forgive him.
At the thought of this, Jin Yang lowered his head in silence and said, “I’m sorry.”
He did not try to explain himself, making it seem as if he was admitting his terrible prank. Qiu Tong’s anger towards him intensified.
When Qiu Xingyu saw that Jin Yang had been slapped, she hurriedly ran to his side. She tugged at Jin Yang’s sleeve and explained to Qiu Tong, “Mommy, we secretly planned to sneak away. It has nothing to do with Uncle Song Yan!”
“We wanted to help you, but we were afraid of being scolded, so we wanted to head back…”
“But we met Uncle Song Yan on the way back. He didn’t do anything wrong! It’s wrong for Mommy to hit people.”
Little Yu stamped her feet in dismay. She took the initiative to grab Jin Yang’s sleeve. “Uncle Song Yan, does it hurt? Squat down!”
Seeing that she was about to cry from anxiety, Jin Yang had no choice but to obediently squat down.
Qiu Xingyu used her hand to gently rub the mark on the side of his face. She pouted and blew at it. She muttered, “It won’t hurt if I blow on it!”
Jin Yang was so touched that his heart seemed to melt as he hugged her. “Uncle doesn’t feel any pain.”
He raised his slender fingers to wipe the tears off Little Yu’s face, not forgetting to speak up for Qiu Tong. “Mommy is worried about you guys, that’s why she’s so anxious. Uncle understands…” Qiu Tong widened her eyes in surprise. Was he pretending to be magnanimous now to win over her children?!
As expected, Little Yu turned to look at her with clear eyes, her expression a little resentful.
“Come here!”
Qiu Tong placed her hands on her hips and ordered in a low voice.
Qiu Xingyuan saw Qiu Tong’s furious expression. He knew that this was happening only because they had run away. He took the initiative to step up and admit his mistake.
“It really has nothing to do with him. He just happened to meet us.”
“If you want to punish someone, punish me. I was the one who ran off with my siblings.”
Qiu Xingyuan wanted to shoulder all the blame. Qiu Xingqiao also put on a brave front and stood in front of Little Yu and Jin Yang. “I have a part in this too!”
These children seemed to all be on Song Yan’s side!
Didn’t they know how dangerous the mountains were?!
Qiu Tong’s gradually quelling anger was once again ignited by their protective actions. She pulled Little Yu over and held her in the crook of one arm, before grabbing Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao also to drag them back towards the camp. “Looks like I have to let you kids suffer a little!”
Jin Yang looked at the lights in the camp and turned to leave bitterly.
Late into the night, Song Yan and his men searched the mountains but could not find any trace of the children. He returned to the camp with regret and guilt.
He had just stepped into the camp when Little Yu ran out of the tent. She threw herself into Song Yan’s arms joyfully and hugged his neck especially intimately. “Uncle Song Yan, why are you only back now?”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s attitude towards him also eased a little as they took the initiative to welcome him. They stood a couple of steps away and stared at him.
Song Yan hugged Little Yu in surprise. Seeing that they were not injured, his worried heart gradually relaxed.

chapters.title: Chapter 166 - Avoidance
chapters.content:
Chapter 166: Avoidance
Song Yan asked his subordinates to stay and guard the surroundings of the camp. He placed Little Yu on the ground and kept a distance from her as he asked, “Where did you guys go? Are you injured? Do you need me to call a military doctor over to take a look?”
When Qiu Xingyu heard his question, she blinked in confusion and asked, “Wasn’t it Uncle Song Yan who sent us back?”
“Why did you run off and then come back again? Don’t you remember anything?”
Qiu Xingyu turned around and stole a glance in the direction of Qiu Tong’s tent. She widened her eyes as if she had guessed the answer. She said in a low voice, “Is Uncle still angry with Mommy? Mommy must have hit you very hard, right?”
“Don’t blame her. Mommy regretted it after you left. She even secretly scanned the campsite for a long time!”
Qiu Xingyu tried to ease the awkward tension between them.
Song Yan was stunned as he stood rooted to the ground. He did not understand Little Yu’s words and could only half-heartedly return to the tent to sort out his thoughts.
Qiu Tong heard movement outside the tent. She got up and saw Song Yan with the children.
Over the past few days, Qiu Tong could sense that the children relied on him now. Even Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s attitude had changed.
Qiu Xingyuan’s willingness to stand up for Song Yan surprised Qiu Tong.
Annoyance and embarrassment flashed across her face as she pursed her red lips. Qiu Tong recalled her impulsive actions and frowned as she rubbed her own head.
Why did she slap Song Yan?
From S City to the neighboring city, Song Yan was the one who helped them survive the difficult times.
Qiu Tong knew that it was normal for Song Yan to not be able to take care of the children while commanding an attack, but she still blamed him.
“Why can’t I control my temper when it comes to the children?”
Qiu Tong sighed and picked up two cooked eggs before walking out of the tent. She looked at Song Yan from afar and explained awkwardly, “I was a little too agitated and went overboard. I’m sorry.”
“Since the children were found safely, let’s forget about what happened before. Let’s not talk about it anymore.”
A temporary light had been placed beside the tent, and Song Yan’s figure happened to be shrouded in shadow. Qiu Tong walked up to him with an egg in her hand and said, “Your face is still swollen, right? Roll an egg over the swollen area. It can reduce the swelling faster.”
“Let me help you.”
Qiu Tong raised her hand to help Song Yan settle the matter. Song Yan instinctively waved her hand away. He turned around slightly and hid his face in the darkness.
“I can do it myself…”
Qiu Tong looked at him in surprise and couldn’t help frowning as she tilted her head to look at him.
Song Yan took the eggs from her hand and hurriedly replied in a low and hoarse voice, “I understand and I’m not angry. You don’t have to take that matter to heart.”
Song Yan’s emotions were a little unstable. He pieced together Little Yu and Qiu Tong’s words and quickly came to a conclusion—Jin Yang had come!
He even communicated with Qiu Tong. Song Yan’s eyes surged with anger and conflicting emotions. He gripped the eggs tightly to suppress his emotions.
“The children must have been shocked today. Stay with them.”
Song Yan pushed Little Yu to Qiu Tong’s side, while he took two steps back to avoid Qiu Tong’s gaze, not letting her see his face.

chapters.title: Chapter 167 - Teasing With Words
chapters.content:
Chapter 167: Teasing With Words
“… If there’s nothing else, I still have to review today’s operation with my men. I’ll go back first.”
Song Yan’s attitude and tone were cold and perfunctory as he turned around and returned to the tent. Qiu Tong was stunned, her eyes filled with disbelief.
Qiu Xingyu hooked Qiu Tong’s finger obediently and shook it twice to comfort her. “Uncle Song Yan is unhappy from the slap. Mommy has to understand!”
Qiu Xingyuan frowned in dissatisfaction when he saw that Qiu Tong’s sincere apology was met with Song Yan’s cold response.
Something was not right!
Qiu Tong looked up at the light source, before turning toward Song Yan’s tent. She subconsciously muttered to herself.
She had once lived during the post-apocalyptic era. The extremely dangerous environment had allowed Qiu Tong to gain excellent eyesight and observational skills. Even though she was in a dark environment with little light, she could still accurately capture everything within a two-meter radius and clearly remember every tiny detail!
Qiu Tong was certain that there were no finger marks on Song Yan’s face just now.
“He shouldn’t have recovered so quickly. Unless he has supernatural powers…”
Qiu Tong shook her head to shake off the ridiculous thoughts that had flashed through her mind. She sent the children back to their room in the encampment and coaxed them to sleep.
Taking advantage of the darkness of the night, Qiu Tong saw that Song Yan’s tent was still lit. She took the initiative to walk to the door with a glass of warm water and knocked lightly.
Song Yan’s tall and slender figure went to the door but he did not open it. Instead, he asked in a clear voice, “What’s the matter?”
Qiu Tong didn’t expect to be refused entry. Thinking of Little Yu’s words, she said in an even more sincere tone, “I didn’t consider your feelings and embarrassed you in front of your subordinates, but I didn’t do it on purpose…”
“The children are my weak spot. I can’t accept or tolerate any accidents happening to them.”
“Since you promised me to take care of them, you should take responsibility for at least part of it. Why don’t we sit down and talk things out?”
Qiu Tong did not want to keep the conflict and resentment in her heart. So she was taking the initiative now, but Song Yan did not open the door.
“It’s late at night and you want to come into my room? Are you planning to do something to me?”
“The unrest caused by the hooligans has already been suppressed. If others see this, they might misunderstand our relationship.”
Song Yan’s voice carried a hint of a smile as he said, “Of course, if you are indeed here with such intentions, I would be happy to invite you in. But you might end up staying the whole night and won’t be able to return.”
Qiu Tong was startled to see Song Yan already pressing down on the door handle. She hurriedly placed the glass of warm water on the ground. “Rest early.”
“We’ll talk about our matter another day!”
Qiu Tong turned and left. Song Yan wiped the smile off his face. He brought the glass of warm water to the table in the room and dialed a familiar number on his phone.
Beep beep beep—
Three seconds later, the call connected.
Song Yan pretended to be relaxed as he stuffed his hand into his pocket. He leaned against the table and gritted his teeth. “Since you are already here, let’s meet.”
Jin Yang knew his intentions and reported his location. Song Yan immediately rushed over.
In the dark night, two extremely similar faces stared at each other. Jin Yang opened his hand and gestured for Song Yan to take a seat, but Song Yan kicked the seat away. He looked at Jin Yang with a cold smile and asked, “What are your intentions?”

chapters.title: Chapter 168 - Brothers Falling Out
chapters.content:
Chapter 168: Brothers Falling Out
Under the dim moonlight, Jin Yang’s profile was especially eye-catching.
Song Yan stared at him with a mocking expression. “I didn’t expect the president to be slapped by a woman? Are those guards of yours all useless?”
“The official residence isn’t good enough for you? Did you come into the mountains to look at the scenery? This place is not as comfortable as the presidential palace!”
Jin Yang pursed his thin lips and didn’t answer. Song Yan was not used to Jin Yang behaving so passively. He raised his eyebrows and said loudly, “You came to S City because of Qiu Tong. You couldn’t sit still when you heard that she might be in danger?”
“I warned you, but you still appeared in front of Qiu Tong and looked after her children.”
“Mr. President, are you interested in Qiu Tong? To put it bluntly, you like her!”
Song Yan observed Jin Yang’s expression carefully, while Jin Yang recalled all sorts of things that had happened after he met Qiu Tong. She appeared cold, but she was actually a very soft-hearted woman. Jin Yang had started paying special attention to Qiu Tong’s actions some time ago, taking her seriously.
The intimate image of Song Yan and Qiu Tong appeared in Jin Yang’s mind. He frowned and said, “We met by chance.”
Song Yan slammed the table in anger when Jin Yang did not admit or deny his feelings.
“You’ve always been such a hypocrite since you were young!”
“You always say that you won’t fight with me over anything. That you will always give me whatever I want. But in reality?”
Song Yan raised his hand and pointed at Jin Yang’s face. His eyes were filled with indignance and anger as he gritted his teeth. “You snatched everything from me. Be it the position of president or the attention of our parents, you never left anything for me!”
“Jin Yang, stop pretending. I’m not like Dad and Mom who are easily fooled by you. I’ve already seen through your true colors!”
Song Yanshen adjusted his emotions and stared at Jin Yang’s silent expression. “I’ll give you one last chance.”
“If you want me to believe you, don’t ever appear in front of Qiu Tong again. Otherwise… don’t blame me for what happens next.”
Song Yan kicked aside the broken tables and chairs, walking over to Jin Yang’s side with cold eyes. He whispered into his ear, “This time, I hope you won’t lie to me or disappoint me!”
Jin Yang felt a wave of helplessness. He had no way of explaining. Faced with Song Yan’s anger and bullying, he could only choose to retreat.
“Okay, I promise.”
After receiving Jin Yang’s answer, Song Yan turned around and left without another word.
…
The next morning, all the hooligans in the neighboring city had been eliminated. There would be no future trouble.
Qiu Tong woke the children up for a simple breakfast, planning to return to S City with Song Yan.
When she arrived at the tent with the porridge, she realized that Song Yan’s tent was empty.
Qiu Tong was about to stop a guard beside her to inquire when one of Song Yan’s subordinates took the initiative to walk to her side. He said respectfully, “Sir has something to do and will leave first. He has ordered us to escort Miss Qiu and the children back to S City. We can set off at any time after you pack up.”
“When did he leave?”
Qiu Tong frowned as she looked at the daily necessities Song Yan had left behind. She speculated that he had left in a hurry and felt increasingly puzzled.
Song Yan’s subordinate kept a straight face, his expression cold and serious. He refused to say anything else. “Miss Qiu, please don’t make things difficult for us.”

chapters.title: Chapter 169 - Coincidental Encounter At The Airport
chapters.content:
Chapter 169: Coincidental Encounter At The Airport
At the airport terminal, the plane to S City was at the airport, waiting for the passengers to check their tickets.
Qiu Xingyuan stared at the heavy-duty planes outside the airport, his eyes filled with confusion. From time to time, he would steal glances at Qiu Tong, but he could not bring himself to ask.
Qiu Tong saw through his intentions and took the initiative to walk to his side. She pointed at the heavy-duty planes and said, “These are all modified military models. Although you can’t tell just by looking, judging from the smoothness of the machines and the gun barrels still attached, they should be from the batch that was eliminated three years ago. They belong to the same batch as the modified drones.”
“But why are they at a civilian airport?”
Qiu Xingyuan asked with furrowed brows. When Qiu Xingqiao overheard their conversation, he came over to eavesdrop with interest.
Qiu Tong recalled what had happened and looked up at the VIP room. “It might be used to transport those hooligans.”
The doubts between Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s brows dissipated. Their attitude towards Qiu Tong changed slightly, and they looked at her with admiration.
“Uncle Song Yan?”
Little Yu sat on a chair in boredom, swinging her legs. With her excellent eyesight, she spotted a familiar figure in front of her.
Qiu Tong followed her gaze and froze in surprise—why was he here?!
Jin Yang also sensed Qiu Tong’s gaze. He remembered his promise to Song Yan, but it was too late to turn around and hide.
“They said that you had something to do and left first?”
“Why aren’t there any guards with you? Where are your subordinates? Where did they go?”
Qiu Tong blurted out in confusion as she quickly blocked Jin Yang’s path.
Jin Yang knew that he couldn’t avoid her, so he lied and replied perfunctorily, “There was a last-minute cancelation in my itinerary. But my men were already sent over.”
Qiu Tong raised her eyebrows, but when she saw the faint mark on the side of Jin Yang’s face, her expression changed to astonishment. She could not help feeling puzzled.
Why would the mark disappear and reappear again?
Qiu Tong raised her hand, wanting to touch the mark, but Jin Yang instinctively dodged.
An awkward atmosphere surged between them. Qiu Tong lowered her hand to her side and was about to say something when the airport broadcast urged the passengers to board the plane. Qiu Tong led the children to check their tickets as Jin Yang followed them into the cabin.
According to the seat number on the boarding pass, Qiu Tong noticed that Jin Yang was sitting in the same row as them. They would be sitting next to each other.
Qiu Xingyuan’s sharp eyes could tell that something was amiss. He signaled to Qiu Xingqiao with his eyes and suddenly said, “I’m a little airsick and need to sit in a seat by the aisle.”
Qiu Xingqiao noted his signal and took the initiative to tug at Qiu Tong’s sleeve. “I’m a little scared. I want to sit next to you.”
Qiu Tong saw that the usually independent children were being strangely clingy. She turned to look at Jin Yang.
Qiu Xingyuan said in a low voice, “Uncle won’t fight with us for seats, right?”
Qiu Xingqiao did not say anything else. He just pulled Qiu Tong to sit down and sandwiched her between himself and Qiu Xingyuan. They looked at Jin Yang warily like two bodyguards.
Qiu Xingyuan took the initiative to fasten Qiu Tong’s seatbelt and reminded her stiffly, “Safety first!”
Qiu Tong was stunned by their attentions. She blinked and looked at Jin Yang.
Why did she feel like she was being treated like an object?!

chapters.title: Chapter 170 - Turbulent Aircraft
chapters.content:
Chapter 170: Turbulent Aircraft
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Xingyu looked at their childish behavior and could not help exposing them. “Eldest Brother and Second Brother are doing this on purpose.”
“You guys just don’t want Mommy to sit next to Uncle Song Yan. According to the boarding pass, they should be sitting together!”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked a little awkward, but they tried their best to explain themselves. “We are young and need to be accompanied by our parent.”
Did Qiu Xingyuan actually call her his “parent”?
Qiu Tong smirked in surprise. The commotion from their group attracted the attention of the surrounding passengers, who whispered praises of the children’s intelligence and cuteness.
