Faced with the two children’s hostility, Jin Yang had no choice but to carry Little Yu and sit on the other side.
“Uncle Song Yan, don’t be disheartened. Little Yu will secretly help you.”
Qiu Xingyu felt that he did not seem like Yu Ge or any other man. He treated Qiu Tong and them well and was genuine about it. As a result, Little Yu’s heart was tipping in favor of him. Jin Yang was comforted by her. Warmth surged in his heart as he rubbed the top of her head and took the initiative to fasten her seatbelt.
The flight took off. Qiu Tong watched the interaction between Little Yu and Jin Yang and felt her eyelids grow heavy.
The battle with the hooligans in the neighboring city had exhausted a lot of her energy. Last night, Qiu Tong was worried that the children would run around again. She could not sleep due to the guilt she felt towards Song Yan. At this moment, she could not bear it anymore and closed her eyes.
Amidst the noise in the cabin, Qiu Tong nodded off from time to time, her body swaying uncontrollably.
Seeing that she was dozing off, Qiu Xingyuan raised his hand to hold her head so that she could sleep more comfortably. However, he put them down just before he made contact with her. With an awkward expression, he straightened his body and tried to use his shoulder to support her, but he was not tall enough.
Qiu Xingyuan’s movements attracted the attention of Little Yu and Qiu Xingqiao.
Qiu Xingyuan clenched his fists and coughed lightly. He deliberately looked elsewhere and pretended to be oblivious.
Little Yu whispered nervously, “Mommy will be very uncomfortable sleeping like this!”
She quickly shot Qiu Xingyuan a look, wanting him to exchange seats with Jin Yang so that he could support Qiu Tong.
However, Qiu Xingyuan had finally managed to separate the two of them, so he was naturally unwilling. He looked at Song Yan doubtfully. He kept feeling that this man was very suspicious and was not a good person worth their trust!
Qiu Xingyuan’s stubbornness and persistence angered Little Yu so much that she stuck her hands at her waist. She quietly pointed at Qiu Tong and mimicked her actions, gently rocking her head around. Little Yu frowned and stared at Qiu Xingyuan, urging him to quickly change seats.
Qiu Xingyuan looked at Qiu Tong with a hesitant and conflicted expression. She had eyebags and she looked exhausted.
This woman had not had a good rest recently and even ran across the entire mountain for them.
Qiu Xingyuan sighed and undid his seatbelt. He went over to Jin Yang’s side. “Please take care of her…”
Jin Yang helped Qiu Xingyuan to secure his seatbelt before turning around to return to Qiu Tong’s side.
At this moment, turbulence rocked the plane. Qiu Tong had unbuckled her seatbelt earlier to get into a more comfortable sleeping position. As a result, her body flew forward. Seeing this, Jin Yang hurriedly sat down and caught Qiu Tong’s head with his shoulder.
The three children looked over in unison and saw the slightly amorous postures of the two adults.. Different emotions flashed across each of their eyes.

chapters.title: Chapter 171 - Cabin Dream
chapters.content:
Chapter 171: Cabin Dream
In her sleep, Qiu Tong seemed to have found a comfortable support. She gently rubbed Jin Yang’s shoulder and took the initiative to hold his arm as she continued to sleep.
Jin Yang sat up stiffly, not daring to move an inch. He could feel Qiu Tong’s steady breathing on his neck. His heartbeat followed her breathing rhythm and in just a few minutes, his palms were covered in a thin layer of sweat.
Jin Yang raised his hand to support Qiu Tong’s neck and her face, allowing her to sleep more comfortably.
In the noisy cabin, Jin Yang was also gradually getting sleepy under Qiu Tong’s influence. He closed his eyes and leaned back in his seat.
In his half-asleep state, Jin Yang suddenly recalled some vague memories.
In the past, there seemed to have been a woman who used to lean against him like this. Her stomach bulged slightly and Jin Yang gently placed his hand on it.
“You’re going to be a father soon. Are you happy?”
Jin Yang felt his heart ache. He wanted to see the woman’s face clearly, but it was as if there were layers of mist surrounding her.
A gentle breeze blew past. Through the mist, Jin Yang saw that the woman’s eyes vaguely resembled Qiu Tong’s. He wanted to take a closer look, but a sharp pain came from his temples. He covered his head in pain, and his abrupt actions woke Qiu Tong up.
Qiu Tong saw that it was Jin Yang beside her. She was surprised to see his pained expression and hurriedly rubbed his temples to relieve the pain.
Jin Yang narrowed his eyes and gripped Qiu Tong’s wrist tightly. He shook his head lightly and said, “Don’t go!”
Qiu Tong looked at him strangely. She could sense Jin Yang’s desire to keep her. She comforted him softly, “Song Yan? What’s wrong?”
Her voice woke Jin Yang up from his trance. He pushed Qiu Tong’s hand away awkwardly and tidied his messy clothes. “Sorry.”
Jin Yang realized that he had lost his composure earlier. Seeing Qiu Tong’s worried gaze, he could only try to offer an excuse. “I had a nightmare just now.”
Qiu Tong did not probe further. A strange silence descended between them.
Why did memories that didn’t belong to him keep appearing in his mind?
And those memories were very clear. All the details were very real, including the emotions and scents…
Jin Yang’s gaze landed on Qiu Tong. From the first time they met, Qiu Tong gave him an inexplicable sense of familiarity.
Every time he interacted more intimately with her, Jin Yang would recall some memory fragments.
This influence was becoming increasingly intense and had gone beyond Jin Yang’s control.
Jin Yang pursed his thin lips and sat up straight. He wanted to keep a distance from the woman beside him and cut off this connection.
But he heard Qiu Tong cough and couldn’t help asking, “Do you have a cold?”
“No. Maybe it’s just that the cabin is a little dry and my body isn’t used to it.”
Qiu Tong replied hoarsely, feeling a little dizzy.
The attendant pushed a cart over from behind. Qiu Tong saw her distributing drinks and wanted to get a glass of warm water.
Qiu Tong raised her hand, but a brat sitting in the row behind her stood up noisily.
The brat was holding a plastic cup filled with warm water. Ignoring his parents’ attempts to stop him, he continued to fuss and jump around.
Splash—
The plane rocked again and he lost his balance, splashing the warm water all over Qiu Tong’s back…
The brat’s parents stood up in a panic and apologized, “I’m sorry!”
The mother looked at Qiu Tong’s wet shirt and handed her a tissue to wipe off the water.

chapters.title: Chapter 172 - Amorous Affair
chapters.content:
Chapter 172: Amorous Affair
Translator: Atlas Studios Editor: Atlas Studios
The brat twisted his fingers in fear. He looked at Qiu Tong and said timidly, “I’m sorry.”
Qiu Tong didn’t fuss with the child. She just waved her hand and said that it was fine.
She took out some clothes from her backpack and went to change in the washroom. After some thought, Jin Yang followed her to the door and waited.
Qiu Tong did not expect him to be so considerate. In the cramped space, she took off her wet shirt and placed it to the side. She then picked up a brand new white shirt to change into it. As she was in a hurry earlier, she did not realize that she had picked a shirt with a zipper on the back.
She looked at the mirror and tried to tug at the zipper, but ended up catching her hair inside the zipper. Qiu Tong could not pull it out by herself, so she called out softly to Jin Yang.
“Can you come in and help me?”
Jin Yang was leaning against the door with his arms crossed. When he heard the voice, he pushed the door open in surprise.
In the small space, their bodies were almost pressed against each other. Jin Yang lowered his head and gently pulled her hair out. He swallowed hard, feeling a little hot. He shifted his gaze away from Qiu Tong’s bare back, but ended up looking at her reflection in the mirror.
The front collar of her shirt had fallen to her shoulders and was very low, revealing the top part of Qiu Tong’s chest.
Jin Yang could hear his heart beating faster. He lowered his head and wanted to quickly pull up the zipper. The two of them were startled when his cold fingers touched Qiu Tong’s skin. The amorous atmosphere in the confined space was so thick that their ears turned red.
“Are you done?”
Qiu Tong asked in a hoarse voice. Jin Yang restrained his thoughts and sped up. A thin layer of sweat broke out on his forehead as he tried his best to control his instinct to help arrange her shirt properly.
With lowered heads, they were about to leave the washroom when the plane suddenly rocked.
Jin Yang saw that Qiu Tong was swaying unsteadily and he reached out to hold her.
When the plane stabilized again, Jin Yang looked down to ask Qiu Tong if she was okay, but he realized that her chest was pressed tightly against hisâ€¦
Qiu Tong was pressed against the mirror by Jin Yang. Behind her was the cold mirror, while in front of her was Jin Yang’s burning skin.
His heavy and hurried breathing explained everything. Qiu Tong could feel the intense pheromones emanating from the man in front of her.
Neither of them spoke. Jin Yang had forgotten to fasten the safety catch of the zipper and it started to slide downâ€¦
When Jin Yang saw the lovely sight before him, he finally lost control and lowered his head to kiss her red lips.
He used his hand to gently cup Qiu Tong’s cheek, not giving her any chance to dodge or resist. At this moment, Jin Yang didn’t want to think about anything else. He just wanted to taste the woman in front of him. Qiu Tong opened her eyes slightly and looked at Jin Yang’s handsome face, recalling all the things they had experienced.
Read latest Chapters at W u xiaWorld.Site Only
All sorts of emotions spread uncontrollably in her heart.
Jin Yang bit her lower lip lightly. Qiu Tong could sense his emotional state. She lifted her chin slightly in assent.
Qiu Tong wanted to raise her arms and hug Jin Yang’s neck, to respond to him and deepen the kiss.
Jin Yang looked at himself in the mirror and recalled Song Yan and his promise to him. That guilt instantly snapped him out of his trance.
He looked into Qiu Tong’s lustful eyes and stiffly pushed her shoulders away. He helped arrange her shirt properly and left in a hurry..
••••

chapters.title: Chapter 173 - Going To Have A Stepfather
chapters.content:
Chapter 173: Going To Have A Stepfather
Qiu Tong steadied herself in the washroom and returned to the cabin. She wanted to pretend that nothing had happened, but whenever her eyes met Jin Yang’s, she would subconsciously avoid them.
When Jin Yang saw her return, he stood up so that she could move into the inner seat.
The attendant just happened to be pushing a food cart down the aisle, making it a tight squeeze. Jin Yang held Qiu Tong’s elbow and put his other hand on her waist, wanting to support her. Qiu Tong felt the warmth of his palm and immediately looked up at him…
Their eyes met. Jin Yang let go apologetically and sat beside her in silence.
Even though they did not mention what had just happened, their evasive looks revealed much.
Qiu Xingyu rubbed her sleepy eyes and looked at Qiu Tong. Seeing that her lips were a little swollen, Little Yu asked innocently, “Mommy, why is your mouth swollen? I think you were bitten!”
Qiu Tong glanced at Jin Yang hurriedly and replied perfunctorily, “Mommy has lipitis. It’s alright.”
Little Yu nodded, believing in Qiu Tong’s explanation. She seriously explained, “Lipitis might be due to a lack of vitamins in the body. When we get back, I’ll get Eldest Brother to help Mommy prepare some ointment that can reduce inflammation and protect the lips. It’ll definitely be more effective than those sold outside!”
“Mommy, don’t worry. You will be fine soon.”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at each other. They did not believe in Qiu Tong’s explanation. They were not as easy to deceive as Little Yu.
They looked at Jin Yang and a thought popped up in their minds at the same time—it seemed like they were really going to have a stepfather!
Qiu Xingyuan sized up Jin Yang’s face and figure seriously. From time to time, the female passengers in front would turn their heads to steal glances at Jin Yang. Qiu Xingyuan frowned as Jin Yang’s image decreased a few notches in his heart. He was dissatisfied with everything he saw.
Sensing Qiu Xingyuan’s gaze on Jin Yang, Little Yu sneaked over to his side and muttered softly, “Uncle Song Yan is so handsome, right? Elder Brother looks somewhat similar to Uncle, but Uncle Song Yan is more manly and can protect Mommy.”
Qiu Xingyu had completely defected to the “other side”. Qiu Xingyuan deliberately refuted, “How is he handsome?”
“I don’t look like him at all. He looks quite old. There are already wrinkles at the corners of his eyes.”
“Don’t you realize that he’s always putting on airs? He’s not easy going at all. Anyone who has to live with him will definitely feel uncomfortable!”
Hearing Qiu Xingyuan’s ridicule, Little Yu quietly said, “I think Elder Brother behaves like that too.”
Qiu Xingyuan choked on his words. He turned his head to look at the white clouds outside the window in a huff, but he could not help turning back to stare at Jin Yang again.
…
At the airport in S City, Qiu Tong waited with the children for their luggage to be sent out.
A passerby standing beside them casually mentioned the news of a riot in the prison. “Have you heard? A few prisoners seemed to have been killed or injured in the riot. I think a few of them even sneaked out. I wonder if they were caught.”
“That’s right. We have to be careful these days!”
Qiu Tong thought of Qiu Rong, who was in prison. She wanted to send the children back to the villa before rushing to the prison to investigate the situation.
However, Qiu Xingyuan seemed to have guessed her thoughts. He raised his little face and said firmly, “We want to go with you!”

chapters.title: Chapter 174 - Visiting The Prison
chapters.content:
Chapter 174: Visiting The Prison
In S City’s prison, Mayor Shen rushed out to welcome Qiu Tong and her group.
When Mayor Shen saw Qiu Tong’s anxious expression, he hurriedly explained, “Mr. Qiu is fine. He has been transferred to a separate cell.”
“I’ll arrange for you to meet him now. No one will disturb you!”
Qiu Tong heaved a sigh of relief after confirming that Qiu Rong was safe and sound. She thanked Mayor Shen and followed him to the guest room.
Qiu Rong sat on the chair nervously. He heard the door open and stood up.
Little Yu smiled brightly and threw herself into Qiu Rong’s arms, calling him “Grandpa” coquettishly. Qiu Rong bent over and stroked her face, his old face filled with joy and excitement.
Qiu Xingyu giggled and reached out to touch Qiu Rong’s stubble. “It’s a little ticklish!”
Seeing that he was safe and sound, Qiu Tong gently pushed Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao over to Qiu Rong’s side. “I heard that there was a riot in the prison? Why did Mayor Shen transfer you to a separate cell? Is there something wrong?”
Qiu Rong was a little hesitant, but he still chose to tell her the whole story.
“I was almost murdered by a fellow cell-mate. If not for Song Yan, I might have died.”
Qiu Tong was shocked and somewhat surprised. She recalled that on the afternoon of the prison riot, she had clearly been with Song Yan.
They rushed to the neighboring city together. How could Song Yan have had the opportunity to appear in prison and save Qiu Rong?
Qiu Tong noticed something amiss and wanted to probe further about the details of the incident, but Jin Yang strode into the guest room and interrupted her.
“Mr. Qiu might have remembered the time wrongly. The riot in the prison happened in the morning…”
“I settled things here before meeting up with you.”
Jin Yang shot Qiu Rong a look before deliberately changing the topic. “That previous cell was dark and cramped. It’s not suitable for long-term accommodation.”
“Mr. Qiu, how is your current room? If you need anything else, you can ask the warden. They will help you with it.”
Qiu Rong hesitated for a moment, but he quickly felt that Jin Yang’s words made sense. He rubbed his forehead and explained to Qiu Tong, “It’s possible that I remembered wrongly. You know that after living here for a long time, your memory will inevitably get messed up.”
“My current room is very good. There’s no need to trouble them anymore.”
Qiu Tong looked at Jin Yang’s face. The doubts in her heart intensified, and a strange feeling welled up.
Everyone chatted for a while in the guest room before Qiu Tong left with the three children.
Just as they were about to leave the prison, the warden ran over with a prepared name list and reported to Jin Yang about the progress of their investigation.
“Additional punishment and labor reform are already being carried out on the prisoners who caused trouble.”
“However, the prisoners who managed to escape are still at large. We haven’t managed to capture them yet. Nevertheless, none of them are hardcore criminals. We’ve already distributed their photos and arrest warrants. The moment we get any leads, we’ll immediately arrest them.”
“This is a list of the escaped prisoners. I think there’s someone called Yu Ge…”
The warden found out that the reason for Yu Ge’s imprisonment was related to Qiu Tong, so he specially mentioned it.
When Qiu Tong heard that Yu Ge had escaped from prison, her expression turned solemn and guarded, worried that he would come looking for trouble.

chapters.title: Chapter 175 - Escort Home
chapters.content:
Chapter 175: Escort Home
At that moment, a prison guard ran over to give an emergency report.
The warden tried his best to signal him with his eyes to keep quiet, but the prison guard thought that he was urging him. He hurriedly said, “Warden, Dina has escaped!”
When Qiu Tong heard Dina’s name, she looked up at the prison guard and asked, “Why did you only notice now?”
The prison guard explained awkwardly, “There was someone lying in Dina’s bed the whole time. We didn’t notice anything unusual when we searched. We thought that he was just feeling unwell. But when we counted all the prisoners who escaped, we realized that there were two names who didn’t match…”
“Dina probably escaped on the day of the riot, but hired a subordinate to replace him.”
The prison guard wanted to escape responsibility, but Jin Yang said with a cold expression, “He’s an important criminal, the leader of a terrorist organization.”
“Dina’s escape must be taken seriously. Send someone to search the entire city immediately. Don’t let him escape.”
The warden was so nervous that he hurriedly dispatched the police officers. Jin Yang turned to look at Qiu Tong and the children. He felt that they were in danger in S City, so he took the initiative to say, “I’ll send you back.”
Qiu Tong didn’t refuse. Little Yu happily clung to Jin Yang, holding his hand tightly, unwilling to let go.
In the villa area, Ke Le and the other mercenaries had already tidied up the house. Jin Yang stopped at the door and rubbed the top of Little Yu’s head gently. “You have to be careful. Don’t run around. When Dina and the rest are arrested and brought back to the prison, I’ll send someone to inform you.”
Qiu Tong nodded, but Little Yu hugged Jin Yang’s leg, reluctantly to let him go. She raised her pink face and asked in a childish voice, “Can Uncle Song Yan stay?”
“Can you stay and play with Little Yu for a while?”
Qiu Xingyu looked at Jin Yang expectantly. Jin Yang explained awkwardly, “I have something else to do.”
“After a while, if I have time, I will come back to see Little Yu. Be good and listen to Mommy and your brothers.”
Jin Yang wanted to coax Little Yu, but she shook her head vehemently. She threw herself at Jin Yang’s waist and threw a tantrum.
“But I don’t want Uncle Song Yan to leave!”
“Mommy doesn’t want that either, right?”
Qiu Xingyu tried to find support. Jin Yang stood rooted to the ground, not knowing how to face a girl’s tears.
Qiu Tong looked at them in confusion. She met Jin Yang’s gaze and smiled awkwardly. She moved over to pull Qiu Xingyu back.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao initially despised Little Yu’s reliance on Jin Yang. But when they saw their sister crying, they instantly became very anxious.
Their sister had always been adorable and strong. When had they ever seen her cry so fiercely?
The two boys looked at each other. They knew that Little Yu really wanted Jin Yang to stay.
Qiu Xingyuan cleared his throat and suggested softly, “Why don’t you carry Little Yu into the house first? She won’t stop crying and it is very chilly outside. She will definitely catch a cold.”
When Jin Yang heard his words, he quickly bent over and carried Little Yu into the villa.
Little Yu leaned on Jin Yang’s shoulder. She smiled brightly and blinked at Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao, before sticking out her tongue.
Qiu Xingyuan’s small body heaved a sigh. “I really don’t know what to do with her.”

chapters.title: Chapter 176 - Destroying A Car
chapters.content:
Chapter 176: Destroying A Car
Jin Yang carried Little Yu to the living room. Qiu Xingyu hurried upstairs to find some toys to play with him. “Uncle Song Yan, wait for me!”
Qiu Tong went to the kitchen to prepare some snacks and warm water for them. Jin Yang took the opportunity while Little Yu was gone to walk to the kitchen door.
He looked at Qiu Tong’s busy back profile and frowned slightly, saying, “I’ll go back first.”
Qiu Tong paused in her actions and turned around, suppressing her disappointment. She maintained a calm expression and said, “Alright.”
“Be careful on the road.”
Jin Yang wanted to reach out to take the glass of warm water, but in the end, he retracted his fingers and replied with a faint smile, “You too.”
Outside the villa, Jin Yang sat in the driver’s seat. He tried to start the car engine but each attempt ended in failure.
He got out of the car with a puzzled expression to check the situation. He discovered that the car’s engine had been burnt. It had been damaged to the point where it could not be activated anytime soon.
From the corner of his eye, Jin Yang saw two little figures hiding behind the car. He sighed helplessly and walked over to pull Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao out.
“You guys did this?”
Jin Yang pointed at the engine. Qiu Xingyuan struggled to break free from his grip. He pretended to be stupid and said, “We just came out for a walk.”
“Did you see who damaged this car?”
Qiu Xingyuan pretended to be serious as he asked Qiu Xingqiao. Of course, Qiu Xingqiao shook his head firmly. “No! We are just children. How could we possibly damage this big machine? We are all very obedient. We don’t know how to cause damage to an engine…”
Jin Yang looked at them in amusement and said helplessly, “Looks like this is all fate, right?”
Qiu Xingqiao nodded vigorously. “Yes, yes! In that case, we have no choice but to let you stay for another night.”
Qiu Xingyuan sensed Jin Yang’s gaze on him and turned away with a cold snort. He muttered softly, “If not for Little Yu, this car wouldn’t have broken down and there wouldn’t be a place for you to stay at our house.”
Jin Yang overheard his muttering and laughed.
He squatted down and pulled Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao in front of him.
Jin Yang took out a handkerchief from his pocket and gently wiped the two children’s blackened faces, which they had dirtied while messing with the engine. The clean white handkerchief was quickly stained pitch-black. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at each other in shock and realized that the evidence of their “crime” had long been written on their faces!
However, Jin Yang didn’t expose them. Instead, he played along with them.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were a little moved. Their impression of Jin Yang changed slightly, but they remained stubborn and did not say anything.
Jin Yang stood up and reminded the two children, “Next time, remember to wrap things up properly. Don’t leave behind such obvious evidence.”
“The easiest way to destroy a car is to destroy its starter. Just a small adjustment on the inside…”
“Don’t do such dangerous things anymore!”
Jin Yang rubbed the top of Qiu Xingyuan’s head as he brought the two children home.
In the living room, Little Yu was crying as she hugged Qiu Tong. She was also clutching her favorite doll. Little Yu wiped her snot and tears on Qiu Tong and cried, “Why didn’t Mommy help me stop Uncle Song Yan?”
“He promised Little Yu that he would stay behind to play with me!”
“Uncle Song Yan is a liar!”

chapters.title: Chapter 177 - Coincidence
chapters.content:
Chapter 177: Coincidence
Qiu Xingyu cried until the tip of her nose was red and her eyes were swollen. She pleaded with Qiu Tong to get Song Yan back.
When Qiu Xingyuan saw Jin Yang standing helplessly in the living room, he had no choice but to cough lightly to alert Qiu Tong and Little Yu to their presence. When they saw Jin Yang return, their expressions instantly turned to surprise and joy. Little Yu ran out of Qiu Tong’s embrace and rushed straight into Jin Yang’s arms. “Uncle Song Yan!”
“You’re not allowed to leave tonight! You promised Little Yu to stay. You can’t lie anymore!”
“Otherwise, I won’t forgive you in the future.”
Helpless, Jin Yang hugged her and whispered to Qiu Tong what the two children had done. “Even if I want to leave, I can’t.”
Qiu Tong met his gaze. Although the two of them did not say anything, their emotions surged. The corners of her lips curled up slightly.
Jin Yang stayed in the living room to play with the children. Qiu Tong was in the kitchen prepping some ingredients from the fridge. She wanted to prepare a sumptuous dinner for them.
Qiu Tong heated up a pan and was about to fry some eggs when she realized that she could not find the egg molds!
“Who knows where the egg molds are?”
Qiu Tong rummaged around in a panic when she saw that smoke was already rising from the pan.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao blinked and shook their heads at the same time.
Jin Yang carried Little Yu to the kitchen door and pointed at the second drawer. “They should be in there.”
Qiu Tong was taken aback by his confident answer. Doubtful, she bent over and rummaged through the drawer. She saw that the egg molds were indeed at the place Jin Yang had mentioned. She quickly cracked the eggs into the pan with the molds and skillfully cooked them. “Are you a wizard?”
“You can conjure up everything that goes missing?”
Qiu Tong teased in a relaxed tone. Jin Yang wiped some cream off the corner of Little Yu’s mouth with his fingertips and replied in a very natural tone, “You always used to stash the egg molds in the second drawer and then forget about it. You will end up buying more when you can’t find them…”
A strange silence fell over the villa.
Alert, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao pricked up their ears to listen to their conversation. Little Yu quickly blinked and turned to look at Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong adjusted the stove fire to a smaller flame and turned to look at Jin Yang. Her eyes were filled with mockery as she asked, “You seem to know my habits very well? It’s as if we’ve lived together for a long time.”
“Even Ke Le probably won’t even remember where I keep the egg molds… how did you know?”
Jin Yang also didn’t know where he got his memories from. He had spoken those words very naturally. But when faced with Qiu Tong’s question, he gave a perfunctory excuse and said, “I was just guessing, because you searched all the other places in the kitchen, leaving only the second drawer untouched.”
Qiu Tong didn’t believe him, but she just focused on cooking and let go of this difficult-to-explain topic.
Jin Yang carried Little Yu back to the living room. Qiu Tong watched his departing figure and frowned as she stir-fried the vegetables in the pan.
Amidst the aroma of the dishes, Qiu Tong muttered to herself comfortingly, “It might just be a coincidence.”
“Many people have the same habits. Maybe the women he used to know are very similar to me…”
Qiu Tong took two deep breaths and ladled the food out. She called Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao over to help. “Let’s eat!”

chapters.title: Chapter 178 - Parent-Child Time
chapters.content:
Chapter 178: Parent-Child Time
The setting sun shone in from the window and the living room was filled with warmth. Jin Yang carried Little Yu, who was clinging onto him, to the French windows to admire the sunset.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were huddled on the sofa. They looked gloomily at their sister, who had completely forgotten about them.
At this time after dinner every day, the three of them would play games. Qiu Xingyuan never expected to fall out of his sister’s favor!
He cleared his throat to attract the attention of Jin Yang and Qiu Xingyu. “Sister, you haven’t done the art homework assigned by the kindergarten teacher.”
“The teacher will scold you tomorrow at the kindergarten!”
Qiu Xingyu pursed her lips and lowered her head. “But it’s so difficult to fold paper animals!”
Qiu Xingqiao wanted to make things difficult for Jin Yang. He lifted his chin and placed a stack of folding papers on the coffee table in the living room. “Isn’t he here?”
“The other children in the kindergarten can’t do it either, but their fathers can!”
“A few days ago, Little Fatty bragged that his father was very skilled in making tigers and lions…”
Qiu Xingqiao snorted awkwardly. He crossed his arms and turned around. However, he did not forget to steal a glance at Jin Yang. “If you want to be our stepfather, you must know how to coax our sister! At the very least, you must help her finish her homework!”
Jin Yang did not expect that he would encounter this test by the children. He raised his eyebrows slightly and stared at the folding paper in silence.
Little Yu’s eyes flickered with anticipation as she shook Jin Yang’s fingers. She asked in a childish voice, “Uncle will definitely be able to do it, right?”
How could Jin Yang bear to disappoint Qiu Xingyu?
He sat cross-legged on the ground and studied the instructions carefully.
Although Jin Yang didn’t have experience with this type of children stuff, he quickly folded exquisite animals such as deer, tigers and lions according to the instructions. His slender fingers carefully pressed the edges of the folding paper. The entire process was completed in one go without any need for corrections…
Qiu Xingyu widened her eyes and kept clapping. She hurriedly stood up and threw herself into Jin Yang’s arms. She hugged his neck and kissed him twice.
“Uncle is indeed the best! Uncle can do anything!”
When Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao saw the paper animals, they could not find anything to nitpick on. The two brothers had no choice but to sit there and sulk.
Little Yu did not hide her admiration and love for Jin Yang. She gently tugged at Jin Yang’s fingers and muttered softly, “If only Uncle is our father. That way, we can be together every day!”
“Will Uncle always be with us? Will you abandon us and Mommy?”
Traumatized by her earlier experiences, Qiu Xingyu asked this question with some trepidation. Jin Yang recalled his promise to Song Yan and his expression stiffened slightly. He then replied perfunctorily, “I will always protect you.”
Qiu Tong watched the three of them interact harmoniously in the kitchen, her eyes filled with gentleness and comfort.
She rinsed the foam off her hands with fresh water. Another ridiculous thought popped into her head. “Could he really be the children’s father?”
Qiu Tong frowned as she stared at Jin Yang. However, she recalled his insistence that they had never met before and so dismissed this conjecture. “Perhaps it’s just a coincidence?” Qiu Tong muttered to herself as she walked to the living room to play with Jin Yang.

chapters.title: Chapter 179 - Amorous In The Bedroom
chapters.content:
Chapter 179: Amorous In The Bedroom
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Late at night, Jin Yang stayed in the guest room of the villa. Qiu Tong prepared a cup of warm milk for everyone as per the family custom.
Qiu Tong stood outside the room and knocked lightly on the door, but she did not hear any response. She frowned and guessed if Jin Yang had something to do and had left again.
She twisted the door lock tentatively and entered the guest room. She heard the sound of water splashing in the bathroom.
Jin Yang turned off the shower and raised his hand to sweep his wet hair over his head. He casually picked up a towel and wrapped his lower body with it as he walked out. Droplets of water trickled down his abs and landed on the tile. The temperature in the room suddenly rose. Qiu Tong instinctively avoided his gaze, her pupils trembling a little.
“Is that for me?”
Jin Yang was a little surprised by her appearance here, but he quickly broke the tension by asking that question, wanting to accept the glass of milk from her.
Qiu Tong’s ears turned red as she turned to put the milk on the bedside table. With her back facing Jin Yang, she hurriedly explained, “I knocked on the door.”
“But there was no answer. I just wanted to come in and take a look. I thought you already left…”
Qiu Tong’s voice tightened. Just as she was about to leave with the tray, she bumped into the corner of the double bed.
Jin Yang saw that she was in so much pain that she was about to fall to the ground. He hurriedly rushed forward and reached out to pull her into his arms.
Qiu Tong instinctively grabbed Jin Yang’s muscular arm, but the two of them lost their balance and fell onto the bed.
Jin Yang supported himself with both hands on the soft mattress, enclosing Qiu Tong between his arms. Water droplets trickled down his hair and landed on Qiu Tong’s neck. The water droplets were cool, but at this moment, they felt especially hot to Qiu Tong. She felt her entire body heat up uncontrollably and she twisted her body uneasily.
Qiu Tong’s bent legs accidentally rubbed against Jin Yang’s lower abdomen, causing the towel to move a few inches downwards.
“Are you all right?”
Jin Yang’s Adam’s apple bobbed. His eyes darkened as he tried his best to suppress the surging desire in his heart.
Qiu Tong shook her head and wanted to get up from the bed, but her hands accidentally brushed against Jin Yang’s exposed abdomen. She panicked and jerked her hands away, only to end up touching the area below his abdomen.
Jin Yang furrowed his brows as he gave a suppressed grunt.
Feeling suffocated, Qiu Tong hurriedly let go. She pushed Jin Yang away and ran out of the door in panic and embarrassment, her footsteps disappearing at the end of the corridor.
Jin Yang sat by the bed and took deep breaths to calm himself. He lowered his head to look at himself. He had no choice but to return to the bathroom and take a cold shower to vent his amorous desires.
…
In the middle of the night, Lu Zhiling was about to close the clinic and leave when two masked men barged in.
Looking at the men who looked like fugitives, Lu Zhiling was so frightened that she hugged her head and squatted on the ground. She raised her hand and pointed at the cashier. “Don’t kill me!”
“I’ll give you whatever you want…”
The two men pointed their guns at Lu Zhiling. They looked at each other and said, “Bring out all the special medicine that can treat liver cancer!”
Lu Zhiling looked up in surprise and explained, “Liver cancer is an irreversible disease. Medicine can only alleviate it. There’s no special medicine…”
When the masked man heard her words, he was so angry that he smashed the clinic. The burly man stepped on the signboard outside the door and broke it.
“Didn’t your sign outside say that you can cure all diseases?”
Lu Zhiling did not expect that her bragging would cause trouble for her. In her panic, she thought of Qiu Tong and hurriedly tried to divert this danger onto her. “You can look for Qiu Tong.. Her medical skills are better than mine. She might have a solution!”

chapters.title: Chapter 180 - Dark Web Bounty
chapters.content:
Chapter 180: Dark Web Bounty
“…Qiu Tong?”
After the masked man knocked Lu Zhiling unconscious, he took off his mask and muttered to himself, revealing his true face. Dina and Yu Ge’s faces were reflected in the mirror!
Dina pulled out two chairs and sat on them. He took out a pill and swallowed it.
Dina had been diagnosed with liver cancer while he was serving time in prison. However, the medical facilities in prison were extremely poor, and there was no way to treat him.
Dina took advantage of the prison riot to escape, wanting to find a chance to save his own life!
Yu Ge was a good sweet-talker. In the prison, he could tell that Dina was very capable, so he took the initiative to help him get food and even massaged his legs.
Dina treated him as his lackey, which was why he was part of the escape plan.
The two of them escaped from the prison. Apart from avoiding the police and the prison guards, they also searched all over for famous clinics.
They were trying to find some reputable clinic and doctor who could treat Dina’s liver cancer, but Yu Ge did not expect this to lead to Qiu Tong.
Yu Ge remembered that it was all thanks to Qiu Tong that he was sent to suffer in prison.
He gritted his teeth, wanting to take the opportunity to settle the score with Qiu Tong.
Yu Ge looked at Dina’s pained expression and suggested, “Elder Brother, I can send a message on the Dark Web.”
“I have some familiar contacts who can think of a way to get Qiu Tong to treat you.”
“But… after Qiu Tong treats your illness, you have to promise me that you’ll hand her over to me to deal with! There’s a grudge between us.”
Yu Ge’s eyes flickered with anger and vengeance. Dina narrowed his eyes and thought for a while before nodding in agreement.
“I’ll do as you say. As long as I can be cured, I’ll help you with anything!”
After Dina made his promise, Yu Ge happily found a computer to go onto the Dark Web.
…
In the guest room of the villa, Jin Yang took a cold shower and returned to the bed. He saw his phone screen light up before fading.
He scooped up a towel and dried his wet hair, but paused when he saw the missed call.
Jin Yang was a little hesitant and wanted to pretend not to see it when Song Yan called again. He quietly accepted the call…
Song Yan asked sarcastically, “I didn’t expect the president to be someone who would back on his word?”
“You promised me yesterday that you would keep a distance from Qiu Tong and never appear in front of her and the children. What are you doing now?”
Song Yan seemed to be secretly observing his actions. Jin Yang frowned in displeasure, but he could not think of any excuse or explanation. He could only purse his thin lips into a straight line as he gripped his phone tightly. He walked to the window of the guest room and pulled open the curtain to reveal his figure.
Song Yan sneered and said, “Think of a way to leave now. Don’t let Qiu Tong and the children find out.”
“If I find out that you secretly appeared in front of them again, I will expose the fact that you have been deceiving them!”
When Jin Yang heard Song Yan’s threat, he frowned solemnly and asked coldly, “What are you planning to do?”
“None of your business. I’ll give you five minutes to leave the villa!”
Song Yan hung up after saying that. Jin Yang listened to the beeping tone and had no choice but to comply.

chapters.title: Chapter 181 - Shower Scent
chapters.content:
Chapter 181: Shower Scent
Early in the morning, Qiu Tong came out of the bedroom in her pajamas. She stretched and looked at the guest room, feeling a little awkward as she recalled everything that had happened last night.
Click. The door next door opened.
Qiu Tong was a little flustered and wanted to turn around to dodge, but she heard two soft chuckles from behind. “Good morning.”
Song Yan rubbed his messy hair. He deliberately yawned and walked to Qiu Tong’s side, greeting her in a hoarse and magnetic voice.
Qiu Tong pursed her red lips. From the corner of her eye, she saw Song Yan lean over. Her face flushed red as she said in a muffled voice, “Good morning.”
Song Yan narrowed his long and narrow eyes. He deliberately reached out to remove a fallen eyelash from Qiu Tong’s face.
The temperature of his fingertips was a little cold. Qiu Tong instinctively lowered her eyes but did not move away. Their posture was slightly intimate and suggestive.
A cool breeze blew over from outside the villa. Qiu Tong suddenly smelled a special shower gel scent on Song Yan—it was not the lemon fragrance from last night.
Back when Qiu Tong was stocking up on daily necessities, she had bought a few boxes of lemon-flavored shower gel and kept them at home as a backup.
Last night, Jin Yang had used that shower gel before he came out of the bathroom. Qiu Tong definitely remembered that familiar smell.
Qiu Tong frowned in confusion. She pulled the front of Song Yan’s shirt toward her to smell, muttering to herself. “Didn’t you use the lemon-scented shower gel yesterday? Did you prepare other toiletries for yourself?”
Jin Yang’s overnight stay had been an unexpected situation. How could he have prepared other toiletries?
Song Yan suddenly realized that Qiu Tong seemed to have noticed some suspicious discrepancies between him and Jin Yang. He cursed Jin Yang in his heart for causing trouble for him!
“The children are watching. Isn’t it improper for us to be like this?”
Song Yan leaned back and held Qiu Tong’s wrist to control her movements. He tilted his head and reminded her with a teasing smile.
Qiu Tong was stunned for a moment. She turned around and saw that Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu had come out of their rooms at some point and were staring at the two of them quietly.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao pursed their lips. Their expressions were indescribably conflicted, causing Qiu Tong to feel a little guilty.
Qiu Xingyu’s eyes shone with excitement. She hurriedly covered her eyes and muttered, “Mommy, don’t worry about us!”
“We didn’t see anything. We won’t peek either!”
“You can continue with Uncle Song Yan…”
Qiu Xingyu’s childish words embarrassed Qiu Tong. She shook off Song Yan’s hand and asked with a frown, “When did they appear? Why didn’t you tell me?”
Song Yan shrugged slightly and leaned against the wall. He pretended to be innocent and said, “You didn’t give me a chance.”
He quietly pointed at his shirt, which Qiu Tong had pulled into disarray, a mischievous glint in his eyes.
Qiu Tong looked away as she said, “Quickly tidy your shirt.”
Song Yan asked, “You wanted to smell my scent just now? Why don’t you continue?”
He deliberately spread his arms, confident that Qiu Tong would not dare to carry out such an intimate act in front of the children. His tone was teasing.
Qiu Xingyu had covered her eyes with her hands, but when Qiu Tong wasn’t paying attention, she peeped at Song Yan and Qiu Tong through the gaps between her fingers.
Qiu Xingyuan was so angry that his face turned red. He and Qiu Xingqiao rushed over to Qiu Xingyu and covered her eyes tightly.
Little Yu pouted in annoyance. She wanted to push away her brothers’ hands, but she did not have enough strength. She could only stamp her feet to express her frustration.
“Why is it that only my brothers can watch? I’m not a child and I want to see Mommy too…”

chapters.title: Chapter 182 - Dark Web Mission
chapters.content:
Chapter 182: Dark Web Mission
Looking at the children’s reactions, Qiu Tong did not probe further into the discrepancies with Song Yan.
Qiu Xingyu clung onto Song Yan and refused to let go. Song Yan’s attitude was a little distant, but he reluctantly played with her for a while to humor her. He then told a convenient lie and found an excuse to leave the villa.
Qiu Tong was tidying the utensils in the kitchen. She looked at the bubbles in the sink and recalled the two strange events that had happened in succession. She felt that something was amiss.
There were times when Song Yan’s behavior and attitude changed. Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and recalled the information she had previously gathered.
“Are they not the same person?”
Qiu Tong frowned and turned off the tap. She wiped her foamy hands and took out her phone to search for news about the capital’s official residence.
Song Yan and Jin Yang were twins. They looked so similar that ordinary people could not tell the difference.
Qiu Tong’s suspicions intensified. “Could he be Jin Yang?”
The screen of her phone lit up. Qiu Tong tilted her head and looked at the news released by the government’s official website regarding the various disasters. She read out a few lines. “The president is extremely concerned about the situation of the people suffering from disasters everywhere. He will hold a special video conference with the officials in the official residence to discuss how to reduce the losses of the peopleâ€¦”
Did this news mean that Jin Yang had never left the official residence of the capital?
Qiu Tong looked out the window at the white clouds. She shook her head, wanting to shake off the ridiculous and complicated thoughts. She once again dispelled her suspicions about her identity.
...
In the official residence of the capital, Shao An had been busy for several nights without even time for sleep. He dispatched Jin Yang’s instructions batch by batch.
“When will the president return?”
Shao An scratched his head. He had been so anxious recently that his body was nearly glowing red. He said, “Not just anyone can do the president’s job!”
He had only been helping to cover for Jin Yang over the past few days, but Shao An was already exhausted with dark eye circles.
In S City, Qiu Tong recalled the prison riot and became increasingly worried about Qiu Rong’s safety.
She remembered that the warden had once mentioned that she could pay money to reduce Qiu Rong’s sentence. Qiu Tong took out a bank card and a few checks from her drawer. After calculating her current savings, she muttered with a worried expression, “I still have to earn more money.”
The children and Qiu Rong needed money. Qiu Tong went to the study and logged on to the Dark Web via the computer, wanting to see if there were any suitable missions to take on.
Qiu Tong filtered the missions according to her own situation and quickly found an employer who claimed to be a government official looking for a skilled fighter.
“What are the specific requirements for the mission?”
Qiu Tong tapped lightly on the keyboard, but the other party did not answer her directly. Instead, he asked her a few basic questions.
A few lines of text appeared in the chat box. “We want to capture a criminal alive.”
“If you can do it, the remuneration will definitely satisfy you.”
The other party confirmed that Qiu Tong’s ability was sufficient for the mission before giving her a contact number and then immediately exited the Dark Web.
Qiu Tong noted down the number with raised eyebrows. “He’s quite cautious.”
She dialed the number and after the call went through, the other party said bluntly, “The person you need to capture is called Qiu Tong.”
“She lives in a wealthy villa district. It’s best if you can capture her within two days. Remember not to let her dieâ€¦”
Qiu Tong looked at her own face in the mirror and smiled in surprise and amusement.
This mission was a godsend!

chapters.title: Chapter 183 - Failed Tracking
chapters.content:
Chapter 183: Failed Tracking
Qiu Tong could tell that the person on the phone was Yu Ge, who had escaped from the prison. She deliberately stalled for time asking, “Since you have a grudge against the person, why do you capture her alive?”
Yu Ge could not be bothered to explain. He just perfunctorily discussed the remuneration after the matter was settled.
Qiu Tong tapped on the computer and started to track the real-time location of the call. She said in a mocking tone, “You just escaped from prison, how could you have so much money? You probably want to trick me into capturing the mark and then cheat me, right?”
“Yu Ge, if you want to capture me, why don’t you just find me directly? Why waste so much time?”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes as she stared at the red dot on the computer screen. She smiled as she headed out to Yu Ge’s location.
Yu Ge finally recognized Qiu Tong’s voice. He was so frightened that cold sweat broke out on his back. “Wh… What are you talking about? Who is Yu Ge?”
Qiu Tong stopped a taxi and directed the driver to drive to the specified location. She smirked and asked, “You don’t even dare to admit your own name?”
“Yet you have the guts to hire people to capture me?”
“I advise you to prepare the remuneration. I am coming to see you now! If you have anything to say, let’s talk face to face!”
Yu Ge swallowed hard. He stared suspiciously at the traffic around him. He was so frightened that he hung up the phone and threw it away before fleeing.
Qiu Tong was just one step too late when she arrived at the location. She searched for Yu Ge using the location of the phone but found the device floating in the river. “You fled quite fast.”
Yu Ge ran back to his temporary residence in a panic. Dina looked at him impatiently. “Have you captured her yet?”
“No, I didn’t expect to encounter Qiu Tong on the Dark Web. She has already discovered that we want to capture her. She’ll definitely be on her guard.”
Yu Ge sensed Dina’s anger and hurriedly handed him two cigarettes. “Don’t worry, give me a few more days…”
Dina waved his hand and kicked Yu Ge away. He raised his leg and stepped on Yu Ge’s chest. Dina whispered fiercely, “I don’t have time!”
“You better bring Qiu Tong over quickly. Otherwise, your life will be in danger!”
“I will make sure you die before me!”
Yu Ge was dizzy from his beating and thought that he would die then and there. However, Dina suddenly coughed twice.
He covered his mouth as he stepped on Yu Ge. He felt an intense pain in his lungs. Dina’s breath seemed to carry the smell of blood.
Yu Ge did not dare to cry out in pain and could only find an excuse to explain. “Qiu Tong immediately recognized my voice. I didn’t expect her to be so smart. I let her escape because I was unprepared.”
“But Boss, don’t worry. We can still target her children!”
“Qiu Tong cares a lot about her children. As long as we can find a way to capture the children and threaten her, she will definitely compromise and work for us to develop a medicine that can cure you.”
Yu Ge suggested with a sincere and pleading look. Dina finally relaxed and let Yu Ge get up. “I’ll trust you one last time.”
Dina took out his phone and contacted his other subordinates using the secret code of the organization. He pointed at Yu Ge and said, “Come here. What do Qiu Tong’s children look like? Where are their usual haunts? Tell them clearly.”
Yu Ge rubbed his neck with his hands. He promptly described Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu…
Dina sat on the bench and looked at the bottle in front of him. There were only two or three pills left. He rubbed his thumb with a dark expression. “I don’t have much time left.”

chapters.title: Chapter 184 - Baited By A Car Accident
chapters.content:
Chapter 184: Baited By A Car Accident
After the riot in the neighboring city was resolved, S City returned to its usual peace and the kindergarten opened as usual.
The Qiu siblings waved goodbye to the teacher and stood obediently under the sycamore tree, waiting for Qiu Tong to bring them home.
Yu Ge and his subordinates from the terrorist organization hid in the dark and watched for an opportunity. They realized that there were not many parents around and started circling the three children, wanting to kidnap them. However, Qiu Tong arrived just then. Seeing that the situation was not right, she shouted, “Come quickly!”
Qiu Xingyuan grabbed Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu and ran to Qiu Tong’s back. When the burly men saw that Qiu Tong was a woman, they wanted to attack her.
Qiu Tong used her arms to block their punches. She bent her legs and kicked the burly man closest to her.
Thump!
Qiu Tong stepped on his shoulder and accurately kicked the head of another man behind. The impact was so strong that both of them fell to the ground.
“Retreat!”
Yu Ge did not expect Qiu Tong to be so skilled in combat. He hurriedly fled, afraid that Qiu Tong would see him.
The terrorist organization’s subordinates carried their injured brothers and fled in a sorry state. Qiu Tong touched the children’s heads and asked if they were injured.
They wanted to kidnap the children?
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes as she looked at the corner of the street where the burly men had disappeared. She frowned as she considered finding Yu Ge’s whereabouts and sending him back to prison.
Meanwhile, Dina looked at Yu Ge, who had returned empty-handed. He asked unhappily, “How much time do you want to waste?”
Yu Ge explained with a trembling voice, “Boss, we have no choice but to think of a way to bypass Qiu Tong and trick the children into coming with us!”
“I have an idea. We will definitely succeed this time…”
Yu Ge squatted beside Dina like a lackey and quietly explained his plan.
Dina pinched the space between his eyebrows and said tiredly, “I’ll give you one last chance. If you can’t capture Qiu Tong, I’ll throw you into the river to feed the fish!” Yu Ge’s pupils trembled violently as he hurriedly nodded and promised.
The next afternoon, Qiu Tong sent the children to kindergarten. She wanted to do some simple cleaning in the villa and sat in the living room humming a song.
However, her personal phone began to vibrate and ring incessantly. Every time Qiu Tong answered the call, she could hear a murmuring coming from the other end, accompanied by a few words that she did not understand. “Hello?”
In just half an hour, Qiu Tong had received dozens of calls. Her patience was running out, so she switched off her phone to have some peace.
Meanwhile, in the kindergarten, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were sitting with Little Yu and watching a cartoon on the screen. The plot was getting intense and Little Yu was sweating profusely for the cartoon’s protagonist.
The next second, the screen switched to the emergency news channel.
The three children looked up at the screen in surprise. The news reported that there was a serious car accident in S City. The current condition of the injured person was extremely unstable and she could die anytime. The ambulance had already sent her to the hospital for treatment.
“Eldest Brother… doesn’t Mommy have clothes that look like that?”
Qiu Xingyu stared at the screen and saw the paramedics carrying a stretcher. Although she could not see the injured person’s face, her clothes were familiar to the children…
Qiu Xingqiao instinctively retorted. “Many people in S City have such clothes.”
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his thin lips. With a serious and nervous expression, he looked at the area where the car had met with the accident. It was along the route between the villa district and their kindergarten. “Don’t panic, let’s go find the teacher!”

chapters.title: Chapter 185 - Tricked
chapters.content:
Chapter 185: Tricked Translator: Atlas Studios Editor: Atlas Studios
Qiu Xingyuan found the teacher and tried his best to describe the situation. "Teacher, can you help us call Mommy?"
The kindergarten teacher suddenly became nervous. She called Qiu Tong on the spot only to hear the cold automated female voice on the other end. "The number you have dialed is unavailable. Please try again later." Qiu Xingyu stamped her feet anxiously. Her eyes were filled with tears as she tugged at Qiu Xingyuan's hand. "Eldest Brother, what should we do?"
Qiu Xingyuan's heart sank. He turned around and looked at the news footage. "The victim has been sent to Guang Ming Hospital for treatment."
"Let's go to the hospital to find Mommy!"
Qiu Xingqiao wanted to run out on impulse, but the kindergarten teacher blocked them. "Children, it's too dangerous for you to go out now. I will think of a way to contact your mother. After we understand the situation, I will bring you to the hospital, okay?"
The kindergarten teacher was afraid that Qiu Xingyuan and the rest would secretly run out, so she left them in a room and closed the door from the outside.
Qiu Xingyu pursed her lips and looked at the news with a sobbing voice. "Eldest Brother, what should we do?"
"If it is really Mommy in the car accident, we have to go to the hospital quickly!"
Qiu Xingyuan took a deep breath and tried his best to placate his younger siblings. "Let's wait for teacheraCr
Outside the kindergarten, the teachers continued to try calling Qiu Tong but to no avail.
They wanted to contact Qiu Tong using the contact details in the school register, which Qiu Tong had provided when the children first enrolled as students. But they realized that the Qiu family had already moved from that address.
The kindergarten teacher whispered nervously, "Could it really be their mother?" "Should we send the children to the hospital?"
However, according to the rules, they could not leave the kindergarten without permission. The teachers had no choice but to contact the hospital to inquire about the situation.
Five minutes later, the reporters had rushed to the hospital for a follow-up report.
The children looked at the doctors and nurses walking in and out of the room. Their expressions were especially serious. Under the questioning of the reporters, they hurriedly answered, "The patient's injuries are very serious now. Her condition is at a very critical stage."
"I hope the family of the patient will rush to the hospital to sign the paperwork if they see the news."
When Qiu Xingyuan heard this, his face instantly turned pale. His hands were tightly clenched into fists, and he could not sit still.
Qiu Xingyuan looked at the glass window of the room and said in a tense voice, "Let's open the window and run out from there!"
Qiu Xingqiao immediately moved a stool over. He was the first to step on the stool and climb to the window. He expertly leaped out and landed safely, before turning around and spreading his arms wide to catch Qiu Xingyuan.
Little Yu nervously climbed up to the window. She looked at the height and felt a little dizzy.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao comforted her. "Little Yu, close your eyes and jump down. We will catch you!"
Qiu Xingyu was so nervous that she took a deep breath. Thinking that Qiu Tong might be critically ill, she propped herself up against the window and gritted her teeth as she jumped down.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao caught her firmly in their arms. The three children fell to the ground due to the impact. Ignoring the abrasions and pain on their arms, they dusted off the dirt and stood up, before rushing to the hospital.
At Guang Ming Hospital, the children found the floor where the emergency room was.
They followed the directions of the man who looked like a doctor and came to a certain ward. The door was locked. Qiu Xingyuan saw the tattoos on the arms of the men in the room and immediately understood that it was all a trap.
They had been tricked!

chapters.title: Chapter 186 - Failure To Fetch The Children
chapters.content:
Chapter 186: Failure To Fetch The Children
Qiu Xingyuan realized that something was wrong. He and Qiu Xingqiao exchanged looks and wanted to break out of the trap, but the three children were too weak.
The burly men from the terrorist organization grabbed the children and tied them to the chairs. “You better stay here obediently and wait for your mother to save you. We won’t hurt anyone, but if you play any tricks, these knives in our hands…”
“Hehe.”
The burly men swivelled the foldable knives in their hands. Qiu Xingyu dodged in fear. Qiu Xingyuan shouted. “Don’t touch our sister!”
…
In the kindergarten, Qiu Tong waited outside for a long time but did not see Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao come out. She found a teacher and asked about the situation.
The teachers heaved a sigh of relief when they saw Qiu Tong. They shook her hand excitedly and said, “I’m so glad you’re alright!”
Qiu Tong looked at them in confusion and asked, “What’s wrong?”
Their eyes met and the teachers were stunned for a moment before pulling up the news footage of the accident. They handed their phones to Qiu Tong for her to see. “We and the children all thought that you had an accident. They were so anxious to go to the hospital to see you.”
“We wanted to call you but couldn’t reach you. Your phone is switched off!”
One of the kindergarten teachers took out the school register. “If it’s convenient, can you update your address?”
“If not for the fact that your address wasn’t updated, we would have gone to your house to ask about the situation!”
Qiu Tong was in no mood to listen to the teachers. She just kept looking at the news footage on the screen, feeling that something was wrong.
“Where are the children? Can you bring me to them?”
Qiu Tong frowned as she spoke. The teachers hurriedly brought her to the room where the children were kept. “We were so anxious and the children were very worried about you. Little Yu was so anxious that she was about to cry…”
“Your relationship is so good. I can tell that the children rely on you very much.”
Qiu Tong felt increasingly uneasy when she heard these words.
The kindergarten teachers opened the door and called out. “Children, your mother is here to bring you home…”
There was no response from anyone in the room. All the toys were scattered on the ground, looking especially messy.
The window of the recording studio was wide open and a few stools were piled up by the window. Where were the children?
Qiu Tong could tell at one glance that Qiu Xingyuan and the others had used the stools to escape. She could not help frowning.
The teachers looked back at Qiu Tong in a panic. Afraid of being held responsible, they explained, “We did leave Qiu Xingyuan and his younger siblings here because we were afraid that they would sneak out, but we didn’t expect…”
They were afraid that Qiu Tong would blame them, but Qiu Tong refused to listen.
Qiu Tong thought of the Yu Ge incident a few days ago and felt increasingly uneasy.
“Can I trouble you to show me the news footage again?”
Qiu Tong carefully analyzed every frame. When she saw the signboard of Guang Ming Hospital, she rushed off to the hospital without another word.
Nothing must happen to the children!
Qiu Tong could feel her palms sweating. She ran out of the kindergarten and met the mercenaries and Ye Luan, who were heading home from school.
“Boss? Where are you going?”
Ke Le had never seen such a flustered expression on Qiu Tong’s face before.

chapters.title: Chapter 187 - Trade
chapters.content:
Chapter 187: Trade
“The children might be in danger. I need to rush to the hospital to save them.”
Qiu Tong explained the situation anxiously. Ye Luan’s expression instantly turned serious and anxious as he said, “I want to go with you.”
It was very likely that Yu Ge and the others had set up an ambush at the hospital. Qiu Tong pretended to be calm and pressed the top of Ye Luan’s head. “No.”
“I can’t be sure how many of them there are. They have Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu.”
“If I bring you to the hospital, I would be too preoccupied to protect you. Just stay at home and wait for news…”
Qiu Tong said in a hoarse voice. Ye Luan retorted seriously, “Their target is you, so they won’t be too guarded against me.”
“Uncle Ke Le and the rest can help you too. We will definitely not be burdens!”
Qiu Tong could see Ye Luan’s stubbornness and persistence. In the end, she compromised and agreed to bring the mercenaries along with her, while Ye Luan had to return home to wait for news.
Ye Luan looked at their departing back profiles. He seemed to have come up with some idea before running off in the other direction.
…
Outside the hospital ward, Qiu Tong saw Yu Ge sitting there with a few burly men. She narrowed her eyes and said, “It’s really you.”
Yu Ge swept his gaze across Ke Le and the rest. Taking advantage of the fact that he had the subordinates of the terrorist organization behind him, he said in a forceful and commanding tone, “If you want to save your children, come in yourself. Don’t let these people come near the ward. Otherwise, I can’t guarantee that your children…”
“Will be able to leave in one piece!”
Seeing Yu Ge’s arrogant manner, Ke Le immediately wanted to take out the pistol at his waist, but Qiu Tong quickly stopped him. “Don’t be impulsive.”
Qiu Tong quietly surveyed the surroundings. She could tell that Yu Ge had everything under control. He would not have been able to do all this on his own.
There must be someone backing Yu Ge…
Qiu Tong tried her best to suppress her emotions as she probed, “I’m the one you want to capture. Since I’m here, you can ask for anything. I’ll definitely do it, but you have to guarantee my children’s safety.”
“I’ll go by myself. Let go of the children!”
Ke Le heard Qiu Tong’s compromise and said anxiously, “This won’t do!”
As a mercenary, Ke Le had a keen sense of danger. He could sense that the other party was no pushover and was extremely hostile towards Qiu Tong.
“I have to go in with you…”
Qiu Tong could tell that Ke Le was worried about her. She tried her best to squeeze out a smile and whispered, “When the children come out later, protect them well. Leave the rest to me. Don’t worry, I know my limits!”
Yu Ge’s eyes were filled with arrogance and evil intent. Qiu Tong knew that things would not end well today.
Qiu Tong took the initiative to put down the weapon she was carrying. She raised her hands and slowly approached Yu Ge. “Are you satisfied now?”
Yu Ge shook his head. He pointed at the mercenaries who were still surrounding them warily and said, “Let them leave.”
Qiu Tong turned around and shot Ke Le a meaningful glance but he remained stubbornly in place. Afraid of angering Yu Ge so much that he would hurt the children, Qiu Tong had no choice but to command. “This is an order!”
It seemed like she would have to suffer a little today before she could leave Yu Ge’s hands.
Qiu Tong stared fixedly at Yu Ge, secretly thinking of a way to escape.

chapters.title: Chapter 188 - Looking For Help
chapters.content:
Chapter 188: Looking For Help
In the other ward, Yu Ge tied Qiu Tong up. He leaned over and patted her face. “Are you obedient now?”
Yu Ge picked up the water bottle and poured all the water over Qiu Tong’s head. Water dripped down her hair.
Qiu Tong frowned but remained silent. Yu Ge saw her expression and had the urge to torture her. He tugged at Qiu Tong’s hair. “You are the one who forced me to this extent. I don’t want to torture you either, but how long was I in prison because of you?”
“Do you know what it’s like in prison?”
Yu Ge licked his lips and tugged at Qiu Tong’s hair, forcing her to look at him. “Don’t worry, I’ll let you feel it!”
Arriving at the front of the government building, Ye Luan immediately went forward and tugged at the security guard. “I want to see Mayor Shen!”
“I’m from Qiu Tong’s family. Tell Mayor Shen… he’ll definitely see me!”
Ye Luan was smart. After he parted ways with Qiu Tong, he had thought of asking Song Yan for help. However, he did not have Song Yan’s contact details, so he could only look for Mayor Shen.
The security guard saw that Ye Luan was just a child and wanted to ignore him. However, he remembered that Qiu Tong was the hero who developed the locust pesticide and had some connection to Mayor Shen. He informed Mayor Shen who immediately came out. When Ye Luan saw him, he blurted out anxiously. “Something has happened to Qiu Tong!”
“Can you contact Song Yan and ask him to save Auntie Qiu?”
Mayor Shen was a little surprised. He frowned and thought that Ye Luan should be talking about Mr. Jin Yang. He might have mixed up the two of them.
Mayor Shen immediately inquired about the situation in detail. “Don’t worry, I’ll tell him about it.”
Ye Luan nodded vigorously, his expression as intense as a young adult’s. “You have to do it quickly! I’m worried that the situation at the hospital will be very dangerous. No matter how powerful Auntie Qiu is, she will still need external reinforcements.”
Mayor Shen immediately contacted Jin Yang, while Ye Luan turned around and rushed to the hospital to meet Ke Le and the rest.
Outside the hospital, Yu Ge did keep his promise. He arranged for the terrorists to bring the children out.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s hands were tied with ropes. When Ke Le saw that they did not seem to be injured, his anxious heart finally relaxed a little. There was some dirt on Little Yu’s face. She was so frightened that she appeared to be in a daze.
Qiu Xingqiao turned around and glared at the terrorist organization members. “Where’s our mommy?”
The terrorist laughed hoarsely and said, “She traded herself in order to save you!”
“You brats are a hindrance to us. Leave now! Don’t interfere with our business… get lost!”
The terrorists were already tired of the children and felt that they were burdens. They threw the children onto the road outside the hospital.
Ke Le and Ye Luan rushed over from the other side of the road, wanting to help them untie the ropes.
However, when Qiu Xingyuan heard that Qiu Tong was still imprisoned in the hospital, he turned around and wanted to rush back to save her. In Ke Le rushed forward to stop him, but the terrorists misunderstood his actions and thought that the mercenaries were trying to start a fight.
“Don’t move!”
The terrorists took out their guns and pulled the triggers ruthlessly. The passersby were so frightened that they dodged and ducked. The scene instantly turned chaotic.
Ke Le hugged Qiu Xingyu but saw that Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao had been re-captured by the terrorists.

chapters.title: Chapter 189 - The Children Save Each Other
chapters.content:
Chapter 189: The Children Save Each Other
One of the terrorists held Qiu Xingyuan and swung his hand, wanting to hit him. However, Qiu Xingqiao wrapped himself around his leg and bit him.
The burly terrorist kicked Qiu Xingqiao away in pain. Taking advantage of the distraction, Qiu Xingyuan used his fingers to poke the terrorist’s eyes. While the man was covering his eyes and wailing, Qiu Xingyuan wanted to continue running towards the hospital. However, the other terrorists rushed over to support their comrade. They spread their arms wide to capture the two children.
Ye Luan saw that the situation was critical. The image of Qiu Tong and the children taking care of him flashed across his mind… he acted on instinct.
Although Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao always seemed to be full of hostility towards him, they would secretly prepare breakfast for Ye Luan. They would even wait for him on the way home from school and awkwardly get him to stay on whenever they saw that Ye Luan wanted to leave!
These memories made Ye Luan lower his head and take out the human modification medicine he had been carrying with him.
He did not know if there would be any side effects after injecting this into his body, but Ye Luan didn’t care now!
He looked at Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao, who were about to be captured by the terrorists. He gritted his teeth and inserted the syringe into his abdomen. The moment the medicine surged into his body, Ye Luan’s physical statistics improved substantially.
Ye Luan ran into the enemy’s side at an extremely fast speed. He pulled away the burly man holding Qiu Xingyuan and shouted, “We’ll run from the left!”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at each other and immediately ran to Ye Luan’s side to meet up with him.
The terrorists did not expect another brat to appear from nowhere. They were rather bewildered as they picked up their guns. “We didn’t want to hurt you, but you kids seem to have a death wish! Don’t blame us…”
Seeing that he was about to pull the trigger, Ye Luan picked up a brick on the ground and threw it at him.
The brick landed accurately on his head. Two drops of blood trickled down the burly man’s forehead. He wiped it with his hand, his eyes filled with frustration and impatience as he growled, “These children are so troublesome!”
Qiu Xingqiao did not expect Ye Luan to be so brave and fierce. He raised his slingshot and picked up a handful of stones, continuously attacking those who tried to get close.
Qiu Xingyuan turned around and looked in the direction where Ke Le and the others had come to reinforce them. Without the need to say anything, the three children slowly retreated in unison toward Ke Le, gradually leaving the terrorists’ encirclement.
Ye Luan handed Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao over to Ke Le. He arranged for them to hide in a secluded corner of the street before turning around, wanting to take advantage of the chaos to enter the hospital.
Qiu Xingyuan grabbed his hand. “Let’s go together!”
Ye Luan shook his head and pulled his fingers away. “You have to take care of Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu. I’ll go find Auntie Qiu.”
Qiu Xingyuan looked at the frightened Little Yu, whose eyes revealed her fear. He pursed his thin lips and looked at Ye Luan. Finally, he frowned and said softly, “You must be careful. Don’t be injured… they are very powerful.”
Ye Luan smiled and nodded. “Alright.”
Meanwhile, Jin Yang was in the prison investigating where Dina and the others might have fled. He received a call from Mayor Shen.
Mayor Shen said anxiously, “Mr. President, the escaped criminal Yu Ge seems to be at Guang Ming Hospital. He used the children as bait to lure Qiu Tong over. The situation is uncertain now. One of the Qiu family kids came to seek help…”
“I’ve already arranged for some police officers to rush over. What do you think…”
Before Mayor Shen could finish speaking, Jin Yang stood up from his chair with a serious expression. He shot a look at his guard before instructing the warden, “Give me some guns! Hurry!”
Five minutes later, Jin Yang rushed to the hospital with his entire team. Along the way, his expression was exceptionally grim. He secretly gritted his teeth as he thought about Qiu Tong’s safety.

chapters.title: Chapter 190 - The Presidents Rescue
chapters.content:
Chapter 190: The President’s Rescue
In the ward, Yu Ge looked at the drenched Qiu Tong, his eyes filled with lust.
Qiu Tong leaned back in her chair, her face pale. She pretended to be defenseless as she accepted Yu Ge’s torment, letting him relax his guard.
Yu Ge bent over and leaned closer. He raised Qiu Tong’s chin with his finger and said with interest, “You haven’t been touched by a man for a long time, right? Why don’t I help you? You look like you need a man to nourish you!”
Yu Ge’s words were disgusting to hear. He tugged at his own belt.
Qiu Tong quietly loosened the hemp rope around her wrists, preparing to subdue Yu Ge at any moment.
Yu Ge walked over to Qiu Tong’s side. Just as he was about to pull her clothes apart, the door of the ward slammed open and Jin Yang barged in with a team. He saw Qiu Tong’s shocked expression and Yu Ge’s hand on his pants. His eyes were filled with raging anger.
The president’s guards restrained all the terrorists in the ward, while Jin Yang strode over to Yu Ge.
Jin Yang grabbed Yu Ge’s head and slammed it onto the table. Bang! Bang! Bang! An especially muffled sound echoed in the room. Yu Ge felt blood gush down his eyes and his body went limp as he fell to the ground.
Qiu Tong’s heart stirred at Jin Yang’s violent behavior. She opened her mouth but didn’t know what to say.
Jin Yang seemed to have sensed her gaze. He turned around and gently untied the rope around her. “Are you alright?”
Heart aching, he frowned when he saw the red marks on Qiu Tong’s wrists and other injuries.
Qiu Tong shook her head. Her clothes clung tightly to her skin, accentuating her graceful figure.
Jin Yang took off his jacket and gently covered her shoulders. A comforting fragrance lingered at the tip of Qiu Tong’s nose. She looked at the figure in front of her and felt an unprecedented warmth.
Jin Yang turned to look at Yu Ge, wishing he could just kill him!
However, as the president, Jin Yang had to follow the law and not punish anyone in private. He could only clench his fists and control his emotions.
“Cough cough…”
Yu Ge supported himself up weakly from the floor. He wiped the blood off his face. “Don’t think you can save Qiu Tong. My boss wants her…”
Yu Ge wanted to threaten the other party, but when he saw Qiu Tong and Jin Yang standing side by side, he was stunned.
The president?!
Such a small matter garnered the attention of the president?!
Could it be that Qiu Tong’s luck was so good that the president happened to be nearby?
Yu Ge could not figure it out, but he knew that the president would never let civilians get hurt. From the corner of his eye, he saw a scalpel on the table in the ward.
“Guards, detain him…”
Jin Yang instructed as he pointed at Yu Ge, not expecting Yu Ge to charge toward Qiu Tong with all his might.
Qiu Tong saw Yu Ge’s actions and wanted to dodge, but unexpectedly, Jin Yang enveloped her in his arms and used his back to block the attack. The president’s guards immediately rushed over from all sides to protect Jin Yang, while Yu Ge took the opportunity to throw the scalpel to the ground. He turned and ran towards the door, taking advantage of the chaos to escape.
“Are you all right?”
Still in Jin Yang’s arms, Qiu Tong looked up and met his dark eyes. She could feel his gentleness and concern. Her heart trembled.

chapters.title: Chapter 191 - An Affectionate Kiss
chapters.content:
Chapter 191: An Affectionate Kiss
The president’s guards escorted the rest of the terrorists out of the hospital so that it would be easier to interrogate them.
Jin Yang looked at the bruises on Qiu Tong’s neck and recalled Yu Ge’s actions. He felt a dull pain in his heart as if someone was squeezing it.
He did not dare to think too much. If he had been a step late, that bastard Yu Ge might have abused Qiu Tong and even…
Huge waves of emotions surged in Jin Yang’s eyes. He grabbed Qiu Tong’s waist and pulled her into his arms.
Qiu Tong’s pupils dilated in surprise as Jin Yang’s warm hands held her waist. Their breathing quickened.
“I’m fine. You don’t have to be so anxious.”
“These are just superficial injuries. Yu Ge doesn’t want to kill me. He probably has other plans.”
Qiu Tong misunderstood that Jin Yang wanted to check on her injuries. She explained in a hoarse voice as she gently nudged Jin Yang’s shoulder.
Jin Yang narrowed his eyes. He could no longer control his emotions. Instead, he held Qiu Tong’s face with both hands and bent over to kiss her red lips. He bit Qiu Tong’s lower lip as if he was tasting a delicacy. He used the tip of his tongue to press against her teeth, making suggestive sounds when their lips met.
Qiu Tong’s legs went limp. Jin Yang held the back of her head, refusing to let her retreat as he grabbed her waist.
Qiu Tong’s scalp turned numb as she gradually leaned into him.
Ye Luan saw the president’s guards escorting the terrorists away. He ran into the ward anxiously and called out weakly, “Auntie Qiu?”
Qiu Tong was immersed in Jin Yang’s kiss and did not hear his voice. When Ye Luan saw that Qiu Tong was not injured, he heaved a sigh of relief.
That human modification medicine had exhausted all of Ye Luan’s energy. He swayed twice and fainted on the ground.
The equipment in the ward was knocked to the ground by Ye Luan and scattered all over the place.
The loud crashing sounds made Qiu Tong and Jin Yang separate. Qiu Tong pushed Jin Yang away anxiously and ran to Ye Luan’s side. Looking at Ye Luan’s pale face, she hurriedly covered Ye Luan’s palm with her hand and secretly used her supernatural power to treat Ye Luan.
Jin Yang helped Ye Luan up from the chair on the ground.
The moment their skin touched, they moved away awkwardly. An awkward atmosphere filled the air.
