Qiu Tong raised her hand to wipe her swollen lips. She detected a faint lemon fragrance on Jin Yang, similar to the smell of the shower gel in the villa…
Ye Luan’s face was flushed red. Qiu Tong stared at the glass fragments scattered on the ground, watching Jin Yang’s actions through the reflection.
She was increasingly suspicious that she was seeing and interacting with two different people!
Ye Luan opened his eyes slowly. Qiu Tong heaved a sigh of relief. Ye Luan said in a weak voice, “Auntie Qiu, I’m so glad you’re alright.”
Qiu Tong was touched. She stroked the top of his head. “Lie here and rest.”
Ye Luan leaned against the wall obediently. Qiu Tong walked in front of Jin Yang and pointed at his injured hand. She said softly, “Let me treat your wound. I am better than the nurses in the hospital, you know that.”
Qiu Tong was probing. She stared intently at Jin Yang’s expression, not missing the slightest ripple in his eyes.

chapters.title: Chapter 192 - Confirming That It Was Him
chapters.content:
Chapter 192: Confirming That It Was Him
Jin Yang was stunned. Hearing Qiu Tong’s intimate tone, he pursed his lips and hid his tumultuous feelings.
At this moment, Jin Yang recalled Song Yan’s repeated warnings. He suddenly realized that he and Qiu Tong had already developed a frank and honest relationship.
Jin Yang shook his head lightly and pushed those thoughts away. He pretended to be calm and raised his hand, holding Qiu Tong’s palm in a familiar manner.
Qiu Tong looked at him with sparkling eyes. As she transferred her power into his body, she could confirm that the man in front of her was the same person she had met initially.
Now, she only needed to find an opportunity to capture the other fellow who was pretending to be him!
Qiu Tong desperately wanted to know what was going on!
However, she pretended to behave as per normal. Qiu Tong picked up the silver pistol that had fallen to the ground. She removed the magazine and filled it with bullets. “How did you find this place?” Yu Ge’s use of the children to threaten her had happened too suddenly. Qiu Tong did not even think of asking for help.
Jin Yang narrowed his eyes and retracted his arm. He lowered his eyes and rolled down his sleeves.
“This child found Mayor Shen and asked him to contact me. He’s very smart and capable.”
Jin Yang looked at Ye Luan’s bruised face and praised him generously, “I can tell that he’s very concerned about you.”
Qiu Tong was touched. She didn’t expect Ye Luan to do all this.
Such a young child had run to the government building in such a short time. He must have suffered a lot in the process.
Qiu Tong’s heart ached. From the corner of her eye, she saw that Jin Yang’s neck was stained with the blood of terrorists. She wanted to take out a handkerchief to wipe it off for him…
“Don’t move.”
Qiu Tong said in a low voice. Jin Yang looked at the woman in front of him and felt his heart skip a beat.
He stood stiffly on the spot, but instinctively bent over slightly to match Qiu Tong’s height.
The president’s guards had finished rounding up the terrorists. One of them returned to report when he saw the scene at the door. He coughed loudly.
Jin Yang raised his long and narrow eyes to glare at him, impatience and ruthlessness clear in them.
The president’s guard quickly straightened awkwardly and saluted. He guiltily shifted his gaze elsewhere. “Sir, according to their statements, there should be a few terrorists who took advantage of the chaos to escape. However, they probably didn’t run far. We have already arranged for men to search the vicinity.”
His hoarse voice startled Ye Luan awake. Ye Luan had been healed by Qiu Tong’s supernatural powers and was now fine.
“Auntie Qiu! Qiu Xingyuan and Little Yu are both outside. I’ll bring you to find them…”
Ye Luan hurriedly ran to Qiu Tong’s side. His small hand gripped Qiu Tong’s palm, wanting to immediately bring her out.
Qiu Tong looked at Jin Yang with furrowed brows. Jin Yang nodded slightly and said, “I need to lead a team to search for the terrorists’ accomplices in this building. I also need to settle their statements…”
“Let them accompany you. They will take care of you when you encounter danger.”
Jin Yang gestured at the president’s guards with his eyes. They promptly formed two lines and followed Qiu Tong out of the hospital building.
When Qiu Tong reached the door, she turned to look at Jin Yang’s lonely figure standing by the window. She had a nagging feeling that there was something wrong.
However, the children were not out of danger yet. Qiu Tong had no choice but to shift all her attention away from Jin Yang.

chapters.title: Chapter 193 - Xiao Zhen Tries To Kidnap
chapters.content:
Chapter 193: Xiao Zhen Tries To Kidnap
At the corner of the street opposite the hospital, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao hid in a corner while protecting Little Yu. They looked warily at a man who was smiling wickedly at them.
Xiao Zhen tried to coax and deceive the children. He turned around and signaled his subordinates to block the street to prevent the children from escaping.
“I am a good person. I’ll bring you to find your family now. Don’t be afraid!”
Seeing that they were still on their guard, Xiao Zhen wanted to grab Qiu Xingyuan impatiently. Seeing this, Qiu Xingqiao opened his mouth and bit his palm.
The child’s sharp teeth pierced into Xiao Zhen’s skin. He shook his hand in pain and finally shed his fake smile to reveal a ferocious expression.
“You brats must suffer a little before you can be obedient.”
Xiao Zhen waved his hand and had his subordinates knock them out and take them away. Unexpectedly, he heard a shout from afar. “Stop!”
Ye Luan led Qiu Tong to the vicinity of the children’s temporary hiding place. They saw Xiao Zhen trying to kidnap the children.
Qiu Tong immediately recognized that the man in front of her was the lieutenant who had wanted to kidnap the children from the villa!
Had he not given up?!
When Xiao Zhen saw that it was a woman, he heaved a sigh of relief and gestured for his subordinates to stop Qiu Tong and the rest. He took out a handkerchief and wiped at Qiu Xingqiao’s teeth marks. His eyes were filled with dissatisfaction as he muttered, “I thought it was those mercenaries who came back. Get rid of them quickly. Don’t delay me from taking the children away!”
Qiu Tong looked at the thugs running towards them with a look of disdain.
The president’s guards whipped out their batons. They had undergone special training and were naturally agile and sharp.
The thugs realized that they were no match for the guards, so they focused their attacks on Qiu Tong.
“Bah, you specialize in picking on the weak. Are you worthy of your uniform?”
Qiu Tong sneered coldly. She picked up a beer bottle from the ground and threw it at one of the approaching thugs. Glass fragments scattered all over the ground and a few drops of blood trickled down the thug’s forehead. He swayed and fell to the ground. Qiu Tong kicked his head and said in disdain, “Trash!”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao heaved a sigh of relief when they saw that Qiu Tong and the others had the upper hand.
Little Yu cheered Qiu Tong on. “Mommy! Beat them all down! Mommy, you can do it!”
Xiao Zhen sensed that something was wrong. He saw that his subordinates were helpless and crushed by Qiu Tong.
He quickly shouted, “Stop fighting, it’s just a misunderstanding!”
Xiao Zhen’s subordinates retreated in a sorry state. Qiu Tong waved at Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao. They hurriedly ran to her side, under the protection of the president’s guards.
“Are you the children’s mother?”
Xiao Zhen tidied the folds of his clothes and put on a kind and hypocritical look as he walked to Qiu Tong and said, “I was passing by and saw that they were being bullied by bad people. There were no adults who could protect them, so I wanted to bring the children to a safe place.”
“This is all a misunderstanding. I was the one who saved the children. How did things turn out this way?”
Xiao Zhen was rather daring in his claims. Qiu Tong frowned and stared at his face. He did not look ashamed at all. Little Yu, who had been hiding behind Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao, quietly stuck her head out. She said in a small voice, “That’s not what happened!”
“You’re a bad person who wanted to kidnap us!”
“We already said that we were waiting for Mommy here. Besides, Eldest Brother and Second Brother managed to hide very well…”

chapters.title: Chapter 194 - Tricking Children
chapters.content:
Chapter 194: Tricking Children
Qiu Xingyu tugged at Qiu Tong’s sleeve. She widened her black grape-like eyes and said, “It was Brother Ye Luan who saved us.”
“Uncle Ke Le told us to hide here and wait for them and Mommy to come back. They went to chase after the other baddies!”
Qiu Tong raised her hand and gently rubbed the top of Qiu Xingyu’s head. Qiu Tong’s heart ached when she saw the little girl still trying to be strong even when her face had already turned pale from fright.
She hugged Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao and said in a low voice, “Don’t be afraid, Mommy will protect you!”
Xiao Zhen did not expect the children to be so smart and bold. Even though his lie had been exposed, he was not the least bit embarrassed. Instead, he walked up to Qiu Tong and tried to worm his way into her good books. The president’s guards saw his actions and promptly held out their batons, gesturing for him to stay put.
Xiao Zhen’s eyes darted around. He recalled that he was not in the villa when the children were kidnapped.
Qiu Tong and her children would not recognize him. Xiao Zhen instantly put on a different expression and said, “Madam, I think your children are very smart and adorable. To be able to maintain such a clear-headed and calm state in such a dangerous environment, it’s obvious that you have taught them well.”
“To be honest, I have some connections in the capital.”
“If you want the children to be better educated and have a more expansive development environment, why don’t you consider coming to the capital with me?”
Xiao Zhen did not hide his motive at all. A mocking smile appeared on Qiu Tong’s face. Did this lieutenant take her for a fool?!
Qiu Tong shook her head. She said coldly, “Thank you for your kindness. We don’t need it.”
Xiao Zhen felt rather embarrassed by her merciless refusal. He immediately turned hostile and asked, “Why? I protected the children and prevented the terrorists from harming them. I’m your benefactor!”
“Don’t you need to repay me?”
Qiu Tong was speechless at Xiao Zhen’s shamelessness. Her eyes revealed a murderous glint as she said, “Protected the children?”
“The children all said that you wanted to kidnap them by force. I’m already being kind and forgiving by not calling the police and arresting you as an accomplice of the terrorists. Don’t test my tolerance anymore. It’s best not to continue tricking children on the streets.”
“Your pathetic lies are sullying my ears!”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and looked at Xiao Zhen’s stunned and sheepish expression. She smirked and added. “Don’t let me see you near the children again. Otherwise, no matter what intentions you have, I won’t let you off so easily like today!”
With an unfriendly expression, Qiu Tong carried Little Yu and held Qiu Xingyuan’s hand. They left.
Xiao Zhen stared at their backs and cursed with a dark expression, “What a troublesome fellow.”
“If she didn’t appear today, I would have already brought the children to the capital!”
Xiao Zhen turned around and saw that his subordinates’ faces were all bruised. He complained in disdain, “You are really a bunch of useless people.”
“You can’t even defeat a woman! Looks like we have to get rid of that woman first if we want to bring them to the capital.”
A murderous intent flashed across Xiao Zhen’s eyes. He wiped the corners of his lips with his fingers and said coldly, “If we turn the children into orphans, they won’t have a mother to rely on and will listen to us…”

chapters.title: Chapter 195 - Clinging To Jin Yang
chapters.content:
Chapter 195: Clinging To Jin Yang
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Was Xiao Zhen’s appearance by chance? Were they in cahoots with Yu Ge?
Qiu Tong thought about it with a heavy heart. She recalled how the children had nearly been kidnapped several times and felt that danger was lurking around them all the time.
Who was that mysterious man?
What was his motive and motive for pretending to be Song Yan to get close to her and the children?
Qiu Tong’s eyes were filled with anxiety and conflicted emotions. She surveyed her surroundings warily, trying to detect any suspicious figures.
She had to flush all the hidden forces as soon as possible and find out the identity of that mysterious man!
Qiu Tong made up her mind. She carried Little Yu back to the hospital and found Jin Yang, who was leading a team to search the hospital building.
Jin Yang heaved a sigh of relief when he saw that the children were safe and sound. He nodded and gestured for his guards to retreat two steps away.
Qiu Tong looked at the remaining terrorists who were locked up in the room. They were all wounded. She could tell that Jin Yang had interrogated them. “Can I ask you for a favor?”
Qiu Tong said softly, pretending to be helpless and flustered. “Just now, there were some people who wanted to kidnap the children.”
“The children are shocked, especially Little Yu. She can’t be alone now.”
Qiu Tong stole a glance at Qiu Xingyu, who was in her arms. Little Yu hurriedly nodded in agreement. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao, on the other hand, rolled their eyes quietly, not responding to their mother’s exaggerated claims. Jin Yang frowned and looked at Qiu Tong, indicating for her to continue.
“The children are young and don’t have the ability to protect themselves. I’m a woman and very weak…”
Qiu Tong said firmly and seriously, “We need protection. Can you please send the children back to the villa?”
“I still have some things to settle. If they encounter any more danger or accidents on the way, I’m afraid I won’t be able to handle it!”
Qiu Tong clutched her chest. Jin Yang looked at her display of weakness in surprise, his eyes filled with bewilderment.
The president’s guards were standing very far away. When they heard Qiu Tong’s words, they felt like grumbling. However, due to Jin Yang’s special treatment of Qiu Tong and her children, they only dared to mutter on the inside. “She didn’t even blink when fighting against those thugs. She has excellent movement and technique that even big, strong men can’t get near her.”
“Those children nearly crippled the hand of the bad guy who wanted to kidnap them. How are they weak?”
“They still need the president’s protection?”
Jin Yang looked troubled. Seeing that he was still hesitant, Qiu Tong shifted Little Yu in her arms and took the opportunity to remind her, “Mommy has assigned Little Yu an honorable and important task. You must watch him closely for Mommy. You must not let him leave even half a step.”
“You can’t let him disappear from your sight until Mommy comes back, understand?”
Qiu Xingyu’s eyes lit up as she nodded vigorously. She leaned on Qiu Tong’s shoulder and pretended to cry.
“Uncle, can you hug me? It was so scary just now. I am so scared!”
Qiu Xingyu’s nose was red from crying. Jin Yang was a little flustered and hurriedly opened his arms to hug her.
Qiu Tong nodded silently and gave Qiu Xingyu a quick thumbs-up without Jin Yang noticing.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at their sister and mother’s tacit cooperation and raised their hands to smack their foreheads in unison.

chapters.title: Chapter 196 - Three Children Causing Trouble
chapters.content:
Chapter 196: Three Children Causing Trouble
Jin Yang drove the children back to the villa. Qiu Xingyu sat in the back row and held Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s hands, quietly transmitting Qiu Tong’s instructions.
The president’s car stopped at the entrance of the villa. Jin Yang planned to leave after settling the children down.
However, Qiu Xingyu opened her arms and stood in front of him. She raised her pink cheeks and pursed her lips as she said, “Uncle, can you stay with us for a while longer? Mommy hasn’t returned yet, and Eldest Brother and Second Brother are already very tired. If the bad guys come over again, we’ll definitely be kidnapped!”
“Didn’t you promise Mommy to take care of us?”
Qiu Xingyuan stared at Jin Yang coldly. He pursed his thin lips, which were somewhat similar to Jin Yang’s. “You can’t go back on your word after making a promise.”
Jin Yang looked at the children standing in front of him in a line. He didn’t know whether to laugh or cry as he explained, “I have things to do…”
Qiu Xingyu hurriedly pinched her own arm and burst into tears.
Qiu Xingqiao’s heart ached for his younger sister. He assumed a fighting stance with Jin Yang to stop him.
Holding a baseball bat and staring fixedly at Jin Yang, Qiu Xingqiao blocked the door with his chin lifted stubbornly.
Qiu Xingyuan walked to the switch of the electric fence. With some chemical powder in his hand, he turned to look at Jin Yang.
Did these children look like they could not protect themselves?!
Jin Yang squatted down with a doting and helpless tone. He raised his hand to wipe the tears off Qiu Xingyu’s face and said softly, “Look, you’re crying like a little kitten. I’ll stay and wait with you for Mommy to come home.”
“Can you guys put everything down now?”
Jin Yang looked at Qiu Xingqiao and Qiu Xingyuan with a smile. “You are both very powerful. You will definitely be able to protect Mommy and your sister in the future.”
Qiu Xingyuan did not smile at his praise.
He looked coldly at Jin Yang. The two boys could sense the change in Mommy and sister’s towards him.
The two boys felt a little sour in their hearts. They were rather insecure and were naturally a little hostile towards Jin Yang’s presence.
Jin Yang carried Little Yu to the bathroom to wipe her face. The president’s guards remained in the living room. They looked at the pride and arrogance on Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s faces and could not help but raise their eyebrows and think to themselves. The president was so formidable. How did he end up being stopped by these two children?
The president’s guards wanted to show support for Jin Yang so they came up with the idea of teasing the children.
They quietly approached Qiu Xingyuan, wanting to restrain him. However, Qiu Xingqiao’s senses were extremely sensitive and he could sense the movements of the guards.
Qiu Xingyuan instinctively hid behind the sofa. His and Qiu Xingqiao’s movements were so practiced that it made one’s heart ache at the thought of what they must have been through.
“What is happening? Are they bad people too?”
Qiu Xingqiao asked in a low voice. The president’s guards were unfamiliar faces. The children had never seen them before, but they were under Jin Yang so they hadn’t been guarded against them. Qiu Xingyuan could not tell either. But he could sense that they did not seem to be hostile. He frowned and said, “Don’t hurt anyone.”
Qiu Xingyuan took out a handful of powder from his pocket. Qiu Xingqiao forced the guards to retreat to the door.
“What are you doing?”
It was Qiu Tong. She happened to return at this moment, only to see Qiu Xingyuan throwing the powder.
Qiu Xingyuan wanted to take back the powder, but it was too late. The president’s guards instinctively hid at the side. When Jin Yang came out of the washroom and saw the scene before him, he rushed over to Qiu Tong and hugged her…

chapters.title: Chapter 197 - Herbal Sachet
chapters.content:
Chapter 197: Herbal Sachet
Qiu Xingyu hurriedly covered her eyes with her hands. But she could not help peeping from between her fingers at the two of them hugging intimately.
The president’s guards looked away and coughed lightly to remind them to pay attention to their actions. Qiu Tong patted the powder off Jin Yang’s shoulder with a flushed face.
She frowned and stared at Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao. She asked softly, “What is going on?”
Jin Yang glared at the guards. He lowered his eyes to look at the woman in his arms and said, breaking the tense atmosphere, “Where did you go?”
Qiu Tong met his concerned gaze and remembered the sachet in her pocket. She took it out and handed it to Jin Yang.
“It’s all thanks to your help today. This is my thank-you gift.”
Qiu Tong stuffed the sachet into Jin Yang’s hands. Her eyes lit up as she said, “I personally concocted this herbal powder. It can alleviate your headache, but you need to wear it on your chest 24/7. Remember not to remove it.”
Jin Yang lowered his head and smelled a sweet herbal fragrance. Seeing his stunned expression, Qiu Tong took the initiative to stand on her tiptoes and hang it around his neck.
The tips of their noses brushed against each other. Qiu Tong’s hair brushed across Jin Yang’s face, as if a pair of hands were playing with his heartstrings.
He instinctively wanted to wrap his hand around Qiu Tong’s slender waist, but Jin Yang saw from the corner of his eye that the children were staring at him. He could only stop and let his hands drop.
Qiu Tong’s palm touched Jin Yang’s chest and she felt his warmth. Her narrowed eyes flickered with satisfaction.
She had bought the sachet from the market and filled it with her homemade herbal powder.
The ingredients were generally inert, but when the wearer’s body temperature rose, they would emit a unique fragrance.
Qiu Tong could use this to confirm if the man in front of her was him or someone else!
Jin Yang pressed down on the medicine bag and said in a hoarse voice, “I’ll go back first.”
When Qiu Xingyu heard his words, she immediately ran to Jin Yang’s side and shamelessly hugged his thigh. “Uncle will accompany me for a while more!”
Jin Yang looked at the darkening sky with a troubled expression. He could only rub Little Yu’s head and coax her, “Another day…”
Little Yu’s eyes darted around and she quickly found another request. “Then can Uncle come over this weekend?”
“Bring us out to play this weekend!”
Little Yu pouted, her eyes instantly filling with tears as she mumbled, “The other children in the kindergarten all have their parents with them…”
“They go to the amusement park and other places to play on weekends, but we’ve never done so!”
“We can only play building blocks with Mommy obediently at home. Second Brother and Eldest Brother will lock themselves in their rooms. They also look forward to going out!”
Little Yu turned around and blinked her eyes, trying to get Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao to cooperate with her. However, they just watched her quietly with their arms crossed in exasperation.
Jin Yang’s heart ached for these sensible children.
Qiu Xingyu could tell that he was wavering. She held his palm with both hands and said, “Teacher assigned us to have a family outing this weekend. We have to write a diary entry on what we did. If Uncle doesn’t agree, I will have to be a liar and write a fake diary entry.”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked at each other in confusion. When did their teacher give them such an assignment?
Qiu Tong took out her phone and looked through the homework information sent out by the kindergarten teacher, but she could not find any such assignment.

chapters.title: Chapter 198 - Little Yu Lied
chapters.content:
Chapter 198: Little Yu Lied
Qiu Xingyu saw that Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were about to expose her. She hurried back to their side.
Silence filled the living room. Qiu Xingyu pouted and puffed up her cheeks as she quietly stepped on Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s feet.
Qiu Tong and Jin Yang smiled helplessly at her childish actions.
Qiu Xingyu rubbed her eyes with the back of her hand and deliberately pretended to be pitiful as she sat on the ground. She stared at Jin Yang bitterly and asked, “Uncle, do you not like me? We just want to complete our homework. If Uncle will be inconvenienced by this, I won’t mention it again then…”
Jin Yang was completely defeated by her tactful move. He had no choice but to quickly agree to Little Yu’s request.
Jin Yang left the villa with the guards, while Qiu Tong sat on the sofa and patted the empty seat beside her. She waved Qiu Xingyu over and asked, “Homework?”
“The whole family has to go out this weekend, and you have to write a diary entry about it?”
“Didn’t Mommy say before that children are not allowed to lie? Little Yu… do you want to say something to Mommy?”
Qiu Tong was extremely patient. Her tone was gentle as she gave Qiu Xingyu a chance to explain. She did not directly reprimand or pressure her.
Qiu Xingyu lowered her head and looked at her fingers, not daring to look up at Qiu Tong.
After a while, she said in a soft voice, “I’m sorry, Mommy. I lied. The teacher didn’t give us such an assignment.”
Qiu Tong frowned rather angrily, wanting to use a serious tone to remind her to be an honest child.
But in the next second, tears welled up in Qiu Xingyu’s eyes.
She pursed her lips aggrievedly and said in a choked voice, “I wanted Uncle to stay. Is that wrong?”
“I’m so envious of other children who have fathers! They all have fathers who send them to and fro the kindergarten. Their whole family goes out to play on the weekends…”
“But my brothers and I don’t have any such things! They bully us in the kindergarten and say that we are wild children that no one wants.”
Qiu Xingyu’s tears fell uncontrollably. Qiu Tong hugged her tenderly and patted her back guiltily.
It was all her fault. When the children were young, Qiu Tong did not create a warm and healthy family environment for them.
“Eldest Brother wants to learn how to make medicine while Second Brother likes to fight. All so they can protect themselves and Little Yu!”
“We don’t have a father, so people often bully us! Little Yu just wants Uncle to spend a weekend with us.”
Qiu Xingyu poured out all her grievances. She hugged Qiu Tong’s neck and wailed.
Qiu Tong’s gaze landed on Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao. They clenched their small fists and looked away. “Not us!”
Although they denied it, Qiu Tong could still see the disappointment in Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes.
She gently patted Qiu Xingyu’s back to comfort her.
Qiu Tong looked at the folded paper dragonfly Jin Yang had made for Little Yu on the sofa. She frowned in thought. Song Yan’s status was very high, while she was just a commoner. They were people from two different worlds. They should not have met each other, but they ended up together by chance.
However, Song Yan was indeed very patient with the children. He always coaxed Little Yu gently and took special care to consider Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s pride and self-esteem.
Qiu Tong struggled and hesitated as she recalled the memories of their time together. It seemed like he didn’t dislike her either.
Perhaps, for the children’s sake, she could try… to make Song Yan their “father”?

chapters.title: Chapter 199 - Reminder From The Capital
chapters.content:
Chapter 199: Reminder From The Capital
In his temporary official residence in S City, Jin Yang sat on the sofa and touched the sachet on his neck with his fingers. It was a quiet night.
Shao An looked at Jin Yang, who maintained the same posture throughout the video call. He could not help but clear his throat and remind him, “Sir, since the unrest in S City has been quelled and the perpetrators have been subdued, shouldn’t you be back in the capital to take charge?”
Shao An scratched his head anxiously. He felt that he had lost a lot of weight in just a few days.
The news of Jin Yang leaving the capital was extremely difficult to suppress. Not only did Shao An have to deal with all the high-ranking officials who came to visit, he also had to entertain the old man.
“Mr. Jin must have sensed that something was wrong. He called you several times at the official residence to contact you.”
“I’ve covered for you using various reasons, but I can’t hide it for too long! Sir, can I book you a flight back to the capital tomorrow?”
Shao An probed, but Jin Yang frowned and stared at Shao An on the screen in dissatisfaction. He said coldly, “I still have some things to finish. I will contact you when I can return.”
News of the perpetrators being captured in S City had already reached the official residence in the capital. There was nothing else unusual that Shao An could see so he asked worriedly, “Are there any escaped suspects?”
Jin Yang looked at the sachet bag and replied calmly, “I’ve already agreed to accompany the children this weekend.”
Shao An eyes widened in shock. He hurriedly used his hands to close his slightly opened jaw. “What?!”
The president chose to abandon the government affairs of the capital and stay in S City to spend the weekend with the children?
All sorts of conjectures surfaced in Shao An’s heart. He probed softly, “Sir, are those children really your illegitimate children?”
Jin Yang’s expression was as cold as ice as he suddenly raised his eyes. He stood up and looked at Shao An. “You’ve been forgetting your position recently.”
“It’s none of your business! Don’t let me hear any more speculations or discussions about Qiu Tong and the children…”
Even though Jin Yang didn’t respond directly, his protective attitude towards Qiu Tong already proved that his relationship with the Qiu family was out of the ordinary.
Shao An risked being reprimanded. He stood in a military stance and said in a hoarse voice, “Sir, you better consider carefully about the Qiu family.”
“The parliament will never allow the President to marry a commoner woman. Furthermore, Qiu Tong has three children. Their backgrounds…”
A cold glint flashed across Jin Yang’s eyes. He hung up the phone before Shao An could finish speaking. He grabbed the hard liquor on the coffee table and took two large gulps.
The burning alcohol flowed down his throat to his stomach. With the burning sensation, Jin Yang regained some clarity.
He was confused by his current actions. Shao An’s reminder was right. As the president, he should maintain a distance from Qiu Tong.
However, every time Jin Yang thought of Qiu Tong and the children, he would feel more light-hearted. He even looked forward to seeing them!
Jin Yang rubbed his temples, feeling a headache coming on. He didn’t know how to deal with this troublesome situation.
…
In the blink of an eye, it was the weekend. Qiu Xingyu saw Qiu Tong’s extremely simple sportswear and her expression instantly turned serious.
She pushed Qiu Tong’s back and chased her into the changing room. “Mommy! We’re going out to play! You have to dress up!”
Qiu Tong was shocked and wanted to object, but Qiu Xingqiao crossed his arms and leaned against the door of the dressing room. He spat venomously, “All men like beautiful women. Who would want to be our father when they see you looking so disheveled?”
Qiu Xingyu stuffed a dress into Qiu Tong’s hands and urged her to change.
Qiu Tong had no choice but to obey the children’s orders. When she came out wearing light makeup and a pale blue tube dress, the three children widened their eyes at the same time—was their mommy really that beautiful?!

chapters.title: Chapter 200 - Identity Confrontation
chapters.content:
Chapter 200: Identity Confrontation
In the temporary official residence in S City, Jin Yang was dressed casually and looking at the mirror. He was prepared to go to the villa to fetch Qiu Tong and the children.
Jin Yang pushed open the door and saw Song Yan, who had been waiting outside for a long time. He stood up and greeted Jin Yang with a lazy and casual expression, “Morning!”
“Where are you going? Let me guess, you’re going to meet Qiu Tong?”
Song Yan spread out his hands with a mocking expression. He used his slender fingers to poke the sachet on Jin Yang’s chest. “This looks like it is mine.”
“Shouldn’t you be returning it to me?”
Song Yan knew about what happened between Qiu Tong and Jin Yang yesterday through the listening device. When he heard that Qiu Tong had given him a sachet, he knew that she must have sensed the disparities between him and Jin Yang, and wanted to use it to differentiate them.
Jin Yang frowned and rejected him with an unhappy expression. “I’ll return to the capital next week.”
“I promised the children that I would spend the weekend with them…”
Song Yan stuck the tip of his tongue against his teeth and revealed a mocking smile. A hint of disdain and provocation flashed across his eyes as he said, “The children want me to accompany them—not you pretending to be me! Jin Yang, when will you be able to recognize reality?”
Song Yan raised his hand, wanting to snatch the sachet over. Jin Yang dodged instinctively.
The two of them quickly engaged in battle. Song Yan was very determined, but Jin Yang’s skills were better than his. In just two or three moves, he had pinned Song Yan against the door. Song Yan tried to break free several times but failed. His face was pressed against the cold wall. Even so, he could not help mocking, “You’re still so hypocritical. You promised to keep your distance from Qiu Tong, but what has happened in reality?”
“You keep trying to find all sorts of ways to get close to her!”
Song Yan tried to break free from Jin Yang’s hold and growled, “You’ve already taken everything that belongs to me!”
“Do you still want to snatch my woman away?”
Song Yan felt the grip on him loosening. His eyes were bloodshot as he questioned, “You are the president but you harbor ulterior motives towards your brother’s woman. Jin Yang, you’re really a gentleman! What a good brother!”
Jin Yang’s heart ached as if it was pierced by needles. Pain flashed across his eyes as he released his hand. He took off the sachet from his neck and threw it to Song Yan.
Song Yan smirked as he rushed to the villa with the sachet.
Jin Yang sat at the doorway in frustration. The sensation of the sachet seemed to linger on his fingertips. He recalled Qiu Tong’s advice. “The herbal powder inside can relieve your headaches…”
Something was not right!
Jin Yang’s pupils constricted. Song Yan did not have headaches. If Qiu Tong was really with him, she would have known!
In that case, Qiu Tong did not know that Song Yan and he were two different people!
Jin Yang grabbed his car keys and immediately chased after Song Yan.
At the villa in the wealthy district, Song Yan knocked lightly on the door. Qiu Xingyu opened the door happily and pushed Qiu Tong in front of him.
Song Yan looked at the dressed-up Qiu Tong and smiled in amazement. “Let’s go.”
Qiu Tong looked at him warily and pretended to probe. “It’s a little cold today. Are your headaches acting up?”
“Do you have the sachet on you?”
Song Yan smiled faintly and took out the sachet. He showed it to her and said, “This is a gift from you. How could I dare to forget it?”

chapters.title: Chapter 201 - Confession At The Cinema
chapters.content:
Chapter 201: Confession At The Cinema
In the private theater, the children stood at the door excitedly, holding popcorn buckets as they waited for Qiu Tong and Song Yan.
Qiu Xingyu’s eyes flickered with excitement and joy. She tugged at Qiu Xingqiao’s sleeve and murmured softly, “Mommy and Uncle Song are so compatible!”
Qiu Xingqiao frowned and looked at Qiu Tong and Song Yan. Going against his conscience, he disagreed. “How are they compatible?”
Qiu Xingyuan had two bottles of cola in his arms. He pursed his thin lips. Although he looked a little reluctant, he kept glancing at Qiu Tong the entire time.
“Uncle! I want to sit with you!”
Qiu Xingyu threw herself into Song Yan’s arms. She raised her head and stared at him with her sparkling eyes.
Song Yan felt a little repulsed but he hid his emotions. He just looked at Qiu Tong and patted the top of Little Yu’s head comfortingly. “Uncle will sit with Mommy!”
Qiu Xingyu was taken aback. She immediately covered her mouth with her hand and nodded solemnly. She pushed Qiu Tong and Song Yan to sit in the last row.
A cartoon comedy was playing on the projection screen. Laughter could be heard from the front row from time to time. Even Qiu Xingyuan’s eyes were lit up with glee.
Qiu Tong couldn’t help smiling when she saw their expressions.
Zap—
Qiu Tong reached into the popcorn bucket and ended up making contact with Song Yan’s fingertips. Sparks of static electricity flashed in the darkness.
Qiu Tong quickly drew back her hand. Song Yan smiled as he placed the popcorn in her arms. Their interaction was as intimate and natural as before, but somehow, she felt that something was amiss. “Sorry, I need to go to the washroom.”
Song Yan nodded and moved aside. Qiu Tong rested her hand on the back of the chair, her jacket brushing against Song Yan’s knee.
In the corridor, a stealthy figure slowly approached. Yu Ge lowered his black cap and hid in the dark, staring at the theater door.
Ever since the failed ambush at the hospital, Yu Ge had been lying in wait outside the villa. When he saw Qiu Tong and Song Yan come out, he had been secretly following them.
Yu Ge gritted his teeth and touched the fresh scar on his cheek. His eyes lit up as he took out a handkerchief soaked in chemicals.
At the sink in the washroom, Qiu Tong let cold water run down her palms. Images of Song Yan and her together flashed across her mind…
Bang—
The door was pushed open from the outside. Yu Ge rushed behind Qiu Tong and covered her mouth with a handkerchief. “This time! No one can save you!”
“Qiu Tong! You forced me to do this…”
The situation happened too suddenly. Qiu Tong inhaled a large amount of chemicals before hurriedly holding her breath. She picked up a big porcelain plate from the sink counter and threw it at Yu Ge.
Yu Ge tried to dodge and nearly tripped over the trash can.
“Don’t move! Are you alright?”
Qiu Tong did not return for a long time. Song Yan sensed that something was wrong. He quietly came out to look for her and heard the noises coming out of the bathroom.
He supported Qiu Tong as he asked her with concern.
Yu Ge saw that the situation was unfavorable and hurriedly fled.
Qiu Tong frowned and shook her head. She supported herself with her hands against the sink. Song Yan held her by the waist and brought her to the theater next door.
In the dark environment, Qiu Tong’s face was flushed red and sweating profusely. When Song Yan saw her appearance, his heart suddenly surged with a strong impulse. It was as if there were voices clamoring and urging him in his mind. “Kiss her! Turn her into your woman!”
Song Yan paused for two seconds. He squatted in front of Qiu Tong and stroked her cheek with his cold fingertips.
“Where are you feeling discomfort? I can help you, as long as you are willing…”
With his index finger, Song Yan tucked a strand of Qiu Tong’s hair behind her ear. He bent over, wanting to kiss her.
Qiu Tong’s eyes suddenly widened. She pushed Song Yan’s chest with her palm. Their faces were so close that she could see her own reflection in Song Yan’s eyes. Taking advantage of Song Yan’s daze, she tore off the herbal sachet hanging from his neck.
“Who are you! Why are you pretending to be him? What’s your motive for wanting to get close to me!”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and questioned warily.
Song Yan frowned, his lips curling into a cold and indifferent smile. He asked, “What are you talking about? Why can’t I understand what you are saying?”
“This is the herbal sachet you gave me to wear 24/7.”
Song Yan wanted to grab her palm, but Qiu Tong retracted her hand in disdain. “No, you’re not him!”
“Anyone who wears this herbal sachet for 24 hours will be infused with its fragrance.”
“But you don’t smell of it at all. In other words, you snatched this herbal sachet from him!”
Qiu Tong stepped away from Song Yan and demanded in a cold tone, “Who are you!”
Song Yan had his hands in his pockets. In the dim light of the theater, he casually admitted, “I’m Song Yan.”
“Your so-called ‘him’ is the one who used my identity to deceive you.”
Song Yan raised his eyebrows and explained calmly, “Jin Yang, the president who lives in the capital used my identity to deceive you and get close to you.”
“He just wants to flirt with you before making me take the blame for everything. That way, he won’t have to take any responsibility.”
Qiu Tong’s pupils constricted. So their first encounter had been a sham?

chapters.title: Chapter 202 - Two Song Yans
chapters.content:
Chapter 202: Two Song Yans
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong felt the effects of the chemicals slowly taking effect on her body. Her vision turned blurry and her palms were covered in sweat.
Song Yan paused for a moment and slowly walked to Qiu Tong’s side. He said in a bewitching voice, “Jin Yang has always been selfish.”
“He takes very good care of you and the children for a hidden motive. He treats you as his prey and will abandon you without any mercy!”
“No one understands Jin Yang better than me. In the beginning, I got close to you because I wanted to see what he wanted to do with using identity…”
“But now, I just want to be with you. Forget about Jin Yang. I will treat you very well!”
Song Yan stared at Qiu Tong with a profound expression. He leaned over and stroked Qiu Tong’s cheek with his finger. Seeing her dazed expression, he moved his thin lips closer.
In the quiet theater, one could almost hear their hearts beating.
A trailer for a romantic movie was playing on the background screen. Qiu Tong wanted to push Song Yan away, but her limbs were limp.
Song Yan kissed Qiu Tong’s earlobe and said with closed eyes, “Perhaps with Jin Yang faking my identity to get close to you, it was just the heavens giving us the chance to meet. It was fated. We should follow our destiny and follow our true hearts!”
Just as his thin lips were about to kiss Qiu Tong, a fist came from the left and landed accurately on Song Yan’s face.
Thump!
Caught off-guard, Song Yan took two steps back. He could taste the blood in his mouth. He raised his hand and used his thumb to wipe the blood at the corner of his lips.
Jin Yang was panting slightly. Qiu Tong bit the tip of her tongue and relied on the sharp pain to cling onto her consciousness.
She looked at the two identical-looking men and smiled self-deprecatingly. “I’m really stupid to have been fooled by you.”
“I’m sorry, let me explain!”
Jin Yang saw Qiu Tong’s indifferent gaze and opened his mouth in a panic.
Song Yan interrupted him and said provocatively, “What are you doing here?”
“Mr. President, it’s better not to meddle in other people’s business! You have a special status. If others see this, there might be trouble.”
“Don’t forget what you promised! Since you promised to leave Qiu Tong and not pester and deceive her, why are you looking for her now?”
Song Yan deliberately scolded Jin Yang with words that could confuse Qiu Tong’s mind.
Qiu Tong looked at Jin Yang coldly. He felt rather uneasy and couldn’t find the right words to explain or clarify the misunderstanding.
Song Yan took the opportunity to stir things up. “I already asked you back then. If you have feelings for Qiu Tong, you could tell me and I would help you explain to her!”
“I would even help cultivate an opportunity for you two, but what did you say? You denied it!”
“You promised me that you would never appear in front of Qiu Tong and affect our relationship, but you went back on your promise and confused her again and again!”
“Jin Yang, is this how you show your sincerity?”
Song Yan’s every word was like a sharp knife, slashing open a wound between Qiu Tong and Jin Yang that would be difficult to heal.
Jin Yang was at a loss for words. He lowered his face in silence and said in a gloomy voice, “I’ve made many wrong decisions before, but you can’t take Qiu Tong away today! She doesn’t want to be with you. I can’t let you…”
“Hehe, you will always find an excuse for yourself!”
Song Yan’s eyes were filled with hostility and disdain as he said, “You just want to snatch my woman! You always liked stealing things that belong to me!”
Jin Yang didn’t defend himself. He knew that any further explanation would be redundant. “My guards are outside. You won’t be able to bring her away.”
Song Yan sneered. He shook his head and asked with a smile, “Are you using your status to threaten me?”
Hearing their argument, Qiu Tong stood up shakily. Stunned, she supported herself on the seat and growled, “Shut up!”
“I’m not a toy for you two brothers to fight over!”
“I don’t want to see either of you. Get lost!”
In the theater next door, the cartoon had finished playing. Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu noticed that Qiu Tong and Song Yan had disappeared without a trace. They hurriedly ran out to look for them.
They followed Qiu Tong’s voice and pushed open the door.
Qiu Xingyu could not help rubbing her eyes. She tugged at Qiu Xingqiao and saw that he was also so shocked that his mouth was agape. She asked in a soft voice, “Second Brother, am I seeing things? Why are there two Uncle Songs?”
Even as Qiu Xingyuan was in shock, he realized that there was something wrong with Qiu Tong’s condition.
“Mommy, what’s wrong?”
Qiu Xingyu and Qiu Xingyuan stood by Qiu Tong’s side supporting her, their eyes filled with worry. She secretly sized up the two “Uncle Song Yan” in front of her.
“Who’s real and who’s fake?”
Jin Yang didn’t know how to explain. He could only rub the top of Qiu Xingyu’s head out of habit. “Little Yu, don’t be afraid.”
However, just as his hand was about to touch Qiu Xingyu, Qiu Xingyuan pulled his sister behind him and stared at Jin Yang warily.. His little face was tense. “Don’t touch her!”

chapters.title: Chapter 203 - Bathroom Treatment
chapters.content:
Chapter 203: Bathroom Treatment
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“Let’s go home.”
Qiu Tong wanted to hold the children’s hands, but her legs went limp the moment she stood up. She could not walk.
Jin Yang hugged her tightly in his arms. He turned around and glared at Song Yan, warning him not to follow them. He left the theater with the children.
In the villa area, Qiu Tong forced a smile as she looked at Qiu Xingyuan. “Qiu Xingyuan, Mommy is fine.”
“Be good and take care of your siblings. Mommy and Uncle have something to talk about.”
Qiu Tong walked into the bedroom with the children looking at her worriedly. When the door closed, she fell to the ground weakly, gasping heavily.
Yu Ge had been very vicious with the potency of the chemicals used. In addition, the matter of Song Yan and Jin Yang also had Qiu Tong’s head spinning.
If she continued to waste time, it might affect her body. Qiu Tong forced herself to get up.
Jin Yang comforted the children before following her into the bedroom.
He was filled with guilt and self-reproach. He wanted to explain, but saw Qiu Tong lying on the ground. Jin Yang picked her up anxiously. “I’ll go find a doctor!”
Qiu Tong suddenly opened her eyes and stared at him. She said in a low and hoarse voice, “No…”
She did not harbor any expectations for the skills of the doctors in this place. The chemicals which Yu Ge used would definitely not be something that ordinary doctors would have the antidote for.
“Please bring me to the bathroom.”
Qiu Tong spoke in a polite and distant tone. Jin Yang felt a sharp pain in his heart when he saw her remote expression.
He held Qiu Tong by the waist and pushed open the bathroom door.
Qiu Tong’s gaze landed on the bathtub in the corner. She could heal herself with her superpower, but she needed to soak her entire body in warm water.
At this moment, the chemicals in her body had taken effect and her limbs were so numb that she could not move at all.
Qiu Tong lowered her eyes and pondered for a long time. She slowly closed her eyes and said, “Help me take off my clothes and turn on the hot water.”
Jin Yang was taken aback, but he quickly understood that she wanted to use her supernatural powers.
He quietly approached Qiu Tong, his cold fingers touching her burning skin.
The noise of the zipper being undone sounded especially clear in the quiet space. Jin Yang’s Adam’s apple bobbed. He slowly took off Qiu Tong’s dress and placed his slender fingers on the clasp of her bra. Click. Qiu Tong’s bra fell to the ground…
In the mirror, Qiu Tong’s skin was pink, and her wonderful figure was displayed in all its full glory.
Jin Yang slowly squatted down and grabbed the edge of her panties with his fingertips. His fingertips brushed past Qiu Tong’s inner thigh and she fell into Jin Yang’s arms, trembling.
“Put me in there, thanks.”
Qiu Tong could feel the warm, hard object pressing against her hips. Her voice was hoarse, her tone a little teasing.
Jin Yang took a deep breath and adjusted the temperature of the water. He held Qiu Tong’s slender waist with his rough hands and slowly lowered her into the bathtub.
Warm water surrounded Qiu Tong. She closed her eyes and slowly used her power to expel the chemicals from her body.
The steam in the bathroom drifted up. Jin Yang turned around to avoid eye contact, only to see the glass mirror hanging on the wall.
In the mirror, Qiu Tong slowly stroked every inch of skin on her body. She raised her neck, her fingertips lightly touching her chest as her legs bent slightly…
Jin Yang’s eyes were bloodshot as he clenched his fists. His body was tense as he endured the waves of instinct and the most primitive urge.
The effects of the chemicals subsided and Qiu Tong regained her faculties. She reached out and pulled out a towel, saying coldly, “Please leave.”
Jin Yang opened his mouth to say something, but quickly gave up and left.
Qiu Tong wrapped her body tightly in her bathrobe and walked out of the bathroom barefooted. She saw Jin Yang standing there. “If there’s nothing else…”
“Mr. President, please leave my home as soon as possible and never appear in front of me and the children again.”
Her words were like a huge rock flung straight at Jin Yang.
He felt as if someone was squeezing his heart, making it impossible for him to breathe.
Jin Yang suddenly took two steps forward, trying to grab Qiu Tong’s wrist. However, she dodged, her eyes filled with vigilance and resistance.
He lowered his hands helplessly. “I didn’t mean to lie to you.”
“When I first met you, it was under special circumstances. I had no way of determining who sent you and whether you were deliberately trying to get close to me.”
“Using Song Yan’s identity is a habit I’ve had for many years. I thought that we wouldn’t meet again…”
Jin Yang’s face was haggard and the dark circles under his eyes proved that he hadn’t had a good rest for many days. Qiu Tong smiled in amusement at his explanation. “Well, can you finally confirm that I’m a good person now?”
“Ever since we met that day, there have been countless opportunities for you to clarify things, but did you? You and Song Yan kept treating me like a fool!”
“If I did not get suspicious, you two would continue this childish game, right?”
Qiu Tong questioned angrily, “What do you take me for? A toy for you two brothers? The spoils of a silly war between you and him?”
“No, no!”
Jin Yang frowned and wanted to refute, but he saw the coldness in Qiu Tong’s eyes.. He swallowed the words he was about to say and said, “I’m sorry.”

chapters.title: Chapter 205 - Threat
chapters.content:
Chapter 205: Threat
The atmosphere instantly turned icy cold as Qiu Tong confronted them with a murderous expression.
Song Yan narrowed his eyes and walked over to Qiu Tong with a smile.
He held the muzzle of his gun and looked at the children.
Song Yan’s voice was lazy and slow, but it carried a hint of warning. “As the biological father of the children, you have no right to chase me away. I can obtain custody and visitation rights of the children through legal means…”
“Simply put, if I go to the courts, there’s a good chance you won’t be able to stay with the children.”
Song Yan frowned, his expression somewhere between sympathy and sarcasm. He deliberately made a tsk-tsk sound as he shook his head and slowly squatted down.
“Do you want to have a happy, complete family or do you want to leave her?”
Song Yan threw the option to the children as he pointed in Qiu Tong’s direction.
Little Yu clutched the corner of Qiu Tong’s clothes tightly in a rather dignified but helpless manner. Song Yan gently ruffled the top of her head and said in a low voice, “Perhaps you can persuade Mommy.”
“I remember. You used to like me a lot.”
Song Yan raised his eyebrows, but Little Yu was so frightened that her face turned pale.
Qiu Xingyuan shielded her behind him and stared at Song Yan warily. He said coldly, “Please leave our home.”
“We will never leave Mommy!”
“Even if this goes to court, I am able to think independently for myself. The judge will take my opinion into consideration and not listen to you!”
Qiu Xingyuan put on a stubborn expression, his eyes flickering with determination.
This was the first time he had expressed his reliance and protectiveness towards Qiu Tong. Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu looked at him with widened eyes.
Qiu Tong paused when she heard this. She was very touched. She also understood that Jin Yang and Song Yan had special status. It would be extremely disadvantageous for her to bring this matter to court.
But given the current situation, she absolutely could not show any fear or retreat.
No one could take the children away from her!
Qiu Tong’s gaze was sharp. She pointed the gun at the floor beside Song Yan and suddenly pulled the trigger. With a loud bang, the air was filled with the smell of gunpowder. There was now a hole in the ground and white smoke swirled out of the gun barrel.
Song Yan looked at her in disbelief. He stood up stiffly and frowned. “As long as we are together, we can resolve all problems. I will help you take care of the children. Isn’t that the best choice?”
“Why are you still hesitating?”
Qiu Tong glanced at Jin Yang and Song Yan. “I won’t forgive you for plotting to get close to me and deceiving the children.”
“If you still refuse to leave, my next shot might hit you!”
Qiu Tong reloaded the gun and raised it.
Qiu Xingyuan held Little Yu’s hand tightly. He and Qiu Xingqiao stood at Qiu Tong’s side as protectors.
Qiu Xingqiao pointed at Jin Yang and Song Yan angrily. He whispered into Little Yu’s ear, “Sister, you have to remember this.”
“No man who looks like them is good! They’re all baddies! In the future, when you see them, you have to avoid them. Don’t be fooled!”
Little Yu looked at Jin Yang in confusion. Her lips moved as she wanted to defend her uncle, but she sensed that now was not the right time. She could only nod obediently.
“Brother, don’t worry. I’ll remember!”
Jin Yang and Song Yan looked at each other in exasperation.
Qiu Tong felt comfort when she looked down at Qiu Xingyuan. She suddenly remembered the officer who had tried to kidnap the children outside the hospital. All her doubts seemed to have been cleared up as she stared at Song Yan suspiciously…
Song Yan and the officer appeared beside her and the children at almost the same time.
Could all the dangers they encountered be related to Song Yan?
Qiu Tong’s entire body tensed up as she glared at Song Yan. She questioned coldly, “Did you have anything to do with those people waiting outside the hospital, waiting for an opportunity to kidnap the children? Did you arrange it?”
Song Yan was a little stunned, but he could sense the change in Qiu Tong’s attitude.
The children were Qiu Tong’s lifeline and weakness.
Song Yan did not answer directly. He raised his hand and tugged at the collar of his shirt, his fingertips playing with his messy hair. “As long as we are together, any problem can be solved and you will be safe.”
Qiu Tong’s dark eyes were filled with anger as she gritted her teeth.
Jin Yang noticed the change in her mood and hurriedly apologized, “I’ll explain to you another day.”
He strode over to Song Yan and gripped his shoulders tightly, dragging him out of the villa.
Thump!
Qiu Tong closed the door to the villa and threw the gun to the ground.
The children surrounded her with worried expressions. Qiu Tong looked up and opened her arms to hug them.
“Don’t be afraid, Mommy won’t let anyone snatch you away!”
This promise made Qiu Xingyu cry loudly. Qiu Xingyuan also took the initiative to hold Qiu Tong’s finger with reddened eyes.
Qiu Xingqiao clenched his small fists and said fiercely, “If they dare to come knocking on our door again, I’ll kick them all out!”
Qiu Tong burst out laughing at his actions and planted a gentle kiss on each child’s face.
“Let go of me!”
Song Yan shook off Jin Yang’s hand and stared at him in disdain. “Don’t keep looking at me like that. Qiu Tong and the children are mine.”
“Don’t tell me the president wants to have the bad reputation of committing incest?”

chapters.title: Chapter 206 - Lawsuit
chapters.content:
Chapter 206: Lawsuit
Jin Yang clenched his fists and stared at Song Yan silently. He then issued a direct warning. “Don’t go near them again!”
“If you insist on causing trouble, I will definitely use my status to chase you out of this city. I won’t have any mercy even on account of our past ties.”
Song Yan gently patted off his sleeves, a mocking and dark expression flashing across his eyes.
He straightened his collar and raised an eyebrow at Jin Yang. “You dare to let Jin Tao know of Qiu Tong’s existence?”
“My dear President, you should understand the situation. The love between the president and a civilian may sound very romantic and touching, but Qiu Tong and the children will be the ones hurt in the end! On the other hand, I’m different. I’m their best choice. Qiu Tong will understand sooner or later!”
“I will continue to use legal means to fight for my rights. Just wait and see!”
Song Yan left with his hands in his pockets.
Jin Yang stood under the streetlamp outside the villa district. The light elongated his figure, but he looked extremely lonely.
…
In the bedroom, Qiu Tong searched for hundreds of photos of Jin Yang and Song Yan. She projected them onto the wall and carefully analyzed them.
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and stared quietly at the two identical faces until she discovered the red mole!
She closed her eyes and recalled the injured man she had picked up by the roadside. It was Jin Yang!
Mixed emotions surged in Qiu Tong’s heart. She opened the drawer and looked at some financial records. She felt a headache coming along and jabbed her own forehead with her finger.
The next morning, there was a knock on the door.
Qiu Tong, who had not slept the entire night, struggled to open her eyes. She pushed open the door in her sleeping robe and saw a mailman standing outside. “Are you Madam Qiu?”
“This is a court summons. Please sign here to acknowledge receipt.”
The mailman held out a pen. His words were like a basin of cold water splashing all over Qiu Tong, waking her up completely.
She recalled Song Yan’s harsh words before he left yesterday and her heart gradually sank.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao came out of the room. They heard the mailman’s words. They looked at each other nervously and stood rooted to the ground in silence.
Qiu Tong opened the envelope and saw the notice written in black and white. She did not expect Song Yan to be so ruthless!
From the full-length mirror, she saw Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s worried expressions. She deliberately put on a relaxed and natural expression, before casually stashing away the documents in the shoe drawer. She then summoned the children to the dining room for breakfast.
Qiu Xingyuan was the first to walk to her side. He took the initiative to help her carry the dishes.
Little Yu ran out of the bedroom barefooted. She held a crumpled drawing paper behind her back and said in a soft voice, “Mommy! This is a gift Little Yu and my brothers prepared for you. Do you like it?”
Qiu Tong wiped her wet hands on her apron and bent over to take it.
The drawing was a two-story villa drawn with a colorful crayon. Qiu Tong could vaguely make out the figures of herself and the three children surrounding her.
Qiu Tong rubbed the top of Little Yu’s head and kissed her face tenderly. She felt a trace of calmness and stability return to her heart.
The four of them sat around the dining table. Qiu Xingyuan took the initiative to pick up two slices of vegetables and placed them in Qiu Tong’s bowl.
Qiu Tong looked at him in surprise. Qiu Xingyuan shifted his gaze awkwardly and cleared his throat before muttering, “Eat more food. You haven’t been looking good recently. If your body fails, how are you going to protect us?”
Qiu Tong could not help chuckling. It had been a long time since the villa had such a friendly and harmonious atmosphere. But even so, there was an undercurrent of graveness and uneasiness.
Ding dong—
The doorbell broke the silence. Ke Le opened the door and saw Jin Yang standing outside.
Qiu Tong frowned and wanted to chase him away, but Jin Yang cut her off. “He’s a lawyer. You can consult him if you have any questions.”
The man holding the briefcase nodded at Qiu Tong. Qiu Tong glanced at the summons peeking out of the drawer and had no choice but to step aside to let the two of them in.
In the living room, the lawyer gained an understanding of the situation. He shook his head with a grave expression.
“Miss Qiu, unfortunately, this lawsuit is very unfavorable for you.”
“As the children’s biological father, Mr. Song Yan has the right to fight for custody of the children.”
“Besides, you don’t have any fixed income source at the moment. You can’t provide stable living conditions for the children. Mr. Song Yan has an advantage over you in this aspect. Besides, his status…”
The lawyer smiled awkwardly. Qiu Tong nodded and said bitterly, “I understand.”
“I will try my best to help you fight this lawsuit, but the chances of winning are not high. I advise you to think of other ways.”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were sitting on a high stool in the dining room, eavesdropping. When they saw Qiu Tong’s gloomy expression, they hurriedly ran to the lawyer and said in a clear voice, “The court has to consider our opinion. We will never follow him!”
“He didn’t fulfill his responsibility of raising us, but now he wants to take us away? On what basis?!”
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his thin lips, his eyes filled with hatred as he gritted his teeth.
Qiu Tong suppressed her heartache. She gently pressed Qiu Xingyuan’s shoulder and said in a low voice, “Qiu Xingyuan, don’t scare your sister.”
Qiu Xingyuan turned and saw Little Yu biting her lips tightly. She looked like she was about to cry. Helpless, he could only let his arms droop down in silence.

chapters.title: Chapter 207 - Winning The Lawsuit
chapters.content:
Chapter 207: Winning The Lawsuit
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong consulted with her lawyer about the procedures and things to take note of in court.
Jin Yang casually picked up two glass cups and went to the kitchen. He took out a honey pomelo syrup from the fridge and brewed some drinks.
“Take your time to discuss this. I’ll go accompany the children.”
In a very natural manner, Jin Yang handed the warm drinks to the lawyer. He spoke gently as he looked at Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong ignored his gesture of goodwill. Her back remained facing him.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao hid at the corner of the stairs. They stared in the direction of Jin Yang and Qiu Tong. Two little heads were huddled together, discussing in low voices how to torture Jin Yang!
Since he had deceived Qiu Tong, he had to pay a price!
Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes flickered. He ran back to his room and found the vegetable juice that he usually kept hidden. He quietly sneaked into the kitchen and found some hot mustard sauce. He mixed the two together and stirred the turbid liquid. He pinched his nose to prevent himself from smelling the pungent smell.
Qiu Xingyuan brought the juice to Jin Yang’s side and pushed it toward him without a word.
Jin Yang stared at him in surprise. The mustard sauce had settled at the bottom of the cup. The color was so striking that there was no way he hadn’t noticed it.
Helpless, he held his forehead with one hand and asked with a bitter smile, “You want me to drink this?”
Qiu Xingyuan crossed his arms and nodded solemnly. He continued to stare at Jin Yang, looking like he would only leave after he finished drinking it.
Jin Yang sighed, his slender fingers grasped the glass cup. He held his breath as he gulped down the juice. The mustard burned his stomach as the stinging smell mixed with his insides.
He covered his thin lips with his hand, desperately trying to suppress his nausea.
“It’s quite delicious.”
Jin Yang squeezed out a smile with difficulty. Qiu Xingyuan frowned and looked at him. His pupils quivered. “Liar.”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao returned to the room. Jin Yang sat on the sofa with his hands covering his stomach. Qiu Xingyu had gotten two cups of yogurt from somewhere and stuffed them into his hands.
“Thank you.”
Jin Yang spoke to the little girl gently. Qiu Xingyu’s eyes were sparkling, but she refused to speak to him.
The two of them looked at each other for a long time. Qiu Xingyu took out a piece of notepaper she always carried with her. She wrote down a few lines of words and quietly stuffed it into Jin Yang’s hand. She then turned her back to him and pretended like nothing had happened.
Jin Yang was amused by her adorable actions. He looked down at the elegant handwriting and his smile froze on his face.
“My brothers said that you’re a liar who cheated Mommy and even wanted to swindle us away. Is that true?”
Jin Yang was feeling very conflicted. He wrote down his reply. “Uncle has lied to you before, but I had my reasons for doing so. I definitely don’t want to ruin your lives, nor do I want you and Mommy to be in danger. I want to help you.”
“Uncle is not a bad person.”
After Jin Yang finished writing, he rolled up the note and poked Qiu Xingyu’s shoulder with his fingertips.
The two of them were like children in kindergarten, sneaking notes to each other.
Qiu Xingyu bit her lips and looked at Jin Yang with her mouth pursed.
She stared at Jin Yang with clear eyes. Qiu Xingyu pricked up her ears to listen to the sounds in the bedroom. She wrote a few lines in a fluster.
“I believe you.”
“But my brothers hate you. They discussed chasing you away. Remember not to drink anything they give you in the future!”
“I’ll help you persuade Mommy not to blame you.”
“My brothers are actually very easy to coax. As long as you remember…”
Jin Yang received the note and looked at the densely packed small words that contained things to take note of regarding Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao. The corners of his mouth curled into a relaxed smile.
Qiu Xingyu looked at him nervously and expectantly. Jin Yang smoothed the crumpled piece of paper and carefully placed it in his pocket.
“I will work hard.”
Qiu Xingyu smiled sweetly at his actions.
She heard the sound of the door opening and hurriedly ran to the other end of the living room, pretending that nothing had happened and maintaining a distance from Jin Yang.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao came out of the room. Taking advantage of the fact that they could not see her, Little Yu quietly pumped her fists in the air to cheer Jin Yang on. Her adorable actions were like pebbles dropping down and causing waves in Jin Yang’s heart.
His heart was filled with a bitter sweetness.
Qiu Tong understood from her lawyer how grave the situation was. Her expression became increasingly solemn as she twisted her fingers nervously.
In the evening, Qiu Tong respectfully escorted the lawyer out of the villa. She stood at the door for a long time without returning to her room.
Footsteps came from behind. Qiu Tong thought it was Ke Le. She let her guard down and revealed a tired expression. “Looks like we have to pack our things and move out of this city. If you don’t want to leave with us, I can settle your compensation now…”
She could not take a risk with the children’s safety, to take a gamble on a mere 20% chance of winning this lawsuit.
Qiu Tong’s heart was heavy. Having not received a reply for a long time, she turned only to see Jin Yang behind her. His expression was full of pain. The two of them quietly averted their eyes from each other.
Jin Yang wanted to place a jacket on Qiu Tong’s shoulder, but she dodged it.
“I have a way to help you keep the children with you.”

chapters.title: Chapter 208 - Proposal To Get Married
chapters.content:
Chapter 208: Proposal To Get Married
The night breeze blew in from the window.
Qiu Tong stared at Jin Yang gloomily. She held up the court summons in Jin Yang’s and asked calmly, “What solution do you have?”
Jin Yang was leaning against the door with one hand in his pocket. When his eyes met Qiu Tong’s, coldness engulfed his entire body.
He immediately stood up straight, his throat tight with hesitation. He didn’t know how to begin.
Jin Yang took a deep breath and suggested in a tentative, “Song Yan and I are twins. Our DNA is the same.”
“In other words, if the children and I undergo a paternity test, the results will be the same as Song Yan’s.”
“If you want, we can get married. This way, Song Yan won’t be able to sue you for custody of the children…”
As Jin Yang explained the feasibility of this plan, Qiu Tong’s eyes turned increasingly cold. She suddenly curled her lips into a mocking smile. “So this is the solution? Jin Yang! I’m warning you, be it you, Song Yan, the president or any high-ranking official, no one can even dream of taking my children away from me!”
“They are my children and have no links with anyone else!”
Qiu Tong was agitated and Jin Yang paused for a moment. He raised his slender fingers to rub the space between his brows, trying his best to lay out the current situation for her in a gentle tone. “Song Yan will never give up. Even if you move out of this city, he will still be able to find you.”
“The children have their own friends in kindergarten. Do you want them to live a life of constant escaping and hiding with you?”
“This is unfair to them. It is not a long-term solution.”
Jin Yang spoke the truth. Qiu Tong bit her red lips and looked away, wanting to avoid him. She clenched her fists and leaned against the corner of the desk.
The space was so quiet that only their breathing could be heard.
Jin Yang bent over and picked up the court summons from the ground. “I can find a lawyer to sign a prenup to protect you and the children’s interests.”
“I can even clearly state that I will never sue for custody of the children. Compared to Song Yan, I am the better choice.”
“Also, even after we get married, we will still stay in separate rooms. I won’t do anything outrageous during this period of time. You can rest assured about that.”
Jin Yang was confident. He would not force Qiu Tong to make a decision tonight. Instead, he would give her time to think.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were hiding outside the door, eavesdropping on their conversation.
Qiu Xingqiao asked in a low voice, “Can we trust him?”
Qiu Xingyuan shook his head and brought Qiu Xingqiao back to the room. “Now that things have developed to this point, we have to rely on our own strength to survive this crisis. We can’t trust outsiders anymore! They might have other motives…”
Qiu Xingqiao’s lips parted. He clenched his fists and secretly swore. “Elder Brother, I will definitely protect our home!”
As time passed, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s attitude towards Qiu Tong evolved from conflict to reliance.
They had seen the changes in Qiu Tong, and now, they considered her perspective before doing anything.
At night, Qiu Xingyuan quietly got up from the bed. He looked at Qiu Xingqiao, who was sleeping soundly, before quietly making his way to the study room.
He saw a faint light coming through the door crack. Qiu Xingyuan knocked softly on the door.
Qiu Tong studied the prenup she had received in her email inbox. She was still feeling conflicted when she heard a knock on the door. She closed the computer and opened the door.
“Qiu Xingyuan? It’s so late. Why aren’t you asleep?”
Qiu Tong asked with concern.
Qiu Xingyuan lowered his arms and stood in the middle of the study room. After a moment of silence, he raised his head and stared at Qiu Tong with his dark eyes. “We are all willing to move away with you. The kindergarten syllabus is too juvenile for us. Qiu Xingyuan and I have already completed all our school work in advance on our own. We won’t lag behind in school.”
“As long as we move to the outskirts of the countryside where communication is inconvenient, it will be difficult for them to find us.”
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his thin lips. Qiu Tong looked at him and suddenly squatted down with a sniffle. She rested her hands on Qiu Xingyuan’s shoulders and said in a nasal voice, “Sorry, Mommy didn’t handle it well and now, you have to worry about me.”
Drip…
Hot tears fell on the back of Qiu Xingyuan’s hand. Momentarily taken aback, Qiu Xingyuan hesitated for a while before raising his small hand and patting Qiu Tong’s back.
Qiu Tong’s eyes flickered. Shaken, she hugged Qiu Xingyuan tightly in her arms and buried her face in the crook of his neck. “I’m sorry.”
This apology made Qiu Xingyuan feel a little lost and helpless. He could only stand there in a daze, letting Qiu Tong’s aura surround him.
“No one can take us away. Even if they kidnap us, I will protect my siblings and find an opportunity to sneak out and run back to this villa to find you. Although you always beat and scolded us in the past, now…”
Qiu Xingyuan paused for a moment, before adding heavily, “You are the only person we will acknowledge as family.”
Qiu Tong couldn’t control her tears. She sat on the ground and covered her eyes with her hands. Tears trickled down her fingers.
With a straight face, Qiu Xingyuan gently reached out to wipe her tears. He muttered softly, “Why are you crying? Such an ugly sight.”

chapters.title: Chapter 209 - Trying To Interact
chapters.content:
Chapter 209: Trying To Interact
It was almost dawn.
Qiu Tong buried her face in her knees as she pondered Jin Yang’s proposal through the night.
She could not be selfish and choose to hide or escape, while letting the children suffer with her!
Qiu Tong grabbed her phone and stared at the number on the screen.
She took a deep breath and pressed the call button. In the quiet room, Qiu Tong could hear her own heartbeat.
The phone rang for two seconds before being picked up. Jin Yang’s voice came from the other end. Qiu Tong nervously shifted away from the phone.
“Qiu Tong?”
“I need to respect the children’s wishes. If they can accept you, I’m willing to marry you.”
Click.
Qiu Tong hung up quickly. Jin Yang was a little dazed as he grabbed his messy hair. When he regained his senses, he heaved a sigh of relief and smiled.
Meanwhile, Qiu Tong threw her phone far away, forcing herself to forget the call she just made.
The next morning, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao walked out of the bedroom yawning. When they heard busy noises in the kitchen, they stood rooted to the ground. The two boys rubbed their eyes at the same time, thinking that they were hallucinating.
Jin Yang heard them as he busied himself at the dining table. He waved and called out to them, “Come and have breakfast.”
“I don’t know what you like so I’ve prepared Chinese, Western and fast food options.”
“If you need anything else, just let me know. I’ll try my best to satisfy your requests.”
The corners of Jin Yang’s lips curled up as he tried to mimic the teacher in the parenting video. He felt his facial muscles stiffen, but he didn’t dare to show any signs of fatigue.
Qiu Xingyuan narrowed his eyes and stared at him with hostility.
When Little Yu saw him, an expression of surprise and joy appeared on her face. She hurriedly ran to the kitchen and pulled out a chair. She opened her arms for Jin Yang to carry her onto the seat.
She took two bites of the bread and gave him a thumbs-up. “Delicious!”
Qiu Xingqiao looked at his sister, who had once again “defected” to the enemy side. He pressed his fist to his lips and coughed twice as a reminder.
Qiu Xingyu blinked, her black, grape-like eyes swivelling. She then put on a stubborn stance and pointed at the two boiled crabs in the bowl. “I want to eat this! Help me crack the shells… Eldest Brother, Second Brother, you two love to eat crabs. Come here quickly!”
Qiu Xingyuan surveyed the living room but did not see Qiu Tong. He sat down suspiciously, wanting to probe Jin Yang’s motive for being here.
Jin Yang’s fingers were long and slender. He used a tool to dismantle the crabs, looking as if he was performing a medical operation.
He carefully picked out the crab roe and meat and distributed them fairly to each child. He even thoughtfully prepared grated ginger and vinegar as accompaniments for the crab.
Such ingratiating behavior had no effect on Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao at all.
They quietly pushed the crab meat away and lowered their heads to eat their plain porridge.
Qiu Xingyu and Jin Yang exchanged glances. Qiu Xingyu shoved the crab meat into their bowls and mumbled, “Why are Eldest Brother and Second Brother throwing tantrums like silly kids?! You’ll only have the strength to fight Uncle when your stomachs are full!”
She had just blurted out Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s plan. Qiu Xingyuan sighed helplessly and had no choice but to compromise and eat.
A sweet smile appeared on Little Yu’s face. She blinked and exchanged secret signals with Jin Yang.
“Do something to gain sympathy!”
Qiu Xingyu took the opportunity to whisper those words to Jin Yang when he bent over to pick up something.
Jin Yang was momentarily taken aback. But he quickly understood and walked to the living room, bringing over a fruit platter.
He held a sharp fruit knife and purposely sliced an apple in a clumsy manner, “accidentally” cutting his own fingers.
Jin Yang cried out softly. Qiu Xingyu dragged half a box of tissues to his side with exaggerated movements. She glanced at Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao and shouted, “Aiyah, what should we do? Uncle is injured!”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked up with cold expressions. Their thin lips parted slightly and their venomous tongues spat out mercilessly. “You can’t even do a simple task properly, idiot.”
Jin Yang’s breathing halted. He shook his hand awkwardly. “It’s alright, just a small injury.”
Qiu Xingyuan frowned and asked, “Why are you here? You’re not welcome here.”
Jin Yang knew that Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao would not be convinced so easily, but he did not expect the situation to be so tricky.
He lowered his eyes and handed them some milk without answering. “From today onwards, I’ll move to the villa to take care of you.”
“If you encounter any problems, you can come to me anytime.”
“I hope that you can rely on me…”
Qiu Xingyuan slammed his chopsticks on the dining table. He pursed his thin lips and said coldly with a resistant expression, “Relyh on a stranger? Do we look stupid to you? Don’t think you can fool us again!” He dragged Little Yu out of the dining room.
Jin Yang sighed helplessly. Taking care of a child was even more tiring than being the president!
He dragged his tired body back to the living room, only to see a band-aid on the coffee table.
A glimpse of the corner of Qiu Xingyuan’s shirt flashed past the door. Jin Yang raised his eyebrows in surprise before curling his lips. It seemed like the situation was not that bad.
Qiu Tong stood on the second floor and witnessed the entire process of Jin Yang interacting with the children. Mixed emotions welled up in her heart.
She slowly drew back her fingers and flipped through the marriage agreement that the lawyer had given her.

chapters.title: Chapter 210 - Gaining Their Consent
chapters.content:
Chapter 210: Gaining Their Consent
In the evening, the sun hung low in the sky. Qiu Xingyu stood on tiptoe and leaned against the window sill to look out.
