Jin Yang lifted her up and saw the hammock and toys in the courtyard. He asked in a low voice, “Do you want to go out and play?”
Qiu Xingyu smiled joyfully.
Jin Yang turned around and asked Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao. They decisively and coldly rejected him.
Qiu Xingyu met their gazes and pouted as she lowered her head. She discreetly tugged at Jin Yang’s sleeve and gestured at her brothers.
Jin Yang understood what she wanted and deliberately raised his voice. “Then I’ll bring Little Yu out to play alone…”
“It’s just that when a little girl goes out to play with a stranger. It’s best if your family can be by your side to protect you. Otherwise, it won’t be good if bad guys kidnap you.”
Jin Yang adjusted his tone to mimic how the teacher spoke in the parenting videos.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao’s faces darkened, but when they saw Little Yu’s expectant eyes, they could only swallow their words.
They changed into sportswear and waited at the door. “Hurry up.” They urged impatiently.
Jin Yang secretly high-fived Little Yu, a victorious smile on his face.
In the courtyard, Jin Yang helped Little Yu tie the hammock properly. He also thoughtfully adjusted the height of Qiu Xingqiao’s sandbags and other exercise equipment.
In the afterglow of the setting sun, Jin Yang accompanied the three children as they ran around the lawn.
Children from the villa district passed by their house and looked at the Qiu siblings with envy. They asked their own fathers, “Daddy, when can you play with me?”
Qiu Xingqiao was playing when he heard this. He stopped what he was doing.
In the past, they had also stood outside the houses of other families, envious that other children could have their parents’ company and a harmonious family.
Suspicion and uncertainty hid in the depths of Qiu Xingyuan’s pitch-black eyes. He stared at Jin Yang’s back profile and quietly closed his fists in thought.
At night, Jin Yang brought the children back indoors.
Qiu Xingyuan stopped him and pointed to the room. “Can we talk?”
Jin Yang was stunned. The boy in front of him sounded as steady as an adult, even though his face was clearly that of a child.
There was a sharp ache in his heart. He nodded and followed Qiu Xingyuan into the room.
There were various laboratory test tubes and chemistry books on the desk, and the single bed was neat and clean.
Qiu Xingyuan stared at Jin Yang. “Our mother and us are not tools to be used.”
“If you want to take revenge on Song Yan through us, you better give up on this idea. We won’t let you manipulate us!”
Qiu Xingyuan displayed obvious hostility. Jin Yang sat on the bench. He did not put on the airs of an adult. Instead, he treated the boy in front of him as an equal. “I never thought of using her or you children. I really want to take care of you.”
“You can choose not to believe it, but I will use my own way to make you understand that I have no ill intentions towards you.”
Jin Yang said with sincerity. Qiu Xingyuan lowered his eyes and asked in a gloomy voice, “Can you promise to always take care of her and protect her?”
The atmosphere in the room was quiet. Jin Yang smiled and raised one hand in a solemn gesture. He swore. “I promise.”
“Then… I agree.”
After Qiu Xingyuan said that, the door was pushed open from the outside. Qiu Xingyu threw herself into Jin Yang’s arms excitedly, a wide grin on her face.
Qiu Xingqiao touched the tip of his nose awkwardly. Faced with Qiu Xingyuan’s probing glare, he explained weakly, “Little Yu insisted on eavesdropping. I had no choice…”
Qiu Xingyu suddenly thought of Qiu Tong, who had been hiding upstairs all day long. She hurriedly held Jin Yang’s hand and ran to the second floor.
Qiu Tong heard the commotion and was about to go out to check on the situation when she bumped into Jin Yang.
Qiu Xingyu pushed him into Qiu Tong’s room. She covered her mouth and chuckled. “Uncle, stay in the villa tonight!”
Jin Yang and Qiu Tong didn’t even have time to react before the door slammed shut from the outside.
By the time Qiu Tong guessed what Little Yu was doing and wanted to turn the door handle, it was already too late.
She and Jin Yang looked at each other and heard Little Yu shouting outside, “Little Yu will open the door for Mommy and Uncle tomorrow!”
Where did they learn all these tricks?
Qiu Tong coughed lightly and looked at Jin Yang. She pointed at the window and asked, “Why don’t you jump down?”
“The second floor isn’t too high.”
The bathroom mirror was misted over. Qiu Tong was wearing a silk negligee with a deep V neckline, highlighting the curves of her good figure. Her wet hair hung on her shoulders and water dripped onto her neck, making Jin Yang’s throat feel dry. He shifted his gaze and said, “I can sleep on the floor.”
“Don’t worry, I won’t do anything.”
Jin Yang’s words sounded superfluous and weird. His Adam’s apple bobbed as he steeled himself for Qiu Tong to chase him out.
However, Qiu Tong just shrugged and opened the wardrobe. She took out a thin blanket and pillow and stuffed them into Jin Yang’s arms. “Sorry for the inconvenience, Mr. President.”
Jin Yang was a little stung by her way of addressing him. “We’ll settle the marriage procedures tomorrow. We should not delay any longer in case anything happens.”
With her back facing him, Qiu Tong stopped what she was doing for two seconds. She sorted through the necessary documents and nodded in agreement. “Alright.”

chapters.title: Chapter 211 - New Neighbor
chapters.content:
Chapter 211: New Neighbor
The next day, at the Civil Affairs Bureau.
The car stopped by the roadside and the Bureau Chief came out personally. He knocked on the tinted glass of the passenger seat with a respectful and flattering expression.
Jin Yang wound down the car window and handed over a leather folder filled with documents.
“Don’t worry, I will settle it as soon as possible!”
The Bureau Chief accepted the leather folder. He was very curious and tried to peep at the backseat of the car.
What kind of woman could capture the president’s heart?
Jin Yang sensed his intentions. He narrowed his eyes and leaned forward slightly to block the Bureau Chief’s view.
His voice was cold as he warned, “This matter must be kept a secret. There must not be any trace of this in your system.”
The Bureau Chief nodded hurriedly and turned around.
After about 15 minutes, two red certificates with the official seals landed in Jin Yang and Qiu Tong’s hands.
Qiu Tong looked at the special marriage certificate bearing their names and casually stuffed it into her handbag.
Jin Yang nodded and the driver drove towards the villa. He turned his head, revealing his clear jawline as he said in a low voice, “I’ll be staying at the villa for the time being.”
“Fine.”
He thought that the matter had been resolved.
However, as the car drove into the villa district, Jin Yang opened the passenger seat door. The two of them were surprised to see Song Yan standing in the courtyard of the neighboring villa, pushing a lawnmower. He waved at them with a relaxed expression and whistled. “Hi!”
“I didn’t expect you two to get legally married.”
“Does that mean I have to call Qiu Tong my sister-in-law? You guys won’t mind if I move in next door, right?”
Song Yan leaned against the lawnmower and raised an eyebrow at Qiu Tong. “I’ll come by your house for lunch later.”
“I have some bad habits. For example, I can’t control my mouth when I’m hungry.”
“If someone who is about to faint from hunger calls Jin Tao and inadvertently divulges something you want to keep secret, I’m afraid things won’t be good for you.”
Song Yan threatened Jin Yang, who frowned and did not answer.
This was Qiu Tong’s home, and he would let her decide.
No matter what the consequences were, he would find a way to bear and resolve it.
Qiu Tong glanced at Song Yan tiredly. After saying “whatever”, she turned the doorknob and disappeared from sight.
Song Yan walked to Jin Yang’s side and bumped his shoulder against his chest. He gritted his teeth with a dark expression. “I won’t give up so easily.”
“By doing this, you only proved that Qiu Tong is special to you. This will just motivate me more to snatch her away from you!”
“Jin Yang, you wait and see.”
Song Yan pushed the door open and entered.
The children stared at him warily and with hostility. From his clothes, they could tell that the man in front of them was not Jin Yang.
Song Yan did not mind. He went to the kitchen to help Qiu Tong prepare the ingredients for lunch. He grabbed a few vegetables and rinsed them under the tap. Amidst the splashing water, he said casually, “Jin Yang just wants to take revenge on me. He doesn’t really love you and the children.”
“You don’t know, do you? There’s another woman in my brother’s heart.”
“That woman once lived in the official residence for a few years…”
These words echoed in Qiu Tong’s ears. She was slicing potatoes with a knife and she gave a slight jerk. The sharp blade grazed her skin, causing blood to ooze out.
She recalled the few times when Jin Yang was unconscious and severely injured. He had subconsciously muttered some words. Her heart tightened with frustration at the memory.
Seeing that his goal had been achieved, Song Yan returned to the living room and sat beside Qiu Xingyu, who was playing with her toys.
“Little Yu, I’m your real father.”
Song Yan tucked a strand of her hair behind her ear. His tone was alluring.
Qiu Xingyu was so frightened that she widened her eyes and wanted to dodge. Jin Yang threw a punch. Song Yan tilted his head and used his finger to wipe the blood from the corner of his mouth.
“Stay away from them. If I hear those words coming out of your mouth again, I will…”
Song Yan suddenly stood up and stared straight at Jin Yang. He asked menacingly, “You will what?”
“You will banish me?”
Song Yan heard footsteps behind him and quickly wiped his earlier expression from his face. He took the initiative to help Qiu Tong carry the food over. “Don’t be so nervous. I just wanted to have lunch.” His thin lips curled up, and his eyes were filled with innocence, as if he had become a completely different person.
…
In an abandoned factory on the outskirts of the city, Yu Ge was tied to a cement pillar. He was covered in injuries and appeared to be on his final breath.
Dina sat on the cement block. He stared at Yu Ge with a sallow and haggard face. He coughed out two mouthfuls of blood. “Trash!”
“It has been so many days but you failed to bring Qiu Tong over! What’s the use of keeping you?”
“You are just a burden!”
Dina’s subordinate understood the hint in his eyes. He swung a barbed whip at Yu Ge. Yu Ge cried out in pain as his flesh split open. He begged for mercy. “Give me one more chance. I will definitely be able to bring her to you!”
“No need.”
Dina stood up and walked to the mirror. He rubbed his chin with a fierce look. “I don’t have time to wait anymore!”

chapters.title: Chapter 212 - Kidnapping Qiu Tong
chapters.content:
Chapter 212: Kidnapping Qiu Tong
Qiu Tong was sitting on a park bench outside the villa.
Two stray cats rubbed against her ankles and jumped onto Qiu Tong’s lap coquettishly, waiting for her to gently scratch their bellies.
Their adorable expressions gradually relaxed Qiu Tong, and a smile appeared on her face.
Thinking of Jin Yang and Song Yan, who were always arguing with each other at home, Qiu Tong felt a headache coming on. She even regretted making the decision to marry Jin Yang.
Now, not only was the matter not resolved, it had become even more troublesome than before.
It was getting late. Qiu Tong had brought two cans of cat food from the convenience store and she placed them on the ground. She was about to go home when she saw a bent old man in front of her. He stood beside the trash can and rummaged through it with difficulty. In the next second, he suddenly held his head and swayed as he fell to the side of the road.
Qiu Tong frowned and rushed to his side to help him. “Are you alright?”
“Thank you.”
“You’re so kind-hearted!”
The old man coughed twice and grabbed Qiu Tong’s wrist, wanting to stand up. He kept thanking her.
A gust of wind blew past. The plastic bag that the old man had in his hands was blown away. It was empty.
Qiu Tong sensed that he was holding her wrist a bit too tightly and immediately became wary.
Just as she was about to dodge and break free, the old man raised his right hand and took out a syringe. He jabbed it into the back of Qiu Tong’s neck.
The old man raised his head, revealing a pair of familiar and shrewd eyes. He pulled off his mask. “Kind-hearted people often bring trouble upon themselves. It has been a long time since we last met, Qiu Tong. You’re still as stupid and gullible as ever!”
It was Dina! Qiu Tong held her breath, wanting to control the speed at which the chemicals flowed through her body. However, her eyelids gradually closed and she fainted.
Dina pressed a button on his communication device and an ordinary-looking van drove over from afar.
Dina’s men helped carry Qiu Tong to the car and quickly left.
Two hours later, Qiu Tong woke up groggily.
In front of them was a dilapidated abandoned factory. Dina’s men from the terrorist organization were sitting by the bonfire, drinking and eating.
Qiu Tong was tied to a stone pillar in the corner. She tried to struggle but realized that the hemp rope was tightly bound and there was no room for her to move.
Dina realized what she was doing and squatted in front of her with a dagger in his hand. The cold blade lifted her chin and slowly rubbed against her carotid artery.
“We finally meet again.”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and realized that Yu Ge was sitting in the distance covered in blood. Realization dawned upon her. “Did you do all that?”
“Yes.”
Dina admitted as he stood up. He took out two hospital photos and handed them to Qiu Tong.
He pointed at the shadow that had almost spread to the entire lung. “I have lung cancer, but I don’t want to die! I want to find a way to survive…”
“I know you have a solution! You can help me, right?”
Dina’s eyes were bloodshot. In the face of death, he had become very agitated and extreme.
Qiu Tong understood his request and regained her composure. After all, Dina needed her to recover and he would not let her die.
“Is this how you treat me when you want my help?”
A mocking smile appeared on Qiu Tong’s lips as she raised her head to question him. Yu Ge was bandaging his wounds and could not control his resentment when he saw her. He dragged his battered body over to Dina. “Boss, please give me another chance to interrogate her on your behalf!”
“I know Qiu Tong very well. I know how to make her yield and make her willing to treat you.”
Yu Ge’s eyes shone with excitement. Dina’s body needed rest after this ordeal. He waved his hand and gestured for Yu Ge to do it.
Yu Ge revealed a fervent and wicked smile. He rubbed his hands together and approached Qiu Tong with a soft whip in his hand. “You didn’t expect your life to fall into my hands one day, right? Why aren’t you smiling anymore? Are you still hoping that someone will come and save you?”
“Stop dreaming! Accept your fate!”
Yu Ge raised his hand and slapped Qiu Tong hard on the face. Qiu Tong looked up at him, her eyes filled with sympathy and pity. “You are always a dog for others no matter where you go. Dina needs me, but he doesn’t need you…”
“Between you and me, who do you think he will choose?”
“Why don’t we give it a try?”
Qiu Tong licked the blood from the corner of her lips. The smell of blood filled the air. She smiled brightly, her eyes flashing with disdain.
Yu Ge was a little flustered. He wanted to cover Qiu Tong’s mouth, but she rushed to shout, “Dina! I can save you…”
“Come here. Let’s talk terms.”
Joy flashed across Dina’s face. He rushed over to Qiu Tong and pushed Yu Ge away. “What do you want?”
“Let me go and prepare a laboratory counter for me to develop the medicine.”
“Also, tie him up so that I can use him as a lab rat to test the medicine for you!”
Qiu Tong’s finger landed on Yu Ge. Yu Ge trembled in fear and shook his head, sensing the danger. “Don’t listen to her nonsense!”
“Boss, she’s stalling for time. She wants to wait for her companions to save her!”
Yu Ge knelt on the ground, but Qiu Tong was in no rush. She looked straight at Dina, her eyes filled with confidence.

chapters.title: Chapter 213 - Revenge
chapters.content:
Chapter 213: Revenge
“Lung cancer is a disease that is impossible to cure. I have a way to concoct a medicine, but I cannot guarantee its effect.”
“Various side effects will inevitably occur during the process. Some of which might be life-threatening.”
“I am sure you don’t want to gamble with your life, right?”
Qiu Tong convinced Dina with just a few words. She raised her eyebrows and stared at Yu Ge. “I have some past grudges with him. I can vent my anger in this way.”
“You don’t mind, do you?”
Dina narrowed his eyes and gestured for his subordinates to untie Qiu Tong.
Yu Ge sensed that something was wrong. He hurriedly got up and wanted to escape, but he had only taken two steps when he was grabbed by Dina.
Dina’s men tied him to the stone pillar naked. Qiu Tong rubbed her wrists and walked to the counter with a smile when she saw Yu Ge’s pitiful look. Dina prepared all kinds of chemicals according to her request. His eyes were filled with suspicion as he held the pistol and pressed it against Qiu Tong’s temple.
“You better not play any tricks. As long as you can cure me, I promise to release you.”
“I’ll even give you a considerable sum of money.”
As Qiu Tong swirled a vial, she recalled the composition of a poison that could numb the nerves. She slowly concocted it.
She turned to look at Dina. “Of course,” she said, a smile lighting up her features. “I’ll do my best.”
…
In the villa, Jin Yang played a game with Qiu Xingyu. He looked at the clock hanging on the wall uneasily.
It had been nearly three hours since Qiu Tong left the house to throw the trash. At first, Jin Yang thought that she was hiding outside to have some peace and quiet, but now, something felt not quite right.
He calmed the children and said to Song Yan, “Take care of them…”
Jin Yang was wearing a windbreaker as he searched for Qiu Tong. He cupped his hand around his mouth and shouted Qiu Tong’s name, but there was no response.
Two stray cats by a bench meowed when they saw him.
Jin Yang looked at the two cans of cat food and realized that there were signs of an unfamiliar car tire passing near the trash can. He immediately instructed his bodyguards to check the surveillance cameras nearby. When he saw the image of Qiu Tong being kidnapped, he said in a low and murderous voice, “Find this car!”
“Yes.”
The presidential guards immediately left. Jin Yang returned home with a dark expression. Song Yan realized that he was in a bad mood. “What’s wrong?”
“Qiu Tong has been kidnapped.”
Jin Yang walked to a corner of the kitchen with him and whispered to him.
Song Yan frowned and asked about the situation. Jin Yang sent him the surveillance footage. At this moment, the two of them were on the same side and cooperated well.
“This car has a dummy license plate. There’s no way to find and track it based on the license plate number.”
“If your presidential guards contact the relevant departments about this, they will cause too much commotion. People at the capital will be alerted. Leave this to me…”
“I’ll find her.”
With that, Song Yan rushed out the door. Jin Yang looked at his back profile, his heart filled with indescribable complicated emotions.
Qiu Xingyuan heard the loud sound of the door closing. He looked at Jin Yang’s slightly grave expression and asked in confusion, “What’s wrong?”
Jin Yang forced a smile and sat beside them. He tried his best to speak in a gentle tone, “We had some conflict. Don’t worry.”
…
In the abandoned factory, Qiu Tong shook the pink test tube and used the syringe to extract the liquid. She slowly walked towards Yu Ge.
Yu Ge was so afraid that he twisted his body. He resisted and tried to break free. The skin on his wrist was grinded by a rough hemp rope, cutting into his flesh.
Dina ordered his subordinates to hold him down and let Qiu Tong inject the liquid into Yu Ge’s body.
A few seconds later, Yu Ge collapsed to the ground, twitching. He rolled his eyes and foamed at the mouth. His tragic appearance frightened the surrounding people.
Dina pointed his pistol at Qiu Tong. “You tricked me!”
“Maybe there’s a problem with the ratio. I’ll continue…”
Qiu Tong returned to the counter and frowned secretly. She wondered why Jin Yang and Song Yan had not found this place yet. Would she really have to use her supernatural power to save Dina? At the thought of this, Qiu Tong’s hands trembled and she spilled two drops of the medicine on the ground.
White smoke rose from the cement ground. Dina ordered his subordinates to subdue Qiu Tong.
“Tell me the formula, I’ll get someone else to concoct it!”
Dina was completely restraining Qiu Tong’s freedom now. She had no choice but to fabricate a formula and try to stall for time.
…
Beep beep—
There was a text message on Jin Yang’s phone. It was from Song Yan. “Found her.”
He immediately left the villa and arranged for Ke Le and the other mercenaries to take care of the children. They drove to the abandoned factory.
The guards who had gone in advance to scout the situation first reported the status quo to them. “More than 20 terrorists led by Dina are in the factory. They rotate the guards outside every 10 minutes. It’s difficult to approach.”
“We have no way of figuring out the terrain inside and where Miss Qiu is.”
“If we attack rashly, we might accidentally injure her. Mr. President, please instruct us…”
Song Yan looked at the sky and said in an extremely cold voice, “If we delay any longer, it will probably be even more difficult when it gets dark!”

chapters.title: Chapter 214 - Factory Explosion
chapters.content:
Chapter 214: Factory Explosion
With an anxious expression, Jin Yang climbed to an advantageous spot with his bare hands. He took out a short-range telescope and surveyed the location. He discovered that there were two windows on the dilapidated red brick wall. He recalled the light signal Qiu Tong had used at home when she was playing with the children. He turned around and asked the guard beside him, “Do you have a mirror?”
The guard was taken aback but he quickly found a square mirror.
Jin Yang slowly adjusted the angle of the light. He focused the light on the window and used Qiu Tong’s secret signal to communicate with the interior…
Qiu Tong leaned against the stone pillar and was elated to see the shimmering light on the opposite wall.
She understood the message Jin Yang was trying to convey. She looked at Dina and said loudly, “I want to go to the bathroom!”
Dina was focused on pressing his subordinate to concoct the medicine according to Qiu Tong’s formula. He waved his hand and gestured for his other men to bring her to a corner.
Qiu Tong’s hands were tied with hemp rope. She hid in a safe corner and quietly counted down.
Three, two, one… with the violent sounds of explosives being thrown in, two groups of presidential guards attacked from outside.
The terrorists dodged in panic. Dina was the first to react. He rushed to Qiu Tong’s side and grabbed her neck. He said ruthlessly, “I underestimated you! I didn’t expect you to be able to contact the outside world and find us here!”
“If you surrender now, I can plead with them to spare your life.”
Qiu Tong saw Dina’s bloodshot eyes. He was now forced to the brink of death and had a desperate do-or-die attitude. She hurriedly tried to calm him.
Dina snorted.
“Surrender? And return to prison? I have lung cancer and won’t be able to live for long!”
“The doctors in the prison are all useless. Since I’m going to die, why don’t I drag a few people along with me!”
Dina lowered his head and pointed the gun at Qiu Tong. He chuckled and whispered into her ear, “With you accompanying me to my grave, I won’t be lonely on the road to hell!”
“Qiu Tong!”
Jin Yang barged in with his team. He shouted loudly when he saw Dina and Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong met his gaze and stepped down firmly on Dina’s foot. She dodged to the side.
Dina raised his hand to grab her, but Jin Yang shot him in the elbow and ankle.
Bang!
Dina fell to the ground. Jin Yang ran to Qiu Tong’s side and helped her up. He asked anxiously, “Are you alright?”
Qiu Tong nodded. The terrorists were fighting for their lives. The situation in the abandoned factory was dangerous.
The presidential guards managed to subdue most of the terrorists. Jin Yang indicated that they could escort the prisoners back. As Qiu Tong had sprained her ankle while escaping, she could only slowly walk towards the door with Jin Yang’s help. “Where are the children?”
Jin Yang comforted her softly. “Ke Le is taking care of them. They don’t know what happened here.”
Qiu Tong heaved a sigh of relief, but she suddenly heard the sound of a ring being pulled from behind. She stopped in her tracks and turned around. She saw Dina standing in the corner, holding two hand grenades and two boxes of explosives beside his feet. “Since I am going to die, you are all coming along with me!”
Jin Yang didn’t expect there to be so many weapons and equipment here. They were still 20 meters away from the door and it would be too late to escape.
“Get down!”
Jin Yang raised his hand and covered Qiu Tong’s head, before enveloping her in his arms.
Boom—
Flames surged several meters high in the abandoned factory. The red brick wall collapsed, turning the scene into a sea of fire.
Qiu Tong felt a warm liquid flowing down her forehead. She opened her eyes in a daze and saw Jin Yang smiling at her. He said softly, “As long as you’re safe!”
Qiu Tong felt her chest tighten, and the smell of gunpowder filled the air.
She saw many guards running towards them through the flames. “President…”
Jin Yang held her hand tightly and muttered, “You’re not allowed to die!”
Qiu Tong fainted.
Qiu Tong seemed to have had a very long dream. In the dream, there was a blurry figure holding her hand, but she could not see that person’s face.
There were the sounds of children crying around her. Qiu Tong felt as if there were two beams of light swaying in front of her eyes, dazzling and harsh.
“Can the patient hear me? Follow the light and move your eyes.”
Qiu Tong gradually woke up and saw the white coat and the children standing by the bed, as well as Song Yan.
She wanted to speak, but she felt a sharp pain in her throat, as if countless hands were tearing at her vocal cords.
The doctor turned to Song Yan and said, “The patient’s life is not in danger. She just needs to rest well.”
Song Yan nodded and sent him off. Qiu Xingyu rushed to the bed and held Qiu Tong’s hand with red eyes. “Mommy, is it very painful? Don’t do such dangerous things anymore, okay?”
Qiu Xingqiao wiped his snot with the back of his hand and tugged at Little Yu’s hand. “Sister, you are pressing down on her IV line.”
Qiu Tong raised her hand and rubbed the top of Little Yu’s head with a comforting smile.
Her gaze landed on Song Yan as she asked slowly, “What about him?”

chapters.title: Chapter 215 - Applying Ointment
chapters.content:
Chapter 215: Applying Ointment
The atmosphere in the ward became heavy and silent because of Qiu Tong’s question.
Song Yan leaned against the door frame and shook his head with one hand in his pocket. He did not answer.
Qiu Xingyu pursed her lips and the tears that she had just suppressed flowed down again. She said in a daze, “Uncle Jin Yang wanted to save Mommy and he protected you with his body. The explosion was especially intense, and when he arrived at the hospital…”
Qiu Tong gripped the bedsheet nervously, but Little Yu couldn’t continue. She hugged Qiu Xingqiao and wailed.
Everyone’s expression seemed to say that Jin Yang had died to save her.
Qiu Tong gave a sad chuckle. Images of her interacting with Jin Yang flashed across her mind. She clearly remembered Jin Yang’s last words to her in the fire.
She pulled out her IV and blood flowed out.
Qiu Tong ignored the pain and got up. Song Yan and Qiu Xingyuan wanted to grab her. They looked like they were saying something.
But to Qiu Tong, they appeared to be moving in slow motion. The world seemed to have become static. She staggered to the door of the ward.
Even if Jin Yang died, she had to see him one last time…
Qiu Tong was about to step through the door when she tripped over the threshold and fell.
Shrill cries rang out from behind her. Song Yan raised his hand, wanting to grab her elbow.
In the next second, Qiu Tong fell into a familiar embrace. She slowly raised her head and saw Jin Yang’s face in the light. She instinctively lifted her hand to caress his statue-like face, muttering softly, “You’re not dead?”
“Wonderful.”
Jin Yang looked at Song Yan and the children in confusion. He held Qiu Tong’s waist firmly so that she could stand firm.
Song Yan shrugged and glanced to the side indifferently. He grabbed an orange from a fruit basket on the bedside table and said, “She wanted to find you. She probably thought you died trying to save her. Now she thinks she saw a ghost.” Song Yan’s tone was harsh, but Jin Yang understood the situation.
He looked down gently at Qiu Tong and pointed at the bandage wrapped around his shoulder. “I’m fine.”
“Shards from the explosion pierced my arms and back. It was a little tricky, but not life-threatening.”
“But if you keep pressing on my wound like this, I’m afraid it will worsen my pain and I will take longer to recover.”
Jin Yang was trying to make a joke. Qiu Tong slowly regained her senses and everything around her finally returned to normal.
She frowned and glared at the children, blaming them for their exaggerated descriptions.
Qiu Xingyuan shielded Little Yu behind him and defended her, “You didn’t finish listening to Little Yu’s whole story. You were too agitated.”
The presidential guards wiped out the terrorist organization led by Dina. Yu Ge and the rest were imprisoned again.
Qiu Tong was unwilling to stay in the hospital to recuperate, so she returned to the villa with Jin Yang.
At night, Qiu Tong was a little worried about Jin Yang’s injuries. She quietly went to the guest room next door and knocked.
The door opened. Jin Yang had a towel wrapped around his waist, revealing his well-defined abs. He wiped his wet hair and did not look embarrassed or surprised. Instead, he pointed at the ointment on the tray. “Can you help me?”
“I can’t apply medicine to the wound behind.”
Jin Yang turned around. Qiu Tong saw the wound on his back. The bomb fragments had pierced his body. Although the wound had been cleaned, it was still terrible to look at.
Qiu Tong nodded and walked to his side. Jin Yang sat with his back facing her in front of the mirror. The atmosphere in the room was thick and ambiguous.
“Gasp…”
Qiu Tong dabbed some cold ointment on Jin Yang’s back. He gasped and his muscles tensed.
Jin Yang endured the pain with all his might, veins bulging on his arms.
Qiu Tong suddenly felt a little hot and uneasy. She tried her best to focus on putting ointment on Jin Yang’s wound.
After applying the medicine on Jin Yang’s wound, Qiu Tong slowly squatted down, her gaze landing on the “tent” that had popped up under his towel.
Jin Yang was a little embarrassed. He said in a hoarse voice, “I can do the rest myself.”
“Let me help you.”
Qiu Tong’s ears were flushed red as she gripped the ointment.
Jin Yang tried to take the medicine from her hand. In the scuffle, they ended up dislodging the towel around his waist…
Qiu Tong saw Jin Yang’s erection and panicked. She wanted to leave, but her toes bumped into the corner of the closet.
The excruciating pain made her lose her balance and she fell onto Jin Yang’s lap.
Qiu Tong’s perky butt landed on his burning erection. She wanted to stand up, but her hips rubbed against it. Jin Yang’s eyes darkened as he hugged her waist and pressed her down slightly. His erection rubbed against her butt cheeks. “In the hospital, you were very worried about me, right?”
Jin Yang whispered hoarsely into her ear, causing Qiu Tong to tremble.
“You have me in your heart, right?”
Jin Yang opened his mouth to suck on Qiu Tong’s ear lobe. He used his slender fingers to pick up the loose hair at Qiu Tong’s temple and tucked it behind her ear.
Qiu Tong did not resist his touch. Sensing the change in her body language, Jin Yang picked her up and threw her onto the bed, before leaning over to press her down!

chapters.title: Chapter 216 - Sudden Return To The Capital
chapters.content:
Chapter 216: Sudden Return To The Capital
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
On the soft bed in the bedroom, the bodies of a man and a woman were entangled together, both breathing out hot air.
Jin Yang held her neck and ran his fingers through her hair. He gently held the back of Qiu Tong’s head and kissed her lips.
He slowly unbuttoned her shirt, his palm pressed against her chest as his thin lips sucked on her collarbone.
Qiu Tong found it ticklish and tried to move away, but Jin Yang didn’t give her a chance.
Jin Yang’s kiss gradually moved down, his short and messy hair brushing against her chest.
In the quiet atmosphere, there was only the sound of their panting as they teased each other.
Jin Yang took a deep breath and tried his best to suppress the urge to grope her hard. He pulled Qiu Tong’s shirt down and buried his face in her neck. “Can I?” But even as he waited for Qiu Tong to agree, his hand was already naughtily reaching into her skirt. He found her sweet spot and pressed it with his fingertips.
Qiu Tong frowned as she somewhat lost control of her emotions from his teasing.
She could feel her body heat up and turn soft and pliable.
Qiu Tong had no energy to think and could only nod in agreement.
With permission, Jin Yang kissed her soft chest, pressing his palm against her lower abdomen and rubbing her buttocks.
Taking advantage of Qiu Tong’s daze, he went straight for her sweet spot.
Qiu Tong could no longer think. She moaned coquettishly.
Jin Yang’s voice was hoarse and his eyes were filled with affection as he lifted her legs and wrapped them around his waist. “Shh, lower your voice.”
“You are pressing in so tight. Let go a little. I can’t move.”
Jin Yang felt his scalp go numb. Qiu Tong trembled and gripped his head as if she wanted to squeeze him dry.
Qiu Tong gasped. She grunted as she grabbed Jin Yang’s back muscles, leaving scratches on his body.
“Can you slow down?”
Qiu Tong complained coquettishly. Jin Yang had no intention of stopping, he planned to make her go limp.
Every time he ventured into the deepest part of her body, Jin Yang would deliberately rub against her.
Finally, Qiu Tong’s panting became hoarse and short and she squeezed her legs tightly together. The two of them were on cloud nine as their bodies were drenched in sweat.
…
The next morning, Qiu Tong woke up aching and exhausted. She saw the man beside her pillow. She picked up the clothes that were scattered all over the floor and quietly left the bedroom.
Qiu Xingyu and Qiu Xingyuan were going to Qiu Tong’s room to look for her, but they bumped into Qiu Tong coming out of the guest room.
Qiu Tong awkwardly used a towel to cover the hickey on her neck.
Qiu Xingyu looked up at her in confusion. “Why did Mommy come out of Uncle Jin Yang’s room?”
“Are there mosquitoes at home? Mommy seems to have been bitten. I’ll find you some ointment!”
Little Yu turned around and ran to the living room to rummage through the first aid kit.
Qiu Tong did not know how to explain. Qiu Xingyuan frowned in understanding and walked to Little Yu’s side. “It’s not a mosquito.”
Qiu Xingyu stood up in a daze. She stared at Jin Yang’s room for a long time before suddenly tugging at Qiu Xingyuan’s sleeve excitedly.
“Elder Brother, will Uncle Jin Yang really become our father in the future?”
“We’ll have a Daddy from now on, right?”
Qiu Xingyuan narrowed his eyes and did not answer. He had seen Jin Yang’s care and concern for Qiu Tong in the hospital, but he still could not be sure if he was sincere.
This guy still had a long probation period ahead of him!
In the bedroom, Jin Yang opened his eyes the moment Qiu Tong left. He used his finger to poke his forehead and sat up.
Sunlight scattered across the bed and floor. He closed his eyes in silence, recalling the dream from last night.
In his dream, there seemed to be a woman beside him. They were in love.
This dream, which had troubled him for many years, was always very realistic. But Jin Yang never managed to see the woman’s face clearly! He recalled Qiu Tong’s appearance under his body last night and he felt very conflicted.
The phone on the bedside table buzzed, breaking Jin Yang’s train of thought and his gloominess.
When Shao An heard that the call was connected, he was so excited that he nearly knelt down. He said bluntly, “Sir, the old Mr. Jin has already called countless times to urge you to return to your old home. I can’t make any more excuses for you.”
“He’s already suspicious. If you still can’t return this weekend, I’m afraid…”
Shao An informed Jin Yang of the worst-case scenario. Jin Yang was silent for a moment. “Help me book the earliest flight back to the capital.”
After hanging up the phone, Jin Yang picked up his shirt from the ground and stood in front of the full-length mirror. He looked at the scratches on his back and chest, before frowning. Qiu Tong knocked on the door and said, “It’s time for breakfast.”
Jin Yang opened the door and locked it before walking into the dining room.
Qiu Xingyuan held his bowl and observed the subtle tension between the two of them. He narrowed his eyes and deliberately probed, “Why didn’t Uncle Song come today? Mommy knows that he doesn’t eat ginger and made a special bowl for him.”
Jin Yang looked at the rice pot in the kitchen with a normal expression.
Qiu Tong frowned, confused by Qiu Xingyuan’s sudden words.
Jin Yang picked up his food and said softly, “I’m going back to the capital.”
“Call me if you encounter anything…”
Jin Yang passed her his private number that could be reached 24/7. Qiu Tong suddenly felt that the food in her mouth had become tasteless.. But she still nodded and accepted it.

chapters.title: Chapter 217 - Disparity In Status
chapters.content:
Chapter 217: Disparity In Status
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
At noon, in the garden of the villa.
Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu were building a wooden castle in the sandbox.
Qiu Tong sat on the bench and watched them quietly. From time to time, she would glance down at her phone.
She pressed the bright screen and opened her chat with Jin Yang. Her fingertips touched the screen and she typed a line of text. She didn’t press the send button for a long time. When the screen turned dark, Qiu Tong saw her own face reflected on the dark screen. She lowered her eyes.
Song Yan came from the villa next door. He crossed his arms lazily and leaned against the tree, watching her movements.
“With Jin Yang’s status, he cannot be with a civilian.”
“As the president, he has no say in choosing his wife and future partner.”
“I advise you to clear your mind of such thoughts as soon as possible. I can totally take care of the children and you. I can give you the same life, and perhaps even more warmth…”
Song Yan’s teasing words allowed Qiu Tong to regain her senses. She kept her phone and returned to her room.
Outside the house, Song Yan squatted beside Little Yu in an attempt to form a good relationship with the children. However, Qiu Xingyuan held his sister’s hand and left with her, as if he was avoiding a bad person.
Song Yan touched the tip of his nose and smiled. He self-deprecatingly finished building the half-completed sandcastle that Qiu Xingyuan and Little Yu had abandoned.
…
Meanwhile, Lin Shan was standing in front of Shu Xian’s house. She had pressed the doorbell countless times, but no one answered.
It was only when the surrounding neighbors complained about the disturbance that Shu Xian’s nanny pushed open the door. She looked at Lin Shan with a troubled expression and said, “Miss Lin, Mr. Shu is not at home.”
“He’s out on a business trip because of the factory. If you want to see him, come back in a few days!”
Lin Shan refused to believe it and wanted to charge in, but the burly nanny blocked the entrance.
“Let me in, Shu Xian must be inside! Why is he hiding from me? Qiu Tong was behind the factory incident. She colluded with Mayor Shen to snatch all the credit for exterminating locusts. It has nothing to do with me!”
Lin Shan had not seen Shu Xian for several days. Many of her bank cards and credit cards had been blocked.
This meant that Shu Xian was angry with her and wanted to abandon her.
Lin Shan tugged at the nanny as if she was clutching at a life-saving straw. She clasped her hands together and pointed inside. “Let me in. I can explain everything to Shu Xian! When we reconcile, I will think of a way to repay you…”
The nanny’s expression changed several times. She looked back at the spiral staircase in the villa and shook her head.
“Miss Lin, if you want to look for Mr. Shu, you should call him. He will see that you called.”
The nanny pushed Lin Shan hard and closed the door with a bang.
Lin Shan fell down outside the door. Her clothes were tattered and her eyes were filled with hatred as she muttered, “Qiu Tong, it’s all because of you!”
“You’re the one who turned me into this. Even if I die, I’ll drag you along!”
Lin Shan gritted her teeth and looked up at the window on the second floor of the villa. She took out her phone and dialed a voice message. “Shu Xian, I know you’re unwilling to accept this outcome. We still have a chance of connecting to the government. That piece of land has not been distributed yet!”
“I know that Qiu Tong has a protective medicine in her hands. As long as you can get it and place it on the factory’s assembly line…”
“Not only can we earn money, we will also be rewarded by the government.”
“Contact me if you’re interested.”
With her bag slung over her shoulder, Lin Shan left the villa district with determined steps. She was certain that Shu Xian would definitely contact her.
After all, a businessman’s nature was to seek profits!
Late at night, a private plane landed. Shao An personally drove over to welcome Jin Yang.
Tears welled up in his eyes when he saw Jin Yang walking down the staircase.
Jin Yang frowned in disdain at his dramatic behavior and kept a distance from him. “How’s the situation in the official residence?”
Shao An straightened his back and saluted. He held the steering wheel and reported to him.
Jin Yang sat in the back seat and looked at his phone. He had not received any messages. He felt an indescribable sense of loss. He hesitantly typed a few lines, deleted and then wrote without sending. Shao An looked at his actions through the rearview mirror and reminded him, “Old Mr. Jin has been sending people to the official residence very frequently in recent times. I used the excuse that it’s an inconvenient time for you to reject their requests to meet you.”
“Well done.”
Jin Yang nodded. Shao An asked hesitantly, “Do you want to return to your old home?”
Jin Yang narrowed his eyes and leaned back in the backseat tiredly. He shook his head and refused, “No, let’s return to the official residence.”
There were too many things in the capital that he needed to settle and resolve. Meanwhile, that text message was ultimately stored in his draft box and not sent out.
Under the full moon, Qiu Tong and Jin Yang missed each other, but no one dared to take that first step.
Jin Yang returned to the official residence and the butler came out to welcome him. He took Jin Yang’s jacket and watched him walk to the second floor.
As Jin Yang’s hand gripped the stair’s handrail, he stopped in his tracks as if he had remembered something.
He turned to the butler and asked, “Do you… remember a woman who often wears a white dress?”
The butler was stunned and did not answer.
Jin Yang frowned and waved his hand. “Forget it. Pretend I didn’t ask..”

chapters.title: Chapter 218 - The Kindergarten Follows
chapters.content:
Chapter 218: The Kindergarten Follows
At the Shu family’s residence, there was a constant moaning sound in the bedroom.
Lin Shan was lying in Shu Xian’s arms, enjoying herself. She reached out a finger smeared with bright red carapace oil and gently lifted Shu Xian’s chin, her gaze seductive.
After the matter was settled, Shu Xian lit his cigar and leaned against the headboard. Lin Shan took the initiative to lean against his chest, her fingertips drawing circles on his chest.
“How did you know that Qiu Tong has a protective medicine?”
Shu Xian’s eyes glinted as he patted Lin Shan’s butt and asked. He had obviously heard that message and felt that she was useful.
Lin Shan understood Shu Xian’s thoughts and replied sweetly, “I overheard it.”
“The children of the Qiu family are all very powerful people. Her eldest son specializes in developing drugs. The locust pesticide was an example.”
“But Qiu Tong has a grudge against us. It’s impossible to buy the protective medicine formula from her.”
Lin Shan narrowed her eyes, her tone provocative. Her palm slowly slid down and landed between Shu Xian’s legs.
“Why don’t you arrange for some men to go to the kindergarten and hold the children? As long as we can hold them, Qiu Tong will definitely be obedient.”
“When the time comes, our factory can be upgraded and replaced. We will definitely be able to earn more money!”
Lin Shan said softly with her red lips. She climbed onto Shu Xian’s body and pressed her soft chest against him.
Shu Xian’s eyes were filled with lust. He pressed Lin Shan down and rode her, imagining the beautiful future.
…
In the kindergarten, Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu carried their school bags as they bid farewell to the teacher.
Ke Le followed closely behind them, keeping in mind his status as a bodyguard.
Little Yu saw her friends at the playground and she ran over to play with them. Ke Le sped up to keep near.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao sat on a bench under the shade of a tree. Qiu Xingyuan narrowed his eyes and pretended to rummage through the textbooks in his school bag. He used his peripheral vision to glance at the few sneaky figures hiding behind the trees. “Someone is following us.”
“Ah? Where?”
Qiu Xingqiao was rash and wanted to look around. Qiu Xingyuan quickly kicked his calf to warn him. “Nine o’clock direction. Don’t let them realize that we spotted them! They have been following us since the entrance of the kindergarten. They must have planned this.”
Qiu Xingqiao thought of the recent television news that reported on child trafficking. He frowned and straightened his back, his expression tense and stiff.
“Could it be human traffickers?”
Qiu Xingyuan shook his head. He hid a mirror in the middle of the page and carefully adjusted the angle until he could clearly see the faces of the two people.
“If it’s a trafficking gang, they will definitely target a child who’s alone.”
“Uncle Ke Le is always by our side. They have no chance to attack. The only possibility is that they are here specifically for us!”
Qiu Xingqiao recalled the kidnapping incident at the hospital. He clenched his fists and asked, “What should we do?”
Qiu Xingyuan looked at Ke Le and gestured with his finger at him.
Ke Le was an elite mercenary. He immediately understood Qiu Xingyuan’s intentions.
He picked up Little Yu and left the playground.
Qiu Xingyuan slowly tidied his school bag, before taking out two bags of powder and secretly stuffing them into Qiu Xingqiao’s palm. He deliberately put on an anxious expression and raised his voice to a high pitch. “Let’s go home quickly!”
When the gangsters hired by Shu Xian saw that the two of them were alone, they looked at each other with joy on their faces.
They hurriedly chased after Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao. They walked to a quiet and deserted alley. The gangsters wanted to make a move as they saw the favorable terrain.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao stopped in their tracks in unison. They turned around and sprinkled powder on the two people who were approaching.
The gangsters were not prepared. As the powder drifted into their eyes, they felt a sharp pain. Their tears kept flowing as they blindly tried to catch the children.
Qiu Xingqiao kept silent. Taking advantage of the situation, he lifted his leg and kicked the gangster’s lower abdomen.
Qiu Xingyuan took out a hemp rope and wanted to tie the gangster up.
Ke Le ran over from afar, wanting to control the two of them. Seeing that the situation was not looking good, the gangsters could not be bothered to capture the children anymore. They fled in a panic. Ke Le wanted to chase after them, but Qiu Xingyuan raised his hand to stop him. “They are very weak. They are not the same group of people who tried to kidnap us last time.”
“Little Yu is frightened. Let’s go back.”
Ke Le nodded and looked at Qiu Xingyu’s confused expression. He hugged her.
Qiu Xingyuan looked in the direction where the gangsters had fled, confusion and suspicion flashing across his eyes.
After returning to the villa, Qiu Tong heard from them about the danger they encountered today. She instantly became very anxious.
She thought of all the people who could be responsible, even Song Yan, but eventually eliminated the possibility that it was any of them.
“Mommy, it’s alright. We can protect ourselves!”
Qiu Xingqiao saw that she was frowning and comforted her. Qiu Xingyuan’s expression was awkward. He pursed his thin lips and said in a very low voice, “We’re not children. You don’t have to worry about us all the time. You should think about your own matters.”
Qiu Tong was surprised. She did not think that she would ever hear Qiu Xingyuan nagging at her…

chapters.title: Chapter 219 - Dark Web Mission Accepted
chapters.content:
Chapter 219: Dark Web Mission Accepted
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
As night fell, the lights in the villa went out one by one. Only the lights in Qiu Tong’s room were still on.
In the dim light, Qiu Tong sat in front of the computer and pondered. The multiple abduction attempts on the children meant that their surroundings were not safe!
She picked up her phone and stared at the blank chat window for two seconds before slamming the phone onto the table.
Jin Yang and her only had a marriage of convenience.
The matters of the Qiu family had nothing to do with him. Qiu Tong reminded herself not to rely on him too much.
Qiu Xingyu had put a family photo carefully in a frame and placed it on the computer table.
Qiu Tong’s gaze landed on it. She picked it up and examined it. Her heart stirred.
The Qiu Rong in the photo frame was full of energy, while the Qiu Rong she saw in the prison some time ago was so worn out that the hair at his temples had turned white.
The warden had told her that she could spend money to reduce his sentence. For every five million dollars, she could reduce the sentence by a year!
Qiu Tong opened the Dark Web with furrowed brows. She selected suitable missions according to the remuneration. She was preparing to bring Qiu Rong back…
There were fake missions mixed into the real missions listed on the Dark Web. Qiu Tong saw that the highest-paying mission was to protect a person of interest over two weeks. The remuneration was three million! She was tempted and memorized the contact method. It was late into the night when she dialed the number.
The phone rang for nearly half a minute. Just as Qiu Tong thought that the mission was a fake, the call finally connected.
“Hello? Are you hiring over the Dark Web?”
Qiu Tong asked coldly. On the other hand, the voice on the other end sounded abashed. “That’s right, I’ll give you the address. Come see me tomorrow!”
The other party hung up after saying that. Qiu Tong looked at the address she received with a blank expression.
Could this be an especially dangerous mission?
The next morning, Qiu Tong prepared breakfast for the children and specially changed into a polished outfit.
Qiu Xingyuan came out of the bedroom in his pajamas and looked at her.
Qiu Xingyu rubbed her sleepy eyes and ran out. She threw herself into Qiu Tong’s arms coquettishly. Seeing her with light makeup on, which was a rare sight, she asked, “Is Mommy going out on a date? Is Uncle Jin Yang back?”
Jin Yang did have some ability. He could win over the hearts of the three Qiu siblings in such a short period of time!
Qiu Tong patted the top of Little Yu’s head and said casually, “Mommy is interviewing for a job to earn money to support the family!”
“Little Yu, why don’t you wish Mommy the best for her interview! That I can successfully get this job…”
When Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao heard that, they put down their chopsticks. Qiu Tong was surprised by their worried and heavy expressions.
Qiu Xingqiao said seriously, “We can lower our living standards.”
“I’ve also developed a medicine recently. We should be able to earn some money from selling the patent. It can supplement the household income.”
Qiu Tong looked at the children’s worried expressions and tried to placate them. She got Ke Le to escort them to the kindergarten while she rushed over to the address, which was a research institute.
She reported her name to the security guard at the door and entered a heavily guarded laboratory building with a pass.
Three million for a bodyguard?
Qiu Tong wondered if all university professors were so rich now.
Qiu Tong pushed the door open and saw an old professor sitting behind the desk. He was a little surprised to see that the applicant was a woman, but he still maintained his gentlemanly manner and pointed at the opposite seat, indicating for her to sit.
The old professor pushed up his glasses and introduced himself, “My surname is Dong.”
“Recently, a group of foreign evil forces has infiltrated our city. They want to kidnap me. I have a bounty on my head so I went to the Dark Web to hire someone to protect me. You are a young lady and you look… I’m afraid you don’t meet my requirements. Sorry.”
Qiu Tong saw that he wanted to reject her and suggested, “You must have some bodyguards by your side now. Why don’t we have a competition before we decide?”
Professor Dong narrowed his eyes at her confident look and gestured for his bodyguards to spar with her.
Qiu Tong glanced at them from the corner of her eye and threw a quick punch, immediately knocking down one of them. Taking advantage of their surprise, she bent down and swept out one leg, bringing the rest of the bodyguards to the ground. The entire process only took three seconds.
Professor Dong was so shocked that his jaw dropped. He immediately signed the contract with Qiu Tong and paid half the fee as a deposit.
“Why do the foreign evil forces want to kidnap you?”
Qiu Tong looked at Professor Dong’s troubled expression and shrugged. “You can choose not to tell me if you want to keep this a secret.”
Professor Dong had already signed a confidentiality agreement with Qiu Tong, so he naturally trusted her.
“Come with me…”
Professor Dong gently rotated the pen holder on his desk. A secret door suddenly opened in the office.
Qiu Tong did not expect the university laboratory building to have such a mechanism. She followed Professor Dong in and saw several huge glass enclosures in the small space. They contained human specimens! On a laboratory counter, which was suffused with a blue light, were a few human organs and some white mice for testing.
Boom—
A loud noise came from a metal cage in the corner. Qiu Tong turned around and saw a faint glow radiating from the darkness.. It was a pair of green eyes!

chapters.title: Chapter 220 - Accusation
chapters.content:
Chapter 220: Accusation
Professor Dong turned on the light. The black chimpanzee in the cage slammed against the bars and growled.
Qiu Tong maintained her composure. Professor Dong seemed very satisfied with her reaction. “Have you heard of the human modification plan?”
He walked to a whiteboard filled with chemical equations and wiped away equations with an eraser.
Qiu Tong frowned and shook her head. “No.”
“Simply put, we are looking for a way to raise the limits of mankind and create a perfect human being…”
Professor Dong’s eyes were filled with fervor as he spoke, but Qiu Tong did not understand.
The development of humans had to conform to the laws of nature. If they relied on drugs and external forces, it was very likely that they would create dangerous creatures. Qiu Tong thought of the post-apocalyptic zombie riot and swallowed the words that were about to come out of her mouth. She did not give her opinion.
Professor Dong flipped through a thick stack of documents. He held up two bottles of chemicals excitedly and drew them into a syringe.
“The government had arranged for other scientists to lead this project, but they were incompetent and gave up halfway.”
“I am taking over the research now. I’ve found a better approach. I don’t know who spread the news, but it attracted the attention of those evil foreign forces. They are also very interested in the human modification plan, so I need you to protect me!”
“Until I successfully developed the formula…”
Professor Dong walked over to the chimpanzee with the syringe. He injected the liquid into its body. The chimpanzee’s face twisted as if it was in great pain.
Qiu Tong frowned and wanted to stop him, but then the chimpanzee quickly calmed down and looked at her with a sad expression.
Professor Dong took out a piece of paper and wrote down an equation and some numbers. He showed it to the chimpanzee who was able to choose the right answer!
“Did you see that? This is my result!”
Professor Dong looked back at Qiu Tong with a fervent expression. Qiu Tong just nodded perfunctorily.
It was evening when the two of them came out of the secret room. Qiu Tong drove Professor Dong home.
Outside the high-end apartment complex, Professor Dong suddenly heard rustling sounds from the bushes. He hurriedly pulled Qiu Tong to his side. Qiu Tong was annoyed by his actions, but she told herself that Professor Dong had already paid her deposit and she could not attack her employer.
She had no choice but to crawl along the bushes, only to see two stray cats hiding inside. “Don’t worry, I will ensure your safety.”
Professor Dong nodded and tidied his jacket before ringing the doorbell.
Qiu Tong watched him enter his house. She fiddled with her curly hair as she stood by the roadside to hail a taxi. She did not know that someone had secretly taken a picture of her and Professor Dong!
Lin Shan’s red lips curled up as she took the photo with her phone.
Anyone who saw this would mistakenly think that Qiu Tong and Professor Dong were having an affair!
She wanted to see how Qiu Tong would explain herself this time!
Lin Shan had made up her mind to cause trouble for Qiu Tong. She found information about Professor Dong online and hired a private investigator to dig out his wife’s phone number. She then sent those photos over…
“Qiu Tong, you always bring me trouble. Now, you can have a taste of what it is like to be accused of being a third party!”
…
It was the weekend. Professor Dong sent a message to Qiu Tong last night saying that she would not be needed today.
Qiu Tong was glad to be free. She busied herself in the kitchen, wanting to cook up some nutritional delicacies for the three children.
Ding dong—
The doorbell rang. Qiu Xingyu put down her toy and ran over to open the door.
A middle-aged woman wearing a heavy pearl necklace angrily pushed her aside and strode into the house!
Qiu Xingyu lost her balance and bumped hard against the shoe cabinet. She cried out in pain.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao hurried over. They stared at the middle-aged woman and asked warily, “Who are you?”
“What are you doing at our house?”
The middle-aged woman looked at the three children and shouted loudly, “Where’s Qiu Tong? Come out and see me!”
“You’re already a mother, but you still went out to steal my husband! Do you have no shame? Since you have the cheek to do it, you should dare to admit it!”
The middle-aged woman suddenly pushed the children away. Qiu Xingqiao could not bear hearing such insults about Qiu Tong, so he opened his mouth and bit her arm.
“Aiyo! No surprise that a mother like her would raise this kind of child!”
“Are you born in the year of the dog?”
The middle-aged woman was in pain from the bite. She raised her hand to slap Qiu Xingqiao, but Qiu Tong ran out of the kitchen and grabbed her elbow.
The door to the villa was open, and the commotion had already attracted some onlookers.
Qiu Tong recognized that she was Professor Dong’s wife and tried her best to explain in a calm tone, “Perhaps there’s some misunderstanding between us, I can explain.”
“But you can’t just insult my children and physically attack them!”
Qiu Tong shielded the children behind her as she stated this in a cold voice.
With a chilly smile, Madam Dong took out the photo from her handbag and threw it in front of Qiu Tong. “I have evidence!”

chapters.title: Chapter 221 - Evil Foreign Forces
chapters.content:
Chapter 221: Evil Foreign Forces
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong’s profile and Professor Dong’s back were vaguely visible in the photo, but the light was dim and blurry, making it impossible to determine if there was indeed an ambiguous relationship between Qiu Tong and Professor Dong.
Mrs. Dong glared as she distributed copies of the photos to the surrounding neighbors. She shouted, “Who would believe that a woman without a job can afford such a villa?!”
“This villa must have been given to her by some man. She is already a mother of three but this vixen is really something!”
“She is able to seduce my husband. You have to watch your man closely when you get home! Don’t let her seduce your…”
Madam Dong was slandering Qiu Tong’s reputation. Her words were getting increasingly ugly.
Qiu Tong frowned and wanted to retort, but Qiu Xingqiao strode over and stood in front of her. He raised his head and shouted, “Shut up!”
“Your photos are all blurry. No one can see anything clearly!”
“I can say that it’s a photo of Mommy, who was kind enough to help an old uncle cross the road! What right do you have to say that Mommy is linked to him?”
Qiu Xingyu nodded vigorously. “This man looks very old! Our Mommy won’t like him. Besides, we already have a Daddy. He’s especially outstanding. This old lady must have misunderstood!”
Qiu Xingyuan raised his hand and covered Little Yu’s mouth, indicating for her not to mention Jin Yang’s identity.
After all, he was the president so Qiu Tong’s marriage to him had to be kept a secret. Qiu Xingyuan looked at Madam Dong coldly. He pursed his thin lips and said in a serious tone, “You barged into our house and can be charged with infringing on other people’s privacy and safety. We can call the police.”
“We all believe that Mommy is innocent. If you think that there is something wrong with your husband, the problem might lie with you.”
Qiu Xingyuan was wearing a loose-fitting hoodie. He was clearly just a young kid, but in Qiu Tong’s eyes, he now looked indescribably tall, reliable and steady.
Madam Dong was at a loss for words. The surrounding neighbors were swayed by the children’s opinions. The tables had turned.
In the villa area, a taxi suddenly braked at the door. Professor Dong came out from the back seat with an anxious expression. He grabbed Madam Dong’s arm unhappily. “Don’t embarrass me here. Go home!”
Madam Dong misunderstood that he was defending Qiu Tong and became even angrier. She sat on the ground and started throwing a tantrum.
“You haven’t been home recently. When you go home, you lock yourself in the study room!”
“Keeping your phone and computer close to you all day every day, I have no idea what you are doing! You must be out fooling around with this vixen…”
“After knowing that I’m here to cause trouble for her, you specially came here to help her out? I’ve been with you for more than 10 years, but you are not showing me any respect.”
Qiu Tong’s head ached at the sight of Madam Dong throwing a tantrum.
However, Professor Dong’s research was confidential. To the outside world, he was just an ordinary university professor. It was difficult to explain.
“Hello? Brother, they’re all bullying me. Come and help!”
Madam Dong made a call and Professor Dong looked at Qiu Tong apologetically. “I’m sorry, I’ll compensate you for this.”
“You still want to transfer money to her?”
Infuriated, Madam Dong stood up and scratched Professor Dong. Qiu Tong raised her hand to protect the children and called Ke Le and the rest out to control the situation.
Swoosh—
Two vans drove into the villa area. A few burly young men came out of the car with their sleeves rolled up. “Who bullied my sister?”
Just as they were about to attack Qiu Tong, several gunshots rang out in the distance.
Everyone looked shocked. Madam Dong was so frightened that her face turned pale as she muttered, “Brother, why did you bring guns?”
The young man shook his head. “It’s not us!”
Qiu Tong realized that they were heading straight for Professor Dong. Sensing that it was the evil foreign forces, she hurriedly ran to Professor Dong and shouted to Ke Le, “Bring the children in. Call the others out to help!”
Gunshots rang out in the villa district. Qiu Tong pushed Professor Dong’s head down and stuffed him into a bush to hide.
Madam Dong hid under the trunk of a car and hugged her head in fear. She could not understand how this confrontation suddenly became a gunfight!
The evil foreign forces were all wearing black masks. They raised their guns and shouted, “Hand over the professor. As long as we get the formula for the human modification plan, we promise not to harm any innocent lives! Otherwise… don’t blame us for indiscriminately shooting at everyone.”
Two bullets tore through the air and grazed Qiu Tong’s arm, leaving two deep bloody marks.
Professor Dong held onto his glasses and opened his mouth to speak, but Qiu Tong put her index finger to her lips, indicating for him to shut up.
Ke Le and his mercenaries hid on both sides of the garden. They followed Qiu Tong’s instructions and waited for an opportunity to attack.
Qiu Tong took off Professor Dong’s hat and poked it out with a tree branch. As expected, it attracted the other party’s firepower to shoot at her…
“Go!”
Qiu Tong gave Ke Le a signal and the mercenaries moved out in tacit cooperation.
Meanwhile, Ye Luan, who was hiding at the door and listening to their conversation, looked nervous. His body was trembling uncontrollably and his lips were pale.
“How did they…?!”

chapters.title: Chapter 222 - Warmth Of A Family
chapters.content:
Chapter 222: Warmth Of A Family
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Ke Le and the mercenaries restrained them. Qiu Tong called the police chief and asked the police to come over to handle the interrogation.
Professor Dong and Madam Dong were so frightened that their legs went limp. They sat on a bench to rest. They looked at the scattered bullet shells on the ground and still felt fear lingering in their hearts.
“Miss Qiu is a bodyguard I hired. She’s here to protect me!”
“How could you come here to harass her without even clarifying things? If there are any problems between us, you should have come to me!”
Professor Dong handed a glass of warm water to his wife. His voice was reprimanding, but his eyes were filled with warmth and heartache.
Now that she knew the truth, Madam Dong slapped her thigh in frustration. She stood up and walked to Qiu Tong, bowing deeply in guilt.
“I’m sorry, I was just too anxious. I’m willing to bear the responsibility for the impact on you and the children!”
“I’ll explain to the surrounding neighbors. I’ll rescind all my negative comments and help restore your reputation…”
Madam Dong took out her phone and pointed at the email she received. “A woman who claimed to be Lin Shan called me last night. She said that she saw you two behaving intimately. When I heard her words and recalled Dong’s strange behavior recently, I couldn’t suppress the anger in my heart!”
Qiu Tong looked at Lin Shan’s phone number and email account. She frowned.
Lin Shan was really stubborn. No matter what, Qiu Tong could not shake this woman off. It seemed like she had to teach Lin Shan a lesson!
Qiu Tong shook her head and comforted Professor Dong and Madam Dong. “The police report states that all the members of the evil foreign forces were arrested. Don’t worry, there won’t be any more members waiting to kidnap or threaten you.”
Professor Dong thanked her profusely and paid her full fees on the spot, before leaving with his wife.
…
When they returned to the villa, Qiu Tong thought that the children would definitely be shocked and was about to comfort them.
However, Qiu Xingyu was sitting in front of the sofa with the first aid kit. With a straight face, Qiu Xingqiao tugged at Qiu Tong’s fingers and pushed her down to sit on the carpet.
Qiu Xingyuan concealed the worry in his eyes. Holding a pair of scissors, he tugged at Qiu Tong’s shirt as gently as possible.
The three children huddled together and gasped when they saw the gunshot wound on Qiu Tong’s arm.
Qiu Xingyuan opened his hand and Little Yu obediently handed over the disinfectant, gauze and ointment.
Qiu Tong sensed their intentions and leaned back on the sofa, her heart feeling warm. She watched with gentle eyes as Qiu Xingyuan seriously treated her wounds.
“If it hurts, just scream.”
“We won’t laugh at you!”
Qiu Xingqiao’s brows were furrowed as he said that. The corner of Qiu Tong’s lips curled up. “It doesn’t hurt at all.”
Qiu Xingyuan glared at her, as if chiding her for trying to put on a brave front.
“Do you lack money?”
“We can also earn money. Elder Brother can develop medicine, Little Yu can design the procedures, I… I can contribute physical effort!”
Qiu Xingqiao scratched his head as he spoke. He suddenly felt a little useless!
Qiu Tong knew that the children would all become powerful leaders in the future, but she did not want to impose the pressure of life on them now. Her eyes were filled with love as she reached out to pull Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu into her arms. She suddenly kissed their chubby cheeks with loud, clear smacks. Ke Le and the others at the side smiled when they saw the deep affection between mother and children.
Qiu Xingyuan rubbed his face awkwardly. “So much saliva!”
“Mommy! Let me blow at your wound. It won’t hurt anymore then.”
The children surrounded Qiu Tong and showed their care for her in their own different ways, letting her feel the warmth of a family.
At night, after the children had fallen asleep, Qiu Tong went straight to Lin Shan’s residence. She climbed up to the window via the drainage pipe with her bare hands. She kicked open the window and saw Lin Shan, who had been startled awake. Qiu Tong grabbed Lin Shan by her hair.
“You! You’re trespassing! I’m calling the police!”
“What do you want to do? Let go…”
Lin Shan was so scared that she wanted to grab her phone. Qiu Tong kicked the phone to the ground and pressed Lin Shan’s head against the corner of the table. She said in a harsh voice, “If you dare to hurt my children again and affect my life, I will never let you off like today!”
“You should know that I have a lot of connections.”
“Stay away from me if you don’t want to die!”
Qiu Tong kicked her into a corner. Lin Shan clutched her abdomen in pain. She looked at Qiu Tong’s figure in the darkness and shivered in fear.
Her lips trembled as she pleaded, “I won’t dare anymore! I really…”
Qiu Tong frowned and returned to the villa from Lin Shan’s place. She saw a small figure curled up at the entrance.
She hurried over and Ye Luan looked up when he heard her footsteps.
His deer-like eyes sparkled in the darkness. Seeing that he was dressed in thin clothes, Qiu Tong quickly hugged him. “Why are you outside?”
“Do you have something to say to me?”
Qiu Tong asked patiently. She seemed to be able to read his mind.
Ye Luan opened his mouth. His peripheral vision landed on his own abdomen. He shook his head and said, “I’m just worried about you…”
“It’s good that you’re back!”

chapters.title: Chapter 223 - Father Jin Tao
chapters.content:
Chapter 223: Father Jin Tao
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
At the Jin Residence in the capital.
The butler received the news of their arrival and came out to welcome them. Jin Yang rolled up his sleeves tiredly. “Dad.”
Jin Tao turned around and glared at Jin Yang sternly. He nodded slightly and pointed at the sofa in the living room. “Sit.”
The atmosphere in the living room was strangely oppressive. The nanny placed a fruit platter in front of Jin Yang and left in a hurry.
“What have you been busy with recently? I called the official residence several times, but Shao An said that you weren’t there…”
Jin Tao looked into the distance with an indifferent expression. His attitude was like a high-ranking official scrutinizing his subordinates. There was no affection or concern between father and son.
Jin Yang was very familiar with his attitude. He didn’t even find it strange.
“There are hidden dangers abroad and locusts in many places in the country that had to be settled. The inaction of local officials had to be dealt with.”
“I had to go and stabilize the situation and didn’t receive your calls. I’m sorry.”
It was hard to imagine that father and son were so distant.
Jin Tao sensed the hesitance and contradiction in his words. He asked calmly, “Has Song Yan contacted you recently?”
“If he causes any trouble outside, we have to clean up after him.”
“I advise you to find him as soon as possible…”
Jin Tao reminded him. Jin Yang looked up and smiled coldly. “Why? Are you going to keep him under house arrest here?”
“You don’t have to worry about that.”
“I heard from the butler that your health hasn’t been good recently. You should recuperate in peace.”
“An external force has infiltrated S City. I might have to rush over to investigate for some time. Please take good care of your health.”
Jin Yang stood up and left, unwilling to stay any longer.
He gripped the cold door handle, wondering if he should turn around and say goodbye, but he swallowed the words.
Bang. The door closed.
Jin Tao waved and his subordinate walked out from a corner. “Go and check on Jin Yang’s recent movements.”
“Investigate who he has been in contact with!”
Jin Tao narrowed his eyes, his cold gaze like sharp blades. For the sake of benefit and power, he would even treat his disobedient biological son as a threat and a thorny problem that needed to be dealt with. Kinship? He only cared about material things that could be held in his hands!
In the backseat of the car, Jin Yang rubbed his temples gently. He looked at Shao An, who was in the front passenger seat. “Book a flight ticket and come with me to S City.”
“Sir, should I stay in the capital to help you scout for information? If I leave, it might ignite gossip and doubts among other officials…”
Shao An guessed that Jin Yang and the old man’s meeting had not been pleasant. He threw out a suggestion in a probing manner.
Jin Yang rejected him outright. “I’ve already informed him of my schedule. From now on, you can follow me at all times.”
Jin Tao wanted to control his actions and Shao An was the biggest obstacle.
Shao An was his subordinate and also his friend. Jin Yang swore to protect him.
Ding! Jin Yang activated the soundproof panel in the car and took out his phone. Without hesitation, he dialed Qiu Tong’s number. The phone rang twice and Qiu Tong answered, “Yes?”
Qiu Tong was rather unhappy that her sweet dreams had been interrupted.
However, when she saw the caller ID, Qiu Tong turned on the night lamp and cleared her throat. “What’s the matter?”
It was three in the morning. Qiu Tong heard her heart beating anxiously.
Jin Yang suddenly smirked and shook his head. “Nothing. I just wanted to hear your voice. Why didn’t you call me?”
As if she was the lead actress in a romantic film, Qiu Tong rubbed her reddened ears and said in a gentle voice, “You are the president and are busy with work. I don’t want to disrupt your work.”
Their difference in status would always be a hurdle in Qiu Tong’s heart.
She had once sworn to stay away from dangerous people, but now… Jin Yang and her fell into silence. Only the sounds of their breathing could be heard. Qiu Tong felt sleepy and she slowly closed her eyes as she laid on the bed.
“I’ll be in S City at noon tomorrow. Wait for me at home.”
Jin Yang listened to her steady breathing and knew that Qiu Tong was falling asleep. He had very naturally referred to her place as “home”.
Half asleep, Qiu Tong murmured. “Yes, I’m bringing the children to the amusement park.”
Jin Yang lowered the soundproof panel. The cool evening wind blew over and he felt much more awake. The gloominess in his heart dissipated.
When Shao An heard the noise, he turned around and wanted to say something. Jin Yang raised his index finger and pressed it to his lips, indicating for him to shut up.
He hurriedly covered his mouth with his hand. From the corner of his eye, he saw the display screen on Jin Yang’s phone. He suddenly understood.
It seemed like there had been many changes in the relationship between the president and Qiu Tong!
Shao An’s ears pricked up in curiosity, but Jin Yang did not say anything else. He returned to the bedroom and quietly changed into his pajamas before lying on the bed. He listened to Qiu Tong’s breathing and soon fell asleep too.
That night, although they were thousands of miles apart, it was the first time they spent the entire night together on the phone…

chapters.title: Chapter 224 - I Am Their Father
chapters.content:
Chapter 224: I Am Their Father
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
At the amusement park. Qiu Tong fulfilled her promise and brought the children out for an outing.
Qiu Xingyuan and Little Yu helped to build a temporary tent for them to rest in. Qiu Tong set out the cutlery needed for their picnic and washed it before placing it on the lawn. The sight of the whole family coming together made the surrounding children cast envious gazes.
Ye Luan, who had come with them, sat alone in the shade of a distant tree. He was frowning and had his head buried in his knees, as if he had something on his mind.
Qiu Tong saw that he looked very lonely. She picked up two cups of hot milk tea and sat down beside Ye Luan.
“Why? Do you miss home a little?”
After Qiu Tong brought Ye Luan back, she never asked about his family situation.
She felt that those were Ye Luan’s private matters. If he wanted to talk about it, he would naturally take the initiative to tell her. She did not wish to keep probing.
Ye Luan shook his head. He held the milk tea with both hands and looked at Qiu Tong hesitantly. “Auntie Qiu, I’m keeping something from you.”
“But… I promised Daddy to keep it a secret. I can’t tell anyone.”
Ye Luan trusted Qiu Tong. He rubbed his fingertips in frustration and subconsciously rubbed the part of his skin that was over the chip.
Qiu Tong stroked the top of his head gently. “Since you promised Daddy, you have to keep your word!”
“I took care of you and brought you home because I wanted you to be happy, not because I want you to do anything for me!”
Qiu Tong hugged Ye Luan and patted his back.
Ye Luan felt a surge of warmth in his heart. However, three resentful gazes were staring at them from a distance.
Qiu Xingyu pursed her lips and tugged at Qiu Xingqiao. “Mommy has been very concerned about Brother Ye Luan recently!”
“I saw them whispering in the living room last night! Mommy brought us out today to play but her attention is all on him.”
