Qiu Xingyuan tugged at the tent rope as he pondered with a complicated expression.
After a while, he suddenly said to Qiu Xingqiao, “Invite him to play football with us.”
Qiu Xingqiao shook his head vehemently. “I don’t want to!”
Qiu Xingyuan rummaged through his bag for a soccer ball. His gaze landed on Ye Luan as he said in a mild tone, “Only when our relationship with him gets better will she spend more time with us!” Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu suddenly understood and nodded. The two of them ran over to invite Ye Luan to join.
Qiu Tong was pleased to see that the children were close. She carried Little Yu back to the tent to prepare the ingredients for dinner.
In the distance, three boys were playing soccer harmoniously. With the sunset, it was a beautiful scene.
Qiu Tong was cutting potatoes with a knife when Little Yu, who was beside her, stood up nervously. “Brother is fighting with them!”
Qiu Tong was shocked. The blade grazed her fingertips. She looked up and saw a few boys in the distance pushing each other. She hurriedly ran over.
“Say that again if you dare!”
Qiu Xingqiao gritted his teeth and growled. The boys, who looked to be a few years older than them, snorted coldly and retorted indignantly, “I told you! You’re all illegitimate children. You don’t have a father!” The boys smirked and made funny faces.
Qiu Xingyuan looked at them coldly. “That’s better than having a father, yet still having no one to teach you manners!”
One of the boys waved his fist toward the Qiu brothers.
Ye Luan, with his thin figure, stood out from behind. He blocked the other party’s fist, his eyes filled with determination. “Don’t bully them.”
The boy shook off his hand in disdain. “You don’t have either a mother or a father. You’re just a pitiful worm picked up by the Qiu family! Are you going to stand up for them now?”
“You really know how to ingratiate yourself to them!”
The boy’s hurtful words made Ye Luan’s face darken, but he still protected Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao without retreating.
Qiu Xingyuan stared at Ye Luan’s back profile and retorted after a moment of silence, “He’s my brother. Who said he doesn’t have parents?”
“Yes! Not only does he have parents, he also has siblings! You’re the pitiful one!”
When Qiu Xingqiao heard his elder brother’s words, he immediately expressed his stance firmly.
Ye Luan didn’t expect them to say that. His eyes surged with emotions.
Qiu Tong stopped in her tracks when she heard this.
The mother of one of those boys rushed over. She knew that her child was in the wrong, but she still defended him. “My son did not speak any untruths. He is just a child. How dare you attack him?”
Qiu Tong saw that the other party was so unreasonable. She planned to persuade her children not to fuss with them.
A pair of strong hands rested on her shoulders and Jin Yang’s deep voice came from beside her ear. “He’s so young and already knows how to spread false rumors. As his mother, if you continue to indulge him, he will just end up making bigger mistakes in the future!”
The boy’s mother doubtfully sized up Qiu Tong and Jin Yang. “You are?”
Jin Yang smiled gently at the Qiu siblings and said firmly, “I’m their father.”
Thump!
Qiu Xingyu threw herself into Jin Yang’s arms with red eyes. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao also looked away and rubbed the corners of their wet eyes with the backs of their hands.
“With me around, no one can bully you all.”

chapters.title: Chapter 225 - Change Of Clothes
chapters.content:
Chapter 225: Change Of Clothes
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The children’s dispute ended with an apology from the boy’s mother.
Qiu Tong sat on the picnic bench. Jin Yang took off his jacket and placed it in her arms.
Jin Yang rolled up his sleeves and used a lighter to light the charcoal.
When Little Yu saw the burning flames, she immediately jumped up excitedly. The flames shone on the children’s faces. Their expressions were relaxed and happy, not affected by the commotion just now.
Ye Luan took the initiative to help pick up some thin branches. He saw Qiu Xingyuan carrying some firewood and hurriedly snatched the heavy load over.
Qiu Xingqiao wiped his face with the back of his dirty hand. He grumbled at the unfair treatment. “My load of firewood is clearly heavier.”
When Ye Luan heard that, he turned back. Qiu Tong couldn’t help smiling when she saw that the children had grown closer.
Jin Yang was roasting meat skewers on the grill. This was his first time and he couldn’t control the heat well.
He ended up burning a couple of beef skewers. Shao An could not help chuckling. “So there are things that even the president doesn’t know how to do.”
Jin Yang looked up and handed over the failed product. “Eat them all.”
Shao An was shocked. “This will cause food poisoning!”
Jin Yang shrugged his shoulders nonchalantly and continued to ponder over the best way to barbecue. After experiencing countless failures, he finally walked over to Qiu Tong with a satisfactory piece of barbecued meat. He tried his best to hand it over in a casual manner. “This is for you. Try it.”
Qiu Tong overheard the entire conversation between him and Shao An earlier. She tried to keep a straight face and took the skewer from him. “Thank you.”
Beside the bonfire, Jin Yang draped his jacket over Qiu Tong’s shoulders. From time to time, he would adjust the size of the fire.
Qiu Xingyu took the initiative to bring over for Jin Yang some food and fruit juice that she had prepared . Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao also awkwardly stuffed a couple of apples into Jin Yang’s hands. The children of the Qiu family treated him the same as they did with Qiu Tong. They were direct, but still somewhat awkward.
“I’m especially happy today!”
Qiu Xingyu bounced on the spot, waving a sparkler in her hand.
The children sang loudly in unison. At night, on the lawn of the park, Qiu Tong felt a warmth she had never felt before. She slowly leaned her head on Jin Yang’s shoulder, enjoying the happiness of this moment. Jin Yang gently held her hand, his index finger and thumb pinching her palm, infusing her with warmth.
…
In the villa, Qiu Tong hurried the children to the bathroom to shower before coaxing them to sleep. She was exhausted.
Qiu Tong dragged her tired footsteps to the second floor. She passed by the door of Jin Yang’s room and suddenly thought about something. She went back to her bedroom and came out with two sets of fresh clothes. She knocked lightly on Jin Yang’s door. Jin Yang turned the doorknob. He was still wearing a towel wrapped around his waist. He was wiping his wet hair and tilted his head to look at Qiu Tong.
“Here, I prepared your pajamas.”
“I bought the size according to Ke Le’s figure. It shouldn’t be too small.”
Jin Yang looked at her with a smile. Qiu Tong’s ears turned red as she walked into the room and placed the clothes on a stool.
“Why did you prepare clothes for me?”
“If you wanted me to come and stay here, why didn’t you contact me?”
Jin Yang asked jokingly. Qiu Tong frowned and turned to leave without replying. However, her toes accidentally kicked the corner of the table. The intense pain made her fall forward uncontrollably.
Qiu Tong instinctively reached out to support herself against the wardrobe, but she fell into his strong arms instead.
The water droplets from Jin Yang’s hair fell on Qiu Tong’s arm. Qiu Tong rested her hand on Jin Yang’s shoulder. When she raised her head, she met his dark eyes, which were as deep as a pool. She was a little dazed. Jin Yang smiled and bent his index finger to tap the tip of her nose. He said in a doting and seductive voice, “If you wanted to stay, just say so. Why resort to this?”
Qiu Tong was taken aback. She came to her senses and pushed Jin Yang away slightly.
As she rushed to the door, Jin Yang leaned over and grabbed her elbow. With his other hand holding the back of her head, he leaned over and kissed her.
Qiu Tong felt her body go limp. She instinctively hooked her arms around Jin Yang’s neck and kicked the bedroom door shut.
Jin Yang chuckled. Qiu Tong bit his lower lip with a frown, punishing him in a teasing manner.
“How long can you stay here?”
Jin Yang pulled off Qiu Tong’s hair tie and her wavy hair cascaded down with a lemon fragrance.
Jin Yang buried his face in her neck, his tongue licking her nimbly.
Hearing Qiu Tong’s question, Jin Yang replied with dark eyes, “As long as you want. I can stay by your side forever!”
Qiu Tong’s heart skipped a beat. Although she understood that these were just sweet nothings, she still could not help falling for them.
She took the initiative to wrap her legs around Jin Yang’s strong waist, inviting him deeper into her.
Jin Yang lowered his head and used his tongue to draw a beautiful picture of Qiu Tong’s body. He then explored her chest with his tongue.
Qiu Tong couldn’t help letting out a soft moan.. Jin Yang pressed his fingers into her and started to give Qiu Tong a most exciting and satisfying experience.

chapters.title: Chapter 226 - Past Love
chapters.content:
Chapter 226: Past Love
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Early in the morning, bright sunlight shone into the room.
In the living room, Jin Yang tried to help the children pack their bags and saw them to the door.
In the kitchen, Qiu Tong was wearing an apron. She was making a soup according to a recipe, and a fragrant aroma soon wafted out of the pot.
Jin Yang stretched his body and walked to Qiu Tong’s side in his loose pajamas. “Do you need my help?”
Qiu Tong turned on the tap to wash the children’s utensils. She nodded in the direction of the refrigerator. “Ke Le and the others bought a lot of prawns and crabs yesterday when they were shopping in the supermarket. Help me prepare them. We will steam them for dinner.”
Jin Yang nodded and followed her instructions.
The villa was very quiet. Warm light shone on the two of them. Even though neither of them spoke, they felt very relaxed and at ease.
Jin Yang was in a tense state every day at the official residence of the capital.
Here, he seemed to be able to shed all the pressure and burdens and enjoy the warmth and happiness of family life.
Qiu Tong stood on her tiptoes, wanting to open the cupboard door and place the dishes inside. Jin Yang appeared from behind and hugged her as he took the items. Qiu Tong pressed her back against Jin Yang’s muscular chest, her heart beating faster.
“You seem to be very good at housework.”
Qiu Tong lowered her eyes to look at the hands at her waist. She suddenly recalled Song Yan’s warning and hints. “Are you as considerate and caring towards your former girlfriend?” Qiu Tong did not realize her voice held a hint of jealousy.
Jin Yang paused. He gripped Qiu Tong’s shoulder and made her turn around.
Their eyes met. Jin Yang felt as if two hands were gripping his heart, making it difficult for him to breathe.
The image of the woman’s back in his dream surfaced in his mind. A white light flashed past and the intense pain in his temples made him press his thin lips together.
Qiu Tong saw the thin layer of sweat on his forehead and raised her hand to wipe it for him. However, Jin Yang instinctively held her wrist tightly, his eyes cold.
Three seconds later, Jin Yang regained his clarity. Cold sweat drenched his clothes.
He shook his head, confusion flashing across his eyes. “I don’t remember.”
Jin Yang didn’t want to lie to Qiu Tong, but such an ambiguous answer made Qiu Tong misunderstand. “I don’t have any intention of probing into the president’s private matters. I just want to know why you guys broke up. I want to try my best to avoid the problems that happened in the past. This will be good for the both of us…”
Qiu Tong replied in a fit of pique. She pushed Jin Yang away and wanted to walk around him. “Please stay away from me!”
“We’re in a marriage of convenience. I can cooperate with you to pretend to be a married couple in front of the children, but I also want them to have a complete family, as well as a perfect father who can be relied on. A father they can be proud of.”
“It’s just the two of us now. You don’t have to pretend. I won’t interfere with the president’s personal life.”
Jin Yang didn’t understand why Qiu Tong was suddenly so angry. He blocked her path. “Is this really how you think?”
“Was what happened last night all fake?”
Jin Yang grabbed Qiu Tong by the waist and threw her onto the sofa in the living room, before leaning over.
Qiu Tong bent her knees in dissatisfaction and wanted to attack. Jin Yang noticed in advance and used his long legs to separate her legs. He bent over and kissed her.
Qiu Tong bit his lips angrily, the thick taste of blood spreading between their lips.
“I like you.”
Jin Yang said in all sincerity. Qiu Tong met his deep eyes and sank into his heartfelt confession. She sighed softly.
…
Outside the villa, Shao An led the presidential guards to patrol the surroundings.
A guard saw a figure flashing past the security booth. He ran over warily to investigate, but didn’t manage to catch the person.
He came back and reported the situation to Shao An. “Should we tell the president…”
After all, the guards could tell how much Jin Yang valued the Qiu family. They didn’t dare to delay.
Shao An took out the gun at his waist and counted the bullets inside. “You guys get the surveillance footage from the management of the estate and carry out an investigation. After you confirm the other party’s identity and motive, you can report to Mr. Jin Yang. Don’t disturb him over such a small matter…”
Shao An stole a glance at the French windows beside the main entrance of the villa. He did not want to barge in and disturb his boss. He might be reprimanded!
“Hey, hey, hey! Auntie, what are you doing?”
Just as the guards were about to split up and carry out their mission, they saw a middle-aged woman with fluffy, permed hair rush to the door of the villa and press the doorbell.
Ding Dong. Jin Yang instinctively separated from Qiu Tong. He gently supported Qiu Tong’s waist and helped her pull down her shirt.
Qiu Tong tidied her messy clothes as she walked to the door. She cleared her throat and opened the door slightly. “Who is it?”
The neighbor saw that her face was flushed red and nosily stuck her head in to take a look.
“What’s the matter?”
Jin Yang asked in a low voice as he held Qiu Tong’s shoulder.
The neighbor suddenly remembered her purpose of visit and hurriedly pointed in the direction of the kindergarten. “Go and take a look!”
“Qiu Xingyuan and the rest are at the police station now!”

chapters.title: Chapter 227 - Shock At The Police Station
chapters.content:
Chapter 227: Shock At The Police Station
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
In the interrogation room of the police station, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were cooperating with the police officers and making their statements. Qiu Xingyu was sitting on a bench outside, chewing on a lollipop.
Jin Yang and Qiu Tong rushed to the police station as quickly as they could. They were stunned to see the little girl leisurely swinging her legs.
They had thought that the children had been in danger and were injured. Qiu Tong’s lips had already turned pale from anxiety, but the situation was completely different from what they had heard from their neighbor. Qiu Xingyu saw them standing at the door. She immediately jumped off the bench and threw herself into Qiu Tong’s arms.
“Mommy, why are you here?”
Qiu Tong bent over and picked her up, carefully checking for any injuries.
“What happened? Auntie Zhang saw you guys being taken away in a police car!”
When the police officer heard the commotion and saw Qiu Tong and Jin Yang, he was shocked. He hurriedly brought Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao out.
“Miss Qiu, your children are very vigilant. If it were any other children, they might be in danger.”
Qiu Tong’s heart skipped a beat. She frowned nervously at Qiu Xingyuan.
Qiu Xingqiao lifted his chin proudly. “We almost helped the police catch a bunch of baddies who specialize in child trafficking!”
Qiu Xingyuan calmly explained the situation. “The kindergarten was holding an outdoor hiking activity. When we were playing football in the nearby park, an old granny suddenly walked over in crutches. Little Yu saw that she was a little pitiful and took the initiative to run over to help.”
“That old lady said that she forgot her way home. She wanted Little Yu to send her back.”
Qiu Xingyu nodded vigorously. With the lollipop still in her mouth, she mumbled in a daze, “She looked really pitiful!”
Qiu Xingqiao shook his hands helplessly. “Initially, Eldest Brother and I wanted to seek the teacher’s help, but Little Yu had already promised the old granny. She was in a bad state too. We had no choice but to follow her instructions and accompany her home. However, Eldest Brother soon realized that something was amiss. We are very familiar with the area around the kindergarten, but she kept leading us to a remote forest…”
Little Yu widened her dark eyes and hooked Qiu Tong’s little finger. “There were no residential buildings there at all!”
“Eldest Brother guessed that she must be planning to trick us and sell us!”
“We pretended not to notice and accompanied the old granny to the alley in front of the small forest. We remember Mommy said that if we meet bad people, we must think of a way to escape. Second Brother pretended to have his shoelaces undone and kept a distance from her…”
Qiu Xingqiao spread out his hands, white powder still lingering on his fingertips.
“Fortunately, we had the powder that Eldest Brother developed. When the granny was momentarily distracted, we threw it all over her.”
“She was temporarily blinded and we took the opportunity to run here and find the police!”
Qiu Tong was shocked as she listened to the children’s narration.
Jin Yang accompanied the children to the evidence room. Qiu Tong looked at the surveillance footage. “Have you found those people?”
The police officer pointed at two magnified screenshots from the surveillance cameras. “They should be from an organization and the action was premeditated. This is the elderly woman whom the children mentioned! But after discovering that the children had run away, two vans appeared at the intersection and drove her away…”
“They were aware of the surveillance cameras and we didn’t manage to capture a clear picture of their faces, so it’s a little difficult to track them down.”
Qiu Tong asked for a copy of the video. She had a feeling that these people were not ordinary human traffickers. Perhaps they were linked to those people in the capital!
Qiu Tong brought the children home. Jin Yang shot Shao An a look from the door.
“Arrange for men to investigate the surrounding districts discreetly. We have to find those people!”
“The van they are in should have been rented locally or pieced together from a scrapyard. Qiu Xingyuan’s powder will cause temporary blindness. Go to a nearby clinic and see if there are any records of such a patient. Follow the clues and investigate!”
Shao An did not dare to delay and ordered his men to strengthen the security around the villa.
“If you see anyone suspicious, report it immediately!”
Shao An said with a cold voice. He suddenly remembered the suspicious figure that someone had reported that morning. He could not help frowning. “Could they be in cahoots?”
In the living room, Qiu Tong gathered the children together.
“You guys didn’t panic when faced with danger. You know how to work together. Mommy is happy.”
“However, Mommy told you before not to trust strangers, much less leave with them. If Little Yu can’t remember this, you will be scolded! Something similar might happen again soon. Mommy has already applied for leave from the kindergarten. You guys can rest at home for the next few days.”
“If anyone thinks of any details that you’ve missed, you must tell Mommy! Got it?”
Qiu Tong looked at Little Yu’s dejected expression and pinched her chubby cheeks. “Mommy will cook crabs for you guys tonight.”
“Okay?”
It was relatively easy to cheer up little kids. Qiu Xingyu’s face instantly lit up.. On the other hand, Qiu Tong’s heart felt incomparably heavy.

chapters.title: Chapter 228 - Capturing Xiao Zhen
chapters.content:
Chapter 228: Capturing Xiao Zhen
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Late at night, Shao An brought some guards to patrol the perimeter of the villa.
Two suspicious vans pulled into the parking lot across the street. Shao An secretly observed them for over 10 minutes but could not see the faces of the passengers inside. He felt that something was amiss and immediately sent guards to surround the exit.
Shao An, who was disguised as a security guard in a villa district, slowly approached the van and knocked on the glass window of the driver’s seat.
“Sorry, residents who are not from this district cannot park here. Please leave as soon as possible.”
Shao An said in a low voice. Someone in the passenger seat rolled down the window. He had a neat buzz cut and a murderous look in his eyes.
He took out two stacks of cash and handed them to Shao An. “Make an exception. We just need to park here until tomorrow morning.”
“Those are the rules. I can’t make an exception.”
Shao An circled to the passenger seat, wanting to spy on the situation in the back of the van.
The man in the passenger seat immediately sat up vigilantly and blocked Shao An’s view. His guilty reflex made Shao An certain that there was something fishy going on. He signaled with his hands behind his back before quickly subduing the man in the passenger seat. Guards ran over from all sides and blocked the van.
“Get out of the car now!”
“Put your hands behind your head! Squat on the ground and don’t move!”
The guards did a headcount and soon realized that these people appeared to be mercenaries.
The door at the back of the van remained shut for a long time. The guard reported to Shao An. He walked to the door and suddenly pulled it open. He was shocked to see the person sitting inside. The atmosphere in the parking lot became heavy and awkward because of the unexpected appearance of this person…
At the villa, the doorbell rang.
Qiu Tong saw Shao An’s grim expression and turned to call out to Jin Yang, who was playing with the children.
“Sir, there’s something I need you to handle.”
Shao An was obviously hiding something. Jin Yang grabbed his jacket and left with him. The two of them chatted for a short while outside. “We’ve already caught the people who tried to kidnap the children of the Qiu family, but their leader… I hope you can go take a look.”
Jin Yang kicked open the metal door of the warehouse and saw Xiao Zhen sitting on a rusty chair with a flustered expression.
When Xiao Zhen saw Jin Yang, he immediately stood up in fear. He bowed and said, “I didn’t expect to meet you here!”
Jin Yang scanned the mercenaries squatting by the wall coldly. Most of them were soldiers who had retired from the military.
“Why do you want to kidnap the Qiu family’s children?”
Xiao Zhen hurriedly shook his head and explained, “Mr. President, it’s just a misunderstanding!”
“My good friend in the capital lost his children not long ago and he asked me to help him search for them. Coincidentally, I received news that children who fit the description had appeared recently, so I wanted to come and look for them! I didn’t expect there to be a mistake. I got the wrong children!”
“I reprimanded my men immediately. Tonight, I wanted to find the parents of the children, whom we frightened earlier today, and personally come to apologize!”
Xiao Zhen fabricated a lie that was full of loopholes. Jin Yang narrowed his eyes and sneered. “You’re looking for lost children and had to hire an old granny to deceive them? Do you think I’m an idiot to be fooled?”
Extreme anger radiated from Jin Yang’s body, causing Xiao Zhen to shake his head in fear.
Xiao Zhen held an important position in the government and Jin Yang could not remove him from his post because of this. Jin Yang knew that Xiao Zhen was hiding something, but he could only warn him. “Stay away from the Qiu family. If I see you again, I will make you disappear…”
“Do you understand?”
Xiao Zhen’s legs trembled as he hurriedly agreed.
Jin Yang and Shao An led the team away. Xiao Zhen heaved a sigh of relief and collapsed onto the chair. He took out the phone from his pocket with a trembling hand and dialed the number.
Shao An followed Jin Yang and looked at his grim side profile. He could not help asking, “Sir, why did you release Xiao Zhen?”
“We found many kidnapping tools in the two vans, including ropes and handkerchiefs soaked with tranquilizers. We can confirm that the kidnapping is premeditated and part of the trafficking process. With the evidence we have now, we can send him to military court, then dismiss him and convict him!”
Shao An knew how concerned Jin Yang was with Qiu Tong and her children. He would never have let Xiao Zhen off with just a warning.
“Do you believe what Xiao Zhen said? He’s just here to help his friend find his lost children?”
Jin Yang stopped in his tracks. “I asked you to investigate Qiu Tong’s connections and social background, and everyone connected to her. Did you see any links between her and Xiao Zhen? There must be a deeper conspiracy behind this matter!”
“I released Xiao Zhen because I want to set him up as bait. I want to see who is the mastermind controlling him from behind the scenes!”
Shao An widened his mouth in realization. He gave Jin Yang a thumbs-up and praised him. “As expected, Sir is far-sighted.”
Jin Yang looked up at the round moon hanging in the sky. He had a vague sense of foreboding in his heart.
Xiao Zhen held a high position in the government. For someone like him to personally come to S City to kidnap the children of the Qiu family…
What was so special about Qiu Tong?
Or was Xiao Zhen actually here for him?!

chapters.title: Chapter 229 - Shes A Substitute
chapters.content:
Chapter 229: She’s A Substitute
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
In the capital, the phone in the study room of the Jin residence rang three times before cutting off.
Xiao Zhen paced around nervously and waited. He stared at his phone and answered the call the moment he received it. “Sir, the plan failed.”
“President Jin Yang lives with Qiu Tong and her children. He has already discovered our plan and has arranged for Shao An and his guards to be on standby.”
“Do you want me to continue with the plan? Please give me your instructions.”
Xiao Zhen straightened his back and waited for the other party’s order compliantly.
Jin Tao’s furrowed brows were reflected on the glass in the study room. He was silent for a long time before saying, “You can come back now.”
The call was cut off and Jin Tao received a photo document from Xiao Zhen.
He clicked on it and saw a blurry photo of Jin Yang and Qiu Tong playing with the children on the lawn.
Unbelievable! Jin Yang went to S City for them?
Jin Tao said to his assistant, “Book me a ticket to S City.”
…
The next morning, Jin Yang looked at Little Yu, who was playing alone in the living room. He looked around for Qiu Tong, but did not see her.
Little Yu pushed some toy blocks toward him. “Mommy got a call and went out!”
Jin Yang glanced at the clock on the wall in puzzlement. Who would ask to meet with Qiu Tong at eight or nine in the morning?
Qiu Tong arrived at the cafe at the appointed time. Jin Tao was already sitting in a corner booth. He nodded at Qiu Tong and pointed at the seat opposite him. “Thank you for coming all this way. What would you like to drink?”
He raised his hand to call for the service staff. Qiu Tong put down her bag and straightened her back warily. “Just give me a glass of water.”
Jin Tao and Jin Yang were indeed father and son. They looked very similar.
But this man in front of her was more mysterious than Jin Yang. Even though Qiu Tong was sitting opposite him and could feel a thick aura surrounding Jin Tao’s body. She could not guess his true thoughts and intentions. She gently stroked the rim of her glass, waiting for Jin Tao to speak.
“Jin Yang told me not long ago that he was coming to S City to stay for the long-term. I thought it was because of official business, but it seems like it’s because of you.”
Qiu Tong frowned and wanted to explain, but Jin Tao interrupted her.
“I have no intention of blaming you. Jin Yang is an adult. He has the right and freedom to choose his life partner.”
“Don’t think that I’m a traditional parent. I never believed that the president has to marry the daughter of a high-ranking official…”
“It’s just that I’m very curious what kind of woman can make him forget about the past. Seeing you today, I kind of understand. You’re indeed very similar to her. Not only your appearance, but also your aura. I also nearly mistook you for her…”
As Jin Tao spoke, Qiu Tong asked in confusion, “Who is she?”
“Didn’t Jin Yang mention her to you?”
Jin Tao held the teacup to his lips and took a sip. He appeared surprised. “Jin Yang had a fiancée a few years ago.”
“They were very much in love. They got engaged and were preparing for their wedding. But for some reason, they suddenly broke up. Jin Yang also sank into depression for a long time because of this. Even now, we don’t dare to talk about the past in front of him.”
“Fortunately, I have you to help him walk out of those painful memories. As his father, I need to thank you.”
Jin Tao put down his teacup and looked at Qiu Tong’s expression seriously.
He had a fiancée?!
Mixed emotions surged in Qiu Tong’s heart. She clenched her hand around the glass, the paleness of her knuckles revealing her true feelings.
Time passed minute by minute. Qiu Tong could not sit still and wanted to leave.
Jin Tao stood up with his usual expression and buttoned his jacket. “Can I ask you a favor as his father?”
“Don’t tell Jin Yang about our meeting today.”
“I don’t want him to misunderstand. I hope you understand.”
Qiu Tong nodded.
She left the cafe and sat in a nearby park for a long time.
Qiu Tong recalled all the details of her interactions with Jin Yang. Those images flashed across her mind like a movie in slow motion. Her heart felt like it had been pierced and a cold wind kept blowing through it, bringing endless pain.
It turned out that Jin Yang’s feelings and care for her was only because of another woman!
Night fell. Qiu Tong got up and went home. She stood at the entrance of the villa and looked at the lights inside before taking out her key.
When Jin Yang heard the sound of the door opening, he ran over and reached out to take Qiu Tong’s bag. “Why are you back so late?”
Qiu Tong looked up at him and instinctively avoided his touch. She said coldly, “Thank you.”
“I’m not feeling well. I am going to my room.”
Qiu Xingyuan laid on the sofa. Seeing Qiu Tong’s expression, he immediately sensed that something was wrong. He turned to look at Jin Yang and asked, “Did you make her angry?”
Jin Yang held up his hands in bewilderment. He also wanted to know what the problem was!
Qiu Xingyuan patted Little Yu’s shoulder and pointed to the bedroom on the second floor. “She likes you the most.. Go and ask her what happened.”

chapters.title: Chapter 230 - Inexplicable Cold War
chapters.content:
Chapter 230: Inexplicable Cold War
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
In the bedroom, Qiu Xingyu blinked her sparkling eyes and gently pushed open the bedroom door.
Qiu Xingyu tugged at the corner of Qiu Tong’s clothes with innocent eyes. She tilted her head and asked in a childish voice, “Is Mommy feeling unwell?”
“Did Uncle Jin Yang do something wrong and make you angry?”
Qiu Tong burst out laughing. She cupped Qiu Xingyu’s adorable face. “Do you like Jin Yang very much?”
Qiu Xingyu thought about it seriously for a while. “Yes! Uncle Jin Yang is very good to us. He will play games with me very patiently.”
“He helped Elder Brother adjust any wrong data in his experiments and also corrected Second Brother’s fighting stance!”
“In the past, I was very envious of the other children in the kindergarten as they had parents to fetch them home. But now, I also have Uncle Jin Yang!”
Qiu Xingyu excitedly waved her arms as she listed out Jin Yang’s various strengths.
Qiu Tong could see how dependent the children were on Jin Yang. She did not know how to tell them that all of this could disappear at any moment.
Half an hour later, Qiu Xingyu came out of the bedroom.
In the living room, Jin Yang, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao looked up at her at the same time. They surrounded her curiously.
Qiu Xingyu pursed her lips and pointed at Jin Yang. “Mommy must be unhappy because of Uncle Jin Yang! Every time I talk about you, Mommy always looks sad. Did you do anything bad behind our backs?”
Three pairs of eyes stared at Jin Yang. Jin Yang recalled his recent actions and shook his head. He held up three fingers and swore. “Definitely not!”
Qiu Xingyuan supported his chin with his hand. He carefully considered the call Qiu Tong had received and felt that there must be a problem!
Qiu Xingqiao asked with a worried expression, “What should we do now?”
Qiu Xingyuan gestured at Jin Yang to come over. The four of them put their heads together and discussed a plan.
…
The next day, Jin Yang and the children sat obediently at the dining table.
They looked at Qiu Tong’s busy back profile in the kitchen and signaled to each other with their eyes.
Qiu Xingqiao cleared his throat. Just as he was about to speak, the doorbell rang and interrupted their plan.
Jin Yang pushed open the door with a frown. Song Yan smiled brightly as he greeted him. He pushed Jin Yang away and bent over to find a pair of slippers to change into. He walked straight to the kitchen and said to Qiu Tong, “Can I trouble you to add another place setting?”
Qiu Tong nodded and they all sat at the dining table, eating in silence.
Qiu Xingyu secretly stepped on Qiu Xingqiao’s feet under the table. He gasped in pain and successfully attracted Qiu Tong’s attention.
Qiu Xingqiao’s eyes flickered. He said in a weak voice, “Mommy! Uncle Jin Yang wants to bring us to the reservoir to fish, is that okay?”
Little Yu pursed her lips and hurriedly added, “It’s been very chaotic outside recently. There are always baddies wanting to capture children!”
“I will only be at ease if Mommy comes with us too, okay?”
Qiu Xingyu looked up at Song Yan and asked, “What about you? Do you want to come also?”
Song Yan was very surprised. He glanced at Jin Yang’s ugly expression and immediately agreed.
After their meal, Jin Yang, Qiu Xingyuan and the rest gathered in a corner to discuss their plan. Song Yan and Qiu Tong stood side by side in front of the kitchen sink, washing the dishes. His lips curled into a teasing smile as he asked in a low voice, “Why? Did you guys quarrel?”
Qiu Tong denied it, but Song Yan did not mind. He deliberately moved closer to Qiu Tong’s side. “Anyway, I’m willing to do anything that can make Jin Yang unhappy. Do you want to see him so jealous that he goes crazy?”
“Why don’t we give it a try?”
Song Yan’s eyes flickered with the excitement of a prank. Seeing their intimate behavior, Jin Yang quietly gritted his teeth, his eyes dark.
At the S City reservoir, Qiu Xingyuan threw out his fishing rod. He sat on a small rock by the shore and waited for the fish to take the bait.
Jin Yang held his own fishing rod as he prepared the bait. He had wanted to use the excuse of teaching Qiu Tong how to fish to resolve this inexplicable cold war with her. But Song Yan had rushed over to Qiu Tong to guide her.
Song Yan raised his eyebrows smugly at Jin Yang, before taking the seat beside Qiu Tong.
When Qiu Xingyu saw that Jin Yang’s plan had failed, she stomped her feet anxiously and ran to Qiu Xingyuan’s side to discuss a new strategy with him.
After a while, Qiu Xingqiao ran back from afar. He pointed at a building in the distance and whispered.
Qiu Xingyu’s eyes gradually lit up. She nodded vigorously and gave him a thumbs-up. “Good idea!”
Jin Yang and Qiu Tong were sitting very far away from each other. Qiu Tong was focused on the calm water, while Jin Yang was paying attention to Song Yan and her actions. He could not sit still. Qiu Xingyuan and Little Yu suddenly cried out in panic. The fish that had been about to bite the bait were frightened away by their high voice.
“Mommy, Second Brother is gone!”
Qiu Xingyu rubbed her eyes and pointed at a building in the distance. “He said he wanted to play an adventure game. Eldest Brother and I thought he would return soon, but we haven’t seen him yet! Could something have happened to Second Brother?”
Qiu Tong saw that the dam was fenced off by railings and knew that Qiu Xingqiao could not have fallen in. Her heart relaxed a little.
“Don’t worry. Be good and wait for Mommy here. Don’t run around.”
“I’ll go over there to take a look…”

chapters.title: Chapter 231 - Locked In The Factory
chapters.content:
Chapter 231: Locked In The Factory
As the night deepened, the surrounding weeds limited their vision.
Qiu Tong shouted Qiu Xingqiao’s name anxiously. She was worried that some kidnappers had already taken him. She quickened her pace and searched the area but did not find any traces of Qiu Xingqiao.
Jin Yang wanted to get his guards to help. Qiu Xingyuan tugged at the corner of his shirt, indicating for him to bend over.
“He’s hiding on purpose. That building ahead is an abandoned factory. Bring Mommy there to find him!”
“Xingqiao and I will lock the metal door from the outside and buy you and Mommy some time to be alone.”
Qiu Xingyuan looked at Jin Yang. He really did not expect to be helping this fellow!
“I hope you can coax her. Otherwise, Xingqiao and I will be scolded.”
Seeing that he was still standing rooted to the ground, Qiu Xingyuan urged him. “Hurry up and go!”
Jin Yang finally understood what the children’s intentions were. He hurriedly chased after Qiu Tong and brought her to the vicinity of the building. He pointed in front awkwardly and said, “Could he be just fooling around and hiding inside?” Qiu Tong thought of Qiu Xingqiao’s character and felt that it was possible, so she followed him.
Qiu Tong searched every corner of the factory with a flashlight.
Song Yan wanted to accompany them, but Qiu Xingyu raised her arms and stood in front of him. “Uncle Song Yan, I’m so scared!”
“Will you stay here with me?”
Song Yan did not know how to reject her. He looked at Qiu Xingyu, who was hugging his thigh like a koala bear. He had no choice but to stand there and wait with her.
The three children each had their own task. Qiu Xingyuan waited for Jin Yang and Qiu Tong to walk into the factory and signaled to Qiu Xingqiao, who was hiding in the dark. The two of them struggled to push the metal door beside them. With a screeching sound, the door slowly closed.
Qiu Tong frowned in shock. She rushed over as fast as she could, but Qiu Xingyuan secured the door with an iron chain.
“You guys are ridiculous!”
Qiu Tong shouted angrily. Qiu Xingqiao pressed his face against a gap at the metal door. “Mommy! I’m sorry!”
“Two hours. Eldest Brother and I will stand guard in front. We’ll let you and him out when the time is up.”
Qiu Xingqiao was safe so Qiu Tong could finally relax. She turned to look at the calm Jin Yang, her tone questioning. “You colluded with them?” Jin Yang shook his head. “I only knew a few minutes earlier than you…”
“Let’s sit down and talk, alright?”
Jin Yang moved a metal bucket over and wiped the dust off with a handkerchief. He looked up at Qiu Tong. “Ever since you met your friend yesterday, you’ve been behaving resentfully against me. If I did anything wrong, you can just tell me. Perhaps I can explain.”
Qiu Tong was feeling very gloomy. She stared into Jin Yang’s dark eyes and bit her red lips angrily.
She kicked the metal bucket away, suppressing her frustration.
There were two old electric fans at the chimney of the factory. Spider webs hung on the fan blades. A rotten smell permeated the air.
Qiu Tong clenched her fists and asked in a low voice, “Are you hiding anything from me?”
Jin Yang was stunned and couldn’t answer.
Qiu Tong chuckled softly at his pause. She shook her head, sighing at her own stupidity and naivety. She was actually hoping that Jin Yang would be honest with her.
“The goal of our marriage of convenience is to get rid of Song Yan’s interference and his lawsuit. I’m very grateful to you for helping our family.”
“The children really like you. I can tell they want to play matchmaker…”
Qiu Tong’s voice choked, but she quickly returned to her normal state. She restrained the emotions in her eyes and looked at Jin Yang tenderly.
“I’m sorry to have troubled you. From now on, we will still pretend to be husband and wife in front of the children.”
“But privately, please keep your distance from me. I don’t want to create trouble for us!”
Qiu Tong had drawn a clear line between the two of them, defining their relationship as just business partners.
Jin Yang took a step forward. He wanted to grab her wrist, but his arm ended up just hanging in mid-air. He did not reach out…
Time passed by slowly. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao unlocked the iron chains with anticipation. They saw Jin Yang and Qiu Tong walk out. They still appeared cold with each other. Qiu Xingqiao glared at Jin Yang with questioning eyes.
Jin Yang sighed deeply. Qiu Xingyuan glanced at him with disappointment before chasing after Qiu Tong.
“Yo, looks like your plan has failed!”
As a bystander, Song Yan had seen through the children’s plan from the start. He pinched Qiu Xingyu’s chubby face and said smugly, “Maybe I will have a chance now!”
Qiu Xingyu twisted her body and struggled to jump down from his arms. She made a face and stuck her tongue out at Song Yan.
“We will never acknowledge you as our Daddy!”
“I like Uncle Jin Yang!”
Faced with her childish declaration, Song Yan rubbed the tip of his nose with his finger. “It looks like my approval rating is very low!”

chapters.title: Chapter 232 - Former Lovers
chapters.content:
Chapter 232: Former Lovers
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong quietly packed her things. The children followed her closely, their low spirits affected the entire atmosphere.
Jin Yang saw that she was struggling to carry the camping and fishing gear and wanted to help, but Qiu Tong pushed his hand away and said calmly, “Thank you, you don’t have to worry about this.” Anyone could tell that the two of them were in conflict.
Song Yan leaned against the SUV with his arms crossed as he gleefully watched the scene.
Jin Yang blocked Qiu Tong’s path and pressed against the car door. “Don’t be like this. We can resolve this.”
Qiu Tong remained expressionless. She looked up at Jin Yang and said in an extremely distant tone, “The children are watching. I hope you can maintain your dignity. I don’t want to talk to you about this now! Okay?”
Her tone was pointed. Jin Yang’s heart tightened and he sat in the driver’s seat.
The full moon hung in the sky as the SUV sped along the highway in silence. Meanwhile, a row of young women stood in the living room of the Jin residence in the capital…
Jin Tao examined the girls, who were all of similar height, and chose the one who looked most similar to Qiu Tong.
He nodded in satisfaction. “Have you memorized all the necessary information?”
“When you see them later, remember to keep your mouth shut! Don’t talk unnecessarily.”
Dressed in a light yellow dress, the girl nodded obediently and boarded the flight to S City.
The next day, Jin Yang came to Qiu Tong’s bedroom early in the morning. He wanted to wait for her to wake up and find an opportunity to resolve the misunderstanding between them.
He looked down at his watch and quietly listened to the sounds in the room.
Qiu Xingyuan passed by in his pajamas. He covered his mouth and yawned. He looked at Jin Yang with disappointment. “Mommy went out for a run with Song Yan early this morning. If you go out now, you should be able to make it for their last two rounds.”
Jin Yang frowned and was about to go out to find them when he received Shao An’s call.
Shao An stammered over the phone, “Sir, there’s a lady who wants to see you. Her status is quite special. You might need to meet her at the garden fountain…” Jin Yang frowned and went downstairs.
At the garden fountain, a woman in a pure white dress had her back to him. Shao An rubbed his hands nervously and hurried over when he saw Jin Yang.
“Qiu Tong?! Why is she here?”
Jin Yang asked in a low voice. Shao An hurriedly shook his head. “I was also shocked when I saw her just now. This lady is simply too similar to Qiu Tong!”
“But she’s the daughter of your father’s friend. Something happened at her home recently and she came to S City to avoid the fallout. You have to take care of her!”
Jin Yang looked very resistant. He stepped forward and had a perfunctory conversation with her.
Qiu Tong and Song Yan ran back. She wiped her sweat and saw the woman leaning on Jin Yang’s shoulder with teary eyes. She stumbled and fell.
Song Yan helped her remove her shoes and socks. When he saw Qiu Tong’s swollen ankle, he looked at her in amusement and said, “Jealousy makes one clumsy.”
“I can help if you want to test and see whose status is higher in Jin Yang’s heart. Yours or that woman’s.”
Song Yan suggested with a wicked smile. Qiu Tong stared at the woman who looked very similar to her. “Is she Jin Yang’s former lover?”
“I’m not sure. Maybe.”
Qiu Tong chuckled sadly. So Jin Tao was right…
Everyone knew that she was just a substitute. She was the only one who had been fooled!
Since Jin Yang’s lover had returned, he would probably leave, right?
Qiu Tong suddenly stood up. When her feet touched the ground, the pain made her lose her balance and stumble forward. Song Yan hurriedly pulled her into his arms and asked with a worried expression, “How is it? Do you want me to send you to the hospital?”
Jin Yang handed the woman over to Shao An and let him settle the issue. When he returned to the villa, he happened to see that ambiguous scene.
He strode over to Song Yan and wanted to snatch Qiu Tong over, but Qiu Tong stared at him coldly.
“Please help me back to the house…”
Qiu Tong placed her hand in Song Yan’s and walked slowly as Jin Yang watched.
Jin Yang clenched his fists. Song Yan smirked, his eyes revealing a smug smile.
Bang—The door to the villa was slammed shut. Qiu Xingyu widened her eyes in shock and craned her neck to look around.
When Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao saw that it was Song Yan who had helped her back, they sighed at the same time.
Qiu Xingqiao frowned. “Are they getting a divorce?”
Qiu Xingyuan rubbed his chin and pondered seriously. “Looking at the current situation, it’s very likely.”
Jin Yang was so stupid!
Would women listen to reason when they were angry? They just needed unconditional love and doting!
Qiu Xingyuan sighed deeply and shook his head. Even a young child knew this, but he did not!
When Jin Yang returned, Qiu Xingyu’s eyes darted around as she thought of a solution. She shot Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao a look and ran to Song Yan’s side, dragging him outside. “Uncle Song Yan! Little Yu lost her favorite toy. It might be in the garden outside. Help me find it!”
Song Yan knew their plan, but he also wanted to see how low Jin Yang would go to appease Qiu Tong. He happily left with the children.
Jin Yang squatted down with a pained expression when he saw the bruise on Qiu Tong’s ankle.
The moment his cold fingertips touched Qiu Tong’s skin, she frowned and shouted, “Don’t touch me!”

chapters.title: Chapter 233 - Reconciliation After A Fight
chapters.content:
Chapter 233: Reconciliation After A Fight
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“I don’t need you.”
Qiu Tong pushed Jin Yang away. She had originally wanted to use her special ability to heal her injury, but then she remembered that Song Yan had personally witnessed her injury. If she were to heal in just a few hours, she might arouse his suspicion. Qiu Tong lowered her hand and Jin Yang guessed her reason for stopping. He wanted to apply the medicine for her.
She lowered her eyes as images of the woman in the white dress leaning on Jin Yang’s shoulder flashed across her mind.
Qiu Tong shook her head, chasing away the messy thoughts.
“Our so-called marriage of convenience is pointless. Song Yan has no intention of taking the children away. We don’t need to continue pretending to be husband and wife. I’ll think of a way to explain to the children. You just need to move out of the villa with your things.”
Instead of waiting for Jin Yang to bring it up, it was better for her to sever this ill-fated relationship that should never have begun!
Qiu Tong’s pride made her unwilling to be the inferior party in love.
Jin Yang heard her merciless words and looked up at Qiu Tong in disbelief. “Because of Song Yan?”
Qiu Tong stood up and was about to leave when Jin Yang angrily pressed her shoulder.
Thump! Qiu Tong grabbed his hand and bent her body slightly, throwing Jin Yang to the ground.
Jin Yang wanted to fight back, but Qiu Tong pressed her elbow against his throat mercilessly. Her voice was cold as she warned, “I don’t want to fight with you. Please leave quietly and let us preserve our last bit of dignity!”
“She probably doesn’t want to see you injured either!”
Who was she? When Jin Yang heard Qiu Tong’s words, he propped himself up on the floor.
Qiu Tong limped to the bedroom door. Just as she pushed the door open, she heard hasty footsteps coming from behind. She gritted her teeth and threw a punch. Jin Yang used his palm to block her attack. Qiu Tong bent her knee and kicked his lower abdomen. Jin Yang dodged. Taking advantage of the moment, she grabbed the door handle and wanted to lock Jin Yang outside.
Jin Yang reacted quickly and stuck his arm into the gap to prevent the door from closing.
Qiu Tong exerted a lot of force. Seeing Jin Yang frown but remain silent, she instinctively let go of the door.
Even if Jin Yang did not suffer any bone fractures, he would still need a few days to recover from that. His arm would definitely be bruised and so painful that he would not be able to lift it.
Qiu Tong could not hide her worry. Jin Yang smiled.
“It’s quite worth it to exchange an arm for a chance to say a few words.”
Jin Yang walked into the room. He looked at Qiu Tong seriously and said sincerely, “As the president, countless terrorists and enemies have been eyeing me from the day I took office. They want my life. You saved me by the roadside, do you remember?”
“I was heavily injured and unconscious for nearly half a month, so I lost a portion of my memories.”
“I don’t remember what happened, and I can’t tell if the fragmented memories are real or just a dream I fabricated.”
Jin Yang looked at Qiu Tong deeply. He told her everything he had previously hidden.
Qiu Tong’s eyes flickered as she listened quietly in shock. She recalled the scars on Jin Yang’s body and could not help frowning as she guessed how many times he had been on the verge of death.
Jin Yang chuckled, as if he could see her worry. He comforted her, “I’m very safe now.”
“I can’t give you an affirmative answer to what you want to know. I don’t want to lie to you either.”
“But at this moment, the Jin Yang standing in front of you only has you in his heart! I didn’t propose marriage only because I wanted to help you keep your children. It was just an excuse which I spent a lot of effort to come up with…”
“When I found out in the capital that you and the children were in danger, I decided to abandon everything and rush to S City to find you. I already decided that the only woman by my side would be you.”
Jin Yang’s confession was heartfelt. But his timing was somewhat off.
After the fight, Qiu Tong’s hair was a little messy and Jin Yang’s shirt was stained with dust.
Qiu Tong’s emotions were in turmoil. She went from shock to acceptance before asking in a soft voice, “What about the woman outside? Isn’t she your lover?”
“So you’re jealous?”
Jin Yang asked in surprise. Qiu Tong frowned unhappily. He immediately spread his hands and explained, “I don’t know her.”
“She’s the daughter of my father’s friend and came from the capital. I only met her once per my family’s instructions.”
“Shao An will handle the rest. I won’t meet her again.”
Qiu Tong did not expect the truth to be like this. She said in a huff, “But she looks very similar to me. I thought…”
Jin Yang smirked and slowly walked over to Qiu Tong. He raised his hand and pulled her into his arms. He leaned over and whispered gently in her ear, “But she’s not you! My heart is very small and can only accommodate one person. Her name is Qiu Tong.”
Qiu Tong clenched her fists and hammered his chest. Jin Yang pretended to be in pain. “Ouch!”
The temperature in the room rose because of the change in their relationship.. Qiu Tong looked at Jin Yang’s profile, but her heart was still troubled by his missing memories and of the former lover whom Jin Tao mentioned.

chapters.title: Chapter 234 - Ye Luan Was Attacked
chapters.content:
Chapter 234: Ye Luan Was Attacked
At the intersection, the traffic light changed colors.
The children deliberately found an excuse to stall for time as they brought Song Yan around.
A small crowd had gathered near the parking lot of the supermarket. They were holding baskets and pointing across the road with complicated expressions.
Qiu Xingyu ran over curiously. She stood on her tiptoes to see what was going on.
“Regardless of what a child did wrong, it’s definitely wrong to beat him! What if they cause permanent damage to the child?”
“That child looks very stubborn. Look! He is even fighting back. It’s obvious that he has had a poor upbringing!”
An old lady in a flowery dress couldn’t help muttering, “Kids these days are really troublesome. They always cause trouble outside. This month alone, the school called my granddaughter’s parents to go to the school three times. My daughter doesn’t even dare to go to the school to face the form teacher anymore. She can’t scold or beat the child!”
Qiu Xingyu squeezed through the crowd and successfully came to the front.
She just wanted to take a look at the commotion and didn’t expect to see a familiar figure. Qiu Xingyu couldn’t help shouting, “Brother Ye Luan?”
Across the road, Ye Luan struggled to kick the tall stranger beside him away. When he heard Qiu Xingyu’s voice, he immediately shook his head nervously. “Run! Go back and find Auntie Qiu…”
Ye Luan wanted to say something else, but the man covered his mouth with his hand.
With a dark expression, he bent over and threatened Ye Luan. “Shout again and I’ll kill them all!”
“You don’t want them to be implicated by you and live in danger from now on, right?”
The man could tell that Ye Luan cared a lot about the little girl. “As long as you obediently hand over what we want, we will never cause trouble for you again. That thing is useless to you, it will only be of the greatest use to us!”
Ye Luan gritted his teeth and didn’t say anything. He glared stubbornly at the man with the scar on his face!
He had been too careless!
Recently, Ye Luan didn’t notice anyone following him. He thought that things were over.
However, he did not expect this man to waylay him at the entrance of the school and pretend to be his father, wanting to drag him into the car and take him away.
Ye Luan wanted to run, but there were too many students and parents around. Cars and parents blocked the road.
“I’m really sorry, my son is throwing a tantrum! Stop running! Come back now…”
The man fabricated a lie while Ye Luan tried his best to explain that he was not related to him. However, the surrounding parents looked at him coldly and even advised him not to quarrel with his father. “Daddy is doing this for your own good. Little boy, you have to understand where he is coming from!”
This situation made Ye Luan panic and frightened. He could only run towards the villa as fast as he could.
Auntie Qiu! Save him!
This was the only thought that kept surfacing in Ye Luan’s mind…
The strange man grabbed Ye Luan’s throat and tried his best to drag him into the car. However, Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu rushed over from the other side of the road. Little Yu shouted, “Let go of Brother Ye Luan! You’re a baddie! We’ve never seen you before!”
“They are child traffickers!”
Qiu Xingyu turned around to look at the surrounding parents for help. Her dark eyes were filled with tears. Her pitiful and aggrieved look made the surrounding people waver as they stared fiercely at the strange man. The righteous crowd automatically pulled Ye Luan over and asked warily, “You said that you are his father. Do you have evidence? Hurry up and call the police. Call the police and let them investigate his identity!”
“You guys… are really nosy.”
The strange man gritted his teeth and ran towards Qiu Xingyu. He raised his hand and grabbed Qiu Xingyu’s collar, wanting to use her as a hostage.
Qiu Xingyu was shocked. She hovered in midair and kept waving her arms.
Qiu Xingqiao took the opportunity to rush over. He aimed at the man’s knee and kicked. “Elder Brother!”
Qiu Xingyuan took out some powder and sprinkled it over the man’s eyes. The intense pain made the man sway and let go.
Qiu Xingyu fell heavily and Ye Luan rushed over to support her.
“Brother Ye Luan?”
Qiu Xingyu rubbed her aching butt. When she opened her eyes, she saw that Ye Luan’s arm was bruised. The wound was stained with mud and blood.
“Just you wait!”
The man’s vision blurred as he crawled up from the ground and fled in a sorry state.
Qiu Xingyu and Qiu Xingqiao helped Ye Luan to stand up. Qiu Xingyuan pursed his thin lips. Without a word, he picked up Ye Luan’s school bag from the ground and helped him carry it. Qiu Xingyuan muttered, “How troublesome.”
Ye Luan lowered his eyes as guilt flashed across his face. He said in a soft voice, “I’m sorry.”
Song Yan stood under the streetlamp with his arms crossed, his eyes fixed in the direction where the man had fled.
It was just an ordinary gangster. The Qiu family’s children were enough to handle them. He did not need to make a move.
But why would a gangster cause trouble for Ye Luan?
He was just an ordinary school student, a wandering child whom Qiu Tong had picked up. Could it be that he had a secret identity?
Song Yan stared at Ye Luan’s back profile and touched the corner of his lips with interest. Things were getting more and more interesting.

chapters.title: Chapter 235 - Gray Zone
chapters.content:
Chapter 235: Gray Zone
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
In the villa, Qiu Tong saw that Ye Luan was injured and hurriedly brought him to the bedroom for treatment.
Qiu Xingyuan told Qiu Tong what had happened. Qiu Tong was putting disinfectant on Ye Luan’s wound and he squeezed his eyes tightly in pain.
Ye Luan’s entire body was trembling, but he still gritted his teeth and endured it, unwilling to reveal any weakness.
Qiu Tong knew that Ye Luan must be hiding something, so she felt guilty. She did not probe further. Instead, she turned around and looked at Qiu Xingyuan and the rest. She said in a harsh tone, “Mommy told you before that you’re not allowed to go out without good reason, especially when there’s been danger recently!”
“Go back to your rooms now and write a diary entry to reflect on yourself. Mommy will check it tomorrow!”
Qiu Tong frowned when she saw them standing by the bed. She rested her hands on her waist and asked, “Are you all being disobedient?”
Qiu Xingyu pursed her lips and pushed Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao out the door with her.
Hearing the sound of the door closing, Qiu Tong saw the sweat on Ye Luan’s forehead. She took out a towel and wiped it for him.
Ye Luan’s lips were pale. He opened his eyes and said weakly, “Auntie Qiu, I’m sorry.”
Qiu Tong shook her head and smiled as she bandaged his wound. “The wound needs to be changed every day. I’ll take your temperature again at night. I’m afraid your wound might be infected by the dirt. Don’t worry about anything else, leave it to me.”
Qiu Tong gently stroked Ye Luan’s forehead and tucked him in before walking out of the room.
She returned to the bedroom and turned on the computer with a solemn expression, her fingers typing furiously on the keyboard.
Qiu Tong hacked into all the nearby surveillance systems as fast as she could. She locked onto the surveillance cameras across the school and found the relevant footage.
She clicked on the mouse and zoomed in. A clear face appeared on the screen, and the screenshot was sent to the police station’s registration system.
Qiu Tong soon found out who the person who tried to kidnap Ye Luan was. She had information on the other party’s identity and made an automatic system search. She searched through the entire internet for every little bit of information on him. As the information loaded, Qiu Tong stared at it without blinking until an address popped up on the screen.
Late at night, Qiu Tong pushed open Qiu Xingyu’s bedroom door. She looked at the girl leaning on the desk with a pen in her hand, feeling a little exasperated and amused.
She removed the pen Qiu Xingyu was holding and carried her to the bed.
Qiu Xingyu was in a daze. She opened her eyes and saw Qiu Tong. She opened her arms and snuggled in Qiu Tong’s embrace. “Mommy, I didn’t do anything wrong!”
Qiu Tong comforted her. Before she left, she saw two lines of crooked handwriting in Qiu Xingyu’s diary. “When Brother Ye Luan was in danger, Little Yu rushed over to help him. Because we’re family, Little Yu is good!”
“Mommy is just worried about me, so she’s very fierce. I know, so I don’t blame her!”
Qiu Tong chuckled. This little girl was really smart and adorable.
She checked that Ye Luan’s injuries had stabilized and left the villa.
Qiu Tong looked down at the navigation information on her phone and drove towards the address where the gangster was.
This was a downtown area. Many gangsters who did business in the black market lived here, and the police would deliberately avoid this place when patrolling at night. Simply put, these two blocks were gray zones beyond the reach of the law.
Qiu Tong parked the car at the intersection. As she stepped into the alley, the gangsters squatting by the side whistled at her.
They fiddled with the sharp daggers with their fingers as they stared at Qiu Tong with murderous gazes.
Qiu Tong’s expression was calm as she looked at them without a hint of panic. She rummaged through the photo album on her phone for a photo of the man she was looking for. She then approached one of the gangsters who looked like he had the most experience and connections. “Do you know where he lives?”
The old gangster shrugged and reached out an open palm. and Qiu Tong handed him a wad of cash.
“Turn left, third room on the second floor.”
The old gangster told her, but a few other burly thugs saw Qiu Tong giving out money. They slowly approached, dragging metal rods on the ground.
Qiu Tong frowned. “Don’t block my way. I’m busy.”
The leader wiped the corners of his mouth and laughed arrogantly. “Hehe, pretty lady, we are busy people too.”
“Either you give us money or you play with us and let us have a good time.”
Lecherous expressions appeared on their faces. Qiu Tong watched as the red dot on the tracking device started to move. She said impatiently, “We’ll have to see if you still have the life to come and get it!”
She dashed to the thugs’ side and lowered her body to sweep their lower bodies.
The thugs were caught off guard by Qiu Tong and their metal rods scattered all over the ground. The leader felt that he had been embarrassed and crawled up in a sorry state, wanting to punch Qiu Tong’s face, but his fist stopped five centimeters away…
Qiu Tong gripped his wrist tightly, the sound of bones breaking could be heard.
“Alright!”
The surrounding gangsters whistled and cheered. Qiu Tong did not wish to continue fighting. She just stepped over them and headed to her destination.
Someone’s here. She is quite skilled. Pack your things and leave.
A thug hiding in the dark sent a message to warn the man.

chapters.title: Chapter 236 - Gangster Den
chapters.content:
Chapter 236: Gangster Den
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The dilapidated building reeked of corruption everywhere.
Trash was piled in front of every door, and the wooden stairs creaked.
Qiu Tong followed the old gangster’s directions and found the room. She looked down at the GPS on her phone and saw the flashing red dot.
The man who had attacked Ye Luan was squatting behind the door. He was holding a cup of instant noodles, drinking tea and chewing on a stale steamed bun.
A phone placed on a paint bucket vibrated. He glanced at it and cursed before opening the message. “Damn you! You are paying me so little but I almost got arrested by the police. If you don’t raise the price, I’ll do this business with others!”
Qiu Tong took a step back when she heard the voice coming from inside. She then raised her leg and kicked open the ajar door.
The man’s mouth was still half full when he finally read the message on his phone. His eyes widened in shock.
He threw his instant noodles to the ground and tossed the paint bucket towards Qiu Tong. He turned around and wanted to jump out of the window.
The man was clinging onto the railing with both hands. Before his other foot stepped onto the windowsill, Qiu Tong had already grabbed his collar and dragged him back onto the ground.
“I’ll fight you to the death!”
Seeing that he could not escape, the man took out a foldable knife from his pocket and made stabbing motions.
Qiu Tong dodged and her waist hit the corner of the table. She gasped in pain.
The gangster used to belong to a criminal gang. He was timid by nature and would hide in a corner during gang fights. He had never tried to attack anyone with a knife before.
His movements were stiff as he brandished the foldable knife. Qiu Tong took advantage of the situation and struck his abdomen with her elbow, snatching the weapon.
Bang bang—Qiu Tong punched his head twice. The gangster fell to the ground and lost consciousness for several moments.
When he opened his eyes again, Qiu Tong had tied his limbs to the bench.
The gangster saw Qiu Tong rummaging around and whimpered. “Who the hell are you?”
“Please do me a favor. I’ve never committed arson or murder!”
“If not for the fact that I can’t survive, who would want to hide in a place like this and live such a dark, shameful life?”
The gangster begged for mercy as he shifted his body, his feet making contact with the bench. Qiu Tong looked at him coldly. “Who sent you?”
“Which matter are you referring to?”
The gangster instinctively asked in return. Seeing Qiu Tong frown, he hurriedly explained, “I stole a few phones previously, you…”
Qiu Tong could tell that he was just pretending to be an idiot. She bent over to pick up the foldable knife from the ground and used her fingers to push the sharp blade against the gangster’s neck artery. “I just need to gently press down here and you will die without even feeling any pain. If you dare to lie again, I’ll let you die.”
“You wanted to kidnap my son. Who was behind this? What do you want?”
Qiu Tong exerted more pressure and a bloody cut appeared on the gangster’s neck. He was so frightened that his legs trembled and he shrank back.
Ye Luan?! This thought flashed across the gangster’s mind, but he quickly dismissed it. “Impossible!”
“His family is all dead. You can’t be his mother!”
The gangster had some information about Ye Luan’s situation. Qiu Tong felt that there was more to this than meets the eye. She aimed the foldable knife at the gangster’s thigh and drove it in.
The blade dug into his muscles as he howled.
Qiu Tong pulled out her knife and placed it on the gangster’s neck. “Do you want to die or live?”
The gangster did not dare to look at Qiu Tong. He was so frightened that he peed his pants and cried miserably. “Please let me go. I really don’t know! I’m just doing it for money. They asked me to capture a boy. After I capture him alive, I’ll wait for them to contact me.”
“Ye Luan is too smart. I followed him for a few days but didn’t succeed. I was even injured by a few children today.”
The gangster swallowed hard. “I’m telling the truth! If you don’t believe me, you can look at my phone records!”
He unlocked his phone with his fingerprint and took the initiative to point out the relevant records. Qiu Tong quickly scanned the information. “You can find him?”
“It has always been a one-way communication. He’ll call when he needs to reach me. He will let the phone ring thrice and hang up, after which I’ll call him back.”
“He changes his phone number every time. When I try to call the earlier numbers, it’s always disconnected.”
The gangster had his suspicions about this before, but the other party’s payment was too generous. He accepted it greedily.
Qiu Tong realized that the other party was very vigilant and careful. She removed the folding knife and the gangster heaved a sigh of relief.
“When was the last time you contacted him?”
The gangster recalled. “Around five last night. He told me I had to get the child here as soon as possible.”
“He’ll probably contact me today.”
The gangster’s phone rang.
The call ended after three rings. Qiu Tong looked at the encrypted caller ID and pressed the redial button.
She pressed the knife against the gangster’s artery again. “You know what to say!”
The call went through and there was silence on the other end.
The gangster cleared his throat, his voice trembling as he tried his best to control it. “That little brat is really too powerful. I almost caught him, but a few fellows who were slightly younger than him appeared out of nowhere and saved him..”

chapters.title: Chapter 237 - Accepting Ye Luan
chapters.content:
Chapter 237: Accepting Ye Luan
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“You are running out of time.”
“By the end of the week. If I don’t hear good news from you, you will need to pay for breach of contract.”
The other party used a satellite phone, and the voice had been processed using a voice changer. Qiu Tong had no way to track the other party.
The gangster sat on the ground, stammering, “I didn’t lie to you, right?!”
Qiu Tong surveyed her surroundings. She bent down and grabbed the gangster by the collar, before pushing him out.
The gangster pressed his hand against the door frame and looked back at Qiu Tong in fear. “Where are you taking me?”
Qiu Tong tilted her head, looking especially impatient. “If you want to wish here, I won’t stop you.”
She needed to control the gangster so that she could contact the other party. She would have to slowly lure the other party into revealing their identity and goal.
If she let the gangster stay here, he could easily reveal to the other party what happened today.
By then, the situation would be completely different. Qiu Tong could not take the risk.
The gangster hesitated. Qiu Tong saw that daylight was approaching and directly drove the knife hilt at his neck, rendering him unconscious. She then dragged the unconscious gangster into the car.
The moon hanging in the sky dimmed, and the sun rose faintly in the east.
In the room of the villa, Ye Luan was supporting his injured arm and strenuously packing his luggage.
The table was filled with the gifts Qiu Tong had given him. Ye Luan carefully put them away. He looked around the room reluctantly and gently stroked the blanket. Although he hadn’t known Qiu Tong for long, he treated the Qiu family as his own.
It was because they were his cherished family that Ye Luan had to leave them…
Ye Luan opened the door and pushed his luggage to the door, planning to disappear into the night.
“Where are you going?”
A clear voice came from behind. Ye Luan turned around stiffly and saw Qiu Xingyuan sitting on the sofa. He frowned, not knowing how to explain.
Qiu Xingyuan stood up and walked to the entrance. “Even if you want to leave, you have to bid farewell to everyone. Sneaking away is extremely rude. Did we do anything wrong to you? What’s the reason?”
Ye Luan lowered his eyes, his knuckles turning white as he gripped the luggage handle. “It’s not you guys, it’s me.”
“I’ll settle my own problems. I can’t implicate you.”
Qiu Xingyuan frowned and pursed his thin lips in disagreement. “The terrorists in the hospital kidnapped and held us hostage. You helped us without any regards to your own safety.”
“That incident had nothing to do with you. According to your logic, you could have just watched from the side.”
“Do you think we’re cold-blooded and selfish? Or are we not worthy of your trust?”
Qiu Xingyuan’s tone was sharp. Ye Luan opened his mouth several times to explain, but he could only swallow his words. In the end, he just shook his head silently.
Qiu Xingqiao was woken by the commotion outside in the bedroom. He overheard the conversation between his elder brother and Ye Luan and immediately rushed over to snatch his luggage.
He raised his chin. “I hated you when Mommy brought you back!”
“But after spending so much time together, I… I’ve already accepted and gotten used to having you at home. I’ve also told the children in kindergarten that I have two brothers. Don’t even think about leaving!”
“Even if there’s trouble, we will definitely be able to solve it.”
When Ye Luan saw their attitude, he felt a surge of warmth in his heart. He had never felt such warmth before.
Bang! Qiu Tong dragged in the kidnapped gangster, only to see three pairs of eyes staring at her.
Qiu Tong tied the gangster to a stone pillar in the living room and looked back at the piece of luggage placed in the empty space. “You’re running away from home?”
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao shook their heads at the same time. They pointed at Ye Luan and refused bluntly. “It’s him!”
There was a huge commotion on the first floor. Jin Yang, Ke Le and the rest came out of the room and saw the dazed gangster. They stared at Qiu Tong in confusion, waiting for her to explain the situation…
“Ke Le, Shao An, please bring him to the basement and arrange for someone to keep an eye on him 24/7. Be vigilant”
“Also, the guards outside the villa should be stationed at the most vulnerable spots…”
Qiu Tong directly ordered Shao An. Shao An looked at Jin Yang with a questioning gaze.
Jin Yang nodded in tacit agreement. Shao An immediately brought the gangster to the basement.
Qiu Tong wanted to set up a tracking system on the gangster’s phone. She typed away on her laptop to design a tracking program. Little Yu laid beside her in her adorable pajamas. She glanced at what Qiu Tong was doing in confusion, before taking over the laptop and skillfully started writing some code.
Qiu Xingyu’s proficiency far exceeded Qiu Tong’s. The program she designed was even more meticulous than Qiu Tong’s.
She was indeed a future big-time hacker!
Qiu Tong rubbed the top of Qiu Xingyu’s head and kissed her cheek to encourage her.
Ye Luan’s eyes darkened as he clenched his fists hesitantly.
Faced with concern for the Qiu family, he had no choice but to tell them the truth. “I have what they want. As long as they don’t get it, they will continue to chase after me.”
“I can’t trouble you anymore. Auntie Qiu, thank you. I better go.”
Ye Luan stood up and bowed deeply in Qiu Tong’s direction.. He bit his lips stubbornly, his voice choked with emotion.

chapters.title: Chapter 238 - Setting Up An Ambush
chapters.content:
Chapter 238: Setting Up An Ambush
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong looked lovingly at the sensible and patient Ye Luan. He was obviously afraid and vulnerable, but he stubbornly chose to face his troubles alone.
Qiu Xingyu opened her arms and blocked the door. Her eyes were filled with tears as she said, “You’re not allowed to leave!”
Qiu Tong grabbed Ye Luan’s wrist and pulled him into her arms. She used a gentle voice to placate Ye Luan. “We will help you solve the danger you face. This is your home, a harbor where you can seek shelter from the outside world.”
Qiu Tong saw that Ye Luan didn’t say anything else. She looked up at Jin Yang. “Those people definitely won’t just hire two or three gangsters.”
“I’m guessing that there will be other thugs lying in ambush around. They’re just not as stupid as that gangster in the basement. We haven’t noticed them…”
Qiu Xingyuan looked at the pitch-black darkness outside and said in an exceptionally calm voice, “Actually, we can set a trap to lure them in.”
Since the other party was anxious to get what Ye Luan had hidden, they could use this to their advantage to control the situation.
Qiu Xingyu carried the laptop over. She sat on the ground and tapped on it. “Mommy! I’ll transfer all the surveillance cameras nearby to this laptop and design an analysis and an automatic alarm system.”
“The moment any suspicious movements or dangerous weapons appear on the screen, the program will alert the police!”
Qiu Xingyu lifted her chin proudly, waiting for Qiu Tong to praise her.
Qiu Xingqiao swiftly moved some sandbags and wooden posts to block the door and window at the bottom of the building. “It’s safe now!”
Qiu Xingyuan held his sketchbook and quietly sketched on the sofa.
After a long time, he handed a complicated-looking map to Qiu Tong. “Uncle Ke Le, please set up roadblocks at the main intersection. Also, set up the electric fence in the garden and the outer wall. This way, no matter how many enemies try to break through, they will be captured by us.”
Qiu Tong blinked in shock. She had not expected the three children to be so clear and decisive in the face of danger.
Their arrangements were even better than her and Jin Yang’s.
Wait a minute! Why were their eyes shining with excitement?
Qiu Tong nodded at Ke Le, indicating for him to follow Qiu Xingyuan’s plan. She lowered her head and pushed Ye Luan’s luggage back to his room.
In the bedroom, Qiu Tong took out the clothes from the luggage and hung them in the closet.
Ye Luan stood beside her like a helpless little animal. He wanted to open his mouth several times but swallowed his words.
Qiu Tong sensed his nervousness and gratitude. She teased him in a relaxed tone, “You’re still a child.”
“Running away from home only with a bunch of thin clothes?”
“Outside, money is what you need the most! Otherwise, where do you plan to stay tonight? Under the bridge beside Qingshui River?”
“It’s very cold there. There will be other tramps coming to snatch your territory. Your arms and legs are so weak. How can you win?”
Ye Luan listened in confusion, “Auntie Qiu, have you… lived there before?”
Qiu Tong paused as she tidied her bed. She recalled her experience in the post-apocalyptic era…
She competed with zombies for food every day. Qiu Tong shook her head and smiled. “Of course not. I saw it on television.”
“Do you need me to sleep with you? Let me tell you a story, okay? Little Yu especially likes to hear me tell fairy tales.”
Qiu Tong found two children’s books and gestured for Ye Luan to come over.
It was rare for Ye Luan to behave so shyly. He laid beside Qiu Tong in his pajamas.
The door handle turned and the three children staggered in at the same time. Qiu Xingqiao was still hunched over in an eavesdropping position. Qiu Xingyuan stood awkwardly at the door tidying the hem of his light blue pajamas. Little Yu rushed to Qiu Tong’s side and pleaded coquettishly, “Mommy! Little Yu wants to hear it too…”
“Eldest Brother and Second Brother both want you to accompany them also. You can’t be biased towards Brother Ye Luan!”
Qiu Tong burst out laughing. She saw Ye Luan taking the initiative to give up his seat beside her and patted the edge of the bed helplessly. “Alright.”
Qiu Tong’s voice was very gentle. Slowly, the children closed their eyes and fell asleep.
