Jin Yang quietly walked to the door. Qiu Tong put her index finger to her lips and the two of them carried the children back to their own rooms.
Ke Le and Shao An were well-coordinated. The security arrangements outside the courtyard were already prepared.
Qiu Tong stood at the entrance and looked at the red rising sun. “I’ve checked the other party’s details, but they didn’t leave any traces.”
She looked up at Jin Yang, hinting at him.
Only high-ranking officials and special organizations could do such a thing.
Either way, it meant that Ye Luan had a deep secret! And that he was in an extremely dangerous situation…
Jin Yang hugged Qiu Tong’s shoulder and said firmly, “Don’t worry, I’m here.”
In a room in the S City hotel, a man wearing a golden mask was wearing a black robe. He pressed the voice changer device on his neck and dialed a few numbers.. The moment the call went through, he said, “The operation will begin at sunset.”

chapters.title: Chapter 239 - Getting The Location
chapters.content:
Chapter 239: Getting The Location
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
In the morning, with a loud bang, a net trap in the garden was triggered.
The children rushed out curiously to check the situation. Qiu Tong led Ke Le and the other mercenaries to surround the net trap with guns.
Qiu Xingyuan pressed the lift button and the net trap slowly descended.
Qiu Tong frowned in confusion when she saw the familiar figure. “Lin Shan?”
Qiu Xingyu and Qiu Xingqiao blocked the door with disappointed expressions. Shao An retreated to the back with the president.
Lin Shan was in a sorry state. She stamped her feet and shook off the mud covering her body. She glared at Qiu Tong resentfully.
The attempted kidnapping of the Qiu family children failed. Shu Xian’s factory was facing suspension, and Mayor Shen was putting pressure on them on behalf of a high-ranking government official.
Shu Xian had been exceptionally irritable recently. From time to time, he would drink excessively and beat Lin Shan up.
Lin Shan blamed everything on Qiu Tong. She had stolen a few bottles of paint and harmful chemicals from the weapons factory. She had wanted to spray red paint on the outer wall of the Qiu family’s villa so that the surrounding neighbors could see it. She wanted to embarrass Qiu Tong!
However, Lin Shan did not expect to be strung up in a net the moment she sneaked in.
Qiu Tong crossed her arms and looked at Lin Shan coldly. Her tone was exasperated and mocking. “Shao An, please hand her over to the police.”
“Lin Shan broke into a house with harmful chemicals. She’ll probably be in custody for a few months.”
Shao An immediately called the police chief. When Lin Shan heard their conversation, she panicked and hurriedly retorted, “Do you have evidence?”
“I was just passing by.”
Qiu Tong pointed at the surveillance camera under the streetlamp and explained kindly, “Your crime was recorded. Explain it to the police.”
Ke Le ran out of the room and looked at Qiu Tong. “Someone’s calling!”
Qiu Tong realized that it was the gangster’s phone. She ignored Lin Shan and ran over. The children and Ye Luan were already gathered in the living room. They held their breaths and stared nervously at the tracking system.
The phone rang three times before Qiu Tong called back.
Beep beep—The call went through. Qiu Xingyu immediately typed on her computer keyboard to track and lock onto the location of the caller. Qiu Tong gestured for the gangster to stall for time.
The gangster’s voice was hoarse. “Boss, I still need a few days.”
There was a long pause on the other end. An ear-piercing electric current rang out. The voice that had been processed by the voice changer sounded strange and terrifying. “Ye Luan, are you listening?”
“Someone will be coming to get you tonight.”
“Your little traps are so childish. They can’t stop me.”
Ye Luan clenched his fists and shouted into the phone, “I won’t let you succeed…”
Qiu Tong’s hairs stood on end. She covered Ye Luan’s mouth with her hand, trying to control his agitation.
This call was like a pitch-black abyss that engulfed everyone in the living room. Qiu Tong’s scalp felt numb, as if there were two pairs of eyes secretly peeping at them. Jin Yang frowned and walked to Qiu Xingyu’s side to look at the screen. “How is it?”
Qiu Xingyu’s palms were covered in sweat. She shook her head and pointed at the flashing codes on the screen.
“The call was too short. I could only track that the other party is in S City. Then, he discovered me and I lost the trail.”
Qiu Xingyu pouted in frustration. This was the first time she had experienced defeat.
Jin Yang bent over and hugged her. “You have already done an amazing job.”
As the youngest hacker in the country, Qiu Xingyu’s skills were considered outstanding in the industry.
Having been coaxed, Qiu Xingyu smiled brightly. She raised two fingers and waved them. “Although he escaped my tracking, I planted a virus code on him.”
“I designed that code. No anti-virus software will detect it.”
“The moment the other party calls any number on his phone, my program will start automatically and record all the other party’s calls.”
Qiu Xingyu looked at Qiu Tong proudly. Qiu Xingyuan narrowed his eyes. “How do we listen in on them?”
Everyone looked at Qiu Xingyu expectantly. She lowered her head and touched the tip of her nose with her hand, muttering guiltily, “We’ll be able to hear after we get his phone. The original intention of my program was to eavesdrop on Mommy’s conversation with Uncle Jin Yang.”
“So I didn’t design it to include cloud transfer…”
Qiu Tong was amused by her and sighed deeply.
Shao An rushed in from outside. “Sir, according to the location clues provided by Miss Qiu Tong and Little Yu, we have tracked the other party to a hotel apartment in the center of S City. According to the front desk, there has been a strange man checking in recently. The car is already prepared and we set off at any time.”
Qiu Tong looked at Jin Yang in surprise. She planned to go along with him.
The children were also clamoring to go too. Qiu Tong asked Ke Le to stay at home to accompany them.
In the car, Qiu Tong stole a glance at Jin Yang’s profile and asked hesitantly, “How did you guess that he was at the hotel?”
“I interrogated the person locked in the basement last night. From his description, I can sense the other party has a pretty high status.”
“Such people won’t stay in basements or residential buildings, so I sent Shao An to check the registration information of all high-end hotel apartments in S City.”
Jin Yang smiled as he held Qiu Tong’s hand and rubbed his thumb against her fingertips.

chapters.title: Chapter 240 - Chen Jia Comes To Stay
chapters.content:
Chapter 240: Chen Jia Comes To Stay
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
On the top floor of S City hotel, Jin Yang shielded Qiu Tong behind him and nodded at Shao An. “Let’s begin.”
The entire hotel had been surrounded. All the entrances and exits of the hotel were strictly guarded by the presidential guards. Shao An led his team to break open the door of the suite and charged in. Everyone searched every room with guns, but they did not find any suspicious persons.
There were two bottles of red wine and champagne on the coffee table in the living room. The remnants of a cigar in the crystal ashtray was still burning.
Qiu Tong turned back. “He probably left a few minutes before we arrived at the hotel.”
Jin Yang frowned. Their operation this time was extremely secretive and last minute. No one should have been able to obtain any information in advance.
However, the other party was able to leave first, as if he was deliberately provoking them.
Qiu Tong gritted her teeth, wanting to find some clues about the other party in the suite. A guard found clues in the bathroom and ran out to report.
Jin Yang and Qiu Tong rushed over. Looking at the phone and satellite communication devices soaked in the toilet bowl, she reached out to pick them up.
Shao An opened a sealed bag and took the initiative to take the phone away.
Qiu Tong instructed solemnly, “You must repair it!”
Ring ring—Qiu Tong want try to find some hair or other evidence in the hotel bedroom. When she heard the phone ring, she picked it up and heard Ke Le’s nervous voice coming from the other end. “Boss, come back quickly.”
“A lady who calls herself Chen Jia is outside. She wants to see Jin Yang.”
Qiu Tong looked at Jin Yang and frowned slightly. She hung up the phone and asked, “Who’s Chen Jia?”
Jin Yang’s movements froze for a moment. After learning about the situation in the villa, he handed the hotel matter over to Shao An and rushed back with Qiu Tong.
In the car on the way back, Jin Yang gripped the steering wheel silently.
His phone kept vibrating. Qiu Tong rolled down the window and tilted her head to look at the night view outside.
Jin Yang cleared his throat and answered the call. He grunted in a perfunctory manner a couple of times before hanging up and explaining, “It’s my father.”
Qiu Tong recalled Jin Tao and nodded.
The two of them returned to the villa and saw Chen Jia standing in the courtyard in a simple white dress. Ke Le stood guard at the door and didn’t let her in.
Ke Le saw Qiu Tong and hurriedly ran up to her to explain the situation.
Qiu Tong said to Jin Yang, “I want to take a walk around outside. You guys can chat.”
Jin Yang opened his mouth to try and explain, but in the end, he could only nod. He strode over to Chen Jia and they whispered to each other. Chen Jia smiled brightly and sweetly. She took the initiative to hold Jin Yang’s elbow.
Qiu Tong felt a surge of frustration and turned around.
Ke Le could tell that there was something not quite right going on between Jin Yang and Chen Jia. He followed Qiu Tong closely. “Boss, if you want, I can help you chase that woman away!” His goofy expression made Qiu Tong’s gloominess dissipate a little.
Qiu Tong sat on a bench in the park and gestured for Ke Le to sit down.
Although Ke Le and Qiu Tong had a contractual relationship, he treated Qiu Tong as his leader and prioritized her needs and feelings over everything.
Qiu Tong looked up at the bright moonlight and asked indifferently, “Do you think we’re alike?”
Ke Le paused. To be honest, he did mistake Chen Jia for Qiu Tong in the first few seconds.
After all, Chen Jia was 80% similar to Qiu Tong in terms of appearance, but their personalities were very different. Ke Le was wondering how he should comfort her when Jin Yang walked over. He left with a knowing look, giving Jin Yang and Qiu Tong some time alone.
Jin Yang stood in front of Qiu Tong, who looked up at him. Their gazes met.
Jin Yang took off his jacket and draped it over her. “I might need you to tidy up a room and let her stay for a few days.”
Qiu Tong retorted with a laugh, “Why should I? My family isn’t a shelter.”
“You want me to let a woman move in with us, someone whom I don’t know at all, just because you say so? Don’t forget, you are the one staying at my house!”
“Jin Yang, get this straight. In my house, you’re not the president. You have no right to order me around!”
Qiu Tong stood up. Jin Yang grabbed her elbow and pulled her into his arms.
He placed his hand on the back of Qiu Tong’s head and sighed. “I know, but there’s no other way…”
“Chen Jia has nothing to do with me, but she came to me with a hospital report.”
“She is suffering from severe separation disorder and needs someone to take care of and accompany her. Father asked her to come and seek refuge with me. If anything happens to her, I will be held responsible.”
“And I feel that her appearance is very strange. It’s as if someone is deliberately pushing her to us. Instead of letting Chen Jia become a hidden bomb that can explode at any time, it’s better to keep her by our side. Even if she wants to do something, it will be easy to deal with her where we can see her.”
Jin Yang patiently persuaded Qiu Tong.
Qiu Tong felt a fire burning in her heart, but she could not vent it.

chapters.title: Chapter 241 - Temporary Guest
chapters.content:
Chapter 241: Temporary Guest
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
In the villa, Qiu Tong and Jin Yang brought Chen Jia back. Chen Jia followed Jin Yang closely, looking extremely insecure.
Qiu Tong showed her the guest room at the back with a dark expression. “You can stay here for the time being. If you need anything, tell Ke Le…”
Qiu Xingyu heard movement outside. She ran out holding a colorful egg that the kindergarten teacher had drawn with her. She was so excited to show off her masterpiece to Qiu Tong. However, when she saw Chen Jia, who seemed to have been carved out from the same mold as her mother, she stopped in surprise.
Qiu Xingyu was so frightened that she could not speak. She hurriedly ran back into the room and dragged Qiu Xingyuan, Ye Luan and the rest out.
The children looked at Chen Jia in a daze, their gazes wandering between her and Qiu Tong.
They all had the same thought. Did their mother have a twin?
Chen Jia squatted down and approached Qiu Xingyu with a gentle smile. “Did you make this yourself? It’s so beautiful.”
“You guys are so cute. I didn’t expect Miss Qiu to be the mother of so many children at such a young age.”
Chen Jia rubbed the top of Qiu Xingyu’s head and wanted to pinch her chubby face, but Qiu Xingyu frowned and took two steps back. Her eyes were filled with vigilance and disgust as she snatched the colorful egg back. “Who are you? Why are you in our house?”
Chen Jia looked very gentle and wasn’t fierce at all.
However, the children instinctively hated her. Their eyes were filled with hostility.
Chen Jia seemed to be frightened by Qiu Xingyu’s actions and attitude. She walked to Jin Yang’s side and looked at him pleadingly.
Qiu Tong said, “She’ll be living with us for the time being. You guys have to behave.”
Qiu Xingyuan shrugged. “Did Mommy rent out the guest room? But this has to be approved by us!”
Qiu Xingqiao nodded. “We are usually very noisy. This auntie might not be able to accept it.”
Auntie?! Chen Jia couldn’t keep a straight face. She tugged at Jin Yang’s clothes and asked in a soft voice, “Brother Yang, don’t they like me?”
Qiu Xingyuan ridiculed bluntly, “We don’t even know each other. There’s no reason to like strangers, right?”
Qiu Tong hugged Qiu Xingyuan and Little Yu and said in a low voice, “You cannot be rude.”
She looked at Jin Yang and her gaze landed on his arm. “Since she is your friend, you take care of her.”
Qiu Tong returned to the second floor exhausted.
Jin Yang pushed Chen Jia’s hand away and carried her luggage to the guest room with a cold expression. He didn’t stay for long before leaving.
Chen Jia closed the door and looked around the room. Her expression changed from gentle to cold.
She dialed Jin Tao’s number and sat by the bed, whispering, “I’ve already successfully moved in. There’s a rift between Qiu Tong and him…”
Jin Tao nodded in satisfaction. “Alright, let’s achieve our goal as soon as possible.”
…
In the bedroom, Qiu Tong was about to change into more comfortable clothes. She stood in front of the wardrobe and heard footsteps coming from behind.
Jin Yang held her shoulders and turned her to look into his eyes.
His thin lips curled into a subtle smile. Jin Yang used his fingertips to lift a loose strand of hair at Qiu Tong’s temple and smoothed it behind her ear. “Are you jealous?”
Qiu Tong refused to admit it. She did not know when Jin Yang had become so important to her.
Jin Yang hooked his arm around her waist, before slowly moving it downwards. The temperature in the bedroom gradually rose.
Qiu Tong’s back was sweating profusely. She frowned and pushed Jin Yang’s chest. “You should go take care of her…”
Jin Yang’s large palm covered her waist, seeking out Qiu Tong’s sensitive area. He moved closer in a low and hoarse voice, his eyes filled with helplessness as he coaxed, “You’re the only one I want to take care of! Besides, I want to bring you somewhere else for a good chat.”
Jin Yang suddenly picked Qiu Tong up and threw her onto the bed.
Qiu Tong frowned. She looked at Jin Yang, who was crawling over like a predator. She bent her knees to push against his chest.
Jin Yang placed his hand on her smooth leg and pulled her toward him. He pinned Qiu Tong under him and swiftly spread her legs. “Don’t forget that we’re legally married…”
Qiu Tong wanted to grab Jin Yang’s wrist, but she gritted her teeth and reminded him, “It’s just a marriage on paper.”
Jin Yang grabbed her arm and threw the pillow aside. He adjusted his position and leaned on her. His thin lips moved closer to Qiu Tong’s ear, deliberately blowing hot air to arouse her. “But this relationship is legally recognized.”
“If it’s against my will, I can sue in court…”
Qiu Tong tried her best to break free from his control, muttering vicious words.
In the next second, Jin Yang kissed the tender flesh of her neck. His fingertips moved nimbly between Qiu Tong’s legs. He dipped his fingertips into her moisture before bringing it before her eyes. He chuckled and said, “But that’s not what your body says.”
“Your body is far more honest than your mouth.”
Jin Yang sighed and bent over to kiss Qiu Tong’s red lips..

chapters.title: Chapter 242 - Declaring Battle
chapters.content:
Chapter 242: Declaring Battle
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong felt her body heat up, even her breathing was hot.
Jin Yang’s fingers seemed to be playing a melody on her skin. Qiu Tong had no choice but to obey.
She hooked her arms around Jin Yang’s shoulders and wrapped her slender legs around his waist.
Jin Yang panted heavily. Just as he was about to enter her, someone knocked on the door.
Qiu Tong’s eyes instantly cleared up and the heated atmosphere was interrupted. Chen Jia’s voice came from outside. “Brother Yang, there seems to be a problem with the air conditioning in my room. Can you help me take a look?”
Jin Yang took a deep breath. Seeing that Chen Jia had no intention of leaving, Qiu Tong raised her leg and kicked Jin Yang’s waist.
She looked at Jin Yang with a dark expression. “Hurry up and help your Chen Jia.”
Qiu Tong walked into the bathroom and closed the door.
Jin Yang scratched his head in frustration. He walked to the door in his pajamas. When Chen Jia saw him, her eyes were filled with surprise. “Am I disturbing you?”
In the bathroom, Qiu Tong listened to their conversation. She was so angry that her scalp went numb. She wished she could go out and expose Chen Jia’s fake identity.
Jin Yang closed the door gently and Chen Jia stole a glance inside.
The messy bed sheets and the scent of love in the air were difficult to conceal. Qiu Tong’s kiss mark was still on Jin Yang’s neck.
Chen Jia narrowed her eyes silently and followed Jin Yang closely. In a light voice, she said, “I think Miss Qiu seems to hate me very much. Did I do something wrong? If I am causing trouble in your lives, I can find a place to move out tomorrow.”
“It’s alright with Uncle Jin Tao. Don’t worry, I’ll explain on your behalf.”
Chen Jia lowered her head as she said those words. Jin Yang called Ke Le and the other mercenaries over. They went to Chen Jia’s room to check the air conditioner and found that it was just that the remote control did not have a battery. Ke Le stared at Chen Jia with a meaningful look. “It’s just a small matter. There’s a brand new battery in the drawer.”
“Even if you can’t handle it yourself, you can ask us for help. You don’t have to bother Boss and the rest, right?”
Ke Le’s tone was filled with annoyance. Chen Jia tugged at the corner of her clothes nervously. She bit her lips and didn’t answer.
Jin Yang shook his head at Ke Le and left after giving Chen Jia a few instructions. When he returned to Qiu Tong’s room, he realized that the door had been locked from the inside. He knocked on the door several times but did not hear any reply. A pillow and blanket had been thrown in the corridor. Jin Yang sighed and carried his things to the guest room next door. He took out his phone and sent a message to Qiu Tong, but she did not reply.
Late at night, Qiu Tong stared at her phone screen several times. She flipped open her laptop in frustration.
The information found on the phone in the hotel had been recovered and sorted out. Qiu Tong checked the details sent to her.
The program designed by Qiu Xingyu had indeed recorded the contents of the calls for about 10 seconds. The voice changer made the conversation difficult to hear. Qiu Tong turned the volume to the maximum and could vaguely hear him say, “There’s been a change in the plan. We can’t let them know.”
Qiu Tong’s thoughts were in a mess. She grabbed a piece of paper and scribbled on it.
Who were they? What did they know?
Ye Luan could shed light on many of the questions, but Qiu Tong didn’t want to force him, so the situation was in a stalemate…
That night, Qiu Tong stared at the ceiling. She slept for a few hours before the sun rose outside the window.
At nine in the morning, Qiu Tong walked out of the room looking exhausted. She planned to make a nutritious breakfast for the children. When she reached the kitchen door, she saw that Chen Jia was already busy inside. There were egg tarts and butter cake in the electric oven, and a nutritious porridge was cooking in the pot. Chen Jia even made jam and cheese sandwiches, completely upgrading the family’s breakfast.
Qiu Tong stood at the entrance, silently watching her.
Cheng Jia heard some noise and turned. She gave a brilliant smile. Ms Qiu, you are up?”
“I was just about to wake you all up. I didn’t know if you guys liked Chinese or Western breakfast, so I prepared a bit of each.”
Qiu Tong frowned as she watched her carrying out the hot milk.
Chen Jia noticed her gaze and smiled. Her eyes were filled with lingering affection as she said, “Brother Yang has a sensitive stomach. If he doesn’t drink some warm milk for breakfast, he’ll suffer from stomach pains the rest of the day. This is specially prepared for him. If you like, I can make you another cup.”
Chen Jia opened the drawer and found the cheese and jam.
Qiu Tong asked in a low and hoarse voice, “How did you know those things were there?”
Chen Jia paused for a moment. “Because I have the same habit. In the past, I liked to keep random things in the second drawer. I forgot that this is your home. I didn’t expect our habits to be so similar.” Her seemingly casual words reminded Qiu Tong of Jin Yang’s familiarity with the kitchen.
With so many clues and coincidences pieced together, it was inevitable that Qiu Tong would come to certain conclusions.
Jin Yang came out of the guest room and hugged Qiu Tong by the waist. “Can you let me return to your room tonight?”
“The guest room next door is very cold. I can’t sleep without you.”
Jin Yang spoke those sweet words in an especially natural manner, not caring that there was another person in the kitchen.
Hearing their conversation, Chen Jia’s fingers instantly turned red when they touched the edge of the milk pot.

chapters.title: Chapter 243 - Torture and Interrogation
chapters.content:
Chapter 243: Torture and Interrogation
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The dining room was a little quiet.
The children sized up Chen Jia and Jin Yang. Qiu Xingyu glared at Jin Yang with a condemning expression. She held her chopsticks and poked at the bread on her plate. Jin Yang coughed lightly and pushed a glass of milk over. Out of spite, she looked away and ignored him.
Seeing that the atmosphere was not right, Chen Jia took the initiative to give Qiu Xingyuan two slices of bacon. “Hope you will like my cooking.”
Qiu Xingyuan immediately transferred the bacon to Ke Le, who was sitting opposite him. He said with a cold gaze, “I don’t like to eat food made by strangers.”
Qiu Xingqiao nodded in agreement.
Qiu Tong was very pleased by the children’s clear stance. But she tried to smooth things over. “You have to be polite and respect our guest.”
Guest? Qiu Xingyuan glanced at Chen Jia coldly. This woman clearly had designs on Jin Yang!
After breakfast, Chen Jia took the initiative to play with the children. But no matter where she went, the children would immediately stand up and walk away.
Chen Jia stood rooted to the ground in embarrassment. She turned around and looked at Jin Yang. Just as she was about to walk over and complain to him, Qiu Xingqiao passed by the middle of the living room on a skateboard and nearly bumped into Chen Jia. She lost her balance and fell to the ground. She hit her wrist against the floor tile and it immediately became swollen.
Qiu Xingqiao stood in front of her with a skateboard in hand. He bowed and apologized in a perfunctory manner. “Sorry, Auntie.”
Auntie?! Chen Jia was shocked by Qiu Xingqiao’s address.
Qiu Xingyuan brought over some ointment and carefully treated her injury.
Sensing that his attitude towards her had changed, Chen Jia asked him, “You’re the little genius who developed the locust pesticide, right? I’ve seen you in the news. You’re really steady and reliable…”
Qiu Xingyuan quietly kept the ointment. “It’s just a mild injury.”
“Auntie, you don’t have to look for Uncle Jin Yang to treat it. If it hurts, you can just ask us for help. After all, we’ve all learned how to treat such injuries in kindergarten. We can definitely help you.”
Qiu Xingyuan’s subtle ridicule was so profound that Chen Jia felt rather humiliated.
Ke Le was like a loudspeaker. He had already told everyone what happened the previous night. Everyone could see her true agenda.
Chen Jia frowned. She didn’t expect things to go so wrong.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao returned to the sofa in the living room. Little Yu took out two lollipops as if she was performing a magic trick and stuffed them into their hands.
“Eldest Brother, Second Brother! You guys are awesome!”
Qiu Xingyuan tore open the wrapping paper and bit into the apple-flavored lollipop, staring at Chen Jia.
Qiu Xingyu called them over and the three children gathered together to discuss how to deal with Chen Jia.
Qiu Xingqiao snorted. “She wants to snatch Uncle Jin Yang away? Impossible!”
Qiu Xingyu clenched her fists. “It wasn’t easy for us to have a Daddy. We can’t let him go, or Mommy will be very sad.”
In the bedroom, Jin Yang suddenly sneezed twice. He had no idea who was secretly discussing him behind his back.
…
In the basement, the gangster who attacked Ye Luan was lying on the ground with a sallow face.
In the darkness, he vaguely saw a figure walking towards the door. “Help! I really don’t know anything!”
In his dying state, the gangster probably really wasn’t hiding anything.
Qiu Tong could not be bothered to waste any more time with him. Just as she was about to instruct Shao An to send him to the police station, the gangster muttered in a daze, “They’ll silence me! I really didn’t see…”
Wait! Qiu Tong’s eyes suddenly lit up.
All the lights in the basement were turned on in an instant. The gangster had been in a dark environment for a long time, and the sudden lights temporarily blinded him.
Qiu Tong grabbed his collar and said, “Tell me the truth!”
The gangster was tense and nervous, and he bit the tip of his tongue, unwilling to say another word.
Shao An heard the commotion. He was afraid that Qiu Tong would be in danger so he rushed in. Qiu Tong explained to him briefly, and Shao An said with a knowing expression, “Miss Qiu, please go out for a moment. I’ll pry open his mouth.”
Qiu Tong wanted to stay behind, but Jin Yang held her waist and walked out. “Don’t worry, leave it to Shao An.”
When the two of them reached the door, they heard wails coming from the basement.
The gangster’s tragic cries spread throughout the entire villa. Shao An pulled off his belt and stuffed a cloth into his mouth.
Qiu Tong wanted to rush in after hearing the muffled groans and the sounds of blood being splattered. Jin Yang held her wrist and shook his head gently. “Shao An has been my bodyguard for many years. Although he appears to be very refined, his methods are ruthless. No one can hide any secrets from him.”
Jin Yang raised his wristwatch and calculated the time.
The gangster did not last more than two and a half minutes. Shao An strode out of the basement and nodded respectfully at Jin Yang and Qiu Tong. “He’s willing to explain now.”
The basement reeked of blood and the gangster was covered in blood.
He raised his head weakly and looked at Qiu Tong with eyes filled with despair. “I’ll tell you everything. Please give me a quick death!”
“You met them, right?”
Qiu Tong voiced her suspicion. The gangster lowered his head slowly.. “Yes.”

chapters.title: Chapter 244 - Enemy Information
chapters.content:
Chapter 244: Enemy Information
“We do business in the dark. Employers mostly want us to kill and rob people for money. The other tasks are about revenge.”
The gangster coughed and spat out two mouthfuls of blood. His expression was self-deprecating. “Employers all have high status in society and don’t want their hands to be covered in blood. Our lives are cheap. We hide in the dark and be their knives for them, helping them solve their problems.”
“It’s common for employers to hide their identities, but when I received this deal, I instinctively felt that something was amiss.”
The gangster looked at Qiu Tong and waved his fingers weakly. “Can I have a cigarette?”
Jin Yang nodded at Shao An. Shao An lit a cigarette and stuffed it between his fingers. After taking two deep breaths, he regained his composure and continued to recall his strange experience that night. “The voice on the phone was clearly processed. They said that as long as I kidnap the child, they will give me a seven-digit fee.”
“And they can create a new identity for me so that I can leave the black market and be an ordinary person.”
The gangster’s hands were trembling. He clasped them together and before placing the cigarette in his mouth.
“I was suspicious at the time. Someone who can create a fake identity must be a high-ranking official or someone with power! Why would they kidnap a child?”
“They probably knew that I didn’t really believe them. Without asking for my bank account information, they transferred a deposit of $15,000 to my account. I was shocked and asked if they weren’t afraid that I would run away with the money. They said that they would be able to find me no matter where I went…”
These threats made the gangster afraid. He knew that he had gotten himself into something nasty, so he had no choice but to agree to the other party’s request.
Qiu Tong had investigated the gangster in front of her in advance. He had a reputation in the black market. It was said that he had a wide network and sinister methods.
He had never failed a mission before.
Perhaps this was the reason why the other party chose him… but they did not expect the gangster to fail with Ye Luan.
The gangster quickly finished his cigarette and crushed it with his foot. “While I was looking for traces of that child, I was also looking for my employer. I wanted to know who they were, but as you can see, they are very vigilant. The numbers they used to call me were all fake, and their voices cannot not be identified.”
“But on one call, I heard the whistle of a cruise ship in the background.”
“I have a lot of connections. According to the time and date of that call, I searched for the harbor and cruise ship. There was a particular pier that aroused my suspicion. All the surveillance footage had been deleted, but I sneaked over and found that there was a surveillance camera installed at the back of the garbage truck that collected trash there every night. I saw them there…”
The gangster felt a chill run down his spine. He still could not forget the effect of seeing that scene.
In the dark rainy night, a man wearing a long black suit had his hands in his pockets, his eyes cold and indifferent.
He looked on emotionlessly at the person kneeling on the ground and begging for mercy. He took out a pistol and aimed it between his brows.
Bang! The pistol was equipped with a silencer. Accompanied by the sound of thunder, no one noticed. Several bodyguards had appeared beside the man. They dragged the corpse and threw it into the sea. Their actions were so swift that even the gangster felt afraid.
“Can you imagine? Some people have very strong auras! I could feel his aura even through the camera…”
Even though he was a gangster who had killed many people, at that moment, he still regretted accepting the deposit from the other party.
He had no way of escaping now. All he could do was chase after Ye Luan and complete the mission his employer assigned him.
The gangster suddenly gaped. He seemed to be pulling at something from his mouth.
Qiu Tong was so nervous that she wanted Shao An to stop him. In the next second, the gangster dragged a thin thread from his throat. He retched a few times before finally pulling out a SD card stained with blood. He threw a tooth he had plucked out to the ground and handed it to Shao An along with the SD card.
“This is the surveillance footage I copied. Although you can’t see their faces clearly…”
Shao An took it and immediately handed it to a tech staff to deal with.
Qiu Tong frowned. She hesitated for a moment before walking up to the gangster. She placed her hand on his shoulder and activated her supernatural power.
A warm current slowly flowed into the gangster’s body. He looked up at Qiu Tong in disbelief.
“You may have done wrong, but there will be laws to punish you. You will not die here, and you won’t die in their hands.”
The gangster suddenly smiled and looked at the woman in front of him. “Are you kind or cruel?”
She had tacitly agreed to Shao An’s torture methods and she attacked him in the black market, but she also wanted to save him and let him be punished by the law? The gangster’s eyes lost their luster. He stared at the ground quietly. “I almost caught up to them before.”
“But I lost them in the end.”
“They parked their car near 730 Guangming Road. You can look for them there. You might be able to find other clues.”
The gangster refused to speak again.
In order to ensure his safety, Qiu Tong arranged for the mercenaries to guard the basement door and temporarily keep him in the villa..

chapters.title: Chapter 245 - Little Kids Take Charge Of The House
chapters.content:
Chapter 245: Little Kids Take Charge Of The House
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Jin Yang and Qiu Tong drove to 730 Guangming Road. They wanted to find any relevant clues as soon as possible.
Qiu Tong leaned her elbow against the window and looked at the increasingly familiar scenery outside. She frowned slightly.
Jin Yang noticed Qiu Tong’s discomfort and would occasionally turn his head to look at her. “Is there something wrong?”
Qiu Tong looked down at 730 Guangming Road displayed on the navigation system. It was actually a university campus!
And this was the campus block where Professor Dong worked! Qiu Tong thought of his secret lab and the gorilla locked in the cage. When she linked all the clues she had now, she could not help arriving at a terrifying thought.
The car came to a stop by the road. Qiu Tong lowered her eyes and asked Jin Yang, “Do you believe that there is a drug that can change the human body?”
Jin Yang’s heart skipped a beat. He concealed his emotions and asked, “Why would you think that?”
Qiu Tong pointed at the building in front of them. “If the guy in my basement didn’t lie to us, I might know where those people went.”
“I once accepted a bodyguard mission from the Dark Web. It was for a professor at this school. He’s developing this drug.”
Jin Yang pursed his lips, shock flashing across his eyes.
He did not expect to find the human modification plan here!
However, that batch of drugs had already failed and been destroyed. Could Professor Dong be developing a new batch of drugs?
As the president, Jin Yang had been bitterly searching for the person who was secretly researching the drug, but he had no clues. He controlled his excitement and made a call. “Shao An, immediately arrange for a private plane. I want to return to the capital’s official residence.”
“Come back with me. There are some things I want you to understand.”
Jin Yang’s eyes were firm. Qiu Tong nodded in agreement.
In the villa, the children were not as happy when they heard that Qiu Tong might stay overnight outside. They sat in a row on the sofa and sighed with dejected expressions. Chen Jia had eavesdropped on their conversation and wanted to know where Jin Yang and Qiu Tong had gone, but she received no answer.
She saw Ye Luan returning from school and knew that he was the only child who was not related to the Qiu family by blood.
Chen Jia took the initiative to run to the door and help him remove his school bag. “School is hard, right?”
Ye Luan nodded politely. Qiu Xingyu waved her arms behind Chen Jia, sending him a secret signal and message.
If Chen Jia wanted to sow discord between Jin Yang and Qiu Tong, she could only start with the children.
She pretended to unintentionally mention all the things that had happened between her and Jin Yang. As expected, the hot-tempered Qiu Xingqiao could not hold back his anger and stood up, wanting to chase Chen Jia out. Qiu Xingyuan patted Qiu Xingqiao’s shoulder, indicating for him to calm down and not fall into Chen Jia’s trap.
Ke Le and the mercenaries patrolled the perimeter of the villa to protect the children.
Since there was no one at home, Chen Jia wanted to improve her relationship with the children. She put on a flattering smile and moved closer to Little Yu. “I heard that Little Yu knows how to design many interesting games and programs. Why don’t I play with you?”
Qiu Xingyu shook her head. She continued tapping away at her laptop, not even glancing at Chen Jia. “I don’t know anything.”
“Elder Brother, the kindergarten teacher gave us a lot of homework that I don’t know how to do. Can you help me?”
Qiu Xingyu cleverly brought Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao back to their room and slammed the door shut.
Chen Jia stayed in the living room alone. She turned her head and saw Ye Luan. She came up with a plan and walked over. “Little kid, I heard that you and your parents got separated. Did Qiu Tong bring you back? Can I help you find your parents? No matter how well Qiu Tong treats you, she’s not your blood relative.”
Ye Luan frowned and looked at Chen Jia calmly.
“Auntie Qiu is my family and this is my home. If you want to sow discord between me and them, please dispel this thought as soon as possible.”
“They are very kind and were willing to take you in. I hope you can control yourself and stop imitating Auntie Qiu.”
“Even if you can imitate her appearance, you will never be able to become her. You will only be a ridiculous replica, a substitute.”
Ye Luan’s every word was like a needle that pierced into Chen Jia’s heart.
In the bedroom, Qiu Xingyu was eavesdropping on the conversation outside.
She quietly gave a thumbs-up sign and turned around to say to Qiu Xingyuan, who was also very curious but was trying his best not to eavesdrop, “See! I knew that Brother Ye Luan was on the same side as us. He will definitely help Mommy!”
Qiu Xingyuan looked away. “At least he has some conscience.”
Qiu Xingqiao was wearing boxing gloves. He hammered the sandbag angrily. “What are we going to do?”
“It’s best if we can chase that bad woman away while Mommy and Uncle Jin Yang are not home!”
Qiu Xingyu raised her arms in agreement. “Mommy hasn’t smiled in the past few days since that woman moved in.”
“We can pretend to be ghosts in the middle of the night to scare her!”
Qiu Xingyu’s childish suggestion made Qiu Xingqiao’s shoulders drop.
He looked at his little sister’s innocent face helplessly and could not bear to rebut her.
Qiu Xingyuan recalled Chen Jia’s behavior during the past few days.. “I think she must have other motives. Why don’t we keep an eye on her and see what she wants to do!”

chapters.title: Chapter 246 - Caught
chapters.content:
Chapter 246: Caught
As the night deepened, Ke Le led the mercenaries to patrol around the villa.
Chen Jia quietly pushed open the children’s bedroom door. She saw Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao lying quietly on the bed. They were sleeping exceptionally soundly.
In the dim environment, Chen Jia came to the second floor.
She took off her necklace and used the silver hook to open the lock. Chen Jia turned the door handle gently and looked around warily, seeing that there was no one around. She slipped in.
Jin Tao’s mission for her was not just to sow discord between Jin Yang and Qiu Tong, but also to monitor Jin Yang.
Chen Jia searched through the bedside table and desk drawer in the bedroom, but found no useful information.
She sat in front of the computer and tried to crack the password, but to no avail.
Chen Jia saw the luggage in the corner and recognized Jin Yang’s personal emblem. She planned to see if there were any secrets inside.
Click—she had just taken two steps when she heard the sound of the door lock turning.
Qiu Xingyuan stood on his tiptoes and turned on the light on the ceiling of the bedroom. The four children looked at her coldly. “Auntie, why are you in Mommy’s room? Don’t tell me you were sleepwalking or you entered the wrong room! When you came to our room just now, we weren’t asleep!”
Ye Luan shielded the Qiu family children behind him. He held his phone and could call the police anytime.
“What are you looking for?”
Chen Jia was a little flustered. She didn’t expect to be caught red-handed.
Many explanations flashed across her mind, but she did not voice them out.
Qiu Xingyu stood on tip toe and stuck her head out from behind Qiu Xingqiao. She bared her little white teeth and said fiercely to Chen Jia, “I will tell Uncle Jin Yang!”
She pouted and said, “You want to steal something!”
Chen Jia didn’t expect these kids to be so difficult to deal with. She raised her hand and twirled her hair, narrowing her eyes and revealing a ruthless expression.
She slowly walked up to the children, thinking that she should have no problem dealing with them.
As long as she could shut them up forever, Chen Jia would naturally have a way to push the blame to the so-called bad guys. With Jin Tao’s protection, even if Jin Yang suspected her, he would not be able to detain or punish her!
Chen Jia was having evil thoughts. Ye Luan realized that something was wrong and kept retreating while protecting his younger siblings.
Qiu Xingyu’s back was pressed against the wall at the end of the corridor. She suddenly waved at a spot behind Chen Jia. “Uncle Ke Le, come and help!”
Chen Jia instinctively turned her head only to see the empty corridor behind her.
She had been fooled! Chen Jia wanted to grab the children, but Qiu Xingyuan and Ye Luan took advantage of her distracted state and bent over to circle around her. The children ran straight for the spiral staircase. They ran quickly, with Chen Jia chasing after them.
In the living room, Ke Le suddenly pushed the door open and entered.
Qiu Xingyu looked like she had seen her savior. She hid behind him with tears in her eyes. She pointed at Chen Jia and said, “She wants to harm us!”
Ke Le was originally patrolling outside. For some reason, he felt uneasy and panicked.
He was afraid that the children would take advantage of Qiu Tong’s absence to fool around at home. He wanted to come back and take a look, only to see this scene before him.
Ke Le put a wary hand on the gun at his waist. “What happened?”
Chen Jia immediately wiped off her vicious expression and took two steps forward apologetically. “I entered the wrong room. I didn’t expect to encounter the children. They might have some misunderstanding about me…”
Qiu Xingyu wiped her tears and gritted her teeth.
She shouted angrily, “You liar! You were the one who sneaked into Mommy’s room!”
Ke Le raised his head and looked at the open door of the bedroom on the second floor. He instantly took out his gun and pointed it at Chen Jia.
Between the children and Chen Jia, Ke Le would never choose to believe in a stranger.
He rested his index finger on the trigger, maintaining a shooting stance. “Please return to your room. When Boss and Mr. Jin Yang return, they will listen to your explanation and make their judgment.”
Chen Jia frowned and wanted to take a tentative step forward. Ke Le shot at the floor as a final warning.
“Alright, I’ll listen to you.”
Chen Jia knew that it was impossible to change the situation now. She had no choice but to return to the bedroom.
…
At the official residence of the capital. Jin Yang and Qiu Tong arrived in a car.
Jin Yang took two steps forward and realized that Qiu Tong wasn’t following him. He turned around and saw that Qiu Tong was still sitting in the car. He returned to her side and asked, “What’s the matter?”
Qiu Tong smiled. “I’ll wait for you here.”
There were many secrets inside the president’s residence. Even though Qiu Tong and Jin Yang were legally married now, she still didn’t want to have anything to do with the rich and powerful.
Qiu Tong knew that there were many problems behind those seemingly glamorous identities. She did not want to get too involved.
Jin Yang knew her well and did not force her. He brought Shao An to the office on the second floor as quickly as possible.
“Bring out all the documents and information on the human modification plan!”
“I need to see all the information and research labs in the shortest time possible…”
Jin Yang loosened his tie as he instructed with a frown.
Shao An was in a difficult position. “Those are all classified information of the highest grade. I have to report to Mr.. Jin Tao if I want to retrieve them…”

chapters.title: Chapter 247 - Chen Jia Escapes
chapters.content:
Chapter 247: Chen Jia Escapes
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Jin Yang pounded the desk angrily. “Are you my guard or Jin Tao’s?”
There had always been whispers in the capital’s political world. Although Jin Yang seemed to have real power and many political achievements, Jin Tao was in close contact with many high-ranking officials. His spies were even hidden in the official residence, and Jin Yang’s actions were directly reported to him.
Shao An was shocked and immediately went to get the information.
The study room was filled with silence and an oppressive atmosphere. Jin Yang narrowed his eyes and looked at his reflection in the French windows. He slowly adjusted his breathing. Through the glass, he saw Qiu Tong sitting in the passenger seat of the SUV. A faint smile appeared on his lips as he regained his rationality.
The butler rushed over when he heard that the president had returned.
He had been taking care of Jin Yang’s daily life in the official residence. After all these years, he already treated Jin Yang as his own child.
The butler was holding a glass of the tea that Jin Yang usually drank. Seeing Jin Yang’s thin appearance, the butler asked with concern, “How long will you be back this time?”
Jin Yang sipped his tea and patted the butler’s shoulder apologetically. “I’m leaving tonight. Please take care of the official residence for me.”
The butler nodded and was about to say something when Shao An walked over quickly with the printed information.
Jin Yang and Shao An didn’t linger on and started to leave. The butler seemed to have thought of something and returned to the second floor to get a pillow. “Sir, please wait!”
The butler chased after Jin Yang and handed it to him. “You have never been able to sleep well outside. Since you are away so often, bring this with you!”
Jin Yang thanked the butler and gestured at Shao An to take the pillow. At this moment, Qiu Tong had received Ke Le’s call. She knew what had happened at home and wished she could fly back quickly. She pushed open the car door wanting to find Jin Yang, but the two of them bumped into each other. She grabbed Jin Yang’s arm and stuffed him into the car.
The butler looked at Qiu Tong’s back profile from afar and rubbed his eyes in disbelief.
The woman looked strangely familiar!
She looked very much like Jin Yang’s fiancée!
The butler wanted to run over and take a closer look, but the car sped away. He shook his head and muttered to himself, “Impossible, how could it be her?”
Shao An floored the accelerator and the car sped down the highway towards the airport.
Qiu Tong gave a simple description of the situation. Jin Yang’s expression was equally gloomy and terrifying, as if frost was forming on his face.
Jin Yang recalled the time when Chen Jia appeared and her strange actions. His eagle-like eyes shot out a cold glint that was terrifying.
Qiu Tong kept in constant communication with Ke Le. She asked tentatively, “What do you know about Chen Jia?”
“Could she have been sent by some outside force and is in cahoots with those people who want to kidnap Ye Luan?”
Jin Yang shook his head, denying Qiu Tong’s judgment.
A light rain started to fall from the sky. The constant patter of the rain irritated him.
Jin Yang clenched his fists. “If Chen Jia’s target is Ye Luan, why would she go to our bedroom to look for things?”
“No matter what she wants to do and who sent her, we will be able to find out when we return!”
Qiu Tong stole a glance at his profile and stopped talking. A torturous silence fell over the car.
Shao An felt cold sweat trickle down his back. He gripped the steering wheel tightly and sped up.
Chen Jia had come to Jin Yang by Jin Tao’s instructions.
Did Jin Tao know about this matter? Qiu Tong thought about her meeting with Jin Tao and wanted to mention it to Jin Yang several times, but she swallowed her words. With their own thoughts on their minds, the two of them took a flight and landed on the open parking space near the S City villa district.
It was already five in the morning when they rushed back to the villa.
Qiu Tong wanted to go straight to the bedroom to interrogate Chen Jia, but when she saw the children and Ke Le sitting in the living room, she immediately felt that something was wrong.
As expected, Ke Le stood up apologetically. “Sorry, Boss.”
“We let her escape.”
Qiu Tong widened her eyes. She ran to the door of the guest room and saw that it was empty. Where was Chen Jia?
The window railings were cut by saw-shaped tools. The ropes binding Chen Jia’s wrists were also scattered on the ground. There were clear footprints of high heels on the window sill. Everything indicated that Chen Jia had escaped.
Ke Le scratched his head. He slapped himself in frustration. “We didn’t expect her to be so skilled.”
Chen Jia had always appeared so gentle in the villa so Ke Le was not too vigilant. He had arranged for a mercenary to guard outside the door, not expecting Chen Jia to escape while tied up.
Ke Le and the mercenaries waited until midnight but did not notice anything unusual. It was Qiu Xingyuan who felt that something was wrong.
After they barged into the room, Chen Jia had disappeared. The mercenaries quickly searched the surroundings but still couldn’t find her.
Qiu Tong frowned, but she did not blame Ke Le and the others. She followed Jin Yang to the bedroom on the second floor to investigate.
The items were all in their original positions. Even the folds of the bedsheet were at their original angles and lines. It was obvious that Chen Jia was highly skilled. Jin Yang and Qiu Tong examined the room separately and found that both the computer and phone bore signs of being unlocked.
Qiu Tong met Jin Yang’s eyes and asked in a hoarse voice, “What is Chen Jia looking for?”

chapters.title: Chapter 248 - Moving Overnight
chapters.content:
Chapter 248: Moving Overnight
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong thought that Chen Jia would be the key to solving all the problems and doubts, but she didn’t expect the clues to stop again.
Jin Yang changed the password and redesigned the login verification method.
The sun slowly rose from the east. It emitted a warm light that illuminated every corner of the room through the thick clouds.
Qiu Tong wanted to go and comfort the children. She walked to the door and Jin Yang grabbed her elbow. “Let’s talk.”
The two of them sat on the edge of the bed. The slew of troubles made their expressions solemn.
Jin Yang rubbed Qiu Tong’s knuckles. “We might not be able to stay in this villa anymore.”
“We have no idea what forces are behind Chen Jia. The people who are chasing after Ye Luan might find this place at any time. Also, Lin Shan and Shu Xian, as well as the foreign forces targeting Professor Dong…”
“Although you and Qiu Xingyuan created an electric fence as a defense mechanism, it’s still not safe for us.”
Qiu Tong agreed with him. During the famine riot, the electric fence had not been able to stop the hooligans from the neighboring city, much less an enemy with high IQ and powerful firearms. Seeing that she was not objecting, Jin Yang continued to suggest, “I have a house in S City. It’s very secretive.”
“There are dozens of soldiers stationed there. They can protect the children.”
“Might as well move over for now and come back when things are settled.”
Jin Yang didn’t use a commanding tone. Instead, he asked for Qiu Tong’s opinion.
Qiu Tong paused for two seconds, then nodded after a moment of hesitation. “Thank you.”
Jin Yang hugged her and comforted her gently, “I know you have feelings for this place. Believe me, you will come back soon.”
After Qiu Tong and Jin Yang finished their discussion, she informed the children to pack up their things.
Ke Le wanted to go to the kindergarten to apply for leave for the children, but Qiu Tong stopped him.
She had two thick stacks of bills in her hand. “You’ve done very well during this period. I’m very grateful.”
“But we might face many dangers in the future. I don’t want to implicate you. I am going to another place this time and you can take up another job from the Dark Web. It’s best to find some easy jobs. Don’t go looking for troublesome employers like me anymore.”
Ke Le looked at the envelope in his hand and refused with a frown. “Boss, it’s our fault for letting Chen Jia escape.”
“Give us another chance. We will definitely bring her back!”
Ke Le was very emotional. His chest heaved up and down. Their conversation attracted the attention of the other mercenaries.
Qiu Tong patted his shoulder and said softly, “I’m not blaming you.”
“You’re all my friends. I don’t want… to see you get hurt because of me!”
Ke Le finally understood what she meant. He said with a stubborn and serious expression, “We don’t have any family or relatives. We accept missions in the Dark Web just to earn a living. Our previous employers treated us as tools. No one has ever treated us like family like you!”
“Over the past period, we’ve already treated you and the children as family!”
“Boss, we are willing to follow you if you don’t mind. Although we can’t compare to Mr. Jin Yang’s guards, we can still help you block a bullet at critical moments.”
Ke Le’s words filled Qiu Tong with gratitude. She sighed and gave in.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao tidied up the room. They looked at their own beds reluctantly before packing up their test tubes and sandbags. “Elder Brother, I didn’t expect us to have so much luggage!”
Little Yu ran in with red eyes. She wiped her snot with her hand. “I can’t bear to leave. There are so many memories of us and Mommy here!”
This was where the whole family had breakfast together for the first time, the first time they argued, the first time they reconciled… just as they were about to leave, all these memories surged up. Even Qiu Xingyuan, who usually hid his feelings deep in his heart, started to choke up.
Qiu Xingyuan patted Little Yu’s head comfortingly. “As long as we are with Mommy, we will create many new memories in the future.”
Qiu Xingyu raised her teary eyes. “Really?”
In the bedroom on the top floor, Qiu Tong was checking to see if there was anything left behind.
She looked up and saw a dust-covered luggage on top of the bedroom closet. Qiu Tong moved a stool over and dragged it down.
Dust floated in the air. Qiu Tong coughed twice and wiped away the dust.
The luggage contained many toys from when Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao were very young. Qiu Tong did not recognize any of them. Qiu Rong must have packed them. She sat by the bed and slowly looked through them. When she saw some yellowing photos at the bottom of the luggage, she could not help smiling.
“Auntie Qiu, Uncle Jin Yang asked how much longer would it take?”
Ye Luan ran in from outside. The sudden sound frightened Qiu Tong so much that she accidentally scattered the photos all over the ground.
Ye Luan hurriedly squatted down to help her tidy up.
When he picked up one of the photos, he suddenly stood rooted to the ground.

chapters.title: Chapter 249 - Black Chip
chapters.content:
Chapter 249: Black Chip
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“Auntie Qiu, what’s your relationship with him?”
Ye Luan’s voice was trembling. He grabbed Qiu Tong’s clothes and pointed at Qiu Rong with his other hand.
His eyes flickered with anticipation as he asked with a tight feeling in his throat.
Qiu Tong took the photo and smiled when she saw her former self leaning on Qiu Rong’s shoulder in the picture.
This should be one of the photos that Qiu Xingyuan and the rest had secretly hidden.
Qiu Tong sat by the bed and said with a smile, “This is my father. We look very similar, right?”
“Unfortunately, he can’t live with us now. After a while, I’ll find a way to get him out.”
When Ye Luan heard the word “father”, his body swayed.
Qiu Tong sensed that something was wrong and was about to ask when she saw Ye Luan rush to the door and lock it from the inside.
Ye Luan came back and rummaged through the drawers until he found a folding knife.
Qiu Tong did not even have time to react before he pressed the blade against his abdomen, slicing apart a layer of skin.
Ye Luan trembled in pain, but his hands did not stop. He dug the blade even deeper.
Qiu Tong was shocked and hurriedly ran to his side to stop him. However, she suddenly noticed that there was a black chip embedded in his flesh. She helped to remove the chip and then covered Ye Luan’s wound with her hand.
She transmitted her special ability from her palm into Ye Luan’s body.
The wound slowly healed and Ye Luan’s pale little face gradually regained its color.
Qiu Tong looked at the black chip and asked in a low voice, “This is what those people are looking for?”
Ye Luan nodded. Qiu Tong looked at the photo in confusion. “Why are you giving it to me?”
Over the past few days, Qiu Tong had tried many times, but Ye Luan had gritted his teeth and refused to reveal any details. But now…
Ye Luan pointed at the photo. “Daddy told me that this thing is very important and I can’t tell anyone about it.”
“Otherwise, not only will my life be in danger, many people will also be harmed. I’ve hesitated many times over whether to tell Auntie Qiu, but I can’t go back on my promise to Daddy…”
Ye Luan lowered his eyes. He recalled his fugitive life over the years and his eyes darkened.
Qiu Tong kept the chip and hugged Ye Luan. “Then why are you willing to give it to me now?”
Ye Luan held the photo. “It’s because of him! I saw him with Daddy before. Daddy said that he is a trustworthy person.”
“And you are his daughter.”
Qiu Tong did not expect them to be linked in this way. She could now sense the huge secret hidden in this tiny chip.
She probed, “What’s in here?”
Ye Luan’s answer was as Qiu Tong had guessed. “Human modification plan.”
So many organizations were fighting over this plan that the government had implemented many years ago.
Qiu Tong thought of Qiu Rong, who was in prison. She could not help wondering if her father was one of them.
Knock, knock. Someone knocked on the door. Qiu Tong and Ye Luan instantly tensed up.
Jin Yang’s voice rang out from the other side. “Are you done packing? The car is outside and ready to leave.”
Qiu Tong quickly replied, “Soon!”
The people in this villa were Qiu Tong’s closest loved ones and were all trustworthy. However, this matter was too important and involved many people. As a result, Qiu Tong did not dare to reveal anything without thinking it through first.
She looked down at Ye Luan and helped him change his bloodstained clothes. “This is a secret between us. You can’t tell anyone.”
“Not even my children and Jin Yang, okay?”
Ye Luan nodded heavily. Although he was only a seven year old child, his intelligence level far surpassed that of an ordinary adult.
Qiu Tong smiled and hooked his little finger in a solemn oath.
…
On the winding mountain road, the vehicle rocked back and forth.
Qiu Tong sat in the front passenger seat and turned around to check on the children. She met Ye Luan’s gaze and instinctively placed her hand on her own lower abdomen.
She had hidden the chip there and it was burning.
Qiu Tong felt as if a wide net was coming down on them. Professor Dong, Ye Luan, the foreign forces and Chen Jia. The human modification plan was like an invisible thread linking everyone together. She tilted her head and looked at Jin Yang, not knowing if she should tell him.
Qiu Tong glanced at the leather folder with the red seal beside Jin Yang.
As the president, how much did he know about the human modification plan?
What was Jin Yang’s view about it?
Blinding sunlight shone through the vehicle’s windscreen. Qiu Tong felt a headache coming on. She covered her face with her hands and lowered her head.
At this moment, many chaotic and complicated memories seemed to sweep over her, but she could not see them clearly.
She seemed to remember hearing Qiu Rong talking to someone…
“Qiu Tong? Are you alright?”
Qiu Tong pursed her lips. Jin Yang held her elbow worriedly and shook it gently. He rummaged for some medicine to soothe motion sickness and handed it to her. “We will be there soon. Hang in there a little longer.”
Qiu Tong nodded. Smelling the lemon orange fragrance of the medicine, she turned to stare at Jin Yang’s profile.
“I think we met somewhere before.”

chapters.title: Chapter 250 - I Am The One
chapters.content:
Chapter 250: I Am The One
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Jin Yang raised his eyebrows in surprise. From the corner of his eye, he glanced at the children sitting in the row behind him. He cleared his throat and pretended to be serious. “It might be better if you tell me these things when we’re alone.” He gently pinched Qiu Tong’s knuckles, hinting at her.
Qiu Tong realized that he might have misunderstood her and hurriedly pulled her hand back. “Be serious and concentrate on driving.”
Jin Yang shrugged, his lips still curled into a smile.
There were guards stationed at the mountainside. When they saw Jin Yang’s car plate, they all saluted and let him pass.
Qiu Xingyu and Qiu Xingqiao leaned against the car window curiously. Everything looked fresh and interesting to them.
A lone building stood in the deep forest, surrounded by layers of security. Shao An instructed the butler and guards to move the luggage.
Jin Yang brought the children around to familiarize themselves with the environment and let them choose their preferred rooms.
In the living room, Qiu Tong lowered her eyes and thought about what Ye Luan had said about Qiu Rong. She felt that there was more to the story.
Qiu Xingyuan mentioned before that Qiu Rong was a refined and educated person and was skilled in all kinds of pharmaceutical research. He was his first teacher.
Qiu Rong’s case file in prison was very vague, which was especially suspicious.
Qiu Tong pondered over Qiu Rong’s remaining prison sentence. She had originally wanted to pay money to reduce his sentence, but now she changed her mind. She wanted to investigate the truth behind Qiu Rong’s arrest. As long as she could get hold of evidence that Qiu Rong was innocent, he would be released soon.
Qiu Tong didn’t want her father to bear a crime he did not commit!
Qiu Xingqiao liked guns. He pestered the guards and kept asking them about all kinds of guns.
Qiu Xingyuan and Little Yu obediently returned to their room to pack their luggage. Jin Yang saw Qiu Tong’s solemn expression from afar. He quietly walked over to her and rested his hand on her shoulder. “What are you thinking about?”
Reacting by instinct, Qiu Tong gripped his wrist tightly and struck his throat.
Jin Yang raised his hand to block her attack. When Qiu Tong saw that it was Jin Yang, she relaxed. “Sorry.”
“Moving to an unfamiliar environment at the last minute would make anyone tense. Let’s go, I’ll bring you to our room.”
Jin Yang sensed that something was wrong with Qiu Tong, but he didn’t probe further.
The two of them walked to the bedroom. The well-lit room had French windows, and beyond the bright and clean glass was a verdant forest. Under the afterglow of the setting sun, this beautiful scene was set before Qiu Tong’s eyes like an oil painting.
Jin Yang hugged her waist from behind and rested his chin on her neck.
He said in a low and hoarse voice, “I never expected to have such a blissful life. With my loved one and the children, life is no longer cold and lonely. It’s lively. Even though it’s a little noisy, I still feel very stable and secure.”
“It’s absolutely safe here. Don’t worry, no one will hurt you.”
Jin Yang raised Qiu Tong’s chin and leaned over to kiss her. He traced the shape of her lips with the tip of his tongue and gently cupped her cheeks, as if he was treating her like a precious treasure. Qiu Tong turned to hug his slender waist, raising her head slightly to match Jin Yang’s actions.
Her breathing gradually became hurried and chaotic…
Jin Yang’s hand moved along the hem of Qiu Tong’s clothes. His fingers deftly hooked the shoulder straps of her bra and pushed it down gently. His palm covered her smooth and soft breast as he kneaded it, pinching her lightly with his fingertips. Qiu Tong gasped and her body went limp.
Outside the door, Ye Luan knocked on the door, interrupting them. “Auntie Qiu, it’s time to eat.”
Qiu Tong tidied her messy hair and pushed Jin Yang away before running down.
…
The next day, Qiu Tong changed into a set of clean clothes and used a plaster to cover the hickey on her neck.
Jin Yang was buttoning his shirt. Seeing that she was about to go out, he asked, “Where are you going? Do you need my guards to escort you?”
Qiu Tong shook her head. She was still hiding the truth about Qiu Rong from Jin Yang and so replied perfunctorily, “I want to take a look at my old residence.”
Jin Yang thought that the packing up of her things yesterday must have triggered the sealed memories in Qiu Tong’s mind, so he didn’t probe further.
Qiu Tong drove to her old residence. The wooden door was covered in spiderwebs. She went to the place where she used to live, and rummaged around the drawers and cupboards to search for evidence that could help Qiu Rong. However, after an entire morning of work, she found nothing but a few bills.
“Did he not hide his things here?”
Qiu Tong tried to recall the memories related to Qiu Rong, but realized that they were blank.
She sat in the rattan chair in frustration as the sun outside shone on the sofa.
Through the rays of light, Qiu Tong realized that there seemed to be something stuffed into a gap. She hurriedly stood up and pulled out a photo with some difficulty.
Qiu Tong’s heart surged when she finally flipped the photo over. Her hands trembled uncontrollably.
The yellowing photo showed her in a wedding dress, and the man beside her was Jin Yang!
Qiu Tong looked at the red mole on the man’s body carefully and confirmed that she was not mistaken. But she had no memories of this at all.
Qiu Tong’s palms were sweating. So she was the woman who had once been engaged to Jin Yang!?

chapters.title: Chapter 251 - Rejecting The Test
chapters.content:
Chapter 251: Rejecting The Test
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
In the evening, Qiu Tong returned to her residence. The lights in the villa were switched on, and the children’s laughter could be heard from afar.
She stood quietly in the courtyard, her brows furrowed as she tried to get rid of the complicated and absurd thoughts in her mind.
Ke Le and the mercenaries were out on patrol. They were stunned to see her. They called out. “Boss, you’re back!”
Qiu Xingyu gave a big grin and ran into her arms. She hugged her waist and raised her head coquettishly.
Jin Yang, Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao stood at the entrance. Qiu Tong forced a smile and entered with Little Yu in her arms.
The light in the living room was warm, but her emotions were a little gloomy.
Jin Yang narrowed his eyes and frowned. Sensing the abnormality in her eyes, the two of them maintained a tacit understanding not to talk about it first.
Late at night, the children went to get ready for bed. Jin Yang held her wrist and brought her back to the bedroom.
Outside the window was a tranquil forest. Jin Yang hugged her from behind and placed his chin on her neck. “Don’t keep things in your heart. You can try to rely on me. Believe me. Can you tell me? Where did you go today?”
Qiu Tong closed her eyes and hesitated for a moment before pushing Jin Yang away. She took out the photo and asked, “Do you remember?”
Jin Yang stared at the wrinkled photo. When he realized that the photo was of him and Qiu Tong, his deep eyes flickered with shock.
Qiu Tong stared intently at his expression and knew that Jin Yang was in the same situation as her.
“We both have a blank in our memories. What happened during that time and what our relationship was, we have no idea. Jin Yang, we’re adults. We can’t come to a conclusion just because of this photo. You should understand what I mean.”
Qiu Tong’s voice was trembling, but her tone was exceptionally firm.
Jin Yang’s eyes flashed with pain as he sat by the bed. He felt waves of stinging pain from his temples again. He rubbed his forehead to resist the tugging sensation from the depths of his soul. It was as if some blurry memories were there but always just beyond his reach.
Qiu Tong walked up to him with her head lowered. She placed her hands on Jin Yang’s shoulders and muttered softly, “We can do a more in-depth test on the children. This way, we might be able to distinguish their link to Song Yang… and to you.”
Jin Yang shook his head and rejected her suggestion. Faint lines appeared in the corners of his eyes.
“The children have experienced too many things recently. Their emotions have just stabilized. I don’t want to agitate them anymore.”
“No matter what happened in the past, it won’t affect my decision or judgment.”
“The future is the most important, isn’t it?”
Jin Yang looked up at her, and the determination in his eyes touched her. She used her slender, fair fingertips to caress Jin Yang’s black hair, and the two of them hugged tightly in passion. Jin Yang placed his palm on her cheek and gently kissed her red lips. It was as if he was recounting his deep love for her features as he slowly traced the shape of her lips.
“Ouch!”
A crashing sound was suddenly heard from outside the door. Qiu Tong and Jin Yang looked at each other as they pushed the door open. When they saw Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu running away in a panic, Qiu Tong sighed helplessly. Jin Yang curled his lips and carried her by the waist, using his knees to close the door.
Qiu Tong widened her eyes. She looked at Jin Yang, who was pressing down on her. From the corner of her eye, she saw the wedding photo on the bedside table. A gentle look flashed across her eyes as she responded to his kiss. Jin Yang raised his hand to caress the back of her legs, letting her slowly wrap them around his waist.
Jin Yang’s breathing was a little heavy. He was especially careful to avoid the place where Qiu Tong was injured.
Meanwhile, Qiu Tong took the initiative to unbutton his shirt. The tip of her tongue licked his Adam’s apple charmingly and slowly moved down, repeatedly licking his chest. Jin Yang was naturally unwilling to remain passive. He hugged her and pushed deep into her.
Qiu Tong’s body hung off Jin Yang. She gently hooked her arms around his shoulders. Every second in contact with him brought extreme pleasure and excitement. Jin Yang wrapped his arms around her legs and raised his head to give her a deep kiss. Ambiguous noise sounded in the bedroom.
Qiu Tong looked up. She was a little distracted as she recalled the abnormality in the Qiu family’s old residence. There seemed to be messy traces of dragging and rummaging under the thick layer of dust. Did this mean that someone had searched the Qiu family residence before her? Who were the people hiding behind the scenes? Was it related to Jin Yang?
Jin Yang noticed her distraction and gently bit her soft chest in dissatisfaction.
A numb current swept through her body as she moaned softly. When she saw Jin Yang’s ferocious beast-like eyes, she hurriedly begged for mercy, but it was too late.. Jinyang tormented her until she had no strength left in her body before hugging her in satisfaction.

chapters.title: Chapter 252 - Yu Ges Bail
chapters.content:
Chapter 252: Yu Ge’s Bail
In the S City prison, Yu Ge squatted in a corner with fear in his eyes. His body was thin as he gnawed on a rotten bun.
As a member of the terrorist organization, Yu Ge was under special custody in the prison.
The criminals here were all evil people. Yu Ge suffered inhuman pain every day. His eyes were bloodshot, and his expression was so lifeless that he was about to collapse.
The prison guard took out his keys and opened the metal door. He frowned at Yu Ge. “You, come out!”
Yu Ge got up shakily. He used his weak hands to support himself against the metal door railing as he said with a trembling voice, “Help!”
The two prison guards looked at each other for a moment before bringing Yu Ge to the bathroom to wash up. They changed him into a clean prison uniform.
“There’s a lawyer and family in the visiting room to see you.”
Yu Ge pointed at himself hesitantly. He repeated the guard’s words in disbelief.
When Yu Ge was young, his parents had passed away due to an accident. He had no relatives at all. He had grown up in bad company in the streets, relying on despicable methods to cheat for food and drinks. Up until now, the only person who could be considered a family member was Qiu Tong, who had almost married him. However, it was impossible for her to bring a lawyer to bail him out!
Yu Ge dragged his heavy chains as he followed the prison guard into the visiting room.
At the table, a blonde man stood up in a well-ironed suit. He took out two bills and stuffed them into the prison guard’s hands before sending them out. Yu Ge looked at them curiously, his eyes filled with vigilance and distrust.
“Hello, I am Terrence. This is the lawyer who helped to arrange for your bail.”
Yu Ge took two steps back and said in a clear voice, “You were hired by Qiu Tong to deceive me, right?”
When Terrence saw that Yu Ge was extremely agitated, he hurriedly spread his arms to indicate for him to calm down.
“Mr. Yu Ge, let’s sit down and chat.”
Yu Ge took a seat. Terrence gestured for the lawyer to hand over the two documents. He pushed his gold-framed glasses up his nose bridge and explained, “We are the executive assistant and lawyer of the overseas Liqing Corporation. You should have heard of the Liqing Corporation, right?”
“Our CEO lived in S City more than 20 years ago and he had a child with his girlfriend at that time.”
“After the CEO went overseas to develop his career, he broke off all contact with S City. Over the recent years, he has started looking for his child…”
Yu Ge looked up at Terrence in disbelief, as if he had already guessed what he was about to say. He quickly opened the documents, and it was indeed a paternity test report.
Terrence said respectfully, “Yes, you’re our CEO’s son.”
“We’ve done a detailed investigation and confirmation in advance, but if you don’t believe us, we can send you overseas to meet our CEO and do a paternity test again…” Terrence said slowly. He realized that Yu Ge had lifted his handcuffed arms. He said with a smile,” We’ll settle the relevant procedures. You can leave this place tonight”
Yu Ge heaved a long sigh of relief. He used half a minute to digest the sudden change in his status.
When he looked up again, Yu Ge’s eyes shone with arrogance and madness. The tables have finally turned!
Half an hour later, Yu Ge walked out of the prison gate in a custom-made suit. He looked back with a cold smile on his face. Terrence instructed the driver to park the limousine at the entrance of the prison. Yu Ge sat inside with his suit jacket buttoned. He looked at the scenery outside the car window and asked, “Where are we going?”
Terrence handed him a tablet. “The Liqing Corporation wants to develop their business in the country and has established a company in S City.”
“Our CEO believes that you know the country and S City very well. This company will be under your control. We will listen to your orders and assist you with as well as we can. No matter what requests you have, we will do our best to help you fulfill them.”
Terrence’s humble attitude made Yu Ge feel a little smug. The image of Qiu Tong appeared in his mind as he thought of a brilliant revenge plan.
…
In the study of the villa, Qiu Tong locked the door from the inside and sat in front of the computer in her sleeping gown.
Qiu Tong took out the chip that Ye Luan had given her and carefully placed it into the device. Countless codes flashed across the computer screen as if it was an automated program. Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and tapped the keyboard to decipher and analyze the data until the final step appeared on the blue screen. “Please enter the password.”
If the human modification plan was led by Qiu Rong, as Ye Luan had said, then the password might be related to her?
Qiu Tong tried the date of her birthday and Qiu Rong’s.
However, a piercing alert rang out.
A red exclamation mark on the screen kept flashing. “Final attempt. If the password continues to be entered incorrectly, the self-destruct sequence will be activated.”
Qiu Tong retracted her finger nervously. She didn’t dare to take the risk and could only resentfully put the chip away.
It was a tranquil night outside. Countless thoughts surged into her mind, causing her to feel anxious.
Qiu Tong stared at the string of numbers in her bank balance and muttered, “It looks like if we want to know the details of the human modification plan, we have to get Dad out as soon as possible…”

chapters.title: Chapter 253 - Liqing Corporation
chapters.content:
Chapter 253: Liqing Corporation
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The next morning, Qiu Tong was on the sofa scrolling through the information on the Dark Web, hoping to find some lucrative bounty missions.
Qiu Xingyu sat down close to her. Curious, she stole a glance at the screen that was flashing with information. She realized that they were recruitment notices regarding underground combat.
Qiu Xingyu immediately sat up in shock. She held Qiu Tong’s phone with both hands and shook her head worriedly.
“Mommy! Do you need money? I have a lot. Can you not do anything dangerous?”
Qiu Xingyu’s voice was very loud. When Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao heard her, they hurriedly ran over.
The three pairs of scrutinizing eyes stared fixedly at Qiu Tong. Qiu Tong rubbed the top of Little Yu’s head with mixed emotions and comforted them. “Mommy is just bored…”
Qiu Xingyuan frowned and pursed his thin lips as he crossed his arms. Clearly, he did not believe her explanation.
Qiu Xingqiao moved quickly. He ran to the bedroom and took out their pink piggy bank. He raised it above his head, wanting to smash it.
Qiu Tong hurriedly stopped him. She understood that the children were worried about her safety and were being overly cautious.
