Jin Tao was silent for a moment on the other end of the line. His voice was authoritative. “Just follow my orders!”
“Only by creating an opportunity for Qiu Tong to bring him out will we have a chance to obtain the information for the second half of the modification plan.”
“Qiu Rong can help us perfect the drug. What do you know?! Don’t ruin my plan, understand?!”
Anger and killing intent flashed across Jin Tao’s eyes. The prison guard trembled as he answered, “Yes, I understand.”
Qiu Rong hid in a corner of the cell as he analyzed the drug Qiu Tong had given him. He sniffed twice and a gratified smile appeared on his face. It seemed like Qiu Xingyuan’s chemistry expertise had reached a new level. He was indeed his grandson!
Qiu Rong quietly dissolved the powdered drug that could paralyze one’s limbs into the syringe. He hid it in his sleeve and laid in bed.
On the other side, Qiu Tong had returned to the villa to prepare dinner for the children.
As she held the sharp kitchen knife, her mind wandered for some reason. She accidentally cut her finger and bled a lot.
Jin Yang was worried about her and asked her to rest in the living room. Qiu Tong wanted to pour some warm water for Qiu Xingyu, but she was too distracted and didn’t hold the cup properly. The cup shattered on the ground…
As she stared at the glass shards all over the ground, her heart felt as if it was being tugged at and she couldn’t breathe.
She had an ominous feeling. Jin Yang hugged her and patted her back gently to comfort her.
In the next second, an ear-piercing ringtone sounded in the villa. Qiu Tong looked at the caller ID.. It was from the prison. She stood up abruptly…

chapters.title: Chapter 268 - At The Hospital
chapters.content:
Chapter 268: At The Hospital
There was news from the prison that Qiu Rong had been accidentally injured and had been sent to the hospital for treatment.
Without even changing her clothes, Qiu Tong grabbed her coat and put it on before running out into the courtyard in her slippers.
Jin Yang motioned for Shao An to drive her to the hospital while he rushed to the prison to investigate the situation. The winding mountain road in the deep forest seemed exceptionally long at this moment. Qiu Tong urged softly, “Hurry up, hurry up.”
Shao An was sitting straight up and he gritted his teeth as he stepped on the accelerator. He drove through countless red lights towards the hospital.
The hospital’s red emergency lights were flashing in the distance. The car was still moving when Qiu Tong pulled the door open and jumped out.
She stumbled and almost fell, but quickly regained her balance. According to the instructions on the reception desk, Qiu Tong looked for the nurse and asked anxiously, “Where is the patient sent from S City Prison?”
The nurse was so frightened that she raised her hand and pointed at the emergency room at the end of the corridor. Qiu Tong thanked her. When she saw the warden pacing back and forth nervously, she frowned and rushed over. She asked, “What happened?!”
The warden’s face turned pale. He rubbed his hands together and wanted to explain, but he couldn’t.
The emergency room door was pushed open. The nurses and doctors took off their masks and shook their heads gently. A bed covered in a white sheet appeared in front of her. Her legs went soft as she knelt on the ground. Her body trembled non-stop as she muttered with reddened eyes, “Impossible!”
“Think of another way…”
Qiu Tong thought of her special ability. She waved the nurse’s hand away and ran to the bed without hesitation.
She wanted to use her special ability to save Qiu Rong’s life!
When Shao An rushed over and saw the state that Qiu Tong was in, he hurriedly held her back. He turned around and shouted at the doctor, “What are you standing there for?”
“Come and help!”
The hospital was in a mess. A confused voice was heard at the end of the corridor. “Tongtong? What’s wrong?”
Qiu Tong turned around stiffly. Qiu Rong’s prison uniform was stained with large amounts of blood. His arm was wrapped in thick gauze, and there were stitches on his brow bone. His left leg was also a little stiff, but he was still standing in front of her!
The warden said timidly, “Mr. Qiu’s life is not in danger. That’s another patient in the operating theater…”
Shao An stared at him with a frown. When Qiu Rong brought them back to his ward, Qiu Tong felt her vision grow dim and her head spin. She tried her best to calm herself down and asked, “Dad, what happened in the prison?”
Qiu Rong picked up the syringe on the bed, his eyes filled with relief and fear.
“Not long after you left, a prison guard secretly came to my cell. I remembered your advice and pretended to be asleep to deceive him. I wanted to see what he wanted to do to me. I didn’t expect him to have the intention to kill!”
Qiu Rong looked at the wound on his arm. He was afraid that Qiu Tong would worry so he did not describe the fight in detail.
However, Qiu Tong could still see the seriousness of the situation from the wounds on his body. The knife wounds on Qiu Rong’s legs were very deep. The wound on his brow bone was clearly caused by a heavy object. If he had dodged just a second slower, he would have been severely injured and fallen unconscious.
Seeing her biting her lips, Qiu Rong raised his hand and gently patted the top of her head. He smiled and said, “Thankfully, I had Qiu Xingyuan’s drug.”
“It was the drug which saved me. I injected all the drug into the guard’s body. That prison guard should still be unconscious. You need to quickly go and…”
Qiu Rong reminded as he glanced at Shao An. He nodded and left the ward to contact Jin Yang.
The warden quietly pushed the door open and entered. He looked at her apologetically, his face pale and ashen.
“Miss Qiu, that prison guard was hired five years ago. There was no problem with his background information. We had no idea he would do such a thing! For this, I’m deeply sorry…”
“But don’t worry. The prison will definitely cooperate with the investigation. We will not hide anything.”
The warden glanced at Qiu Rong and handed a document over. He continued. “Mr. Qiu Rong is seriously injured, and it completely fits the prison’s approval criteria for bail. I’ve already helped you settle the paperwork in advance. As long as you sign it, Mr. Qiu can leave with you guys. All of this is in accordance with the rules.”
Qiu Tong frowned slightly. She was a little confused and couldn’t tell if it was a bad thing or a good thing that Qiu Rong was injured.
She scanned through the contents of the bail document and signed it before leaving with Qiu Rong. The hospital was not a completely safe place. If the other party could infiltrate the prison, they could also disguise themselves as hospital staff to get close to Qiu Rong!
Only the villa in the deep forest was safe.
Qiu Tong didn’t dare to trust anyone other than Jin Yang…
In the quiet car, Qiu Tong held Qiu Rong’s hand tightly. She secretly transmitted a faint but steady dose of her special ability to help him recover.
Qiu Rong felt a warm current flowing through his palm endlessly, making him feel indescribably comfortable.
His brows relaxed, but he didn’t forget to comfort Qiu Tong. He patted the back of her hand gently. “Don’t worry, I’m fine. My body is very strong and I only have superficial wounds. I’ll be fine very soon.”
Qiu Tong had overspent her special ability. She nodded tiredly and gave a faint smile..

chapters.title: Chapter 269 - Family Reunion
chapters.content:
Chapter 269: Family Reunion
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The cold night was bone-chilling.
When Qiu Tong and Qiu Rong reached the villa, they saw Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and the rest waiting outside with flashlights in their hands.
When Qiu Xingyu saw the car driving into the courtyard, she ran over and waved her arms as she shouted, “Mommy!”
Shao An slowed the car down. Ye Luan carried Qiu Xingyu to a safe area.
Qiu Tong saw that the children’s faces were red from the cold. Clearly, they had been waiting for them outside for a long time.
When Ke Le received the news, he pushed over the wheelchair that he had prepared earlier and let Qiu Rong sit in it. He scratched his head and explained, “When Boss called, they were all eavesdropping. I advised them to wait in the house, but they refused.”
Qiu Xingyu sniffed and threw herself into Qiu Rong’s arms. “I miss Grandpa so much. I wanted to see Grandpa as soon as possible!”
She bumped against Qiu Rong’s wounded arm and he instinctively winced.
Qiu Xingyuan could tell that something was wrong and hurriedly pulled her off. “Grandpa seems to be injured. Be careful!”
Qiu Tong urged the whole family to return to the villa. Qiu Rong narrowed his eyes as he sized up the building that resembled a base in the mountains.
Countless sentries were hidden along the mountain road. Guards with real guns numbered in the hundreds. The glass windows of the villa were all bulletproof. According to the construction blueprint, there was also a basement that could withstand missile attacks. Qiu Tong had raised three children on her own. How did she manage to arrange all this?
Qiu Rong sized up Shao An with a scrutinizing gaze. It was obvious that he was from the army and had a high status.
When he was at the hospital, he could talk to the warden directly. The warden was also very respectful to him.
Qiu Rong thought of everything that had happened previously. Just as he was about to ask, the door to the villa opened. Jin Yang appeared in his line of sight. The guards behind him were carrying the unconscious prison guard. “Bring him to the basement and stand guard over him.”
After giving his instructions, Jin Yang walked to Qiu Tong’s side and gently held her hand. He greeted Qiu Rong. “Hello, Uncle Qiu.”
Qiu Rong widened his eyes. Although he had guessed that Qiu Tong had some dealings with Jin Yang, he didn’t expect their relationship to be so intimate!
Qiu Xingyu didn’t notice the tense atmosphere. She hugged Jin Yang’s leg coquettishly and looked up innocently. “Grandpa is moving in too. Our whole family is reunited! Uncle Jin Yang’s body is so cold! I will warm you up!”
Qiu Xingyu held Jin Yang’s large palm with her chubby hands. Qiu Rong’s emotions were indescribably complicated.
He frowned as he sized up Qiu Tong and Jin Yang.
Qiu Tong thought for a moment and explained, “We encountered some trouble and have to stay here for the time being. Jin Yang and I are husband and wife now. There have been many things that happened between us that I can’t explain to you in just a few words.”
Married?!
Qiu Rong was so agitated that he slammed the armrest of his wheelchair. He pointed at Jin Yang and said, “How can the president marry a civilian?”
“Tongtong, he’s definitely lying to you! Jin Tao… why would his family accept you?”
Qiu Rong was in a fluster. Jin Yang looked at him suspiciously and inquisitively.
Why did he feel that Qiu Rong knew him and Jin Tao very well?
Jin Yang had his doubts but didn’t express them in public. Instead, he tightened his grip on Qiu Tong’s hand. “Uncle Qiu, my feelings for her are serious. Please don’t worry.”
Qiu Rong was abnormally angry and wanted to separate Jin Yang and Qiu Tong. When Qiu Xingyu saw Qiu Rong’s face had turned red from anger, she ran to his side with sparkling eyes. “Grandpa, don’t be angry! I will care for you. Your wound will recover soon.”
“Uncle Jin Yang treats Mommy and us very well! I like him a lot. Grandpa, don’t hate him, okay?”
Qiu Xingyu was very sensitive and considerate. She could feel Qiu Rong’s dislike for Jin Yang.
She pouted and shook Qiu Rong’s arm ingratiatingly. She also gestured to Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao to help.
They surrounded Qiu Rong with awkward expressions and deliberately talked about other topics to distract him.
Clanging sounds came from the kitchen. Ye Luan walked out clumsily with two bowls of ginger soup.
He looked at Qiu Rong with bright eyes and handed him the ginger soup. “Grandpa Qiu, have some to warm your stomach. Auntie Qiu, you too…”
Qiu Rong looked at Ye Luan’s eyes, which were very similar to his old friend. He touched his head with reddened eyes. “Good child, you’ve suffered! Your father often told me about you. You’re his greatest pride in life!”
“He said that you have astonishing talent in biology. He mentioned to me many times that he wants you to join this profession.”
Qiu Rong had been in prison for many years and guessed that Ye Luan’s father must have already passed away. He looked at the boy with even more pity and love.
When Ye Luan heard his words, he finally couldn’t control his emotions. He hugged Qiu Rong and wailed.
“Grandpa Qiu, I miss him so much. I miss my father so much…”
Qiu Tong and Jin Yang stood by the side.. When they saw that Ye Luan had finally let down his guard and revealed his inner thoughts, they couldn’t help being moved to tears too.

chapters.title: Chapter 270 - Psychological Tactics
chapters.content:
Chapter 270: Psychological Tactics
In the dark and dim basement, Shao An whipped the prison guard with a soft whip filled with thorns.
The prison guard spat out two mouthfuls of blood. He glared at Shao An and shouted hoarsely, “Come at me again! Is that all you’ve got? You’re just scratching an itch for me!”
Shao An raised his hand to tug at the collar of his shirt. He brushed the blood from his cheek and took out the dagger hidden in his military boots.
The prison guard’s chest was full of whip marks. His split flesh looked particularly terrifying.
The enclosed environment was filled with the smell of blood, as the prison guards provoked Shao An.
Just as he was about to attack him again, Qiu Tong appeared at the staircase. She berated Shao An for his actions and reminded him coldly, “Don’t let him manipulate your emotions. He deliberately made you angry.”
Shao An was shocked. He cleaned up the stains on the floor and instructed the guards to turn on all the lights in the room.
Qiu Tong and Jin Yang sat opposite the prison guard. She said softly with a smile in her eyes, “It looks like you are quite smart. You know psychology? To be able to provoke Shao An like this, you are definitely no amateur.”
“The warden said that you passed the test five years ago and have been hiding in S City Prison for many years. Could it be that your mission is just to kill Qiu Rong?”
“Why is he worth exposing your identity? Qiu Rong is just an ordinary researcher, isn’t he?”
Qiu Tong stared at the prison guard, unwilling to let go of any changes in his expression.
The prison guard pressed the tip of his tongue against his teeth and sneered. “No matter how many times you ask me, I will answer the same. The other prisoners gave me money in exchange for more peaceful days, but Qiu Rong just had to go against me. There are so many deaths in the prison. I could make him go away just by using the excuse of a sudden illness. But I didn’t expect him to be able to escape me.”
“You want to interfere in a private feud between a prison guard and an inmate?”
The prison guard laughed wildly. He was stubborn. Shao An narrowed his eyes and walked over, punching a wounded part of his body twice.
Qiu Tong remained calm. She knew very well that the more the prison guard wanted to provoke them, the more it proved that he knew a lot more information. He might have the clues they wanted.
The prison guard could not move in the basement. He wanted to commit suicide, but he couldn’t find a way.
Qiu Tong twirled her pen calmly and nodded in agreement. “Your explanation is flawless.”
“The person behind you has brilliant methods. I have to admit your employment records in the prison were all done through proper channels. I couldn’t find any clues, but are you willing to accept this? Are you willing to be sacrificed as a pawn?”
Qiu Tong walked to the prison guard, while Jin Yang stood beside her, protecting her.
The prison guard’s eyes flickered. He looked away, not daring to meet Qiu Tong’s eyes. Shao An held his chin, forcing him to face her.
Qiu Tong’s eyes were filled with pity as she whispered, “You can clearly perform many more missions. Your skills are not bad. To be able to endure Shao An’s torture and refuse to betray your boss, you are truly loyal.”
“But he treated you like an abandoned dog, arranging for you to go through a dull prison routine everyday for years. You were there just waiting to be used.”
“Your only mission is to kill someone, a prisoner who can’t resist at all. Did your boss ever consider the possibility that you might fail? What are you to him? You’re like a dog that can be abandoned at any time, right?”
The prison guard wanted to use psychological tactics to court death, but Qiu Tong refused to let him succeed. As she spoke, her words pierced his heart. The man in front of her was already on the verge of collapse. Shao An looked at Qiu Tong in admiration as he swallowed silently and stared at Jin Yang guiltily.
Even in such a tense moment, Shao An couldn’t help musing that if Jin Yang and Qiu Tong were to go against each other, who would win?
Sensing his gaze, Jin Yang narrowed his long, narrow eyes and turned around. Shao An cleared his throat and lowered his head.
The prison guard lowered his head weakly. Qiu Tong noticed an unusual scar on his skin!
She tore off the prison guard’s clothes. The prison guard struggled and the chains binding his hands rang out. Jin Yang raised his leg and kicked him in the stomach. Shao An and the guards also restrained him.
Qiu Tong touched the hideous scar with her hand and thought of the tattoo. “You’re from the Vulture Organization?”
The prison guard paused for two seconds before denying it.
However, she could tell from his hesitation that she was right. Jin Yang handed her a handkerchief and she wiped the blood off her fingertips.
A glint flashed across Qiu Tong’s eyes as she tried other methods to confuse the prison guard’s mental state. “I know a few people from the Vulture Organization. They said that only exiled soldiers will get rid of their tattoo. No wonder you were assigned to such a mission.”
The prison guard finally lost control. He spat blood at Qiu Tong. “Bullshit!”
“I’m a top-notch killer! I was highly regarded and that was why I was assigned to go to S City Prison to keep an eye on that old fellow!”
Qiu Tong said happily, “I see.”
The prison guard realized that he had misspoken and wanted to salvage the situation, but it was already too late. He glared at the woman in front of him with hatred..

chapters.title: Chapter 271 - Ring Token
chapters.content:
Chapter 271: Ring Token
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The prison guard looked at Qiu Tong in fear, afraid that she would dig up more information. He gritted his teeth and kept quiet.
Jin Yang motioned for Shao An to continue his torture. Qiu Tong looked at the prison guard’s silent stance and felt that something was wrong.
She carefully observed the changes in the prison guard’s expression and realized that when Shao An attacked his stomach, his expression would be that of unbearable pain. The body did not lie. Qiu Tong was reminded of the hooligan who wanted to kidnap the children. He had once swallowed an important thing for safekeeping.
Qiu Tong stood up abruptly. “Wait. Open his mouth and see if you can find anything?”
Shao An followed her instructions and slowly approached, but the prison guard’s expression suddenly became nervous and frightened. He was so frantic that he wanted to bang his head against Shao An to stop his search.
Qiu Tong was increasingly certain of her judgment. She said coldly, “Even if you commit suicide, I can dissect your corpse and retrieve the item.”
“I advise you to save your strength and stop resisting. Perhaps you can preserve your life.”
The prison guard’s eyes were filled with the gloom of death. Shao An found a fishing line hooked between his teeth and pulled it… he washed the item with water and wrapped it with a tissue before handing it to Qiu Tong.
It was a ring. The acid in the guard’s stomach had corroded the material but Qiu Tong could still see the Vulture Organization’s symbol on it. Qiu Tong brought it out of the basement and found Ke Le. “Do you recognize this?”
Ke Le and the mercenaries surrounded her. “The ring might be a keepsake of the Vulture Organization. A killer we know in the Dark Web used to wear a pendant similar to this. It might be a symbol of the status of a soldier who has reached a certain level in the Vulture Organization.”
Qiu Tong and Jin Yang looked at each other. They seemed to have come near the edge of the foggy truth.
The children were already asleep. Jin Yang and Qiu Tong brought the mercenaries to the study and whispered solemnly, “What can you tell us regarding the Vulture Organization’s situation? Anything you can remember, tell us!”
Ke Le mulled over his memories. He scratched his head good-naturedly. “They’re all men driven to the brink. I’ve had very little contact with them.”
One of the mercenaries took two steps forward and said hesitantly, “I know a little!”
Ke Le looked back at him in shock. This mercenary’s code name was Skinny Monkey. He was one of the mercenaries who had followed Ke Le for the longest time. Ke Le dared to say that there were no secrets between them, so he didn’t expect Skinny Monkey to step out at this moment…
Skinny Monkey gritted his teeth guiltily. “Three years ago, I was addicted to gambling.”
“I hid it from Brother Ke Le and spent all my money on gambling. A group of gamblers played a trick on me and cheated me of all my money. They even tricked me into signing a huge loan contract. But I have already paid everything back now!”
Ke Le was so angry that he felt faint. He wanted to punch Skinny Monkey but restrained himself because of Qiu Tong and Jin Yang.
Skinny Monkey continued, “I once met a few people from the Vulture Organization at a gambling den called Sent Bar. They keep a low profile and usually hide among the gamblers. I had some dealings with them because I borrowed from some loan sharks.”
“They are extremely vigilant. Anyone who takes the initiative to contact and search for them will be secretly killed.”
“The soldiers of the Vulture Organization are divided into many levels. Most of them only have a one-way communication with the organization and they don’t know each other’s identities. The rings and tattoos are the only ways to confirm their identity. That’s all I know…”
Skinny Monkey looked at Ke Le and heaved a sigh of relief. All these years, he had always felt guilty for hiding something from him.
At this moment, the heavy stone that had been weighing on his heart for a long time was finally lifted. He felt more at ease.
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and played with the ring in her palm. “The Sent Bar?” she muttered.
Jin Yang understood her intentions and wanted to snatch the ring away. However, Qiu Tong quickly stuffed the item into her clothes.
“You can’t go!”
Qiu Tong looked at him with a faint smile. “You have a special status. You must not appear there or you will be in trouble if someone recognizes you.”
Jin Yang’s eyes were filled with gloom. He stared at her firm expression and said in a frustrated tone, “Let Shao An accompany you. I can feel more at ease then.”
“No, as your personal guard, Shao An will also be highly-recognizable in places like this bar. It’s very dangerous.”
Qiu Tong looked up and pointed at an alert-looking boy in the President’s team. She smiled and said confidently, “Those guys can accompany me to the bar. I’ll discuss the specific plan of action with you. There won’t be any accidents.”
Jin Yang stood up angrily and left the study. Over the past few days, he had heard too many words like “absolutely” and “definitely”. However, behind these guarantees were countless dangers…
He was Qiu Tong’s husband and the president of his country.. Yet, he felt utterly powerless and tormented at this moment.

chapters.title: Chapter 272 - Sent Bar
chapters.content:
Chapter 272: Sent Bar
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The villa was exceptionally quiet in the wee hours of the morning. Any slightest sound would be magnified.
Qiu Tong came out of the children’s room and was about to return to her bedroom to rest, she saw that the door to the guest room where Qiu Rong was staying was ajar. A shadow flashed past the dim room.
Feeling uneasy, she walked softly to the door and pushed it open as she knocked on it.
Sitting on the wheelchair, Qiu Rong’s back view was still regal. He dropped his gaze, as if he was angry at her.
Qiu Tong pushed him to the bed and squatted down in front of him. She asked helplessly, “Dad, what are you angry about?”
Qiu Rong looked into her eyes, unable to speak.
There was no way to change Jin Yang’s identity. The longer Qiu Tong interacted with him and the deeper their relationship grew, the greater the pain they would suffer in the end. Qiu Rong knew very well that those high-ranking officials were used to sweet-talking and deceiving others. Their current promises were just an illusory bubble. He didn’t want to see his daughter get hurt again.
While Qiu Tong and Jin Yang were interrogating the prison guard in the basement, Qiu Rong had played with the children.
Qiu Xingyu had been praising Jin Yang the whole time. Qiu Xingyuan had always been a boy of few words but he expressed his willingness to accept Jin Yang as their father. Qiu Rong felt even more uneasy. He wanted to persuade Qiu Tong to move out of the villa, but he didn’t know what to say.
Qiu Tong misunderstood his concern and said softly, “Dad, Jin Yang treats me very well.”
“Previously, I avoided his good intentions because I felt that being associated with high officials would bring trouble. I’m not alone. I still have Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu to take care of. I won’t be able to withstand…”
Qiu Rong nodded, but she continued, “But Jin Yang is different. He genuinely treats us well.”
“And he has the ability to protect us. I know you’re afraid that I’ll get involved in danger, but you’ve seen what happened in prison!”
“The human modification plan has already implicated the Qiu family. We can’t distance ourselves completely. All those forces want information on the plan. They chased after Ye Luan and even wanted to kill you. Do you still think we can hide? Where are we going to hide? Their reach is everywhere…”
Qiu Rong frowned in silence. He understood her reasoning, but he was unwilling to admit it.
Over the years, he had kept all his secrets and hid in prison, trying to make the outside world forget it all, but it was clearly useless. The storm would not stop just for anyone.
Qiu Tong placed her face in Qiu Rong’s aged palm and rubbed it against him as if she was a child. “Dad, I don’t know what you’re worried about, but Jin Yang is trustworthy. I hope you can support and believe in my choice and slowly let time prove it…”
“I will resolve this!”
Qiu Rong hugged her and sighed for a long time without saying anything else.
Before Qiu Tong left, Qiu Rong looked at her back profile and said softly, “I’m sorry, Tongtong. It’s Daddy’s fault.”
…
Three days later, Qiu Tong appeared at the entrance of the Sent Bar.
She looked beautiful and delicate. Her chestnut brown curly hair was draped over her collarbone, and her sexy leather jacket outlined her graceful figure. The moment she appeared, she attracted countless hooligans to whistle at her, becoming the focus of the bar.
The waiter guided her to the bar counter. “Hello, Miss. Is this your first time here?”
Qiu Tong took out a few bills and gently kissed them, leaving behind traces of lipstick. She then stuffed them into the waiter’s collar. She said charmingly, “A friend introduced me. He said that you have a place here where you can gamble. Can you bring me there, handsome?”
The waiter’s ears turned red and he was in a fluster as he led Qiu Tong to the casino on the second floor.
“You can exchange your chips here and choose a gambling table.”
“But you’d better not try the roulette. The stakes there are very high. Every night, many gamblers end up owing huge debts.”
The waiter spoke softly. He had good intentions and couldn’t bear to see such a beautiful woman fall into the depths of gambling addiction.
However, he didn’t expect Qiu Tong to walk straight towards the biggest betting counter.
She placed all her chips neatly on a number. The dealer was surprised by her action. Qiu Tong acted as if she didn’t notice his expression. She just twirled her hair with her fingers.
“Let’s begin…”
The roulette wheel spun, and the gamblers held their breaths until it stopped. The number was as Qiu Tong predicted. The dealer pushed a thick stack of chips at her. “Congratulations, you’re very lucky.”
Qiu Tong picked up two chips and played with them between her fingers as she pushed the rest of chips to the same number again.
The surrounding gamblers gasped. They were all shocked by the stubbornness in her eyes. Even the dealer paused for a moment. It was rare for a gambler to dare to repeat her bet!
Qiu Tong could feel countless pairs of eyes secretly scrutinizing her. Her goal had been achieved. She grinned and said lightly, “It’s my lucky number. I believe it can bring me wealth.. Please begin.”

chapters.title: Chapter 273 - Bo Langs Ambush
chapters.content:
Chapter 273: Bo Lang’s Ambush
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The environment of the casino was extremely chaotic. Gamblers were shouting in a crude and ugly manner.
News that there was a beautiful woman at the roulette wheel quickly spread. Qiu Tong was slowly surrounded by drunk onlookers. After failing a few times, she only had a few chips left. The sleazy onlookers heckled her. “Beauty, stop playing!”
“If you lose again, I’m afraid you’ll have to sell your body to the casino! We heard that the casino recently detained a few female guests who didn’t pay their debts and forced them to become strippers next door!”
The crowd roared with laughter at the story. The men stared at her lecherously, roving their eyes all over her body.
Qiu Tong looked up indifferently and pushed the remaining chips onto the table. “No need to worry about me!”
The wheel slowly came to a stop. Qiu Tong lost again.
The dealer took away all her chips and said apologetically, “Do you want to continue placing more bets? If you don’t have any more chips, you have to leave your seat as soon as possible to give others a chance.” Qiu Tong could see just how ruthless the casino was. She glanced at the president’s guard who had sneaked into the gambling den with her and rubbed her ears. It was their secret signal..
The guard caught her signal and raised his voice. “Beauty, do you have anything valuable on you? You can pawn it in the casino!”
“You can redeem it after you earn back your money. Don’t give up!”
It was easy to instigate the other gamblers. They all echoed the guard’s words and even suggested things to Qiu Tong.
“The necklace you’re wearing looks pretty good…”
Another guard approached her and pulled out the ring hanging on a chain hidden under her leather jacket. The ring with the Vulture Organization’s logo was exposed to everyone for about three seconds. Qiu Tong timed it precisely before stuffing the ring back into her clothes. “Don’t touch it!”
“You’re not worthy!”
Qiu Tong then downed her drink and staggered out of the casino.
In a corner of the casino, a few people stood up and exchanged glances with each other before following Qiu Tong…
…
In the dark and narrow alleyway outside the Sent Bar, Qiu Tong slowed her footsteps until she heard faint sounds behind her.
A fist flew towards her, bringing with it a gust of cold air. Qiu Tong quickly bent down to dodge it. Stepping off the wall, she used the momentum to soar into the air and grabbed the other party’s neck with her legs, dragging him onto the ground. “Do you want money? Or sex?”
A mocking smile appeared on her lips as she continued with killing intent in her eyes, “No matter what it is, provoking me tonight will be the death of you!”
Qiu Tong squeezed her legs together, wanting to strangle the burly man who had attacked her.
However, four to five burly men rushed in from both sides of the alley. Seeing that the situation was not good, Qiu Tong took out a dagger that she carried with her and pulled the man up from the ground. She placed the sharp blade against the artery of his neck and said loudly, “Are you guys in cahoots? Don’t come over! Otherwise, I’ll kill him…”
The hostage held by Qiu Tong suddenly laughed and said hoarsely, “Good moves.”
As the dark clouds that blocked the moonlight dissipated, Qiu Tong saw an obvious scar on the burly man’s left eye. His pupils were dark blue and they looked a little strange when they moved. Taking advantage of her distraction, the burly man grabbed her knife and pried it away from his neck.
Blood flowed down his palm and quickly formed a puddle on the ground.
The burly man seemed to not feel any pain as the others gathered around him. He grabbed Qiu Tong’s hair and pressed her to the ground.
“The ring you are wearing around your neck, who does it belong to? Where did you get it?”
The burly man questioned Qiu Tong. She could feel the bones in her arm being twisted, nearly to the point of being dislocated
Her forehead was covered in cold sweat from the pain, but she still gritted her teeth and cursed, “It’s mine! What do you care? Don’t even think about taking it away!”
The burly men laughed. They released Qiu Tong and she struggled to stand up, staring at them in confusion.
“We’re all part of the same family.”
The burly man tore open his T-shirt to reveal the tattoo on his shoulder. Qiu Tong’s pupils dilated as she tried to identify it. “You guys were also split from the organization?”
The burly men exchanged glances and pointed at the dilapidated wine house in front of them. “This place isn’t suitable for a long chat. Let’s go over there to talk.” Qiu Tong did not move but just stared at them. The burly man in the lead looked at her in surprise.
Qiu Tong pointed at the ring in his hand. “Give that back to me.”
Realization dawned on the burly man and he smiled. He threw the ring back to her. “I’m Bo Lang. What about you?”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and followed them with a disdainful expression. She answered in a faint voice, “Sally.”
Everyone in the Vulture Organization used fake code names so Qiu Tong wasn’t afraid that they would investigate her. This was why she dared to toss out a fake name.
Bo Lang raised his eyebrows and smiled with an indifferent expression. “Your name suits you.”
When they reached the winehouse, Bo Lang arranged for two of them to stand guard outside. He led Qiu Tong past the corridor with lanterns hanging on it. When they reached the backroom, Bo Lang closed the door and looked at her with a smile.. The scar on his left eye was particularly eye-catching.

chapters.title: Chapter 274 - Interrogation
chapters.content:
Chapter 274: Interrogation
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“Which branch of the organization are you affiliated with? What mission are you carrying out in S City?”
Bo Lang took out two bottles of hard liquor from the liquor cabinet and waved them at her as he asked in a familiar manner.
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes at his actions and remained silent.
Bo Lang didn’t mind. The brown liquid flowed into two glass cups. He took out two white pills and tossed one in each. Dense bubbles instantly erupted in the glasses. This was probably one of the methods the Vulture Organization used to identify their members.
Bo Lang moved one of the cups closer to Qiu Tong. He wiped his thin lips with his thumb and said with a smile, “Truth serum.”
“It’s a sort of stimulant. Give it a try? Members of the organization often complain it’s not stimulative enough!”
Bo Lang raised his head and downed his own cup, his hawk-like eyes staring fixedly at her.
Qiu Tong knew that she had to drink it. Otherwise, the burly men standing beside her would beat her up.
She raised her hand to twirl her hair as she secretly unscrewed the hidden mechanism in her hair clip and dipped her index finger in the transparent liquid inside.
Qiu Tong raised her glass and dipped her index finger in it before clinking glasses with Bo Lang and drinking it all.
As the hot alcohol flowed down her throat and into her stomach, Qiu Tong quickly felt dizzy. She forced herself to sit up straight and stare in Bo Lang’s direction with a cold smile. “I didn’t expect to be screened like this after being split from the organization for half a year. How ridiculous!”
Bo Lang raised his eyebrows and looked at her in doubt. “How did you get separated?”
Quests covered her forehead with her hand and bit the tip of her tongue with her teeth, relying on the stabbing pain to maintain her consciousness. “The higher-ups have arranged for me to lie low, but ever since the mission was issued to me five months ago, there has been no contact. He might be dead. When I entered the organization, my status was low, so I couldn’t contact anyone else. I could only wander around S City, gamble, and try my best to survive, waiting to be activated at any time.”
Bo Lang’s blue left eye swiveled as he pointed at the ring hanging around her neck. “Is that yours?”
Qiu Tong shook her head. She remembered that Ke Le and the prison guard had both mentioned the rank of the ring. “The ring belongs to my handler.”
“I stole it while he was drunk. I thought I would return it to him when I carried out a mission. I didn’t expect…”
Qiu Tong had chosen to win Bo Lang’s trust with honesty. Bo Lang took out his dagger and rubbed his fingers against the blade. He leaned back in his chair and stared at her. “Where is your tattoo?”
The room froze for a moment. Qiu Tong’s body swayed as she stood up, her eyes tearing as she opened the collar of her tight-fitting clothes in a flirtatious manner.
The dark green tattoo was eye-catching on her round and plump breasts. The surrounding burly men took deep breaths. Bo Lang only glanced at her briefly before gesturing for her to sit down. At the same time, he cleared his throat, indicating for everyone to restrain the filthy thoughts in their minds.
After all, they were comrades. The burly men pushed open the windows and let the cold wind cool down their primitive instincts.
Qiu Tong slowly stuffed the ring back into her clothes. She had drawn the tattoo of the Vulture Organization from memory and got Jin Yang to draw it on her chest overnight. Only if it was drawn on an intimate part of her body would it prevent Bo Lang from examining it further.
Qiu Tong was right again!
The truth serum was very effective. Under the effects of the drug, Qiu Tong was unable to tell a meticulous lie. Bo Lang’s attitude towards her changed from suspicion to trust. He tossed some beef jerky in front of her and said hatefully, “The recent deployment in S City is very tight. We have also lost contact with the higher-ups. However, the organization focus has shifted from overseas to here. I believe there will be some big movements soon.”
“Don’t worry. Since we have encountered each other, it’s considered fate!”
“I’ll definitely inform you when our handlers need us to carry out a mission.”
Bo Lang raised his hand as Qiu Tong’s indifferent gaze met his.
Bo Lang then pried open his eyelids and took out one of his blue eyes. “It’s fake. This eye was blinded during a battle with the capital’s army. I will always remember this debt. I took the initiative to come here from overseas to seek revenge on the guy!”
Qiu Tong picked up her glass and took two sips before saying hoarsely, “It looks like he’s very powerful.”
When Bo Lang saw her actions, his smile grew wider. He nodded and admitted, “He’s a very powerful opponent!”
“It’s getting late. Where are you staying? I’ll get someone to send you back!”
Qiu Tong wanted to refuse, but Bo Lang stood up and stopped her protests. “You’re young and beautiful. The truth serum’s effects are still in play. I will feel guilty if you encounter any trouble on the way. No need to stand on ceremony with me!”
Was this her final test? Qiu Tong smiled as she played with her curly hair. Her red lips parted slightly as she said, “Alright.”
Outside the dilapidated wine house, Bo Lang stared at the back profiles of Qiu Tong and two other members of the organization.. He whispered to his assistant, “Do you think there’s a problem with her identity?” The assistant shook his head. Bo Lang stabbed a dagger into the wall and said coldly, “The more perfect her performance is, the more suspicious she is!”

chapters.title: Chapter 275 - Expelling the Truth Serum
chapters.content:
Chapter 275: Expelling the Truth Serum
Going by the address provided by Qiu Tong, the dilapidated van was speeding towards the black market.
Qiu Tong sat in the back seat while two burly men sat in front. They could smell the faint fragrance emanating from her body, and their bodies were reacting. One of the men rolled down the car window, and the cold wind blew at her hair. Qiu Tong felt her mind return to clarity and rationality.
“You’ve been in S City for so long. You never found a woman to settle your needs?”
Qiu Tong stared provocatively at the men. One of them was more shy and he kept swallowing as he shook his head.
The other burly man was more bold. He took the initiative to place his hand on Qiu Tong’s waist and pressed his face against her neck. He took a deep breath. “The organization sent us to S City for more than three months. We’ve been camping out near 730 Guangming Road every day. How would we have the time to find women?!”
730?! Qiu Tong thought of Professor Dong’s laboratory. Could it be that his research had made some progress?
Qiu Tong suppressed her disgust and allowed the man to take advantage of her.
She asked tentatively, “Bo Lang is your superior?”
The shy man nodded. His body was tense as he stared at Qiu Tong, his hand covering the tent between his legs.
“Bo Lang is a high-ranking member of the Vulture Organization. He personally led the team to S City to await instructions from the handler. We’ve been waiting for the handler’s signal. There should be news in a few days.”
“Don’t be anxious. Since Bo Lang promised you that he will help you contact the organization again, he will definitely keep his promise.”
The burly man wanted to unbuckle his pants, but Qiu Tong avoided his touch and deliberately said in a cold tone, “I don’t believe anyone! You guys are at the casino every day. Perhaps you’re also abandoned by the organization!”
The shy man blinked. He wanted to kiss Qiu Tong’s. He blurted out. “Bo Lang spoke to our handler on the phone yesterday! They agreed to meet in half a month!”
Qiu Tong narrowed her eyes and smiled now that she got the information she wanted from them.
She pointed at the dark alley in front of the van. “We are here.”
She gently pushed the two of them aside and jumped out of the van. She blew a seductive kiss at them and walked towards the building.
This was the residence of the gangsters who had abducted the children. Qiu Tong had instructed Jin Yang and Shao An to set up an ambush in advance.
She pushed the door open and entered the room, turning on the dim yellow electric light.
The van parked in front of the building for about 15 minutes before leaving the alley.
Qiu Tong hid behind the curtains. Her vision was a little blurry, and she could feel waves of heat emanating from her abdomen. Her body felt especially empty.
The colorless antidote Qiu Xingyuan had given her was able to break down and eliminate a portion of the drug, but the truth serum that Bo Lang had given her was extremely effective. The fact that she could endure until now was already more than she could bear.
A soft sound rang out on the wooden floor. Qiu Tong vigilantly took out the dagger she carried with her. However, her hand was controlled by the other party, and the two of them struggled with each other.
Under the moonlight, Jin Yang’s handsome face appeared in Qiu Tong’s vision. She relaxed her strength and fell into his arms weakly.
“Mr. President, Miss Qiu, they’ve already left. Are you alright?”
Shao An wanted to barge in, but Jin Yang shouted at him, “Get out! Close the door!…”
Jin Yang carried Qiu Tong and placed her on the simple foldable bed.
Qiu Tong’s face was red. She felt very hot as she tugged at her tights. When Jin Yang returned after drawing the curtains, she threw herself into his arms in her sexy undergarments. “Help me! I feel so uncomfortable, so hot…”
Jin Yang’s Adam’s apple bobbed. He sighed softly and pressed her against the foldable bed.
He placed her fair and slender legs on his shoulders and pushed himself into her. Due to the effects of the drug, her body was even more sensitive than before. She kept letting out soft moans as she called out Jin Yang’s name softly.
This undoubtedly stimulated Jin Yang. His muscles were covered in fine sweat.
Under the moonlight, he saw the love bites on her neck. A ruthless glint flashed across his eyes as he forced her to the corner of the bed.
Jin Yang held her hands and raised her arms high. He bent down and bit down heavily on her breasts.
Qiu Tong felt a numbing sensation spread throughout her body. She couldn’t help but tremble slightly. Jin Yang gritted his teeth as he resisted the urge. He stopped just when Qiu Tong was about to reach cloud nine.
“Hurry up, Jin Yang. I want… you!”
Qiu Tong felt exceptionally empty. Her hands wrapped around Jin Yang’s neck like vines as she licked him with misty eyes. Jin Yang felt his scalp tingle. In the end, he lost control and continued to thrust.
Only when a thin fog appeared outside did Shao An finally hear Jin Yang say in a hoarse voice, “Bring the clothes over.”
Shao An straightened his back and wished he could close his eyes when he reached the door. He handed the two bags over and quickly turned around. “Sir, the car is already waiting outside. We can set off at any time!”
Jin Yang frowned silently. He helped Qiu Tong up and changed her clothes before leaving quietly..

chapters.title: Chapter 276 - Pleasing His Father-In-Law
chapters.content:
Chapter 276: Pleasing His Father-In-Law
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The next afternoon, Qiu Tong was awakened from a nightmare.
The dazzling sunlight outside made it difficult for her to open her eyes. The effects of the truth serum and Jin Yang’s torment made her body ache and tired.
The extremely realistic nightmare made Qiu Tong panic. She wanted to turn over and sit up, but a pair of cold and delicate hands reached over and wiped the sweat off her forehead.
Qiu Tong turned around in surprise to see the children surrounding her. Their eyes were filled with worry.
Qiu Xingyuan pursed his lips and placed the thermometer in her mouth.
Qiu Tong waited for two minutes in a daze. She heaved a sigh of relief after he took it out and read the numbers carefully.
Qiu Xingyu pounced into her arms and rubbed her face coquettishly. “Mommy, you scared us all!”
Qiu Xingqiao nodded. “Uncle Jin Yang carried you back last night. He didn’t allow us to disturb you and said that you needed to rest.”
Qiu Tong recalled the intense battle last night and could understand the reasoning behind Jin Yang’s words.
Qiu Xingyu tugged at her pajamas. Her sparkling eyes caught a glimpse of the red mark on her neck as she rubbed it with her short fingers. “Mommy’s neck was bitten by a mosquito! I will stop the itch by applying some ointment on Mommy!”
Qiu Tong’s ears turned red at her childish words. She hurriedly carried them out of the room.
Before leaving, she took out a thin scarf from her closet and wrapped it around her neck. When she looked at herself in the mirror, the scarf did look rather out of place.
In the living room, Jin Yang and Shao An compared the photos of the members of the Vulture Organization they had taken last night. They found that no information could be found on them anywhere, even on the Dark Web.
It seemed that the Vulture Organization was much more powerful than they had imagined.
Qiu Tong carried Little Yu as she sat beside Jin Yang. He thoughtfully handed her a cup of tea.
Qiu Xingyu opened her arms coquettishly to let Jin Yang hug her. She tilted her head in confusion and stared at the red mark on Jin Yang’s Adam’s apple before turning to look at Qiu Tong again. “Eh? That’s strange! Why are the mosquitoes in the villa specifically biting Mommy and Uncle Jin Yang?”
When Qiu Rong heard her words, he halted his footsteps and turned to carry Qiu Xingyu away.
As he did so, he shot Jin Yang a dirty look. Qiu Tong blinked at Jin Yang, who shrugged helplessly.
It seemed like it would take a long time for the President to get his father-in-law’s approval…
Qiu Tong summarized the information she garnered last night to Jin Yang and Shao An.
They could confirm that the Vulture Organization’s purpose in coming to S City was for the human modification plan. Bo Lang was a high-ranking member of the organization and Qiu Tong felt that he might be able to reach its core.
Jin Yang stared at the computer screen solemnly. He had a nagging feeling that things were going too smoothly.
“Bo Lang is probably still suspicious about you. I’ll send someone disguised as you to hang around the area near the black market. I hope this can convince the other party…”
Jin Yang spoke in a determined manner. He would not let Qiu Tong take such a risk again.
Qiu Tong smiled and threw herself onto the sofa. She rubbed her temples and closed her eyes lazily.
“Now, we can only wait for Bo Lang to contact me!”
…
In the children’s room, the door was closed.
The four children, led by Qiu Xingyuan, sat around the bed. Imitating Qiu Tong and Jin Yang, they carried out their own meeting in a solemn manner. Qiu Xingyu raised her arm high and said sweetly, “Big Brother, Second Brother, Brother Ye Luan!”
“Grandpa seems to hate Uncle Jin Yang very much. I’m afraid that Uncle Jin Yang will be chased away by Grandpa. Then, we won’t have a place to stay!”
“Mommy will be very sad too. We have to think of a way to help Uncle Jin Yang and get Grandpa’s approval!”
Qiu Xingqiao nodded valiantly. He could also tell that Qiu Rong hated Jin Yang.
Every time Qiu Rong passed by the living room, he would turn around and take a walk in the garden courtyard whenever he saw Jin Yang. Qiu Xingyuan frowned and asked, “Do you have any good ideas?”
Qiu Xingyu chewed on her finger and muttered, “Every time I act spoiled with Grandpa, he’ll be very happy.”
Qiu Xingyuan, Qiu Xingqiao and Ye Luan: “…”
The children discussed for the entire morning but could not come up with a definite plan. They could only postpone this matter for the time being.
In the courtyard of the villa, two loaded trucks were parked by the roadside.
The president’s guards quickly moved dozens of heavy metal boxes onto the courtyard. Qiu Tong walked out in an apron and stood beside Jin Yang. “What are these?”
Jin Yang curled his thin lips smugly and whispered in her ear, “It’s high-precision laboratory test equipment.”
“They’re all from the first-rate laboratories in the military. I had Shao An bring back an entire set.”
“This way, it will be very convenient for Uncle Qiu and Qiu Xingyuan. I hope this can earn me some brownie points.”
Jin Yang hugged her shoulders and gently kissed her cheek.
Qiu Tong didn’t expect him to be so considerate. She was so touched that she beamed happily as she leaned her head on his shoulder.

chapters.title: Chapter 277 - Modification Drug
chapters.content:
Chapter 277: Modification Drug
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The top-floor conference room of the villa had been modified into a chemistry laboratory specially for Qiu Rong.
Countless sophisticated instruments were sitting in the spacious room. This was undoubtedly the greatest temptation for a scientist. Even if Qiu Rong pretended not to be interested, he still couldn’t control his excitement as he walked into the laboratory.
At first, he just looked at the equipment. Slowly, his hands began to itch and he started fiddling with them. He even forgot about the time and stayed there for an entire afternoon, trying out all the equipment.
Qiu Tong and Jin Yang hid in the shadows and watched his delighted expression. Qiu Tong whispered, “It looks like your plan is effective.”
Jin Yang raised his eyebrows slightly, the heaviness in his heart lifting slightly.
Qiu Xingyuan walked silently to the laboratory and stood obediently beside Qiu Rong. He quietly observed his movements and memorized them. Qiu Xingyuan was an extremely talented young genius, but his knowledge and practical experience were still far inferior to Qiu Rong’s.
Qiu Rong shook a test tube and handed the purple liquid to Qiu Xingyuan.
He asked tentatively, “Can you tell its components?”
Qiu Xingyuan gently sniffed the liquid. He then wrote down precise chemical composition on a piece of paper.
Qiu Rong nodded in delight. He couldn’t help praising him. “Good! You’re indeed my good grandson!”
…
In the dining room, everyone was sitting around the dining table.
Although Qiu Rong’s expression remained stern, everyone could feel that his attitude towards Jin Yang had softened.
Qiu Xingyu was especially excited as she raised her drink to clink glasses with them. Qiu Tong saw that Qiu Xingyu’s sleeve was dipping into the vegetable soup and she hurriedly helped her roll up her cuffs. She then glanced at Jin Yang, gesturing for him to speak.
Jin Yang took the initiative to stand up and pour some wine for Qiu Rong. He said respectfully, “Uncle Qiu, if there’s anything you need or if there’s anything you are uncomfortable with, feel free to tell me.”
Qiu Rong frowned and clinked glasses with him without saying a word. A conflicted look flashed across his eyes.
In the evening, Qiu Tong saw that Qiu Rong was still in the laboratory.
She walked over to Qiu Rong and placed her hand on his shoulder. “Dad, you are still recovering. Don’t be too anxious.” She saw a familiar chemical formula written in a notebook.
Sensing her gaze, Qiu Rong told her, “This is the human modification drug.”
Qiu Tong frowned and examined the chemical formula. She wanted to voice her doubts.
Qiu Rong beat her to it. “This isn’t the complete version. Back then, the government gathered all the experts and scholars in various fields to develop a drug that can change the structure of a human’s body and strengthen the various bodily functions by a hundred times.”
“Ye Luan’s father and I were both in the project.”
Qiu Rong’s expression grew heavy as he recalled his memories.
“In the beginning, we had high expectations and were very enthusiastic. We felt that developing this drug would become the biggest breakthrough in our field, or even in the entire world’s history! But things are much more complicated than we imagined…”
“The human body has already evolved to a stage where all the cells and functions are in a balanced state.”
“If we use drugs to break the balance, it will definitely cause serious side effects.”
“The chemical formula you saw in that notebook is only half of the complete formula. Ye Luan’s father accidentally discovered it, but we destroyed all the drugs we made. We also destroyed half of the records.”
Qiu Rong sighed deeply. He knew that Ye Luan’s father’s death was also related to it.
Qiu Tong frowned. She knew a little about biology and chemistry, and she couldn’t see any harm in this formula.
Qiu Rong stood up after a moment of silence and walked to the operating table to mix his chemicals.
He took out two mice from a cage and injected the drug into their bodies. About five minutes later, the two mice were clearly restless, anxious, and even tried to smash themselves against the cage.
Qiu Tong stared at him with widened eyes. Qiu Rong injected the antidote into their bodies and the white mice fell asleep, their limbs twitching occasionally. They were clearly weaker than before.
Qiu Rong poured the drug away. “The modification drug can amplify a certain function. In short, it can allow a person’s running speed or resistance to attacks to become three or even five times that of the original. But after the medicinal effects dissipate, the person will show signs of weakening and irreversible damage.”
“In serious cases, death will occur.”
Qiu Rong smiled in self-mockery. He took off his protective goggles and said dejectedly, “I never expected that this drug would end up being a poison that will cause death! Tongtong, do you think I’m a bad person?”
Qiu Tong sensed his gloom and took the initiative to hug him. “No!”
“I believe you can find a solution.”
Qiu Tong looked at him confidently. Qiu Rong looked at her with a complicated expression. “Tongtong, do you want me to help Jin Yang?”
As the president, Jin Yang could use the drug to strengthen the army and stabilize his current position.

chapters.title: Chapter 278 - Blurting Out
chapters.content:
Chapter 278: Blurting Out
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
“I trust Jin Yang. Even if he has the drug, he won’t abuse it to hurt anyone and stabilize his so-called position of power.”
“I will also respect your choice. If you want to continue developing the drug, we will support you all the way. But if you want to give up, I will still feel proud of you. Because you made your choice for the sake of everyone and not for your own benefit.”
Qiu Tong answered Qiu Rong’s question firmly. Her honesty and warmth made Qiu Rong feel unprecedentedly secure.
Qiu Rong hugged her tightly. Both their eyes had reddened with emotion. They didn’t say anything else.
In the stairway near the laboratory, a few tiny heads were crowded together.
The children were trying to eavesdrop when they saw Qiu Rong and Qiu Tong walking out side by side. Their expressions were solemn and the atmosphere was awkward and stiff.
Qiu Xingqiao was so impatient that he lost his balance and fell. He covered his mouth and ignored the dull pain coming from his butt.
Qiu Xingyu narrowed her eyes worriedly. She tugged at the corner of Ye Luan’s shirt, already imagining the worst-case scenario.
“Did Grandpa fight with Mommy? Does he want Mommy to bring us out of here? What about Uncle Jin Yang?”
As Qiu Xingyuan listened to her whining, his cold and handsome face was filled with dark clouds. He quietly clenched his fists and tried to think of a solution.
Ye Luan was a little older, so he came up with a brilliant suggestion. “We can let Uncle Jin Yang do something to please Grandpa Qiu!”
The other children looked at Ye Luan. Half an hour later, Qiu Xingyu ran to the study and pulled Jin Yang out by the wrist.
Jin Yang followed her to the garden in surprise. When he saw the three children standing there solemnly, he instantly became a little nervous.
Qiu Xingyu stood beside Qiu Xingyuan with her hands on her waist. The children looked like they were about to interrogate Jin Yang. Qiu Xingyuan asked, “Are you willing to give up everything for Mommy and do whatever it takes to make her happy? You don’t want to see her being caught between Grandpa and you, right?”
Jin Yang nodded, not understanding what the children were trying to say.
Carrying a hoe, Qiu Xingqiao pointed at the plant nursery a distance away. He gestured for Jin Yang to come closer.
Jin Yang hesitated for two seconds before striding to their side and squatting down. The children crowded around him and whispered into his ear. Shao An saw this scene from afar. Thinking that they were having an intimate family moment, Shao An sighed enviously.
“In just a few days, his relationship with the children has progressed so quickly…”
The children’s explanation was a little messy but Jin Yang managed to pick out the keywords and finally understood their intentions. He rubbed his aching ears in amusement.
Qiu Xingyu looked up at him worriedly. “Got it?”
Jin Yang rubbed the top of her head with his hands. Looking at her fluffy and perky hair, he couldn’t help smiling. “Don’t worry!”
…
The next day at noon, Jin Yang brought Shao An to the nearby plant nursery and bought hundreds of fresh flower buds.
Shao An carried the flower pots and seedlings to the loading truck. He rubbed the sore muscles in his arms and grumbled, “Sir, are you going to change professions to become a flower farmer? Where do you plan to put these seedlings?”
Shao An felt that Jin Yang’s recent actions were becoming increasingly difficult to predict.
Jin Yang also raised his hand to wipe the sweat off his forehead. He looked at the message he received on his phone. “Let’s set off. The materials I ordered for planting have arrived. We need to move them into the garden now. Later, you’ll follow me and plant them in the backyard.”
Shao An was so shocked that his mouth fell open. He wondered if he was hallucinating.
Jin Yang slapped the back of his head harshly, causing stars to appear in Shao An’s eyes as he swayed unsteadily.
“This is a brilliant solution the children came up with for me. Little Yu asked me to think of a way to please Qiu Rong. If you mess up and make my wife leave, I will punish you by sending you to the remote suburbs on patrol duty!”
As Jin Yang explained, Shao An finally understood the reason behind this all. He followed behind Jin Yang and couldn’t help grumbling softly, “You’ve really changed too much for Miss Qiu. If news of this were to spread, no way the high-ranking officials in the capital would believe you did all these.”
“Mr. President, do you know how to be a farmer?”
“Will these flower buds survive until they bloom?”
Shao An mustered up the courage to ask in a worried tone. Jin Yang stopped abruptly and turned to glare at him with narrowed eyes.
Oh no! Why did he blurt those words out?!
Just as Shao An was thinking of a way to save the situation, Jin Yang frowned and whispered, “Help me find a tutorial on planting flowers.”
“Qiu Xingqiao said that I have to plant it personally to show my sincerity. Only then can I move Qiu Rong’s heart…”
Shao An heaved a sigh of relief. As he looked at Jin Yang’s back, his eyes were filled with indescribable sympathy.
Even the president would also lose all common sense after falling in love!

chapters.title: Chapter 279 - Getting Approval
chapters.content:
Chapter 279: Getting Approval
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The sun was warm in the afternoon at the villa. Qiu Rong was busy adjusting the ratio of the chemicals in the laboratory.
Knock, knock. Qiu Xingyu’s little head popped out. She ran to Qiu Rong’s side with a mysterious expression and held his hand as they walked out. Qiu Rong hurriedly put down the chemicals in his hand and followed her to the balcony on the top floor.
Qiu Xingyu pointed at the figure in the garden and said in a sweet voice, “Grandpa, look!”
“Uncle Jin Yang is preparing a surprise gift for you. He’s really taking good care of us…”
Qiu Rong followed her finger and saw that the garden had suddenly turned into a different sight.
Long lines were dug into the soil. With some difficulty, Jin Yang and Shao An carried the various flower buds and planted them. Their clumsy actions but serious attitude made Qiu Rong frown. The emotions in his eyes swirled. In the end, he sighed and took off his protective suit. “They’re ruining those plants. Little Yu, come with Grandpa to take a look!”
Qiu Xingyu watched Qiu Rong’s expression change and stuck out her tongue happily.
In the garden, Shao An’s face was filled with dirt streaks as he dug the holes. From time to time, Jin Yang would stop and flip through the plantation manual given by the seller. He instructed Shao An to throw two seedlings into the pit. Just as he was about to cover them with soil, a voice stopped him from behind.
Qiu Rong appeared beside him in a straw hat and snatched the hoe in disdain.
“This is a peach blossom tree plant and it needs a deeper pit. Otherwise, it will collapse in the wind. All of you, stand at the side to watch…”
Qiu Rong waved the hoe. Jin Yang and Shao An looked at each other before observing Qiu Rong with humble and respectful expressions.
Qiu Xingyu squatted on the ground and used her hand to fiddle with the flower buds as she asked all sorts of questions.
Qiu Rong answered her questions patiently. From the corner of his eye, he realized that Jin Yang was also working by copying his actions. His furrowed brows finally relaxed a little.
The sun was scorching. Qiu Xingyu couldn’t bear it anymore, her face was covered in sweat. Qiu Rong had Shao An bring her back to the house to cool down.
When only the two of them were left in the garden, Qiu Rong raised his hand to wipe the sweat off his forehead. He hesitated for a moment before saying, “It wasn’t easy for Tongtong. She brought up those children by herself. I didn’t fulfill my responsibility as a father. I feel guilty towards her.”
“I can tell that you’re very attentive to her, but Tongtong doesn’t need a short-term love affair.”
“She needs a responsible man to take care of her. No matter what happens, he cannot abandon her, even if he has to go against his principles…”
Qiu Rong propped the hoe on the ground and stared straight at him. “Can you do it?”
In the garden, Jin Yang stood tall. He paused to think for a moment before nodding. “Uncle Qiu, Qiu Tong will always be my first choice. I won’t let her and the children suffer!”
Qiu Rong was very satisfied with his answer. He waved his hand and pointed at the flower buds nearby. “What are you waiting for? Hand them to me!”
Sensing the change in his attitude, Jin Yang hurriedly helped out.
On the balcony, a few tiny heads were gathered together. Qiu Xingqiao leaned against the railing and looked at Qiu Rong and Jin Yang. He tilted his head with uncertainty and asked, “Brother, does it look like Grandpa has accepted him?”
Qiu Xingyuan released his clenched fists and nodded with pursed lips.
In the evening, Jin Yang followed behind Qiu Rong, covered in mud. He looked up and saw the children. He made a victory sign at them. Qiu Xingyu waved her arms sweetly. Qiu Xingqiao and Ye Luan high-fived each other in celebration.
When Qiu Rong heard the commotion and looked over, the children quickly stopped their actions and pretended to be occupied.
Jin Yang and the children’s tacit cooperation made Qiu Rong feel rather exasperated. Nevertheless, a gratified smile flashed across his eyes.
From the moment Qiu Xingyu appeared, Qiu Rong had guessed the children’s motives. He was just testing Jin Yang. Over the past few days, no matter how coldly he treated him, Jin Yang did not show any disrespect or annoyance. As a result, Qiu Rong slowly started to accept him.
As long as Qiu Tong was happy, Qiu Rong felt that everything was worth it.
In the living room of the villa, Qiu Tong saw that their faces were red from the sun. She hurriedly poured two glasses of ice water for them. She wanted to find out what had happened between Jin Yang and Qiu Rong. However, the two of them smiled knowingly and refused to divulge anything.
Jin Yang held her shoulder and took a deep breath.
Qiu Tong sensed Qiu Rong’s gaze and wanted to slap his hand away. However, Jin Yang tightened his grip instead.
Qiu Rong’s gaze swept past them indifferently as he walked straight to the kitchen. Qiu Tong’s eyes widened in surprise as she pinched Jin Yang’s face and asked, “How did you do that?” If it were in the past, Qiu Rong would have coughed loudly to remind them to be more discreet!
Jin Yang smiled and looked tenderly at the children running down the stairs. “I have reliable support!”

chapters.title: Chapter 280 - The Breakup Between Father And Son
chapters.content:
Chapter 280: The Breakup Between Father And Son
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
In the official residence in the capital, Jin Tao sat alone in the empty living room, emanating a gloomy and cold aura.
News from the prison and Chen Jia came separately. Jin Tao’s deployments in S City had all failed. Qiu Tong and Jin Yang were very vigilant. He held a glass and gently rubbed the rim with his finger, sensing that things had become a little tricky.
Jin Tao’s assistant lowered his head and stood in front of him. He said in a pained tone, “Sir, the spy in the prison just committed suicide.”
“It’s said that he killed himself in Jin Yang’s basement while the guards were changing shifts. He didn’t say anything about us.”
Jin Tao nodded indifferently. There was no pity in his tone as he instructed, “Send some money to his family.”
The assistant opened his mouth a few times but swallowed his words in the end.
Jin Tao could tell that there was something on his assistant’s mind. He placed the glass on the table and stood up to pat his shoulder.
“We have to look at the big picture. From the day he went to the prison to be a spy, he knew that his final fate was likely to be death. If you go soft, you will lose! You will be stepped on by your opponent!”
“Qiu Tong and Jin Yang’s relationship is progressing quickly. They’re cooperating well and will definitely be an obstacle to us in the near future.”
“Send more men to S City and get rid of Qiu Tong as soon as possible. Remember to hide your identity and not let Jin Yang find out anything! You can’t use our weapons or gear. Clear out anything that can point to your true identity before carrying out the mission!”
Jin Tao’s voice was cold as he instructed. The assistant adjusted his emotions and nodded, turning around to carry out his orders.
Meanwhile, Song Yan overheard their conversation and his pupils dilated.
Song Yan returned to the capital last night and he planned to stay a couple of nights before greeting Jin Tao. He didn’t expect to hear such a shocking plan.
Condensation from the cold beer in his hand dripped onto the living room floor…
Jin Tao suddenly looked over, his eyes filled with scrutiny and faint coldness.
Song Yan’s mind raced. He rubbed his hair and yawned. He waved at him lazily. “Dad.”
“Good evening. Long time no see.”
Song Yan walked casually towards the living room. He threw himself onto the sofa and gulped down his beer, reeking of alcohol.
Jin Tao narrowed his eyes and asked impatiently, “When did you return?”
Song Yan held up two fingers as his lips curled into a self-mocking smile. “You didn’t notice, right?”
“I’m already used to it. Since when did I exist in your eyes? I have to hide myself in case your blood pressure shoots up at the sight of me. I was just sneaking a drink and didn’t expect to be caught by you. Don’t worry, I promise I will be very quiet in the future.”
Jin Tao heard the sarcasm in his words, but he just asked about Jin Yang instead.
Song Yan gritted his teeth and sneered. He ruffled his hair and stood up abruptly. “Jin Yang, Jin Yang! You only think about him! I’m your son as well. When have you ever looked me in the eye?!”
“Oh, I almost forgot. Only the president can be your son, so I’m not worthy…”
Song Yan raised his hand and slapped his left cheek. He walked to Jin Tao and growled in disappointment and anger, “You chose Jin Yang over me since we were young, choosing the one most suitable for nurturing and management. So of course I was abandoned by you.”
“All these years, I’ve been neglected. Do you know what the high-ranking officials secretly say about me?”
“Mr. Jin Tao, I can ignore everything, but what exactly am I to you?”
When Song Yan saw that he was still silent, the frustration in his heart surged. He took two steps back and laughed wildly. “But what about now? Where is Jin Yang? He has gone beyond your control too! Isn’t that so?”
Smack!!
Jin Tao slapped Song Yan harshly. Song Yan held his stinging right cheek and looked at his so-called father in disbelief.
Jin Tao pointed at the door and scolded, “Get lost!”
Song Yan pressed his tongue against his teeth and wiped the blood from his thin lips. He grabbed his jacket from the back of the sofa and walked out.
In the cold night, he walked for a long distance before stopping. Song Yan looked back at the brightly lit villa and called his trusted aide. “Help me book a plane ticket to S City. The sooner, the better!”
…
At the villa, a steady breathing sound echoed in the room.
Qiu Tong suddenly opened her eyes. She pushed Jin Yang’s arm away and sat up, panting heavily.
Jin Yang switched on the night light with sleepy eyes. He saw Qiu Tong’s pale face covered in cold sweat and hugged her. “Why have you been having so many nightmares lately? I’ll get Shao An to bring a doctor to do a full body checkup for you. Do you want to take some calming medicine?”
Qiu Tong shook her head as she thought of the recurring nightmare that she had been having recently.
She held Jin Yang’s hand tightly and thought of the extremely realistic explosion in her dream. She couldn’t help pressing her head against his chest in panic.
Jin Yang sensed her fragility and coaxed her in a relaxed tone, “Dreams are the opposite of reality. Don’t be afraid!”

chapters.title: Chapter 281 - Meeting At The Crossroads
chapters.content:
Chapter 281: Meeting At The Crossroads
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Three days later, Qiu Tong received a call from the network. She raised her index finger to her lips to signal for silence.
Qiu Xingyu cleverly ran to the computer. She wanted to use the GPS system to track the other party’s exact location.
Qiu Tong picked up the call, and the background noise of the casino came from the other end.
Bo Lang swirled his cup and took two deep breaths from the cigar in his hand. “Sally, go to the crossroad in the suburbs at 9:58 PM tomorrow. A van will bring you to see me. Don’t be late.”
“The upper echelons of the organization would like to meet you and confirm your identity before revising your mission. Any problems?”
Qiu Tong frowned but responded in a relaxed tone, “Of course not, thank you.”
After hanging up, Qiu Xingyu pointed at the location of the Sent Bar on the map.
Qiu Tong picked her up with a smile and kissed her sweet face. She then turned to look at Jin Yang. “It looks like we can find out the other party’s core information this time!”
As long as she could gain the trust of the upper echelons of the Vulture Organization, she would be able to monitor their movements in S City and find out about their boss.
Jin Yang felt uneasy. He offered his gun to Qiu Tong but she shook her head.
Qiu Xingyu placed Qiu Xingyu on the ground and motioned for her to go play with Ye Luan outside.
“Bo Lang is very vigilant. I will definitely have to undergo a body-search before I can meet the upper echelons of the organization. I will bring a couple of daggers and an ordinary handgun as part of my cover, but I will let them find them…”
“Shao An’s intelligence said that Bo Lang hasn’t sent anyone to keep an eye on the black market recently. Their suspicions about me should have been dispelled.”
“I’ll try my best to contact you before midnight. If you don’t receive my call by then, Little Yu will help you find my location.”
Qiu Tong looked at the little girl running around with a kite in her hand and opened her palm to show Jin Yang the tape that had almost merged with her skin.
Her eyes were filled with pride as she explained, “Qiu Xingyuan and Little Yu worked together to develop a new tracking locator chip. This tape covering the chip ensures that it will not be detected by electromagnetic devices. Meanwhile, the chip can help you find my location and monitor my vital signs.”
Jin Yang looked at the tape in surprise. Qiu Tong looked at his expression and smiled.
Qiu Xingyuan would indeed become a top scientist and Little Yu a formidable hacker in the future!
…
The next day, Qiu Tong waited at the crossroad in the suburbs as promised.
She looked around and observed her surroundings. She realized that there were no buildings around that would block the view. It seemed like Bo Lang was still cautious.
A horn beeped. Qiu Tong saw a dilapidated van appear at the end of the road and raised her hand to greet them.
The van door was pushed open from the inside, and some burly men jumped out with masks on. They took out a black blindfold and tied it around her, then had her sit in the backseat. As she listened to the commotion, she determined that there were at least five or six people around.
The car continued to drive. Qiu Tong closed her eyes to visualize their journey, but she realized that they were just circling around.
Qiu Tong had a bad premonition. She gave a light laugh and asked the person beside her, “Where’s Bo Lang? Where are we going?”
“I’m feeling a little dizzy. Can you remove my blindfold so that I can take a breather?”
The car was quiet. No one answered. Qiu Tong was about to touch the door when a hoarse voice berated from the side, “Don’t move! Behave yourself if you don’t want to die. Mr. Bo Lang is already waiting for you at the abandoned factory!”
“You want some air? There’s a lot of time for you to enjoy it later!”
Bo Lang was waiting for her? Not the upper echelons of the Vulture Organization?!
Qiu Tong sensed danger and instinctively swung her elbow at the man beside her.
She moved to take off her blindfold and escape when… thump!!
The dull thud of a metal rod hitting her neck echoed in the car. Qiu Tong felt dizzy and fell unconscious.
The van drove towards the abandoned factory. Bo Lang sat beside a paint bucket. He stood up with an intrigued expression.
Dozens of bare-chested burly men were gathered in the spacious venue. Their arms, backs or waists were all marked with the Vulture Organization tattoo. Bo Lang lit the firewood and threw a red-hot branding iron on the ground. He nodded and gestured for them to go over.
The members dragged Qiu Tong out of the car and tied her to a wooden seat.
Bo Lang got the burly man beside him to splash a bucket of cold water on Qiu Tong to wake her up…
Qiu Tong opened her eyes and gasped. Her curly hair was wet and stuck to her face. She saw Bo Lang squatting in front of her. “What are you doing? Didn’t you say you were going to bring me to meet the upper echelons? Let go of me!” She wanted to kick Bo Lang, but her ankles were tied up and she couldn’t move.
Bo Lang’s eyes were filled with sympathy as he hooked her chin. “Upper echelons?”
“Are we going to continue pretending now?” Bo Lang clapped his hands and stared at her. “Should I call you Sally or Qiu Tong?”

chapters.title: Chapter 282 - Lie Exposed
chapters.content:
Chapter 282: Lie Exposed
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Tong’s pupils constricted as she stared at Bo Lang. “When did you find out?”
Bo Lang downed two mouthfuls of hard liquor. He tore open Qiu Tong’s collar and took out the ring hanging from her neck on a chain. “From the first time we met, I knew you weren’t part of us…”
Qiu Tong frowned slightly as she suppressed the fear in her heart.
Bo Lang took out the ring and wore it on his thumb. He opened his left hand and looked at the other similar ring.
“You’re very smart. There’s no way to verify the lies you’ve fabricated. Your story had no loopholes and faced with such a femme fatale, the members will be inclined to believe you and welcome you back to Vulture.”
Bo Lang paused and pretended to be sympathetic as he pinched her chin. “But you’re unlucky.”
“The Sent Bar is my territory, and I happen to be a high-level member of the Vulture Organization. This ring is only gifted to members who have made great contributions to the organization. There are less than ten of them around, and I’m familiar with all of them.”
“Also, Vulture has never accepted a female member. This is your fatal flaw!”
Qiu Tong listened to his explanation and recalled how much the prison guard had cared about the ring. He had also bragged that he was a top killer and was placed in an important position…
It turned out that what he said was true. Qiu Tong had dismissed his claims and this was why she had ended up in this situation now.
