Qiu Tong looked at Bo Lang resolutely. “What do you want to do with me?”
Bo Lang clicked his tongue and shook his head. He wasn’t in a hurry to hurt her. Instead, he was enjoying the game. He wanted to slowly torture her, her body and mind, until she was at the brink of collapse and beg for death.
The bonfire in the abandoned factory was burning brightly. The burning flames were very glaring, preventing Qiu Tong from seeing her surroundings clearly.
As Bo Lang drank with the members, he glanced sideways at her and stuffed a piece of smelly raw meat into her mouth.
“You must have some safety protocol with the president, right? Something like you’ll contact him before midnight…”
Qiu Tong frowned and watched helplessly as Bo Lang took the phone from her and dialed Jin Yang’s number before pressing the speaker button.
Jin Yang’s voice rang out from the other side. Qiu Tong wanted to warn him, but two burly men rushed over and covered her mouth tightly. She couldn’t make any sound at all.
Jin Yang asked anxiously, “How’s the situation? Where are you? I’ll pick you up now.”
Bo Lang pursed his lips in an exaggerated manner and shook his head gently as he said into the phone, “Mr. President, I’m sorry. I am not Qiu Tong.”
When Jin Yang heard the unfamiliar male voice, his body instantly stiffened as he gripped his gun.
He realized that Qiu Tong’s identity had been exposed. He motioned for Shao An to contact the guards.
Bo Lang looked at Qiu Tong’s wretched state coldly. “I’ll give you the address, Mr. President. You’d better hurry over with Qiu Rong and the modification drug. I don’t want to hurt your woman.”
“As long as I can get what I want, I promise you that she will remain unharmed.”
“But if you play any tricks, I’m sorry, you’ll only see Qiu Tong’s corpse… the kind that has been abused.”
Beep! Bo Lang hung up the phone and sent the address to Jin Yang. He waved his hand to signal the members to leave.
Qiu Tong spat out the raw meat and cursed Bo Lang and his men. But they just laughed. Five minutes later, Qiu Tong finally regained her composure.
She looked at him rationally and asked, “How did you know about my relationship with Jin Yang?”
Bo Lang poked at the fire with a soldering iron and stared at her with his blue fake eye. The scars on his face were particularly eye-catching. “Do you think the Vulture Organization is like those small-time hooligans at the black market? We have members embedded in every official department in all the cities.”
“As long as we want to find out, nothing can evade us!”
As if recalling something from the past, Bo Lang took the initiative to tell Qiu Tong, “I remember telling you that my eye was injured during a certain operation, and the person who blinded me was Jin Yang…”
“I brought my men to corner him and his guards, but I didn’t expect this to happen!!”
Bo Lang’s eyes were filled with anger as he kicked the bonfire. He tugged at Qiu Tong’s hair as his lips curled into a cold smile.
“I’ve always wanted to take revenge for my eye, but I couldn’t find a chance.”
“I didn’t expect you to deliver it to me! It’s a lie that I’ll let you go after getting the drug.”
Bo Lang took out the submachine guns and rocket launchers in the corner and distributed them to the members. He stationed himself on a high ground of the abandoned factory and observed the movements around him. He said through gritted teeth, “When Jin Yang comes, I will make sure he can never leave. I want to dig out both of his eyes and let him experience the feeling of losing your sight…”
“I’ll send you along with him to hell. Don’t worry.”
Bo Lang looked at her and arranged for some members to watch over her. He then communicated with his subordinates to confirm their plans and deployment arrangements.

chapters.title: Chapter 283 - Rescue
chapters.content:
Chapter 283: Rescue
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao ran to the entrance to stop Jin Yang and Shao An. The children could guess what happened from their expressions.
Qiu Xingqiao said with resolution, “Uncle Jin Yang, is Mommy in danger? We’ll go with you!”
Qiu Xingyu brought out her laptop and drone equipment from the room and looked at Jin Yang with a firm expression.
Ye Luan frowned nervously. “We will definitely listen to your instructions and not cause trouble for you.”
Jin Yang wanted to refuse, but Qiu Xingyuan interrupted him. “Even if you leave us behind, we will find a way to follow you.”
Qiu Xingyuan’s firm tone stunned Jin Yang. There was no time for them to waste.
Jin Yang frowned at Ke Le. “Protect them!
The group drove to the abandoned factory. Jin Yang and Shao An ordered the guards to station themselves in an open space 100 meters away from the factory.
The scouts went first to observe the situation and returned to report to Jin Yang. “There are no hidden traps around the factory. Over 10 armed personnel are patrolling the empty space. They are well-armed and there’s a possibility of them having explosives in the factory.”
“They are too far away. There’s no way to confirm Miss Qiu’s exact location…”
Jin Yang had lost his rationality. He wanted to storm the factory with his guards and rescue Qiu Tong.
Shao An tried his best to stop him. “Sir! The Vulture Organization wants to use Qiu Tong to threaten you. If we give them the drug and Mr. Qiu, she’ll be safe. You can’t charge in rashly. You’ll fall into their trap!”
“You stay here and command the troops. I’ll bring a team in and confirm Miss Qiu’s location for you!”
Wearing protective gear, Shao An assembled the team.
Qiu Xingyu walked to them with her laptop in her arms. She was so nervous that her hands were trembling, but she pointed at the coordinates displayed on the screen. Qiu Tong’s location and vital signs were displayed in front of them.
“They didn’t discover the tracker on Mommy. Second Brother and I searched for information on the nearby factories and satellite databases. The topographic map drawn should be accurate. The abandoned factory in front was built in the last century…”
Qiu Xingqiao’s hoarse voice was heard from the left. He held his binoculars and said, “The factory is built with red brick walls.”
“Mommy is in the southeastern corner. If we bomb the beam supporting the second floor, a small portion of the roof will collapse.”
“That degree of damage won’t hurt Mommy. Snipers, lie in ambush and cover us with gunfire. We have 30 seconds to save Mommy!”
Shao An was so shocked that he couldn’t close his mouth. He looked at Qiu Xingqiao with surging emotions. He didn’t expect Qiu Xingqiao to have such talent in military tactics!
Jin Yang quickly analyzed their plan and nodded at Shao An. “Do as they say.”
Qiu Xingyu curled up in the corner and secretly wiped the tears from the corners of her eyes with the back of her hand.
Qiu Xingyuan walked to her side and held her hand tightly.
Qiu Xingyu looked at him helplessly. “Brother, Mommy will definitely be fine, right?”
Qiu Xingyuan nodded heavily. Although he was also very anxious, he still comforted his younger sibling. At this moment, Qiu Rong and Ye Luan were sitting in a bulletproof van. Apart from waiting, they couldn’t do anything else. Time passed bit by bit. Qiu Rong wanted to go out.
But Ye Luan stopped him. “Grandpa Qiu, you can’t show yourself. Otherwise, it will affect Uncle Jin Yang’s plans.”
Qiu Rong looked down in frustration. He had never regretted participating in this drug research so much.
He covered his head and whispered, “I’m sorry!”
After the president’s guards were deployed, Jin Yang diverted Bo Lang’s attention by calling Qiu Tong’s phone.
Bo Lang immediately picked up the call. Jin Yang raised his hand and was about to order his men to fire when the sound of fierce gunfire came from behind the factory.
Jin Yang looked at Shao An in surprise. “Our people?”
Shao An shook his head. Bo Lang said fiercely, “Jin Yang! You’re playing dirty with me!”
Click! The phone call was cut off. Jin Yang couldn’t care about anything else as he ordered the guards to bomb the second floor beam.
The battle instantly turned chaotic. Qiu Tong trembled as debris fell all around her. She saw a heavily injured Vulture member lying on the ground beside her. Using all her strength, she crashed herself and her chair into a cement pillar nearby. The violent impact shattered the wooden chair into pieces.
Qiu Tong surveyed her wounds and stood up unsteadily, before quickly untying the rope around her wrists and ankles.
Bo Lang continued to shoot from the top floor. The attacks from the front and back had him in a bind. The Vulture members watched as some masked criminals charged in. They panted as they said to Bo Lang, “Boss, they don’t seem to be in cahoots with Jin Yang!”
The masked criminals’ firepower was extremely formidable. Bo Lang saw the stairs of the building explode and shouted, “Trash! Keep an eye on Qiu Tong!”
“We can’t let her escape!”
Bo Lang knew that she was his only bargaining chip.
The Vulture members immediately ran downstairs to block her escape.

chapters.title: Chapter 284 - Hero Saving The Beauty
chapters.content:
Chapter 284: Hero Saving The Beauty
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The smell of gunpowder was everywhere.
Loud explosive sounds made Qiu Tong’s ears. She wanted to take advantage of the chaos to move to the periphery to meet up with Jin Yang.
When the Vulture members discovered her, they surrounded her from all directions.
Qiu Tong picked up two submachine guns from the ground and took cover as she fired. She tried to contact Qiu Xingyu through the tracker, but the chaos in front of her made it impossible for her to find the right opportunity.
The president’s guards were in a deadlock with the Vulture Organization at the periphery. The masked criminals sneaked into the factory.
The moment they saw Qiu Tong, they issued a fierce barrage of gunfire.
One of the bullets pierced Qiu Tong’s arm. She threw her submachine gun away in pain and took cover.
Who were they?!
The Vulture Organization wouldn’t kill her, but the masked criminals clearly wanted her life.
Outside the factory, Jin Yang brought the guards closer to the southeast corner. He called out Qiu Tong’s name in a hoarse voice, but there was no response. When the masked criminals saw him, they frowned before quickly surrounding Qiu Tong.
They aimed their guns at Qiu Tong. A red dot light appeared on her forehead.
Bang! The masked criminal pulled the trigger, and a bullet shot out from the barrel.
Qiu Tong couldn’t dodge in time and looked at the bullet coming at her. A black shadow suddenly appeared in front of her and threw her to the ground.
“Song Yan?! Why are you here?”
Qiu Tong looked at the face before her. Still in shock, she covered his bleeding abdomen with her hands.
Song Yan spat out some blood. His eyes darkened as he said, “Jin Yang is simply trash. He still hasn’t come to save you.”
“Do you want to consider being with me? I saved your life!”
Song Yan smiled and the sight of his teeth covered in blood shocked Qiu Tong. She tore off a piece of cloth and bandaged his wounds before dragging him to a safe spot. Jin Yang and his guards slowly gained the upper hand as the masked criminals and Vulture members began to retreat.
Ke Le led the mercenaries into the factory to conduct a search. He saw Qiu Tong was covered in blood and shouted anxiously, “Boss!”
“Where are you injured? There’s a doctor outside. I’ll bring you out now!”
Ke Le bent over to carry Qiu Tong but she just held her injured arm and pushed him away. “Carry him out of here.”
“This blood is all his. If we delay any longer, he might lose too much blood and go into shock.”
Ke Le was surprised and confused at the sight of Song Yan.
The mercenaries supported her as they walked out of the factory. Jin Yang ran over quickly and the two of them hugged tightly amongst the ruins. Qiu Tong looked at the bloodstains on his face and placed her hand over it, using her special ability to heal his wounds. “Bo Lang escaped. He’s a high-ranking member of the Vulture Organization.”
“I’m afraid it will be difficult for us to investigate further.”
Jin Yang felt his heartbeat stabilize. He held her face in his hands and leaned down to kiss her, ignoring the situation.
As their lips touched, Qiu Tong could feel his uneasiness. She wrapped her arms around his neck and responded to him.
“Ahem.”
Lying on the stretcher, Song Yan opened his eyes and saw this intimate scene. He rolled his eyes and laid back down.
Shao An led the guards to clean up the battlefield and gather the corpses. Jin Yang sent people to carefully search for any information they might have left behind. Qiu Xingyu looked at them with tears in her eyes. The children surrounded Qiu Tong and Qiu Xingyuan sensibly disinfected her wounds.
Ye Luan wrapped gauze around her and said hesitantly, “Auntie Qiu.”
Qiu Tong hugged him and patted her head gently. “Don’t be afraid, I’m fine!”
Ye Luan felt her warmth and couldn’t help crying.
When he and Qiu Rong were hiding in the bulletproof car, his mind was filled with scenes of his father’s death. The gun battle. His father had hidden him in a safe corner. “Good child, come out only when there’s no sound outside! Don’t turn around. Run forward. Protect yourself, okay?”
The shadow in Ye Luan’s heart was triggered at this moment. He trembled as he tugged at the corner of Qiu Tong’s clothes and gritted his teeth.
Qiu Tong patted his back and whispered, “Your father loves you very much. He must be watching you from above.”
Qiu Xingyu wiped her tears in empathy. Song Yan sat up weakly and looked at his bandage, which was already soaked through with blood. He said in a daze, “Hey, do you guys have any conscience? Without me, your Mommy would have died.”
“Cough cough…”
Song Yan shivered. His entire body felt cold as if he had fallen into an ice pit. He curled up his body and grimaced in pain.
Qiu Xingyu ran to his side with the first aid kit. She held Song Yan’s bloodstained hand.
“Uncle Song Yan, thank you!”
Qiu Xingyu blinked her sparkling eyes, which were filled with fear. However, she still carefully removed the bandage. “Uncle, bear with the pain. You’ll get better soon!”
Listening to her voice, Song Yan’s eyes gradually closed before he fainted.

chapters.title: Chapter 285 - Provocation
chapters.content:
Chapter 285: Provocation
Translator:
Atlas Studios
Editor:
Atlas Studios
The news reported on the vicious gun battle in the suburbs.
Jin Yang had instructed the relevant departments to attribute the incident to a gang fight over territory.
Back at the villa, Qiu Tong looked at Song Yan lying on the bed. She treated the wound on his abdomen.
The Vulture members had used a shotgun which caused serious damage to Song Yan’s abdomen area.
A flirtatious and wicked expression crossed Song Yan’s pale and haggard face. He narrowed his eyes and quietly watched as Qiu Tong sutured his wounds without anesthesia. Occasionally, he would grunt in pain.
He clenched the bed sheets tightly and endured with all his might.
Qiu Tong stared at him and casually probed. “Why were you at the abandoned factory?”
The timing of Song Yan’s appearance was too strange. Qiu Tong suspected that he was linked to the masked criminals.
Qiu Tong’s blunt question made Song Yan press against his heart sadly. “I’m your savior, but you still suspect me?”
“I took a plane from the capital to S City at dawn. I saw suspicious cars at the toll station on the airport’s highway. Since I was bored, I followed them. I wanted to watch a good gunfight, but I didn’t expect their target to be you.”
“Who knows why I was kind enough to take the bullet for you back then? I’m probably crazy.”
Song Yan wiped away his cold sweat. His body trembled violently, but he still said flirtatiously, “If I really wanted to harm you, would I need to let myself get hurt to do it?”
Qiu Tong frowned slightly, but her actions became gentler than before.
In the living room, Jin Yang listened to Shao An and the guards’ report. There were dozens of dead bodies at the scene of the abandoned factory, most of whom had died from the explosion or gunshot wounds. When Shao An examined the corpses at the scene, he confirmed that all Vulture members had the tattoo on their bodies.
Jin Yang flipped through the photos at the scene and took out a rather special one, scanning it repeatedly.
Shao An explained the photo. “This is a photo of a dead body who should be a member of the masked criminal gang. We found him among the ruins. We speculate that the roof beam structure crashed down on him and killed him.”
Jin Yang re-examined the information. Sensing something strange, he looked up at the guards. “Only this one corpse?”
Although the situation at that time was complicated, Jin Yang was very sure that the masked criminal gang had suffered heavy casualties. There shouldn’t only be one corpse!
The captain of the guards nodded. “Sir, there are signs of a clean-up at the scene. They must have taken their dead comrades away.”
“The place where this corpse was buried was hidden. They didn’t have much time to fully scout the area, so they didn’t find it.”
Jin Yang and Shao An were both silent. Why were they so cautious?
Could it be that the dead bodies would reveal clues about them?!
Jin Yang motioned for Shao An to bring the corpse back for further examination.
The villa was filled with a sense of oppression after the ordeal. The children fell into a deep sleep due to exhaustion. Jin Yang wanted to check on Song Yan’s condition. He pushed the door open and saw that Song Yan was naked and acting very flirtatiously.
Qiu Tong was sewing up his wounds with her head lowered. Her hand movements were extremely stable, and she did not stop Song Yan’s actions.
Jin Yang deliberately made a sound as he opened the door. Song Yan looked up at him and leaned against the bed frame. He said in a provocative tone, “You brought dozens of heavily-armed guards. You were truly cautious when dealing with your enemy.”
“If I hadn’t appeared, you would probably be holding Qiu Tong in your arms and crying about your uselessness right now, right?”
Jin Yang’s expression changed as Song Yan mocked him. He clenched his fists and stared at him.
Qiu Tong tightened her grip on the needle and thread, causing Song Yan to gasp in pain.
Song Yan was in so much pain that his thin lips went pale as he growled, “Hey! I’m telling the truth!”
Qiu Tong stood up to pack up the first aid kit. She gently brushed back the loose strands of hair at her temples and glanced at Song Yan indifferently. “You’ve lost too much blood. You need to recuperate quietly. It’s best if you don’t talk so much! Otherwise, you’ll probably have to lie in bed for a long period of time.”
“I’ll come by regularly to change your dressing. Have a good rest.”
With that, she held Jin Yang’s elbow and pulled him out of the room. She closed the door behind her.
Jin Yang’s expression was extremely ugly. Qiu Tong looked up at him and said gently, “Your identity requires you to consider many things. You can’t sacrifice the members of your team rashly just because of me. They are also people. I understand your dilemma.”
Qiu Tong smiled and looked at the closed door.
“But Song Yan did save my life at the critical moment.”
“Bear with him for a while. No matter what he says, it won’t affect our relationship, right?”
Qiu Tong coquettishly buried her head into Jin Yang’s chest. Jin Yang raised his hand and placed it on her shoulder. He took a deep breath and nodded reluctantly.
However, Song Yan’s words were like a thorn that had taken root in Jin Yang’s heart, just waiting for the right time to germinate and grow!
The burden and responsibility brought by Jin Yang’s status made him feel stifled and unable to breathe. He could only hug Qiu Tong tightly and try his best to forget the images that flashed in his mind…

chapters.title: Chapter 286 - Confrontation Of The Brothers
chapters.content:
Chapter 286: Confrontation Of The Brothers
The next morning, the television in the living room was turned up so loud that no one could continue sleeping.
Song Yan’s recovery had progressed extremely well. In the corridor, he sat in a wheelchair full of vigor as he played noisy songs over a loudspeaker. He came to a stop in front of Jin Yang and Qiu Tong’s bedroom.
It was only when Qiu Tong walked out rubbing her sleepy eyes that Song Yan smiled wickedly. “I’m hungry.”
Qiu Tong stared at him helplessly as she slammed the door behind her and went to the kitchen to prepare breakfast.
Song Yan sat smugly in the living room. He was feeling bored as he switched between television channels and glanced at Qiu Tong from time to time.
Qiu Rong returned from his morning jog and saw Song Yan slumped on the sofa. He stared at him with a scrutinizing expression.
Song Yan blinked and hurriedly stood up with his walking stick. He smiled ingratiatingly. “You’re Uncle Qiu, right? I’m Qiu Tong’s good friend. I’ve often heard her mention you in the past. I didn’t expect you to be so young!”
Qiu Rong looked at his facial features that were identical to Jin Yang’s. He asked with a frown, “Your relationship with Jin Yang is…?”
Song Yan’s eyes darkened for a moment before he smiled and answered, “He’s my brother. We are twins, but our personalities are different!”
“You might not know, but I have a good relationship with the children. They’re actually my…”
Just as Song Yan was about to tell him about the paternity test, Qiu Tong walked up to him and purposely knocked against his wound when handing him the breakfast tray.
Song Yan instantly broke out in cold sweat. He was in so much pain that he had to crouch over. He whispered in Qiu Tong’s ear, “You’re too ruthless!”
Qiu Tong gritted her teeth and threatened, “You’d better not spout nonsense, or I’ll make sure your wound never heals!”
Song Yan silently chewed on the burnt toast. He met Qiu Rong’s puzzled eyes and explained, “Qiu Xingyuan and the rest happen to be the kind of children I like. I get along very well with them.”
Qiu Rong felt that there seemed to be a special relationship between him and Qiu Tong. He wanted to probe further.
The children ran out of the bedroom and surrounded Qiu Rong to distract him.
Jin Yang stared at Song Yan coldly and whispered, “Come out with me.”
Song Yan shrugged and followed him to the garden outside. Through the French windows, he could see the happy figures of the children playing with Qiu Rong. He stood facing Jin Yang with his walking stick. They stared at each other with disdain and contempt.
Song Yan cleared his throat and asked, “What? Do you want to hit me?”
“I can’t win you in a fight now, but if I’m heavily injured again, Qiu Tong will be very upset, right?”
“She hates being indebted to others, just like you. How long do you think she will remember my kindness?”
Song Yan raised his hand and pulled down the collar of his pajamas, revealing his exquisite collarbone. There was a clear red lipstick mark on it.
Song Yan had deliberately bumped into Qiu Tong when she was changing his bandage. He looked at Jin Yang proudly and said, “Your facial features are nearly identical to mine.”
“Do you think Qiu Tong will mix us up in the middle of the night and end up running to my bed…”
Smack! Jin Yang punched Song Yan’s left cheek.
Song Yan’s body swayed as he crashed into a metal rack in the garden. He was in so much pain that he grimaced. His eyes were filled with anger and viciousness as he growled, “You only know how to be a brute with me. When we were at the abandoned factory, you could have used the guards as cover to rush over and save Qiu Tong.”
“What were you thinking back then? Every time Qiu Tong is in danger, what else do you do but wait anxiously at the back?”
Song Yan raised his index finger and pointed it at Jin Yang. He spat out blood and gritted his teeth. “Jin Yang, I look down on you!”
“You’re a coward. You think you have many responsibilities on your shoulders, but in reality? You only hide behind your status!”
“No wonder Jin Tao chose to support you as the president back then. It’s because you’re easy to manipulate. Do you understand?”
Song Yan laughed wildly as he continued. “Sooner or later, you’ll lose everything you cherish, just like me! When the time comes, I want to see if you can rise again like me… you can’t!”
Jin Yang clenched his fists tightly. His eyes were filled with surging anger, but he quickly released his grip.
Under the glaring sun, Jin Yang walked to Song Yan and stared straight at him. “You don’t understand what responsibility is at all.”
Song Yan looked at him with mocking eyes and shook his head before turning to leave.
Qiu Tong frowned as she listened to their argument.
She had a nagging feeling that there seemed to be a deep estrangement and misunderstanding between the brothers, and this was definitely not something that happened overnight. Instead, it seemed to be caused by the accumulation of multiple problems over many years.
“Mommy, Grandpa went into the laboratory again!”
Qiu Xingyu ran to her side barefooted. She grumbled, “He’s been cooped up in the laboratory recently, refusing to play with me. He’s also unwilling to talk.”
“Does Grandpa not like me?”

chapters.title: Chapter 287 - Changing His Way Of Thinking
chapters.content:
Chapter 287: Changing His Way Of Thinking
“Grandpa might be busy with his research. Little Yu is the most obedient baby. She has to be obedient.”
Qiu Tong hugged Qiu Xingyu and looked towards the laboratory worriedly.
Ever since the gun battle at the abandoned factory, Qiu Rong’s personality had undergone a huge change. He believed that all the danger they encountered stemmed from the human modification plan, from his inability to develop a successful drug.
Qiu Rong seemed to have fallen into an obsession. He began to study the drug all night, even cutting into his sleep time.
In just two days, he looked so haggard that he seemed to have become another person.
In the laboratory, Qiu Rong grabbed his hair in frustration. He slammed the table angrily and destroyed the failed concoction for the umpteenth time.
After countless adjustments to the chemical formula, Qiu Rong had added all the ingredients he could think of, but the drug could not be blended no matter what. Qiu Rong paced around anxiously.
Qiu Xingyuan and Ye Luan secretly ran to his side and brought over two high stools to sit beside him.
Ye Luan had once read some information about the modification plan from his father. He read the complicated equations carefully.
Qiu Xingyuan silently analyzed the failed drug. He suddenly thought of something and looked up at Qiu Rong.
“Grandpa, why are you trying to find a component that can merge the various components of the drug?”
His clear voice made Qiu Rong regain some rationality. He took off his glasses and rubbed his forehead.
“Because if the drug is to be injected into the human body, it has to complement the cells.”
“If there’s no way to merge the separate components of the drug, the chemicals will scatter like loose sand and be useless.”
Qiu Rong had studied nearly every single ingredient from both Western and Chinese medicine. At this moment, he was already at his wits’ end.
Qiu Xingyuan stood up with a heavy expression and drew a sketch on white paper.
After a while, he suddenly said, “We can choose ingredients that naturally stick to each other to make the drug. This way, there won’t be a need for a fusing agent. They can react and merge themselves, eventually forming a stabilized drug.”
Qiu Rong felt like his head had been hit by a wooden stick.
As an authoritative expert in biochemistry, Qiu Rong had trapped himself in a fixed thinking pattern. He had experimented according to the so-called rules, but he had never thought about whether he could find another way to achieve his goals.
Qiu Xingyuan was a child. He might lack professional knowledge, but he was brave enough to try different means.
Ye Luan pointed at the chemical components on the paper in agreement. “I’ve seen replacements for these drugs in Dad’s notebook. We can try to replace them according to Qiu Xingyuan’s method. Perhaps, we’ve already found the path to success.”
Qiu Rong felt much more relaxed. He looked at Qiu Xingyuan and said with admiration, “You are both the hope of the future. You’re smarter than me. Are you willing to help me with the drug research?”
Qiu Xingyuan and Ye Luan exchanged looks before nodding with sparkling eyes.
They placed their hands on the back of Qiu Rong’s hand, and the trio grinned at each other.
At this moment, the setting sun outside the window shone onto the laboratory, coincidentally landing on a glass tube. It seemed to be a good omen.
…
In a demolition area of S City, Bo Lang and the members of the Vulture Organization were hiding to recuperate.
Jin Yang and the guards had extremely accurate marksmanship. Bo Lang had been shot in the shoulder and legs, making it difficult for him to walk.
He tore open the bottle of antiseptic with his mouth and poured it on his wound. The intense pain made his eyes turn red. Bo Lang then dug into the open and festering wound with his bare hands to dug out the bullet. He then threw it on the ground beside him.
He took two big mouthfuls of hard liquor and turned to look at the remaining few people.
Damn Jin Yang and Qiu Tong! He would settle this score with them!
Bo Lang coughed twice and struggled to sit up. He found the satellite phone he was carrying and dialed an encrypted number.
The phone beeped a few times. A man’s deep voice came from the other end. “Why are you calling this number?”
“Unless there are special circumstances, it’s best if we don’t meet or contact each other. You should understand…”
When Bo Lang heard his cold words, he sneered and said, “More than half of my brothers have died. Is that considered a special situation? You guys hide in office buildings and enjoy your lives while the cold wind blows outside as my brothers fight for you!”
“I need to see you. Now! Immediately!”
Bo Lang spoke threateningly. Surprise and conflict flashed across Terrence’s eyes.
Yu Ge sat in the swivel chair playing with a dart. He stared at Terrence, who was hiding in the corner, and tugged at his tie. “Who is it?”
Terrence thought for a moment before explaining the situation to him. Yu Ge slammed his desk and leaned forward slightly to stare at him. “Let him come to the company.” Yu Ge pouted. He was dissatisfied at Terrence’s lack of action.
“Do you want to disobey orders?”
A ruthless glint flashed across Yu Ge’s eyes. Terrence took two deep breaths and frowned. In the end, he gave in and said to Bo Lang, “I’ll send someone to pick you up.”
“Send me the address.”

chapters.title: Chapter 288 - Joining Forces For Revenge
chapters.content:
Chapter 288: Joining Forces For Revenge
At Liqing Corporation, Yu Ge’s office had two French windows, giving it a wide view.
Yu Ge was wearing a casual sports suit as he played a virtual reality golf game. He kept swinging the golf club in his hand, hitting out beautiful balls. Yu Ge took off his virtual reality goggles and walked to Terrence. He handed the club to him and said, “Don’t perform too badly!”
“Since the CEO believes in me and has handed over everything here to me, you should be happy for me.”
Yu Ge gave a carefree smile. From the moment Qiu Tong left the Liqing Corporation, he had thought of a way to contact the CEO, who was far away overseas. He had persuaded the CEO to hand over all the power to him. Perhaps it was out of guilt, but the CEO readily agreed to Yu Ge’s request.
At this moment, the Liqing Corporation in S City was completely in Yu Ge’s hands.
Terrence frowned and stared at the elevator. Ding! The man came out in a wheelchair, pushed into the office by his assistant.
Bo Lang stared hard at Terrence with his bright blue left eye. “You sure have a good life,” he said sarcastically.
Terrence and Bo Lang were high-ranking members of the Vulture Organization, but they were in charge of different aspects.
Bo Lang was like a mouse wandering in the dark as he completed the missions assigned to him. His hands were stained with blood and his body was covered in countless scars. On the other hand, Terrence was like a businessman living in front of a camera. He was the organization’s white glove, accumulating wealth for them.
Because of this, Bo Lang’s attitude towards Terrence was always conflicted and disdainful.
If the damage from this gun battle had not been so serious, Bo Lang would definitely not have humbled himself to seek Terrence’s help.
Yu Ge stared at Bo Lang curiously. He sat on the desk leisurely and pointed at his fake eye. “Can you take it out?”
Bo Lang glared at him fiercely. “Terrence, who is he? Get rid of him. I have something to tell you!”
Terrence cleared his throat loudly, hinting at Bo Lang to shut up.
“He’s the son of the CEO of the Liqing Corporation. He’s the highest-ranked leader in this country.”
“If you don’t want to die, be polite!”
Bo Lang looked at Yu Ge in surprise. He didn’t have the aura of a leader, and he had never heard of him before.
Yu Ge didn’t mind. He stared at Bo Lang with interest. “Who on earth beat you up like this? Terrence said that you’re the best in the organization but you don’t look like much. You are in such a wretched state!”
Bo Lang was furious, but because of Yu Ge’s status, he couldn’t scold him directly. He had no choice but to soften his tone and answer, “That b*tch!”
“I didn’t expect her to be so lucky. If it weren’t for that group of masked criminals who suddenly appeared, she would already be dead!”
“There was no way the president’s guards alone could have saved her.”
Bo Lang gritted his teeth and muttered angrily. Recalling the gunfight that day, he still felt that he had missed a good opportunity. “I should have shot her to death…”
Yu Ge frowned as he listened to his description. He felt that something was familiar.
He went to squat down in front of Bo Lang. “Woman? What’s her name?”
Bo Lang narrowed his eyes at Terrence and slowly spat out, “Qiu Tong.”
Yu Ge froze. He then looked up and laughed out loud. He almost lost his balance as he clapped. “What a coincidence!”
Yu Ge suddenly stopped smiling. He turned to look at Terrence and instructed in a commanding tone, “Send all our members stationed in S City to search for Qiu Tong’s current residence. At the same time, inform everyone to be on standby. Move out the moment we find her location.”
Although Bo Lang had the goal of getting reinforcements, he didn’t expect things to progress so smoothly. He was also stunned.
Terrence wanted to stop him, but Yu Ge’s eyes flashed with viciousness as he asked, “Do you want to disobey orders?”
Bo Lang looked at the tense atmosphere between the two. He piped up. “The weapons of the president’s guards are very good. They’ve all undergone special training and are very good at fighting. I’m afraid we’re not their match. We need to plan our countermeasures properly.”
Yu Ge patted his shoulder as a bloodthirsty smile appeared on his lips. “Don’t worry, I’ll avenge you!”
“We have hundreds of members in S City, and we have sufficient weapons. Even if we use up half of our men in this fight, we can still capture them. Moreover, Terrence has two armored vehicles equipped with cannons in the arsenal.”
“As long as we can find her hiding place, we will succeed.”
Yu Ge said confidently. Bo Lang looked at Terrence hesitantly. He had doubts about this new leader.
“Qiu Tong, let’s see if you can still escape this time. We’ll meet again soon!”
As Yu Ge muttered to himself, he took out two bottles of wine from the liquor cabinet and handed them to Terrence and Bo Lang. He said proudly, “Friends, let’s have a toast to celebrate our victory in advance!”
Meanwhile, Qiu Tong suddenly sneezed in the living room. There were many dark clouds blocking the sun outside the window. She looked up as frightened crows flew away from the electric lines. Qiu Tong bit her red lips as she fell into deep thought.

chapters.title: Chapter 289 - Sudden Attack
chapters.content:
Chapter 289: Sudden Attack
“Reporting! We have found the location of the target.”
In the office on the top floor of the Liqing Corporation, a member on the other end of the video call reported loudly. Yu Ge slapped his thigh. He picked up the gun from the drawer and hugged Terrence’s shoulder as he walked out. “Let’s go teach the President a lesson!”
An armored vehicle with a gun barrel drove out of the secret warehouse in the suburbs and sped towards the villa.
Yu Ge sat in the command car, wiping his lips excitedly.
He held the walkie-talkie and communicated with all the members of the Vulture Organization. “Remember, I want Qiu Tong captured alive. Even if you have to break her arms and legs, you have to bring her back to me still breathing!”
The members answered in unison, “Yes!”
Terrence and Bo Lang exchanged glances, questioning Yu Ge’s rash, impulsive and unplanned attack.
After half an hour of travel, the command vehicle and armored vehicle parked a hundred meters away from the villa, waiting for orders.
Yu Ge held the binoculars and looked ahead. He whispered, “So she’s hiding here?”
“Attack them! I’ll give anyone who can bring Qiu Tong back alive a generous reward!”
With Yu Ge’s order, the members of the Vulture Organization swarmed out and shot down all the guards manning the front.
…
An ear-piercing alarm resounded throughout the villa.
Qiu Xingyu widened her eyes in shock and hid behind the sofa.
Jin Yang and Song Yan rushed to the entrance. They were both stunned to see the fierce gunfire. No one expected the enemy to reorganize so quickly and find this place to launch a sudden attack.
Shao An ran back from the outside and said hurriedly, “Sir, the other party is very well-equipped. I’m afraid we can’t hold on.”
“I’ll send the personal guards to flee with you, Miss Qiu and the children. Don’t worry, I’ll definitely protect them for you…”
Boom! A rocket launcher accurately hit the roof of the villa, causing the entire building to shake.
Jin Yang held onto the wall and barely managed to steady himself. He snatched the map from Shao An. “Flee?”
“They have surrounded us from all sides. How can we flee?”
Jin Yang threw the bulletproof vest to Song Yan and shouted at him. “Take the children and hide in the basement. Lock the door. The structure of the bomb shelter will make it difficult for even a tank to break in!”
Song Yan narrowed his eyes and rejected him flatly. “I won’t be so cowardly as to hide! You can hide if you want to.”
Jin Yang gave him a vicious punch. Qiu Xingyu’s sobbing could be heard. Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao hid in the corner with Qiu Xingyu in their arms. No matter how calm and composed they usually were, their eyes were now flashing with panic and fear.
After confirming the situation, Jin Yang looked up and said to Song Yan, “You’re injured. Don’t come out and cause trouble.”
Qiu Tong held Qiu Xingyu’s laptop and started the power grid system outside the villa as quickly as possible.
She hoped that this could delay the other party’s attack!
Song Yan looked at their backs and hesitated for two seconds. He then turned around and walked to the children. He held their hands and walked towards the basement.
Qiu Xingyuan flailed his legs as he shouted that he would stay behind to accompany Qiu Tong and Jin Yang.
Song Yan looked down at him with a ruthless expression. “What can you do for them? The enemy can charge in and abduct you. Do you want that to happen so that Qiu Tong has to go and exchange her life for yours? Shut up and stay here obediently…”
Qiu Rong and Ye Luan followed Song Yan to the basement and locked the door, blocking out the sound of gunshots.
Qiu Xingyu threw herself into Qiu Rong’s arms. Her face was covered in tears as she cried, “Why are there bad people everywhere?”
“Grandpa, Mommy, and Uncle Jin Yang are clearly good people. Why do they have to attack us all the time?!”
The young child’s words touched Song Yan’s heart. He clenched his fists and slammed them against the wall of the bomb shelter. He thought to himself that Jin Yang must not die in the hands of others!
Boom! The opponent’s attacks did not stop at all. It was as if there were endless cannonballs.
Jin Yang looked at the guards who were retreating and knew that they wouldn’t be able to hold on for long. He took out the seal he had brought with him and stuffed it into Shao An’s hand. “Go to the nearest neighboring city to find help. We will try our best to hold on until you return!”
Shao An shook his head with red eyes. “Sir, my mission is to protect you!”
Jin Yang shouted anxiously, “That is an order! Hurry up and leave…”
Qiu Tong patted Shao An’s shoulder and said, “The only person we can trust now is you. Hurry up and stop wasting time.”
Shao An gritted his teeth and left as quickly as possible under the cover of the guards.
Qiu Tong picked up a pair of binoculars. The left lens had already shattered but she could still spot Yu Ge sitting in the command vehicle from afar.
Shock flashed across her face for a moment before she regained her composure. “I underestimated him.”
Jin Yang protected her behind him and asked with deep affection, “Are you afraid?”

chapters.title: Chapter 290 - Sacrificing Himself
chapters.content:
Chapter 290: Sacrificing Himself
In the face of these crazy attacks, any words were unnecessary. Qiu Tong held Jin Yang’s hand tightly and shook her head.
Jin Yang personally put the bulletproof vest on her, a faint smile on his lips. “Shao An will bring reinforcements back.”
Qiu Tong nodded and snatched the walkie-talkie over. She found a relatively safe corner and sat down. She cleared her throat and gave instructions. “Everyone, don’t linger in battle. We aim to exhaust the enemy’s ammunition. Disperse and attack the enemy. Delay their attack speed!”
“Send a small team to guard the power source of the electric net. Snipers occupy the high ground. Do not let any enemy near the main entrance.”
Qiu Tong had clear plans for the remaining guards and placed them in the precise positions.
As Qiu Tong’s plan was executed, the Vulture Organization’s assault speed clearly slowed down. Their casualties were increasing. Yu Ge sat in the command vehicle and shouted at them, “Charge! Don’t retreat!”
Bo Lang looked at his crazed expression and used his eyes to signal his subordinates to fall to the back and watch.
Terrence felt a headache coming on as he rubbed his temples. He knew that he could do nothing to dissuade Yu Ge at this moment, so he simply let it be.
Relying on Qiu Tong’s tactics, the guards manage to hold out for two hours. Everyone was exhausted and it was difficult to even pull a trigger.
The members of the Vulture Organization slowly approached the villa and tried to lure Qiu Tong and Jin Yang out.
Jin Yang and Qiu Tong sat behind the sofa with their backs to each other. They used the furniture to construct a fortress-like structure to block the gun fire from the other side. Qiu Tong picked up the submachine gun and magazine and whispered, “I don’t regret meeting you.”
Jin Yang’s eyes sparkled. He hugged her neck and kissed her red lips. “This might be our last chance to speak. I want to tell you that I love you, Qiu Tong!”
This desperate confession made their eyes glisten with tears.
The sound of footsteps could be heard behind him as Qiu Tong raised her gun. Song Yan staggered backward with an iron plate in his hand. “It’s me!”
“I thought you guys needed help. I didn’t expect you to still have the time to confess your love for each other.”
“Keep your lives and you can say those words in the future…”
Song Yan picked up a gun from the ground and sat cross-legged beside Qiu Tong.
Jin Yang saw that he was a little stunned and asked anxiously, “Where are the children?”
Song Yan gritted his teeth and tightened the bandage around his waist. Large beads of sweat rolled down his forehead, and his body trembled uncontrollably. However, he forged on as he said, “They’re hiding in the bomb shelter in the basement. With Qiu Rong protecting them, they don’t need me.”
“I came up to help you. How can I let you be a hero by yourself?”
A machine gun suddenly fired from the opposite side of the entrance. Jin Yang bent down and held Qiu Tong’s gaze as he elegantly raised the muzzle and took aim. A single bullet pierced through the middle of the other party’s eyebrows. The sound of gunfire was temporarily halted.
Song Yan recalled some childhood memories and said mockingly, “Back then, Dad was willing to teach only you how to shoot.”
“He said that I’m playful and not someone who can control my temper.”
Song Yan sneered as he lifted his gun. He aimed it at Jin Yang, and pulled the trigger.
The bullet brushed past Jin Yang and flew straight into the heart of a Vulture member who had sneaked in. He fell to the ground with his eyes widened. Even in death, he didn’t expect anyone to have such fast and accurate marksmanship and nimble judgment.
Jin Yang frowned and stared at him. Song Yan smiled contemptuously as he loaded the gun.
“He doesn’t know that my slingshot has always been accurate!”
A sense of helplessness rose in Qiu Tong’s heart when she heard their conversation.
The members of the Vulture Organization were gathered at the entrance. The other party had determined the corner where Jin Yang and the rest were. They surged in and shot indiscriminately. Qiu Tong took out her dagger, quickly and nimbly slitting the necks of everyone who approached, so that they could save some bullets.
Yu Ge couldn’t bear it anymore. He pushed open the door of the command vehicle and snatched the gun from the bodyguard beside him. He walked towards the villa.
Song Yan’s wound had split open. He couldn’t support himself as he leaned against the sofa and panted.
Jin Yang looked at him and said with concern, “Hide and rest for a while. Leave this to me.”
Song Yan curled his lips into a mocking smile and retorted weakly, “I’m afraid you’ll aim the gun at me!”
While the two of them were bickering, Yu Ge jumped in from the window. He aimed the gun at Song Yan and said loudly, “Go to hell!”
Jin Yang looked over at the voice. Without hesitation, he pounced toward Song Yan and shielded him.
The bullet entered Jin Yang’s left chest, and his pupils dilated. Song Yan didn’t even have time to think. He looked at Jin Yang’s face and stammered in disbelief, “Why! Why did you save me?”
Qiu Tong ran over from afar. Jin Yang smiled brightly at her and said to Song Yan, “You’re my younger brother.”
“Promise me that you’ll take care of Qiu Tong and the children for me. Don’t make them sad…”

chapters.title: Chapter 291 - Heart Surgery
chapters.content:
Chapter 291: Heart Surgery
“Jin Yang!!”
Qiu Tong felt as if her heart was being torn apart. She went crazy with bloodshot eyes as she raised her machine gun and aimed it at Yu Ge. She kept pulling the trigger. Bullets rained down on the other party. Yu Ge’s bodyguards felt fear in their hearts as they protected him and retreated.
At this moment, Shao An had arrived with reinforcements.
In five minutes, they had chased the Vulture members out of the villa area and forced them to disperse.
Shao An returned with the seal, his face covered with injuries. The next second, he saw Jin Yang lying in a pool of blood. He was shocked and wanted to kneel down and put pressure on the wound to stop the bleeding. “Sir… medic, come over quickly!”
Qiu Tong was oblivious to the movements around her. She covered Jin Yang’s wound with her hands, desperately trying to infuse her special ability to him. Hot tears streaked down the corners of her eyes and hit the back of Jin Yang’s hand.
Jin Yang raised his hand weakly and held her face. He smiled faintly and said, “Don’t waste your energy.”
Her Esper ability could allow the wound to heal quickly, but at the same time, it would consume Qiu Tong’s energy.
Jin Yang said with difficulty, “As long as you’re alright!”
Qiu Tong shook her head fiercely. She held Jin Yang’s palm tightly. “You can’t leave me…”
The medical staff rushed to the scene to lift Jin Yang up and transport out for surgery as soon as possible.
Qiu Tong refused to let go. She stared at Shao An and said, “I’ll perform the surgery for him!”
Shao An understood her feelings, but Qiu Tong didn’t have any experience in surgery. He gestured at the presidential guards beside him with his eyes, and they restrained Qiu Tong. Shao An said earnestly, “I know you’re worried about Sir. This medical team has performed hundreds of open chest surgeries. They were the ones who treated Sir’s serious injuries in the past. Sir will definitely be safe this time.”
“Calm down and don’t disturb them. Okay?”
“We all care about Sir very much and hope that he can survive! You’re not the only one in pain!”
Shao An was equally worried. He was practically shouting by now.
Qiu Tong looked at him blankly, looking as if she was desperately holding onto the sliver of hope. She muttered, “The surgery will be successful.”
“Jin Yang promised me that he would bring me to many places. He promised Little Yu that he would give her a younger sister. How could he go back on his words?”
Qiu Tong’s hair was loose. She bit her nails and squatted by the wall, staring straight at the makeshift operating table.
Song Yan bandaged his own wound and walked to the glass window. He looked at Jin Yang lying on the operating table as unforgettable images flashed across his mind. He had never thought that Jin Yang would sacrifice himself for him.
Perhaps it was as Jin Yang had said, it was just instinct.
Song Yan couldn’t help but wonder if he would block that bullet for Jin Yang if the situation had been reversed.
He didn’t know the answer…
The villa had a very sturdy structure. Only some glass panels in the first floor were damaged by the attack. Shao An arranged for the reinforcement troops to tidy up the place. When Qiu Rong and the children came out of the basement and learned that Jin Yang was seriously injured, they surrounded Qiu Tong.
When Qiu Tong saw Qiu Xingyu’s worried eyes, she wanted to squeeze out a smile, but her tears fell uncontrollably.
Qiu Xingyuan and Qiu Xingqiao took the initiative to walk to her side. They opened their young but strong arms and hugged her.
Qiu Xingyuan imitated Jin Yang’s usual act of gently patting Qiu Tong’s back. He heard her sobbing and said seriously. “Uncle Jin Yang will definitely be fine.” At this moment, everyone in the villa had the same wish. They were all waiting for news from the medical team.
At dusk, one of the medical staff walked out. He took off his mask and protective suit and looked at Shao An. “Fortunately, the bullet missed Mr. President’s heart by 0.2 centimeters. The surgery was successful, but Mr. President’s body was severely injured, and many of his nerves were damaged.”
“I cannot determine when he will wake up or even whether he can wake up.”
The medical staff’s words made everyone heave a sigh of relief even as anxiety clouded their hearts again.
Unable to determine if Jin Yang would wake up. It was possible that he would continue to be in a coma and have to rely on medical devices to survive.
Qiu Tong’s hands trembled slightly as she tried her best to regain her rationality. “Can I visit him now?”
The medical staff nodded. “Try not to stay for too long. Mr. President needs an absolutely quiet environment.”
Qiu Tong forced a smile and let Shao An handle the rest. She changed into her protective suit and walked to the bed. Looking at Jin Yang’s pale, handsome face, Qiu Tong sat down beside him. “Can you bear to let Song Yan take care of me?”
“I know. You must be trying to scare me. I’ll wait for you to wake up.”
Qiu Tong’s red lips had gone pale. She quietly placed her hand on Jin Yang’s chest and tried her best to transfer the last trace of her special ability to him.
Some color returned to Jin Yang’s face. Qiu Tong heaved a sigh of relief and placed her head in his palm.
“Don’t make me wait too long!”

chapters.title: Chapter 292 - Coma For Five Days
chapters.content:
Chapter 292: Coma For Five Days
The moon was bright. When Qiu Tong came out of the room, she saw Song Yan squatting on the ground.
Song Yan saw her from the corner of his eye. He stood up and asked, “How… is he?”
Qiu Tong saw the bleeding bandage on his waist and pointed at a guest room toward the front. “Come with me. I’ll change your dressing.”
The room was filled with a heavy atmosphere. Song Yan’s wound had split open. As Qiu Tong handled Song Yan’s wound, he didn’t seem to feel the pain and didn’t make a sound. She frowned as she stared at the wound. “Why do you hate him?”
They were twin brothers. What kind of hatred would drive Song Yan to target Jin Yang like this? Even the mention of him would bring an intense sense of hatred.
Song Yan lowered his head and fiddled with a bullet shell in his hand. A self-deprecating smile hung on his lips as he said indifferently, “Hate?”
“I used to trust and rely on him a lot. I looked up to him as a model example.”
Countless images appeared in Song Yan’s mind. The dusty memories surged over, causing him to feel a suffocating pain in his heart.
Qiu Tong sat quietly beside him and listened to his narration.
Song Yan looked at the shadows of the trees dancing outside the window. “Our father constantly chose between us brothers since we were young. He wanted the best to become the president and hold the highest authority and power. Jin Yang is very smart and obedient. Father will often praise him.”
“I’m envious, but not jealous. I’ve never even thought of snatching anything from him.”
Song Yan curled his lips into a bitter smile. “But that’s not what Jin Yang thinks. Father is very strict with us. He doesn’t allow us to love any living thing. I secretly raised a stray dog outside and only brought Jin Yang to see it…”
“The next day, I found the dog’s corpse. Its stiff limbs were straight, and its eyes were filled with lingering fear.”
Song Yan could not forget the scene at that time. The seeds of disappointment grew in his heart.
When he was young, he was ignorant of relationships between men and women. Song Yan liked a girl from the same class, but the other party broke up with him only after a short while. The reason was that she had fallen in love with Jin Yang and wanted to be with him!
Song Yan had lost the people and things he cared about one after another. Resentment began to blind his eyes.
“From that moment on, I swore to snatch away what Jin Yang treasured as well! I’ll let him taste the pain of loss…”
Qiu Tong saw the conflict and frustration in his eyes. “I think there might be a misunderstanding between the two of you. Jin Yang wouldn’t do such a thing. He has always cared about you. I can feel that he has a brotherly bond with you. He’s also accommodating you and trying to make it up to you.”
Song Yan stood up silently and stared back at the room where Jin Yang was in. He turned around and left silently.
…
Jin Yang had been in a coma for five days. Every day, Qiu Tong would treat him with her special ability.
Qiu Xingyuan looked at her gradually weakening appearance with an aching heart. He discussed with Ye Luan and Qiu Xingqiao about making some nourishing soup for her, or taking turns to watch over Jin Yang. He wanted to reduce Qiu Tong’s burden. She sensed their concern and hugged them in relief, silently absorbing their strength.
The living room was very quiet. Suddenly, Shao An’s voice was heard from the second floor.
Qiu Tong let go of Qiu Xingyuan and ran upstairs. She hit her ankle against the corner of the coffee table, but she couldn’t care less about the pain as she barged into the ward.
Shao An was so excited that tears flowed down his cheeks. He pointed at the man on the bed who had opened his eyes.
Qiu Tong hesitantly took two steps forward, afraid that she was hallucinating.
Jin Yang waved at her weakly and called out her name. Qiu Tong heard his familiar voice and pounced onto the bed. She held his hand tightly, holding back her tears as she asked, “How are you feeling now? Does your wound still hurt?”
Jin Yang shook his head. The medical staff rushed over after receiving the news and conducted a meticulous examination on him.
Qiu Tong clenched her fists nervously. She only heaved a sigh of relief when she heard the medical staff say, “Mr. President’s health is no longer a problem. He just needs to recuperate in peace.” Everyone in the room had already tactfully left, leaving only Qiu Tong to accompany Jin Yang.
That chaotic gunfight seemed to have happened just yesterday. Qiu Tong looked at him quietly and said, “You’ve already been asleep for five days.”
Jin Yang’s eyes flashed with apology. He wanted to squeeze her hand but his wound ached and he frowned.
Qiu Tong glared at him and ordered, “Don’t move. I’ll be keeping an eye on you!”
Jin Yang smiled and nodded. It was as if he had been having an incomparably long dream for the past few days. He could hear Qiu Tong whispering to him every night about what she wanted to do with him. Jin Yang wanted to answer, but he couldn’t open his eyes.
Sensing his burning gaze, Qiu Tong thought that he had something important to say and leaned forward to kiss him.
Jin Yang smiled and said, “Were you serious when you said that you wanted to give Little Yu a younger sister?”
Qiu Tong frowned at his mischievous smile. She raised her fist high and sighed before answering, “Yes!”

chapters.title: Chapter 293 - The Conflicting Truth
chapters.content:
Chapter 293: The Conflicting Truth
Late at night, the sound of a hubcap rolling across the floor could be heard in the quiet and cold villa.
In the rehabilitation room at the top floor of the villa, Jin Yang pushed his wheelchair away and gripped the rehabilitation equipment tightly, wanting to speed up his recovery.
In the shadows in the corner, Qiu Tong stared at him quietly, clenching her fists tightly as she silently cheered him on.
Jin Yang soon became so exhausted that he trembled all over and nearly fell off the device, Qiu Tong hurriedly ran out to stabilize him.
Qiu Tong wiped his sweat with a towel. Jin Yang avoided her gaze with a look of annoyance.
During this period, everyone had been very careful about Jin Yang’s feelings. But he felt very suffocated.
Qiu Tong placed her hand gently on his shoulder and massaged his tensed muscles. She whispered, “Don’t be anxious. Take your time.”
Time passed quickly. Half a month later, Jin Yang was able to move freely. Apart from not being able to carry heavy items, he was no different from a normal person.
Qiu Tong often saw Song Yan pacing back and forth at the bedroom door. He seemed to want to thank Jin Yang, but he always chose to give up and turn around to leave. It was as if there was a wall separating them. Qiu Tong held a glass of hot milk and gently pushed the door open.
Jin Yang came out of the bathroom with water dripping from the ends of his hair. He wiped his hair with a towel, his eyes as bright and innocent as a young man.
Qiu Tong handed him the milk, wanting to tell him about Song Yan.
Jin Yang took two sips. Before she could react, he wrapped his arms around her neck and transferred the warm milk into her mouth. The fragrance lingered in their mouths as she placed her soft hands on his thin waist and accidentally pulled off the towel covering his lower body.
Jin Yang let go of her lips and caressed her earlobe with his fingertips. He whispered, “Are you in a hurry?”
Qiu Tong’s face instantly turned red. She wanted to explain herself, but Jin Yang didn’t give her any chance. He gently pulled her towards the bed. Qiu Tong was worried that any vigorous action would affect his recently healed wound, so she followed obediently.
She raised her fingertips and carefully traced Jin Yang’s features under the mottled light.
Her warm fingers caressed his straight eyebrows, his deep eyes and his thin lips. Qiu Tong couldn’t control her emotions as she hooked her arms around his neck and kissed him. Complicated emotions surged into her heart. She gently pushed Jin Yang’s shoulders and pressed him onto the bed. Her slender and fair legs straddled his waist, and her perky buttocks pressed against him as she deliberately twisted and squeezed.
Jin Yang’s eyes darkened as he tried to take off her pajamas. However, Qiu Tong stopped him and slowly unhooked her bra strap.
In the ambiguous light, Qiu Tong bit her soft red lips. Her plump and round breasts broke free from the restraints of her undergarment. Jin Yang’s Adam’s apple bobbed uncontrollably as he eagerly grabbed Qiu Tong’s buttocks.
Qiu Tong teased him for a long time before allowing him to enter her.
The two of them sighed in satisfaction. Jin Yang and Qiu Tong moved in unison, with Qiu Tong gently massaging his chest and swaying her hips.
Jin Yang raised his hand and held her soft chest, his breathing heavy and rapid.
This long-awaited moment of love brought with it the urgency of someone who had experienced the touch of death. Qiu Tong’s face was filled with joy as her red lips let out a soft moan. In the end, she went limp and laid on Jin Yang’s body, letting him control their movements as he pleased.
It was only in the wee hours of the morning when the sky outside the window started to light up that Jin Yang finally stopped. Qiu Tong’s eyes were misty as she laid beside him.
In her half-asleep state, she didn’t forget to tell him what Song Yan had said. Jin Yang paused for a moment before gently stroking her sweat-drenched curly hair and planting a gentle kiss on her brows. “Thank you.”
The next morning, Song Yan appeared at the bedroom door as usual. He placed the breakfast he had prepared on the floor and turned to leave.
The door opened at that moment and Jin Yang met his gaze. He said lightly, “Shall we have a chat?”
Song Yan frowned and followed him to the balcony on the top floor.
The morning breeze blew across his face. Jin Yang looked at the rising sun before turning to look at Song Yan. “That stray dog was poisoned by my father. I wanted to stop him, but I didn’t succeed in the end. He didn’t want us to know how to sympathize with the weak.”
Song Yan’s pupils dilated, but he did not answer.
Jin Yang heaved a long sigh of relief. “As for your girlfriend, she did confess to me, but I rejected her.”
“I’ve never had the thought of fighting with you. Moreover, those are things and people that I don’t care about at all. You’re my younger brother. Father hopes that we’ll be afraid of each other. He relies on you to keep me in check, while using me to agitate you.”
“But I know that you’re actually a kind person. It’s just that you’re easily influenced by others.”
Song Yan couldn’t withstand the impact of the truth. He shook his head repeatedly and took a few steps back. His thin lips curled into a bitter smile as he denied it. “No, impossible. You’re lying. I don’t believe…”

chapters.title: Chapter 294 - Ye Luan As A Hostage
chapters.content:
Chapter 294: Ye Luan As A Hostage
After learning the truth, Song Yan felt that he couldn’t face it, so he chose to leave the villa overnight to digest it alone.
Shao An summarized the information about the attack. Qiu Tong and Jin Yang analyzed it seriously and felt that there were two separate terrorist groups hiding in the dark. They were interested in the drug or in Qiu Tong. The masked criminal group would always appear at the critical moment to kill her.
The situation had become tricky, but they couldn’t find any clues that could confirm the other party’s identity.
Qiu Tong frowned. The children were sensible and obedient as they gathered in the corner to play quietly. She looked at them with gentle eyes and quickly sensed that something was wrong. She abruptly stood up and walked to Qiu Xingyuan’s side. “Where’s Ye Luan?”
Qiu Xingyuan put down his chemicals and looked at Qiu Xingqiao.
Qiu Xingqiao replied, “He said that he was going out to meet a friend. He left at around eight in the morning.”
Qiu Tong turned to stare at the clock hanging on the wall. It was already five in the evening.
She dialed Ye Luan’s number. A cold female voice sounded. “The number you’ve dialed is unavailable for now. Please try again later.”
Qiu Tong clenched her fists in panic and instructed Shao An to immediately search for Ye Luan.
Through the surveillance video around the villa, he learned that Ye Luan had indeed left by himself on a bus heading to the city. He was last seen by the surveillance cameras in an underground car park. There was no trace of him after that.
Qiu Tong stared fixedly at the screen and saw that familiar van in the parking lot.
She instantly felt uneasy as her phone rang.
Qiu Tong looked at the encrypted number and her heart sank.
Jin Yang answered the call and pressed the speaker button. Bo Lang’s voice came from the other end.
“Qiu Tong, are you surprised? We might meet again soon!”
Bo Lang motioned for a member to kick Ye Luan, who had fallen to the ground. He groaned in pain.
Bo Lang placed the phone in front of Ye Luan, gesturing for him to speak. Ye Luan gritted her teeth and glared at him with hatred.
“Ye Luan? Is that you? How are you now? Auntie Qiu will be there to save you soon! Hang in there!”
Bo Lang walked to a cracked glass mirror and adjusted his fake blue eye. “I only told him that I’m his father’s friend and that I’m in danger, someone is hunting me. I have what they want.”
“I didn’t expect this kid to be so stupid as to run out alone to see me.”
Bo Lang clicked his tongue and laughed. He kicked Ye Luan’s chest with the tip of his shoe. Seeing his body curled up in pain, he said to Qiu Tong, “He probably wanted to resolve this by himself because he’s afraid of implicating you guys. Your relationship is really great. I’m impressed.”
“I’ll give you two hours to think about this. Come and see me yourself.”
Bo Lang was in an enclosed place and his intact eye revealed a fierce killing intent. “I don’t need you to bring the drug with you this time. I just want your life! In two hours’ time. Exchange your life for his. Otherwise, I’ll kill him.”
“Wait to collect his corpse…”
When Ye Luan heard their conversation, he endured the pain and shouted, “Auntie Qiu, don’t worry about me! I’m not afraid of death!”
Bo Lang hung up the phone. He grabbed Ye Luan’s neck forcefully and lifted him up. His thin body flailed in the air. Ye Luan’s face had already turned purple, and he could barely breathe.
Ye Luan’s pupils dilated as Bo Lang abruptly let go, causing him to fall harshly to the ground.
Bo Lang stepped on his palm and crushed it harshly. Looking at Ye Luan’s stubborn eyes, he said kindly, “You’re really similar to your father. You’re as stubborn as him. You want to be a saint to save the world and sacrifice yourself to protect others.”
“I’m not lying to you. I’m indeed your father’s friend. I’m the friend who personally sent him to the netherworld.”
Bo Lang gestured with his hand like a pistol and placed it on Ye Luan’s temple. “I killed your father.”
“Before he died, he seemed to be calling your name. He said that he hoped that you would be brave enough to survive for him.”
Ye Luan’s eyes were bloodshot. He struggled with all his might, but it was useless. Bo Lang slapped him before instructing the members of the organization to tie a bomb to Ye Luan’s body. “Don’t worry. I’ll send you to reunite with him soon. Of course, there’s also your favorite Aunt Qiu!”
Bo Lang checked all the settings in the room. It would be a death trap for Qiu Tong. As long as she dared to come, she would not be able to escape.
At the villa, Qiu Tong received the address and prepared to leave immediately.
Jin Yang held her hand. “I’ll go with you.”
Qiu Tong opened her mouth to refuse, but when she met his dark eyes, she finally smiled and nodded.
The car sped along the highway. Qiu Tong looked down at the address Bo Lang had sent her. It was an abandoned military base. The other buildings had already been demolished half a year ago, leaving only one as the demolition had yet to be completed.
It seemed like Bo Lang had planned everything precisely…
Qiu Tong looked at Jin Yang worriedly as she secretly hid something in her sleeve.

chapters.title: Chapter 295 - Life For A Life
chapters.content:
Chapter 295: Life For A Life
At the military base, the Vulture Organization’s flag fluttered on the top floor.
Qiu Xingyu activated the infrared surveillance system software developed by Qiu Xingyu to scan the buildings.
The data showed that the members of the Vulture Organization were all hidden very well. Even snipers lying in ambush at the most advantageous vantage point would be unable to kill any terrorists.
Bo Lang had meticulously set up the venue. He treated the building as a prison and waited for Qiu Tong to deliver her life.
Qiu Tong knew that she had no other choice. She opened the car door and Jin Yang followed her out.
Qiu Tong pushed him back in shock. “What are you trying to do? I’ll bring Ye Luan out. Wait here for my news.”
Jin Yang smiled and ruffled her curly brown hair. “I’m someone who has experienced death. Would I be afraid? I’ll accompany you. No matter what happens, we will be together. You promised me that, didn’t you?”
Qiu Tong stared at the ground for a moment before looking up with a bright smile. “Alright!”
The members of the Vulture Organization pushed Qiu Tong and Jin Yang in. In an enclosed space, Bo Lang sat beside Ye Luan and held a remote control. “Do you see the bomb on him? If you dare to move, I’ll immediately turn him into countless pieces…”
Bo Lang was in desperate straits now. Only five of his brothers were left after the two gun battles.
Even if Yu Ge and Terrence didn’t allow him to seek revenge, he would still choose to disobey orders.
Bo Lang pointed at the black-and-white photos on the wall. “No one will be able to walk out of here alive today. I’ve already betrayed the Vulture Organization. Even if I live, I will be punished. But you have to pay with your lives for my brothers. Kneel!”
Bo Lang pointed at Qiu Tong angrily. She frowned, wanting to mock his stupidity and ridiculousness.
But Bo Lang placed the dagger on Ye Luan’s neck, so she had no choice but to go down on one knee.
A Vulture member kicked her from behind and stepped on her other leg, forcing her to go down on both knees.
Bo Lang handed the remote control to a member and ordered someone to restrain Jin Yang. He then pulled Qiu Tong up by her hair.
Qiu Tong stared at him coldly. Enraged by her gaze, Bo Lang clenched his fists and punched her abdomen.
“We could have gotten along very well. If only you had just given me the drug, I would have given you a large sum of money and let you live a carefree life anywhere in the world. Your children could have had the best childhood. You could have lived without worries!”
“But you chose to go against me and the Vulture Organization…”
Qiu Tong spat at him and said coldly, “Even if the drug is developed, I won’t give it to you.”
If the drug fell into the hands of bad people, it would probably become a spark that would destroy the entire society.
Qiu Tong thought of the apocalyptic era she was in. There were zombies everywhere, and she was in a state of fear every moment. She had to fight non-stop in exchange for a chance of survival. She absolutely couldn’t let the children live in such a world!
Bo Lang sneered and took out his gun, aiming it at her.
Jin Yang was so nervous that he wanted to rush over. However, he saw Qiu Tong take out a syringe from her sleeve and inject it into her body. In an instant, her eyes turned red. Her breathing was hot and rapid. She broke Bo Lang’s arm at lightning speed and snatched this gun, aiming it at his heart.
“Don’t move! Otherwise, I’ll kill him!”
Qiu Tong shouted hoarsely. Bo Lang twitched in pain, indicating for everyone to calm down and listen to her request.
Bo Lang had claimed that he would die with Qiu Tong, but in reality, he had prepared a way out for himself.
When Qiu Tong came to this enclosed space, she spotted a pit behind Ye Luan and confirmed that it could be a path of escape.
Bo Lang’s arm had been broken, and it dangled at the side of his body. He looked at her suspiciously. “You used the modification drug!”
He instantly thought of the drug. Qiu Tong kept silent in tacit agreement while holding him hostage. She slowly walked to Ye Luan’s side.
Before she left the villa, she went to the laboratory on the top floor without telling anyone and stole the half-finished drug.
Qiu Tong knew that this was the only way, so she was willing to use her body as a test subject…
“Remove the bomb on him!”
Qiu Tong motioned for the members of the organization to take action. Bo Lang could only frown and nod.
Jin Yang broke free from the restraints and protected Ye Luan. Qiu Tong motioned for them to hide near the pit.
Ye Luan shouted anxiously, “Auntie Qiu, what are you going to do?”
Qiu Tong could feel her heart beating rapidly. She could hear thumping sounds in her mind, and her blood and muscles felt like they were burning. “You guys leave first. I’ll catch up to you guys soon.”
As Qiu Tong spoke, Bo Lang slammed his entire body into her, causing the two of them to fall to the ground. Qiu Tong quickly kicked the gun away as the Vulture members charged at her with daggers in their hands.

chapters.title: Chapter 296 - Family
chapters.content:
Chapter 296: Family
Ye Luan wanted to break free from Jin Yang’s protection and run towards her. He shouted hoarsely, “Auntie Qiu, be careful!”
Jin Yang quickly pulled Ye Luan back. He stared intently at Qiu Tong as she fought with Bo Lang and the rest. “Don’t distract her!”
The modification drug had enhanced the various functions of her body to a terrifying level. She seemed to not feel any pain. Even if a dagger pierced into her arm, she could pull it out without blinking and use it to stab it back into the chest of her attacker.
Qiu Tong’s speed was more than three times that of an ordinary person. She flipped Bo Lang onto the ground and almost crushed him with her strength.
She wrapped the bomb that was tied to Ye Luan’s body around Bo Lang. When she saw the fear in his eyes, a bloodthirsty smile appeared on her lips. She picked up the remote control from the ground and ran back to the entrance of the pit.
Qiu Tong hugged Ye Luan and used her body to protect Jin Yang. The moment the three of them jumped into the pit, she pressed the remote control.
The violent explosion caused the building to shake violently a few times, and pungent smoke filled the air.
Shao An and the guards rushed over with tears in their eyes. When they saw Qiu Tong supporting Jin Yang and carrying Ye Luan out of the dust and smoke, they surrounded her excitedly. Qiu Tong leaned weakly against Jin Yang’s shoulder.
She turned around and looked at the collapsed building. She touched the top of Ye Luan’s head and said, “I’ve helped you take revenge.”
Ye Luan shed tears of guilt. Like an AI machine that had short-circuited, she spat out two mouthfuls of blood and swayed as she fell to the ground.
Jin Yang held her in his arms. Qiu Tong lifted her broken wrist with difficulty, her lips moving as if she wanted to say something.
Jin Yang hurriedly moved his ear closer and heard her whisper, “Tell Dad and Qiu Xingyuan…”
“The effective duration of the modification drug is 45 minutes. Your body… will experience soreness and fractures. It cannot be used.”
After that, Qiu Tong lost consciousness.
…
In the villa, Qiu Rong and the children were gathered at the entrance of the surgery room.
The medical staff walked out with a heavy expression. Jin Yang anxiously asked about Qiu Tong’s condition, but the staff didn’t know how to answer.
“Miss Qiu’s vital signs are stable. The superficial wounds caused by the fight are not serious. She will recover in half a month.”
“But her mental state is currently in chaos. She is not reacting to external stimulation. I’ve been a doctor for decades, and I’ve never encountered such a situation, so I can’t make a judgment now. Miss Qiu’s condition is like being in a coma after taking a stimulant poison…”
Poison? Qiu Rong and Jin Yang looked at each other. They knew that it was caused by the modification drug.
When Ye Luan heard their conversation, he clenched his fists and ran to the top terrace. Two of his ribs were broken, and his body was covered in injuries.
Qiu Xingyuan sensed his emotions and followed him here.
Ye Luan turned to look at him and said in a very low voice, “I’m sorry. It’s all because of me that Auntie Qiu became like this.”
“I received that message. If I had discussed it with you guys, this wouldn’t have happened…”
Qiu Xingyuan stood beside him and said with an exceptionally rational and calm expression, “Bo Lang and the members of the terrorist organization wanted revenge. Even if you escape this trap, there will still be a next time. And it might be me or Little Yu.”
“If it were me, I wouldn’t be as strong as you.”
Ye Luan looked at Qiu Xingyuan fixedly. He didn’t expect Qiu Xingyuan, who usually looked at him coldly, to say such words.
Qiu Xingyuan seemed to sense his gaze as he turned around and walked towards the laboratory. He said indifferently, “You were in danger. It is natural for us to think of a way to save you. It’s Bo Lang’s fault that Mommy is unconscious, not yours. You don’t have to blame yourself and feel guilty.”
“You… are our brother.”
Ye Luan couldn’t believe what he had just heard. He widened his eyes and took two steps forward. He moved his thin lips, wanting to confirm, but he didn’t dare to speak.
Qiu Xingyuan turned around. He picked up two bottles of chemicals and said seriously, “The most important thing now is to find a way to get rid of the toxins in Mommy’s body and develop a medicine that can wake her up. I need your help. Can you do that?”
Ye Luan was stunned for two seconds before nodding solemnly. He turned up the laboratory’s lights and started to work with him.
At this moment, Ye Luan felt like he had found the warmth of home again. It turned out that Qiu Xingyuan had already accepted him in his heart a long time ago. He was so stupid that he didn’t realize it. When Qiu Rong heard the commotion in the laboratory and saw two young but determined boys bustling about, he joined their efforts.
Jin Yang accompanied Qiu Tong in the room. Seeing her sleeping profile, he said softly, “I know you’re very tired. Have a good sleep.”
Shao An walked in after knocking on the door. He looked at Qiu Tong on the bed and reported softly, “Bo Lang’s remains were found at the scene. His arm and head exploded, and fragments of his body have been found. After testing the DNA, we can confirm that it’s him.”

chapters.title: Chapter 297 - Wedding Ceremony
chapters.content:
Chapter 297: Wedding Ceremony
Late at night, Qiu Tong was sleeping peacefully.
Qiu Xingqiao and Little Yu surrounded her bed and stared at her with swollen eyes. No matter how tired they were, they didn’t dare to close their eyes, afraid that if they looked away for a moment, the woman lying on the bed would stop breathing.
The usually noisy children had learned to be quiet and sensible at this moment. Qiu Xingyu would wipe her tears with the back of her hand from time to time.
Qiu Xingqiao said in a very low voice, “Mommy taught us not to cry no matter what happens.”
“Crying won’t solve anything. It would only show others our cowardice…”
Qiu Xingyu choked back her sobs and tried to stop crying, but the more she thought about it, the more afraid she became. She threw herself into Qiu Xingqiao’s arms and said, “Second Brother, will Mommy never wake up again? Does she despise us for being noisy? She thinks that we’re disobedient, so she doesn’t want us anymore!”
Qiu Xingqiao raised his arm stiffly and pursed his lips stubbornly without saying a word.
Qiu Xingyuan walked to their side and quietly looked at Qiu Tong.
